**To not shame poverty and lowliness** (*bù chǐ pín jiàn*), **to not covet wealth and nobility** (*bù tān fù guì*), **to not indulge in sounds and colors** (*bù shì shēng sè*), **to not be entangled by fame and profit** (*bù dān míng lì*), **to not fear calamity and adversity** (*bù jù huàn nàn*), **to not act in disgrace or humiliation** (*bù zuò chù rǔ*), **externally seeking nothing** (*wài wú suǒ qiú*), **internally undisturbed** (*nèi wú suǒ huò*), **to see only in the Void** (*wéi jiàn yú kōng*)—
**The Void has nothing to void** (*kōng wú suǒ kōng*), **serene and ever tranquil** (*zhàn rán cháng jì*), **then by day there are no thoughts** (*yú shì zhòu wú xiǎng*), **by night there are no dreams** (*yè wú mèng*). **Thus, the spirit dwells in supreme bliss** (*qī shén qī zhī zhì lè*), **and the Heavenly True Nature is in abundance** (*tiān zhēn zhī xìng yǒu yú*), **while turbid and chaotic emotions do not arise** (*zhuó luàn zhī qíng bù zuò yǐ*).

**Approaching the boundary of supreme stillness** (*qū biān yú zhì jìng*), **greed and desire do not manifest** (*tān qiú bù shēng*), **and the heart has nowhere to stray** (*xīn wú suǒ wǎng*).

**The flying crow restrains its body and soars in emptiness** (*fēi wū zhì qí shēn yóu yú kōng xū*), **leaning upon its qi** (*píng qí qì*).
**The deceased** (*sǐ fū*) **refine their form into supreme Yang** (*xiū liàn qí xíng ér chéng zhì yáng*), **and thus can enter gold and stone without obstruction** (*qí néng rù jīn shí ér bù yè*), **traverse Sun and Moon without shadow** (*xíng rì yuè ér wú yǐng*), **which is their inherent principle** (*gù qí lǐ*).

**The people of the world must consume food and drink to nourish their form** (*shì zhī rén xū yǐn shí yǐ yǎng qí xíng*), **yet they do not know that by abstaining from food and drink, their form becomes firm** (*bù zhī jué yǐn shí ér xíng nǎi gù yǎn*).
**They must preserve the corpse-like shell to nourish their spirit** (*xū shī pò yǐ yǎng qí shén*), **yet they do not know that by discarding the corpse-like shell, their spirit becomes complete** (*bù zhī qù shī pò ér shén nǎi quán yǎn*).
**They must have Yang and Yin together to aid in life** (*xū yáng yǔ yīn bìng xiāng jì yǐ shēng*), **yet they do not know that when Yin is exhausted and Yang is pure, eternal life ensues** (*bù zhī yīn jìn yáng chún zé zhǎng shēng yǐ*).

**Western Ascension (西升) Section:**

When the wandering sage **Zeng Yan** (曾慥) collected it, the **Mysterious Thread (玄言)** of Western Ascension—
only **Li Mozi** (力默子) holds its essence;
**Yinzi** (尹子) embraced the Dao and journeyed westward,
to teach **Yin Xi** (尹喜).

As **Laozi** (老子) prepared to enter the Western Regions,
**Yinzi** (尹子), **Yin Xi** (尹喜) by name, encountered him at the pass and inquired about the Dao.

Laozi said:
*"The boundless void and indistinct haze—
this is the root of the Dao (道).
It gave birth to me in emptiness (虚),
placed me in nonexistence (无),
so the one who birthed me was the **divine (神)**,
and the one who ended me was the **heart (心)**.
Thus, the body (身) is the **divine’s** chariot, dwelling, and master.
When the body is tranquil and still, the **divine** abides within it;
when the body is restless and agitated, the **divine** departs from it.
Therefore, if one preserves the **divine** while externalizing the body,
the **radiant essence (精曜)** remains."*

When the Dao is attained in its singular unity (一合),
one becomes harmonized with the Dao (道).

The **virtuous person (善人)** does not contend with all things,
but remains humble, empty, and without desire (無欲).
Thus, desire (欲) is the root of calamity and harm (凶害);
nonexistence (無) is the primal origin of heaven and earth (天地).

The **sage (圣人)** abandons desire and enters nonexistence,
thereby aiding the preservation of their body (辅其身).

I gaze without seeing, listen without hearing,
speak without uttering words, eat without tasting flavor.
Silent and detached, I attain **Supreme Clarity (太清)**—
**effortless action (无为)**, where the **qi (气)** naturally returns to its unborn state.
The **woeful (哀人)** are not pitied as much as their bodies (身);
one who cherishes their body (身) for a day is better than one who loves their **divine (神)**,
one who loves their **divine (神)** is better than one who abandons it,
one who abandons their **divine (神)** is better than one who guards their body,
and one who guards their body will thus endure forever.

The **divine (神)** is the origin of form (生形);
form is the fulfillment of the **divine (成神)**.
Thus, if form does not attain its **divine (神)**,
it cannot sustain itself in life (自生).
If the **divine (神)** does not attain its form,
it cannot manifest itself (自成).

When form and **divine (神)** are harmonized and unified,
they mutually generate and mutually nourish—
this is their perfect balance.

The highest filial piety in the world
is to be able to nourish one’s mother.
He who can love his mother
will thus prolong his own life (身).

The **emptiness (虚)** of the body—
all things gather therein;
the **nonexistence (无)** of the heart—
**harmonious qi (和气)** returns thereto.

Thus, the one who skillfully nourishes their body
conceals their body within their body, unseen,
and hides their **divine (神)** within others, unperceived.

Why so?
Because they perpetually regard **emptiness (虚)** as the body,
and **nonexistence (无)** as the heart—
this is the **body without body (无身之身)**,
the **heart without heart (无心之心)**.

Thus, they preserve the **divine (神)** in its utmost clarity,
and this is called **harmonization with the Dao (道同)**.

My life lies within me alone,
not dependent on heaven and earth (天地).
If I do not see, do not hear, do not know,
then the **divine (神)** does not depart from my body,
and I endure in harmony with the Dao.

I share with heaven and earth a single **qi (气)**,
and govern myself by preserving its root (根本).

Nothing in the world is softer or weaker than **qi (气)**;
nothing is softer or weaker than the Dao (道).
The Dao’s softness and weakness
are what enfold heaven and earth,
and penetrate all things.

Thus, the soft can generate the firm,
the weak can produce the strong—
yet none know the origin from which they spring.

Nonexistence (无) has **emptiness (虚)** as its mother;
**emptiness (虚)** has the Dao (道) as its mother—
this is the Dao’s root.

Why is it called the Dao?
Because it commands:
*"Though the **divine (神)** resides within the body,
it must not be allowed to remain in the body."*

**Flourishing arises from decay (盛生於衰)**;
**yin (阴)** emerges from **yang (阳)**.
Thus, existence and nonexistence mutually generate,
**emptiness (虚)** and **fullness (实)** mutually complete.

Therefore, existence returns to existence,
nonexistence returns to nonexistence.

Humans dwell within the Dao;
the Dao dwells within humans—
like fish within water,
water within fish.

When the Dao departs, humans die;
when the waters dry, fish perish.

Thus, the **sage (圣人)** reverses to the unborn state,
hiding their form (隐),
preserving their **divine (神)** (留),
and all under heaven submits thereto.

With **effortless action (无为)** and **non-interference (无事)**,
the state flourishes and the people prosper—
this is the constant of preserving the Dao,
known as **Mysterious Harmony (玄同)**.

Humans attain life through the **divine (神)**,
yet do not know where the **divine (神)** resides.
Only the **sage (圣人)** conceals the **divine (神)** within,
so their **vital spirit (魄)** does not stray.
To guard their mother (原),
their child (子) remains whole,
and the people thrive in abundance.

The method of **nourishing life (养生)**,
penetrating the **primordial essence (玄元)** and **mixed qi (混气)**,
is to reflect and preserve one’s self.

Heaven does not desire **clarity (清)**;
**clarity (清)** naturally returns.
Earth does not desire **turbulence (浊)**;
**turbulence (浊)** naturally returns.
**Moisture (湿)** does not desire **water (水)**;
**water (水)** naturally returns.
**Dryness (燥)** does not desire **fire (火)**;
**fire (火)** naturally returns.
The **void (虚空)** and **effortless action (无为)** do not desire the Dao;
the Dao naturally returns.

From this perspective,
what nature is not **self-so (自然)**?

After Laozi had fully expounded his Dao,
he again instructed Yinzi:
*"I speak to you of the essentials of the **Supreme Dao (至道)**:
tranquilize the heart and guard the One (一),
and all impurities will be dispelled,
all affairs completed."*

**Inner Virtue (内德) Section:**

The **Three Activities (三业)** and **Seven Emotions (七情)**,
having clarified their source (澄其源);
the **Five Spirits (五神)** preserved in their repositories,
seeking the **Three Unities (三一)** for eternal existence (求存).

The **Supreme One (太上)** says:
*"Tranquilize the **Three Activities (三业)**—mouth, eyes, ears—
clarify the **Seven Emotions (七情)**,
and the **Five Spirits (五神)** will each guard their repositories,
the **Three Unities (三一)** enduring forever."*

The **Three (三)** refers to the **primordial spirits (元神)** of the body,
the number **three (三)** of the **hexagram Li (离)**.
The **One (一)** refers to the **true essence (真精)** of the body,
the number **one (一)** of the **hexagram Kan (坎)**.

Within the body are **three thousand six hundred spirits (神)**,
**one thousand two hundred forms and shadows (形影)**,
**twelve thousand rays of essence (精光)**,
and the **Fourteen Spirits (神)** of the **five viscera (五脏)** and **six bowels (六腑)**.
To the left, **three souls (三魂)**;
to the right, **seven spirits (七魄)**—
one must constantly ponder them,
lest they depart from the body.

**Day (日)** is the **Functionary (功曹)**,
the **yang qi (阳气)**;
**Moon (月)** is the **Chief Clerk (主簿)**,
the **yin blood (阴血)**.

The **Thunder Lord’s (雷公) emissaries** reside in the **three souls (三魂)** of left and right;
the **Wind Marshal (风伯)** and **Rain Master (雨师)** dwell in the **seven spirits (七魄)** of front and back.

**Six Yang (六甲)** are the **six yang spirits (六阳神)**;
**Zhi Fu (直符)** are the **six yin spirits (六阴神)**—
they encircle the body.
The **Azure Dragon (青龙)** supports the left,
the **White Tiger (白虎)** supports the right,
the **Vermilion Bird (朱雀)** leads the front,
the **Dark Tortoise (玄武)** follows the rear—
these are the **four symbols (四象)** of the body.

The **Big Dipper (北斗)** covers the head,
the **spirit of essence (精光)**;
**Tian Chen (天呈)** points at the feet,
the **spirit of true qi (真气)**;
the **Victorious Serpent (胜蛇)** lies in the hands,
the **spirit of gall (胆)**.

I dwell within the **Elixir Field (丹房)**,
embracing the method of guarding the One (一).

The **Supreme Unity (太一)** is the **palace of the Lower Primordial (下元)**,
the **true primordial spirit (真元神)**—
this is my **companion (偶)**."

「Left Three, Right Seven, correspond to **Zhen (震)** and **Dui (兑)**—
the **Three Legs (三足)** and **Seven Stars (七星)** of the **Big Dipper (北斗)**;
**Wearing Nine, Treading One (戴九履一)**, correspond to **Li (离)** and **Kan (坎)**—
the **Heavenly Fire (天火)** and **Water (水)**;
**Two and Four as Shoulders (二四为肩)**, are **Kun (坤)** and **Xun (巽)**—
the **Earth (地)** and **Wind (风)**;
**Six and Eight as Feet (六八为足)**, are **Qian (乾)** and **Gèn (艮)**—
the **Heaven (天)** and **Mountain (山)**;
**Five dwells in the Central Palace (五居中宫)**, as **Earth (土)**—
these are the **Eight Trigrams (八卦)** and **Nine Palaces (九宫)** of the **spirits (神)**, all manifest within the **abdomen (腹)**.

In general, when one sleeps, the **spirits (神)**, **soul (魂)**, **essence (精)**, and **vital breath (魄)** disperse and wander outside. **Yin evils (阴邪)** may then exploit the gaps to steal one’s **essence and qi (精气)**. Therefore, one must summon the **Four Symbols (四兽)** to guard the body. What are the **Four Symbols (四兽)**?
The **Azure Dragon (青龙)** emerges from the **liver (肝)**,
the **White Tiger (白虎)** from the **lungs (肺)**,
the **Vermilion Bird (朱雀)** from the **heart (心)**,
the **Dark Tortoise (玄武)** from the **kidneys (肾)**.
Do not allow myriad evils to disturb the **Jade Palace (玉房)**.
The **Jade Palace (玉房)** is the **Essence Region (精区)**.
The **liver (肝)** governs storing the **soul (魂)**,
the **lungs (肺)** govern storing the **vital breath (魄)**,
the **heart (心)** governs storing the **spirit (神)**,
the **spleen (脾)** governs storing the **will (志)**,
the **kidneys (肾)** govern storing the **essence (精)**.
The **five visceral spirits (五脏之神)**, when summoned, repel evils,
when withdrawn, settle the **spirit (神)**.
Having guarded the body, they then return to their respective abodes.
**Inhale the Heavenly Qi (吻天鼓)** thirty-six times to gather the **spirit (神)**,
**swallow the saliva (咽液)** thirty-six times to gather the **qi (气)**,
and **close the Yin Gate (阴户)** with **yin lock (阴关)**,
preventing myriad evils from dwelling below.
**Closing the Qi (闭气)** means counting from one to ten in the mind,
then stopping at the **Nine Nines (九九)**— eighty-one breaths.
**Closing the Qi (闭气)** is not about constricting the breath,
but about **spirit stillness (神定)** and **qi harmony (气和)**,
cutting off thoughts and forgetting concerns,
so that the **nasal breath (鼻之息)** flows gently, as if present yet absent.
Pulse diagnosis shows six movements as one breath,
and the **Nine Nines (九九)**— eighty-one breaths.
Always retain the **Red Qi (赤气)** emerging from the mouth,
like a fiery wheel encircling the chamber.
When still, **internally visualize (内想)** tranquility and repose within it—
diseases will then naturally dissipate, and **yin evils (阴邪)** will retreat.

**Chapter on the Revered Mysteries (玄网篇):**
The **Daoist schools (道家者流)** are vast and boundless,
exploring their profound subtleties,
to grasp their fundamental principles.
The **Revered Mysteries Master (崇玄子)**— surnamed **Tang (唐)**,**Hào (昊)**,**Áo Wù (凹兀)**—
once said:
"The **Dao (道)** arises from the **Non-Being (无)** and gives birth to existence.
The **Heaven (天)** and **Earth (地)** are its manifestation.
**Heaven (天)** is movement,
yet the **North Pole (北辰)** does not shift—
it **embodies the void (含虚)** without depletion.
**Earth (地)** is stillness,
yet the **eastern rivers (东流)** do not stagnate—
they **raise clouds (兴云)** without exhaustion.
Thus, **stillness (静)** is the **heart of Heaven and Earth (天地之心)**,
and **movement (动)** is their **qi (天地之气)**.
When the **heart is still (心静)** and the **qi moves (气动)**,
this is how they **sustain and transform (覆载)** without end.

Those who **penetrate the Dao (通乎道者)**,
keep their **heart tranquil (心宁)** to align with the **Dao (道)**,
and **cultivate their qi (气运)** to preserve their form—
unseduced by things, they are called **Supreme Stillness (至静者)**.
Originally, there is no **spirit (神)**—
when **emptiness reaches its peak (虚极)**, the **spirit arises (神自生)**;
Originally, there is no **qi (气)**—
when the **spirit moves (神运)**, the **qi transforms (气自化)**.
**Qi** has no inherent substance—
it **condenses and coalesces (凝委)** to form shape.
**Form** has no inherent nature—
when it **moves and functions (动用)**, its **nature is depleted (性亏)**.
Thus, what **gives birth to me (生我者)** is the **Dao (道)**,
and what **annihilates me (灭我者)** is **emotion (情)**.
When **emotion is forgotten (情忘)**, **nature is complete (性全)**,
when **nature is complete (性全)**, **form is complete (形全)**,
when **form is complete (形全)**, **qi is complete (气全)**,
when **qi is complete (气全)**, **spirit is complete (神全)**,
when **spirit is complete (神全)**, the **Dao is complete (道全)**,
when the **Dao is complete (道全)**, the **spirit reigns (神王)**,
when the **spirit reigns (神王)**, the **qi is refined (气灵)**,
when the **qi is refined (气灵)**, the **spirit transcends (神超)**,
when the **spirit transcends (神超)**, **nature is perfected (性彻)**,
when **nature is perfected (性彻)**, one **returns and reverses (反覆)**,
flowing **unified with the Dao (通流与道为一)**.
This allows one to **make the "having" into "non-being" (有为无)**,
and the "real" into **emptiness (虚)**—
to stand equal with the **Creator (造物者)**.

The **Dao (道)** does not desire **a fixed mind (有心)**,
for if there is **a fixed mind (有心)**, the **true qi (真气)** will not gather.
It does not desire **a strained will (苦志)**,
for if the **will is strained (苦志)**, **external evils (客邪)** will come and lodge.
It lies in **evenness and tranquility (平和恬淡)**,
**clarity and subtlety (澄静精微)**,
**emptiness and primordial essence (虚明含元)**,
**responsive yet unattached (有感必应)**,
**accepting without grasping (应而勿取)**—
then **true and false are distinguished (真伪斯分)**.
Thus, if my **heart does not incline (心不倾)**,
then all things will be **upright (无不正)**;
if **moving thoughts have their place (动念有属)**,
then all things will be **evil (无不邪)**.
The coming of **evil and rectitude (邪正)** depends on me alone.
Only when **refining the mundane (炼凡)** reaches **immortality (仙)**,
and **refining immortality (炼仙)** reaches **the True (真)**,
and **refining the True (炼真)** merges with **the Marvelous (妙)**,
and **merging with the Marvelous (合妙)** unites with **the Spirit (神)**,
and **Spirit unites with the Dao (神与道合)**,
then the **Dao becomes my body (即道为我身)**—
this is how I **ascend to the Jade Capital (升玉京)**,
**roam the Golden Gate (游金阙)**,
**possessing yet transcending (能有能无)**,
**without beginning or end (不终不段)**.»

The **Revered Mysteries Master (崇玄子)** said:
"I have often stated that **immortality and the spirit (神仙)** have **principles that can be cultivated (可学之理)**.
There are those who **attain without study (不学而自致)**,
endowed with **unique qi (异气)**;
There are those who **must study before achieving (必学而后成)**,
whose **practices are fully realized (功业充)**;
And those who **study yet fail (学而不得)**,
whose **initial diligence wanes (初勤终息)**.
Thus, those **far from immortality (远於仙者)** and those **near to immortality (近於仙者)** each have **seven distinctions (七焉)**.

The **body and qi (形气)** are the **repository of nature (性之府)**—
when the **body and qi (形气)** are destroyed, **nature has no place to reside (性无所存)**,
and if **nature has no place to reside (性无所存)**,
then what **am I (我何有)**?
This is the **first distinction of those far from immortality (远於仙者，一也)**;
Some say **immortality must have limits (仙必有限)**,
and one will **return to decline (归於沦坠)**—
this is the **second distinction of those far from immortality (远於仙者，二也)**;
Some say **the body’s decay is inevitable (形体以败散为期)**,
and **nourishing the vital breath (营魄)** is the means to **regenerate (更生)**—
how do they know of **entering the Great Furnace of Transformation (入造化之洪炉)**,
and **submitting to the refining of yin and yang (任阴阳之鼓铸)**?
This is the **third distinction of those far from immortality (远於仙者，三也)**;
Some say **luxurious titles (轩冕)** bring **fulfillment of desires (得意)**,
and **official honors (功名)** ensure **immortality (不朽)**—
they indulge in **beauty and sound (悦色耽声)**,
**abundant clothing and rich flavors (丰衣厚味)**—
this is the **fourth distinction of those far from immortality (远於仙者，四也)**;
In **times of vigor (强盛之时)**, they are **enslaved by emotional attachments (为情爱所役)**;
when **gray hairs appear (及斑白之后)**, their **studies begin to sprout (习学始萌)**,
yet **injuries remain unhealed (伤残未补)**—
they **covet the name of the Dao (窃慕道之名)**,
while **contradicting its true essence (乖契真之实)**—
this is the **fifth distinction of those far from immortality (远於仙者，五也)**;
They **pursue alchemy with relentless focus (汲汲於炉火)**,
and **study herbs with tireless effort (孜孜於草木)**—
this is the **sixth distinction of those far from immortality (远於仙者，六也)**;
They **violate prohibitions in their actions (动违科禁)**,
and **neglect cultivation in their stillness (静无修习)**—
this is the **seventh distinction of those far from immortality (远於仙者，七也)**.

But those who **indulge in the Dao’s emptiness (耽玄虚)**,
**few in desires (寡嗜欲)**,
**embody Supreme Stillness (体含至静)**,
and **take non-action as their practice (以无为为事)**—
this is the **first distinction of those near to immortality (近於仙者，一也)**;
Those who **plant myriad yin evils (万阴贼)**,
**cultivate yin virtue (植阴德)**,
**restrain anger and reduce desires (惩忿损欲)**,
**equalize praise and blame (齐毁誉)**,
and **refine true purity (修清真)**—
this is the **second distinction of those near to immortality (近於仙者，二也)**;
Those who **dwell in official positions (身居禄位)**,
yet **their hearts roam in virtue and the Dao (心游道德)**,
**practicing benevolence, humility, and harmony (仁慈恭和)**,
and **extending wide and generous love (弘施博爱)**—
this is the **third distinction of those near to immortality (近於仙者，三也)**;
Those who **do not covet titles (爵之不从)**,
nor **treasure wealth (禄之不爱)**,
and **tranquilly focus on preserving life (恬然以摄生为务)**—
this is the **fourth distinction of those near to immortality (近於仙者，四也)**;
Those who **use stillness to stabilize the body (静以安身)**,
**harmony to nurture the spirit (和以养神)**,
and **precision to attain the True (精以致真)**—
this is the **fifth distinction of those near to immortality (近於仙者，五也)**.

「失於壮齿，收之晚节，以功补过，以正易邪，
**When vigor fades in youthful years (壮齿), it is reclaimed in the twilight of life (晚节)**—
to **redeem past faults with merit (功)** and **replace falsehood with rectitude (正)**,
**refining the subtle (微) with precision (精)** and **accumulating it to manifest (成着)**—
this is the **sixth distinction of those near to immortality (近於仙者，六也)**.

忠孝清廉，不待学而自得，
**Loyalty, filial piety, integrity, and incorruptibility (忠孝清廉)**,
**naturally attained without formal study (不待学)**—
this is called **hidden brilliance and latent transformation (隐景潜化)**,
**where death does not extinguish their essence (死而不亡)**—
this is the **seventh distinction of those near to immortality (近於仙者，七也)**.

**To embrace the seven near (取七近) and reject the seven distant (放七远)**,
is to **extract oneself from the mire of suffering (拔陷区) and escape the perilous path (出溺途)**.

玉芝篇
**The Five Great Phases (五太相生)**,
**manifest before all things (在物之先)**,
**clearly foretell the coming (明告来者)**,
**like the hidden treasures of the Dao (犹鱼之荃)**.

The **Zhao Yuanzi (朝元子)** Chen Ju (陈举) said in the **Treasure of the Primordial (宝元中人)**:
**To merge with the root of the Primordial (混元之本)**,
**to follow the pivot of Heaven and Earth (法天地之枢)**—
**establish oneself as the Great Furnace and Vast Cauldron (洪炉大鼎)**,
**to refine one’s True Essence (炼其真焉)**.

**Internally, cultivate the lead and mercury (养铅汞)**,
**externally, embody the trigrams of Li (☲ 離) and Kan (☵ 坎)**—
**harmonize yin and yang (运其阴阳)**,
**command dragons and tame tigers (驱龙驭虎)**,
**to return to the root and restore the Primordial (返本还元)**.

Thus,
**the mystic frost and crimson snow (玄霜绛雪)**,
**the jade elixir and golden salve (玉药金膏)**,
**are ninefold refined into treasure (九转而成宝)**.

**Wei Boyang (魏伯阳) achieved Dao through the Three Refined (参同成道)**,
**Ma Mingcheng (马明生) transcended through Golden Elixir (金液超真)**,
**Yin Changsheng (阴长生) concocted the elixir of Supreme Truth (太真之剂)**,
**and Liu An (刘安) cultivated the Primordial One (太一之元)**—
**this is what is meant by the hidden treasures of the Dao (奥荃者欤)**.

**While the yang soul (阳魂) remains unmanifest (未交)**,
**it is like the dark cavern (玄窟)**.
**Once the yang essence (阳精) begins to take form (既兆)**,
**it then assumes its inherent nature to manifest as substance (禀性以成乎形)**.

Thus,
**yin separates from yang and returns to quiescence (阴判阳而归寂)**,
**while yang dwells within yin and forms materiality (阳寓阴而成质)**.
**When yin and yang unite, all things flourish (阴阳交而万物泰)**;
**when sun and moon coalesce, the four seasons manifest (日月合而四时成)**.

**If Heaven and Earth did not interact (天地不交)**,
**how would day and night arise (何以为昼夜)？**
**If sun and moon did not merge (日月不合)**,
**how would their waxing and waning be known (何以着盈反)？**
**If all things did not unite (万物不合)**,
**how would their display of growth, decay, and change be seen (何以显荣枯)？**

**At the time of the Great Simplicity (太易)**,
**the cosmos is indistinct and hazy (混混蒙蒙)**, like **the embryo in the womb (胞中蒂)**—
**thus arises the meaning of the Great Simplicity’s first spring, the single yang (首春一阳)**.

Its **substance is the dark and luminous (玄黄)**,
**before the four symbols (四象) are distinct**.
**The mystic mist of the Golden Elixir (玄雾乎金液)**,
**the radiant light sealing the Water Spirit (华光锁乎水精)**.
**The night begins at the hour of Zi (子)**, the **initial position of the hidden dragon (初九潜龙)**.

The **Great Simplicity (太易)** is:
**virtue (仁), spring (春), yang (阳), dragon (龙), sun (日), Heaven (天), fire (火), soul (魂), spirit (神), mercury (汞), wood (木)**.
Thus, **yang qi (阳气)**—
**entering things brings life (入乎物日生)**,
**departing things brings death (离乎物曰死)**.
The **Great Simplicity governs life (司生)**.

**If yang does not ascend from below (阳不发於下)**,
**how would all things come to life (则万物何以生哉)？**
Thus, the **Classics say: "Upper Water, Lower Fire" (上水下火)**—
**this refers precisely to this principle**.
**Yang must rise and steam above (必蒸於上)**,
**while yin must moisten below (阴必润於下)**.
**Steaming is its heat (蒸者，其热也)**.
**Heat steams the yin (蒸其阴)**,
**while yin ascends as vapor (阴腾其气)**.
**The light (轻者)** floats upward to become Heaven (上浮而为天)**—
**its clear mists and clouds (清云霞)**,
**its condensed rains and dews (凝雨露)**,
**its dispersed winds and vapors (散风烟)**,
**its cold frosts and snows (寒霜雪)**.
**From Zi (子) to Wu (午), it ascends (升者)**;
**from Wu (午) past Zi (子), it descends (降者)**.

**The clouds, mists, frosts, snows, rains, dews, winds, and vapors (云霞、霜雪、雨露、风烟、气雾)**—
**these are the means by which yin descends to nourish all things (所以降而滋万物者也)**.
The **Classics say: "Return to the root and restore the Primordial, merging with the Earth’s pulse" (返本还元归於地脉)**—
**this is what is meant (此之谓欤)！**

**Within the body, it becomes the fluids (津), the essences (液), the tears (涕), the blood (血), the flesh (肉), the semen (精), and the marrow (髓)**.
**The five metals and eight stones (五金八石)**,
**depend on the rising and descending of Heaven and Earth’s qi (依乎天地之升降)**,
**their transformation and harmonization (运转和合)**,
**and their return to the root essence (归乎本元)**—
**thus, it is called "restoration" (故曰还)**.
**Ninefold refining yields rigidity (九炼成刚)**—
**thus, it is called "elixir" (故曰丹)**.

The **Great Beginning (太初)** is **the origin of Heaven, Earth, and all things (天地万物之初)**.
**When yang and yin first establish form (阴阳得位)**,
**the tiger and dragon are divided (虎龙分)**.
**The clear and turbid qi of Heaven and Earth (清浊之气)**,
**follow the grand keys (崇钥)**, transforming into all things.

This **qi (气)**—
**in the Dao, it is yin and yang (阴阳)**;
**in humans, it is soul and spirit (魂魄)**;
**in things, it is their outer and inner layers (表裹)**;
**in Heaven, it is sun and moon (日月)**;
**on Earth, it is sound and color (声色)**;
**in the elixir field (丹田), it is lead and mercury (铅汞)**.

This **Dao (道)**—
**arises from One (生於一)**,
**One generates Two (一生二)**,
**Two generates Three (二生三)**,
**Three generates all things (三生万物)**,
**and finally returns to One (终於一)**.

Thus, it is said:
**One is water (一者，水也)**;
**Two is fire (二者，火也)**;
**Three is earth (三者，土也)**.
**Are there things that do not thus generate and perish (物有不因此而生灭者)？**
**Water and fire (水火)**—
**each obtains its own singular aspect (各得其一)**.
**Obtaining One (得一)**—
**this is the mother of things (物之母)**,
**the essence of qi (气之精)**,
**the root of life (命之根)**,
**and the progenitor of consciousness (识之祖)**.

The **Heavenly Dao** obtains its **augmented power (威)** through this,
the **Earthly Dao** obtains its **manifested potential (机)** through this.
This is the **progenitor of the Divine (神之祖)**,
the **agent of qi (气之使)**,
the **father of things (物之父)**,
the **controller of the spirit (魂之制)**,
and the **master of the body (身之主)**.

**Water** generates a single male—this is the **Kàn (坎)**, named **mercury (汞)**;
**Fire** generates two females—this is the **Lí (离)**, named **lead (铅)**.
This is called the **Four Symbols (四象)**.

**Mercury (汞)** is the **elixir (丹)**;
**Lead (铅)** is the **medicine (药)**.

The **Heavenly Old Lord (天老神君)** says:
*"Use lead but not mercury,
must first refine within lead,
yet when it comes to using mercury,
using mercury alone is a mistake—how so?"*

**Mercury (汞)** is **yang (阳)**, the **child (子)**;
**Lead (铅)** is **yin (阴)**, the **mother (母)**.
**Mercury (汞)** without **lead (铅)**—
its **singleness (独#1)** lacks the **motherly aspect**—
how then can it generate?

When **lead (铅)** and **mercury (汞)** merge,
and after **three years** they become **treasure (宝)**,
burning away the **lead’s (铅)** impure **qi (气)**—
this is **shedding the shell (脱壳)**,
named **pure yang (纯阳)**.

Thus, *"use lead but not mercury"*—
I have observed the **Great Dao (大道)** does not surpass **yin and yang (阴阳)**,
uniting in the **Central Palace (中宫)**,
where there is **movement (动)** and **stillness (静)**.

**Movement (动)** is **mercury (汞)**, pure and inclined to ascend;
**Stillness (静)** is **lead (铅)**, turbid and reluctant to rise.
When **mercury (汞)** ascends, it aligns with **fire (火)**;
when **lead (铅)** remains still, it aligns with **water (水)**.
**Water (水)** flows and moistens,
**Fire (火)** attracts and dries—
is this not so?

The **Divine (神)** is **life (命)**;
**Stillness (静)** is **nature (性)**.
**Life (命)**—
moves and brings **birth (生)** and **fulfillment (成)**;
**Nature (性)**—
remains still and is **unstained (无染)** and **unattached (无着)**.

Thus, the **three souls (三魂)** return to **Heaven (天)**,
the **seven residues (七魄)** return to **Earth (地)**,
each having its own **source (源)**.

**Tàisù (太素)** is the **foundation (本)**.
When the **foundation (本)** is established, the **Dao (道)** arises.

In the **Tàishǐ (太始)** and **Tàisù (太素)** era,
**hardness (刚)** and **softness (柔)** were distinguished,
to establish the **Three Powers (三才)**,
to manifest the **Four Symbols (四象)**.

**Tàisù (太素)** governs **autumn (秋)**,
the time when **all treasures (万宝)** are formed.
The **classics (经)** say:
*"Fire becomes empty, water becomes void—
this is their **form and symbol (形象)**."*

For instance, a person in the **womb (胎)**,
**yin blood (阴血)** and **yang essence (阳精)**,
mixed and coalescing,
by the **third month** the **yin and yang (阴阳)** separate,
and each attains its own **abode (居)**.

The **mother’s (母)** primordial **role (元职)** is in the **muddy origin (泥元)**,
named the **sea of blood (血之海)**;
The **father’s (父)** primordial **mastery (元主)** is in the **yin position (阴位)**,
below the **navel (脐下)**,
named the **sea of qi (气之海)**.

Their **divine qi (神气)** intermingles,
named the **Three Powers (三才)**.
The **harmonizing (冲)** and **balancing (和)** **qi (气)** follows the mother’s **breathing (呼吸)**,
responding to her **upward and downward (上下)** flow.
When the **Three Powers (三才)** are complete, all things **grow (长)**.

The **mother’s (母)** primordial **mastery (元主)**—
**blood (血)**, **flesh (肉)**, **essence (精)**, **marrow (髓)**, **will (意)**, **residue (魄)**—
is my **lead (铅)**, the **tiger (虎)**;
The **father’s (父)** primordial **mastery (元主)**—
**sinews (筋)**, **bones (骨)**, **heart (心)**, **soul (魂)**—
is my **mercury (汞)**, the **dragon (龙)**.
By the **fifth month**, form is nearly complete,
and the **outer and inner layers (表裹)** are divided.

My **transformation and nurturing (化育)**—
is this not just like this?

The **Yang elixir (阳丹)** is **essence (精)**;
The **Yin elixir (阴丹)** is **blood (血)**.
When the **Southern Sun reaches its zenith (日南至)**,
it marks the **beginning of one yang (一阳之始)**, the **hidden dragon’s position (潜龙之位)**.
Await the retreat of **five yin (五阴)** as **yang ascends (阳升)**.
The **eleventh month, twelfth month, and first month**—
these are the **times of three yang (三阳之时)**, when all things **sprout (芽)**.
Is not my **refinement of form (炼形)** also thus?

**"Three thousand" of attainment (功盈三千)**, what does it mean?
To ingest the elixir for **a thousand days (服丹千日)** is **three years (三年)**.
It is like the **three months of spring within the elixir**—
in three years, the **two qi (二气)** are fully manifested.
**Transform my mortal frame (易吾之躯)** into the **natural body (自然之体)**,
circulating **water and fire**, merging **mercury and lead (交汞铅)** through **nine transformations (九转)**.
**Nine transformations (九转)** are **nine years (九年)**.
**Nine times nine (九九)** is the **completion of numbers (数之盈)**.
Within **nine years**, there are **nine changes (九易)**:
The **first year** refines **qi (易气)**,
the **second year** refines **blood (易血)**,
the **third year** refines **vessels (易脉)**,
the **fourth year** refines **flesh (易肉)**,
the **fifth year** refines **marrow (易髓)**,
the **sixth year** refines **sinews (易筋)**,
the **seventh year** refines **bones (易骨)**,
the **eighth year** refines **hair (易发)**,
the **ninth year** refines **form (易形)**.
Those **aspiring to the Dao (志於道者)**—
how could they fail to examine this?

To **abandon this and seek the Dao (舍是而求道者)** is like the **blind pursuing a hare (瞽者逐兔)**.

The **Yellow Emperor (黄帝)** said:
*"I possess the **Returning Elixir (还丹)**, sevenfold in its kind (其品七焉):*
**saliva (津)**, **marrow (髓)**, **blood (血)**, **spittle (唾)**, **essence (精)**, **qi (气)**, **spirit (神)**.
Thus, I speak of **water, fire, lead, and mercury (指水、火、铅、汞)** as metaphors.
**Saliva (津)** is **mercury (汞)**,
**essence (精)** is **lead (铅)**.

**Water** dwells in the **brain (脑中)**,
**fire** resides in the **lower abdomen (脐下)**.
Circulate **lead to govern mercury (运铅以制汞)**,
refine **mercury to return to lead (炼汞以投铅)**,
coming and going, returning to the source—
**water and fire are thus harmonized (水火正矣)**.

The **Great Ultimate (太极)** is the **end of heaven, earth, and all things (天地万物之终)**.
Thus it is said:
The **Great Ease (太易)** is **water (水)**;
The **Great Beginning (太初)** is **wood (木)**;
The **Great Commencement (太始)** is **fire (火)**;
The **Great Substance (太素)** is **metal (金)**;
The **Great Ultimate (太极)** is **earth (土)**.
All things **are born and die in earth (生死於土)**.

**One yang** first **stirs in the eleventh month (子十一月)**.
In the **Book of Changes (易)**, it begins with **Kǎn (复)**,
then **Lín (临)**, **Tài (泰)**, **Dà Zhuàng (大壮)**, and **Fù (夫)**—
**Qián (乾)** is the **apex of yang numbers (阳数之极)**.
**One yin** first **stirs in the fifth month (午五月)**.
In the **Book of Changes**, it begins with **Shēn (娠)**,
then **Huán (还)**, **Pǐ (否)**, **Guān (观)**, and **Bò (剥)**—
**Kūn (坤)** is the **apex of yin numbers (阴数之极)**.
This is the **symbol of one year (一岁之象)**.

**One month (一月)** is also the **symbol of one year (一岁之象)**,
**one day (一日)** is also the **symbol of one month (一月之象)**—
all bear the **numbers of yin, yang, and the Five Phases (阴阳五行之数)** within them.

No thing reaches **eighth or ninth month (八月、九月)** without completion—
thus, my **elixir has nine transformations (九转)**.

Who is not the result of **yin and yang combining (阴阳合)**?
The **sun with a crow (日有乌)** is **yin (阴)**;
The **moon with a hare (月有兔)** is **yang (阳)**.

From the **first to the eighth day of the moon (一日至八日)**,
its name is **upper arc (上弦)**, **192 *cùn* (一百九十有二铢)**—
**gold and water balanced (金水平分)**.
Its name is **"one-eight" (一八)**, the **division of spring (春之分)**.
Its time belongs to **Mao (卯)**, called **lead (铅)**, **192 *cùn* (一百九十有二铢)**.
By the **sixteenth day (旬有六日)**, **yang reaches its peak (阳数极)** and **brightens (而明)**,
then **one yin arrives (一阴至)** and **yang retreats (阳退)**.

After the **sixteenth day**, it **wanes until the twenty-third day (亏至二旬有三日)**,
its name is **lower arc (下弦)**, also **192 *cùn* (一百九十二铢)**—
**dragon and tiger balanced (龙虎中分)**.
It is also called **"one-eight" (一八)**, the **division of autumn (秋之分)**.
Its time belongs to **Yǒu (酉)**, called **mercury (汞)**, **192 *cùn* (一百九十有二铢)**.
By the **twenty-fourth day (二旬有四日)**, **yin is at its height (阴盛)** and **yang declines (阳衰)**,
the **sun and moon are exhausted (日月尽)**, and **yin reaches its limit (阴极)**.

**Yang** and **yin**—
do they not **end and begin anew (终而复始)**?
Thus, **eight days** are **192 *cùn* (一百九十有二铢)**,
and **sixteen days** are **384 *cùn* (三百八十有四铢)**.
A **jīn (斤)** produces **16 liǎng (两)**, a **liǎng** is **four fēn (分)**.
Thus, **384 *cùn* (三百八十有四铢)** corresponds to the **numbers in the Great Ease (大易之策数)**.

A **year’s days (一岁之日)**—their **qi (气)** and **climates (候)**—are **twenty-four (二十有四)**,
thus **complete (备矣)**.
Counting their **divisions (分)** as **sixty-four (六十有四)**,
these are also the **lines of the sixty-four hexagrams (卦之爻)** in the **Great Ease**.
**Six lines per hexagram (六爻)**, **four hexagrams (四卦)**, totaling **384 lines (凡三百八十有四爻)**—
they align with the **numbers of the Great Ease (易之策数)**,
and they also align with **human breathing (人之息数)**.

Thus, **fire is kindled from Zi (子) to Wu (午)**, six hours—
**yang (阳)**, its symbol **spring and summer (春夏)**;
From **Wu (午) to Zi (子)**, six hours—
**yin (阴)**, its symbol **autumn and winter (秋冬)**.
Even within **one day (一日之内)**,
the **sequential movements of heaven, earth, sun, moon, and stars (天地日月星辰)** are fully present—
**twenty-four qi (二十四气)**, **seventy-two seasonal divisions (七十二候)** are all complete.
Thus, my **Dao cannot be neglected in any one aspect (废一而为之者)** and still succeed.

Why must **fire be kindled at Zi (子)**?
To **harness yang qi (承阳气)** and **ignite the fire (起火)**—
only then is its **power complete (火力斯全)**.
Beyond **Zi (子)**, **yin predominates (阴盛)** and **fire falters (火不然)**.
Thus it is said: **"Water overcomes fire (水克火)"**.

**Fire (火)** is not the **fire of the heart (心之火)**.
The **heart (心)** is the **spirit (神)**.
I have the **central furnace (中宫之鼎)** beneath the heart,
so when the **heart is fire (心为火)**, it is **consumption (焚)**—
**fire above the furnace (火在鼎之上)**.
The **Classic** says:
*"Fire arises from below the navel (火起於脐下),
water emerges from the furnace (水出於鼎中)"*—
the **accomplished (既济)** symbol.
**Water above, fire below (上水下火)**.

This **furnace (鼎)**—
when the time reaches **Mao (卯)**, **lead increases (增铅)**;
when the time reaches **Yǒu (酉)**, **mercury increases (增汞)**.
**Lead without fire does not ascend (铅不得火则不腾)**,
**mercury without lead does not solidify (汞不得铅则不凝)**.
The **Classic** says:
*"Take water from the mountain (取水於山),
ignite fire from the sea (起火於海),
extract mercury from the high tower (取汞於重楼),
gather lead from the ninth heaven (采铅於九天)"*—
its **circulation (运)** is **complete in the four seasons (备乎四时)**.
**Align with spirit (与神御之)**, **harmonize with qi (与气和之)**—
then the **four symbols (四象)** are complete,
and the **central furnace (中宫之鼎)** resembles a **magpie (鹦子)**.
In **three years (三年)**, **red and white are distinguished (赤白判)** and the **body is exchanged (换躯)**.

**Golden intestines and jade bones (金肠玉骨)** emerge from the **Five Phases (五行)**,
their name is **shedding (蜕)**.
Thus, the **four symbols merge (四象交)** and **mercury is purified (汞乾)**,
**yang is complete (一阳备)** and **lead is eliminated (铅去)**—
its name is the **Returning Elixir (还丹)**.
Then the **spirit and soul stand firm (神魂立)**,
and the **body becomes unyielding (其体刚矣)**.

**Three Flowers into One, Five Colors Return to Yang—**
this is called the **Uncultivated Realm**.

The **Chao Yuan Zi** once composed a song of it, sixty verses in total.
When the **You Zi** read them, he exclaimed:
*"Profound! The depths of the Great Dao!"*
Now I reveal them plainly.

**The *Direct Meaning*** says:
*"Two greens must be paired with four yellows, ground together—
all transformations are but the natural union.
To make the Three Pure Ones return to One Chamber,
you must rely on the Cloud-Rain to circulate the Three Fields.
To the south, blood is mercury from the sand,
to the north, essence is lead from the water.
This is the law of the Great Luo Heaven—
once recognized, one becomes an Immortal."*

**The *Alchemical Prescriptions*** say:
*"Within the Central Plain, the two or three households of Chonghe
produce gold, silver, mercury, and sand.
The radiant spirit-plant grows on Ling Mountain’s peaks,
the noble wavelike flowers bloom in the purple mists.
From the ninth heaven’s heights, the Primordial Fire is born,
and in the three-tiered furnace, the treasure-carriage ascends.
The mysteries are clear and profound—
no further arcane wonders need be boasted."*

**The *Winter Solstice*** says:
*"Li and Kan alternate, and I can fathom them—
beneath the five yins, the Qian Dragon lies.
The Yang Symbol advances and retreats, high then low,
the Returning Hexagram adds and subtracts, single and double.
All day, the noon hour marks the start of summer,
each night after the hour of Zi brings the new winter.
Do not say Heaven, Earth, and Man are unfathomable—
the *Zhou Yi* clearly reveals its fundamental intent."*

**The *Path of Attainment*** says:
*"How could the Bagua’s departure be delayed?
Two paths diverge to the edge of Heaven—
within Li, the Geng-Xin lands lie,
and within Yin, the Jia-Yi flowers bloom.
The Three Scenes follow the crimson-crested crane’s clouds,
the Five Directions’ winds summon the Purple River Car.
Beneath Kunlun’s peaks, the burning place—
a single beam of light-wind leads to the Mother’s abode."*

**The *Mysterious Female*** says:
*"The central peak, towering, aligns sun and moon,
while Qian and Kun’s branches and leaves thrive in Ling Xi’s stream.
The tortoise and serpent coil in dual segments,
wind and rain drench the banks, one field of water.
Within the furnace, the ministers are named Zi and Wu,
in the cauldron, the husband and wife are called Shu and Xi."*

**The *Child-Mother*** says:
*"Within one, another one—how could this be spoken?
The Three Realms arise from a single source.
In the Red Stone Cavern, the Holy Mother hides,
On the Vermilion Palace Platform, the Divine Grandson appears.
Within the Jade Pool’s waves, the true cinnabar-mercury glows,
Before the White Jade Peak, the murmuring clouds drift.
This is the Origin of Heaven and Earth—
The world’s fools would never hear of such things."*

**The *Mother’s Visage*** says:
*"The Vermilion Gate and Jade Palace already stand in peace,
Gazing upon the construction of the Purple-Gold Citadel.
Rain and wind extinguish the Three Fires,
Thunder and lightning drive back the Five Essences.
Black qi fades with the mist’s dispersal,
The elixir’s first taste rises with the clouds.
Though the work is not yet fully perfected,
One knows to register among the Celestial Court’s names."*

**The *Purple River Car*** says:
*"Mingled winds and white qi descend,
The Golden Mother descends to Penglai’s expanse.
The Snowy Peaks’ Three Passes open,
The Celestial Streets’ two paths extend.
The Elixir Hall’s court assembles the Emperor,
The Watery Realm accompanies the Sacred Infant.
Nine times nine, frost and snow descend,
Yang light pervades the Purple City."*

**The *Dao/Way’s Release*** says:
*"The mysteries of Primordial Transformation are hard to fathom,
The Golden Earth’s teachings run even deeper.
Dragon and Tiger have long given birth to the Four Seas,
The Golden Just Ones originally dwell in the Twin Forests.
The Yang Soul stands alone, preserving life,
The Yin Nature ascends alone, transcending the mortal heart.
Endless flow yet none comprehend—
Willing to be like water-bubbles in rise and fall."*

**The *Joy of the Dao/Way*** says:
*"A myriad vain labors plague this body,
Here, subtle signs communicate with the divine.
Sometimes, the Golden Phoenix dances on the mountain’s peak,
At night, the Qí-flowers bloom across the sea’s face.
Valley qi of the Five Phases all become earth,
The Yang elixir transcends the kalpas, leaving no dust.
Each morning, only seek those of like mind,
To meet the Bundled Void—no one else remains."*

*«The *Ritual of the Altar*» says:
*"To build the altar, no earth nor ash is used,
Creation relies entirely on the **Homogeneous Elixir** as the mediator.
The bitter mists condense into frost, Yin conceives the **Mercury**,
Light clouds enfold the snow, Fire births the **Primordial Embryo**.
When the threefold work is complete, the Three Realms are divided,
When the fivefold talents are perfected, the Five Peaks are revealed.
Refinement must follow this method alone,
Do not let the filth of dust disturb the **Divine Embryo**."*

*«The *Fetal Breath*» says:
*"Faint and yet profound, the Void is both white and pure,
Harmonized and clear—returning to the **Root of the Original**.
The Three **Mercuries** return to their **Native Realm**,
The myriad **Sprouts** are gathered back to the **Bundled Void**.
Yang coalesces, Yin forms the **Symbol of the Embryo**,
The **Golden Phoenix** flourishes, Fire takes shape.
Who can match this work?
A thousand days fill the **Divine Essence**."*

*«The *Two Eights*» says:
*"Graceful and refined, the **Two Eights** of windy elegance,
Husband and wife rejoice, united in bliss.
**Layered** and **Mysterious** divide Yin and Yang,
**Mao** and **You** equally share the **upper and lower arcs**.
The **White Beast** hides at the start, like the **Tiger’s Den**,
The **Green Dragon** rests at full moon, in **Dragon’s Sleep**.
[Original text missing two lines]

*«The *Divine Water*» says:
*"The enlightened ruler’s **Dao/Way** clears all lands,
With one stroke, the Yellow River reaches the **Boundless Void**.
All **Dharmas** are upheld by the **Celestial Sovereigns**,
The Three **Talents** revere their **Root in the Bundled Darkness**.
The **Black Pearl** subjugates the **Homogeneous Elixir** in the **Palace of the Void**,
The **Red Elixir** circulates in the **Court of the Great Ultimate**.
If one does not awaken in a hundred years, how many days will pass?
Willingly follow the **Five Thieves**, letting the body run wild."*

*«The *Original Dao/Way*» says:
*"The Dao/Way that establishes Heaven is fixed in the human form,
It never departs from **lead, cinnabar, mercury, and silver**.
The **Metal Horse** gallops back in the **Mountain’s Rain**,
The **Earth Ox** plows forth in the **Palace’s Spring**.
Within the **Celestial Sovereign’s Hall**, the Three **Qi** are attuned,
In the **Martial Furnace**, the Four **Divine Agents** are nurtured.
Even the greatest talents cannot fathom this alone,
**Confucius** himself still questions the **Fisherman**."*

*«The *Pairing*» says:
*"The **Two Eights** of windy elegance meet once more,
This night’s joyful reunion carries heavy **auspicious qi**.
Husband and wife return to sleep in the **Green Canopy**,
The **Bubbling Phoenix** resumes its **White Geng-Dragon** stride.
Together they feast on the **congealed essence of the Azure Clouds**,
Their union blooms beyond the **jade-like form of the Celestial Phoenix**.
Who knows who first initiated this?
Let us join Heaven and Earth in this shared **principle**."*

*«The *Seven Returns*» says:
*"The **Mother** moves alone in her **camp**,
The **Wind and Clouds** welcome only after her passage.
She cycles through the **Five Sacred Peaks**,
Ascending step by step to the **Three Pure Ones**.
She dwells in the **Southern Water of the Ninefold Return**,
Gathering the **Seven Flavors of the Embryo’s Essence**.
With the **Ninefold Return**, the work is complete in a day,
The **body of the Celestial Phoenix** weighs but **six liang** and is light."*

*«The *Manifest Dao/Way*» says:
*"Once the **principle** is attained, all is effortless,
Residing in **thoughts of tranquility**, nurturing **Nature’s Spontaneity**.
The **Three Flowers** fade, leaving the **Pure Land**,
The **Seven Treasures** are gathered to sow the **Field of the Embryo**.
Life and death are all **Dao/Way**—rooted in Heaven and Earth,
**Vitality** and **destiny** belong to **mercury and lead**.
This method should lead to the **Dao/Way’s Path of the Elixir**,
'Four **Eclipses**—when the day comes, let the body turn to dust."*

*«The *Forging the Cauldron*» says:
*"Rabbit marrow and crow liver, one **jin** in measure,
Enclosed in the **Heaven-Earth Furnace**, refined into the **True Elixir**.
The **Green Dragon** nourishes with **snowy milk** to strengthen sinew and bone,
The **Red Elixir** blooms flowers to forge the **Cauldron’s Body**.
Within its **three legs**, the **Three Worlds** are divided,
Its **double tiers** encase the **Celestial Stars**.
Common folk do not recognize the **method of longevity**,
Yet they say: ‘Forging the elixir is not the true way.’"*

*«The *Fire’s Temperament*» says:
*"At the initial **nine**, Yang arrives from midnight,
The **Whale’s Breath** pierces the **Penglai Sea** within.
The **Twelvefold City** enfolds the **Dragon Chariot’s Return**,
Before the **Twelve Palaces**, the **Tiger’s Steed** wheels back.
A **jin** of sun and moon becomes the **Great Medicine**,
Two **jin** of Heaven and Earth first form the **Embryo**.
Clearly measure the **Heavenly Cycle’s Count**,
Do not let **erroneous timing** or **false incantations** rush the process."*

*«The *Mind’s Method*» says:
*"Again, it belongs to **South Without** and to **Yellow**,
Before the gate, the **Two Golden Trees** stand tall.
All myriad **afflictions** are born from the mind’s creation,
The **Seven Thieves** must perish by the **sword of insight**.
The **Mind’s Essence** enfolds the **Wisdom-Light Boat**,
Within **Zen**, the **Ancestral Seal** shines like frost in day.
When the **Single Essence** reaches the shore, abandon the **Mind’s Method**,
Only then is one called **Liberation’s Fragrant Incense**."*

*«The *Union of the Dao/Way*» says:
*"The **Wondrous Woman** lies in the **lonely pavilion**,
**Liu Lang** arrives at midnight’s hour.
East and west, **celestial mists** arise,
Above and below, **rain-winds** follow in turn."*

*«The *Alchemical Refining*» says:
*"Tame the three forms of **mercury**,
Harmonize the five little ones;
After a thousand days of **Divine Elixir**,
The husband and wife shall part in two."*

*«The *Furnace Has a Gate*» says:
*"At the Five Aggregates Mountain’s white jade peak,
The **Green Sovereign**’s branches and leaves dwell within.
Towering waves arise, **Dragon** moves the rain,
**Zhūróng**’s **cloud-winds** follow the **Tiger’s** roar.
Two currents of **jade-green** flow intertwined above and below,
Two **solar** eclipses return east and west;
Before one’s eyes, the **Dao/Way** is plainly pointed out,
Yet doubt and grasping cling to the **void** all too long."*

*«The *Three-Five Cycle*» says:
*"The Great Sky hangs its **cosmic symbols** to meet **Kunlun**,
The Eight Trigrams first divide at **child’s hour** and **midnight**;
The Three Realms arise from **True Martial Fire**,
The Five Talismans rise and fall with **Zhūróng Sovereign**.
The **Black Dragon** exhales mist—**river-pool rains**,
The **Red Sovereign** brings spring—**mountain-altar clouds**;
If one does not seek within this truth,
One sweetly follows the **sensual chaos** in vain."*

*«The *Dao/Way’s Mechanism*» says:
*"Leisurely riding the **Earth-Horse** through lands and streams,
One traverses **Heaven** and **Earth** as if in a glance;
**Black-Faced Night-Demon** drives the **White Tiger**,
**Green-Haired Talisman** commands the **Red Tortoise** to gather near.
Two **sheng** of **sea-water** nourish the Three Realms,
A six-**cùn** porcelain bottle stacks the Nine Heavens;
When one grasps this truth, it is truly **self-sufficient**,
Yet who shall **measure and weigh** it to the **profound Dao/Way’s** depths?"

*«The *Dao/Way’s Virtue/Power*» says:
*"To depart from **Kàn (Abyss)** is the root of the **Primordial**,
The surging **Zhào** (creative transformation) holds **quán** (authority) as the One.
**Húnyīn** (undifferentiated darkness) is called **Upper Virtue/Power**,
**Xiān Tiān** (Primordial Heaven) is named **Lower Virtue/Power**.

When the **Mother** is strong, the **Child** must respond,
**Mercury** (Gǒng) dries as **Lead** (Qiān) selflessly yields.
**Dān Yáng** (Cinnabar) can undergo **nine transformations**,
Embracing the **One** to become an **Immortal**.

*«The *Jade Terrace of Golden Gates*» says:
*"On **Kūn Lún** (Kunlun) Mountain’s peak stand the Three Officials,
Who sever the **Heavenly Ford**—asking of both above and below.
A cluster of pavilions where **Dragons** emerge and vanish,
Two forked paths where **Phoenixes** return and wheel.
The **Harmonizing Hall** enfolds the **Principles of Yin and Yang**,
Within the **Twelve Terraces**, **Life-Force** and **Destiny** drift at ease.
If one does not here **fathom the creative transformation**,
They’ll be ensnared by **thoughts** in the **human realm**’s whirl."

*«The *Spiritual Primordial Realm*» says:
*"A single spark of **jīngyīng** (luminous essence) divides the **Black** (darkness),
Two tiers of streets gleam with **Buddha’s** gold and silver.
The entire city, **Dragon** and **Tiger** roam the **Three Realms**,
Their **beards** encircle the **Ten Thousand Folk** as the nation turns.
**Limitless Immortals** all gather in the **Cauldron**,
The **Great Thousand Worlds** never stray from one’s own body.
Yet if one truly **penetrates** the **inner dharma**,
To seek **Truth** outside is but **dust** to the mind.

*«The *Three in One*» says:
*"From the **heart of waves** emerges the **Five Phases**,
**Heaven** and **Earth** naturally **fulfill** their cycles.
**Fēn Fù** (fragrant fields) span **three sections**,
**Chéng Qīng** (pure waters) gather in **one pool**.
**Rise and fall** both rest in **Soil**,
**Returning to Nature** is but **Gēng** (the seventh Heavenly Stem).
Few **know** this as I do,
**Forgetting contrivance**—do not **display** it recklessly!"

*«The Nine Cauldrons»* says:
The sages and worthies manifest **forms** to embody **human relations**,
Yet never stray from the **true essence** veiled in **yang-yin**’s embrace.
All things are forged in **Heaven’s** water, refined in **Earth’s** embrace—
The **Five Phases** rise and fall like **spring** in the **Sea’s** deep heart.

The **Yellow Emperor’s** **Great Cold** roots in **Primordial Soil**,
While the **Great Sage’s** **Twin Pines** symbolize the **body’s** own form.
To **return** yet cannot **reclaim** the **original place**,
Endlessly **entering and emerging** in the **mire of delusion**.

*«The Joy of the Dao»* says:
I envy not nobles’ wealth or splendor’s display,
But cherish the **Supreme Path** as my life’s true way.
Each meal, I pluck **Queen Mother’s** garden’s fruit,
Silently watching **Jade Emperor’s** flowers bloom in the **cave’s** seclusion.

The **Sun** beneath the **water** is **Kui’s** **Wood-Fire**,
The **lead** within the **Soil** is the **Purple River’s** **elixir**.
The **busy world’s** fools, so lost in dust,
Would scarcely believe the **Heavenly Path** is not distant.

*«The Great Sea»* says:
The **Four Obscurities** name the **Four Great Elements**,
A million transformations merge with **Heaven’s** divine will.
**Fire** flickers on the **water’s** surface at **three watches**,
**Spring** blooms in the **pond’s** depths at **midnight’s** hour.

The **tides** surge from the **Tortoise’s** **mouth** in waves,
A **single rain** opens the **Sea Gate’s** **ford**.
This **Dao** few truly **know**—
How many grasp its **truth**?

*«The Nine Heavens»* says:
**Yin-Yang** unfolds the **Ninefold** **Heavenly Gates**,
All existing in the **common person’s** very **body**.
The **Earthly Horse** births **Mystic Lady’s** **Fire**,
The **Iron Ox** plows, turning the **Black Tortoise’s** **soul**.
Driven back into the **tail’s** **cavern**, flames link to the **void**,
Hurled into the **Heavenly Crossroads**, they **soar** upward.
This is the **foundation of life**, **Heaven’s** and **Earth’s** treasure—
Now **fuse the Tortoise and Hare** to **complete the cosmos**.

*«The Three Pure Ones’ Hall»* says:
**Heaven** and **Earth** in **harmonious balance**,
A **palace** of **seven treasures** in **jewel-crafted** splendor.
The **Two Principles** contain **ten thousand transformations**,
One **qi** threads the **Three Pure Ones** as one.
**Rain** descends upon the **mountain’s** peak,
**Clouds and mists** rise from the **sea’s** expanse.
**Golden Elixir** divides into **nine grades**,
**Divine inspiration** naturally **fulfills** its form.

*«The Flowering Pool»* says:
The **Holy Mother** rides the **River Chariot**,
Journeying through **Brahman’s** and **Buddha’s** **realms**.
The **Phoenix** circles, **rising** in **pair**,
The **Five Clouds** swirl, **twisting** in **grace**.
The **Earth’s Axis** pivots from the **Autumn Stone**,
The **Heavenly Wheel** grinds **rainbow-hued** **mists**.
If one cannot **grasp** this **principle**,
Where shall they **seek** the **Yellow Sprout**?

*«The Pointing to the Dao»* says:
**Being and Non-being** are the **Kàn-Lí** **essence’s** core—
Truly, the **Huang Family’s** **Way** is thus **complete**.
All things’ **origin** stems from **Kun’s** **Earth**,
The **Three Thousand Schools** spring from **Jǐng’s** **lineage**.
The **Phoenix** hides in the **south**, **green** within **white**,
The **Dragon** sleeps in the **north**, **black** within **bright**.
But if one **penetrates** **yin-yang’s** **manifesting** **transformations**,
The **common body** naturally **lightens**, **pure**.

*«The Unbounded Dao»* says:
I tend my **fields**, sowing **wheat** and **hemp**,
Then ride my **willed steed** past the **Three Vehicles**.
With **outstretched hands**, I greet the **Heavenly Worthy’s** **abode**,
Where **ten thousand things** are born in the **Mother’s** **domain**.
The **Fire-Horn** **Ox Brother** swallows the **Water-Tiger**,
The **Snow-Maned Lion** bears **golden sand**.

「But one must recognize the **true** **lead-mercury** (*zhen qian-hong*),[^1]
And match them, so that **inch-long sprouts** (*cun ya*)[^2] may burst forth at every moment.

*«The Art of Application»* says:
Last night, the **golden Phoenix** (*jin feng*) descended upon the **high mulberry** (*gao wu*),[^3]
Sleeping and embracing the **black Tortoise** (*li long*) within its mouth—**pearls** (*zhu*).
The **luminous body** (*guang ti*) rises from the **emerald pond** (*bi tan*) like **red waves** (*hong lang*),[^4]
Its **shadow** (*ying*) follows the **cold snow** (*han xue*), spreading **white gold** (*bai jin*)[^5] across the ground.
A **gentle breeze** (*qing feng*) scatters **three petals** (*hua san duo*) of flowers,
And **white milk** (*bai ru*)[^6] is refined into a **pitcher of wine** (*jiu yi hu*).
From this point onward, the **Elixir Platform** (*dan tai*) has a path to return—
**Fourfold darkness** (*si ming*)[^7] another day, let it endure **scorching decay** (*jiao ku*).

*«Nature and Life»* says:
The **A-type Tortoise** (*jia long*) belongs to the **fire** (*huo*) and **Kun’s** **Earth** (*kun di*),
The **Geng-type Tiger** (*geng hu*) is called **transformative talent** (*zao hua cai*).
There is **movement** (*you dong*) and **flight** (*you fei*)—the **true grandmother** (*zhen lao nu*),
No **growth** (*wu zeng*) nor **decay** (*wu zang*)—she is named **Thus-Come** (*Ru Lai*).
When **yin** (*yin*) is consumed, **pure yang** (*chun yang*) begins—
At **stillness** (*xiang ji*), she transcends the **six realms of rebirth** (*liu qu tai*).
The **ancestral Buddha** (*zu fo*) and **ancestral Immortal** (*zu xian*) are thus attained,
All returning to this **principle** (*li*), emerging from **dust** (*chen ai*).

*«True and False»* says:
Awaken to the **mystic black-and-yellow** (*xuan huang*)[^8] **transformative form** (*zao hua shen*),
Do not vainly seek **external** (*wai*) **divine** (*tong shen*)[^9] elsewhere.
**Yin-yang** (*yin-yang*) are not borrowed from others’ **figures** (*ta ren wu*),
**Dragon** (*long*) and **Tiger** (*hu*) must rely on **one’s own treasures** (*zi ji zhen*).
**Soul-nourishing elixirs** (*ling yao*) enter the body, harmonizing with **sun and moon** (*ri yue*),
**Cinnabar** (*dan sha*)[^10] refined by **fire** (*jing huo*) turns to **ash and dust** (*jie chen*).
After **nine years** (*jiu nian*), it returns without error—
Refined into **pure yang** (*chun yang*), it becomes the **Supreme Truth** (*zhi zhen*).

*«Returning to One»* says:
From the start, **pointing to the Dao** (*zhi dao*) is **not the Dao** (*fei dao*),
All talk of **yin-yang** (*yin-yang*) is but **transformative expedience** (*zao hua quan*).
Nurturing the **embryonic form** (*pao tai*)[^11] requires **ten moons** (*shi yue*),
Burning and refining **elixir** (*dan yao*) spans **three thousand days** (*san qian*).
The **five elements’** (*wu xing*) **sprouts and dregs** (*ya zi*) all return to **Earth** (*tu*),
The **seven spirits’** (*qi po*) **yin-winds** (*yin feng*)[^12] dissolve into **Heaven** (*gān*).
When the **work** (*gong*) attains **pure yang** (*chun yang*), it is called **embracing One** (*bao yi*),
Riding the **Dragon** (*long*) to **fly into the Great Luo Heaven** (*da luo tian*).

*«The Dao’s Source»* says:
One **soul** (*ling*)[^13] **originates** (*yuan chan*) within a **single herb** (*yi zhi zhong*),
Revealing **nature** (*xing*)—**four kinds** (*si lei*)[^14] in the **West** (*xi fang*).
Beneath the **sea**, the **Tiger** (*hu*) and **Dragon** (*long*) divide **day and night** (*fen zhou ye*),
In the **clouds**, the **male and female** (*nan nv*) are named **Western Bundles** (*xi shu*).
The **male** (*nan*) dwells in the **Northern Sea** (*bei hai*), **blue-green** (*qing zang*) within **white** (*bai*),
The **female** (*nv*) resides in the **Southern Mountain** (*nan shan*), **black** (*hei*) reflecting **red** (*ying hong*).
From this place, **ten thousand saints** (*wan sheng*) and **thousand sages** (*qian xian*) are attained,
All returning to this **ground** (*ci di*), merging into the **true void** (*he chen kong*).

*«The Five Elements Generating Each Other»* says:
One **thing** (*wu*) divides into **five forms** (*wu ban xing*),
Five **forms** (*wu ban*)[^15] of **refined essence** (*jing cai*) and **five kinds of sentiment** (*wu ban qing*).
The **green Dragon** (*qing long*) is originally the **golden son** (*jin gong zi*),
The **white Tiger** (*bai hu*) was once the **astonished daughter** (*jia nv xiong*).
The **four symbols** (*si xiang*)[^16] are arranged within **Kun’s** **Earth** (*kun di*),
The **central heavens** (*zhong tian*)[^17] **nourish** (*ji fang*) within **Jǐng’s** **lineage** (*bing jia sheng*).
The **great elixir** (*da dan*) leans chiefly on the **power of the golden flower** (*jin hua li*),
It must rely on the **virtuous mediator** (*liang mei*)[^18] for **harmonious completion** (*pi pei cheng*).

*«The Five Elements Conquering Each Other»* says:
The **Great Dao** (*da dao*) is **mysterious and profound** (*you xuan miao fu wei*),
The **five elements** (*wu xing*) **reciprocally generate** (*xiang fan*) their **threatening might** (*ge sheng wei*).
The **envoy of the South** (*nan fang shi*) originally wears **black** (*pi hei*),
The **general of the North** (*bei mian jiang jun*)[^19] **boldly** (*da zhe*) **dons the white** (*ying hei*).
**Kun’s** **female** (*kun nv*) slays her **husband** (*sha fu*),[^20] **yet he submits** (*fu shun fu*),
**Metal** (*gān*) conquers **Wood** (*mu*), **yet Wood returns** (*mu gui yi*).
If **mystic black-and-yellow** (*xuan huang*)[^21] **do not unite** (*wu jiao he*),
How could **yang** (*yang*) **ever rise from the abyss** (*kan*)[^22] and **fly** (*xia fei*)?

*«The Furnace and Tortoise»* says:
The **furnace and tortoise** (*lu ao*) are divided into **two heavenly qi** (*liu qian er qi jun*),
**Cyclic** (*xun huan*) **flow** (*shui*) **above and below** (*shang xia*), connecting their **source** (*jie yuan*).
**Forest and Grove** (*sen luo*)[^23] **irrigate** (*gai guan*) the **three fields** (*san tian*), overflowing—
Only when **congealed** (*ning jie*) does it form the **four seas** (*si hai*) in **oneness** (*hun*).
Within the **twenty-eight** (*er ba*)[^24] **body**, **transformative talent** (*zao hua*) is divided,
In **one pound** (*yi jin*) of **medicine** (*yao*), **Heaven and Earth** (*gān kūn*) are refined.
Boiling and frying require **the waters of Hua Pool** (*hua chi shui*),
When the **rain is sudden** (*yu zou*), **purchase the lotus** (*lei mai*) to **return** (*gui fan*) to the **ancestral home** (*gu yuan*).

*«Recognizing the Iron Ox»* says:
Every **person** (*shi ren*) has an **Iron Ox** (*tie niu*)[^25] to ride,
Yet **limitless** (*wu xian*) **common folk** (*chang liu*) know it not.
When **hunger strikes** (*ji dao*), they **consume the golden Tiger’s marrow** (*jin hu zhi sui*),
When **thirst comes** (*ke lai*), they **drink from the silver water pool** (*yin yin chi*).
They **drag the chariot** (*qian che*) to rest beneath **two groves** (*shuang lin xia*),
They **harness the fire** (*yun huo*) at **midnight** (*ban ye shi*).
This is the **true operation of yin-yang** (*shi yin-yang zhen dong yong*),
**Generating life** (*sheng cheng jia huo*)—all **depends on it** (*jin sui yi*).

*«Union»* says:
**Chang’e** (*chang e*) descends nightly into the **Heavenly Palace** (*tian tang*),
A **red torch** (*hong ju*)[^26] welcomes her into the **cave chamber** (*dong fang*).
She **suddenly departs** (*za bie*) the **nine heavens** (*jiu tian*) to **pay homage to the Holy Ancestor** (*chao sheng zu*),
Only to **arrive** (*cai lin*) in **central China** (*zhong guo*) before the **Immortal Husband** (*xian lang*).
She **feeds on Queen Mother’s jade fruits** (*yin wang mu qiong lin guo*),
She **drinks the nectar from the Western Palace’s** (*xi shuang gui dian jiang*).
This is the **true transformation of Heaven and Earth** (*zhen zao hua gān kūn*),
How could **radiance** (*zhao zhao*) not **emanate everywhere** (*he chu sheng guang*)?

*«Entering the Chamber»* says:
Tonight at **midnight** (*ye ban*) is the **auspicious hour** (*liang chen*),
Joyfully meeting **husband and wife** (*fu qi*) to **reunite old bonds** (*jie jiu yin*).
**Li’s** **female** (*li nv*) and **Kan’s** **male** (*kan nan*) come in **proper order** (*lai shun ling*),
**Geng’s** **husband** (*geng fu*) and **Jia’s** **wife** (*jia fu*) recognize their **natural affinities** (*ren xiang qin*).
The **proud Dragon** (*jun long*)[^27] **seizes the mountain peak** (*chen shan tou xi*),
The **fierce Tiger** (*ling hu*) **descends into the pure sea depths** (*jiang gui hai nei chun*).
After the **grandmother** (*lao nu*) and **Liu Lang** (*liu lang*) meet,
They **lead** (*yin*) him into the **cave** (*dong fu*) to **refine into the true** (*lian cheng zhen*).

*«The Refined Mercury»* says:
Two **forking paths** (*qi lu*) meet at the **mud pellet** (*ni wan*),
Ascending **green mountains** (*qing shan*) only to descend again.
Each time the **yellow crone** (*huang po*) is sent to **bear the earthen door** (*jian di hu*),
She **commands the Green Emperor** (*qing di*) to **close the Heavenly Gate** (*bi tian guan*).
The **benevolent Dragon** (*ren long*) **twists along the Three Pure Ones’ path** (*san qing lu*),
The **righteous Tiger** (*yi hu*) **circles the Nine Turns Bay** (*jiu zhuan wan*).
It is **all entrusted** (*quan jia*) to the **golden son** (*jin gong zi*) for **seizure and binding** (*qin fu*),
How could the **sun’s soul** (*ri hun*) **dare not return** (*na gan bu gui huan*)?

*«Refining the Lead»* says:
The **Iron Ox’s offspring** (*tie niu zi hou*) is fed **red flowers** (*hong hua*),
Its **violent roaring** (*meng lie pao xiao*)[^28] **no force** (*shi mo jia*) can **restrain**.
Turning back, it **spits white snow** (*pen bai xue*) from the **sea**,
Revolving its body on the **path**, it **bears golden sprouts** (*chan jin ya*).
The **nine heavens’ light** (*jiu tian guang*) **melts into the Dragon’s fiery march** (*long xing huo*),
The **three realms’ yin-dew** (*san jie yin lin*)[^29] **is the Phoenix’s sand-spitting** (*feng tu sha*).
Understanding the **law of the heavens above the heavens** (*tian shang tian fa*),
One **naturally finds it easy** (*zi ran rong yi*) to **enter the Immortals’ ranks** (*dao xian jia*).

*«Parent and Child Reunion»* says:
**Steady thought** (*ding si*) and **congealed spirit** (*ning shen*) at **midnight** (*ban ye*) grow **strong** (*qiang*),
**Colored clouds** (*cai xia*) **swirl** (*liao rao*) above the **elixir chamber** (*dan fang*).
In the past, they **jointly governed** (*gong guan*) the **Geng-Xin lands** (*geng xin di*),
Today, they **dwell together** (*tong ju*) in the **Jia-Yi villages** (*jia yi xiang*).
Within the **five-colored waves** (*wu cai lang*), the **Dragon** (*long*) **emerges and vanishes** (*chu mo*),
Beyond the **nine heavens’ clouds** (*jiu xiao yun*), the **crane** (*he*) **soars** (*fei xiang*).
The **three talents** (*san cai*)[^30] **share the same law** (*tong fa*)—no **difference** (*wu cha bie*),
Yet **foolish mortals** (*zhi shi yu ren*) **recklessly speculate** (*luan cun liang*).

*«Strong Yang»* says:
When **yin is extinguished** (*yin xi*), **yang ascends** (*yang teng*) in **coiling cycles** (*fu guo zhou*),
**Upholding the True One** (*zun zhi zhen yi*)[^31] **balances** (*ze gān rou*).
For **three years** (*san nian*), it **dwells as a guest** (*zu ke*) within the **pitcher** (*hu zhong*),
The **two essences** (*er wei*)[^32] **reside together** (*tong ju*) on the **island of the sea** (*hai shang zhou*).
It **subdues the mystic pearl** (*xuan zhu*) to **return to Earth** (*gui wu tu*),
It **arranges the Li-fire** (*li huo*) to **awaken the Tortoise** (*qi kun niu*).
The **ninefold gates** (*jiu chong men*) **wrap it** (*guo*), yet it **can be recalled** (*kān hui shou*),
Straight up to the **Tortoise Peak** (*gui feng*)—**former haunts** (*shou you*).

*«Adding to the Cauldron»* says:
The **medicine** (*yao*) is **not gold, stone, nor the three yellows** (*fei jin shi ji san huang*),
It **purely uses the soul’s essence** (*ling yuan*) to **counter the five constants** (*dui wu chang*).
At **midnight** (*zi ye*), **add to the furnace** (*tian lu*) the **three surnames’ treasures** (*san xing bao*),
At **dawn and dusk** (*chen hun*), **pour into the cauldron** (*tou ding*) the **five families’ nectar** (*wu jia jiang*).
Beside the **jade terrace’s pool** (*yu lou chi pan*) and the **wind-cloud cave** (*feng yun dong*),
On the **Tortoise Ridge’s peak** (*gui ling shan tou*), the **parent-child chamber** (*zi mu fang*).
This is the **true secret of the Returning Elixir** (*huan dan zhen mi li*),
Where else could one

The **Three-Grade Altar** complete, its substances manifest—
On **Five-Peak Mountain**, the **Pí-Lú** hall is raised.
Yet knowing only to **use the North as South**,
This is the **model of yin-yang transformation**.

*«Sprouting and Germinating»* says:
When the **Tài hexagram’s** yang harmony fully sprouts,
The **elixir + cinnabar** stands ashamed—life is born.
**Huángpó** best understands blending **Wén** and **Wǔ**,
While **Chìdì** excels in governing **Jiǎ-Gēng**.
Encountering **sliced gold** in wind-blown blossoms and fruit,
Opening **enlightenment** with waves, rain, and clouds—
Then take the **Nine Wilds’ Silver River water**,
To irrigate the **immortal root**, making it thrive.

*«Dividing the Two Qi»* says:
By the **third month**, the embryo forms—**two qi** complete;
Diligently refining **water and fire**, the essence becomes singular.
A **cool wind** penetrates flesh, skin transforms,
**White qi** pierces the intestines—**marrow hardens**.
Within the **cauldron**, new **parents** are seen,
In the **flask**, old **lands and rivers** re-recognized;
When **yin-yang’s work** is fulfilled, the **true body** returns—
One **pure self** ascends among the **immortals**.

*«Changing the Cauldron»* says:
Each year turns anew—**each turn** fresh,
Layer upon layer enters the **cauldron**, banishing **demonic dust**.
Illuminating the **five viscera**, dispelling the **three meditations**,
Purifying the **upper chambers**, refreshing **ten thousand spirits**;
**Changing bones** relies on **golden phoenix marrow**,
**Replacing sinews** depends on **wood-dragon essence**;
Under **Nán-Gōng’s** name, the **immortal register** is inscribed,
Ranked on the **Dan Platform** as **Upper True One**.

*«Completion of the Work»* says:
After **nine turns**, the work is done—**the shell discarded**,
Ascension’s transformation soars to **highest decree**.
Five **streaks of mist** shine through **thousand realms**,
One **mysterious pearl** steadies the **nine regions**.
Beneath, **Yáo-Gōng’s** palace connects **ten caves**,
Above, **Jīn-qiè’s** gate crowns **three platforms**.
Circulating freely, the work’s depth is **unfathomable**—
Straight to **Azure Sky**, no turning back.

*«Direct Practice»* says:
**Direct practice** forbids **qi’s** and **hou’s** transgression,
**Precision in words**—**vigorous strength** in the **Microcosmic Orbit**.
Though able to **harmonize** the **Li-Gōng maiden**,
One must **borrow** **dike-defenses** from **Kǎn’s gate** and **lead**.
But **trim the red dust** from **Hòu-Tǔ**,
Naturally, **white liquid** becomes **pure Qián**.
Ancient and modern **Dao** is thus transmitted—
All **piercing** **Xī-Yí’s** **transformative authority**.

**The Fourth Scroll of *Dao Shū*** concludes.

**Dao Shū Scroll Five**
*Attributed to the *Zhì Yóuzǐ* (Master of Direct Practice) Zēng Dòng*

**The Circulation of the Microcosmic Orbit**
The **qi** of the Microcosmic Orbit aligns with day and night,
The **Eight Trigrams** dwell at its core, transforming without haste.

The *Zhì Yóuzǐ* says:
The **Twenty-Four Solar Terms**, each differing by **two degrees and a half**.
At the **Summer Solstice**, the day is longest; at the **Winter Solstice**, shortest.
In **Spring and Autumn**, the day and night are balanced—**equalized**.

After the **Winter Solstice**, the **daylight** **waxes** (*swells*), while after the **Summer Solstice**, it **wanes** (*shrinks*).
This marks the **period** of **Yin-Yang’s** **ascend and descend**.

**Zǐ** (the 11th solar term) is **five degrees**; **Guǐ** (the 24th) is **four**—
This is the **Great Snow** and **Winter Solstice** **division**.

The **Winter Solstice** **division**:
The sun rises at the **second degree** of **Chén** (11 AM–1 PM), sets at the **third degree** of **Shēn** (3–5 PM),
Daylight lasts **thirty-five degrees**, night **sixty-five**—
The **upper element** of the **Kǎn Trigram**.

The **Great Snow** **division**:
The sun rises at the **first degree** of **Chén**, sets at the **third degree** of **Shēn**,
Daylight lasts **thirty-eight degrees**, night **sixty-two**—
The **lower element** of the **Qián Trigram**.

**Chǒu** (the 12th solar term) is **four degrees**; **Jǐ** (the 23rd) is **four**—
This is the **Lesser Cold** and **Greater Cold** **division**.

The **Lesser Cold** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Great Snow** **division**,
The **middle element** of the **Kǎn Trigram**.

The **Greater Cold** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Small Snow** **division**,
The **lower element** of the **Kǎn Trigram**.

**Yín** (the 13th solar term) is **four degrees**; **Jiǎ** (the 22nd) is **four**—
This is the **Establishment of Spring** and **Rain Water** **division**.

The **Establishment of Spring** **division**:
The sun rises at the **second degree** of **Yǐ** (7–9 AM), sets at the **second degree** of **Gēng** (7–9 PM),
Daylight lasts **forty-three degrees**, night **fifty-seven**—
The **upper element** of the **Gèn Trigram**.

The **Rain Water** **division**:
The sun rises at the **fourth degree** of **Yǐ**, sets at the **fourth degree** of **Gēng**,
Daylight lasts **forty-five degrees**, night **fifty-five**—
The **middle element** of the **Gèn Trigram**.

**Mǎo** (the 14th solar term) is **five degrees**; **Yǐ** (the 21st) is **four**—
This is the **Awakening of Insects** and **Spring Equinox** **division**.

The **Awakening of Insects** **division**:
The sun rises at the **second degree** of **Mǎo** (5–7 AM), sets at the **second degree** of **Yǒu** (5–7 PM),
Daylight lasts **forty-eight degrees**, night **fifty-two**—
The **lower element** of the **Gèn Trigram**.

The **Spring Equinox** **division**:
The sun rises at the **center** of **Mǎo**, sets at the **center** of **Yǒu**,
Day and night are **both equal**—
The **upper element** of the **Zhèn Trigram**.

**Chén** (the 15th solar term) is **four degrees**; **Xùn** (the 20th) is **four**—
This is the **Pure Brightness** and **Grain Rain** **division**.

The **Pure Brightness** **division**:
The sun rises at the **third degree** of **Mǎo**, sets at the **second degree** of **Yǒu**,
Daylight lasts **fifty-three degrees**, night **forty-seven**—
The **middle element** of the **Zhèn Trigram**.

The **Grain Rain** **division**:
The sun rises at the **fourth degree** of **Jiǎ**, sets at the **fourth degree** of **Xīn**,
Daylight lasts **fifty-five degrees**, night **forty-five**—
The **lower element** of the **Zhèn Trigram**.

**Wèi** (the 16th solar term) is **four degrees**; **Qián** (the 19th) is **five**—
This is the **Establishment of Summer** and **Lesser Fullness** **division**.

The **Establishment of Summer** **division**:
The sun rises at the **third degree** of **Jiǎ**, sets at the **third degree** of **Xīn**,
Daylight lasts **fifty-eight degrees**, night **forty-two**—
The **upper element** of the **Xùn Trigram**.

The **Lesser Fullness** **division**:
The sun rises at the **third degree** of **Jiǎ**, sets at the **third degree** of **Xīn**,
Daylight lasts **sixty degrees**, night **forty**—
The **middle element** of the **Xùn Trigram**.

**Wǔ** (the 17th solar term) is **five degrees**; **Dīng** (the 18th) is **four**—
This is the **Grain in Ear** and **Summer Solstice** **division**.

The **Grain in Ear** **division**:
The sun rises at the **first degree** of **Yín**, sets at the **second degree** of **Xū** (9–11 PM),
Daylight lasts **sixty-two degrees**, night **thirty-eight**—
The **lower element** of the **Xùn Trigram**.

The **Summer Solstice** **division**:
The sun rises at the **second degree** of **Yín**, sets at the **second degree** of **Xū**,
Daylight lasts **sixty-five degrees**, night **thirty-five**—
The **upper element** of the **Lí Trigram**.

**Wèi** (the 18th solar term) is **four degrees**; **Kūn** (the 17th) is **five**—
This is the **Lesser Heat** and **Greater Heat** **division**.

The **Lesser Heat** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Grain in Ear** **division**,
The **middle element** of the **Lí Trigram**.

The **Greater Heat** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Lesser Fullness** **division**,
The **lower element** of the **Lí Trigram**.

**Shēn** (the 19th solar term) is **four degrees**; **Gēng** (the 16th) is **four**—
This is the **Establishment of Autumn** and **Limit of Heat** **division**.

The **Establishment of Autumn** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Establishment of Summer** **division**,
The **upper element** of the **Kūn Trigram**.

The **Limit of Heat** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Grain Rain** **division**,
The **middle element** of the **Kūn Trigram**.

**Yǒu** (the 20th solar term) is **five degrees**; **Xīn** (the 15th) is **four**—
This is the **White Dew** and **Autumn Equinox** **division**.

The **White Dew** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Pure Brightness** **division**,
The **lower element** of the **Kūn Trigram**.

The **Autumn Equinox** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Spring Equinox** **division**,
The **upper element** of the **Duì Trigram**.

**Xū** (the 21st solar term) is **four degrees**; **Qián** (the 14th) is **four**—
This is the **Cold Dew** and **Frost’s Descent** **division**.

The **Cold Dew** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Awakening of Insects** **division**,
The **middle element** of the **Duì Trigram**.

The **Frost’s Descent** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Rain Water** **division**,
The **lower element** of the **Duì Trigram**.
