**Hài** (the 22nd solar term) is **four degrees**; **Rén** (the 13th) is **four**—
This is the **Establishment of Winter** and **Small Snow** **division**.

The **Establishment of Winter** **division**:
The sun’s rising and setting, along with day and night, match the **Establishment of Spring** **division**,
The **upper element** of the **Qián Trigram**.

The **Small Snow** **division**:
The sun rises at the **third degree** of **Yǐ**, sets at the **first degree** of **Gēng**,
Daylight lasts **forty degrees**, night **sixty**—
The **middle element** of the **Qián Trigram**.

**Yellow Emperor’s Questions**
*Returning from Kǎn-Gāng’s* **heights**,
*Revisiting the* **august Sage**.

The **Three-One** is thoroughly understood—
The **True** and the **Piercing** are known.

The **True Emperor** hid upon **Éméi Mountain**.
After the Yellow Emperor had pacified **Chīyóu**,
He sought the **Way of Non-Action**, wandering the world
until he reached the wilds of **Qīngchéng**,
where he first beheld the **Nurturing True Person**,
thus attaining the **Nine-One Principle**.

He then heard that the **True Emperor** was enlightened in the **Great Dao**,
so he followed to question him further.

The **True Emperor** said:
*"If you wish to cultivate your body,
first chill your intentions—then it may be done.
Thus, internally, calm your spirit;
externally, abandon your desires.
When afflictions arise, govern them with **qi**."*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"Do those who cultivate the Dao also suffer afflictions?"*

The **True Emperor** replied:
*"Those who hear the Dao late have already dissipated their **True Qi**,
their vitality wasted—how could they avoid afflictions?"*

The Yellow Emperor asked:
*"May I ask—with what **qi** does one govern them?"*

The **True Emperor** said:
*"For minor ailments, use **water**;
for great ones, use **fire**—
nothing can resist water and fire.
Deeply retreat, close your eyes,
and gaze at the **candle’s thread** above your nose—
do not let your mind stray from your original form or rise,
then you will be **established**.
Do not chase external phenomena.

Next, observe the **white light** emerging above your brows,
strenuously directing it into the **crown of the head**.
When **samādhi** is firmly attained, the work is victorious.

Let the **heart be without action**,
external thoughts not intruding.
From **Nine to Nine**, refine **Seven to Seven**.

If you wish to conceal yourself in the world,
constantly visualize the **crown opening**,
filling heaven and earth with **yellow clouds**.
With a **silent mind**, subtly contemplate—
within, there is a **spirit**.
With intent, act—
coming and going as you will.

To depart your body,
let **yellow clouds** envelop you—
sometimes returning to your form,
sometimes dividing your shape,
sometimes entering others’ bodies,
sometimes seizing others to benefit yourself,
or causing others to abandon their forms—
use **skillful means** to rescue, widely bestowing **virtue**—
this is permissible.
But to harm others for self-gain is guilt.

However, the method of **dividing the form**
requires awaiting the **birth of the Yang Number**.

In a **silent chamber**, refine the **Five Phases**:
At the crown, store the **Great Yang**—**forty-five** in number—
sufficient in quantity.

When the **five wheels beneath the brows** are complete,
arise within **establishment**.

Thus, within **fire**, the **Wood Spirit** emerges;
within **water**, the **Metal Qi** arises.
**Water and Fire**, the **Five Viscera**, circulate in exchange
without departing from **Earth**,
then contemplate the **True Essence** of the **Two Kidneys**,
uniting into **One Qi**.

The **heart’s blood** congeals downward, forming an **infant**—
its form is **yellow sprouts** upon **Earth**,
this is my **command**.

At the first light of dawn,
when the sun shines upon water a hundred times,
and again, it treads its shadow.

Thus, the **kidneys’ sun and moon** emit **red and white qi**,
and at night, **seven sevens** issue from the **crown**,
ten months later equal in **spiritual essence** to the body—
this is the **Earthly Immortal**.

Refine the **kidneys’ qi**, entering and exiting through the **ears**,
a hundred days to pour into the **Sea of Resonance**,
internally refining its **essence** into a **sword**.
Refine the **Five Viscera’s essence** to fill the **Nine-Nine** count,
letting the **Golden Cauldron** gather the **qi**,
soaring upward, ascending to heaven—
within **establishment**, again cast into the **womb**,
twice cultivated, twice bound—
twelve years to transform into **four bodies**,
its manifestations endless.

The Yellow Emperor said: *"Excellent!"*
**Xuan’yuan’s Questions**

The heavens clear and the earth tranquil—**Dao** is drawn from within the self.
Use fire to guard the yin, and the yang becomes pure.

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"The **Daoist Master** speaks of those who move and those who remain still—what does this mean?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The moving is **mercury**—the **qi** of passion, rising and dispersing; the still is **lead**—the **qi** of turbidity, heavy and unaroused. There is no true difference between them. When **lead** ascends, it is because it has encountered fire; when **mercury** does not rise, it is because it has met **lead**. Movement brings birth and death, stillness finds no resting place."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"Where in the body is the **Yellow Court of the Purple Palace**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"This is the **Sea of Essence**, the **Abode of Clarity and Stillness**—within the liver, its **gallbladder** is the place."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is the **Mud Pill**? What is its form?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"This is the **Sea of Blood**, divided into nine chambers. Each chamber is square and round, a span in breadth, with a circumference of nine inches, and its color is white. Within it, one chamber holds blood, and it is called the **Blood Sea**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"The **elixir** has yin and yang—what is its color? Where does it reside?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The yin **elixir** dwells in the **Sea of Blood**, its essence the **silver lead** of the **blood-internal spirit-soul** (*hun-po*), residing in the **cinnabar field**. The yang **elixir**’s essence is **precise**, its master the **heart-spirit** (*xin-shen*) within the **cinnabar field**, the **dragon of mercury**. Here, the **qi** of yin and yang converge—this is the **source of the elixir**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"Why does **Nine Refining** reach nine?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"**Nine Refining** is **Nine Transformations**. In the first year, **qi** is nourished; in the second, blood is enriched; in the third, the **vessels** are strengthened; in the fourth, flesh is perfected; in the fifth, marrow is refined; in the sixth, sinews are tempered; in the seventh, bones are hardened; in the eighth, hair is vitalized; in the ninth, the body is fully formed."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is **Returning the Elixir**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"It is the **elixir** completed in nine years. Its eyes are like **lacquered pitch**, its skin like **congealed fat**, its bones like **jade**, and its intestines like **tempered sinews**."*

---

The **Way of Cultivation** is vast and boundless.
**Zhengyang** said: *"The **Lord of the Piercing Cavern** is **Lü Dongbin**.
Reading the **Scriptures of the Elixir** and **Mysterious Books**, their meaning is profound and abyssal.
Fearful that later generations might not fathom them, I asked **Zhengyang** of the **Chongli Cloud Room**:
‘The *Scripture of Purity and Stillness* speaks of those who move and those who remain still—what does this mean?’*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The moving is **mercury**—the **qi** of passion, rising and dispersing; the still is **lead**—the **qi** of turbidity, heavy and unaroused. There is no true difference between them. When **lead** ascends, it is because it has encountered fire; when **mercury** does not rise, it is because it has met **lead**. Movement brings birth and death, stillness finds no resting place."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"The **Yellow Court of the Purple Palace** resides within the body—where exactly?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"This is the **Sea of Essence**, the **Abode of Clarity and Stillness**—within the liver, its **gallbladder** is the place."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is the **Mud Pill**? What is its form?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"This is the **Sea of Blood**, divided into nine chambers. Each chamber is square and round, a span in breadth, with a circumference of nine inches, and its color is white. Within it, one chamber holds blood, and it is called the **Blood Sea**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"The **elixir** has yin and yang—what is its color? Where does it reside?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The yin **elixir** dwells in the **Sea of Blood**, its essence the **silver lead** of the **blood-internal spirit-soul** (*hun-po*), residing in the **cinnabar field**. The yang **elixir**’s essence is **precise** (*jing*), its master the **heart-spirit** (*xin-shen*) within the **cinnabar field**, the **dragon of mercury**. Here, the **qi** of yin and yang converge—this is the **source of the elixir**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"Why does **Nine Refining** reach nine?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"**Nine Refining** is **Nine Transformations**. In the first year, **qi** is nourished; in the second, blood is enriched; in the third, the **vessels** are strengthened; in the fourth, flesh is perfected; in the fifth, marrow is refined; in the sixth, sinews are tempered; in the seventh, bones are hardened; in the eighth, hair is vitalized; in the ninth, the body is fully formed."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is **Returning the Elixir**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"It is the **elixir** completed in nine years. Its eyes are like **lacquered pitch**, its skin like **congealed fat**, its bones like **jade**, and its intestines like **tempered sinews**."*

The white hair sprouts from the brow,
Golden radiance encircles the body.
Moving faster than six swift steeds,
Piercing vision extends a hundred paces beyond,
With a constant fragrance of purity from mouth and nose.

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"Why are they called **lead** and **mercury**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"**Lead** arises from the left of the kidneys—its exterior is dark, its interior white, the true *qi* of wood. It dwells in the northern *zi* position, the yin within the yin. Yet it has two aspects: the refined essence of lead when touched by fire, and the brain’s vital blood essence.

**Mercury** arises from the right of the kidneys—its exterior is green, its interior red, the true *qi* of metal. It dwells in the southern *wu* position, the yin within the yang. Yet it has four aspects: the *liuli* (glazed stone), the water reaching the central palace, the congealed essence forming sand, and the bile’s fluid *qi*."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"How does **Transformation** achieve the elixir?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"One must draw water from the mountain’s peak, fire from the ocean’s depths, extract mercury from the towering heights, and gather lead from the Nine Heavens. When mercury enters, lead settles and returns, congealing in the central palace—its form like a parrot’s beak, its hue crimson and orange, its name the **Sacred Embryo**. Thus, the dark and white separate to form the **Transformative Pair**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"When refining the **Microcosmic Orbit**, sometimes fire is withdrawn, sometimes added—its use spans years, months, days, and times. Why?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"Years, months, days, and times belong to water, all rooted in yin, capable of overcoming fire. Thus, the months of **late spring** and **late autumn**, the seventh and eighth days, the twenty-second day, the third day, as well as the **waning moon** and **new moon**, are all unsuitable for practice.

If the **Three Peng** guard the **Spirit Storehouse**, the work is difficult to complete—one must rely on methods and discipline."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What in the body serves as fire?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The ignorant take the heart as fire. Within the heart lies a spirit—the **Celestial-Terrestrial Furnace**, the **Yin-Yang Cauldron**, located beneath the heart. If one takes the heart as fire, fire instead resides above—how then can one cook? This is not the **Achieved** path. Fire must rise from below, like a steaming pot. Thus, fire is the *qi* of the **Primordial One** below the navel, fully gathered into flame, while water emerges from the brain."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is the **Furnace**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"It exists within our body. In the great cold of the forge, an external furnace holds the fire, allowing molten metal to be placed within. Inside the crucible lies the medicine, sealed beneath a cover. Our furnace is no different!"*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"May I inquire about the **Forge’s Gate** and its form?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The **Purple Smoke** is not the fire of the world. **Purple Smoke** is *qi*. When the **Three Pure Ones** ascend and descend within and without, and the breath flows continuously through the nose, then the refining yields **Purple Smoke**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What are the **Four Serpents** and **Two Mice**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The four are the **Four Seasons**; the two are the **Sun and Moon**. Marvelous—these are difficult to speak of!"*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"Where does the **Chamber of Mystery** reside?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"It lies between the brows, entering two *cun* before the **Dirt Pellet**, shaped like a jade mountain, within which dwells the **White Primordial Spirit** at the **Purple Extremity**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What of the **Hall of Clarity**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"It lies before the **Chamber of Mystery**, entering the brow by one *cun*, within which resides the **Central Primordial Spirit**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is the **Supreme Method** of *‘Store Three, Guard One’*?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"One substance with three forms—water, fire, and earth. When gathered, they become the heart, the kidneys, and the spleen; when transformed, they become *qi*, blood, and essence. *Qi*, blood, and essence refine into spirit. While in the body, they are the **Red, Yellow, and Dark Cauldrons**—this is the **Central Palace**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"How does human life and death cycle endlessly?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"This is no mystery—it lies in **nature**. Those who abandon themselves to greed, letting greed breed attachment, attachment breed torment, torment afflict the heart, a disturbed heart scatters the spirit, a scattered spirit fuels desire, and desire brings sickness and death."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is **nature**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"It exists in the **Great Void**—this is difficult to speak of. The coming and going of form and *qi* is **nature**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"What is **spirit**?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"It is the **True *Qi* of the Supreme One** in the **Upper Mysterious Palace**. Its count is thirty-six thousand, shifting with its manifestations. Thus, *qi* transforms into spirit, spirit transforms into *qi*—when *qi* is present, spirit endures; when spirit departs, *qi* scatters. Its scattering becomes **clouds and mist**. It is named **form**; its emergence is **immortality**; its return is **truth**. It binds above to the **Three Primordial Ones**, below to all things, and follows the **Nourishing Path**. Thus, the undispersed is **truth**; the dispersed is **death**."*

**Xuan’yuan** asked: *"When spirit and *qi* are exhausted, how does *qi* perish?"*
**Zhengyang** replied: *"The body has six orifices. When blood is depleted and sparse, the spirit becomes unclear and unsteady. Unclarity causes the **body fluids** to stagnate; unsteadiness invites **evil *qi** to gather. Thus, the **passage of life is blocked**, and the **path of death opens**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **Jīnyè** and **Qióngjiāng**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"**Qióngjiāng** is the **tears of the eyes**; its residual *qi* flows to the right of the **upper lip**, becoming **Jīnyè**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is **Shénshuǐ**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **blood within the heart**; its residual *qi* flows to the left of the **tongue**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Then what is the **Huá Chí**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **water within the kidneys**; its residual *qi* flows to the right of the **tongue**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is **Huángyá**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It arises from within the **brain**, dwelling in the **central palace**; it is the **phlegm of the brain**, the **fluid of the spleen**. Its residual *qi* flows to the **upper lip**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Qīnglóng**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **liver**, the **Wood**. Within it, **Shénshuǐ** ebbs and flows, residing to the left of the **spinal column’s victory point**, and internally emerges from the **eyes**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Bái Hǔ**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **lung**, the **Metal**. Within it, **Shénshuǐ** ebbs and flows, residing to the right of the **spinal column’s victory point**, and internally emerges from the **nose**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Zhūquè**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **heart**, the **Fire**. Its position is the **south**, its **stem-branches** are **Bǐng-Dīng**; within it, **Shénshuǐ** flows from the right of the **abdomen** to beneath the **tongue**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Xuánwǔ**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **kidneys**, the **Water**. Its position is the **north**, its **stem-branches** are **Rén-Guǐ**; within it, **Shénqì** flows from the left of the **abdomen** to the **ears**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Gōuchén**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **spleen**, the **Earth**. Its **stem-branches** are **Wù-Jǐ**; within it, **Shénqì** flows from the **kidneys’ center**, ascending along the **spine** to the **victory point**, and enters the **brain**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Huángpó**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **spleen’s Earth**; hence it is called **Huáng**. It is the *qi* of the **spleen**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Jīnwēng**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **lung’s Metal**; hence it is called **Jīn**. It is the *qi* of the **lungs**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are **Zǐnǚ** and **Yīng’ér**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"**Zǐnǚ** is the **phlegm of the heart**; **Yīng’ér** is the **water of the kidneys**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"When *qi* issues forth in **xū**, **hē**, **xī**, **hū**, **xī**, **yàn**, **chuī**, and **jiào**, to which **viscera** does it belong?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The *qi* of the **nose** belongs to the **lungs**, hence it is called **xī**; the *qi* of the **mouth** belongs to the **liver**, hence it is called **chuī**. As for **yàn**, it belongs to the **lungs**; **chuī** belongs to the **kidneys**; **hū** belongs to the **spleen**; **hē** belongs to the **heart**; **xī** belongs to the **Triple Burner**; **jiào** and **xū** belong to the **bladder**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **inner** and **outer Eight Trigrams**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **inner** are:
- **Liver**, **Zhèn**;
- **Heart**, **Lí**;
- **Lung**, **Duì**;
- **Kidneys**, **Kǎn**;
- **Great Abdomen**, **Qián**;
- **Gallbladder**, **Xùn**;
- **Small Abdomen**, **Kūn**;
- **Bladder**, **Gèn**.

The **outer** are:
- **Eyes**, **Lí**;
- **Tongue**, **Zhèn**;
- **Mouth**, **Duì**;
- **Ears**, **Kǎn**;
- **Neck**, **Qián**;
- **Toes**, **Kūn**;
- **Abdomen**, **Xùn**;
- **Hands**, **Gèn**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Tiān Cāng**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It has three names: **Shítáng**, **Yànmén**, and **Dìhù**—it is the **mouth**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Tiěniú**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **Qīnglóng**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Chónglóu**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **Yùlóu**—the **human’s food cavity**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Within **huǎnghū**, there is **wù**; within **yǎomíng**, there is **jīng**. What does this mean?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **wù** is the **water within the *qi***. This water is formless—when **Winter Solstice** arrives, **Yin** reaches the **Heaven**, and accumulated *qi* generates it. It is the **Tàijí** giving birth to **Yin**; it has three names: **True Water**, **Lead**, and **Tiger’s Soul**. Its form is white, its nature is **Metal**; hence it is called the **Golden Crow of the Sun**, the **Jade of Stone**, the **Metal of Water**, the **blood of the brain**—collectively called the **Sea of Blood**, dwelling within the **brain**.

The **jīng** is the **qi within the water**. This *qi* is formless—when **Summer Solstice** arrives, **Yin** reaches the **Earth**, and accumulated **Yin** generates it. It is the **Tàijí** giving birth to **Yang**; it has three names: **True Fire**, **Mercury**, and **Dragon’s Spirit**. Its form is red, its nature is **Fire**; hence it is called the **Jade Hare of the Moon**, the **Sand of Water**—in humans, it becomes **tendons**, **bones**, the **rigid essence of things**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **Wū** and **Yù**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Jīnwū** is the **water within the heart**, the **true *qi* within the water**; the **Yùyù** is the **qi within the kidneys**, the **true water within the *qi***."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"How do the **Five Sacred Peaks**, **Six Ministries**, **Four Great Rivers**, **Five Lakes**, **Nine Rivers**, **Two Palaces**, and **Wind and Rain** differ?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **left cheek** is **Tàishān**; the **chin** is **Héngshān**; the **right cheek** is **Huàshān**; the **jaw** is **Chángshān**; the **nose** is **Sōngshān*. The **Five Viscera** are the **Five Lakes**; the **Six Fu-organs** are the **Six Ministries**. The **Triple Burner** are the **Three Palaces**. The **nine bends of the large intestine** are the **Nine Rivers**. **Jīng** is the **river**; **sōu** is the **Yellow River**; **xuè** is the **Huai River**; **jīn** is the **Jì River**."*

The **Four Seas** are also spoken of. **Sweat** is **Rain**; **Qi** is **Wind**.

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"One body is like one state. Who are the sovereign and ministers?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Heart** is the **King**; **Qi** is the **Chancellor**; the **Spleen** is the **Great Officer**; the **Lungs** are the **Grand Scribe**; the **Kidneys** are the **Chaste Lady**; the **Liver** is the **Ministry of Revenue**. The **Gallbladder** is the **Ministry of Rites**; the **Stomach** is the **Ministry of War**; the **Bladder** is the **Ministry of Punishments**; the **Sea of Essence** is the **Ministry of Works**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Dragon**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **Original Qi**, born from the left and right of the **Two Kidneys**, within the **Yao-Ming Palace***. The **Sea of Original Essence**—great or small, like a ring—its **Qi** entering and exiting like a crimson thread. It is the **Father of Spirit**, the **Root of Yang**, and the **Source of Yin and Yang**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Tiger**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is the **Yin-blood**, the **Yin-fluid**, transformed into it. Born from **Li***, it steals the **True Qi of the Five Grains**, reaching the **Heart** and then flowing into the **Kidneys’ domain**, where **Essence-Qi** is formed. This is called **Cinnabar Mercury***. The **Fire Dragon** is in **Kan***, the **Root of Life**, the **Mother of Spirit**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"**Lead** is **stillness**, **nature**; where does **nature** originate?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **True Qi of the Five Grains**, stolen by the **Heart**, transforms into **blood**; then **blood** condenses into **fluid**, and **fluid** refines into **True Qi**, which solidifies into **Spirit**—this is **nature**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"**Mercury** is **movement**, **life**; what is its meaning?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"**Life** resides within the **Two Kidneys**, inside the **Sea of Original Essence**, issuing forth the **True Original Qi**. Thus, within it lies **True Water**, born originally from the **Heart**, flowing into the **Kidneys** and transforming into **Essence**. **Essence** is no closer than these two*—**Heart** and **Kidneys**—so the **Spirit’s Original Flow** ceases not, else **Spirit** would be unsettled."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"When the **Root** is established, the **Dao** arises—what is the **Root**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"**Spirit**, **Qi**, **Essence**, **Bone Marrow**, **Tears**, **Saliva**, **Ting-Liquid**, **Blood**, **Sweat**, and **Mia-Liquid***—these are the **Root**. If the **Root** is not established, it is like a tree’s trunk rotted by woodworms, its branches withered and dry. Thus, when **Qi** flows through my body, it nourishes my form—this is called **Spirit-Water**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **Three Pools**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **mouth** is the **Pool of Jade**; the **Nì-Wán** is the **Pool of Heaven**; the **stomach** is the **Middle Pool**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Nine Palaces**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"Within the **brain** are nine chambers; its bones are eight pieces, and within the nine chambers lie four **female** and five **male** guardians."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **Three Passes**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **mouth** is the **Heavenly Pass**; the **hands** are the **Human Pass**; the **feet** are the **Earthly Pass**. The **Nì-Wán** is the **Upper Pass**; the **Gàng Palace** is the **Middle Pass**; the **Lower Original** is the **Lower Pass**. Why call these **Passes**? To close and seal them—this is not the speech of those who do not grasp the **Dao**. I now tell you: The **Upper Pass** is the **eyes**; the **Middle Pass** is the **nose**; the **Lower Pass** is the **mouth**. Their paths connect to the **Nine Orifices**, where **evil** takes harm. Thus, one must lock them tight."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Humans possess **Heaven**, **Earth**, **Yin**, and **Yang**—what does this mean?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **head** is **Heaven**; the **feet** are **Earth**—this is the **external**. The **Heart** is round and the **Kidneys** are square—this is the **internal**. The **Sun** is **Yang**; the **Moon** is **Yin**—this is the **external**. **Qi** ascends and **fluids** descend—this is the **internal**. Thus, **Heaven** reaches **Earth** in **eighty-four thousand li***; the **Heart** reaches the **Kidneys** in **eight cun and four fen***. This is the **Heart-Kidneys’ analogy to Heaven-Earth**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"The **Two Solstices** and **Two Equinoxes**—how do they apply to me?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **hour of Zi** and **hour of Wu** are the **Two Solstices**; the **hour of Mào** and **hour of Yǒu** are the **Two Equinoxes**. This is the **Sun’s analogy to the Two Solstices and Two Equinoxes***. The **New Moon** and **Full Moon** are the **Two Solstices**; the **Two Equinoxes** are the **Two Equinoxes**. This is the **Moon’s analogy to the Two Solstices and Two Equinoxes***. When the **Sun** reaches its **northern solstice**, **Yang** ascends, rising from below to return to **Heaven**, and thus **one Yin** reaches. When the **Sun** reaches its **southern solstice**, **Yin** descends, falling from above to return to **Earth**, and thus **one Yang** reaches. The **spring equinox** is the division when **Yang** ascends above, encountering the **spring equinox** and entering **Yang**, departing **Yin**. The **autumn equinox** is the division when **Yin** ascends above, encountering the **autumn equinox** and entering **Yin**, departing **Yang**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Where do the **Five Bandits** dwell?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"Humans nourish themselves with the **Five Grains** and are born from the **Five Phases***, yet birth brings decay. Thus, the **Five Phases** can both give life and cause death—how they become **bandits**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are **monthly cycles**, **seasonal nodes**, **daily hours**, and **yearly divisions**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **twelve hours** make up **one day**; **five days** are **one cycle**; **three cycles** are **one seasonal Qi**; **two seasonal Qi** are **one node**; **two nodes** are **one season**; **four seasons** make up **one year**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Is there a method to **Lock the Yang Pass**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"Enter the chamber, draw your body inward, and sit upright. Guard **Spirit** and **Awareness** within, gently pressing your sides."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is **elixir** and its **refinement**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"Fill your mouth with **Ting-Liquid** and swallow it, returning it to the **Palace of Life**. Circulate **Qi** within the **Yellow Court***, and thus **Qi** and **fluids** transform and form **Essence**. **Ting-Liquid** accumulates into **blood**; **blood** accumulates into **pearls**; **pearls** become **mercury**; **mercury** becomes **sand**; **sand** becomes **elixir**—this is its **refinement**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Yellow Court**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It lies above the **Bladder**, before the **Spleen**, **Stomach**, and **Kidneys**, behind the **navel**, to the right of the **Liver**, and to the left of the **Lungs**. It is like the **parrot’s nest** or the **balance stone**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Why is the **Spleen** called **Yellow Mother** but not **Yellow Court**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Spleen** can receive **Heart-Liquid** and **Kidney-Qi**, blending them to form **elixir**, but it is not the **Yellow Court**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Where does one **advance the Fire**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"Fire arises below the **navel**—invisible when observed, yet cannot be grasped from afar nor abandoned when near. It appears like the **deep blue void**, beyond naming."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is **Golden Liquid refining the Form**, and how does **Form and Spirit** unite with **Dao-Truth**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"Refining **mercury** yields **Spirit**; refining **Qi** yields **Form**. Thus, **ascending behind** and **swallowing before**, each substance merges to form the **embryo**—this is **uniting with Dao-Truth**, the **Golden Liquid refining the Form**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is **daily practice with the Eight Trigrams**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"At the hour of **hai** (11 PM–1 AM), apply **Qian** (Heaven); at **zi** (1–3 AM), apply **Kan** (Water); at **yin** (3–5 AM), apply **Gen** (Mountain); at **si** (5–7 AM), apply **Xun** (Wind); at **you** (5–7 PM), apply **Dui** (Lake); at **shen** (7–9 PM), apply **Kun** (Earth); at **wu** (11 AM–1 PM), apply **Li** (Fire); at **mao** (7–9 AM), apply **Zhen** (Thunder). These are the **external** applications. The **Spinal Passes** also have three **Gates**—may I inquire about them?"*

**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Spinal Passes** have twenty-four nodes, with each **Gate** spanning three nodes. Below the **brain**, it is called the **Jade Gate**; opposite the **spine**, it is called the **Middle Gate**; and opposite the **Kidneys**, it is called the **Lower Gate**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"I have heard the name of the **Great Dao**, but not its nature."*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Dao** is formless; speaking of it is not the **Dao**. The **Dao** is void; describing it with the real is not the **Dao**. The **Dao** takes the void as its substance—like a shout echoing in the mountains, where the **valley** responds. Thus, **nurturing within the Lungs** is **Spirit-Qi** and **True Nature**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"When **cultivating True Nature**, there are **demons** that disturb—how does one deal with them?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"If thoughts do not return to unity and wander outward, **demons** will arise. When the **mind** moves, **Spirit** is confused; when **Spirit** is confused, one falls into **torpor**; when in **torpor**, **demons** flourish and the work is hard to complete."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Is there a way to **ward them off**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"It is difficult to speak of!"*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"How do **wind**, **clouds**, **rain**, **mist**, **frost**, **snow**, and **canopy** vary so?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"This is the **True Primordial-Qi**. Its **Qi** is unstable: when exhaled, it becomes **canopy**; when inhaled, it becomes **mist**; when blown, it becomes **wind**; when breathed upon, it becomes **clouds**; when scattered, it becomes **frost and snow**; when condensed, it becomes **rain and dew**. When it ascends, it darkens the sky; when it descends, it sinks to the earth. The **clear** rises and floats, the **turbulent** falls and settles—thus it follows its transformations."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"The human body has the **numbers of Heaven and Earth**—both **upper** and **lower** positions are complete. **Gold** weighs eight **liang** (128 **qian**), totaling **192 qian**; **Silver** is the same. **Yang** and **Yin** also follow this measure. Thus, the **Sixty-Four Hexagrams** have **384 lines**. One **qian** is divided into four **fen** to correspond to **Yin-Yang Fire**. These numbers align with the **cycles of the sun and moon**—what does this signify in humans?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"I have already spoken of the **numbers of Heaven and Earth**. Eight thousand four hundred **li** (league) span **Heaven and Earth**; eight **cun** (inches) with four **fen** (divisions) correspond to **Heart** and **Kidneys**. Thus, he who **grasps the numbers of Heaven and Earth** can manipulate them as easily as counting on his palms—two and five make ten."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **state of the White Horse’s Fangs**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Five Phases** are complete. The **true Qi** of the five **Zang** (solid organs) and their **liquids** and **Essences** condense. Their **Qi** and **fluids** merge in the **Crucible**, and thus **White Qi** emerges—its appearance like **flaring flames**, like the **fangs of a white horse**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Does the **Heart** have alternate names?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Heart** is the **South Point** (compass). Its **stem** is **bing-ding** (丙丁), its **virtue/power** is in **Fire**, its **hexagram** is **Li** (離), and its name is **Crimson Mercury**, the **Foot of the Red Dragon**, the **Jade Maiden**, the **Li Maiden**, the **Jade Terrace**. The **Heart** has **blood**, called the **Marrow of the Red Phoenix**—when it flows into the **brain**, it is called the **Sea**; when it flows into the **Golden Pool**, it is called **Divine Water**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Does the **Kidney** have alternate names?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Kidney** is the **North Point**. Its **stem** is **ren-gui** (壬癸), its **virtue/power** is in **Water**, its **hexagram** is **Kan** (坎), and its name is **Infant**, **Mysterious Lead**, **Golden Light**, **Golden Essence**, **Spiritual Root**, **Jade Jar**, **Jade Furnace**, the **Turtle of the Northern Sea**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is **Nine Returns and Seven Refinements**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"From **zi** (1–3 AM) to **shen** (7–9 PM) is **Nine Turns**. Thus, the **refiner** completes one **turn** in nine years, three **turns** making one **cycle**. **Heaven** has **Seven Luminaries**; humans have **Seven Orifices**. The **Seven Luminaries** move five **stages** at night; the **Seven Orifices** correspond to the **Five Zang** (solid organs) in **internal** practice. My **True-Qi** circulates **up and down**, from **shen** to **yin**—alternating **Yin and Yang**, ascending and descending, floating and sinking—**Essence**, **Marrow**, **nasal mucus**, **saliva**, **Qi**, **fluids**, and **sweat**. Preserving them day and night without loss is **Seven Refinements**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **Golden Crucible** and **Golden Flower**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Golden Crucible** is the **canopy** below the **Flowery Cap** (华盖), positioned in the **West**. Its **stem** is **geng-xin** (庚辛), and its **virtue/power** is **Metal**."*

The **Golden Flower** is the **lung**, its position in the **West**, its **qi** white. From the **lung** it emerges, congealing like a **flower**.

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What of **Divine Light**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"After nine years of cultivation, its light will manifest."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Is **Mind** like a **horse** or like a **monkey**? I do not know the forms of the **Dry Horse** or the **Station Horse**."*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **Dry Horse** is the **heart’s fluid**; the **Station Horse** is its **qi**. The **monkey** is the **heart’s intention**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What is the **Dry Ox**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **qi** of the **kidneys**, the **Water** of the **North**—the **Metal Ox**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **Six Bandits**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **eyes**, the **ears**, the **nose**, the **tongue**, the **heart**, and the **mind**. All things originate from these—what root is there that does not stem from them?"*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"What are the **Three Vehicles**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **forehead and temples** are the **Great Ox-Cart**, the **Sheep-Deer-Cart**; the **stomach cavity** is the **River-Cart**, the **Celestial River**, the **Water Palace**—**True-One qi** from the heavens enters through the mouth and nose, hence it is called the **River-Cart**; the **region below the navel** is the **Fire-Cart**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Which is the **Cave of Penglai**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **upper and lower regions of the abdomen**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Which is **Caoxi**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **inner lips, outer teeth**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Which are the **Three Corpses**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"The **qi of the heart and kidneys**—one is the **Three Poisons**, the other is the **Three Corpses**. When the **Three Corpses** are annihilated, **True-Form** is achieved."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"Where do the **Two Springs** originate?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied: *"They emerge from within the **mouth**, beneath the **tongue**, with two orifices on either side, each as large as a **sealed needle’s tip**. They connect to the **heart and lungs**, and at times, **essence-fluid** is generated in the **throat**—this moistens all things and nourishes the **Five Zang**."*

**Pure Yang Child** asked: *"How does one resemble **Heaven and Earth**?"*
**Zhengyang Child** replied:
*"My **eyes** are the **sun and moon**; my **intestines and stomach** are the **lakes and seas**; my **joy and anger** are the **clouds and clear skies**; my **nose and forehead** are the **Five Peaks**; my **breathing** is the **thunder and lightning**; my **Five Zang** are the **Five Phases**; my **qi** is the **winds and clouds**; my **hair and fur** are the **grasses and trees**; my **sweat and pores** are the **dew and rain**; my **blood vessels** are the **rivers and streams**; my **nasal mucus and saliva** are the **frost and snow**; my **filth** is the **dung and soil**; my **male and female** are **Yin and Yang**; my **form** is the **house and beams**; my **nine orifices** are the **Nine Luminaries**; my **four limbs** are the **four directions**; my **hair follicles** are the **four symbols**; my **Five Phases** are the **five planets**; my **saliva and fluids** are the **springs**; my **four symbols** are the **four seasons**; my **eight trigrams** are the **eight nodes of Earth**; my **awakening and sleep** are **day and night**; my **lice and fleas** are the **ants and crickets**; my **aging and infancy** are the **cold and heat**; my **calamity and prosperity** are the **waxing and waning of the sun and moon**; my **life and death** are the **reversal of Heaven and Earth**.*

*"He who can fathom the **mechanisms of Heaven and Earth** may equal their duration."*

**Pure Yang Child**, having heard the **essential Dao**, then opened the **Mystic Lock** and understood the **Eight Leaks**:
*"The **eyes’ excessive discharge** is the **Liver Leak**; the **nose’s runny mucus** is the **Lung Leak**; the **mouth’s excessive saliva** is the **Kidney Leak**; the **external body’s sweat** is the **Heart Leak**; **nighttime sweating** is the **Small Intestine Leak**; **sleeping with drool** is the **Brain Leak**; **dreaming with ghosts and lust** is the **Spirit Leak**; **lustful desire** is the **Body Leak**.*

*"If these eight are sealed and not leaked, and their essence is gathered into the **Golden Crucible and Jade Pool**, refined into **lead and mercury**, then it may be measured."*

**Pure White Child** inquired at the **Ladies of Mount Li**,
and the **Essential Dao** of the *Yin Fu* was first expounded,
its teachings revealed with grandeur—**the erudite of mountains and marshes** were astounded.

**Pure Yang Child**, surname Yanggu, courtesy name **Pure White**,
and known as **Pure Yang Child**—met a **strange and wondrous adept** in the **capital of Shu**,
whose pupils were deep and luminous as a **moon’s crescent**, radiant with light.

**Pure Yang Child** was struck by this and sought him out for instruction.
The adept replied: *"Aye."*

**Pure Yang Child** then asked: *"Does not the* **Yin Fu** *speak of the Dao above—where the gods and immortals embrace the One,
the laws in the middle—where wealth and peace for the land and people are cultivated,
and the methods below—where armies are strengthened and battles won? What does this mean?"*

The adept said: *"To embrace the One is to refine the **Spirit**.
The* **Laozi** *says: 'The Dao gives birth to the One; the One gives birth to the Two;
the Two gives birth to the Three; the Three gives birth to all things.'
The One is **water**.
Heaven generates the **divine water** as the foundation of wondrous transformation—
the* **I Ching** *'s 'Heaven One' is this.
The **True One Child** says: 'This is the essence of **True Lead**,
the root of Heaven and Earth, the progenitor of **Yin and Yang**.
All things depend upon it for their creation,
and myriad spirits rely upon it for their **expansion and contraction**.*

'He who can embrace the One and hold to the Middle
will not let the **Spirit-qi** disperse—
this is the **True Person** indeed.

In ancient times, the **Yellow Emperor** obtained the **True One Scripture** of the **Celestial Sovereign**
yet did not grasp its meaning,
so he visited the **Royal Person** at **Mount Emei**
and asked him about it.

The **Royal Person** said: 'The **True One** resides within the **Great Abyss of the Northern Pole**,
before which stands the **Bright Hall**,
beneath which lies the **Crimson Palace**.
There, the **Flowering Canopy** and **Golden Tower** rise;
to the left, the **Ladle Constellation**; to the right, the **Kui Constellation**,
with **Dragon and Tiger** standing guard on either side.
It neither takes nor gives—
the One rests in its place;
neither slow nor swift—
the One enters its chamber.'"

「能暇能豫，一乃不去；
能 rest in leisure and ease, the One then does not depart.

守一居真，乃得通神；
Hold fast to the One and abide in its truth, then one attains the **transcendence of the Spirit-qi**.

节饮约食，一乃留皂.
Moderate drinking and restrict eating, the One then lingers in the **Cinnabar Field**.

故知一者非难也，守之而勿失者为难也。
Thus it is known that attaining the One is not difficult, but preserving it without loss is the true challenge.

纯粹子曰：世之学者以道为强名者也，号之虚无以为自然，无为更不修炼，斯何如耶？
**Chunzhuzi** said: "The scholars of this age merely use **Dao/Way** as a grand name—
they call it **emptiness and nothingness** as though it were **natural**,
and claim that **non-action (wuwei)** requires no further cultivation and refinement.
What kind of **Dao/Way** is this?"

奇士曰：斯言过矣，不知天地要用之机，阴阳变化之道。
**Qishi** replied: "Your words are excessive—
you do not understand the **essential mechanisms of Heaven and Earth**,
nor the **Dao/Way of yin-yang transformation**!

夫无为者，非不修炼者也。
**Non-action (wuwei)** is not the same as neglecting cultivation and refinement.

不因修炼其何以离於生死乎？
Without cultivation and refinement, how could one transcend **birth and death**?

所谓无为者，无所不为也。
So-called **non-action (wuwei)** means **acting without bounds**—
it is not inaction!

身外之物谓之有为可也，悟道修真非有为也。
External things may be called **action (youwei)**,
but **enlightenment to the Dao/Way** and **cultivation of the True Person** are beyond such labels.

夫道者，性之本也；
The **Dao/Way** is the **root of nature (xing)**—

性者，心之源也。
nature (xing) is the **source of the mind**.

心性同体，应化无边，
Mind and nature share the same essence, responding to transformations without limit—

是乃所谓自然者也知乎此而能虚心实腹，
this is what is called **natural**—
to grasp this and **empty the mind while filling the abdomen**,
to **embrace the One and transform**—

则可以仙矣。
then one may attain **transcendence (xian)**."

纯粹子曰：富国安民者奈何？
**Chunzhuzi** asked: "How does one **enrich the land and bring peace to the people**?"

奇士曰：炼气之法也。
**Qishi** replied: "It is the **method of refining the qi**."

《老子内丹经》曰：一身之设，一国之象也。
The **Laozi Inner Alchemy Scripture** states: "The structure of one’s body mirrors that of a **land**."

圣人以身为国，以心为君，以精气为民。
The **sage** regards the body as the **land**,
the mind as the **sovereign**,
and the **essence-qi** as the **people**.

民安则国斯泰矣，民散则国斯虚矣。
If the **people** are at ease, the **land** prospers;
if the **people** are scattered, the **land** becomes desolate.

夫能惜精爱气，则所以长生者也。
He who **cherishes the essence and nurtures the qi** is the one who **prolongs life**.

夫人之形禀父母精血而为，元气所化者也。
The human form is shaped by the **essence and blood** of one’s parents,
and it is the **primordial qi** that transforms it.

中黄真人曰：骨肉者以精血为根焉，灵识者以元气为本焉。
**Zhonghuang Zhenren** said: "The **bones and flesh** take **essence and blood** as their root,
while **spirit-consciousness (lingshi)** relies on the **primordial qi** as its foundation.

性者，命之本也；
Nature (xing) is the **root of fate (ming)**—

神者，气之子也；
Spirit-qi is the **child of the qi**—

气者，神之母也；
The qi is the **mother of the Spirit-qi**—

子母者，不可斯须而离也。
child and mother cannot be separated for even a moment.

如是则气乃湛然住於丹田而成变化矣。
Thus, the qi **settles and abides in the Cinnabar Field**,
where transformations take place.

《老子》曰：绵绵若存，用之不勤。
The **Laozi** says: "Continuous as though it endures,
its application is effortless.

出息微微，入息绵绵，
**Breathing out** is subtle and refined,
**breathing in** is continuous and prolonged—

深根固蒂，此长生久视之道也。」
**deep-rooted and firmly established**,
this is the **Dao/Way of longevity and enduring vision**."

《内观经》曰：气来入身谓之生，神去於形谓之死，
The **Scripture of Inner Observation** states: "When **qi enters the body**, it is called **life**;
when **Spirit-qi departs from the form**, it is called **death**—

所以通生谓之道。
thus the **Dao/Way of transcending life** is spoken of.

於是气旺则人旺矣，气衰则人衰矣，
When the **qi thrives**, the person thrives;
when the **qi declines**, the person declines—

故日气能富形，
thus it is said that **qi can enrich the form**—

神能御气而飞形者也。
**Spirit-qi can command the qi and transcend the form**.

其诀在乎天门开，地户闭，
Its **secret lies in opening the Celestial Gate**,
and **closing the Earthly Gate**—

永永绵绵而勿废。
enduring and continuous without cessation.

其吸也至於根，
**Inhalation reaches down to the roots**—

其呼也彻於蒂，
**exhalation penetrates to the base**—

如鹦抱卵，如鱼生水，
like a **parrot brooding over its egg**,
or a **fish giving birth in water**—

圣胎成而斯蜕矣。」
when the **sacred embryo** is complete, then **transcendence (tui)** occurs.

纯粹子曰：强兵战胜奈何？
**Chunzhuzi** asked: "How does one **strengthen the army and achieve victory in battle**?"

奇士曰：金液炼形者也。
**Qishi** replied: "It is the **refinement of the form through the Golden Elixir**."

积魂以消阴魄，阳兵以御阴寇，
**Accumulate the soul** to **dissolve the yin spirit**,
and **deploy the yang army** to **ward off yin invaders**—

盖用五行相克，八卦相荡，
this is done by **applying the Five Phases to overcome each other**,
and **using the Eight Trigrams to harmonize and dispel**—

归根复命而成丹者也。
**returning to the root and restoring fate** to **forge the elixir**.

黄帝曰：还丹百数，其要在乎神水华池。
The **Yellow Emperor** said: "There are countless **methods of returning the elixir**,
but their essence lies in the **Divine Water of the Flowering Pool**.

易真子曰：还丹者，反覆阴阳之气者也。
**Yizhenzi** said: "The **returning of the elixir** is the **repetitive inversion of yin-yang qi**."

圣人设其法象诱太阳之气，
The **sage** establishes its **methods and symbols** to **attract the Solar Qi**—

先为神丹以驻形神，
first **forging the Divine Elixir** to **stabilize the form and Spirit-qi**—

然后能成其道焉。
only then can one **fulfill the Dao/Way**.

如国之有寇须兵以制之，
Just as a **land** must **deploy its army** to **conquer invaders**—

既制之矣乃可行皇王之道焉。
once conquered, it may then **pursue the path of the sovereign**.

坎戊者，月精也；
**Kanwu** is the **essence of the moon**—

离己者，日光也；
**Lijǐ** is the **light of the sun**—

坎离者，水火也；
**Kanli** are **water and fire**—

子午者，卯酉也；
**Ziwu** are **Mao and You**—

龙虎者，乌兔也；
**Dragon and Tiger** are **Wu and Tu**—

震兑者，房参也；
**Zhendui** are **Fang and Shen**—

魂魄者，阴阳也；
**soul and spirit** are **yin and yang**—

雄雌者，父母也；
**male and female** are **father and mother**—

夫妇者，男女也；
**husband and wife** are **male and female**—

铅汞者，金木也；
**lead and mercury** are **metal and wood**—

甲己者，乙庚也；
**Jiaji** are **Yiji and Geng**—

乙庚者，丙辛也；
**Yiji and Geng** are **Bingxin and Ding**—

丙辛者，丁壬也；
**Bingxin and Ding** are **Dingren and Ren**—

丁壬者，戊癸也；
**Dingren and Ren** are **Wugui and Gui**—

金华秋石者，婴儿姥女也；
**Golden Flower and Autumn Stone** are **baby and old woman**—

黄芽白雪者，丹砂也；
**Yellow Sprout and White Snow** are **cinnabar**—

交梨火枣者，玉醴金浆也；
**Jiaoli and Huozao** are **jade nectar and golden broth**—

河车者，黄婆也；
**Hechhe** is the **Yellow Mother**—

神水者，华池也。
**Divine Water** is the **Flowering Pool**.

此殊名而同归者也，
These are but **different names for the same essence**—

其要不出乎阴阳而已。
their core does not stray beyond **yin and yang**.

《太一志》曰：圣人括《易》象以炼铅焉，
The **Record of the Supreme One** states: "The **sage** employs the **symbols of the Yi** to **refine lead**—

固身保神非外物也。」
**solidifying the body and preserving the Spirit-qi** is not an external thing."

曹真人曰：以元气补元气，岂必丹砂石哉！
**Caozhenren** said: "To **supplement the primordial qi with primordial qi**,
why must one rely on **cinnabar and stones**?"

陶真人曰：缀花不可以结实，内肉不可以成胎。
**Taozhenren** said: "One cannot **attach flowers** to **produce fruit**,
nor can one **insert flesh** to **form an embryo**."

立乾坤，运水火，合三才，应天符，
**Establish the trigrams of Qian and Kun**,
**circulate water and fire**,
**unify the Three Realms**,
**respond to the Heavenly Mandate**—

然后可以为丹矣。
only then can one **forge the elixir**.

刘真人曰：乾坤者，鼎也，天地之道也；
**Liuzhenren** said: "Qian and Kun are the **cauldron**,
the **Dao/Way of Heaven and Earth**—

坎离者，药也，南北之位也；
Kan and Li are the **medicine**,
the **positions of the south and north**—

龙虎者，束西也。
Dragon and Tiger are the **restraint of the west**."

真一子曰：自复也、乾也、娠也、坤也，
**Zhenyizi** said: "Self-renewal, Qian, pregnancy, Kun—

十有二辰之中观其气候，
within the **twelve celestial stems**,
observe the **climates of the qi**—

分震巽之门，
**divide the gates of Zhen and Xun**—

子而往，午而来，
**enter at Zi** and **exit at Wu**—

阴符阳火合於天符。
**yin corresponds with yang fire**,
uniting in the **Heavenly Mandate**.

三百有六十度，
**Three hundred and sixty degrees**—

此晦朔阴阳刑德交会、天地变化万物生成之数也。」
this is the **number of the waxing and waning of yin and yang**,
of **the Five Phases’ mutual overcoming**,
of **the convergence of Heavenly transformations**,
where **Heaven and Earth’s changes give rise to all things**.

依乎刻漏而运行焉，
**Follow the water clock** in its operation—

夺取气候入於神室之中，
**seize the climates of the qi**,
**entering the Divine Chamber**—

可使真铅天地之母受此运用而产精神者也。
one may **cause the True Lead, the mother of Heaven and Earth**,
to **receive this operation** and **bear the Spirit-qi**.

《龙虎经》曰：道犹驭也，
The **Dragon-Tiger Scripture** states: "The **Dao/Way** is like **driving a chariot**—

衔辔准绳，随軏辙之处中以制乎外者也。
**holding the reins and measuring the lines**,
**following the proper path** to **control the external**—

盖有偃月之鼎，
there exists the **cauldron of the crescent moon**—

其要在乎三日庚生以开兑之户，
its **secret lies in the three days of Geng**,
where the **gate of Dui is opened**—

黑金胚出而白银来矣。」
when the **black metal embryo** emerges,
**white silver** then appears."

The **Nine-Six** are spring and summer,
their **application lasts five-three**—

the **Seven-Eight** are autumn and winter,
their **return and movement** come thereafter.

Thus it is known: the **Great Elixir** is the **Primordial Qi’s** transformation.

Therefore it is said:
**"Divine Pool’s** water of refinement,
**jade mercury and gold lead**,
**Heaven and Earth’s** cyclic operations,
**Sun and Moon’s** alchemical brewing—
**Lunar and Penetrating** kindle the fire,
**advance and retreat** refine the essence,
**drawing and adding** in **baptismal** practice,
**nine transformations** in one year,
**Kan and Li** penetrate and harmonize,
**three thousand labors** performed,
**held without ceasing**,
**transmutes form into Daoist Immortality**.

**Pure and Refined Child** then understood the **essentials of the Three Pure Ones**,
and further asked: *"Can one cease movement and refine the Spirit?"*

The **Wondrous Sage** replied:
*"Then one becomes a Daoist Immortality*,
for **its form sinks** while **its Spirit ascends**."

**Pure and Refined Child** asked: *"Can one cease movement and refine the Qi?"*

The **Wondrous Sage** replied:
*"Then one becomes a **Fetal Immortality***,
for **its Spirit-qi** intermingle in **sensitive resonance**,
**congealing the embryo** and **nurturing the infant**,
like the **shedding of a cicada**."

**Pure and Refined Child** asked: *"Can one cease movement and refine the Form?"*

The **Wondrous Sage** replied:
*"Then one remains in the world*,
for **it returns youth** to **minority**."

**Pure and Refined Child** asked: *"If all three methods are practiced together, what then?"*

The **Wondrous Sage** replied:
*"Then one ascends to **Celestial Office**."*

**Pure and Refined Child** asked: *"Beyond these three methods, is there still another Dao?"*

The **Wondrous Sage** replied:
*"There are indeed:
**preserving the Spirit** and **entering samadhi**,
**corpse dissolution** and **living departure**,
**taking rebirth** and **transmigrating form**,
**treading the Dou’s steps** in **offering**,
**Five Symbols** and **Three Qi**,
**Five Teeth** and **Six Characters**,
**embracing the Moon** and **harvesting the Sun**,
**ingesting Qi** and **cutting off grains**,
**exhaling and inhaling**, **bending and stretching**,
**guiding and preserving thought**—
these **thousands of techniques** are all **shallow lateral methods**,
**gradual stages** for the **beginner**,
not worthy of advancement."*

**Pure and Refined Child** then followed and received the **precepts** for refining **Spirit, Qi, and Form**.

The **True Edict Chapter** lists the **sublime essences of the Immortals**,
uttering words as **scriptures**;
**condensing its profound mechanisms**,
one may **follow life’s order**.

Du Guangping, whose **art-name is Du Qieyu**,
a **man of the Later Han Dynasty**,
transmitted the **Dao of Mysterious White** to **Master Jie**—
he sat and reclined **daily**,
at will **preserving thought** in the **muddy pellet**,
where **black qi** emerged;
then **preserving thought** in the **heart**,
where **white qi** emerged,
and in the **navel**,
where **yellow qi** emerged.

When he first **preserved thought**,
the **qi** issued forth like a **bean**,
then **its great surge ascended to Heaven**.
Thus the **three qi** like clouds,
**ensnared the throat** and **wrapped the body**,
covering his **form above**,
**transforming into fire**—
within the **three throat-passages**,
they **reunited with their reflections** to **refine one body**,
and within **one body**,
the **five viscera** shone **penetratingly**.

Thus he **practiced this daily**,
until **midday**, when he ceased.

Then he **ingested Qi** **two hundred and twenty times**,
the **so-called method** of *"knowing white and guarding black"* **to avoid death**.

The **Great Substance Elixir Scripture** states:
*"On one side of the face*,
**constantly rubbing** with the **left and right hands** **to generate heat**,
**high and low** following the **body’s contours**,
**all made to reach their utmost**—
one may **prevent wrinkles and spots** from arising,
and **radiate luster** like a **maiden**,
the **so-called method** of *‘mountains and rivers harmonizing Qi’*."

The **Scripture of Essence-Refining Massage** states:
*"When rising or lying down, one must **align Qi** and sit **upright**,
first **crossing the left and right hands**,
then **covering the neck behind**,
**lifting the head** to gaze upward,
while **raising the neck**,
**making the neck and hands contend** **three or four times**,
**to harmonize the Essence** and **blood**,
**to prevent wind-qi** from entering.
Afterward, **bending and moving the body**,
**stretching the hands to the four extremes**,
**reaching outward, pulling sideways**,
**propagating and shaking the hundred joints**,
**doing each three times**—
then **rising** and **donning fine or thick silk**,
**wiping the neck and behind the ears**,
**making all areas warm** **in a gentle manner**.

**Following the hair’s growth**, **massage the neck** as if **combing the scalp** **without count**—
after a long while, **massage the left and right hands** to **treat the face and eyes**.
Then **swallow saliva twenty times**,
**to guide the internal fluids**.
**Practicing this constantly**,
one’s **eyes become bright**,
one’s **body remains unsoiled**,
and **evil qi** does not **dry up**.

At the **time of life-giving Qi**,
**swallow saliva seven times**,
**press the body’s pains** toward their **corresponding directions**,
and **invoke**:
*"Left Mysterious, Right Mysterious*,
**three Spirits** **unite truly**;
*Left Yellow, Right Yellow*,
**six Refined** **correspond harmoniously**;
*Evil wind-qi and pestilence*,
**suppressed and hidden** **in the four quarters**."

「The **Jade Elixir** flows and nourishes, **promoting free circulation** above and below;
**within**, it dispels **water and fire**,
**without**, it repels **inauspicious influences**;
**eternal life and ascension** are attained,
**as the body remains ever robust**.

After **invoking**, **swallow saliva** again **seven times**,
**pressing** the **pains** of the body **twenty-one times** in total.
**Practicing this constantly**,
one shall **be free from illness**.

The **ears and eyes** are the **steps to seek the True**,
the **gates to all spiritual essence**.
**Constantly** use **the hands** to **press the small acupoints** behind the brows **thirty-nine times**,
**massage the upper eyelids** with the **palms and fingers**,
and **rotate the ears with the hands** **thirty times**—
**the rubbing must be swift and without fixed measure**.

Once completed,
**use the hands to reverse-comb the forehead** **thirty-nine times**,
from the **center of the brows** and **return upward** into the **hairline**.
**Swallow saliva without limit**,
**and practicing this constantly**,
one’s **eyes grow clear and bright**.

Behind the **brows** lies a **small acupoint**,
**the abode of the Upper Primordial’s Six Harmonies**,
**where the radiance of life’s essence is born and transformed**.
Below the **eyes**, at the **upper eyelid’s edge**,
**is the ford of Regulus**,
**and rotating the ears with the hands** follows the **path of the Bright Pearl**.

**Human aging** does not **begin with the ears and eyes**,
but if one **uses the hands to reverse-comb the forehead** while **internally preserving the essence of the Red Boy**,
then **both sun and moon shine eternally**,
and the **Upper Primordial rejoices**.

Thus, **completing the thirty-nine cycles**,
**this is the "Hands Serving the Three Primordials"**,
**which firmly secures the brain and hair**.

The **four sides of the head**,
**use the left and right hands to comb them**,
**following the hair’s growth to its knots**,
**only increasing the strokes**.
Then **the scalp’s blood circulates freely**,
and **wind-dampness** does not **congeal**.

Once done,
**press the eyes with the hands twenty-nine times**,
**this is the method to inspect the eye’s spirits**.

The **Master of Fate** said:
*"If one **keeps a pure fast** and **avoids grains**,
then **the sun abides in the day** and **the moon in the night**,
**residing in the mouth**,
**making them large as rings**—
the **sun** is **red** with **purple radiance** and **nine rays**,
the **moon** is **yellow** with **white radiance** and **ten rays**.
**Then swallow the luminous essence**,
**and practice this secretly without limit**,
or **let the sun and moon dwell in the face**,
**with the sun on the left and the moon on the right**,
**so that the two lights merge with the pupils**,
**their qi interflowing**—
**this is the method to gather and nourish life’s essence**,
**to harmonize and unite the soul and spirit**."

The **True Person of the Great Void** said:
**"On the moon’s fifth day**, during the **Child’s hour**,
**internally preserve the sun’s form** and **let it enter through the mouth**,
**dwelling in the heart’s center**,
**illuminating the inner mind**,
**and merge its light with the sun**,
**feeling the heart grow warm**.
**Then swallow saliva nine times**.
**On the fifteenth day**, the **twenty-fifth day**, and the **twenty-ninth day**,
**repeat this practice**,
**and the ears and eyes become keen and penetrating**,
**the hundred channels clear and bright**,
**the face radiates with jade-like luster**,
**the body glows with golden sheen**.
**After fifteen years**, the **Celestial Ascension’s Divine Vehicle** will arrive.

The *Scripture of Great Wisdom* says:
**"Within the heart**, there is a **sun** as large as a **coin**,
**red** with **nine rays**,
**rising from the heart**, passing the throat to the teeth,
**returning to the stomach**.
**After a long while**, one **sees it within the heart and stomach**.
**Then exhale and swallow saliva thirty-nine times**,
**three times daily**.
**Practicing this for a year** removes illness,
**for five years** the body **radiates with splendor**,
**at eighteen years** one **may attain the Dao**,
**and the sun moves without shadow**.

**At night**, **wear the moon’s essence** like **wearing the sun’s**,
**only descending from the brain**,
**entering at the throat’s root**,
**not emerging from the teeth** but **returning to the stomach**.

**Zhang Weizi** said:
**"At dawn**, first **close the eyes and gaze inward**,
**as if seeing the five viscera**.
**Then exhale through the mouth twenty-four times**,
**so that the eyes perceive the five-colored qi** **entwined upon the face**,
**and inhale through the mouth fifty times** to **absorb these five-colored qi**.
**Swallow saliva sixty times**,
**knock the teeth seven times**,
**swallow saliva seven times**,
**and then open the eyes**.
**Practicing this for long**,
one **rides the clouds and mist** while traveling—
**this is the method to wear the mist**."

The **True Consort of the Nine Flowers** said:
**"The sun is the substance of the mist**,
and **the mist is the sun’s essence**.
I have **heard of the method to wear the sun**,
but **never seen the scripture of eating the mist**.
The **scripture of eating the mist** is **most secret**,
but the **method to gather the mist** is **most simple**.

The **eyes** are the **mirror of the body**;
the **ears** are the **window of the form**.
**Excessive vision** causes the mirror to **dim**,
**excessive listening** causes the window to **close**—
I have **the technique to polish the mirror and clear the window**.

The **face** is the **courtyard of the spirit**;
the **hair** is the **flower of the brain**.
**Grief in the heart** causes the face to **wither**,
**the brain’s decay** causes the hair to **turn white**,
**the loss of vital essence** diminishes the **crimson elixir**—
I have **the method to restore youthful complexion and return to black hair**.

**Essence is the spirit of the body**;
**luminosity is the treasure of the form**.
**Excessive toil** causes **essence to scatter**,
**overuse of the mirror** causes **luminosity to fade**—
I have **the scripture to augment essence and prolong luminosity**."

**If one steadfastly guards the True Essence**,
**in one year**, the **head will not turn white**,
**and baldness will regrow**.

**If one harbors internal familial burdens and external worldly ties**,
**with broad hearing and mingled breath and voice**,
then **the Dao is not single-minded**,
**and practice yields no benefit**.

**True talent often hides in forests and mountains**,
**far from the world**,
**and if one embraces it with sincerity**,
**then youthful visage and dark hair endure**.

**Thus I shall prescribe the elixirs of Jade Nectar and Golden Grain**,
**the fruits of Fire Peach and Intertwined Pear**—
**if the body is not yet pure and refined**,
**and malicious thoughts fill the heart**,
**then these cannot be attained**.

**Fire Peach and Intertwined Pear** are **not external things**;
**they are born from the heart**.
**If the heart harbors thorns and brambles**, then **peach and peach do not appear**.

The **Great Lord of the Azure Boy** said:
*"To cultivate the root of **extinction and enlightenment**,
one must **uproot the seed of birth and death**;
**to sink into the Nine Abysses**,
one must **only sit and preserve the corporeal form**."*

The **True Person of the Western City** said:
*"The spirit is the **vessel for transcending the form**,
**a thin shore** must be **crossed**;
**to linger on the Wheel of Birth and Death**,
one must **only suffer** from **indecisive heart**."*

**Can one who seeks the Dao** **fail to exert their own power**?

**When a person dies**,
**if their form resembles life**—
**their feet do not turn blue**,
**their skin does not wrinkle**,
**their eye’s light is not extinguished**,
**their hair does not fall out**,
**and their bones remain firm**—
**this is **spontaneous dissolution**."*

The **spontaneously dissolved immortal** merely attains to ride the **Celestial Canopy**, mount the **Flying Dragon**, ascend the **Supreme Pole**, and wander the **Nine Palaces**.

Those who have attained the Dao and temporarily dwell in the **Great Yin**—the **Great Unity** guards their corpse, the **Three Souls** tend to their bones, the **Seven Spirits** defend their flesh, and the **Fetal Spirit** preserves their **qi**.

For those who cultivate the Dao, they must ensure the **Three Passes** are always harmonized.
The **mouth** is the **Pass of the Heart**;
the **feet** are the **Pass of the Earth**;
the **hands** are the **Pass of Humanity**.
When the **Three Passes** are harmonized, the **Five Viscera** will be at peace.

**Jiang Bozhen** encountered an immortal. The immortal leaned against him at **high noon**, and his shadow was askew.
The immortal said: *"You are earnest in your pursuit of immortality, yet your heart is not upright—why so?"*
I will instruct you.
When the sun rises three *zhang* high, place your hands above your shoulders, aligning the sun with your heart. When your heart grows warm, your heart will be upright.
Heeding this, he attained the Dao.

At **midnight**, remove the pillow and lie flat outside, gripping firmly and relaxing the body. If the **qi** flows smoothly and subtly, then both **body and spirit** are complete.

There are **nine afflictions** in the pursuit of the Dao:
Having **resolve but no timing**—the first;
Having **timing but no companion**—the second;
Having a **companion but no resolve**—the third;
Having **resolve but no teacher**—the fourth;
Meeting a **teacher but remaining unaware**—the fifth;
Becoming **aware yet not diligent**—the sixth;
Being **diligent yet failing to uphold the Dao**—the seventh;
Having **resolve yet not steadfast**—the eighth;
Being **steadfast yet not enduring**—the ninth.

**Joy and anger** diminish one’s resolve;
**Pleasure** harms one’s nature;
**Wealth and honor** confuse one’s **virtue**;
**Yin and Yang** exhaust one’s essence—
These are the **taboos of the Dao**.

Those who cultivate the Dao must constantly **expel the dead qi** and **draw in the living qi**, carefully restraining laughter and speech while contemplating their form.

Why does the **ritual method** sharpen one’s vision?
I take **clear water** from the **first day of the Heavenly Stem-Branch cycle**, mix it with **True Elixir**, and wash the eyes—thus, clarity is attained.

**The Most High** said: *"How many days does human life span?"*
Some said, *"Within a few days."*
Others said, *"Within a meal’s time."*
**The Most High** said: *"Not yet."*
Some said, *"Within a breath."*
**The Most High** said: *"Excellent! This is to know the Dao."*

Zǐwēi Fūrén said: *"Those who cultivate the Dao are like holding fire in a darkened chamber—when the darkness vanishes, only the light remains.*

**Wealth and desire** are like the blade’s sweetness—
A child knows its taste but not the peril of severed tongue.

Nánjí Lǎorén said: *"Love begets sorrow; sorrow breeds fear.
Thus, without love, there is no sorrow—
Without sorrow, there is no fear."*

Tàishàng Zhēnrén said: *"How does one play when the strings are slack?"*
Some replied: *"Neither mournful nor joyous."*
*"How when the strings are taut?"*
*"The sound breaks, and grief is wounded."*
*"When slack and taut are balanced?"*
*"All harmonies blend, and the eight tones resound in perfection."*

Tàishàng Zhēnrén said: *"To study the Dao, fix the mind—like tuning a zither.
Those who cultivate the Dao think of morning meals without fail;
Guard their qi as their face—none shall remain unpreserved.
The vulgar chase fame like incense burning for their own tomb—
When buried, their qi is extinguished, yet they crave only to be heard.
Is this not delusion?"*

The *Tàisù Jīng* says: *"Rub your face with both hands until warm—
Then wrinkles and blemishes vanish, leaving radiance."*

Rub your palms until hot, then wipe your eyes,
And with your hands, comb your hair as if with a brush.
Massage your arms with both hands—
Then your hair will not gray, and your pulses will not float."*

The *Xiāomó Jīng* says: *"If the body is restless,
Retract your tongue to block the throat,
Gargle with saliva, swallow without counting—
Then the body will find peace.
Press your ears repeatedly—
Hearing sharpens, as if fortifying the city walls,
Recorded in the Imperial Register of Names.
Press your nose’s sides repeatedly—
Qi becomes balanced, as if irrigating Zhongyue,
Recorded in the Imperial Decrees.
When drowsy, sit with closed eyes,
Gazing inward to see the five viscera—
Then the intestines and stomach will be clear.
As I comb my hair, I face the Sovereign’s land and pray:
*'Níhuán Xuánhuá, preserve essence eternally—
Left, the hidden moon; right, the root of the sun.
Six directions refine in purity—
A hundred spirits receive this grace.'*
After swallowing saliva three times,
Your hair will not gray, and vitality will renew daily."*

The *Zhēngyī Jīng* says: *"Retaining the breath in stillness makes demons tremble—
The Functionaries and Dragon-Tiger Lords arrive.
Why are dreams malevolent?
First, the spirit is bewitched;
Second, the heart is tested;
Third, the corpse-thief strikes.
Upon waking, pinch the *rénzhōng* fourteen times,
And strike your teeth fourteen times—
Then misfortune turns to fortune.
For auspicious dreams, rub your eyes fourteen times,
And tap your teeth fourteen times.
Sleep on a raised bed—
Then earthly qi cannot reach you, and malevolent ghosts cannot assail.
Ghostly qi invades those who dwell too low.
At night, striking your teeth makes ghosts recoil, daring not to approach.
On *jiǎyín gēngshēn* days, ghosts contend, and the spirit grows restless."*

Huángniú Dàoshi said: *"At night, keep the sun at your brow,
The moon at your navel—
Then all malevolence retreats."*

Zhōngshān Liú Wěi studied Daoist cultivation for twelve years.
A仙师 tested him by suspending a ten-thousand-*jin* stone with a single hair,
Commanding him to sleep beneath it.
Liú Wěi remained calm and plump—
The仙师 could instruct him daily.
After taking the Divine Elixir,
He ascended to heaven in broad daylight.

Once, a man devoted to the Dao knew not its method,
And night and day bowed to a cypress, seeking longevity.
After twenty-eight years, the tree bore purple blossoms,
Sweet as candy—
And he ate them, becoming immortal.
Some bowed to Tàihuá,
And the Old Man of the Western Peak taught them the Dao.
Some bowed to the River for ten years,
And the River Spirit granted them the method of water-walking without drowning.
This was no other—
It was the power of utmost sincerity.

Wáng Zhòngfǔ absorbed the two luminaries,
Ate mist for forty years, yet achieved nothing.
His son practiced for eighteen years and ascended.

Nányuè Zhēnrén told Zhòngfǔ: *"Your brain’s palace is deficient,
And your sinews lack nourishment—
How could you succeed?"*
After treating his illness, Zhòngfǔ refined his essence and also ascended.

Thus, those who study the Dao must first nurture their bodies—
Then may they discuss the Way.

*(End of Dao Shū Volume Six)*
*(Beginning of Dao Shū Volume Seven)*

The *Dao Shū* Volume Seven continues:

When **Youzi Zēng Cāo** compiled the *Huángtíng Pān*, he gathered the teachings of **Inner Vision**, which indeed has two schools. Examining their most refined essence, their intent is without deceit.

The **Glazed Palace** within a person—this is the **Upper Clarity**—its name is **Purple Mist**. It is where the five phases gather harmoniously within the body, the most refined of *qi*.

The **Three Souls** are:
1. **Tāiguāng** (Fetal Light), dwelling in the **Upper Dan Field**;
2. **Shuǎnglíng** (Luminous Spirit), dwelling in the **Middle Dan Field**;
3. **Yōujīng** (Mysterious Essence), dwelling in the **Lower Dan Field**.

The **Lower Dan Field** is the **Lower Close-to-the-Genitals**—also called the **Gate of Life**, the **Golden Gate**, the **Mysterious Gate**, and the **Gate of Death and Birth**. The **Two Kidneys**—the left is **Minor Yang**, the right is **Major Yin**—connect upward to all the vessels and reach the **Ending of the Channels**, this being the **Secret Door**.

What the two kidneys produce is like the *qi* of the sun and moon, constantly entering and exiting with each breath, internally irrigating the **Gate of Life**, ascending to the **Mud Pillow**, and flowing upward and downward like the sun and moon’s movement. One must always keep this in mind during movement and stillness, inhalation and exhalation.

The **Original *Qi*** emerges from the **Lower Dan Field** and circulates through the body. When the day’s *yang* reaches its peak, *yin* arises, so the two converge at the **Mud Pillow**. *Yin* and *yang* push each other in an endless cycle, just as the stars are arranged in the day and night. If one can **cultivate *qi* and preserve essence**, attuning to its rhythms, then the refined *qi* will condense and transform like **purple smoke and white clouds**, filling the **Three Dan Fields**. When it ascends, it becomes **cloud**; when it descends, it becomes **rain**, nourishing the five *zàng*-organs and rooting them.

**Absorb the essence** above, **do not let *qi* escape** below—when *qi* and essence are full, like a deep well gushing with spring water, it naturally flows endlessly, passing through the nostrils and entering the mouth, nourishing the body. Thus, **yellow lead and purple mercury** are born.

Harvest and refine them according to the seasons, entering them into the **Dan Field**, penetrating all the joints—then they will naturally emerge from the **Dark Chamber** and illuminate the **Gate of True *Yang***. This is what is meant by *"Returning Purple, Embracing Yellow, Entering the Dan Field."*

The **mouth** is the **Jade Pool**. Its refined essences all come from the **spleen and stomach**, which transform water and grain into essence. Its source is the **Elbow Post**, surging to the **Winnowing Fish Gate**, branching into four vessels: the two lower ones enter from the back of the crown, piercing the two orifices of the tongue and emerging through the gaps in the lower teeth; the two upper ones enter the **Mud Pillow**, passing through the two orifices of the upper palate and emerging through the upper teeth.

If the *qi* is unbalanced, water and grain cannot be transformed, the **spleen and stomach’s *qi*** weakens, and the **Jade Pool** dries up.

The *Classic* says: *"To not sleep day or night is to achieve the True."*

*"Not sleeping"* does not mean not lying down—it means dispelling the **obscuring *yin* *qi***.

The *Nine Sovereigns’ Alchemical Classic* says: *"By day, swallow the refined essence; by night, contain the true *qi*. Over time, the *qi* will naturally circulate through the Three Palaces like the sound of waves."*

Thus, the mind aligns with *qi*, *qi* aligns with spirit—blended and harmonized, clear and still, unattached to external things, entering the realm of **immobility**.

Why practice **Nurturing the Yellow Court**? To **close the Eight Gates**, **lock the Golden Gate**, **clarify the Spirit Platform**, **sweep away the Dark Chamber**, and make the two *qi* converge at the **Toad Palace**—this is how one refines **Jade Elixir** and **repairs the blood-brain**.

The **ears**, the **nose**, the **mouth**, the **heart**, and the **Gate of Life**—these five orifices must not be recklessly opened. One must **withdraw the senses and return the hearing**, cutting off all external perceptions. This is called **"The Seven-Jewel Lock Closing the Two Gates."**

To practice **Great Circulation**, one must first **master the Three Essentials**—the **ears**, the **eyes**, and the **mouth**—and then **close the Golden Gate**. Thus, the **Primordial One’s Mysterious Spring** dissolves at the **Deep Pass**, ascending to **Kunlun**.

The **Nine-Minor Immortals**, who always carry the **Tiger Talisman**, are **gold from the depths**.

The **spleen** is the **Horizontal Ferry**. The spleen is one *chǐ* long, the ferry three *cùn* and six *fèn*—located beneath the heart, called the **Yellow Court’s Treasury**.

The **heart** and **spleen** are like father and son. This is **fire arising from earth**, the dwelling of the **Spirit Platform**.

The **nose** is the **Central Peak**. The left nostril’s *qi* is **financial *yang***; the right nostril’s *qi* is **obscuring *yin***. Day and night, *yin* and *yang* shift—first converging at the **Dan Field**, then flowing to the **Cubit**, passing through the nose, penetrating the five *zàng*-organs, and returning to the **Gate of Life**.

**Biānqué** said: *"With one exhalation, the pulse travels three *cùn*; with one inhalation, the pulse travels three *cùn*. When breath is steady, the pulse travels six *cùn in total*. Day and night, there are **13,500 breaths**, so the pulse travels **50 degrees** and completes its circuit through the body. Its movement is endless, like a ring with no beginning."*
