**Nourishment** is *yang*; **Defense** is *yin*. If **Nourishment** is delayed by one breath, **cold** arises; if **Defense** is excessive by one breath, **heat** arises. If the spirit controls *qi*, the nose will not lose its rhythm, like an infant in the womb.

Thus, **Womb-Breathing** reaches from the **Gate of *Qi*** to the **Sea of *Qi***, without the labor of mouth and nose.

Why do **True Persons** breathe with the heels? When *qi* settles at the **Lower Primordial**, the breath becomes long and distant; when it rises above the **Three Burners**, the breath becomes short and hurried.

**Gě Zhēnrén** said: *"The wise tortoise and crane live a thousand years without eating—because they master breathing."*

Beneath the tongue are three orifices: the left is **Golden Spring**, the right is **Jade Dew**, and the center is **Mysterious Embrace**—all gushing sweet waters to irrigate the **Sea of *Qi***. The **Sea of *Qi*** is the **Gate of Life**, this being the **shore of life and death.**

「The **Three Treasures**—**Spirit** (*shén*), **Qi**, and **Essence** (*jīng*)—are the body’s most precious gifts.

Their cultivation has three essential stages:
- **First**, guide and lead the hundred limbs (*bǎi huái*), smooth the flow of blood and vessels, and harmonize the four limbs to ensure their tranquility;
- **Middle**, diligently refine the hundred virtues (*bǎi xíng*), embrace and restrain the soul and spirit (*hún pò*), and preserve the myriad gods (*wàn shén*) to safeguard all life;
- **Final**, purify and temper the **Primordial Essence** (*běn yuán*), soar like the sun and moon, and restore the **True Essence** (*zhēn jīng*). For when one attains the **True Essence**, immortality (*xiān*) is possible.

The key to nurturing the body lies in **mindful cultivation** (*cún xiǎng*), which includes **false contemplation** (*wàng xiǎng*) and **true contemplation** (*zhēn xiǎng*).
- To **close the eyes and gaze** (*bì mù zuò guān*), one may either draw the **Five Colors of Qi** (*wǔ sè zhī qì*), transmute the **luster of sun and moon**, assume the forms of **Dragon and Tiger**, or manifest the likeness of an **infant**—or even ponder the **crimson pearl** or visualize the **golden elixir** (*jīn dān*). These are all **false contemplations**.
- To **close the eyes and inwardly observe** (*bì mù nèi shì*), one must make the **Spirit recognize Qi** and the **Qi recognize Spirit** (*shén rì qì, qì rì shén*). Thus, the **Qi becomes the Spirit’s womb** (*shén tāi*), the **form becomes the Qi’s master** (*qì zhǔ*), and when **Spirit and Qi merge naturally**, this is **true contemplation**.

When the **sun and moon’s energies** are fully realized, one may enter and exit their **orbits** (*gǔ*).

The **lungs** govern **Qi**, and are called the **Flowery Canopy** (*huā gài*). Below, they connect to the **Gate of Life** (*mìng guān*), and above, they pierce the **Divine Abode** (*shén lú*). If **Qi does not flow**, the nose becomes congested (*bì sé yǔng zhì*).

Then, one must **nurture the White Primordial** (*bái yuán*), adjust the **Six Qi** (*liù qì*) with stillness—**smiling inhalation** (*shěn*), **exhaling breath** (*xū*), **prolonged exhalation** (*hē*), **blowing**, **calling forth**, and **drawing in** (*hū, xī*). This can **transform stagnation** (*gé yōng zhì*).

What is the **White Primordial**? It is the **True Qi** of the lungs. Among all methods to **nurture the body**, none surpass **circulating Qi**.

When **Qi is active**, blood thrives; when **blood thrives**, essence solidifies; when **essence solidifies**, spirit becomes luminous; and thus the **Four Seas** within the body flourish.

What are the **Four Seas**? They are **Qi**, **blood**, **essence**, and **marrow** (*suǐ*). Their essence lies in **avoiding the Five Injuries** (*wǔ shāng*):
- Excess **salty** harms the heart (*xīn*);
- Excess **bitter** harms the lungs (*fèi*);
- Excess **sour** harms the spleen (*pí*);
- Excess **spicy** harms the liver (*gān*);
- Excess **sweet** harms the kidneys (*shèn*).

Moreover, prolonged **gazing** injures the blood (*xué*), prolonged **anger** consumes the Qi (*qì*), prolonged **standing** weakens the bones (*gǔ*), prolonged **sitting** harms the flesh (*ròu*), and prolonged **walking** strains the sinews (*jīn*).

Those who understand this can **harmonize blood and Qi**, ascending to **seven returns** (*qī fǎn*) and descending to **nine restorations** (*jiǔ huán*), refining the **True Primordial** (*zhēn yuán*), subduing the **golden essence** (*jīn yè*), so that **blood turns to milk**, **Qi becomes like clouds**, **bones harden like gold**, and **marrow condenses like frost**.

The **liver** stores the **soul** (*hún*). To **endure wrath** is to **subdue the yin**, and to **restrain joy** is to **nourish the yang** (*yǎng*). When **one yang** arises from **Child** (*zǐ*, 11 PM–1 AM) to **Si** (*sì*, 11 AM–1 PM), the **six yangs** reach their peak. For ordinary people, **True Qi** at its extreme **disperses**.

The **adept** (*dá shēng zhī shì*), however, observes this peak and **generates one yin internally** (*yīn jí yú hài*), letting the **six yins** culminate at **Hai** (*hài*, 11 PM–1 AM). Then, **one yang** is generated within. **Yin and yang** thus **propel each other**, perpetually giving rise without end, so the **soul is preserved** and the **essence restored**, aligning with heaven and earth eternally.

This is what **Dao**? It is the use of the **seven-day return** (*qī rì lái fù*) to **retrieve the soul** and **restore the spirit** (*shè hún huán pò*), refining the elixir and **forming the embryo** (*lián dān jié tāi*), so that one may **ascend to seven returns** and achieve **inverted reunion**.

- **First**, ascending to the brain (*nǎo*) forms **clouds** (*yún*);
- **Next**, passing through the bones (*gǔ*) solidifies **marrow** (*suǐ*). When marrow is full, bones become firm; when bones are firm, flesh grows; when flesh is solid, sinews relax; when sinews are fixed, blood flows and **vitality is replenished**; when blood is abundant, Qi is enhanced; when Qi surges, **hair and nails flourish**.

The **spleen** is the **Golden Terrace** (*jīn tái*), the **great root** of **Primordial Qi** (*yuán qì*), capable of **converting food into Qi**. Its vessel descends to the **Gate of Life** (*mìng mén*), located below the navel (*qí*) by **one inch and three divisions** (*sān fēn*), named the **Jade Ring** (*yù huán*), which is the **Lower Elixir Field** (*xià dān tián*).

What is the **Gate of Life**? It is the **portal of nature and destiny** (*xìng mìng zhī mén*), not solely the right kidney. Constantly **warming and nourishing** the **spleen-fire** (*pí huǒ*), ensuring the **earth-Qi** (*tǔ qì*) is plentiful, strengthens the body and secures its foundation.

When the **spleen is solid** and **Qi is full**, its face glows like **cinnabar** (*dān*). The spleen is long—**one foot**—and **concealed within the Great Granary** (*tài cāng*). If it is **robust and full**, all five viscera (*wǔ zàng*) are harmonized; if **weak**, the **four limbs** (*sì zhī*) wither.

Once, **Zhang Zhongding of the Buying Cave** (*Guài Yá Zǐ*), a man of **public song** (*gōng yǒng*), encountered **Mr. Xi Yi** (*xī yí*) in the heat of summer, **clinging to fire** (*fù huǒ*), wearing a **cotton cap** and **thick clothing** (*mián guān hòu nà*). He said: *"I guard one breath of Qi—unable to contend with the **transformative forces of nature** (*zào huà*)."*

The **gallbladder** is the **refined essence** of the **six palaces** (*liù fǔ*), governing all **Qi-forces** (*zhū qì lì*), and externally manifesting in the **pupils of the eyes** and the **bridge of the nose** (*mù tóng bì zhù*). Refining the **Three Primordial Qi** (*sān yuán zhī qì*), over time, the **luminous spirit** of the five viscera (*wǔ zàng*) shines like a torch at night (*yè zhú*).

When the **three souls** (*sān hún*) are **settled**, dreams vanish. The **three fields** (*sān tián*) each have their **chambers** (*shì*), each **one inch and two divisions** wide (*èr fēn*).

When **yang rushes forth** and **yin flees**, the **sages** liken it to **Dragon and Tiger** (*lóng hǔ*), for it is **difficult to subdue**.

The **three front gates** of the body are: the **nose** (*bí*), the **eyes** (*mù*), and the **heart** (*xīn*).
The **three rear gates** are: the **tailbone** (*wěi wèn*), the **back of the elbow** (*zhǒu hòu*), and the **vertebrae** (*zhuǎn lú*).

The **mouth**, the **hands**, and the **feet**—these are the **three outer gates** of the body.
Inhalation and exhalation, advance and retreat—**none may be omitted**.

He who knows the **three fields** stores and refines the **true qi of the North**, harvesting it at its proper time, returning it in measured cycles. Naturally, it transforms—this is the **great elixir of the Nine Mysterious Golden Liquids**.

The **Earthly Gate** is the **mouth**; the **Imperial Homeland** is the **third eye**; the **nose’s qi** flows clear outward and mysterious inward.

To **cultivate and ignite fire**, to **operate the River Chariot**—this is nothing but the **breath itself**.

Here, one refines the **saliva and fluids**, drawing them into the **Mysterious Palace**. The **lead and mercury of the kidneys** ascend the **Upper Path**, and thus the **upper and lower gates are sealed without leakage**—the **sage embryo** is then formed.

The **tongue’s extension and retraction**, the **rinsing of saliva and swallowing of fluids**, should flow like rivers—**uninterrupted within the five viscera**.

Nurturing the **three fields**, massaging the **six palaces**, securing the **spirit chamber**, closing the **evil gates**—thus, the **essence of the five viscera** is condensed, the **primordial cell of Great Transformation** is nourished, and the **qi dwells in the Spirit Palace**, the **elixir circulates in the brain**. This can **transform decay into vitality**.

When the **three fields** are fully refined, **precision is preserved and the embryo is stabilized**—naturally, the **three qi spiral rightward at the Brain Gate**, the **six yangs encircle leftward at the Heavenly Palace**. Above and below flow in harmony, the **hundred gates are all bright**, and the **nine orifices open fully**.

The **true qi of the North, the One of Rectitude**, governs the **two qi of the Dark Chamber and the Golden Room**—**Kan and Li**.

When **Kan and Li unite**, the **essences of sun and moon** naturally merge and converge in the **three fields**.

The **Golden Room’s Lower Primordial** is the **kidney organ**, named the **Sea of Longevity**.
If the **tailbone is not restrained**, the **Ocean will dry up**.
Thus it is said: **"For true longevity, one must be most cautious in the Chamber of Repose"**—this is what is meant!

Gazing inward at the **three chambers and nine rooms**, making **inner and outer spaces transparent**, one then **stores and swallows the jade fluids of the five teeth**—the **five teeth** are the **five viscera**.

Then, **closing the Gate of Life**, **locking the Golden Bolt**, **restraining the vital essence**—when the **lead and mercury are about to ascend**, one must **suppress their flight**.
**Lead** is the **gold in water**; when full, the **spirit wavers**.
**Mercury** is the **silver in fire**; when full, the **soul trembles**.

The **large intestine** is the **palace of the Jade Hall**; the **small intestine** is the **palace of Primordial Yang**; the **left shoulder** is the **palace of Great Harmony**; the **right bladder** is the **palace of Great Purity**; the **stomach** is the **palace of Central Yellow**; the **gallbladder** is the **palace of Supreme Clarity**.
Cultivate and govern them—**do not let them decay**; this is how it must be.

The **wise in life** first govern their **heart**.
When **agitation arises**, **calm it**; when **evil arises**, **correct it**; when **desire arises**, **suppress it with abandonment**; when **turbulence arises**, **clarify it with purity**.
Action and stillness rest here; **haste and deliberation** are here.
In time, **external things grow dim**, while **inner discernment sharpens**.
One does not **seek stillness** yet grows ever stiller; one does not **seek tranquility** yet grows ever more tranquil.
Thus, **movement and stillness are both forgotten**, and **Heavenly Purity finds its own ease**.

The **Five Phases**—**dispersed, they are five**; **united, they are one**.
**One** is **one qi**.
**One** is the **beginning of the Dao**, the **ancestor of the elixir**.
Thus, **Heaven with one yang descending gives birth to Reunion**; six descents give birth to **Qian**.
When **yang reaches its peak**, one **yin descends**, giving birth to **Pregnancy**; six descents give birth to **Kun**.
From the **eleventh month to the fourth month**, the hexagrams are **Reunion, Lin, Tai, Great Strength, Central Peace, Qian**.
From the **fifth to the tenth month**, the hexagrams are **Pregnancy, Pursuit, Opposition, Contemplation, Shedding, Kun**.

The **sage gathers and refines the true qi of Heaven and Earth**, dividing it into two bodies:
**One is lead**, the **second is mercury**.
Each **eight liang** makes **three hundred eighty-four fen**—**two fen and four fen make one liang**; three hundred eighty-four fen is one **jin**—this corresponds to the **hexagram lines**.

Gazing upward at the **Heavenly Way**, looking downward at the **water clocks**, one **evenly divides the fire’s duration**, seizing **eighteen hundred units of fire’s power** to **shed the mortal form**. This begins with **One** and ends with **One**.

The **fire’s duration for the Golden Elixir**—
When viewed from the **Mysterious Root**, it is the **division of Hunyuan**, where the **Three Powers are complete**, and the **four seasons shift**.
When viewed from the **inner landscape**, it is the **division of Hongmeng**, where the **three palaces are complete**, and **ten thousand phenomena arise**, with the **four seasons circulating**.

This is how **Heaven, Earth, and Man all arise from One**, is it not?

Its marvel lies in **uniting the three-five qi**, using the **nine-nine rhythms**.
What are **three-five**? **Water, fire, earth**.
Thus, **closing the Hidden Gate**, **refining the Eight Trigrams**, **dividing the Three Clarities**.

Its **father is the Mud Pillow**; its **mother is the Feminine One**, gathering the **three luminaries** and returning them to the **Chamber of the Son**—**spirit and essence are not lost**.

What are the **Eight Trigrams**?
**Nine above, one below**; **three on the left, seven on the right**; **two and four as shoulders**; **six and eight as feet**—this is what is meant.

What are the **Three Clarities**?
The **palace of the two kidneys**—its **left is the sun**, its **right is the moon**, and the **abode of the Dipper**—this is what is meant.

Within my body are **sun and moon**.
If I make them **soar high**, ascending to the **Mud Pillow**, traversing the **five viscera**, circulating through the **three palaces above and below without end**, then the **hundred bones will be firm** and the **marrow and essence plentiful**.

This is the **Way of the Yellow Court**.

What is the **Mysterious One**?
Refining the **yin spirit**, nurturing the **yang soul**, condensing the **Mysterious Pearl** and securing the **Sea of Essence**.

Common folk **refine yin with yang**—do they not **wither from vigor to old age**?
The **enlightened sage refines yang with yin**—do they not **return from old age to vigor**?

Those who **rinse and refine** first **close all the orifices**, then **turn the Red Dragon**, drawing upon the **jade fluids of the Jade Pool** to **nourish and augment** them, making **upper and lower regions communicate**—this is the **great medicine of embryonic fluids and fetal essence**.

What is **embryonic fluid**?
If I can **deeply support and firmly lock the North’s central region**, then the **three fields and nine orifices** will be **pure and undisturbed**, and **one fluid, one qi** will be condensed.

The *Classic* says:
*"Ascend to the heavens riding the Jade Wheel,
Day and night for seven days—do not sleep.
Why?*
The six yin and six yang,
The sevenfold cycle of inner alchemy’s fire—
This is the refining of the Golden Elixir.

Not sleeping means
Ever keeping one’s true thoughts serene and clear,
Lest the Spirit Platform grow dim.

The hundred grains—
The essence of earth and soil—
Can only nourish the form.

It is said:
*If you wish not to die, keep your intestines pure;
If you wish to live long, keep your intestines clear.*
Thus, one should eat the refined *Tàihé* qi.

To fill the belly,
First empty the mind.
The mind governs stillness,
Qi governs motion.
Thus, those attuned to the Dao
Soar beyond the cosmic expanse while their minds remain tranquil,
Rest within the infinitesimal yet keep their qi ever flowing.

Only through stillness can one align with the utmost void;
When the void reaches its peak, it becomes luminous;
When luminous, it becomes clear;
When clear, it becomes penetrating—
Then nothing in heaven and earth can escape the square inch of the heart.

The mind is the dwelling of the spirit;
The eyes are the spirit’s window.
When the mind moves, the eyes open;
When the mind stirs not, the eyes close.
Thus, by day, the light shines forth,
By night, it is concealed—
This harmonizes the *huā jīng* (flowering essence),
Balancing yin and yang.

The *róng* and *wèi* circulate through the six extremes,
Concealed at the *mǎo-yǒu* (hour of the hare and rooster),
Stored in the two kidneys.
The left is the *Yùfáng* (Jade Chamber), where the *Tàihé True Person* resides;
The right is the *Jīnshì* (Golden Hall), where the *Tàixuán Jade Maiden* dwells.

The Big Dipper—
Within, four ministers;
Without, three ladles—
Ever mingling with the *Qìhǎi* (Sea of Qi).
The *Qìhǎi* is the position of the *Hidden Dragon* at *Chǐzǐ* (first hexagram).

The *Classic* says:
*Knowing how to guard the male with the female ensures no aging—why?*
The male is the *Fire Dragon*,
Which delights in consuming *zǐjīn huángyá* (purple gold and yellow buds),
Its nature ever restless and unceasing.
The female is the *Water Tiger*,
Which delights in consuming *hóngyín bái xuě* (red silver and white snow),
Its nature ever roaming without fixity.

Those attuned to the Dao
Make the Dragon and Tiger mate in secret,
Feeding them with *zǐjīn huángyá*,
Nourishing them with *hóngyín bái xuě*—
Thus, the male clings to the female,
The Tiger lies low, the Dragon hides—
Then winds and rains follow their order,
And the work of heaven and earth is complete.

When the mind’s essence is focused,
Its inner self does not falter,
Uniting the three burners above,
Descending the jade nectar below,
Drawing moisture from the *Xuānyīng* (Mysterious Belly),
Entering the *Míngtáng* (Bright Hall),
Irrigating the throat—
Then the spirit’s clarity is restored.

This is how
The lower elixir must first be refined,
Then the primal fluid is boiled above—
Making yin exhausted while yang flourishes,
Fire drawn forth while water is replenished,
In an endless cycle.

How does one draw the moisture?
Stirring beneath the tongue makes the waves rise full—
Swallowing sends it to the *Dānhǎi* (Elixir Sea).

When the great work nears completion,
The outer *xiéguān* (obstacle gate) is sealed,
The inner *Mìngmén* (Gate of Life) is unlocked?
The lungs govern the *róng* and *wèi*—
In the kidneys, this is *jīnshuǐ xiāngshēng* (metal-water mutual generation),
The way of parent and child.

Performing thirty-six swallows at the *Yùtí* (Jade Pool)
Opens all the vessels and enriches the blood.

What are the *seven returns*?
Rising to the brain, they form clouds;
Descending to the mouth, they form water;
Passing through the lungs, they form saliva;
Passing through the heart, they form blood;
Passing through the liver, they form essence;
Passing through the spleen, they form fluids;
Passing through the kidneys, they form the two vessels—
The refined yin essence and yang purity.

The *Jīnjīn Yùyè* (Golden Fluid, Jade Dew)
Are born of yin and yang.

If one ascends through seven returns,
Entering the two kidneys,
Descending through nine cycles,
Reaching the brain,
Endlessly circulating above and below—
Then this is the *Qiónggāo Yùshuāng* (Jade Paste, Pearl Frost).

As the great work takes root,
The primal qi becomes full and substantial,
The eight pure fluids flow freely,
The kidneys receive the essence,
Penetrating the five viscera,
Then the *jiǔjiǔ* (eighty-one) true fire is kindled—
When the qi is full and the moment is ripe, the Golden Elixir is complete.

---
**The Tàijí Chapter**
The body has a *horizontal津* (moisture),
The root of the *Tàijí*.
Preserve the *central yellow* (middle essence),
And the form may endure.

The *Shùyáng Child* said:
Humans receive the *central qi* to live,
Sharing the same origin as heaven and earth.

The *Yì* says:
*The Yì* has the *Tàijí*,
From which the two principles arise.
The *Tàijí* is the great centrality.

The *Spring and Autumn Annals* says:
Humans receive the centrality of heaven and earth to live—
This is called *command* (fate).

When forming in the womb,
The kidneys first receive the shape,
Then the five viscera arise—
Thus, the kidneys are the *Gate of Life*.

The left is *Shàoyáng* (Lesser Yang),
Heaven, the Sun;
The right is *Tàiyín* (Greater Yin),
Earth, the Moon—
This is how the *Tàijí* of the body first divides and takes form.

Heaven and earth endure long
Because the *Tàijí* remains constant;
Humans achieve longevity and clarity
Because the central qi is not lost.

Thus, ancient sages spoke of nurturing life
By cultivating the *Huángtíng* (Yellow Court) of the body.
*Huáng* is the color of centrality;
*Tíng* is where centrality is born.
It lies directly between the two kidneys.

Above, it reaches the *Húntíng* (Soul Court), which is the spleen;
Below, it reaches *Guānyuán* (Pass Gate), the *Qìhǎi* (Sea of Qi).
Three inches above and below the navel,
Front to *Shēngmén* (Life Gate), back to *Mìhù* (Secret Door).
*Shēngmén* is the navel;
*Mìhù* is the *Jīngshì* (Essence Chamber).

Within, the qi and fluids circulate,
Ascending to the *Níhuán* (Mud Pellet),
Descending to the *Héngduān* (Horizontal End).
The *Sān Yuán Jiǔ Gōng* (Three Origins, Nine Palaces),
The *Bā Zhēn Èrshísǎng* (Eight Truths, Twenty-Four Scenes)
All take the *Huángtíng* as their master.

Just as humans have the *Huángtíng*,
Heaven and earth have the *Tàijí*—
This is what the *Lǎozi* called the *Gǔshén* (Valley Spirit).

What is the *Gǔshén*?
*Gǔ* speaks of the void where the spirit is stored.

The *Xuānpìn* (Mysterious Female) are the two kidneys.
The left is *Xuān* (Mysterious), the color of heaven;
The right is *Pìn* (Female), the nature of earth.
The breathing of heaven and earth enters here—
Thus it is said:
*The root of heaven and earth*
*Endures like a thread,*
*Using it without strain—*
This is called *tāixī* (embryonic breathing).

---

To cultivate it properly is to keep it ever-present without loss—
Thus one may stand alongside Heaven and Earth.

Yet how could cultivation be easy?
There must be a Way to it.

In essence:
The movement and application do not exceed the mind,
Preservation and storage do not exceed the kidneys,
Nourishment and harmonization do not exceed the spleen,
Attaining unity, guarding stillness, and accumulating strength over time—
Then success is inevitable.

Thus the Way of cultivation
Takes *mìnsè zhēnqì* (conserving true *qi* in secrecy) as its foundation—
Wasting and leaking are its greatest taboos.

The *Classic* says:
*"Close the Command Gate, preserve the Jade Capital—*
*At a hundred years, you shall be drunk with life, with surplus years.*
How could one not take heed!"

I observe that three inches below the navel is the *Héngjīn* (Horizontal Ferry),
Where it transforms into *jīngshuǐ* (essence-water),
Flowing outward if unchecked.
To seal it lies only in *chóngmì* (double secrecy)—
Double secrecy ensures the *qi* and essence circulate.
This is my true *qi*—
How could one not guard it with utmost diligence?

---
**Fire and Candling Section**
The foundation of *nèidān* (internal alchemy) relies on fire to complete;
The *zhōutiān* (circulation) must not deviate from its proper course.

The *Zhì Yóuzǐ* (Master of the Ultimate) said:
*"Close the breath twenty-four times—*
*The number suffices; exhale and close again.*
Using the *Red Dragon* to stir right seven times,
Left nine times, rinsing sixteen times,
Grinding the teeth twice—
Then divide into three swallows:
First right, then left, then center—
This is the *yīn yáo* (yin principle).

Close the breath thirty-six times—
The number suffices; exhale and close again.
Using the *Red Dragon* to stir left seven times,
Right nine times, rinsing thirty-three times,
Grinding the teeth three times—
Then three swallows:
First left, then right, then center—
This is the *yáng yáo* (yang principle).

In total, close the breath one hundred ninety-two times,
Refining with *huǒ èr bā* (fire two eights)—
This is what is meant by *fire and candling*.

---
**Water and Fire Section #3**
Fire originally governs Heaven, water originally governs Earth;
One ascends, one descends—
Thus their function is *jìjì* (completed).

The *Zhì Yóuzǐ* said:
*"The human body has three *sānmi* (trigrammatic) fires:
The first is *jūn huǒ* (Sovereign Fire), the *shàngmi* (upper trigrammatic), which is the heart;
The second is *chén huǒ* (Minister Fire), the *zhōngmi* (middle trigrammatic), which is the kidneys;
The third is *mín huǒ* (Common Fire), the *xiàmì* (lower trigrammatic), which is the bladder.

Now, what we practice are the *chángshēng huǒ* (long-life fires) and the *zhōutiān huǒ* (circulation fires).
If one does not know the laws of contraction and dispersion,
This fire will flare upward and become a calamity.

Did not the ancient poem say:
*'Originally from striking stones for light,*
*It led to baking Heaven with heat.'*
Is this not the case?

In essence, fire cannot be absent—
Greatly, it can eliminate the *sānshī* (Three Corpses) and achieve immortality;
Slightly, it can dispel the *jiǔchóng* (Nine Worms) and prevent illness.
Yet one must know how to return it to its source.

Who understands the function of water?
Water in the body becomes sweat, tears, blood, urine, semen, saliva, and spittle—
These are the many ways water flows outward in the body.

Within, the brain is the *zuìhǎi* (marrow sea),
The heart is the *xuèhǎi* (blood sea),
The *dāntián* is the *qìhǎi* (qi sea),
The spleen and stomach are the *shuǐgǔ zhīhǎi* (sea of water and grain).
The hundred bones are like rivers converging into the four seas—
When the four seas flow freely, the rivers will be fully replenished.

*Zhuāngzǐ* said:
*"The nature of water is unmixed, it is clear;
Unmoved, it is level—
If stagnant and unflowing, it cannot be clear."*

Thus it is said:
*"A door hinge never rots, flowing water never putrefies—*
*This is their principle."*

*Liú Gāoshàng* composed the *Huófǎ* (Method of Revival) based on this.
*Sū Shì* resided at the *Báiè Zhīfēng* (White Crane Peak),
Inspired by the *rǔquán* (breast spring) to compose a poem—
Its meaning is profound.
Alas, many can speak of it but cannot practice.

Thus, the scholar must now understand the method of *shuǐhuǒ jìjì* (Water-Fire Completion).

Fire in the heart is *xìng* (nature),
Water in the kidneys is *mìng* (fate)—
These two truly depend on each other to complete.

The kidneys’ water, without the heart’s fire to nourish,
Cannot ascend.
The heart’s fire, without the kidneys’ water to store,
Cannot descend.

To long-nourish and complete, reaching the uppermost, lowest, and lateral extremes,
Penetrating the *sānyuán jiǔgōng* (Three Origins, Nine Palaces),
The five *zàng* (viscera) and hundred *jié* (nodes)—
Only then can one preserve and endure eternally.

Thus *Cuī Zǐ* said:
*"Within stillness, if water and fire penetrate,*
*Then one is an immortal who does not die."*

---
**Kànlí (Abysmal and Bright) Section**
*Juéyīn* (Concealed Yin) generates *kǎn* (Abyss),
*Juéyáng* (Concealed Yang) generates *lí* (Brightness);
Deeply understanding their use
Lays the foundation for prolonged vision.

The *Zhì Yóuzǐ* explained:
*"Heaven and Earth are separated by eighty-four thousand *lǐ* (miles).
In the human body, the heart is Heaven,
The kidneys are Earth—
Separated by eight inches and four *fèn* (divisions),
Matching the numbers of Heaven and Earth.

Thus, when Heaven’s *qi* descends, the heart’s *qi* descends to the kidneys—
The kidneys are *kǎn*.
When Earth’s *qi* ascends, the kidneys’ *qi* ascends to the heart—
The heart is *lí*.

When Heaven and Earth harmonize, all things are born;
When *kǎn* and *lí* are completed, the *huángyá* (yellow sprout) emerges.

By analogy:
*Lí* is yang, thus *kǎn* is yin;
*Lí* is the sun, thus *kǎn* is the moon;
*Lí* is fire, thus *kǎn* is water;
*Lí* is nature, thus *kǎn* is fate;
*Lí* is the dragon, thus *kǎn* is the tiger;
*Lí* is odd, thus *kǎn* is even;
*Lí* is lead, thus *kǎn* is mercury;
*Lí* is fluid, thus *kǎn* is *qi*.

In ancient times, *Hǎi Chánzǐ* said:
*"The Five Phases and Four Symbols are the essence of *kǎn* and *lí*."*

I observe that the *rìhún yuèpò* (soul of the sun, spirit of the moon)
Follow each other day and night without pause—
Nature and fate are inseparably linked,
Yet most people remain unaware.

If one can clarify the ascending and descending movements of Heaven and Earth,
Understand the proper conjunction of sun and moon,
Generate fluid from *qi*, generate *qi* from fluid,
Hold yin within yang, hold yang within yin—
Then *kǎn* and *lí* will be complete.

This crucial key is rarely known by mortals.

*Mǎ Zìrán* encountered thousands of *fāngwài shì* (outer sect adepts) in his life,
Yet their teachings were nothing more than
Swallowing saliva, circulating *qi*, practicing *tāixī* (embryonic breathing),
And refining the *zhōutiān huǒhòu* (fire and candling of circulation).

At sixty-four years old, he met *Hǎi Chánzǐ*—
Then, suddenly enlightened, he realized all his previous teachings were incorrect.

---

So then, what is the essential method?

There are the **Two-Eight Elixirs** passed through furnace and crucible,
Where Dragon and Tiger copulate ten thousand times without ceasing—
Then the Great Elixir is thus perfected.

Master Lü’s verse says:
*"If someone asks me of the method for longevity,
I know it lies beyond the wheel of Heaven’s sun and moon."*
Truly profound words!

The **Jiǎ-Gēng Chapter** states:
East and West fixed in position, metal and wood clearly manifest;
At **Yín** and **Shēn**, refining has its method.

**Yóuzǐ** says:
Many discuss the **Zǐ-Wǔ** (Child-Midday) practice.
**Zǐ** is the water of **North Kǎn**, the **Tàiyuán** essence.
I observe the celestial patterns—
Above, it connects to the **Xuányáng**’s tread,
Residing in the **Nǚxū-Wēi** constellations,
Below, it responds to the wilds of **Qí**,
In the human body, it corresponds to the **kidneys**.
Examined through the **guàqi** (trigram-energy), it is the **Fù** hexagram—
The moment when **one yang** first stirs.

**Wǔ** is the fire of **South Lí**, the **Yángmíng** essence.
I observe the celestial patterns—
Above, it connects to the **Zhēnhuǒ**’s tread,
Residing in the **Liǔxīng-Zhāng** constellations,
Below, it responds to the wilds of **Zhōu**,
In the human body, it corresponds to the **heart**.
Examined through the **guàqi**, it is the **Guì** hexagram—
The moment when **one yin** first stirs.

Though **Zǐ** is yin, one yang is born within—
This is called **"yin within yang."**
Though **Wǔ** is yang, one yin is born within—
This is called **"yang within yin."**
This is what scholars commonly know.

Practitioners, when **one yang** first moves and **original qi** ascends,
All know to **grasp the perineum, tuck the knees**,
**Raise the body, advance the fire**,
Circulate **metallic essence** into the **marrow sea**,
Fill **spiritual water** at the **high source**,
Let the nasal breath be soft and continuous,
Internally settle the spirit-mind—
Until **Chǒu**, when they pause,
Waiting for **original qi** to transmit to **Tíngwǔ**,
Where it merges with **heart-fire**—
This is the **interaction of water and fire**.

When **one yin** first moves and **fluid-blood** converges,
All know to **tuck the feet, fold the hands**,
Settle the heart-mind, let the nasal breath be soft and continuous,
Fill the mouth with saliva—
**Do not swallow, do not spit**—
Circulate **heart-fire** upward to merge with **jade fluid**,
Exchange **heart-kidney qi**,
Achieve the **Jiǔjì** (Completion) effect—
Until **Wèi**, when they pause,
Waiting for **heart-blood** to transmit to **Hài-Zǐ**,
Where it merges with **kidney-water**—
This is the **return of water and fire to their origins**.

Silently turning the alchemical wheel,
They believe they can practice **Zǐ-Wǔ** and unite **Dragon and Tiger**.

Those who practice the **Zǐ-Wǔ** method
Seek to unite **Dragon and Tiger** and return the **Great Elixir**.
Yet **Dragon and Tiger** cannot be made to copulate without first being born—
Thus, the **Zǐ-Wǔ** practice must begin with **nurturing Dragon and Tiger**,
And its subtlety lies in **refining Jiǎ-Gēng**.

Let us examine this thoroughly.

What is **refining Jiǎ-Gēng**?
Some say **Jiǎ** resides in **Yín**—
**Yín** is where fire is born and reigns in **Wǔ**,
The essence of **southern bundling**—
This is the method of **fluid-blood transformation**,
Where the **yang Dragon** is born—
Thus, **Jiǎ** must be refined at **Yín**.

**Gēng** resides in **Shēn**—
**Shēn** is where water is born and reigns in **Zǐ**,
The essence of **western-northern bundling**—
This is the method of **essence-blood transformation**,
Where the **yin Tiger** is born—
Thus, **Gēng** must be refined at **Shēn**.

This is where **Dragon and Tiger** are born,
Yet they do not know the mystery of **how to birth Dragon and Tiger**.

Fire is born in **Yín** and reigns in **Wǔ**,
Yet it later receives gestation and nourishment in **Chǒu**.
Water is born in **Shēn** and reigns in **Zǐ**,
Yet it also receives gestation and nourishment in **Chǒu**.
Nothing exists without first being gestated and nourished before it can be born and reign.

Ancients practicing the **Zǐ** method paused at **Chǒu**—
**Chǒu-Yín** is the **northern bundling** hexagram,
Both residing in the **Gèn** palace,
Their energies balanced, transmission swift.

At the start of **Chǒu**, **spiritual water** gradually descends to the **Huápó** (Jade Pool).
One must **stir with the tongue at the upper palate**,
Practice **swallowing at the double-story tower**—
Once **jade fluid** flows, ascending to the **double-story tower**,
Then **Jiǎ’s wood** receives **jade fluid** and transmits nourishment.
When **Jiǎ** is nourished, **liver-wood** is born,
And **liver-wood** transmits to the **heart**—
At this point, **heart-fire** reigns.
Thus, when **jade fluid** transmits to **Wǔ** and stirs **heart-fire**,
It transforms into **blood**—
This is the **yang Dragon**.

Practicing the **Wǔ** method, they pause at **Wèi**—
**Wèi-Shēn** is the **southwestern bundling** hexagram,
Both residing in the **Kūn** palace,
Their energies balanced, transmission swift.

At **Wèi**, the **true elixir** gathers in the **golden crucible**,
Then the nasal breath enters more than it exits,
Consolidating **true fire** in the **spleen-earth**.
Once **true fire** transmits and nourishes **spleen-earth**,
Then **Gēng’s metal** receives **spleen-earth** and transmits nourishment.
When **Gēng** is nourished, **lung-metal** is born,
And **lung-metal** transmits to the **kidneys**—
At this point, **kidney-water** reigns.
Thus, **heart-blood** transmits to **Zǐ** and stirs **yin-qi**,
Transforming into **essence**—
This is the **yin Tiger**.

Therefore, **Tàibái Zhēnrén** sings:
*"Five Phases inverted in technique,
Dragon emerges wrapped in fire,
Yin and yang move out of sequence,
Tiger is born within water."*

Master Lü says:
*"The yang Dragon returns to emerge from the Lí palace,
The yin Tiger remains born from the Kǎn position."*

The *Tàishàng Nèirìyuè Jīng* states:
*"Original qi enters the heart and transforms into blood.
Blood is the source of essence, the mother of spirit—
When it flows into the yin of the kidney palace, it transforms into essence."*

Truly, the mystery of **refining Jiǎ-Gēng to birth Dragon and Tiger**
Fundamentally lies in **Chǒu-Wèi**!

Yet **spiritual water** descending to the **Huápó** is called **jade fluid**,
And practicing **swallowing at Chǒu**—
How is this verified?

The *Língbǎo Dàoyào* says:
*"Gazing eastward toward Fúsāng at dawn,
Raising the body before sunrise,
Gradually passing the double-story tower,
Galloping the celestial steed repeatedly,
The universe’s youth—
Halting at Yángzhōu."*

**Gèn** is the **youth**.
**Yángzhōu** is the land of **Chǒu**.
I observe the celestial patterns—
**Chǒu** above connects to the **Xīngjì**’s entanglement,
Residing in the **Dòu-Niú-Nǚ** constellations,
Below, it corresponds to the land of **Yángzhōu**.

Zhang Ping-shu’s poem says:
*"The golden tripod holds no cinnabar-wrapped mercury,
The jade pool first descends silver into the water—*
Thus, the practice of swallowing at **Chǒu** is made clear.

Yet when **liquid-blood** gathers in the golden tripod, it is called **true medicine**,
And practicing **nurturing fire** at **Wèi**—
How is this verified?

The *Língbǎo Dàoyào* says:
*"To gather medicine, rely on the **Jade Rabbit**,
To consummate the union, it must be at **Huángpó**,
Awaiting **Yōngzhōu** to meet—
Presenting a *Yánggē* song in tribute.*

Again it says:
*"Why does the southwest fire enter **Yōngzhōu**?"*

The **Jade Rabbit** is the **metallic essence**;
**Huángpó** is the **spleen-earth**.
Its position is **Kūn’s southwest**.
**Yōngzhōu** is the land of **Wèi**.
I observe the celestial patterns—
**Wèi** above connects to the **Quánshǒu’s** entanglement,
Residing in the **Jǐng-Gǔi-Liǔ** constellations,
Below, it corresponds to the land of **Yōngzhōu**.

Zhang Ping-shu’s poem says:
*"To know the birthplace of the medicine’s stream,
Look only to the southwest—its native land."*
Thus, the practice of nurturing fire at **Wèi** is made clear.

Truly, the mystery of **refining Jiǎ-Gēng to birth Dragon and Tiger**
Lies in its alchemical completion—
And its fruition is realized at **Zǐ-Wǔ**.

To practice the **Zǐ-Wǔ** method while unaware of this critical principle—
How could one ever achieve transformation?

Though the enlightened cultivate through gradual refinement,
Unlocking the **passages**—
It is not achieved in a single day.

To penetrate the **subtle mysteries** and exchange the **common body**,
One’s awakening must have its cause.

I have weighed its truth and say:
*"Channel the **River Vehicle’s** pure *qi*,
Declare at the **Tail** and **Hearth**, between the **Spine’s** ribs,
Pierce the **Jade Capital**,
Harmonize the **Two Substances**,
At the **Mudball**, return to the **Great Elixir**,
At the **Elixir**, seize the **Creative Power’s** authority—
Thus attaining the **Way of Eternal Life**—
It is nothing but refining **Jiǎ-Gēng**,
Is it not profound?"

---
*End of Volume Seven of the Dao Gun*
