*Volume Eight of the Dao Gun*
*Collected by the wandering scholar Zēng Cù*

**Kunlun Chapter**
At the peak of Kunlun stands the **Mudball**—
The abode of a hundred deities, the gate of ascent.
The Wandering Scholar says: *"I was taught by the Most High that the Dao is One alone.
Is this the True One you speak of?"*
The *Huángtíng Scripture* declares: *"If you wish not to die, cultivate Kunlun."*
For Kunlun is the Mudball—
Like heaven itself.
When yin does not ascend and yang does not descend, it is bound to the world—
Unable to create and transform.
In the human body, it cannot circulate without end,
Nor flow in harmony with Heaven and Earth.
Thus it is said: *"The upward path—no thousand sages dare transmit it.*
Only my True One suffices."*

Master Huán Kǎi once received the Dao from the Immortal Lord Lǐ Huán,
And took *Huán* as his surname.
The Immortal Lord said: *"External elixirs, flying steps, hidden forms,
The interplay of Kǎn and Lí—you have mastered these all,
Yet you have not heard the Great Dao.
He who silently worships the Most High
Opens the gate of ascent—
Only then may he transcend the Land of Eternal Day,
And return to the Elixir of Immortal Souls.
The Jade Spring issues from Kunlun’s mountain,
The Golden Elixir from the Realm of Sun and Moon.
Its mountain—though but a span in height,
A handful in breadth—
Houses the Three Sovereigns,
The abode of a hundred deities.
To grasp this method, to worship the True Ten Thousand times,
With pure practice complete—
Ascend to the Purple Clouds,
All within the span of an inch.

Between the brows lies the Gate of Divine Light,
The Jade Gate and Golden Pillars converse yet remain sealed—
Only by attaining the Secret Words and Sacred Texts may one arrive.

Within the body dwell thirty-six thousand luminous spirits,
Twelve thousand sovereigns of soul and shadow,
And in the Mudball, the Great Sovereign of Immortal Life.
The Two Principles, Four Symbols, Eight Trigrams, Nine Officials,
The Square Inch and the Hollow Gourd—
All are complete, none lacking.
Beneath Kunlun, the Sun and Moon flow,
Their radiance scattering in the Golden Pool.
Gold corresponds internally to the lungs,
The lungs externally to the nose;
Wood corresponds internally to the liver,
The liver externally to the eyes.
When the eyes follow the five colors, they grow blind;
When the nose pursues the five scents, it becomes clogged.
Gold and Wood divided, the radiance flees the outer gate,
The Divine Pearl scatters—
Thus does one reach death.

But he who reverses the Sun and Moon’s brilliance,
Illuminating the Kunlun of the Supreme Ultimate—
What Dao is this?
My left and right eyes are the Sun and Moon.
When they shine through the twelve hours,
The Celestial Gate opens,
True Immortals arrive, and one returns to childlike purity.
In three years, the Yellow Cloud forms;
In a thousand days, the Sacred Embryo is complete;
In nine years, one ascends the Golden Gate;
In twelve years, the Three Platforms.
Thus, the Dragon and Tiger naturally unite.
The Most High rests upon the Golden Terrace,
All deities long to gaze upon the Celestial Tablet.

The Immortal Lord then instructed Kǎi:
*"You have received the Sacred Texts.
Let your heart be as dead ashes.
After twelve years of practice,
You shall ascend the Immortal Ladder—
White Light arises from the Rounded Form,
Purple Qi surges through the Clouds,
And your lifespan shall match that of Heaven and Earth."*
Kǎi bowed in reception.

The Immortal Lord further expounded:
*"Internal illumination returns the Soul-Light,
The Supreme One embraces True Fragrance,
Perfume drifts through the Valley of Flowers,
Lush grows the Purple Chamber,
The Celestial Gate opens to the Azure Expanse—
Silently worship the Jade Emperor,
And know that the Soul-Light shines within,
The inner realm clear and bright.
I observe the symbol of Zhú Qián—
A white crown emerging from the Rounded Light,
Seated upon a Treasure Lotus—
Thus, the Dao is complete.
Buddha and Lao are not so different."*

**Chapter on Nourishing Qi**
Strengthen with grain, refine with *qi*;
Strength brings decay, *qi* brings eternal life.
The Wandering Scholar says: *"Man draws upon Heaven and Earth’s primordial *qi* to live,
Thus inhalation and exhalation correspond within and without.
The Six *Qi* govern the five viscera,
The remaining *qi* envelops the Triple Burner.
If one masters this *qi*,
In one year, *qi* flows freely;
In two years, *qi* circulates;
In three years, *qi* condenses into the Mysterious Pearl.
*Qi* is the Dao;
The Dao is emptiness;
Emptiness is spontaneity;
Spontaneity is non-action;
Non-action is the mind.
When the mind does not move—why?
For if the inner mind does not stir, the outer world does not enter;
If inner and outer are tranquil, the spirit harmonizes;
If the spirit harmonizes, *qi* harmonizes;
If *qi* harmonizes, primordial *qi* naturally replenishes;
If primordial *qi* replenishes, the five viscera are nourished;
If the five viscera are nourished, the hundred vessels flow;
If the hundred vessels flow, the fluids ascend;
If the fluids ascend, the five tastes vanish,
Hunger and thirst cease—
Thus does one reverse aging and return to youth.

At first, *qi* transforms into blood,
Blood into essence,
Essence into spirit.
In one year, *qi* renews;
In two years, blood renews;
In three years, the vessels renew;
In four years, flesh renews;
In five years, marrow renews;
In six years, sinews renew;
In seven years, bones renew;
In eight years, hair renews;
In nine years, form renews.
Thirty-six thousand spirits dwell within the body,
Transformed into an Immortal.

The spirit is the most refined, formless essence.
Thus, the spirit draws from the Dao,
In stillness aligning with nature;
Man draws from the spirit,
In motion aligning with emotion.
Hence, following nature, the spirit condenses;
Prolonged, the spirit stirs;
Extreme, the spirit departs;
Stirring brings life;
Departure brings death—
All moved by emotion, not by the spirit’s will.

The practitioner of *qi*-nourishment,
With a single thought, lifts the spirit beyond the Three Realms,
Descends to Kunlun’s Hill,
Enters the Vermilion Palace,
Pierces the Gushing Spring,
Causing primordial *qi* to revolve endlessly.
The *Scripture* says: *"When primordial *qi* flows freely, the Dao of Non-Death is attained."*

**Chapter on Nourishing Mist**
The essence of Heaven and Earth disperses as mist;
Feeding upon its refined essence,
The form may be preserved.

**Chapter on Binding Mist: The Instruction of Lady Yufu**

Lady Yufu of the Bound Sashes once told Zhang Weizi: *"I possess a method for nourishing mist."* Weizi replied: *"May I humbly inquire what you mean?"* Lady Yufu said: *"Mist is the refined essence of mountains and marshes, the overflowing *qi* of metals and stones. Prolonged practice can dissolve the form and merge it with emptiness, uniting with clouds in substance."*

Weizi said: *"May I humbly ask for the method?"* Lady Yufu replied: *"At the very beginning of dawn, I sit or lie as I please. First, I close my eyes, then internally observe the Five *Zàng*-organs. Afterward, I exhale *qi* through my mouth twenty-four times, until I perceive the Five-Colored *qi* swirling above my *chǐzhái* [cubic inch of space], drawn into the Jade Pool within me fifty times. I swallow the saliva likewise. Then, I pray:

*'The Great Sun shines forth,
Clouds and mists scatter in four directions.
*Qi* condenses, curving and coiling,
Five-Colored *qi* fills the Celestial Caverns.
The spirit and *qi* harmonize, opening in union,
Refining the true essence of metals and stones.
The fragrant *qi* fills the purple void,
Cultivating the form to preserve it whole.
Emerging from the hidden, concealed in the profound,
The Five Spirits dissolve and transform.
Uniting with the luminous, fanning the numinous,
At the right moment, ascending on the Six Clouds.
Gathering and containing my body,
I rise to the Nine Heavens.'*

Having finished, I again grind my teeth seven times, swallow the saliva seven times. Prolonged and steady practice enables one to ride upon clouds and mists and depart."*

**Chapter on Inner Vision**
Within the one body,
There exists a spirit overseeing it;
The heart at peace, the spirit tranquil,
Then the form does not decay.

Master Liangqiuzi said: *"The Yellow Court refers to the brain, the heart, and the spleen."* The *Scripture* says: *"The Heart-strings dance in triple layers, refining the Heavenly Embryo."* Why is this so?

The *Scripture* says: *"Qín, harmony; dié, accumulation. Preserve the Three Dantian, making harmony and accumulation as one. Tái xiān (the Heavenly Embryo) is tái xī (Embryonic Breathing)—like the embryo in the womb, having qi but no breath."*

The *Scripture* says: *"Seven dishes of jade keys seal the two gates. Why? The seven orifices open and close like gates and keys; used in accordance with the Dao, they are not opened recklessly."* The two gates are the eyes when storing spirit and closing them.

The *Scripture* says: *"Layer upon layer, the Golden Pass sealed, the pivot mechanism hidden. Why? Guard the spirit and essence without dissipation."*

The *Scripture* says: *"The Soul’s Platform steadfast, never exhausted. Why? The heart is the Soul’s Platform. If divine spirit resides within it, stillness preserves unity, movement stores spirit—when spirit is whole, the body is at ease, thus never exhausted."*

The *Scripture* says: *"The Central Peak of Heaven, refined with meticulous care. Why? The Central Peak of Heaven is the nose. Counting and pressing its left and right sides balances the qi—this is called irrigating the Central Peak."*

The *Scripture* says: *"Within the dwelling, there is true clothing of cinnabar. If one can truly see it, there will be no illness. Why? The Master of Original Yang said: ‘If one constantly preserves the heart-spirit, there will be no sickness.’"*

The *Scripture* says: *"Obscured and dense, the Dao-smoke governs purity and turbidity. Why? Obscured and dense is the wood symbol. Fire brings forth smoke, yang brings forth clear qi—clearness brings bright eyes, turbidity brings dimness."*

The *Scripture* says: *"The Palace of the Heart contains a lotus bearing flowers, governing the harmonious balance of cold and heat, nourishing and defense. Why? Cold and heat are the static and agitated qi of yin and yang. When one maintains harmony, nourishing and defense flow through the body—just as Laozi said: ‘Agitation overcomes cold, stillness overcomes heat; purity and tranquility are the true essence of the world.’"*

The *Scripture* says: *"Externally, the mouth and tongue emit the Five Flowers; at the brink of death, calling them brings revival. Why? The heart governs the mouth and tongue, inhaling and exhaling the essences of the Five Zang, distinguishing the flavors of the Five Phases. When illness arises, one must preserve the Cinnabar Field, summoning a child in red robe and crimson cap to rescue."*

The *Scripture* says: *"The Palace of the Liver is wrapped in emerald layers, governing the opening of all gates and the clarity of perception. Why? The origin of Green Yang begins with the eyes—the gates and mirrors of the Five Phases."*

The *Scripture* says: *"Gather the soul, return the spirit—eternally unshaken. Why? On the third, thirteenth, and twenty-third days of the moon, the three souls wander outside as corpses. To retrieve them, one must gaze upward, remove the pillow, stretch the feet, clasp the hands over the heart, close the eyes, hold the breath three times, and tap the teeth three times. Then, storing the heart, a red qi like a parrot emerges from within at the throat. As the red qi grows larger, it envelops the body and transforms into fire, burning the body. Upon awakening, the body feels smaller, and if hot, one calls the names of the three souls: *Shuangling, Taiguang, Youjing*, and whispers: *‘The Celestial Micro Palace, the Central Yellow Beginning with Green. Refining the three souls, Taiguang is at peace. The Divine Treasure Chamber, rebirth with me. Do not move recklessly; the Overseer is the Most Spiritual. If you wish to fly, ascend to Shangqing. If hungry or thirsty, drink the Jade Elixir.’*

On the new moon, full moon, and dark moon, the seven po (spirits) wander. One must sleep on the back, stretch the feet, cover the ears with the palms so the fingers meet at the neck, hold the breath seven times, tap the teeth seven times, and store the heart at the nose-tip. A white qi as large as a bean appears, gradually expanding into nine layers over the body. The qi suddenly forms two Azure Dragons in the eyebrows, a White Tiger on either side of the nose, a Vermilion Bird above the heart, and a Spirit Serpent beneath the left foot. Two jade maidens in brocade robes, each holding a flame, stand at the ear gates. Afterward, swallow saliva seven times, calling the names of the seven po: *‘Shīgǒu, Fúshǐ, Qiǎoyīn, Tūnzéi, Fēidú, Yīnhuì, Chòufèi,’* and chant: *‘Pure qi returns nine times, subduing the rogue po. Heavenly Huntsman guards the gate, the maiden holds the key. Refining the soul and softening it, let it dwell with me in peace. Do not move recklessly; observe the form and face. If hungry or thirsty, drink the Elixir of Sun and Moon.’"*

The *Scripture* says: *"The Palace of the Kidneys is the Mysterious Gate, round and vast, containing a youthful True One of Upper Mysteriousness, governing the Six Palaces and the source of the Nine Fluids, externally manifesting as the green essence of the two ears. Why? Upper Mysteriousness is the heart. Its qi connects with the kidneys, so the Five Zang, Six Fu, and Nine Fluids intermingle, and the hundred vessels flow—none can be neglected. The Nine Fluids are the essences of the nine orifices. The Kidney Palace governs the ears; if its qi weakens, yin invades yang, but harmony ensures the hundred vessels and fluids flow freely. When kidney qi is abundant, the ears and eyes are sharp, and yang does not decline."*

The *Scripture* says: *"The two Water Kings face the Gate of Life, granting longevity and ascent to the Nine Heavens. Why? The Master of Original Yang said: *‘Cold and heat spur each other; male and female complete each other. The left kidney, male, bears the sun; the right kidney, female, bears the moon. The Water King then transforms into a赤子 (Red Child), who becomes a True Person and ascends to the Nine Heavens.’* The Nine Heavens are the Nine Blacks—Green Heaven’s qi governs life."*

The *Scripture* says: *"Swallowing and rinsing the Golden Elixir, consuming the Jade Flower, thus attaining immortality and the demise of the Three Worms. Why? The Golden Elixir and Jade Flower are the mouth’s essences. Within the heart’s stomach-mouth stands a naked infant girl named *Jiè*, standing upright in the stomach passage, opening her mouth to receive the spirit essence, inhaling the Five Qi. When the mouth is filled with inner and outer essences, swallow them fully into the mouth of the Mysterious Maiden. After five repetitions, tap the teeth three times and swallow saliva nine times—thus the Three Worms perish."*

*The Scripture says:*

*"Always remember the Three Chambers are interconnected—
preserve and rinse the Five Teeth to banish hunger and thirst.
Why? The Bright Hall, the Cavern Chamber, and the Elixir Field—
three threes make nine, and nine merge into one.
The Five Teeth are the generative *qi* of the Five Phases.
On the first day of spring at the crowing of the rooster,
enter the chamber facing east, bow nine times, and sit upright.
Tap the teeth nine times, then meditate on the Nine-Thousand-Myriad-People
descending—*Yuan Shi* Old Lord *Jiu Qing* in his Green-Ling *Yuan Shi* glory,
his form shrouded in mist like clouds within the room.
Let him enter through your mouth, descending straight to the liver.
Recite:
*'Nine *qi* of Green Heaven,
Yuan Shi of the Upper Clarity,
Sovereign Old Lord, divine and august,
clad in green robes,
commanding celestial officials,
radiant as the Morning Star,
scattering brilliance, perfuming virtue,
nourishing my form—
I consume the morning dew,
drawing the essence of wood,
thus nourishing the Green Teeth,
securing them in the spirit—
the liver’s palace swells with fullness,
jade sprouts of their own accord,
extending years, preserving youth,
my face like that of a child.
The Five *qi* blend harmoniously,
Heaven and Earth eternally united.'*

When the incantation is complete,
draw the Green *qi* inward nine times and cease.

*The Scripture says:*
*'The clouds of the Five Peaks rise in Peng-Heng splendor,
moistening the Jade Nostril to repay itself.
The Jade Nostril—this is the nose.
The Five Forms remain round and firm, free from calamity.
Why? The *qi* of the Five Peaks is the *qi* of the Five Viscera.
If unobstructed and flowing, the Three Worms perish on their own.
Entering and exiting through the Mysterious Female,
endless and unbroken—
thus, preserving and refining, the Dao is complete.
The Empty Chamber births White,
the Five Viscera grow firm and round—
then sickness cannot take root.

*The Scripture says:*
*'The Five Spirits light the night with eightfold brilliance.
Why? The Five Spirits are the Five Stars,
arrayed across the body.
If always preserved, one becomes one with Heaven and Earth.

*The Scripture says:*
*'Within the square inch, ponder the Deeply Hidden.
Why?'*

The square inch is called the Lower Pass,
located three inches below the navel,
its breadth and depth one inch—
here the Essence is stored.
Square when still, round when moving,
neither motionless nor restless—
only block and seal it, never let it leak.

*The Scripture says:*
*"Within, embrace the sun and moon, the constellations arrayed,
the Seven Luminaries and Nine Celestial Ones crowned at the Gate of Birth.
Why?*

At the hour of *zi* (子),
store the heart in the Western Tai Bai Star,
between the eyebrows, straight inward one inch—
this is the Jade Hall, the Purple Gate,
with the Sun to the left and Moon to the right.

Next, store the Northern Chen Star
in the Imperial Homeland, the Mysterious Palace—
the Mysterious Palace is five *fen* at the hairline,
straight inward one inch.

Next, store the Eastern Sui Star
in the Cavern Gate, the Vermilion Terrace—
the Vermilion Terrace is behind the eyes,
straight inward one inch.

Next, store the Southern Yinghuo Star
in the Jade Gate, the Flowery Square—
the Flowery Square is five *fen* from the outer corner of the eye,
straight inward five *fen*.

Next, store the Central Zhen Star
in the Golden Chamber, the Long Valley—
the Long Valley is at the philtrum,
straight inward two *fen*.

Store them as if suspended above,
knocking the teeth five times,
swallowing saliva five times.

Whisper softly:
*"High and lofty Purple Gate,
within five spirits reside.
Jewelous brilliance spreads its light,
radiant beams burst through the Gate—
Essence-qi accumulates and grows,
transforming into the Old Man,
wearing a headband, white robes, green cloak, crimson skirt,
right sash with jingling bells, left sash with tiger guards,
holding Heaven’s Rigor, scattering crimson stars,
stepping on the Flowery Canopy,
spitting radiance to refine the spirit—
preserve the Three Scenes,
grant me this body,
nurture the soul, subdue the soul-spirit,
ascend on the Phoenix to become immortal."*

Thus, the Seven Luminaries are the Seven Stars,
paired with the seven orifices.
The Nine Heavens are the Nine Celestial Ones,
paired with the nine orifices—
none may be neglected.

*The Scripture says:*
*"When qi is lost and fluids leak, the form is not your own.
Seal within, govern the light—only then comes lasting peace.
Why?*

Close the chamber, refine the qi,
neither spit far nor speak much,
restrain emotions and desires,
store the light of sun and moon.

The Upper Clarity has the method of *Adopting the Flying Root*,
always at dawn facing east, knocking the teeth nine times.

Whisper in the dark:
*"Day-Soul Pearl-Light,
illuminating the Green Jade,
twisting crimson clouds, the Red Boy,
dark flames chanting the Symbol."*

Then, close the eyes and grasp firmly,
store the five colors of flowing clouds,
all entering the mouth—
this is *Adopting the Flying Root of the Sun*.

Thus, facing the sun, swallow the clouds forty-five times,
swallow saliva nine times in succession.

*The Scripture says:*
*"The Five Phases urge each other, returning to One,
three and five combine—qi of the ninefold nodes.
Why?*

The Five Phases generate and conquer in cycles,
their urging returns to One.
One is the number of Water—
the origin of the Five Phases, the root of all things.

Laozi said:
*The Dao gives birth to One,
One gives birth to Two,
Two gives birth to Three,
Three gives birth to all things.*

The *Yijing* speaks of the Supreme Ultimate,
which gives birth to the Two Principles.
The Supreme Ultimate is One—
One is the name of the Primordial.
All things are formed from it,
thus they return to One.

Three refers to the ears, nose, and mouth in man.
Five refers to the Emperor’s Essence.
Thus, three and five combine—
three threes make nine.

Three and five are the roots of Heaven and Earth,
the pivotal convergence of the six directions,
the rhythmic nodes of the Nine Palaces.
The Three Primordial qi,
the mixed Essence of creation,
entering and exiting the Palaces of Upper Clarity and Great Purity—
if one preserves and reflects upon them,
the Dao of longevity is attained.

*The Scripture says:*
*"Ascend swiftly to the Dao of sun and moon above.
Why?"*

There is a method of ingesting the Moon’s essence.
When the moon rises in the west, strike your teeth ten times,
then softly invoke the names of the Five Moon Ladies—
*"Moon Arc, Radiant and Veiled,
Graceful Void, Sacred Orchid,
Luminous Jade, Pure Gold,
Stately and Resplendent"*—
and pray:

*"Moon Arc, resplendent and veiled,
Fragrant and luminous, subtle and clear,
Graceful in the void, sacred orchid,
Lush blossoms clustered like cranes,
Pure gold, clear glow,
Stately bearing, marked by virtue."*

Then close your eyes and clench your fists,
concentrating as the moon’s five-colored radiance
enters your mouth as a unified light.
Within that light, a yellow *qi* appears,
large as a pupil—
this is the *Flying Yellow Moon Essence* within the Jade Embryo.
To cultivate it is to make *Yùyí* chase the sun,
and *Jiélín* chase the moon,
harmonizing voices and seeking matching *qi*.

*The Scripture says:*
*"The Primordial Dao refines the upper and lower soul-spirit,
and in one act, the transformation is complete.
Why?"*

Use One to refine the spirit,
and refine the spirit to merge with One.
One is the name of *wuwei*—
its essence is tranquil and obtained without sight,
guarding the True with full intent, returning to the self.

*The Scripture says:*
*"Condense the pearl, secure the essence, nourish the spirit-root.
Why?"*

The *condensed pearl* refers to saliva rising and falling like beads,
while *securing the essence* means not letting it leak.
The *spirit-root* is the physical form.

*The Scripture says:*
*"Whether seated or rising, we share the rafters,
day and night, shining like the sun, then hidden at dusk.
Circulate the flower-essence to balance yin and yang.
Why?"*

The spirit uses the body as its dwelling—
this is its rafters.
The mind’s focus aligns with the eyes.
The *flower-essence* is the eye-essence.
When the heart opens, the eyes open,
day as sun, night as moon—
thus it balances yin and yang.

*The Scripture says:*
*"Loosen the hair, desireless, to endure eternally,
all five flavors return as pure *qi*.
Why?"*

The *embryonic breathing* method:
lie back, hair unbound, raise the head two inches and two *fen*,
curl both thumbs, clench fists, close eyes,
extend arms five *cùn* from the body,
rinse the mouth fully, swallow saliva three times,
then gently inhale through the nose for five or six breaths,
exhaling.
One inhalation and exhalation is one breath.
After ten exhalations, a groan may emerge;
after groaning, repeat.
Forty-nine breaths complete one cycle—
one cycle is seven days.

*Loosening the hair* means *wuwei*, desireless,
as the spirit condenses and the fluids flow,
the Primordial *qi* enters the viscera,
forming the five flavors, all arriving together.
Unified into One, they become still and clear.

*Exterior Radiance Chapter*

「The jade *yin* and golden *yang* lock within—
to fortify the inner essence.

Alone nourishing the *Tàihé* (Great Harmony) *qi*,
one may attain immortality.

The *Scripture* says:
Above is the Yellow Court, below the *Guānyuán* (Cradle of Primordial *Qi*).
Why is it One?

The Yellow Court lies within the head,
its *Míngtáng* (Bright Hall), *Dòngfáng* (Cavern Chamber), and *Dānyī* (Elixir Field) are thus named.
Two *cùn* behind the eyebrows is the Bright Hall,
two *cùn* further in is the Cavern Chamber,
three *cùn* deeper is the Elixir Field.
These three are the Upper Primordial’s essence—**One**.

The Yellow Court is split into two halves,
forming the Cavern Chamber.
Within its center grows the Red *Yīzi* (Embryonic Breath),
thus becoming **One**.
If one constantly contemplates this without error,
the Red *Yīzi* transforms into the True Person within the Bright Hall.
Hence, the One is within the Bright Hall.

Guiding and directing *qi*,
closing the eyes to gaze inward,
calming the mind and steadying the will—
the chaotic void knows no bounds.
Focus to let one’s refined essence ascend,
flowing to the *Níwán* (Brain of Mud).

Within the Bright Hall are the Sovereign and Minister,
within the Cavern Chamber are Father and Mother,
within the Elixir Field are Husband and Wife.

Some say:
The Yellow Court is the spleen.
Its cultivation lies three *cùn* below the *Zhōngguānyuán* (Middle Cradle),
where the *Yuányáng* (Primordial Yang) Gate is found before it.
The suspended essence shines like a mirror,
illuminating the entire body—
this is the Dao.

The *Scripture* says:
Behind lies the *Yōuyè* (Dark Gate), before the *Mìngmén* (Life Gate).
The Breathing Lodge’s *qi* enters the Elixir Field,
the Jade Pool’s clear waters nourish the Lingering Root.
Why?

The Dark Gate refers to the two kidneys,
shaped like an inverted cup,
three *cùn* below the navel,
small at the top and broad at the bottom,
bearing the Sun and Moon.

The Life Gate lies below the navel.
The Breathing Lodge’s *qi*—
when exhaling, it is *hū* (Breath Out),
when inhaling, it is *xī* (Breath In).
The Lodge is the nose—
the critical passage for expelling the old and drawing in the new.

The eyebrows’ *qi* retreats three *cùn*—
this is the Elixir Palace.
The Jade Pool’s clear waters are the mouth’s saliva.
The Lingering Root is the tongue.
To constantly refine the teeth and rinse the saliva,
one may irrigate the root of the tongue.

The *Scripture* says:
The Three Yang’s exterior origins come from the divine—
the Three Yang grant longevity.
Why?

Eight for men, seven for women—
these are the Three Radiance’s cycles.
Inner cultivation begins here,
aligning with the sun and moon,
preserving the heavens and earth.

The Three Yang’s Embryonic Breath is born,
one divine spirit of *hún* (ethereal soul) and *pò* (corporeal soul) enters the womb,
the nose draws the Yang *qi* inward for nurturing.

The Red *Yīzi*, True Person, and Embryonic Breath—
these are the Three *Yīn*, the so-called One *Yīn* Spirit.

*Hún* is Yang;
*Pò* is *Yīn*.
Those without virtue and power in this world
will see their *hún* and *pò* scatter and depart.

Yet if one restrains the ethereal soul
and governs the corporeal soul,
keeping them from straying,
ever within the body,
then one’s Dao harmonizes with Nature.

The *Scripture* says:
The *Yóuqí* (Wandering Pearl) and suspended *Zhū* (Jewel)
return to their source—
the jade *yin* and golden *yang* lock within,
the body becomes firm and whole.
Why?

The Wandering Pearl revolves and turns,
the *qi* and meridians flow without ceasing.
Closing the mouth to preserve the spirit,
rinse the *Lìquán* (Nectar Spring) like flowing pearls.
*Yīn* is the *yin* (female),
Yang is the *yang* (male);
when neither harms the other,
the mouth attains harmony,
refining essence and transforming form—
thus one attains firmness and wholeness.

The *Scripture* says:
The tortoise mirrors the four seasons,
its essence transforms like the elixir.
Bending forward and backward, each has its own gate—
sending the elixir and *Xuánduàn* (Mysterious Spring) to the tortoise,
drawing *qi* to the Lingering Root.
Why?

The Bright Hall’s four pathways correspond to the four seasons,
where the True Person’s elixir resides.
Chewing its *qi*,
if one contemplates it, then longevity knows no end.

Head and feet,
kidneys and heart—
the heart is red, the kidneys black,
both rooted in the same origin.
Water and fire counterbalance each other,
hence the differing gates.

The elixir is blood.
When transformed into the Lower Primordial,
it becomes white essence.
At this moment, draw in the nose to return it,
ascending to the *Níwán*,
descending to the mouth,
changing into the Jade Spring,
then with the nose draw *qi* to the tongue’s root.
Swallowing and sending it to the abdomen,
a thunderous resonance answers—
this is the True *Qi* acting thus.

The *Scripture* says:
Alone consuming the *Tàihé* (Great Harmony) *Yīn-Yáng Qi*,
thus one may not die—
the celestial correspondence is complete.
Why?

Mortal men consume the earth’s refined essence,
rewarding the earth with death.
The Sage consumes the *Yuánhé* (Primordial Harmony) *Qi*,
rewarding the heavens with transcendence.
Thus, the student of immortality
feasts on Yang *Qi* in the morning,
feasts on *Yīn Qi* in the evening,
and when both are united,
one may not die.

The *Scripture* says:
The Dao sustains my divine spirit,
the luminous light of *hún* and *pò*.
By day, it shines resplendent,
by night, it guards itself.
Thirst yields to nectar,
hunger finds fulfillment.
Why?

Contemplate the heart’s red *Qi*,
illuminating all spirits with clarity.
Guard the light of the sun and moon,
ponder the kidneys’ roots.
By day, guard the light;
by night, guard the spirit.
When hungry, consume Nature’s *Qi*;
when thirsty, drink the *Huápóu* (Flower Pond) nectar—
then one will know no hunger nor thirst,
and attain longevity.

The *Scripture* says:
Pass through the Six Palaces and Five Storehouses,
*zǎo* (morning) and *yǒu* (evening)—
the Yang’s essence is hidden within the Nine.
Why?

The roots grow from the Six Palaces,
hidden within *zǎo* (morning) and *yǒu* (evening).
Their subtleties are profound—
Yang reverses to belong to *Yīn*,
turning to align with its counterpart,
returning to be hidden within the Nine.

The Nine is the head—
this is the saying: *Left Three, Right Seven, Wear Nine and Tread One*.
At the time of *yīngwū* (parrot-like breath),
lie back, hair unbound,
refine the teeth thirty-six times,
swallow essence and gulp *qi*—
this is the path to distance death.

The *Scripture* says:
The liver’s *Qi* is refined and prolonged,
arrayed across the Five Storehouses to generate the Three Radiance.
Above, it unites with the Three *Jiāo* (Burners),
the Dao drinks the Flower Pond nectar.
Why?

Refined *Qi* ascends to the head,
supplementing the *Níwán*.
The Five Palaces and Six Palaces each have their own master,
hence the kidneys’ upper and lower bear the Sun, Moon, and Three Radiance.

The Three Radiance are the Sun, Moon, and stars.
The Three *Jiāo* are the Three Primordial Gates.
The nectar is the Flower Pond.

The *Scripture* says:
My divine spirit, *hún* and *pò*, reside in the center,
essence and fluids flow like springs,
departing from the nose’s fragrance,
standing at the *Xuányīng* (Mysterious Navel),
embracing the Bright Hall.
Why?

The central *hún* and *pò* are the two kidneys,
whose essence and fluids flow like springs,
departing from the nose’s fragrance—
this is the *Xuányīng* (Mysterious Navel),
where one stands to embrace the Bright Hall.»

The left *hún* and right *pò*,
by day the *hún* guards the *pò*,
by dusk the *pò* guards the *hún*—
restraining the *hún*, mastering the *pò*,
so they may not move or act arbitrarily.
When yin and yang merge,
the essence is lost and fluids leak,
then food becomes tasteless and the nose loses its fragrance.

The region beneath the tongue is the *Xuányīng* (Mysterious Navel).
The lungs are the Bright Hall.
If one contains and swallows the *Qi*,
it will irrigate the Bright Hall,
and flow throughout the body.

The *Scripture* says:
*"Nourish my essence and refine my fluids,
balance yin and yang,
and dwell at the Mysterious Gate,
awaiting the Heavenly Dao.*
Why?

This is the practice of storing essence and nurturing spirit—
embracing yin and containing yang,
to regulate one’s spirit and vital essence.

The Mysterious Gate is the nose.
Awaiting the spirit of the upper capital,
to guard the spirit and vital essence
and thereby preserve the body.

The *Scripture* says:
*'Empty and tranquil, without contrivance,
the spirit lingers and remains.
The vital essence ascends and descends,
passing through the Three Primordial Gates to regulate its functions.*
Why?

Within, one refines the Dao to achieve non-action;
without, one refines the Dao to achieve non-desire.
Thus the heart is not troubled or disordered,
and the spirit lingers and remains.

Essence is the spirit;
*Qi* is the Dao.
Preserving essence and conserving *Qi*,
the upper and lower each have their proper functions.
When essence is considered,
contemplate its ascent and descent,
to guard the singular spirit—
this is possible.

The *Scripture* says:
*'Returning past the Flower Pond,
stirring the kidney’s essence,
standing at the Bright Hall,
gazing upon the Elixir Field,
to command all spirits to open the Commanding Gate.*
Why?

It is the path from the brain’s chamber,
descending along the spine,
and entering the kidneys.

The eyebrows mark the return:
one inch inward is the Bright Hall,
three inches inward is the Elixir Field.

The nose is the Heavenly Root;
draw its true *Qi* continuously day and night—
this is possible.

The *Scripture* says:
*'Following the nose’s ascent and descent,
open the two ears,
and with eyes closed,
preserve the Child within
to regulate essence and refine fluids,
thus harmonizing the teeth.*
Why?

The Primordial *Qi* enters and exits through the nose,
ascending and descending to the two ears.

Heaven is the head;
Earth is the lower body.
The Child is the preservation of singular thought,
to guard the spirit.

Inhale the Five *Qi*,
polish the thirty-six teeth,
swallow the saliva thirty-six times,
and this can regulate the Mysterious White.

The *Scripture* says:
*'Nurture the灵 Root,
and it will not wither again.*
Why?

To nourish the tongue’s root
is to prevent its desiccation.
Beneath the tongue lies the *Lìquán* (Sweet Spring),
its flow like pearls,
always contain and swallow it—
do not spit it out recklessly.

The *Scripture* says:
*'Seal the Commanding Gate like the Jade Capital,
and life will extend beyond ten thousand years.
The spirit within the spleen roams the Middle Palace.*
Why?

Human life depends on essence and fluids;
always cherish and nourish them,
do not waste them recklessly,
then the essence congeals like jade,
dwelling in the lower body—
and this can ensure longevity.

The spleen is above the Great Granary,
by day it serves the Lord Lao to govern,
by night it roams the Bright Hall,
as the Lord of Great Unity.
The *Scripture* says:

*'Irrigate the blood vessels,
and sweat becomes nectar.*
Why?

The Five Palaces are in harmony,
and the sweat and fluids of hands and feet
are the signs of divine clarity.

The *Scripture* says:
*'Observe the Heavenly *Qi* above,
and one’s years will increase.*
Why?

To consume the Primordial *Qi*
makes the bones light,
and when *Qi* and spirit harmonize,
one’s lifespan will reach three hundred years.

The *Scripture* says:
*'Ingesting the Mysterious *Qi* can fulfill life,
returning past the Seven Gates,
to drink from the Great Spring.*
Why?

The Mysterious *Qi* is the white *Qi* between the two kidneys.
The Great Spring is the *Lìquán* (Sweet Spring) within the throat.

#1催: *Original text* reads 『推』.
#2精: *Original text* reads 『清』.

*(From Daoist Canon, Volume Nine of Dao Gunshu, compiled by Master Youzi Cangzhu.)*

**神景篇**

The Divine Landscape:
The *Taishan* (Great Mountain) Palace is the *yang* (male),
while the *Qi* lingers in the *yin* (female) chambers.
When their *qi* intermingles in harmony,
the spirit governs them as its chariot.

The *Tiangu* (Heavenly Valley) is the palace of the *Nihuan* (Mud Ball).
Above, it is crimson; below, it is dark and mysterious.
To the left, it is azure; to the right, it is white—
within, there shines a yellow,
the abode of the Primordial Spirit,
the most sacred essence of the True One.
This is our very nature,
while the heart serves as its function.

When the spirit is still, all transformations rest in peace;
when emotions stir, all transformations arise.
He who guards the One,
who guards the spirit—
then the spirit grows still,
and the True One dwells in Heaven.

The Upper *Yin* is the *Tuo* (Detachment).
Before the *Nihuan* lies the *Ziwu* (Purple Forbidden) position,
and before *Ziwu* lies the *Yuqing* (Jade Purity) position.
Below *Yuqing* lies the *Mingtang* (Bright Hall) position,
which descends through the nose.
The nose is the gate of the *yin*.

The Lower *Yin* is the heart.
Above the heart lies the *Yuquan* (Jade Spring) position,
and above *Yuquan* lies the *Taihuang* (Great Sovereign) position.
Above *Taihuang* lies the *Jinguang* (Golden Light) Court position,
and above *Jinguang* lies the *Huiquan* (Wisdom Spring) position.
Above *Huiquan* lies the *Wuling* (Five Spirits) Source position,
and above *Wuling* lies the *Lingquan* (Spirit Spring) position.
Passing *Tianyue* (Heavenly Luminaries),
it exits through the stomach’s mouth,
enters the *Jiudian* (Nine Ends),
and flows through the earth’s vital pathways
until it reaches its mouth and the ears—
the gate of the *yin*.

The spirit is the mother of *qi*,
while *qi* is the child of the spirit—
never to be separated, not for an instant.
When the spirit rests in the *yang* chambers,
the *qi* lingers in the *yin* halls.
Thus, the spirit governs below,
intermingling with *qi* in ascent and descent,
an unceasing flow of Nature’s Way.
Therefore, one must strive with utmost diligence.

To attain stillness within the marvelous,
and within stillness, to find the spirit—
then the Three Garments are complete,
while the Four Organs stand empty.
What are the Three Garments?
They are *nature*, *wisdom*, and *enlightenment*.
What are the Four Organs?
They are the eyes, the ears, the nose, and the tongue.
Nature is the spirit,
wisdom is its penetration,
enlightenment is its transformation.
The sage observes nature to generate the *dharma*—
the *dharma* is boundless.
Thus, transformation extends infinitely,
entering the realm of *wuwei* (non-action).
To act without knowing one acts—
the organs are empty,
the six dusts vanish,
and what need is there of the Six Bandits?
I purify the spirit, untainted by the myriad transformations,
its transcendent power ever-guarded.
How could it weary in use?
How could it grow weary in preservation?

The ordinary mind is empty yet not formless,
formful yet not empty—
the wondrous function of *wuwei*.

The Three Palaces are the ascending and descending heart and spleen.
The Two Gatherings are their pathways.
Above, they connect to the Heavenly Gate,
below, they reach the Earthly Door,
and within, they irrigate the Three Palaces.

The brain is dark above, crimson below,
white on the left, azure on the right—
within, there shines a yellow,
the true essence of the Three *Yin*,
the core of the *Tai Xuan* (Great Mystery).
Its external essence is called *Sao* (Searching),
its watery essence is the *Shengshe* (Remaining Serpent),
its name is the *Magician* of *Taisu* (Great Primordial).
It inhales and exhales true *qi*,
circulating through the meridians.

The lower heart is crimson above, dark below,
azure on the left, white on the right—
within, there shines a yellow,
the true essence of the Three *Yang*,
the core of *Taiyi* (Great One).
Its external essence is called *Mo* (Submergence),
its watery essence is the *Yuangui* (Tortoise),
its name is the *Magician* of *Tai Xuan* (Great Mystery).
It inhales and exhales true *qi*,
circulating through the meridians.

The spleen resides at the center,
as the hall where the Two *Qi* ascend and descend,
where spirit and *qi* intermingle.

If I guard the *Nihuan* and *Tiangu*,
its master governs two thousand seven hundred breaths.
When *qi* settles into ten cycles,
naturally, the heart’s *yang* and the brain’s *yang*
merge with the spleen.
Descending through the *Yucai* (Jade Vault),
passing the *Taicang* (Great Granary),
entering the *Weiwèn* (Tail Gate),
exiting through the heart,
ascending the Two Gatherings—
its form resembles a fire wheel.

The Primordial Spirit passes through *Shangqing* (Upper Purity),
travels through *Taishu* (Great Pivot),
crosses the *Lingdao* (Spirit Path),
enters the *Zhongmiao* (Central Temple),
proceeds through the *Naohu* (Brain Gate),
exits the *Fengfu* (Wind Palace),
transmits through the Two Gatherings—
spirit and *qi* intermingle,
and the hundred limbs,
the five forms,
burn like fire,
their essence surging like a gushing spring.

Thus, in observation,
the spirit does not enter the realm of form.
In vision, the spirit does not enter the realm of sound.
In scent, the spirit does not enter the realm of aroma.
I am serene and steadfast in stillness—
the Four Organs may be said to be empty.

The sage knows that emptiness is not empty,
that form is not form,
and thus attains wisdom here.

To know the unknown—who knows wisdom?
To see the unseen—who knows the marvel?
Thus, the nature beyond nature is called *he* (harmony),
the spirit beyond spirit is called *zhen* (true)—
this is the daily stillness.

He who, within stillness,
discerns the spirit beyond spirit,
the nature beyond nature—
nurtures the spirit and transforms nature,
and thus aligns with Heaven and Earth in duration,
harmonizing with *yin* and *yang* in movement.

---
**颐生篇**

According to the prescribed method,
derived from the *Xuance* (Mysterious Strategy),
it can prolong life
and dispel ailments.

The True Person said:
*"To nourish life, one must take non-harm as the foundation.
To advance the Dao, one must take illness-free as the priority.
I have obtained thirteen methods of tranquil ease.*

The divine person of *Shaoguang* Mountain is called *Jinmu* (Golden Mother),
who admonished the Yellow Emperor:
*'Few thoughts, few desires—
then sound and color will naturally fade away.'*

The *Tai Shang Jiao* (Supreme Teaching) True Person *Yin* said:
*'Empty the heart, weaken the will—
then spirit and *qi* will endure in eternal peace.'*

The True Person *Peng* (named *Gui Nian*):
*'I once suffered from eye ailments.
Day and night, I kept my eyes wide open to dispel the haze,
then closed them briefly before repeating.
Through persistent practice, even the finest hair could be discerned.'*

The True Person *Xu* (named *Jia*):
*'I once suffered from eye ailments.
Sitting upright in a darkened room,
I rotated my eyes in circles—
eighty-one times in total.
Then, with eyes narrowed and spirit gathered,
I rotated them endlessly.
With time, the divine light appeared,
like a golden wheel.'*

The True Person *Liu* (named *Wang*):
*'At times, I suffered from headaches,
as the wind-*qi* assailed from above.
Day and night, I bound my forehead with both hands,
opposing the *Tiancang* (Heavenly Granary) with my thumbs,
closed my breath, and directed *qi* to attack the head and eyes.
After resting my thumbs,
I allowed the *qi* to reach the crown—
then the wind dispersed with the *qi*."*

The True Person *Gě* (named *Zhēnren*):

*"When one suffers from headaches due to brain wind,*
*let them dwell in a secluded chamber,*
*quietly sit and close the breath,*
*cover their ears.*
*When the *qi* reaches its peak, release it.*
*Upon release, gently sway the head—*
*yet it does not cease.*
*The wind disperses, the pain subsides,*
*the eyes brighten, and the marrow is nourished."*

The True Person *Zhū* (named *Zhēnren*):

*"When *qi* is weak and the body frail,*
*excessive food causes stagnation.*
*Day and night, at the moment of stagnation,*
*sit cross-legged in quietude,*
*lift the body and drum the abdomen,*
*close the breath without pause,*
*then the six cavities empty,*
*and food is digested."*

The True Person *Yuán* (named *Gǔ*):

*"Before attaining immortality,*
*I fasted in an open valley,*
*consuming only herbs and trees.*
*Then, I drummed the abdomen to disperse the congealing of the five viscera,*
*closed the breath to gather the true *qi* of the Three Realms,*
*and, with internal visualization by fire,*
*swallowed my saliva,*
*receiving the true water within.*
*The *hóngwèi* and *guānshè* (vital and defensive *qi*) were pleased,*
*and the *qi* flowed harmoniously.*
*Thus, one may prolong life."*

The True Person *Zuǒ* (named *Cí*):

*"In old age, serving the Dao,*
*one is often harmed by wind.*
*Day and night, cross the left and right hands,*
*press the head against the earth,*
*and let the *qi* surge upward toward the Heavenly Pillar.*
*Then, sweat will flow profusely from the four limbs—*
*and it is done.*
*This can dispel epidemics,*
*brighten the eyes,*
*and guide the *qi*.*
*Constant practice brings harmony to the *qi*,*
*bright eyes,*
*softened skin,*
*and strong bones."*

The True Person *Wáng* (named *Lì*):

*"When feeling cold,*
*sit cross-legged in a secluded chamber.*
*With both hands, encircle the kidneys and close the breath,*
*press the head against the ritual vessel*
*for fifty-seven times.*
*Sweat will emerge from the four limbs,*
*and the cold will disperse.*
*Regular use harmonizes the *qi*,*
*brightens the eyes,*
*softens the skin,*
*and strengthens the bones."*

The True Person *Liú* (named *Kědào*):

*"Those dwelling in mountains,*
*when invaded by snow and frost,*
*suffer abdominal pain.*
*Sit in a sealed chamber,*
*with no thought or consideration,*
*internally visualize the abdomen,*
*and embrace the navel with cupped hands.*
*This can disperse cold *qi*
*and benefit the Original Yang."*

The True Person *Sūn* (named *Shǒuyī*):

*"For general abdominal pain with worms in the intestines,*
*ten times, gather the body and swallow the breath.*
*Embrace the navel and rub the hands a hundredfold,*
*repeat the rubbing,*
*and the pain will cease,*
*the worms will be expelled.*
*Regular use nourishes *qi* and invigorates the blood,*
*prolonging life."*

The True Person *Hào* (named *Xùn*):

*"Sit quietly in a sealed chamber,*
*stack the palms and cross the legs,*
*close the eyes and quiet the mind,*
*lift the body and concentrate the breath,*
*and internally observe where the illness originates.*
*Then, transmit *qi* from the heart.*
*Thus, a hundred ailments may be cured.*
*Constant practice can strengthen the steps,*
*and restore youth."*

The True Person *Yuán* (named *Shǒuyī* or *Yuánzhēn*):

*"Swallow and retain the hundred breaths,*
*without disturbance,*
*and the true water naturally ascends.*
*If one has an illness, use this method,*
*and the disease will be cured.*
*Regular use brings radiance to the skin.*
*Constant practice nourishes the flesh."*

The True Person *Yuán* (named *Sù*):

*"Close the breath and press the hips,*
*cutting off and returning the true *qi* to the Original Source.*
*This is the method of preservation and benefit.*
*With persistent practice,*
*one may prolong life*
*and solidify the body."*

The True Person *Cuī* (named *Déjī*):

*"Press the head and embrace the neck,*
*and the divine light will circulate.*
*Enter the Heavenly Palace,*
*and with time,*
*the face and eyes will clear,*
*the spirit and *qi* will harmonize."*

The True Person *Liú* (named *Hǎimán*):

*"Stack the fingers to close the Jade Gate,*
*and practice by retaining saliva,*
*preventing it from escaping.*
*This is called the Lock of the Golden Pass.*
*This can prevent nightmares of demonic encounters,*
*and with persistent practice,*
*one may prolong life*
*and ascend to the heavens."*

The True Person *Yuán* (named *Yuánzhēn*):

*"Swallow and retain the hundred breaths,*
*without disturbance,*
*and the true water naturally ascends.*
*If one has an illness, use this method,*
*and the disease will be cured.*
*Regular use brings radiance to the skin.*
*Constant practice nourishes the flesh."*

The True Person *Lǚ* (named *Kūn*):

*"Rub and encircle the navel and kidneys,*
*alternating hands and pressing,*
*and beneath the navel,*
*grasp the kidneys.*
*With left and right hands exchanging,*
*one may gather true *qi*
*and fortify the Original Source."*

---
**平都篇**
**太上玄丹**

**Chapter on Píngdū**
**The Supreme Daoist’s Mysterious Elixir**

When the subtlest becomes manifest,
The crimson palace with its purple gate—
its method is not distant.

The True Lord of Zhōngyuè, Sū Zǐxián, says:
*"I have obtained the Supreme Daoist’s Mysterious Elixir Scripture.
Between the two eyebrows, retreat upward three inches,
dividing into the Guard of the Twin [Eyebrows] and the Inch-Field [Forehead].

Within, the left side holds the Crimson Terrace and Azure Chamber,
while the right side holds the Yellow Gate and Purple Portal.
Within the Crimson Terrace, seek the Dao—
guide it left and right to the palaces and gates,
awaiting the extraordinary *qi*.

The spirit of the Purple Portal is named the Peaceful Guardian Sovereign Who Upholds the Law;
the spirit of the Azure Chamber is named the Rectified Heart.
Their forms resemble infants,
clad in robes the color of their chambers,
each holding a golden chime that flows like liquid metal.
At dusk, when resting or meditating,
first invoke the three spirits—
their forms appear indistinctly.

Then strike the teeth,
three times calling their names and praying:
*'Great Gods of the Purple Portal and Azure Chamber,
handling flowing chimes,
your bodies generating wind and clouds,
escorting the True Dao,
come before me—
my thoughts resonate with you,
your spirits swift as pottery,
entering and exiting with precision,
ascending the Nine Gates,
thus revealing the Nine True Sovereigns of the Supreme.*

After the prayer,
meditate on the Three-One, the Nine Passages of the Cavernous Chamber, and all essential pathways.

Within the left and right ears are the Cloud Commands.
The Cloud Commands toll their bells to notify the Nine Officials—
when heard, clasp your hands over your ears
and pray:
*'The Red Sovereign dwells in the Palace,
the Nine True Ones in the Chamber.
Hearken to divine command,
reveal all omens of misfortune—
the Supreme One’s flowing fire
extinguishes all calamity.*

After the prayer,
with your fingers, pass seven times through the ear gates.
If your face grows warm, it is a good sign.
If your neck feels cold and shivering,
evil has entered.

Lie down in darkness, close your eyes,
and focus on the Mysterious Elixir Palace.
The Supreme One True Lord, with his flowing-fire chime,
illuminates and casts it forth,
driving away malevolent *qi*.
Then your ears and eyes—both inner and outer—
burn with radiant fire,
illuminating your entire body.

Retreat inward one inch—
this is the Bright Hall Palace.
Within it,
to the left stands the True Lord of Luminous Youth,
to the right stands the True Lady of Luminous Virtue,
and within them is the Spirit Lord of the Clear Mirror.
These three officials govern water and fire.
They wear green brocade robes,
belted with red jade chimes,
holding red jade mirrors in their mouths.
Their forms resemble infants,
facing outward and emerging.

After invoking them,
three times call their names:
The Luminous Youth is named *Xuányáng*, styled *Shàoqīng*;
the Luminous Virtue is named *Wēiyīn*, styled *Shàoyuán*;
the Clear Mirror is named *Zhàoqīng*, styled *Sìmíng*.
Strike the teeth nine times,
and a thousand demons will be subdued,
a myriad ghosts annihilated.

For hunger and thirst,
invoke the three lords—
your mouth will emit red *qi*,
which you swallow and absorb.
In moments, hunger and thirst will vanish.

For extending life,
fix your heart and lie still in the Bright Hall,
before the three lords.
Face outward, kneel long,
and emit red radiant *qi* from your mouth,
pouring it over your body.
Soon, the red *qi* will encircle you as fire,
merging with your form—
your body and fire become one,
inner and outer luminous.
After some time, it ceases—
this is the Sun-Moon Refining of the Form.

Retreat inward two inches—
this is the Cavernous Chamber Palace.
Within it,
to the left stands the Masterless Prince,
to the right stands the White Sovereign,
and within them is the Yellow Old Lord—
this is the path of the Flying True Ones.

Retreat inward three inches—
this is the Elixir Field Palace.
Within it dwells the True Emperor of the Upper Primordial,
who governs with two ministers,
together guarding the Three Primordials.
This is the True One’s Dao—
the genuine essence of this land.

Retreat inward four inches—
this is the Flowing Pearl Palace,
where the Official of Destiny moves.

Retreat inward five inches—
this is the Jade Emperor’s Palace,
where the Jade Empress resides.

Above the Bright Hall, one inch—
this is the Heavenly Court Palace,
where the Pure Clarity True Maiden resides.

Above the Cavernous Chamber, one inch—
this is the Cavernous Truth Palace,
where the Supreme Ultimate’s Consort resides.

Above the Elixir Field, one square inch—
this is the Mysterious Elixir Palace,
the soul palace of the brain’s essence and the *níwán* [marrow].
The brain is the spirit of the body,
the birthplace of a hundred spirits,
the source of fluids and the origin of essence,
the jade chamber of the soul.
If one can make the *níwán* round and empty,
filling it with the True,
then a thousand pores stand erect,
a myriad holes emit mist—
its virtue encompasses Heaven and Earth,
merging with the Great Square.
Thus it is called *níwán*.
The *níwán* is the supreme spirit of form.
Only those who know to swallow *qi* and absorb fluids,
humming and striking the teeth,
but do not know their source—
these are but the remnants of the *níwán*.

The Mysterious Elixir Palace is one square inch,
with a green chamber and purple microcosmic room.
When filled with crimson essence,
the *níwán*’s Supreme One True Lord resides within.
His form resembles an infant,
seated upon a golden bed beneath a jade canopy,
wearing embroidered purple robes,
his waist belted with flowing light.
In his left hand, he holds the dipper of the Big Dipper,
in his right, the North Star’s presentation.
The North Star is the unmoving star of the North Pole.
*The Supreme Dragon Scripture* says:
*'Sit upright in the Mysterious Elixir,
neither leaning nor askew—
this is the Dao.*

At night, when resting,
set aside all thoughts,
sit or lie as you will.
First, meditate on the North Star’s purple *qi*
entering the Mysterious Elixir Palace.
Soon it overflows outward,
surrounding your body internally and externally,
merging with the purple chamber.

Again, meditate on the sun’s entry into the Mysterious Elixir Palace,
where purple *qi* resides—
it appears like a fire-pearl in darkness.
Then, invoke the Supreme One True Lord of the Central Yellow
descending from the North Star’s purple *qi*
into the Mysterious Elixir Palace.
Afterward, meditate on his sudden ascent
into the Mysterious Elixir Palace,
sitting before the Supreme One.
His robes shift with his will.
Rise, bow twice with your head to the ground,
and kneel, asking questions before him."*

Now swallow the purple *qi* thirty times,
and swallow the saliva thirty times.

Then, meditate on the seven stars of the Big Dipper,
wherewithin there is a crimson *qi* like a bowstring,
descending directly into the Mysterious Elixir Palace.
Thus, the Supreme One and his form together follow the sun’s path,
entering the crimson *qi*’s way,
ascending to the Big Dipper’s handle.

Practice this for fourteen years,
and you shall wander with the Supreme One through the seven primal threads;
for sixteen years,
and you shall receive scriptures from the Upper Clarity.

Evening practice is essential—
count only, do not neglect it.
Those who specialize in this need not observe the Three Ones.*

On the first, third, seventh, and fifteenth days of the month,
as well as at midnight,
meditate on the Supreme One True Lord within the Mysterious Elixir Palace,
sitting upright and facing outward,
exhaling purple *qi* from the mouth,
letting it descend into your own,
and swallowing it fifty times.

Recite softly:
*"Supreme True Emperor, Central Yellow Purple Lord;
Your title is *Guiying*, your name *Huaxuan*;
On golden bed and jade pavilion, in crimson brocade and embroidered robes;
Waist girded with fire-bells, slaying evil and crushing deceit;
Holding stellar essence, crowned with the sun’s true light;
Seated and exhaling *qi*, commanding me to swallow the saliva;
Grant me audience, serve me the Mysterious Elixir;
Refine and nourish the seven spirits, harmonize and soften the three souls;
Divine spirits guard me, let me ascend as an immortal;
The five viscera regenerate, restoring youthful vigor;
Receive scriptures from Upper Clarity, O Lord of Destiny;
All desires fulfilled, a hundred blessings renewed."*

Afterward, meditate on his form ascending into the Mysterious Elixir Palace,
resting before the Supreme One.

What is the Mysterious Elixir?
It is the spirit of the *Nihuan* [Cinnabar Field].

*The Scripture of the Primordial True One* says:
*"Qi congeals into essence, essence gives rise to spirit.
Spirit becomes the True Person, the True Person ascends as the Red Boy—
this is the True One."*

Thus, those who guard the Three Ones are Earthly True Ones,
those who guard the Inner Chamber are True Persons,
and those who guard the Mysterious Elixir are officials of the *Taixuan* [Supreme Mystery].

The method of guarding the One
requires meditating on the seven stars of the Big Dipper,
taking its handle as a canopy,
its shaft pointing forward,
with the Red Boy dwelling within.
When the seven stars rise gradually to my crown,
their feet facing heaven and pointing straight ahead,
meditate on the *Yangming* and *Yinjing* in the rear,
and on the *Tianguan* star, ordering it to align with my mouth—
seven *chi* distant—
so that yellow *qi* and yang essence flow harmoniously in three paths.

Now, each of the seven stars has its attendant boy:
1. The *Yangming* star, named *Shumíng*;
2. The *Yinjing* star, named *Yaoling*;
3. The True Person star, named *Beiyuan*;
4. The *Xuanning* star, named *Baojing*;
5. The *Danyuan* star, named *Danying*;
6. The *Beiji* star, named *Qingqing*;
7. The *Tianwu* star, named *Ziying*.

If you constantly meditate on them above a single star,
a hundred evils will not dare act,
and malevolent *qi* will perish.

*The Inner Vision of the Central Plane* says:
*"To ascend to the Pure and Refined,
meditate on the five stars;
Secrets within secrets, never leaving the courtyard.
The method of meditation is as follows:"*

At midnight when *qi* is born, sit upright on the couch, facing the moon’s position, and strike the teeth nine times to clear them, swallowing saliva thirty times. Bow twice northward. In a solemn invocation, declare:

*"Respectfully I inform the Most High, the True Lord of the Supreme Polarity—
I request the Five Directions, the Five Emperors, and the Five Spirits to gather and manifest."*

After the invocation, close your eyes and visualize the five stars suspended above you:
The **Chen** star of the North rests upon your head,
The **Sui** star of the East at your left,
The **Tai Bai** star of the West at your right,
The **Yinghuo** star of the South between your knees,
The **Zhen** star of the Center within your heart.

Practice this constantly, and in time you will perceive the essence of the stars—
the Five Elders will arrive, and you may question them about the Dao of flying immortals.

**Huang Bo Yan**, named Jing, had a method of refining the form:
*"Visualize the Central Star of the North Pole,
and within its core, imagine the Red Boy of the Sun holding a crimson banner,
brandishing the Fire of Shao Hao to burn your body—
thus refining away the Three Corpses and attaining longevity."*

**Shi Tang** transmitted this method:
*"Constantly focus on a star between your brows,
its light like a bean—
meditate until it glows red as fire,
then suddenly it envelops your face and spreads across your body.
In an instant, you forget your form,
seeing only the fire’s crimson radiance—
after a time, it fades, and your body returns to its original state."*

**Le Zi Chang** had the method of *Xuan Hua Chi*:
*"Hold a date pit in your mouth as a child sucks milk,
until it fills—
swallow three parts, retain two,
and let the saliva descend with the *qi*.
This is called *Returning the Essence*—
it can circulate endlessly."*

Rise and strike the teeth thirty-six times;
when done three hundred times, the loose teeth will firm,
the decayed will heal,
and the aching will cease.

There is also the method of consuming the Five Sprouts:
First, face east and strike the teeth nine times, then invoke:
*"Eastern Green Tooth, Purple Clouds flowing like dewdrops;
Three Pure Ones lingering, Dark Frost and Jade Nets;
Consume the Morning Radiance, swallow the Dawn’s Flowers."*

Afterward, with your tongue against the upper lip’s edge,
collect saliva and swallow thirty times—
lick and swallow each time, visualizing the green *qi* entering your liver.
Practice this for ten years,
and the Eastern Elder will come to teach you the *Scripture of Green Truth*.

Next, face south and strike the teeth nine times, then invoke:
*"Southern Crimson Crow, Vermilion Clouds of Tai Wei;
Nine Paths descending mist, dispelling the Bright Splendor;
Consume the Sacred Dawn, drink from the Crimson Pool."*

Afterward, with your tongue against the lower lip’s edge,
collect saliva and swallow thirty times,
visualizing the red *qi* entering your heart.
Practice this for ten years,
and the Southern Elder will come to teach you the *Scripture of Radiant Elixir*.

Next, face west and strike the teeth nine times, then invoke:
*"Western Upper Brightness, Flying Clouds of Golden Elixir;
Consume the Supreme Brightness, the Pure Spirit’s Essence;
Drink the Jade Wine, the Dawn’s Flowers awakening the Sacred;
Ascend to the Void Emperor, rise to the High Purity."*

Afterward, with your tongue against the inner lip,
collect saliva and swallow thirty times,
visualizing the white *qi* entering your lungs.
Practice this for ten years,
and the Western Elder will come to teach you the *Symbols of Pure Authority and Divine Power*.

Next, face north and strike the teeth nine times, then invoke:
*"Northern Mysterious Nourishment, Clouds crossing to awaken the embryo;
Three Ascents of Green Mist, Purple Canopy and Azure Dawn;
Consume the Sun’s Flowers, drink the Jade Candy."*

Afterward, with your tongue against the inner lower lip,
collect saliva and swallow thirty times,
visualizing the dark *qi* entering your kidneys.
Practice this for ten years,
and the Northern Elder will come to teach you the *Symbols of Mysterious Records and Precious Clarity*.

Finally, sit facing south and strike the teeth nine times, then invoke:
*"The Wu-Ji Essence, Yellow and White Five Clouds,
Four Vermilion Mists of Purple and Azure,
Eight Sceneries and Nine Dawns,
Two Bright Ones stirring the Splendor,
Seven Celestial Luminaries of Sacred Venerability—
Blend the saliva to nourish the *qi*,
Consume the Central Essence,
Luminous Flowers nurturing the embryo,
Drink from the Nectar Spring."*

Afterward, rinse your mouth fully—
between the upper and lower teeth, the tongue and gums—
swallow the saliva forty times,
visualizing the yellow *qi* entering your spleen.
Practice this for ten years,
and the Central Yellow Elder will come to teach you:
*The Yellow Qi and Yang Essence,
The Hidden Heaven and Concealed Moon,
The Green Chapter and Azure Talisman,
The Waist-Tiger’s Scriptures.*

These five methods may all be combined to ascend.

If you ascend with the Mysterious and the Four Elders together,
the Four Polar Elders will descend simultaneously and ascend with you—
they do not depart one by one.
Yet even if practiced separately, it need not be done in strict stillness;
a tranquil mind and relaxed body suffice.

---
**Chapter on Refining the Essence:**

Rise and chew the jade spring within;
Repel external harm, secure the Three Fields.

**Sun Zhēnren** said:
*"At dawn, before speaking, chew the jade spring slowly and swallow it twice seven times,
then strike the teeth fourteen times.
With prolonged practice, the essence will fill,
moistening your entire body.
Hair should always be combed,
teeth always struck,
saliva always swallowed,
*qi* always purified,
hands often held to the face,
feet frequently moved,
ears regularly massaged,
eyes often rubbed.
At the hour of the Tiger, perform *Dao Yin* exercises—
strike the teeth thirty-six times to gather your spirit,
visualize the colors and forms of the Five Viscera in the *Dan Tian*,
and circulate them once.
Then still your breath for two inhalations,
sever all thoughts,
and keep your mind constantly in the Lower *Dan Tian*—
whether standing, sitting, or lying down—
always thus focused.
In time, the spirit and *qi* will settle,
and no ailments will arise.

But resentment, anger, sorrow, fear, vexation,
and lustful desires—
these are the greatest taboos for the True One.
Even a single disturbance will deplete the Original *Qi*.
This is called Inner Elixir."*

「Bestow kindness upon others in secrecy,
this is called the Outer Elixir.

In the *Pure Yang* Chapter,
the Cauldron of *Tai Yi* follows the model of *You* (酉).
Breathing a hundred *ke* (刻),
this is called the *Divine Talisman* (神符).

The Yellow Emperor wandered in the wilds of *Qingcheng* (青城),
where he encountered *Guangchengzi* (广成子),
*Qibo* (岐伯), and *Huangguzi* (黄谷子),
and inquired of them.
Thus, he obtained the *Divine Talisman* of a hundred *ke*.

The *Pure Yang* Master said:
*The ke* begins at one,
yet my breath encompasses a hundred and twenty-five *ke*.
At the hours of *Zi* (子), *Wu* (午), *Mao* (卯), and *You* (酉),
the *ke* number is nine and eight in excess—
when it reaches fullness, a hundredfold,
my breath is fixed at one.

Through day and night,
my breath totals thirteen thousand five hundred *ke*.
Circulating throughout the body,
thus the *meridians* and *blood vessels* flow in fifty cycles,
and the Inner Elixir is born.

The hour *Mao* (卯) is called *You* (酉),
for it represents the division of two—
how could it be unclear?

The fire of mid-spring,
the *Great Yang* (太阳),
is called the Fire Taboo (*huǒ jì* 火忌).
Thus, I observe the principles of advance and retreat,
with the Dragon following the Tiger,
and the *Divine Talisman* is attained.

Indeed, I use the *Jue* (兑) metal as my *Ze* (泽),
water born of metal,
metal born of earth,
forming the Cauldron of *Tai Yi*—
this is what is called the *You* model.

I am now advancing the fire,
three thousand days until the *Zhu Lin* (珠琳) is complete.
*Jia* (甲), the gallbladder—*Zi* (子), *Xu* (戌), *Shen* (申), *Wu* (午), *Chen* (辰), *Yin* (寅);
*Yi* (乙), the liver—*Wei* (未), *Mao* (卯), *You* (酉), *Si* (巳), *Hai* (亥), *Chou* (丑);
*Bing* (丙), the small intestine—*Zi* (子), *Shen* (申), *Wu* (午), *Yin* (寅), *Chen* (辰), *Xu* (戌);
*Ding* (丁), the heart—*Chou* (丑), *Mao* (卯), *Si* (巳), *Wei* (未), *You* (酉), *Hai* (亥);
*Wu* (戊), the stomach—*Zi* (子), *Yin* (寅), *Chen* (辰), *Wu* (午), *Shen* (申), *Xu* (戌);
*Ji* (己), the spleen—*Chou* (丑), *Mao* (卯), *Si* (巳), *You* (酉), *Wei* (未), *Hai* (亥);
*Geng* (庚), the large intestine—*Zi* (子), *Chen* (辰), *Yin* (寅), *Xu* (戌), *Wu* (午), *Shen* (申);
*Xin* (辛), the lungs—*You* (酉), *Mao* (卯), *Si* (巳), *Chou* (丑), *Hai* (亥), *Wei* (未);
*Ren* (壬), the bladder—*Zi* (子), *Yin* (寅), *Chen* (辰), *Wu* (午), *Shen* (申), *Xu* (戌);
*Gui* (癸), the kidneys—*Chou* (丑), *Mao* (卯), *Si* (巳), *Wei* (未), *You* (酉), *Hai* (亥).
This is what is called *Pure Yang*.

Without heaven and earth,
ten thousand things would not be born.
I have obtained it as the method of life and transformation.
*Ren* (壬) is the *Heavenly Mechanism* (天机),
*Bing* (丙) is the *Earthly Knot* (地纽).
By returning to the *Six Jia* (六甲),
I complete the *Way* of heaven and earth’s five phases—
this is the *Great Dao*.

The ancient cauldrons were five:
The largest held water two *sheng* (升),
its height five and a half *cun* (寸),
its name *Dan Sha* (丹砂),
aligned with the *Original Qi* of heaven and earth;
One held water one *dou* (斗),
its height one *chi* (尺),
its name *Qiu Shi* (秋石),
aligned with the *Ten Heavenly Stems* (十干),
all changing every nine days;
One held water one *dou* six *sheng*,
its height one *chi* six *cun*,
its name *Bai Ma* (白马),
aligned with the numbers of sun and moon,
changing daily;
One held water two *dou* eight *sheng*,
its height two *chi* eight *cun*,
its name *Bai Xue* (白雪),
aligned with the *Twenty-Eight Constellations* (二十有八宿),
changing every fifteen days;
One held water two *dou* four *sheng*,
its height two *chi* four *cun*,
its name *Huang Ya* (黄芽),
aligned with the *Twenty-Four Seasons* (二十有四气),
also changing daily.

Now the cauldrons have the *double-nine Yang numbers* (九九阳数).
The essence of the cauldron is *gold* and *mercury*, *Dan Sha* (丹砂).
Its largest holds five *sheng*,
its form changes every five days,
completing a cycle in nine days.

From *Dao Shu* Volume Nine, number one: "In an instant" (斯须):
The essential text reads: *"Xūyú"* (须臾).
The second instance reads: *"Sì"* (四).
The third instance reads: *"Lǐ"* (礼), changed to *"Tǐ"* (体) according to the essential text.
