**Volume 10 of Dao Shu (Collected by Ziyouzi Zengmi):**

The pivot of the sun and moon,
The mechanism of Heaven and Earth.
The *Hua yang* text was inscribed,
Taking its master as the model.

*Hua yangzi* said:
*"I possess the method of returning old age to youth.
When inner elixir is refined, true qi arises.
When outer elixir is completed, mortal bones grow strong."*

*Chunyangzi* said:
*"At dawn, swallow the foul saliva to open the stomach,
Exhale heart-qi to massage the face.
For heart-qi—
When it ascends, it becomes complexion;
When it scatters, it becomes pulse;
When it flows, it becomes blood;
When it congeals, it becomes marrow.*

Next, apply thick saliva to the wrist-residence,
Internalize true qi—
The face will naturally glow with ease.

To nourish the lower *yuan*,
Extract the essence of the Dragon and Tiger,
Congeal it in the Yellow Court to form inner elixir.
Inner elixir—
This is what grants longevity.

Refine metals and minerals to supplement the *dantian*,
This is the inner great medicine.
The great medicine—
This is what grants immortality."

*Chunyangzi* said:
*"Rub the abdomen below the navel with both hands,
Completing the *double-nine* count.
Then, with left and right hands alternately encircling the outer kidneys,
Use the number nine.

At mealtime, swallow qi while massaging the outer kidneys,
Draw bladder-qi into the *dantian*,
Send heart-qi downward.
Heart-fire must always descend,
Silently illuminating like the rotation of a fire wheel.
Though its verification may be slow,
Its efficacy is great.

Thus it is said:
The kidneys are the sea of qi;
The heart is the capital of spirit.
Guard them without loss,
Rub, encircle, massage, and swallow.
With both hands embracing the navel,
When exhausted, bend the knees outward.
With the outer kidneys facing the navel,
The lower *yuan* naturally solidifies,
And the inner elixir coalesces.

When uniting *Kan* and *Li*,
Take the *mao-you* hours as appropriate;
When uniting Dragon and Tiger,
Take the *zi-wu* hours as appropriate.
The ancient sages nourished the Yang without nourishing the Yin,
Refined the Dragon without refining the Tiger—
Who can fathom their profundity?

Using *mao* to unite with *Kan-Li*,
Close the breath and sit still,
Allowing qi and fluids to converge inward,
Nourishing the five viscera internally,
Filling the four limbs externally.

Using *wu* to unite with the Tiger,
Fill the mouth with saliva,
Allow lead to merge with mercury,
Let *dansha* congeal and solidify,
Harvest and supplement the returned elixir.

Qi arises from the kidneys,
Return qi to the kidneys—this is called *Small Return Elixir*;
Spirit arises from the heart,
Return spirit to the heart—this is called *Middle Return Elixir*;
Marrow arises from the brain,
Return marrow to the brain—this is called *Great Return Elixir*.

The union of Dragon and Tiger is *Small Return*;
Inner observation is *Middle Return*;
The *Zhouhou* method is *Great Return*.

*Chunyangzi* said:
*"Kill the husband, save the wife—
Seek their mother."*

«Examine the five phases’ cycle of generation and conquest,
Follow the four seasons’ waxing and waning—
This may be called the ultimate refinement.

Though killing the husband and seeking the mother
Can only rescue and supplement the deficiencies of the five viscera,
And summoning the child to expel the ghost
Can only drain the excess of one’s own organ—

Whenever the organ’s essence is deficient,
One must seek the mother and exhort it,
So that the *qi* returns to the *tian* (field),
And the child-mother mutually generate,
Thus refining and transforming the form.

What is the *Taiyin* (Great Yin) method of refining the form?
By drawing water from the throat to irrigate the four limbs—
This is the *Yuyeli* (Jade Fluid) method of refining the form.

What is the *Taisun* (Great Yang) method of refining the form?
By governing *qi* within the *dantian* (elixir field),
And burning it throughout the hundred bones—
This is the *Jinye* (Golden Fluid) method of refining the form.

Refining Yin with Yang yields slow results,
Refining Yang with Yin yields subtle effects.

At the time when *qi* reigns supreme at noon,
Sit still and elevate the body,
Exhale through the nose without limit in its length—
When the *qi* is full, let perspiration emerge slightly,
This is called the *Zhenzhu Yu* (True Pearl Bath).

After noon, when the *qi* is weak,
Lie down and circulate the *qi* between the hands and feet without stagnation,
And when the *qi* is full, draw it back into the *danyuan* (elixir origin),
Repeatedly gathering it without limit in its quantity—
Frequent swallowing and frequent pounding are the marvelous techniques when entering the *danyuan*.

If, after the *Small Return Elixir*, the residual *qi* descends to supplement the brain,
Or if, after the *Return Elixir*, the residual *qi* ascends to burn the body,
These methods are not applicable at that time.

Gold and stone may be extracted for external elixir,
Yet borrowed *qi* will never truly belong to one’s own body;
The *Kanli* (Water-Fire) method may be adopted for internal elixir,
Yet empty *qi* will never sustain constant use.

In the past, some refined true Yin and true Yang
To congeal into internal elixir,
And within the *qi* further extracted true *qi* to return to the *Huangting* (Yellow Court).

When practicing this, one must seize the moment
When the five *qi* converge at noon,
Paying close attention to gather it—
This is how the *Hechiji Dan* (Scarlet Vermilion Elixir) forms in a single day,
And within a decade, one achieves the goal of seizing three hundred years of life.

At the juncture of *Chen* and *Wei* (3 AM–9 AM),
Gather the essence of the liver—
This is called the *Qingjin Dan* (Blue-Green Elixir);
At the juncture of *Wu* and *Shen* (1 PM–5 PM),
Gather the essence of the heart—
This is called the *Hongye Dan* (Red Fluid Elixir);
At the juncture of *Zi* and *Wu* (11 PM–7 AM),
Gather the essence of the spleen—
This is called the *Huangya Dan* (Yellow Sprout Elixir);
At the juncture of *Xu* and *Hai* (7 PM–3 AM),
Gather the essence of the lungs—
This is called the *Xihua Dan* (Western Splendor Elixir);
At the juncture of *Chou* and *Yin* (9 PM–1 AM),
Gather the essence of the kidneys—
This is called the *Tawei Dan* (Great Minute Elixir).

Whenever one elixir is refined and gathered,
It suffices to extend one’s lifespan to a hundred years.
Refining and gathering the five elixirs
Is the method for prolonged vision and longevity.

Extract true *qi* to refine *qi*,
And thus within *qi* there arises *qi*—
This *qi* generates spirit,
And where spirit abides, form abides as well.

Refine true *qi* according to the great cycle,
Refine elemental *qi* according to the small cycle—
This is indeed a method for longevity and extending years.
Yet it is still not as good as
Refining the five *qi* in a single day,
And forming the great elixir in ten days—
By extinguishing thoughts to guard true breath,
And retaining *qi* to nourish the elemental spirit—
First within the five viscera,
Then within the remaining six palaces,
Where *qi* generates spirit,
And refining spirit unites with the Dao.

The principles of the *Zhou Tian* (Circulation of the Heavens) fire stages
Are not singular.

By closing the breath to attack illness,
By pressing the sides and abdomen to supplement decline,
By elevating the body to unblock the meridians,
By pressing the hips to strengthen the waist and knees—
What is valued is that the timing must be precise,
Advancing and withdrawing must be measured,
Adding or reducing fire must be appropriate,
And draining or supplementing must be well-timed.

A skilled elixir refiner
Depends on the *sanmei* (threefold) breath
And follows the *Zhou Tian* circulation—
Every five days, a breath cycle is completed,
Then proceed to the next stage—
Accumulating a hundred breaths is called *Small Achievement*,
A thousand breaths is called *Middle Achievement*,
And ten thousand breaths is called *Great Achievement*.

Before noon, refine the form
By frequently elevating and drawing the *qi*—
This is not to be exhausted;
After noon, refine the elixir
By frequently swallowing and drinking the *qi*—
This is the marvelous technique.

Why does one add or reduce fire?
At the start, use *Qian* (Heaven),
Then *Dui* (Joy),
And finally *Kun* (Earth);
At the start, refine with *Lian* (Refinement),
Then with *Liang* (Nourishment),
And finally with *Jin* (Severance)—
These are all the principles of fire progression.

What is *inner observation*?
It means observing oneself, not external objects,
Observing the inner, not the outer.

I have a method of observing the heart—
When not a single thought arises,
It is like holding a bowl of water,
Ever serene and constantly clear.

I have a method of observing the heavens—
All day long, sit in stillness,
Silently facing the Supreme Dao.

I have a method of observing the nose—
Always as if a thread hangs from it,
Ascending then re-entering,
Descending then ascending again.

When *inner observation* reaches its peak,
The *qi* enters the *niniwan* (brain marrow),
And the spirit transcends the *Neiyuan* (Inner Court).

Those *Shamen* (Buddhist monks) who enter prolonged meditation
Eventually fall into confusion and torpor,
Only achieving the emergence of the Yin spirit from its shell.

The Daoist who lingers in *zuowang* (forgetting sitting)
Becomes dull and attached—
How can spirit and *qi* ever be perfected?

Thus, the method of *inner observation*
Must take extinguishing the heart as its foundation,
And severing thoughts as its application—
Lowering the heart’s fire into the *dantian*,
Without calculating the stages of progress—
It is like Bodhidharma’s saying:
*"Not a single thought escapes—
The mind naturally settles internally,
And the elemental spirit congeals."*

The *qi*-bearing breath is easy to practice but difficult to perfect—
Why?
Because of the presence of deluded perceptions of the heart.

The true *qi*-bearing breath is difficult to practice but easy to perfect—
Why?
Because of the presence of a naturally tranquil nature.

The technique of *qi*-bearing breath:
Close the breath that enters,
Retain the breath that is transmitted—
Soft and continuous, as if it exists naturally,
And its application need not be frequent.

Thus, there is the method of *Chao Yuan* (Ascending to the Origin):
At the time of *Zi* (11 PM), *qi* is generated,
And by *Wu* (7 AM), it ascends to the heart;
At the time of *Wu* (7 AM), fluids are generated,
And by *Zi* (11 PM), they descend back to the kidneys.

When the Dragon and Tiger unite to form the elixir,
This is called *Descending Chao Yuan*.

By separating lead and mercury within the *qi*-bearing breath,
And thus forming the spirit,
The three Yangs ascend into the *Neiyuan* (Inner Court)—
This is called *Ascending Chao Yuan*.

When refining *qi*, the *qi* reveals its true nature,
When refining spirit, the spirit enters the *Yuan Palace* (Origin Palace).
By dispersing the Yin demons with true fire,
The elixir forms and the *qi* naturally ascends—
When the *qi* is true, the spirit naturally ascends.

Before noon, sit in stillness,
And through the nose, draw the *qi* long and deep—
It will naturally converge with the *Zhongyuan* (Central Origin).»

Before the hour of *Zi* (11 PM), sit in stillness,
Retract the body and swallow the *qi*—
It will naturally ascend to the *Xiaoyuan* (Lower Origin).

Before sunrise, sit in stillness,
Raise the body and arch the back—
The *qi* will naturally ascend to the *Shangyuan* (Upper Origin).

Why is this called *Returning Essence to Nourish the Brain*?
For essence resides in the kidneys—
If supplemented by *qi*, one may attain longevity.
*Qi* resides in the heart—
If calmed by spirit, one may attain immortality.
Marrow issues from the brain—
If supplemented by true Yin and true Yang, one may reverse aging and return to youth.

To draw the kidney’s *qi* from behind the elbow
And send it flying into the Upper Palace—
This is supplementing with true Yin.

To return the true *qi* inward and observe within,
Ascending to the Inner Palace—
This is supplementing with true Yang.

To remain silent all day, forgetting concerns and severing schemes,
As Yin and Yang *qi* intermingle and congeal in the *Suihai* (Marrow Sea)—
This is supplementing both Yin and Yang.

The method for supplementing true Yin
Does not exceed the time between *Chou* (1–3 AM) and *Yin* (3–5 AM).
Raise the body, straighten the waist, and arch the chest,
Close the *Double Pass* and move within.
The young may open it monthly,
The old may open it every hundred days.
Open the *Double Pass* and then close the *Upper Pass*—
Open as before, and once entered into the Upper Palace, it is *Ji Ji* (Completion).

What is *Ji Ji* and *Wei Ji* (Uncompleted)?
When *Kan* (Water) and *Li* (Fire) align,
They nourish the five viscera but cannot yet form the elixir.
When Dragon and Tiger interact,
They gather the five *qi* but cannot yet ascend to *Chao Yuan*.
Only when the elixir forms in *Wei Ji*
And the spirit converges with pure Yang can it be achieved.

The Pure Yang Sage becomes a long-lived immortal dwelling in the mortal realm—
This is the work of *Kan* and *Li* interacting.
To become a Pure Yang High True One who abandons the shell and ascends—
This is the work of Dragon and Tiger uniting.

The interaction of *Kan* and *Li* occurs in the *Li* hexagram.
It is the drawing of saliva and inhaling *qi*.
Taking Yang from within Yin,
Taking Yin from within Yang—
This alone suffices for longevity and immortality.

When the elixir is complete that very day,
Pure Yang *qi* arises—
It is no longer like the kidney *qi* containing the Yin Tiger.
When the marrow is full that very day,
Pure Yang water descends—
It is no longer like the heart fluid containing the Yang Dragon.

Upper water, lower fire—
This is the meaning of *Ji Ji*.
Thus, without the true water in the cauldron,
One cannot regulate the Pure Yang *qi*;
Without the true fire in the elixir,
One cannot refine the Pure Yang essence.

Rising and descending alternately,
Using Yang to refine Yin until Yin is exhausted and Pure Yang remains.
Thus, the Yang spirit naturally gathers,
Ascending to the Heavenly Palace, ready to abandon the shell.

The method of *Ji Ji* involves,
Before noon, practicing the *Fenshen* (Dividing the Form) method within the *Fenshen* posture,
And applying the *Huan Dan* (Returning the Elixir) swallowing technique.

What is the method of *Dividing the Form*?
Sometimes, by hanging a thread from the nose,
Making the *qi* ascend into the Heavenly Palace.
Sometimes, by summoning earthly forms to rise,
Causing the spirit to depart its original position—
Both can achieve *Dividing the Form*.

Or, like a crane leaving its nest to pierce the Heavenly Gate,
Or a dragon emerging from water to enter the *Biluo* (Celestial Realm),
Or through the Three-Story Red Mansion,
Or the Seven-Layer Jewel Tower,
Or the Flower Village,
Or the Withered Tree—
All can lead to abandoning the shell.

This is called the method of *Adjusting the Spirit and Ascending as an Immortal*, is it not?

For humanity’s origin lies in the parents’ essence and blood,
Which forms the kidneys.
The kidneys are the elixir.
The true elixir is the Yin and Yang of our body.
When the elixir forms, true *qi* arises.
When true *qi* is sufficient, only then can transformation begin.
Ascending to refine the form leads to soaring flight,
Retaining to refine the *qi* leads to abandoning the shell.

If one lacks inner elixir and only relies on the kidney *qi*’s ascent and inhalation to seek *Dividing the Form*,
One may only achieve the Yin spirit mistakenly exiting the Heavenly Gate—
This is the path of the Ghost Immortal.

Preserving and guarding the kidney *qi*,
Extracting the essence of Yin and Yang,
Congealing it into elixir—
When the elixir forms and *qi* is sufficient,
Refining *qi* according to the method will cause the Original *qi* to ascend and the true spirit to gather.

Adjusting the spirit according to the method,
The spirit naturally forms its body—
Why seek further the method of *Adjusting the Spirit* or the likeness of *Dividing the Form*?
Students err by not establishing their foundation
And yet seek the secret of *Dividing the Form*.
Even if they can exit the Heavenly Gate,
Their comings and goings are unrefined,
Their departures and returns flawed—
The dim true spirit cannot re-enter the body.
This is their fault, and it is truly pitiful!

**Observing the Heavenly Chapter**
The Original *qi* of the Dao is its foundation;
Water and fire interact, Yin and Yang circulate.

The *Chongxu* Sage expounds upon the *Taishang*’s teachings:
The *Chongxu* Sage annotates:
The Original *qi* takes the Dao as its foundation,
Its essence lies in the movement of water and fire.

What are water and fire?
They are the *qi* and fluids of heart and kidneys, mutually generating.
Thus, refine their Yin and Yang—
What are Yin and Yang?
They are the sun-soul and moon-shadow,
Ensuring their harmony without exceeding measure.

Metal and wood restraining each other,
Through restraint, instruments are formed.
The Dragon is Yang, born of *Li* (Fire),
The Tiger is Yin, born of *Kan* (Water)—
These are called the Yellow Sprouts!

The Daoist practitioner has three realms:
The first is the *Head of the Heavenly Realm*—
This is the *Shangyuan* (Upper Origin).
The *Tiangu* (Heavenly Valley) of the *Nihuan* (Brain’s Cavity),
Where ten thousand spirits gather,
Where thirty-six thousand spirits pass through—
This is the path of ascending and descending,
Of guiding the spirit into the brain.

The *Dazui* (Great Hammer) bone is the Heavenly Realm’s pass,
The route of ascending and descending, of coming and going in cycles—
A single strike can reach the Heavenly Pass.
Ascending from below is the *Jiaofu* (Joint Support) pass,
Within which lies the medicine—
This is the Yellow Sprout, the White Snow!

The heart is the *Jiangong* (Vermilion Palace).
When the heart is at ease, the spirit is at ease;
When the heart is disturbed, the spirit is disturbed—
All spirits take their measure from it.
Its form is the Vermilion Phoenix,
Its name is the Red Dragon—
It belongs to the fire of the South.

Using the heart’s fluid to refine the lung’s *qi*
Yields the Golden Paste.

The Vermilion Palace’s rear holds the **Tai Xuan** Pass and the Blood Viscera’s Treasury—why so?

From the heart arises **True Water**.
**True Water** is the **Mysterious** (*Xuan*).

Three inches below the navel lies the **Great Sea**,
Its name is the **Great Sea**, within which dwell the **Tortoise and Serpent**,
Hiding the **Original Qi**.

Those who cultivate life know how to breathe—
This is the foundation of nourishing the **True**!

The left is the **Kidney** (*Shen*), the right is **Life** (*Ming*).
Embrace and guard the **Original Qi**,
Refine and temper **Nature and Fate**,
Polish the **Yin** to make it **Yang**—
Thus one may find peace and prolong life.

Within the **Kidney** dwells a spirit.
Before enlightenment, it is called the **Chaste Maiden**;
When perfected, it is called the **Original Sovereign** (*Yuan Jun*).
Before refinement, it is the **Original Tortoise**;
When refined, it is the **White Deer**—
With two heads and four feet!

The **Great Sea** holds a **Treasure Bottle**,
Within which the **True Essence** is stored—
Called the **Nine Returns, Seven Transformations, Immortal Elixir**.
Behind it lies the **Tail Question Pass**,
Within which are two orifices connecting to the **Shu Lu** Pass.

Ascending from the **Tail Pass** is the first movement;
Passing the **Tai Xuan** is the second;
Passing the **Shu Lu**—
Thus, a single strike opens both passes.

The left is **Cultural Qi** (*Wen Qi*), the right is **Martial Qi** (*Wu Qi*).
They ascend to the **Heavenly Realm**—
The left holds the **Azure Dragon**, the right the **White Tiger**—
These are the two **Qi**.

In the world, people between the **Child** and **Horse** hours
Gargle and swallow their **saliva from the Flower Pool**—
Yet the three passes remain unopened,
So they merely inhale into emptiness,
Swallow water into the hollow intestines—
How can they reach the **Extreme Yang’s Head**,
The **Níhuán Palace**,
And achieve transformation?

Only when **Child** hour follows and **Yang** first arises
Must one set the furnace’s fire below,
Gather the **Yang Spirit** in the inner courtyard,
Seize the **Dragon and Tiger** in the **Bottle**—
This is the marvel of refining essence,
Driving away ghosts and spirits.

With each inhalation and exhalation,
**Qi** travels three inches.
Calculating one breath,
Day and night it moves **12,500 times** through the body.

When breath and movement are steady,
The **Dragon and Tiger embryo** may form.

The *Laozi* says:
*"Know its mother, then know its child;
Know its child, then guard its mother.
Child and mother cling together,
Guarding the **Bright Hall**—
Thus the inner **Divine Infant** is unbroken."*

The **Bright Hall** is the **Níhuán**.
The **Child and Mother** are the roots of **Yin and Yang**.

What then is the key?
Nourish the **Yang Spirit**,
Refine the **Yin Soul** (*Pò*),
Turn **Essence into Qi**,
**Qi into Spirit**,
**Spirit into the Dao**—
When the work is complete and the path fulfilled,
This is the way of **eternal life and longevity**.

---

**Observing the Five Voids**

Movement yet unobstructed,
Stagnation yet unblocked—
Examine their extremes,
To observe the **Five Voids**.

**Xi Yi Master** says:
*"To fathom the Void’s lack of Void,
Nothing surpasses **Spirit and Wisdom**—
This is the path of the **Great Void**."*

Thus there are **Five Voids**:

The first is the **Dull Void**.
Why?
Empty yet untransformed,
Stagnant yet unpassing,
Yin-heavy and turbid,
Clear **Qi** buried and unaroused,
Yang weak and crude—
This is the ultimate fool.

The second is the **Nature Void**.
Why?
Empty yet unyielding,
Still yet clear—
Only the **emptiness within the *Li* (Fire)** is embraced,
Yet unaware of the **fullness within the *Kǎn* (Water)**.
Bearing all marvels,
Guarding the **lonely Yin**,
It becomes a ghost of **dark obscurity**—
This is the **one with truncated insight**.

The third is the **Law Void**.
Why?
Moving yet unobstructed,
Still yet generative—
Massive yet unforced,
In the **Potential Dragon’s *Kǎn* position**,
Initially communicating with the **Mysterious Valley**,
Within the **formless and colorless**—
Doing nothing,
Yet doing nothing—
In harmony with the **Heavenly Dao**—
This is the **beginning of attaining the Dao**.

The fourth is the **True Void**.

Why?
Knowing color yet not clinging to color,
Knowing emptiness yet not fixating on emptiness—
Thus, the **True Void** transforms and gives birth to the **True Dao**,
The **True Dao** transforms and gives birth to the **True Spirit**,
The **True Spirit** transforms and all things are complete—
This is the **Immortal Sage**.

The fifth is the **Non-Void**.
Why?
Heaven is high and pure, yet it has the sun, moon, and stars;
Earth is still and tranquil, yet it has mountains, rivers, grasses, and trees;
Humans are empty and insubstantial, yet they become Immortals.
The three arise from emptiness and then take form.
One spirit transforms into myriad forms,
One *qi* harmonizes into the Nine *qi*—
Thus, movement rests upon stillness as its foundation,
Existence depends on non-existence as its root—
This is the **Lofty Dragon’s Return**, the highest of the True Ones.

**Chapter on Great Clarity**
The Five Phases and Four Symbols are the essentials of Dao cultivation.
He who knows them may thereby observe the marvels.
The Dao cultivator must clearly understand the Five Phases and Four Symbols.

The Four Symbols are:
1. **Jīn Wēng** (金翁),
2. **Chà Nǚ** (诧女),
3. **Yīng’ér** (婴儿),
4. **Huáng Pó** (黄婆).
Only then will one know the principles of Yin-Yang ascent-descent and the operation of the Seven Treasures.

The Five Phases are the Five Viscera.
The liver is Wood, its stem-branches are *Jia* and *Yǐ*,
Within it is *qi*, named the **Azure Dragon**,
Its path is along the left side of the spinal column,
Above the network of vessels, flowing into the eyes,
Its transformation yields **appearance**.

*Sè* is the residual *qi* of True Water,
Flowing into the left upper palate—
This is called **Jīn Yè** (金液, Golden Fluid).

The lungs are Metal, their stem-branches are *Gēng* and *Xīn*,
Within it is *qi*, named the **White Tiger**,
Its path is along the right side of the spinal column,
Entering the nostrils, its transformation yields **nasal mucus**.
*Nasal mucus* is the residual *qi* of True Metal,
Flowing into the right upper palate—
This is called **Huán Dān** (还丹, Elixir).

The heart is Fire, its stem-branches are *Bǐng* and *Dīng*,
Within it is *qi*, named the **Vermilion Bird**,
Its path is along the heart’s network of vessels,
Entering beneath the tongue, its transformation yields **saliva**.
*Saliva*, when swallowed, enters the heart and transforms into **blood**.
*Blood* is the residual *qi* of True Fire,
Flowing into the left side of the tongue—
This is called **Shén Shuǐ** (神水, Spirit Water).

The kidneys are Water, their stem-branches are *Rén* and *Guǐ*,
Within it is *qi*, named the **Dark Warrior**,
Its path is along the right anterior network of vessels,
Entering the ears, flowing to the right side of the tongue—
This is called **Huá Chí** (华池, Flowering Pool).

The spleen is Earth, its stem-branches are *Wù* and *Sì*,
Within it is *qi*, named the **Victorious Serpent**,
Its path is along the posterior network of vessels,
Circulating into the *Ní Wán* (泥丸, Mud Pillow),
Its transformation yields **ptyalin**.
*Ptyalin* is the residual *qi* of True Earth,
Flowing beneath the lips—
This is called **Huáng Yá** (黄芽, Yellow Sprout).

**Chapter on the Golden Elixir**
Nurture the *qi* and refine the form;

「Calm the mind and sever all thoughts,
Thus the **True Essence** returns.

The Sage of **Zhōu** (茆君, *Mào Jūn*) says:
To perform the work, nothing precedes the cultivation of **qi**;
Once **qi** is cultivated, then retain the **Essence** to refine the form,
And the **True Essence** shall return, uniting with the **One Qi** (一兀气, *Yī Wù qì*).

I have often dwelled in stillness,
Calming the mind and severing all thoughts,
Not stifling the heart while breathing in harmony.

Then I practiced **dǎoyǐn** (导引, *guided movements*),
To make the four limbs flexible and open,
Taking **True Water** (真水, *Zhēn Shuǐ*) to nourish within the **Ding** (鼎, *Crucible*).

Next, I opened the **Jiā Jǐ** (夹脊, *Intertwined Spine*)—twenty-four **guān** (关, *passages/locks*)—
Using **inner** and **outer fire** (内外之火, *Nèi Wài zhī Huǒ*) to ignite the **Three Passages** (三关, *Sān Guān*),
This is the **vital junction** of **Essence** and **qi**.

Sitting for a long while, **qi** accumulates and the **fire carriage** (火车, *Huǒ Chē*) turns;
Three turns, and the **Golden Essence** (金精, *Jīn Jīng*) arises.
The count completes at **nine**,
Then with **water** and **fire**, descending to the **Dān Tián** (丹田, *Elixir Field*), its name has nine:
The **Water and Fire** are already **crossed** (既济, *Jì Jì*),
**Kàn** and **Lí** (坎离, *Kǎn/Lí*) are in **exchange**,
The **husband and wife** (夫妇, *Fū Fù*) are **mutually invested**,
The **sun and moon** (日月, *Rì Yuè*) are **conjoined**,
**Gān** and **Kūn** (乾坤, *Qián/Kūn*) are in **chaotic unity**,
**Jīn** and **Mù** (金木, *Jīn/Mù*) are in **mutual punishment**,
The **Dragon and Tiger** (龙虎, *Lóng/Hǔ*) are in **assembly**,
**Lead and Mercury** (铅汞, *Qiān/Gǒng*) are **harmonized**,
**Yīn** and **Yáng** (阴阳, *Yīn/Yáng*) are **paired**.

When practiced, the **qi** flows freely,
The body feels as if bathed,
And its form becomes **radiant and luminous**.

Thus, the **fire carriage**’s revolutions reach **eighty-one**,
And the count is complete.

In general, after the **child hour** (子时, *Zǐ Shí*),
There is **flaming fire** beneath the navel,
And **lingering illnesses** are dispelled;
Even **hair-like ailments** cannot afflict.

I tested the **stages of this practice**:
On the **first day**, the mind is **turbulent and vexed**;
On the **second day**, the **stomach qi** (谷气, *Gǔ qì*) churns within the abdomen, producing **sound**;
On the **third day**, the **Essence** is **disturbed**, and **qi** sometimes escapes;
On the **fourth day**, the **spirit-qi** (神气, *Shén qì*) is **turbulent**, and **dullness** ensues;
On the **fifth day**, the **True Fire** (真火, *Zhēn Huǒ*) presses the **Three Corpses** (三尸, *Sān Shī*), and the **creatures** depart;
On the **sixth day**, heat arises beneath the navel—**True Fire** has reached the **Elixir Field**, and the **two fires** unite;
On the **seventh day**, the **two flanks** (二胁, *Èr Xiē*) **resonate**, and **True qi** circulates throughout the abdomen;
On the **eighth day**, **water** and **fire** **intertwine**, and the **Elixir Field** and navel **constantly move**;
On the **ninth day**, the **back and spine** (背脊, *Bèi Jǐ*) grow **hot**, the **joints** **yearn to open**, and **True qi** gradually ascends to the **brain**, completing **two cycles** (二九, *Èr Jiǔ*)—**True Fire** revolves to the **Upper Elixir Field** (上丹田, *Shàng Dān Tián*), and sometimes **substances descend**.

They resemble **sparrow eggs** (雀卵, *Què Luǎn*),
Best refined and **swallowed** (吞纳, *Tūnà*).

At **three cycles** (三九, *Sān Jiǔ*), the **kidney chamber** (肾堂, *Shèn Táng*) opens to the **joints**, and **qi** **boils** in the **brain**,
Like **water’s chill**—
Then the **fire carriage** **reverses**, circulating endlessly without pause,
Refining like **snow** while the **Crucible**’s summit **freezes**, its coldness **shivering**.

At **four cycles** (四九, *Sì Jiǔ*), the **spirit-qi** is **clear**,
And the **nose’s** inhalation and exhalation are **unobstructed**.

At **five cycles** (五九, *Wǔ Jiǔ*), the count reaches **forty-five**,
And the **spirit-substance** (神物, *Shén Wù*) appears;
At **six cycles** (六九, *Liù Jiǔ*), the **Flowering Pool**’s **water** is **abundant**,
Irrigating the **hundred vessels** (百脉, *Bǎi Mài*) without **drying** them;
At **seven cycles** (七九, *Qī Jiǔ*), the **joints** **resonate** and **open in silence**,
Permeating the **body**—
Sitting in a **secluded chamber** (密室, *Mì Shì*), the **flesh feels damp** as if **encountering wind**,
And the **qi** within the body **naturally enters**;

At **eight cycles** (八九, *Bā Jiǔ*), the **body is light and nimble**,
And the **Essence** **does not leak**—
**Qi** **naturally revolves**, dwelling in the **center**,
This is called the **rotation of the Dharma Wheel** (法轮, *Fǎ Lún*).

Thus, **eighty-one cycles** (九九八十有一, *Jiǔ Jiǔ Bā Shí Yī*), the **qi** and **vessels** are **open and unobstructed**,
The **nails turn scarlet and fresh**,
The **Absolute Yin** (绝阴, *Jué Yīn*) is **dispelled**,
And the **hands and feet** **perspire constantly**,
While the **complexion changes**.

In general, **eight stages** (凡八者, *Fán Bā Zhě*), if practiced without **cessation**,
And **one hundred days** (至於百日, *Zhì yú Bǎi Rì*) of **sustained circulation** (少通运, *Shǎo Tōng Yùn*) are achieved,
Then **True Mercury** and **True Lead** (真汞真铅, *Zhēn Gǒng Zhēn Qiān*) are **born**—
If **sexual activity** (房色, *Fáng Sè*) is **encountered**, there will be **abdominal distension** (膨腹之疾, *Péng Fù zhī Jí*).
Thus, **lustful desires** (色心, *Sè Xīn*) must not be **indulged**,
And **evening drinking** (暮夜饮酒, *Mù Yè Yǐn Jiǔ*) is **forbidden** while practicing.

**The Tenth Scroll of *Dào Shū* (道枢) concludes.**
**The Eleventh Scroll of *Dào Shū* begins.**

**The *Ní Jīn Piān* (泥金篇) by Master Zēng Kāo of the Wandering Scholar’s School**

When **Kàn** and **Lí** intermingle,
**Gold** and **Water** merge in **Mystic Unity**—
**Yellow Sprout** and **White Tiger**,
**Nine years** bring **fulfillment**.

Those who seek **self-cultivation** must first **discern the Four Symbols** and **Five Phases**,
Then **master the methods of alchemical refinement**—
**Reducing fire to three hundred eighty-four *chǐ* per *jīn***,
**Nine years** bring **fulfillment**—
This is the **Supreme Dao**.

**Yellow Sprout** is the **essence of Lead**;
**White Tiger** emerges from **Mercury’s union**, returning to **True Unity**.
Lead, when joined with Mercury, **transcends from Nonexistence to Existence**—
Mercury, when joined with Lead, **transcends from Existence to Nonexistence**.

**Transforming the Four Symbols** without losing the **Five Phases**,
**Internal Kàn and external Lí**, **Metal and Wood** in harmony,
**Numbers pressing upon hexagrams and lines**, **Sun and Moon marking the hour**,
**Chaos mingles with Harmony**, **Heaven and Earth unite**, and the **Three Realms** are complete.

From **Zǐ (Child)** to **Wǔ (Horse)**,
**Cultivate the Water-Fire cycle**,
**Suppressing and restraining** for **six *zhōu* and six *jiǎzǐ***,
The **Seven Returns** are thus fulfilled.

The **Scripture** says:
*"Lead is the Sovereign, Mercury the Minister.*
*If Lead is untrue, Mercury will not unite with it—*
*If Lead is true, the Minister will not stray."*

**Green Waist Messenger**, **Red and White Generals**,
**Gold unites the two lineages**—
**Diverse clans, yet one family.**

**White Tiger** is the **Root**,
**Yellow Sprout** the **Foundation**—
**Refine Lead into powder**,
**Transform Mercury into dust.**

**Yin dwells within Yang**, **Yang circulates through Yin**,
**Sun waxes, Moon wanes**, **Cold and Heat divide**.
Only **my method** endures with the **Dao**.

Thus, **sixteen *liǎng* of Gold Elixir** can **achieve True Transformation**.

**Harvest the Yellow Sprout**, **sift and wash it**,
**Decant and nurture it**—
Its name is **Gold Sand**, the **Gold Essence**.

Then take **five *liǎng* of Mercury and White Sand**,
**Forming a structured array in the Hua Pool**,
**Placing it in the Divine Furnace** to **solidify and aid**—
**Nurture with fire for five days**, maintaining **five *liǎng* of flame**,
**Drawing the elixir to one *jīn***,
**Entering the Divine Chamber** to **cultivate it**,
**Nine Circulations in the Three Fields**—
Thus, the **Elixir is complete**.

**Cultivators**, at **Winter Solstice (Zǐ)**, first **bathe**,
Enter the **Quiet Chamber**, **burn incense**, and **sit cross-legged**,
**Close the eyes**, **quiet the mind**,
**Tap the teeth thirty-six times**, **drum the Heavenly Drum thirty-six times**,
Then **visualize**:

To the **left, the Azure Dragon**,
To the **right, the White Tiger**,
Before, the **Vermilion Bird**,
Behind, the **Dark Tortoise**.

Then, with the **tongue**, **rinse and swallow the Jade Fluid thirty-six times**,
**Continuously, without pause**.

Afterward, **focus the mind on the Lower Dantian**,
**Gather the spiritual *qi* into one**—
This is called **Water-Fire Intercourse**,
**Mother-Father Guarding Each Other**—
**Ensure no breath escapes through nose or mouth**,
**As in *Chán* meditation**, this is **the supreme method**.

From **dawn to noon**, thus it is done.
From **Zǐ to Wǔ**, in **rest, sleep, or activity**, only **hold the mind in the Lower Field**,
**Guarding the *qi* in unity**.

By the **sixth day of the fourth month**, when **Yang is fully born**, the **spirit does not scatter**;
By the **sixth day of the tenth month**, when **Yin is fully born**, the **year completes its cycle**, and the *qi* **forms**.
A **pearl** congeals in the **Lower Field**, the size of a **quail’s egg**, ever **moving and turning**.

**Nine years**—the *qi* is full, the form **round**, its **light fills the chamber**.
**Eighteen years**—**teeth turn black**, **new teeth grow**, **cold and heat no longer harm**.

**Eighty-one years**—the **viscera and orifices are empty and vast**,
The **pearl of *qi* rises from the Lower Field to above the spleen**,
Like **Sun and Moon converging**, **swallow and descend it**—
**Naturally sated and full**, the **pearl then detaches from the Lower Field**,
Rising to **form the Yellow Sprout**.

**One hundred eighty years**—the **pearl ascends to the Brain of Mud**,
**Circulating at the crown**, its **base ever floating**—
This is the **sign of Ascension**,
**Naturally emitting five-colored *qi***, **transforming into five-colored clouds**,
**Hovering beneath the feet**, **rising into the sky**,
Entering the **Kōngdōng Celestial Realm**,
Sitting upon the **Retreating Bone Terrace**,
**Closing the eyes, quieting the mind**,
The **Mystic Pearl descends from the crown**,
**Transforming into a body**, **effortlessly at ease**—
This is the **True Person**.

**Zǐ** is the **Black Tortoise**.
**Geng, Chǒu to Gèn**—these are the **days the Sun emerges** in the **fifth month**;
**Yín**—the **fourth and sixth months**;
**Jǐa**—the **third and seventh months**;
**Mǎo**—the **second and eighth months**;
**Yǐ**—the **first and ninth months**;
**Chén**—the **tenth and twelfth months**;
**Xùn**—the **eleventh month**.

**Sì, Wèi to Kūn**—these are the **days the Sun sets** in the **eleventh month**;
**Shēn**—the **tenth and twelfth months**;
**Gēng**—the **first and ninth months**;
**Yǒu**—the **second and eighth months**;
**Rén**—the **third and seventh months**;
**Xū**—the **fourth and sixth months**;
**Qián**—the **fifth month**.

**Hài, Rén**—these are the **days of the Moon**—
**This method of Sun and Moon must be known.**

Those who seek **self-cultivation** must, at the hour of **Chǒu**,
**Sit cross-legged**, first **tap the teeth**, then **drum the Heavenly Drum**—
Each **thirty-six times**—
Then, with **both hands**, **lift beneath the navel nine times**—
This is called **Three Lines**.

With **shoulders**, **twist left and right nine times**—
This is called **Returning to the Mountain**.

With **both hands**, **embrace and dance left and right nine times**—
This is called **Dancing with Jade**.

With the **head**, **turn left and right to the *Jīngshèng* nine times**—
This is called **Tiger’s Gaze at Gold Essence**.

With the **head**, **nod forward eighteen times**—
This is called **Six Lines**.

**Ascending to the Dan Palace**, with the **head**, **strike shoulders left and right nine times**—
This is called **Dragging and Shaking Gold Essence**.

**Sit with legs crossed**, **visualizing water rising from the soles**,
**Entering the *Jīngshèng***, **piercing the Azure Palace**,
**Ascending to the Brain of Mud**, **passing the Front Hall of Light**,
**Descending through Lung, Liver, Heart, Kidney, and Spleen**—
Thus, **eighty-one times**,
**Practiced for nine years**—
The **Dao is fulfilled**.

This is the **method of exchanging bones for immortals**, the **prescription for prolonging life for the refined**—

On **Jia-Yi days** (木, Wood),
**Stare fixedly**,
**Cultivate the Liver’s *qi*** nine times,
and **swallow** thirty-six times.
This is called **Cultivating the Green Dragon’s *qi***.

On **Geng-Xin days** (金, Metal),
**Cultivate the Heart’s *qi*** nine times,
**Crossing hands behind the neck**,
and **swallow** eighty-one times.
This is called **Cultivating the Vermilion Bird’s *qi***.

On **Bing-Ding days** (火, Fire),
**Cultivate the Lungs’ *qi*** nine times,
**Lifting hands upward** twenty-seven times,
and **swallow** seventy-two times.
This is called **Cultivating the White Tiger’s *qi***.

On **Ren-Gui days** (水, Water),
**Cross hands over the knees**,
**Cultivate the Kidneys’ *qi*** thirty-six times,
and **swallow** one hundred and eight times.
This is called **Cultivating the Dark Tortoise’s *qi***.

On **Wu-Ji days** (土, Earth),
**Cultivate the Spleen’s *qi*** fifteen times,
**Pressing lips to swallow**,
and **swallow** twenty-three times.
This is called **Cultivating the Soaring Serpent’s *qi***.

The **Liver** belongs to the **Wood phase** of Jia-Yi,
thus its *qi* is named **Green Dragon**.
Its *qi* ascends from the **back spine**, **piercing the left meridian**,
and **enters the *Shénmén*** (神门).
The **Green Dragon’s *qi*** is the **Liver’s *qi***.
The **Green Dragon’s *qi*** enters the **eyes**,
where it **transforms into *mì*** (汨),
the **true Wood**.
The **residual *qi*** of *mì* flows into the **upper left gum**,
where it is **as small as a millet grain**—
this is called **Returning Elixir**.

The **Lungs** belong to the **Metal phase** of Geng-Xin,
thus its *qi* is named **White Tiger**.
Its *qi* ascends from the **back spine**, **piercing the right meridian**,
and **enters the *Xuánmén*** (玄门).
The **White Tiger’s *qi*** is the **Lung’s *qi***.
The **White Tiger’s *qi*** enters the **nose**,
where it **transforms into *tì*** (涕),
the **true Metal**.
The **residual *qi*** of *tì* flows into the **upper right gum**,
where it is **as small as a millet grain**—
this is called **Metal Essence**.

The **Heart** belongs to the **Fire phase** of Bing-Ding,
thus its *qi* is named **Vermilion Bird**.
Its *qi* ascends from the **front abdomen**, **along the left meridian**,
and **reaches the *Tiěniú*** (铁牛).
The **Vermilion Bird’s *qi*** is the **Heart’s *qi***.
The **Vermilion Bird’s *qi*** enters the **tongue**,
where it **transforms into blood**,
the **true Fire**.
The **residual *qi*** of blood flows into the **left side beneath the tongue**—
this is called **Divine Water**.

The **Kidneys** belong to the **Water phase** of Ren-Gui,
thus its *qi* is named **Dark Tortoise**.
Its *qi* ascends from the **front abdomen**, **along the left meridian**,
and **reaches the *Bōrěchuán*** (般若船).
The **Dark Tortoise’s *qi*** is the **Kidney’s *qi***.
The **Dark Tortoise’s *qi*** enters the **ears**,
where it **transforms into *jīng*** (精),
the **true Water**.
The **residual *qi*** of *jīng* flows into the **right side beneath the tongue**—
this is called **Flowering Pool**.

The **Spleen** belongs to the **Earth phase** of Wu-Ji,
thus its *qi* is named **Soaring Serpent**.
Its *qi* ascends from the **back spine**, **piercing both meridians**,
and **reaches the *Níhúan*** (泥丸).
The **Soaring Serpent’s *qi*** is the **Spleen’s *qi***.
The **Soaring Serpent’s *qi*** enters the **brain**,
where it **transforms into *xián*** (涎),
the **true Earth**.
The **residual *qi*** of *xián* flows into the **upper and lower lips**—
this is called **Yellow Sprout**.

What are the **Four Symbols**?
The **Metal Elder** is **saliva** (唾);
The **Yellow Matron** is **spittle** (涎);
The **Infant** is **essence** (精);
The **Amazed Maiden** is **blood** (血).

A **person’s day and night** consist of **twelve hours**,
sometimes with longer nights and shorter days,
sometimes with longer days and shorter nights.
Each hour contains **eight *kè*** (刻),
each *kè* has **sixty *fēn*** (分),
so the **twelve hours** total **ninety-six *kè***,
with **Gān-Kūn** (乾坤) and **Gèn-Sùn** (艮巽) accounting for **four *kè*** and twenty *fēn*.
Four times six is twenty-four,
so **two hundred and forty-eight *fēn***,
this is the **unified hundred *kè*** (百刻).

**Each breath**—its **inhalation and exhalation**—
is **three inches long**,
thus one breath is **one *xī*** (息),
one *xī* is **one *zhū*** (铢) of Fire.
Twenty-four breaths are **one *liǎng*** (两) of Fire,
three hundred and eighty-four breaths are **one *jīn*** (斤) of Fire,
and **thirteen thousand five hundred breaths** are **true Fire**:
thirty-five *jīn*, two *liǎng*, twelve *zhū*.
The *qi* of **one hour** is **six thousand seven hundred and fifty inches long**,
and **twelve hours** make it **eighty-one thousand inches long**.

Within the **hundred *kè*** of day and night,
**fix the *Èrbā*** (二八) **Gate**,
**Refine the Great Elixir** with Seven Materials,
thus forming **Seven Treasures**—
this is the **scheme of *Bāyīn Bāyáng*** (八阴八阳).

**Zǐ** (子) is **eight *kè*** of **Yang**—
the **Black Tortoise**;
**Chǒu** (丑) is **eight *kè*** of **Yin**;
**Gěn** (艮) is **one *kè*** of **Yang**;
**Yín** (寅) is **eight *kè*** of **Yang**;
**Mǎo** (卯) is **eight *kè*** of **Yin**—
the **Green Dragon**;
**Chén** (辰) is **eight *kè*** of **Yang**;
**Sùn** (巽) is **one *kè*** of **Yin**;
**Wèi** (巳) is **eight *kè*** of **Yin**;
**Wǔ** (午) is **eight *kè*** of **Yang**—
the **Crimson Phoenix**;
**Wèi** (未) is **eight *kè*** of **Yin**;
**Kūn** (坤) is **one *kè*** of **Yin**;
**Shēn** (申) is **eight *kè*** of **Yang**;
**Yǒu** (酉) is **eight *kè*** of **Yin**—
the **White Crane**;
**Xū** (戌) is **eight *kè*** of **Yang**;
**Qián** (乾) is **one *kè*** of **Yang**;
**Hài** (亥) is **eight *kè*** of **Yin**.

The *Laozi* says:
**"Cultivating the body** begins by **nourishing the spirit**,
**Nourishing the spirit** begins by **nourishing the *qi***,
**Nourishing the *qi*** begins by **nourishing the brain**,
**Nourishing the brain** begins by **nourishing the Spleen**,
**Nourishing the Spleen** begins by **nourishing the essence**,
**Nourishing the essence** begins by **nourishing the saliva**,
**Nourishing the saliva** begins by **nourishing the water**."

**Water** is the **Fluid of the Flowering Pool**,
the **refined essence of the Original *Qi*** (元气).
**Water** resides in the **Lungs**,
where it **transforms into saliva** (唾),
**white in color**, symbolizing **Metal**,
constantly **consumed by the Heart’s meridian**.

Thus, its **saliva flows into the Heart** and **transforms into blood**,
**red in color**, symbolizing **Fire**,
constantly **controlled by the Kidney’s meridian**.

Thus, its **blood flows into the Kidneys** and **transforms into essence**,
**black in color**, symbolizing **Water**,
constantly **influenced by the Spleen’s meridian**.

Thus, its **essence flows into the Spleen** and **transforms into spittle** (涎),
**yellow in color**, symbolizing **Earth**,
constantly **controlled by the Liver’s meridian**.

Thus, its **spittle flows into the eyes** and **transforms into *mì*** (汨),
**green in color**, symbolizing **Wood**.

The **brain** has **two meridians** descending to the **back spine**,
**reaching the *Qìhǎi*** (气海) **one inch and three *fēn*** below the navel.
The **Sea** is where **spirit, *qi*, and essence** are **concentrated**.

Thus, it is said:
**"Water nourishes all things**,
but **when water is exhausted**, all things **wither**."

**Original *Qi*** (元气) that has not yet **circulated freely**,
cannot **fully explore its subtle functions**.
**Original *Qi*** is the **life essence** of a person.
Its **nature** belongs to the **Spleen**,
the **Spleen** emanates from the **will** (意),
and **will** arises—**the Heart cannot hold it back**.

When one **aligns with the True Way**, one **realizes the nature of awareness**.

What are the **True Five Phases** refined in the furnace?
**Earth**—the White Tiger;
**Heaven**—the Red Phoenix, the Yellow Mother, the Black Tortoise;
**Wind**—the Azure Dragon;
**Mountain**—[itself].

What are the **True Five Phases of the Eight Trigrams**?
**Earth**—the White Primordial;
**Heaven**—the Red Dragon, the Central Palace, the Tortoise Entering the Sea;
**Xùn**—the Azure Serpent;
**Mountain**—[itself].

What are the **Eight Trigrams of the True Five Phases** entering the crucible?
**Kūn (Earth)**—the Small Intestine, the Lungs, the Large Intestine;
**Qián (Heaven)**—the Heart;
**Gèn (Mountain)**—the Kidneys;
**Xùn (Wind)**—the Liver, the Gallbladder, the Bladder.

The **body** is the **empty dwelling of spirit and *qi***;
*Qi* is the **father of spirit**;
Spirit is the **mother of *qi***.
When **spirit and *qi*** are **preserved**, longevity follows;
When **refined to the Original Root**, sainthood is achieved.

Those who **cultivate the body** must **grasp the Five Phases** and **understand the Eight Trigrams**.

I use **three hundred eighty-four *liǎng* of True Fire**, within to correspond to the numbers of the trigrams and lines.

Now, the Eight Trigrams arise from the Liver:
The Liver, **shaking (Zhèn)**, becomes **thunder**;
The Gallbladder, **Xùn**, becomes **wind**;
The Heart, **Lì**, becomes **fire**;
The Small Intestine, **Kūn**, becomes **earth**;
The Lungs, **Duì**, become **marsh**;
The Large Intestine, **Qián**, becomes **heaven**;
The Kidneys, **Kàn**, become **water**;
The Bladder, **Gèn**, becomes **mountain**.

Thus, the Liver **generates seven children** in the **Mao (Zhèn) Azure Dragon** position:
The Gallbladder **constantly**, the Heart **prosperous**, the Small Intestine **prepared**, the Lungs **returning**, the Large Intestine **great strength**, the Kidneys **dissolving**, the Bladder **slight excess**.

Thus, the Gallbladder **generates seven children** in the **Wèi (Xùn) Wind** position:
The Heart **family**, the Small Intestine **observing**, the Lungs **inner trust**, the Large Intestine **small accumulation**, the Kidneys **dispersing**, the Bladder **gradual**, the Liver **benefit**.

Thus, the Heart **generates seven children** in the **Wǔ (Lì) Vermilion Bird** position:
The Small Intestine **advancing**, the Lungs **contrary**, the Large Intestine **great abundance**, the Kidneys **unfinished**, the Bladder **traveling**, the Liver **biting**, the Gallbladder **the cauldron**.

Thus, the Small Intestine **generates seven children** in the **Kūn (Earth)** position:
The Lungs **approaching**, the Large Intestine **peace**, the Kidneys **teacher**, the Bladder **modest**, the Liver **repeating**, the Gallbladder **ascending**, the Heart **bright darkness**.

Thus, the Lungs **generate seven children** in the **Yǒu (Duì) White Tiger** position:
The Large Intestine **centered**, the Kidneys **restrained**, the Bladder **harmony**, the Liver **following**, the Gallbladder **great excess**, the Heart **transforming**, the Small Intestine **gathering**.

Thus, the Large Intestine **generates seven children** in the **Qián (Heaven)** position:
The Kidneys **litigation**, the Bladder **pursuing**, the Liver **no deception**, the Gallbladder **encountering**, the Heart **harmonious**, the Small Intestine **blocked**, the Lungs **treading**.

Thus, the Kidneys **generate seven children** in the **Kàn (Water) True Warrior** position:
The Bladder **contesting**, the Liver **beginning**, the Gallbladder **well**, the Heart **already accomplished**, the Small Intestine **comparing**, the Lungs **restraint**, the Large Intestine **waiting**.

Thus, the Bladder **generates seven children** in the **Gèn (Mountain)** position:
The Liver **nourishing**, the Gallbladder **entangled**, the Heart **abundant**, the Small Intestine **peeling**, the Lungs **damaged**, the Large Intestine **great accumulation**, the Kidneys **enveloped**.

These **Eight Trigrams within**, each with seven children,
The **sixty-four hexagrams**, each with seven children,
Form **seven husbands and seven wives**—
This is the **sevenfold return**, named the **Seven Treasures**.

The **Seven Treasures** are:
*Qi*, blood, essence, **saliva**, **fluids**, **tears**, **spittle**.

Refined with **three hundred eighty-four *liǎng* of True Fire**,
In **nine years**, success is achieved.

I possess the **diagram of the True Five Phases entering the crucible**.

**Qián, Kūn, Gèn, Xùn**—the **four corners**.
**North** is **Kàn**, the Black Tortoise, belonging to **Hài, Zǐ, Chǒu**.
The hexagrams of **Hài** are **Kàn, Zhèn, Kūn, Duì**;
The hexagrams of **Zǐ** are **Jiē, Huī, Xiǎo Chú, Fù**;
The hexagrams of **Chǒu** are **Dà Chú, Jiě, Dǐng, Lín**.

To the **right, Water**; to the **left, Wind**—

To the **right, Earth**; to the **left, Heaven**—

**Sitting in a quiet chamber**, **holding fast**, **striking the teeth thirty-six times**,
When **saliva first emerges**, take **nine large steps**, swallow **eighteen to twenty-eight mouthfuls** of the **glossy** kind through the **Heavenly Gate**.
When the **moon rises**, do likewise—
This can **seize the creative mechanism of Heaven and Earth**,
**Assisting the Golden Elixir**, **drawing upon spirit and *qi***.

**The Golden Purity Chapter**:
The **supreme mystery of the Dao** is none other than **Primordial Oneness**.
**Sealing its gate** determines the **abode of life and death**.

**Emperor Purple Yang of the Vermilion Phoenix** says:
**Original *Qi*** encompasses the **thirteen orifices**.
The **mouth** is the **gate and threshold** of the **viscera**;
The **tongue** is the **barrier and lock** of the **viscera**.
The **three pass gates** are the **city of entry and exit**,
The **six palaces** are the **doors of departure and return**!

**Excessive five flavors** weary the teeth and **dry the mouth**,
**Grind the throat** and **consumes the stomach**,
**Dull the intestines** and **agitate the heart**—
Thus, **blocking Duì and closing the pass** to **guard the center** is **proper**.

**The Golden Purity Chapter (continued)**:

The **nose** is the **window and aperture**—
When the **window and aperture** are serene, **spirit and thought** are at ease,
And **spirit and thought** at ease bring **clarity and stillness**;
Thus, **harmonizing the hundred pass gates** brings **eternal life**.

The **heart** has **nine functions**,
To **drive the nine orifices**.
The **sage** attains **longevity and tranquil purpose**,
By **preserving the heart**.

The **large intestine** is **one zhang** with **two chi**,
The **abode of Primordial *Qi***.
When **food fills it**, it **stands upright**,
When **food empties**, it **leans askew**—
**Thickened**, it **resists illness**,
**Thinned**, it **wastes the form**.
Thus, the **sage** seeks to **thicken the abdomen**,
For when the **abdomen is thickened without residue**, **death does not come**.
What does **thickening the abdomen** mean?
It means **abandoning the five flavors**.

The **small intestine** is **eight chi**,
The **source of body fluids**.
It **connects with the hundred pass gates**.
Hence, the **large intestine** is the **cavern**,
The **small intestine** is the **orifice**—
**Sealing the cavern and closing the orifice** brings **eternal life**.

The **heart’s *Qi*** reaches the **kidneys** and **unites with the ears**,
Thus, **excessive listening** wearies the **heart**,
And **closing the ears** brings **tranquil purpose**.

The **lungs** are the **abode of body fluids**.
The **five viscera**—if **followed**, bring **well-being**,
If **contradicted**, bring **illness**,
If **dried**, bring **heat**,
If **moistened**, bring **coldness**.

**Food and drink** are received by the **spleen**,
**Digestion and assimilation** by the **stomach**—
Thus, the **spleen** receives **yang *Qi*** and **shakes leftward**,
The **stomach** receives **yin *Qi*** and **moves rightward**.
When the **stomach is closed**, **death comes**,
When the **spleen’s shaking reaches its limit**, the **soul is lost**.
Ah! The **five viscera** depend on the **spleen**,
And **life and death** depend on the **stomach**.
The **stomach’s tranquility** lies in **abandoning the five flavors**.
The **five viscera’s well-being** comes from **spirit**,
Their **agitation** from **qi**.
When **qi is full**, **spirit is tranquil**.
**Spirit’s tranquility** is the **Dao of eternal life**.
The **Dao knows no greater mystery** than **Primordial Oneness**.
**Primordial Oneness** is **Primordial *Qi***—
It is the **gate and threshold of life and death**,
The **barrier and lock** of **sealing and opening**.

**Pò** is **yin**, **hún** is **yang**—
When **awake**, one **commands the *hún***,
When **asleep**, one **commands the *pò***—
Thus, the **true person** does not **dream**,
For they **preserve the *hún*** and **quiet the *pò***.
**Not to lose** means **preserving the *hún***,
**Not to think** means **quieting the *pò***.
Thus, **true *qi*** remains **constant** and **death does not come**.

To **tranquilize the body**, one **tranquilizes the heart**,
For if the **heart is not tranquil**, the **true essence** is **lost**.
Thus, **tranquilizing the body** means **preserving the true essence**.
The **true person** who **transforms in the womb** and **rises from the bones**,
Their **qi** is **refined as essential as gold and stone**,
Never **exceeding the nine-one count**.
I have the **Dragon-Tiger Precept**:
**Green Dragon** winding, winding—

**Sinking and floating**, undetermined,
**Coming and going**, no trace to follow.
**Descend**, it reaches the **nine abysses**,

**White Tiger** is **frail and delicate**,

The **Tiger’s power**,

When it **meets the Green Dragon**, **its head bows in an instant**.
The **Dragon passes through nine fires**, the **Tiger submits without confusion**;
**They embrace mutually**, **as husband and wife**.
The **Dragon does not transform without water**,
The **Tiger does not subdue without fire**—
**Water** is the **Dragon’s den**,
**Fire** is the **Tiger’s medium**—
**Nature follows its course**,
**Harmony unites like clay**—
The **Dragon soars to the heavens**,
The **Tiger mourns and weeps**.

**Fire transforms into earth**,
**White Tiger solidifies its form**,
**Blazing flames**—

**Emerald-green, pure-white**,

**Now yellow, now green**,

**Focus the heart**, **lock the will**—

**The Black Tortoise Precept** says:

**Like rain, like clouds**—
**Capable of the ordinary, capable of the sage**,

**Entering fire**, it **does not change**,

**Nine Dragon’s path**, **Eight Guàn’s ford**,
**The leader of elixir**, **guest of golden fluid**—

**Can be yang, can be yin**,

**One, seven, five, three**,
**As the *jì* and *gāng***—
**Response lies within**,
**Manifestation spreads without**.

**The Precept of Earth Uniting with Heaven’s Count** says:
**The Dragon-Tiger Dao**,
**The scripture of heaven and earth**—

**Must be **fixed in brightness**—

When **yin and yang are consumed and refined**—

The **heavenly Dao** **intersects**...

「Eight and nine having returned,

**Sun and moon’s** grandeur,

「Desiring to enter yet unable to—

The **method** of **Golden Liquid** lies within **Nine Springs** and **Seven Stones**.
**Nine Springs** and **Seven Stones**—

When **True** is **stored** and **yin-yang** are not **extinguished**,

**Still-Gold Chapter**

The primal ancestor of **Heaven** and **Earth**, the numinous essence of the cosmos—
Within its depths lies the utmost **precision**, hidden in the **void** and **dark**.

The **Moon Hare**’s son, Liu Zhaoyuan of Yan, said:
*"The **Still-Gold** is the **qi** of **Heaven** and **Earth**, the numinous essence of the cosmos;
The primal ancestor of **Heaven** and **Earth**, the essence of **Sun** and **Moon**.*

Within its **flickering** form, it is contained by the **Two Poles**;
Within its **fathomless** depths, it embraces the **One Thing**.

Pairing **Jia** and **Geng**, fixing **Li** and **Kan**;
Severing **Water** and **Fire**, spreading **flame** and **frost**;
Ranking **Lord** and **Minister**, unleashing **Dragon** and **Tiger**;
Causing **yin** and **yang** to **return** **lead** and **mercury**;
With fixed divisions and unerring seasons—
Nine **transformations** yield **Golden Elixir**, three years yield **Jade Elixir**.

Thus, what I call **"Return"** is the **Return** to the **Seven Sources**’ subtlety,
And the **Nine Transformations**’ **Heavenly Pass**.

**Gold** is the **true lead** of **cinnabar-mercury**, the **true elixir** of **yellow sprouts**.
Here, the **Nine Numinous Deities** of **Spirit** gather under **Non-Action’s** single **Master**,
All converging in this **scroll**.

**Secret Verse**:
*"South and North interlace, West binds—creation’s flow outstrips Yu’s feat;
One steed gallops past the Three Isles, six **Deities** linger in the Five Lakes;
Boiling, wrapping, refining—**Elixir** and **Snow** are sealed,
Purifying **Flower Pool**, dispersing the **Black Wind**;
Lightning flashes, opening the **Luminous World**,
Only at night does the **True Dragon** reveal itself."*

**Master of Supreme Wandering** said:
*"How profound! This is the **Still-Gold’s** subtlest mystery!"

---

**Return-to-Origin: Upper Scroll**

At its origin, **Original Qi** is as large as a **millet grain**;
When **gathered**, it forms; when **dispersed**, it decays.

**Humans** are one of the **Three Powers**.
**Heaven** does not collapse, **Earth** does not sink—yet mortals perish in multitudes. Why?

**Humans** share **Spirit-Life** of **43,200 days**, **Divine Qi** of **36,000 **Original Yang****, and **True Qi** weighing **384 *cai* (38.4 *jin*)**,
Resonating internally with **Heaven**—yet they remain unaware, letting it scatter,
Thus crossing the **Midway** and entering the **Pass of Death**.

**Heaven** is the **Six Yangs** undisturbed, yet to act or disperse.
If one cultivates thus, the **True Immortal’s Way** is attained.

From age **fifteen to twenty-five**, if **dispersal** ceases not, **48 *cai*** are lost,
And what remains aligns with **Encounter** (*Lǜn*).
If **lust** intensifies for ten years, **48 *cai*** are lost,
And what remains aligns with **Withdrawal** (*Dùn*).
If **nurturing** is unknown, another ten years pass, **48 *cai*** are lost,
And what remains aligns with **Opposition** (*Pǐ*), the **Central Qi** of **Heaven** and **Earth**.
If **nurturing** is unknown, another five years pass, **72 *cai*** are lost,
And what remains aligns with **Observation** (*Guàn*).
If **nurturing** is unknown, another five years pass, **96 *cai*** are lost,
And what remains aligns with **Decay** (*Bó*).
If **nurturing** is unknown, the **64 Hexagrams** reach their end—**Original Qi** is exhausted,
And it aligns with **Earth** (*Kūn*).
**Earth** is **pure yin**.
Only **An Valley** sustains life—its name is **Gǒushòu** (*"Temporary Longevity"*).

Yet if a **Clear Teacher** reveals the **Mysterious Gate**, one may yet approach the **Way**.
The *Yellow Court Scripture* says:
*"Even at twenty years, one may still **Return**—this is what is meant."*

After the **Southern Solstice**, I secretly draw **Heaven** and **Earth’s** **True Qi**, calling it **"Ascension"**;
At the **Northern Solstice**, I call it **"Descension."**
By **year**, **month**, **day**, and **hour**, all contain **yin** and **yang**.
The **year** marks the **Two Solstices**,
The **month** marks the **Two Crescents**,
The **day** marks from **Child** to before **Horse**,
And the **hour** follows likewise.
Thus, following the **Law**, one may **compensate** and **Return yin** to the **Intestines**.

A **hundred-year-old tree**, its **sap** drained and withered—
If I graft its **young shoots**, it thrives anew.
How is **Human** different?

If one **consolidates qi** and **nurtures essence**,
**Essence** nurtures **Spirit**, **Spirit** clings to the **Body**—
Then **qi** abides eternally.

If one obtains a **Clear Teacher** to impart the **Secret Key**,
And follows, cultivating with **Child** as the pivot,
Turning the **Heavenly Cycle** in due measure—
After one year of refining the **Golden Cauldron**, **Original Qi** increases by **48 *cai***,
Aligning with **Recovery** (*Fǔ*).
After two years, the **Red Dragon** moves, inheriting **Spring’s qi**,
As **mist** descends, **sea-waters** surge at **Pénglái**,
The **Golden Cauldron** opens, using the **Gentle Wind**,
And **Qi** increases by **48 *cai***, aligning with **Approach** (*Lín*).
After three years, the **Two Qi** intermingle—
The **Cauldron** radiates brilliance.
**Dragon** roars, **Tiger** howls, **Souls** flash like **lightning**,
And **Qi** increases by **48 *cai***, aligning with **Great Harmony** (*Tài*), the **symbol of **Established Spring***.
If cultivation is assiduous, **Qi** increases by **72 *cai***,
Aligning with **Great Strength** (*Dàzhuàng*), where **Fire’s** light is full,
The **Red Dragon** emerges, **wind** and **thunder** multiply,
**Jars** hold **Sun** and **Moon**, **Cauldron’s** waves turn **emerald**.
**Great Strength** is the **symbol of **Established Summer***.
Thus, **Evil Qi** cannot enter—**Qi** increases by **92 *cai***,
Aligning with **Centrality** (*Yǎo*), where **White Tiger** is subdued and **Green Dragon** bound.
After six years of accumulation, the **Inner Recovery** aligns with **Heaven** again.

Then **Fire’s** light blazes—**the furnace** turns **red**.
At **Child** and **Horse** hours, the **True Dragon** and **Tiger** are recognized,
And one may **divide** them at will.

Yet the **essence** of **True Cultivation** lies in **abandoning greed** and **cherishing love-desire**.
Once cultivated:
One year—**essence** is renewed,
Two years—**marrow** is renewed,
Three years—**bones** are renewed,
Four years—**sinews** are renewed,
Five years—**hair** is renewed,
Six years—**form** is renewed.
**Inner qi** does not exit, **outer qi** does not enter—
This is called the **True Person**.
