**Return-to-Origin: Lower Scroll**

**Master of Supreme Wandering** said:
*"The **Way of Change**—how subtle and profound!"*

In ancient times, **hexagrams** were formed with **two, three, four**,
Or with **three, four, five**—
This is the **mutual transformation**.

The **Perfect Person’s** method of **True Cultivation** begins with **Upper Nine** as the head, **Initial Six** as the feet, and **Two, Three, Four, Five** as the body. The transformations of the six lines flow cyclically, like the **Nourishing Vessels** and **Defensive Vessels** moving through the four seasons.

Thus, the sixty-four **hexagrams** align with the **Heaven** and **Earth**. If I master their numbers, I shall harmonize with **Heaven** and **Earth**.

What sustains humanity is **form**; what sustains **form** is **qi**.
When **qi** is gathered, **form** coalesces;
When **qi** disperses, **form** decays.
To know what sustains and to **nurture** it—
Is this not the **Way of Change**?

My dwelling should be on **soft mats**, my clothing thick,
And I must conform to the **season’s** needs.
Thus, at **Winter Solstice** or on **Day Jiazi**,
After **Zi**, I loosen my clothes, bind my hair, and sit cross-legged.

Binding my hair—**drawing in vital qi**.
I tap my teeth thirty-six times, rubbing my palms together,
Then warm them and wipe my eyes,
Cover my ears for a moment—
A faint sound, like a bell, arises within.
I do this three times,
Then rub my face until warm,
Slowly move my tongue to **lick the upper palate** twelve times,
The **lower palate** twelve times,
The **outer teeth and inner upper lip** twelve times,
The **inner lower lip** twelve times—
This is called **The Vermilion Dragon’s Plowing**.

When saliva arises, I rinse my mouth,
Filling it with warmth, then swallow three times.
Each swallow must draw in **inner qi**—
**Inner qi** is taken by closing the mouth and inhaling through the nose.
I send it to the **Lower Elixir Field** beneath the navel,
Imagining a **cauldron** and guiding the **qi** inside.
Then I imagine the **heart-fire** as a flame descending to ignite the **cauldron**,
Thus thirty-six breaths form **One Yang Line**.

Next, I repeat the licking as before,
Rinsing and swallowing again—
Twenty-four breaths form **One Yin Line**.
I do this five times, accumulating **Five Yin Lines**—
This is called **Return**.

When the **Return** **hexagram** is complete,
I rest my breath briefly,
Imagining my **qi** as yellow clouds swirling above the **spleen and stomach**.
After a while, I imagine the **qi** returning to beneath the navel,
Its form like yellow soil covering the **cauldron**.
Then I comb my hair a hundred strokes,
Lie down for a short while—
Thus, the day’s work is done.

Each month completes one **hexagram**, cycling endlessly:
When the month reaches **Zi**, it is **Return**;
When it reaches **Chou**, it is **Taming**;
When it reaches **Yin**, it is **Peace**;
When it reaches **Mao**, it is **Great Strength**;
When it reaches **Chen**, it is **The Clinging**;
When it reaches **Si**, it is **Heaven**;
When it reaches **Wu**, it is **Encounter**;
When it reaches **Wei**, it is **Retreat**;
When it reaches **Shen**, it is **Opposition**;
When it reaches **You**, it is **Contemplation**;
When it reaches **Xu**, it is **Shedding**;
When it reaches **Hai**, it is **Earth**.

**Jade Vessel Chapter**
The essence of **Golden Elixir** lies in **Divine Water, Flowering Pool**—
Speaking of its use, it relies on **water and fire**.

**Zhongtiao Zi**, whose surname was **Zhang**,
Was later hidden in **Zhongtiao**, hence his name.
I had heard of the **Golden Elixir’s** essence in **Divine Water, Flowering Pool**,
But I did not grasp its meaning.
Later, I met **Taiyi True Person**, named **Yuangui**, at **Taishan**,
Who revealed its secret:

*"Stone is firm, yet water is yielding—
Which of the Five Phases will rest?
How do I know the virtuous maiden’s fate is submerged?
The stone’s form lies buried in the sand,
While water flows away."*

He then asked: *"Do you know of the **Flowering Pool**?
**Flower** is **fire**, **Pool** is **water**—
They are the **lofty keys** of **Heaven** and **Earth**."*

**Zhongtiao Zi** said: *"What use does **Golden Water, Flowering Pool**—
The Five Phases’ **metal and water**—have?"*

**Taiyi True Person** replied:
*"All things naturally embrace **yin** and **yang** to form.
Without the **essence-qi** of **sun and moon**,
Without the maturation of **yin** and **yang**,
How could there be birth and growth?

Moreover, humanity’s life begins in the womb,
Where **yin** and **yang** interact to form.
After ten months, when **yin** and **yang** are complete, life emerges.
The **True Nature** is like **mercury** hidden in sand,
Born from **true gold**—
Thus, the **Golden Elixir’s** marvel lies in **yin** and **yang**,
Refining **lead** into **mercury**."

Clarify the Five Phases,
Discern the **qi** of seasons—**cold and heat** interacting,
**Yin** and **yang** mutually applied.
**Yin** obtains **yang** and matures,
**Yang** obtains **yin** and ascends—
This is the **essence of Returning Elixir**.

Wood has **rigidity and hollowness**,
Things have **sweetness and bitterness**—
Though they share **yin** and **yang qi**, their natures differ.
Thus, the **Golden Elixir** must align with the **mysteries of sun and moon**,
With **Dragon** and **Tiger** rising and falling,
With **water** and **fire** in motion.
If one attunes to the **proper seasonal signs**, great success follows.

**Zhongtiao Zi** asked: *"Where does **lead** and **mercury** come from?"*

**Taiyi True Person** said:
*"**Lead** is the **White Tiger**;
**Mercury** is the **Green Dragon**—
Yet they are not ordinary substances.
**Mercury** is born from **gold**,
**Gold sand** is produced from **lead**—
The treasure of **long life**.
This **Way** must be passed only to those of **moral virtue, compassion, and wisdom**.
But those who are **arrogant, cruel, greedy, or domineering**—
Who **bully others, indulge in wine and lust, or are miserly**—
Should not be taught."*

After **Zhongtiao Zi** received the **Way**,
Two years later, he met **Ying’er**, the servant of **Shuangyang County Clerk Cao**.
The servant was **Taiyi’s** attendant,
Sent to complete **Zhongtiao Zi’s** cultivation.

He said to **Zhongtiao Zi**:
*"The **Three Stars** are **water**—
The **White Tiger’s** essence,
Descending as a treasure.
If refined, it can become **Returning Elixir**.
The **Room Star** is **wood**—
The **Green Dragon’s** essence.
When **sun and moon** align,
And **water and fire** pair,
They unite as **husband and wife**—
Those who gather them return together,
Those who separate them struggle to reunite."*

The **gold, lead, silver, mercury, and cinnabar**—
these are the treasures that ascend to **sainthood**.
**Zhongtiao Zi** was suddenly struck with great alarm,
and so the **True Person of Taiyi** revealed to him the **secret of water and fire**.

The servant said:
*"This is the **vital essence of the Great Sun**,
which transforms heaven and earth,
and commands ghosts and spirits.
When cultivated, **clouds rise, winds stir, dragons and tigers unite**,
and **changes occur in secret resonance**—
the **Five Phases** harmonize,
and only **heavenly beings and humans** can comprehend it."

**Zhongtiao Zi** asked:
*"When will my **medicine** be complete?"*

The servant replied:
*"When the furnace is formed, **One Yang** arises,
and **pure Yin** is exhausted.
**Heaven and Earth’s two *qi*** are divided between south and north,
and **Yin and Yang** establish their positions,
holding the **central alignment of Sun and Moon**.

The servant further instructed him in the **Ten Chapters of Taiyi’s Jade Vessel**.
Its essence is thus:
*"The **Room Star** and **Day Star** are the **Green Dragon** and **White Tiger**,
while **Sun and Moon** are the **Jade Emperor** and **Black Tortoise**.
To know the **Great Dao’s** foundation, the **mysterious origin**,
one must obtain the **central *Wu* and *Ji* Earth**—
the **Room Star** and **Day Star**,
the **Sun and Moon**—
all are called **lead and mercury**.

In the **Great Elixir Scripture**:
**Divine *qi*** is the **medicine**,
and **heaven and earth** are the **furnace**.
Observe the **water clock**,
and harmonize the **symbols of the *Yijing***—
**Yi Cheng Zi**, surnamed **Peng Zhongkan**,
a native of **Tiantai**,
once encountered a **perfected sage**,
who told him:
*'The **Dao of Non-Action** surpasses nothing more than **golden elixir**.
To attain the **Dao**, one must follow the **golden symbols**.*
Thus, he gathered **gold** from **Lishui**,
sought **jade** from **Kungang**,
and only then could he proceed.

**Yi Cheng Zi** understood its essence,
and so recorded its words:
*'The **Great Medicine** is **lead and mercury**.
The **origin of lead and mercury**,
through the **refinement and transformation of the Five Phases**,
is achieved by dividing **mercury** to form **lead**.
Thus, **lead** is the **mother of the Five Metals**.
**Lead** has dross—
when the **Five Metals** approach it, they wither and turn black.
Yet **true white gold** emerges
from the **grinding of lead**,
refined by **water and fire** into its genuine form.
Thus, when **gold and mercury** blend,
they soften and yield like clay.

**Lead and mercury** are **father and son**,
and when they meet,
they become **husband and wife**—
this is the principle of **mutual control**.
They cling to each other,
never parting,
as when **mercury meets gold and settles**.
**Lead is refined to reveal gold**,
and **mercury is purified without loss**—
this is the **Great Medicine**.

The **Scripture** says:
*'The **Dao** generates **One**,
**One** generates **Two**,
**Two** generates **Three**,
**Three** generates all things.*
Thus, one knows that **lead and mercury** share a **single origin**,
for this is the **One generating Two**.
Each occupies its own realm,
embodying the **principle of mutual affinity**.
The **Scripture** also says:
*'The **crane’s cry** lingers in the **Yin**,
and its young harmonize with it.*
Does it not refer to this?
Thus, **lead and mercury** are **Yin and Yang**,
**floating and sinking**,
the **single origin of two substances**.*

In human life, **divine *qi*** is the root,
and **blood and *qi*** are the foundation.
For those who **practice the Dao**,
**divine *qi*** is the **Great Medicine**.

**Lead and mercury** are the **golden elixir**,
the **ultimate attainment** of the ancients.
If one does not know the **golden elixir**
but only clings to the **Room Star techniques**,
one may live to a hundred years
but cannot attain **immortality**—
why is this?
Because there is no **divine *qi***.

**Lead and mercury** are **Sun and Moon**;
**Sun and Moon** are **water and fire**;
**water and fire** are **Dragon and Tiger**;
**Dragon and Tiger** are **Yin and Yang**;
**Yin and Yang** are **heaven and earth**;
**heaven and earth** are **Qian and Kun**—
**Qian and Kun** are the **gateway to the *Yijing***,
the **parents of all hexagrams**.

The **Qian Transmission** says:
*'There are **six times** that align with its position—
why is this?
There are **heavenly times** and **earthly times**,
which, when **scattered**, become **three**,
and when **unified**, become **one**.
The **song** says:
*"The **second and eighth** are **Zi**, the **third and seventh** are **Hai**,
the **fourth and sixth** are **Xu**, the **fifth and tenth** are **You** and **Dui**,
the **ninth and proper** are **Chou**, the **eleventh and twelfth** are **Le**—
the **Great Void** unites at **Mao** within.
These are the **twelve heavenly times**.*

Again, it says:
*"Five watches, two marks—
the **ninth month** is proper.
The **hare and parrot** mark the **four sounds of the water clock**,
and at **three watches and seven marks**, the **flat dawn** is **Yin time**,
while **four watches and six marks** mark **Sunrise**—
no distinction from **Yin time**.
At the **fifth month**, the **Sun’s elevation** is three *zhang* above the earth.
At the **tenth and twelfth months**, **four watches and two marks**,
as if encountering the **eleventh month**,
when **four watches and the first mark** align with **Yin time**—
this reveals the **earthly Yin time**."*

The **Great Sun’s** **footprint** spans the **Twenty-Eight Constellations**,
moving **one degree per day and night**,
and completing a **heavenly circuit** in a year with **one fen and two li** remaining.

The **stars, celestial bodies, Sun, and Moon** flow **eastward**;
the **heavenly Dao** revolves **westward**.
In **one day and night**, heaven completes its **circuit**—
this is **384 degrees**.

The **Great Yin** (Moon) has **four seasonal nodes** in a month,
from **new moon** to the **fifteenth day**,
one **slow and one swift**,
and from the **sixteenth day** to the **end of the month**,
also one **slow and one swift**.
If they do not **align**, it is not **new moon**;
if they do not **oppose**, it is not **full moon**.

When **slow**, it moves **twelve degrees per day**;
when **swift**, it moves **fourteen degrees and seventy-four and a half fractions per day**;
when **evenly paced**, it moves **thirteen degrees and thirty-seven fractions per day**.

Those who **practice the Dao** must observe the **degrees of Sun and Moon’s movement**,
their **orbits, waxing, and waning**,
and the **cycles of the Five Phases**—
why is this?
The **Four Seasons** have their **symbolic nodes**,
and the **Five Phases** have their **terminal numbers**.
When one attains the **Dao**, the **law of the Great Yin** becomes clear.

What is the **Great Yin**?
It is the **separated essence of the Sun**,
and the **Kan *Wu* Moonlight**—
Thus, **lead and mercury** are **Qian and Kun**.
**Qian** is the **father**, **Kun** is the **mother**—
those who receive the **father’s *qi*** become **male**,
those who receive the **mother’s *qi*** become **female**.
**Qian and Kun** together generate **six children**—
this is what is meant.

The **six positions** each have **thirty days** as their node.
Two and three make six—
this is **360 degrees**, the **Dao of thirty spokes converging at one hub**.

**Jia** is the **fifteenth day**,
when the **month is full**—
the **Qian symbol** appears at **dusk**.
**Yi** is the **thirtieth day**,
the **end of the month**—
this is the **loss of companions**, the **Kun symbol**.
**Bing** is the **eighth day**—
the **Gèn symbol**.
**Ding** is the **twenty-third day**—
the **Dui symbol**.
**Geng** is the **second day**—
the **reunion of companions**, the **Zhèn symbol**,
when it appears at **dusk**."

**Xīn** is the **sixteenth day**, seen at **dawn**—the **Xùn symbol**.

**Rèn** is the **empty position**; **Wù** is **Kǎn**, the **moon**.
**Guǐ** is the **empty position**.
This is the **Way**, returning to **earth**.

**Jia and Yi** complete seven cycles and return to **Ji**.
**Gēng and Xīn** complete seven cycles and return to **Wù**.
**Wù and Ji** are the **central tripod of the palace**.

Thus, it begins with **Jia and Yi** and ends with **Qián and Kūn**.

The **two bodies** follow the **sun’s path along the Yellow Way** and the **moon’s path along the Red Way**.

**Liú Hóng** said:
The **Qián symbol** has nine paths.
The **Great Sun** reaches its northernmost point at the **summer solstice**, emerging from **Yín** and entering **Xū**.
At the **winter solstice**, it reaches its southernmost point, emerging from **Chén** and entering **Shēn**.
The **heavenly wheel turns counterclockwise**, completing one revolution of day and night—**384 degrees**—
amounting to **2,932 li and 30 steps per degree**.
After the **winter solstice**, it enters **increase**; after the **summer solstice**, it enters **decrease**.

**Yì Chéngzǐ** said:
*"Is this not the Dao?"*

**Lead and mercury** are **one**.
**One** is the **origin of the Five Phases**.
The **Great Unfolding’s number** is **fifty**, yet its use is **forty-nine**—the **Five Phases**.
Each of the **Five Phases** has **five**, making **twenty-five**.
Heaven has **Five Phases**, earth has **Five Phases**—
their two positions combine, each with its **pairings**, forming **fifty**.
This is the **extreme number of the Five Phases, Twelve Positions, Three Cycles, and Yin-Yang qi**,
cycling endlessly.

The **Sage** knows **One** as **lead and mercury**,
thus **embracing One** and refining for **forty-nine days**,
until the **sacred embryo** forms in the **Earth-Thunder Recovering hexagram**—
**one yang beneath five yin**.

The **Recovering hexagram** says:
*"On the seventh day, it returns."*

Its manifestation reveals the **heart of Heaven and Earth**,
so a person’s **seven souls** are complete at **forty-nine days of life**,
and at death, the **seven souls depart** in **forty-nine days**—
this is the **Returning number**, the **extreme of yin and yang**.

Heaven and Earth are the **Five Phases**, yet neither has an **even count** in their generation.
**Qián**, the **yang essence**, is paired with **odd numbers**;
**Kūn**, the **yin essence**, is paired with **even numbers**.
**Five** is the **generative number**; **ten** is the **completing number**.
**Generating** means **mutual generation**; **overcoming** means **mutual completion**.
**Lead and mercury**—are they not the **mediators of yin and yang**?

**Qián and Kūn** are the **sun and moon**; the **sun and moon** are the **Cháng**.
There is **Cháng** only because there are **Qián and Kūn**,
and there are **Qián and Kūn** only because there is **Cháng**,
and there is **Cháng** only because there is the **Recovering hexagram**.
Thus it is said:
*"If Qián and Kūn are destroyed, the Cháng cannot be seen."*
The **Cháng** is **lead and mercury**.

From **Two Principles** come **Four Symbols**, and from **Four Symbols** come **Eight Trigrams**.
If there were no **lead and mercury**, **Qián and Kūn** would nearly cease!

The **twelve hours of day and night** total **100 moments**,
each hour divided into **sixty parts**—**eight moments** per hour.
Only **Chén, Xū, Chǒu, and Wèi** belong to **earth**, called the **Four Seasons**.
Each **double-hour** has **nine moments** for one hour,
with the **Four Seasonal double-hours** each contributing **one moment**,
divided among the **four孟 (Mèng) double-hours** as **twelve parts**,
and the **four仲季 (Zhòng-Jì) double-hours** as **twenty parts**,
leaving **twenty parts** in their original positions—
thus, each hour is **eight moments and twenty parts**.
Each **moment** yields **115 breaths**,
so eight moments make **920 breaths**,
plus the **twenty parts** of the **Zhòng-Jì double-hours**, forming **40 breaths**,
totaling **960 breaths**—this is **one hour**.

**Qí Bó** said:
*"One exhale and one inhale make one breath."*

Thus, when divided, it is **counted by parts**,
when measured by **moments**, it is **counted by moments**,
when measured by **hours**, it is **counted by hours**,
and when measured by **breaths**, it is **counted by breaths**—
so the **twelve hours** total **11,520 breaths**,
matching the **Great Unfolding’s extreme strategy of Qián-Kūn and the Five Cycles**.

Now, taking **120 breaths** as the standard,
**100 moments** naturally align with the **twelve hours of day and night**,
the **great key of yin and yang’s profound numbers**.

As for the **fire candidates of yin and yang**—
how does the **sun’s lead and mercury** compare?

The **Great Unfolding’s extreme number** spans **81 days**,
requiring **11,664 catties of charcoal**,
yielding **180**—**180 times 180**—
still resulting in **81**.
**144** remains.

A **year** has **384 days**; subtracting the **24 solar terms**,
**Kǎn and Lí** operate for **260 days**,
requiring **51,840 catties of charcoal**,
yielding **480 instances of 180**.
**81** becomes **648**—
thus, **one year’s charcoal** sustains **nine years’ days**,
and **three years’ charcoal** sustains **27 years’ days**.

**120 days** make **one cycle**, **one year** makes **three cycles**,
and **three years** make **nine cycles**.

There is a **method for refining the elixir**.
**Lead** is cast as **bait**—
so **lead** has **hooks, rods, coins, and bait**.
Without a **hook**, there is no **fishing**; without a **rod**, there is no **casting**.
Without **coins**, the fish will not rise.

**Charcoal** is the **fire’s fuel**, burned from **Fú-Sāng wood**.

**Kǎn** is **Zǐ (Child)**,
**Gèn** is **Chǒu-Yín (Ox-Tiger)**,
**Zhèn** is **Mǎo (Wood)**,
**Xùn** is **Chén-Sì (Dragon-Snake)**,
**Lí** resides centrally with **no fixed direction**,
**Kūn** is **Wèi-Shēn (Sheep-Monkey)**,
**Duì** is **Yǒu (Rooster)**,
**Qián** resides centrally with **no fixed direction**—
when observed in rotation, the **sixty-four hexagrams of Heaven and Earth** appear.

Observing the **Lunar Ordinances** reveals the **seasons of Heaven**.
In the **eleventh month**, the **sun is in Jī (Winnowing Basket)**,
setting behind the **eastern wall**,
with the **midday sun at one *hàn***,
and the **Big Dipper** aligned at the **beginning of Zǐ (Rat)**.

The **Wū Xián Classic** says:
*"The Dipper lies beneath the Celestial Pavilion,
beneath it is the **Tiānchéng Star**,
beneath the star is the **Gōu-Chén Constellation**,
and within **Gōu-Chén’s mouth** is the **Heavenly Sovereign’s Star**,
directly opposite the **Great Emperor Star**."*

The **Big Dipper** is the **Heavenly Sovereign’s Command**,
its first star is **Tiānshū (Celestial Pivot)**,
its second is **Huán (Ring)**,
its third is **Jī (Bead)**,
its fourth is **Quán (Scale)**,
its fifth is **Héng (Balance)**,
its sixth is **Wéiyáng (Enclosure of Yang)**,
and its seventh is **Yáo Guāng (Jade Light)**.

The Dipper has nine stars, but two are unseen.

Beneath it, I establish a **three-tiered altar**—
**water above, fire below**.

The *Yì (Classic of Change)* says:
*"Using nine [stars], one sees the **group of dragons without a head**—auspicious.
Again, it says:
**'Clouds follow the dragon, winds follow the tiger'**—
the **gentleman** advances in **virtue** and cultivates his **practice**,
desiring to keep pace with the times.
To **embody virtue** as **action**,
to see the **visible Way** in daily conduct.
He who knows **advancement and retreat, survival and perishing**
yet does not lose his **correctness**—
is there not only the **sage**?

The **scholar** perceives the **Dao** as if mirrored in his palm.

The **eleventh month**—**Fù (Return)**—
is the **initial nine**, **fire rising at seven *liáng***¹;
the **twelfth month**—**Lín (Approach)**—
is the **nine-two**, **fire used at fourteen *liáng***;
the **first month**—**Tài (Peace)**—
is the **nine-three**, **fire used at twenty-one *liáng***;
the **second month**—**Dà Zhuàng (Great Strength)**—
is the **nine-four**, **fire doubled**;
the **third month**—**Yāng (Central Pivot)**—
is the **nine-five**, **the month of fire’s advance**;
the **fourth month**—**Qián (Creativity)**—
is the **upper nine**, **the month of the exultant dragon**;
the **fifth month**—**Qù (Encounter)**—
is the **initial six**;
the **sixth month**—**Dùn (Withdrawal)**—
is the **six-two**;
the **seventh month**—**Pǐ (Decay)**—
is the **six-three**, **all three requiring fire’s retreat**;
the **eighth month**—**Guān (Contemplation)**—
is the **six-four**, **when fire may be drawn out**;
the **ninth month**—**Bō (Shedding)**—
is the **six-five**, **when fire may be withdrawn**;
the **tenth month**—**Kūn (Receptivity)**—
is the **upper six**, **the month of fire’s extreme retreat**.

This is the **essence of water and fire**!

The **Master Yì’s song** says:
*"Lead and mercury govern the **Qián-Kūn (Creativity-Receptivity)** affairs like hemp,
Where else seek the **Heavenly Vehicle**?
The **Nine Schools** know only **sand-drawing mercury**,
The **immortal** can **refine mercury into sand**."*

The **Dao Gun** scroll concludes here.

**Dao Gun Scroll, Volume Thirteen**
*Collected by Master Youzi Zeng Can*
**The *Zhǐ Xuān* (Pointing to the Mysterious) Chapter**

Non-substance, non-form—
Who can fathom its beginning?
Yet it has a destination:
The **Three Fields’ elixir**.

**Master Chunyang** said:
*"The Dao’s source, once manifested,*
*Gives rise to all things and forms.*
*Thus there is the **Jade Purity’s** sacred realm,*
*Where **Yuanshi** dwells supreme;*
*Next, the **Upper Purity’s** true realm,*
*Where **Yuánhuáng** resides;*
*Then the **Great Purity’s** immortal domain,*
*Where **Tàishàng** abides.*

*Below these, there are the realms of*
**Tàiwú (Great Non-Existence),**
**Tàixū (Great Emptiness),**
**Tàikōng (Great Void),**
**Tàizhì (Great Substance).**
*Tàizhì—*
*The chaos of Heaven and Earth’s beginning,*
*Its hue dark-yellow,*
*Like a parrot’s egg suspended in the Great Void.*

*The Southern Palace’s flying immortals*
*Advance ten million eight thousand li daily,*
*Crossing eight hundred kalpas,*
*Yet cannot escape this realm’s bounds.*

*Only he who grasps the Mysterious’ essence*
*May transcend into the **Three Purities**.*

*Chaos—*
*Like the great womb’s first conception,*
*Three hundred days until form takes man.*
*My elixir—three hundred days,*
*And qi gives birth to spirit.*

*Heaven like an inverted basin,*
*Earth like a flat stone.*
*Yang born beneath the earth,*
*Darkly bearing yin’s substance—*
*To reach pure yang’s realm,*
*Ascending to Heaven is hard;*
*Yin born within Heaven,*
*Darkly embracing yang’s essence—*
*To sink into pure yin,*
*Descending to Earth is hard.*

*At Winter Solstice, yang is born,*
*Accumulating eighteen decans to reach Heaven;*
*At Summer Solstice, yin is born,*
*Accumulating eighteen decans to reach Earth.*
*Rising and falling in cycle,*
*He who comprehends this*
*May equal Heaven and Earth.*

*Heaven and Earth are eighty-four thousand li apart,*
*Yet man’s heart and kidneys*
*Are but eight inches four divisions distant—*
*The principle of transmission,*
*Rising and falling, is one.*

*The sun and moon span eight hundred forty li:*
*The sun traverses **Qián (Creativity),**
*The moon traverses **Kūn (Receptivity).**
*The sun draws the moon’s shadow to become clear,*
*The moon draws the sun’s soul to become bright.*
*Clarity and brightness—*
*Their qi;*
*Essence and refinement—*
*Their substance;*
*Yin and yang—*
*Their Dao;*
*The tortoise and hare—*
*Their symbols;*
*Mao and You—*
*Their paths;*
*Day and night—*
*Their measure;*
*Their conjunction—*
*Their function.*
*I follow the laws of sun and moon,*
*And may traverse vast kalpas.*

*The Three Passes behind the elbow*
*Are like the three islands beyond the sea.*
*Without passing the three islands,*
*One cannot be called an immortal;*
*Without passing the three passes,*
*One cannot be called a Daoist.*

*Turn the flying golden crystal to the crown,*
*Not only to return to youth*
*But also to withdraw fire and extract lead.*

*The **Dòngtiān (Cavernous Heaven)***
*Is neither in Heaven above*
*Nor in Earth below—*
*It lies in the boundless void.*

*Encircled by twelve peaks,*
*With upper, middle, and lower tiers,*
*Thirty-six in number—*
*Like the upper **Three Fields** of man’s spiritual palace.*

*Returning and reversing the two Fields,*
*Qi and spirit intertwine—*
*This is my **Dòngtiān**.*

*The Dao gives birth to Heaven and Earth,*
*And man is born of the Dao.*
*Yet seven emotions disturb within,*
*Six desires entice without,*
*Heavy vapors rise in towers,*
*Golden tortoises leak below.*
*My qi—eight hundred ten zhang long—*
*Nine times nine, diminished,*
*First chaos, then sickness,*
*Weakness, aging,*
*Decay, and death.*

*Life cannot nourish itself,*
*Peak cannot gather,*
*Dispersion cannot be reclaimed,*
*Decay cannot be mended—*
*How pitiful!*

*I have **Dragon and Tiger** within,*
*Not the liver’s **Green Dragon***
*Nor the lung’s **White Tiger**—*
*These arise from water and fire.*

**Master Chunyang** said:
*"Only after hearing Master Cuī Zǐ’s name—Xīfàn—*
*Did I know of **Dragon-Yang** and **Tiger-Yin**:*
*Dragon-Yang emerges from **Lí (Fire),**
*Tiger-Yin from **Kǎn (Water).**
*Their union is the Dao’s foundation.*
*Why so?*
*When the Five Phases move disorderly,*
*The Tiger is born in water;*
*When the Five Phases reverse,*
*The Dragon emerges from fire.*

*The Dragon—*
*The heart’s essence-fluid,*
*The pure yang’s breath;*
*The Tiger—*
*The kidney’s **True One** water.*

*This is called the **Mysterious within the Mysterious**.*
*The refined essence of true yin and yang,*
*In others, it begets man;*
*In oneself, it begets spirit.*

*The heart’s fire is no imagined qi,*
*No false breath of inhalation.*
*I have three true fires:*
*The heart—**Jūn (Sovereign) Fire**, named **Upper Darkness**;*
*The kidneys—**Chén (Subject) Fire**, named **Middle Darkness**;*
*The bladder—**Mín (Commoner) Fire**, named **Lower Darkness**.*
*Concentrated, they become fire;*
*Dispersed, they become qi.*
*Rising and falling in cycle,*
*They complete the **Microcosmic Orbit**—*
*Two hundred sixty measures,*
*The degree of the **Small Heavenly Cycle**.*

*Heaven’s qi increases every five days—*
*The qi’s rhythm;*
*My cultivation—five counts advance,*
*One count retreats—*
*The fire’s rhythm.*

**Master Chunyang** said:
*"Nourish with fire the **Yellow Grandmother**."*
*The **Yellow Grandmother**—*
*The residual qi of spleen and stomach.*

**Hǎichán Zǐ** said:
*"The fire spirit must not be made to fly."*

*The **Golden Crystal**—*
*The refined essence of the lung,*
*Transmitted to the kidneys,*
*Transformation incomplete,*
*Sent to the **Mud Pillow Palace**,*
*Thus called **flying golden crystal behind the elbow**.*

*The **Returned Elixir***
*Is neither substance nor form—*
*The **Three Fields’ elixir**.*
*Returned—*
*Having gone and yet returning.*
*The **Three Fields**—*
*Where qi is born.*
*Qi is stored in the **Middle Field** and begets spirit,*
*Spirit is stored in the **Upper Field**—*
*Once stored, it must not be lost.*

*If fire’s rhythm spans three hundred days without error,*
*The inner elixir is complete,*
*Pure yang is born,*
*Refining the five viscera,*
*Thus the five qi become spirit and ascend to immortality—*
*Why cling to **Returned Elixir***
*To merely solidify the form?*
*The **Returned Elixir** solidifies the form,*
*Yet even this has its limits.*

*When wood is fully consumed,*
*It becomes charcoal,*
*With a lifespan of a hundred years;*

「The earth, when fully refined, becomes brick,
Brick’s lifespan spans a thousand years—
Yet tiles are merely for mortals!

To attain the Dao of the True Immortal,
One must persist in cultivation without ceasing,
Then may enter the Great Dao,
Refining *qi* to form spirit.

Now, those who seek inner observation to kindle fire and gather spirit,
Must first have the elixir—
Without it, they only indulge in vain imaginings.

When refining spirit to merge with the Dao,
The Dao is already complete—
Then, in stillness, one silently contemplates,
And vital essence surges from the heart’s depths.
With sufficient counting, one naturally abandons the mortal body
And ascends.

Fire refines the elixir—
When fire arrives, the elixir congeals.
To refine *qi*, when fire arrives, spirit manifests its form.
With ample fire and spirit’s potency,
Spirit naturally unites with the Dao’s truth,
Soaring within stillness as if in flight.

When spirit merges with the Dao’s completion,
Suddenly it transforms into a fire-dragon,
Ascending through the Heavenly Gate—
Beginning with a step or two,
Then progressing to three *li* or five *li*.

To enter and never exit—
One’s form and spirit both attain perfection.
To exit and never return—
One abandons substance and ascends to immortality.

Yet, to adjust spirit and emerge from the shell has its efficacy—
But do not rely on the body.
To enter and never exit,
Roaming and returning in cycles,
Transmitting the Dao and guiding others,
With both practice and merit fulfilled,
Then one enters the *Tongtian*—
The *Return to Root* chapter,
A book of Heavenly Concealment,
Rooted in rationality.

To preserve the elixir field well,
And return to the Root of Life—
Master Zhengyi, upon receiving the *Heavenly Concealment* text,
Read it for three years and attained enlightenment,
Then cultivated for three more years until body and mind were at ease.

After yet another three years,
The *Heavenly Concealment* Master instructed him on the essence of contemplation,
And only then did he grasp the wonder of *Return to Root*.

Master Zhengyi said:
*"A person’s root lies in the elixir field,
And if one can restore it, longevity follows—
Thus it is called *Return to Root* and *Restore the Vital Essence*."*

Observe the soul’s awareness—
It originates from rationality.
When rationality is perfected,
One attains the wondrous myriad transformations without end—
Thus it is called *Perfecting Nature* and *Myriad Wonders*.

I know that breathing is sustained by *qi*—
Thus there is the method of exhalation and inhalation;
Saliva is born from water’s storage—
Thus there is the technique of swallowing and spitting;
Thoughts arise from the heart’s perception—
Thus there are the keys to contemplation.

As for the *Nourishing* and *Defensive* circuits of blood and *qi*,
When awake, they course through the outer body;
When asleep, they circulate within.
Awake and asleep, inner and outer,
Mutually nurture each other—
Only then can harmony be achieved.

From the hour of *zi* to *wu*,
First harmonize the exterior,
Stretching and relaxing the four limbs,
Then rising to guide and lead,
Adjusting one’s breath until it steadies.
Then, one taps the small molar at the *Dantian* with a light hum,
Followed by tapping the large molar with a deep hum,
Rubbing one’s face with both hands,
Waiting until warmth permeates the ears and eyes.

Then, seated cross-legged, one rolls the tongue in the *Huachi* pool,
Waiting for saliva to arise and rinsing it,
Silently counting its drops—
When reaching three hundred, one swallows it.
Each time swallowing,
One must first inhale deeply, then swallow,
And upon completion, inhale again—
Thus, all inhaled and swallowed flows smoothly into the *Dantian*.

From *zi* to *wu*,
After food is digested and the mind is empty,
One may rinse and swallow without counting—
When the intention is exhausted, one stops.

Thus, five days constitute one *hou* (cycle),
Burning incense in a quiet chamber,
Contemplating one’s body—
From head to foot,
From foot to *Dantian*,
And upward along the spine’s meridian,
Entering the *Nihuan*—
The imagined yellow *qi* swirls like clouds,
Piercing straight through the *Nihuan*.

After contemplation, one rinses and swallows again,
Then covers the ears with both hands,
Taps the forehead like a drum—
Three times seven—
Stretches both feet,
Sits upright with head tilted,
Straining mightily to straighten the neck,
Both hands clenched firmly,
Crossed beneath the ribs,
Adjacent to the *Yao Mei* bone,
Then lifting both shoulders,
Holding the breath for a moment,
Waiting until *qi* fills the face and turns it crimson—
Then one ceases.

Practice this seven times,
And *qi* will ascend from the spine,
Piercing through to the *Nihuan*.

This is the grand outline of cultivation.
Yet there are also essential subtleties.

My *qi* should harmonize with the true *qi* of Heaven and Earth,
And move in unison with them.
I can recognize *qi*’s arrival,
Discern its path—
Then I may endure alongside Heaven and Earth.

Its method begins at *Winter Solstice*, the hour of *zi*,
When pure yang first emerges—
Slow or swift, one waits for its coming,
Then moves one’s own *qi* in accordance,
Aligning with Heaven and Earth’s *qi* as they awaken.
The next day, one again observes this *qi*,
Tracking its ebb and flow—
This is the most refined Dao of the Immortals.

For three hundred and sixty days,
One cultivates *qi* to merge with true *qi*.
When its practice reaches two or three,
The body grows ever clearer and gentler—
With prolonged practice, immortality is not difficult to attain.

The *Hong Meng* chapter:
The utmost spirit has no form,
The utmost Dao has no substance.
Embrace simplicity, guard stillness,
And fully align with principle.

The *Hong Meng* Master Zhang Wumeng,
With the courtesy name *Lingyin*,
Concealed himself at Tian Tai—
The True Emperor said:
*"A nation is like the heart—
When the heart is without action, *qi* harmonizes,
And when *qi* harmonizes, all treasures coalesce;
When the heart acts, *qi* is disordered,
And when *qi* is disordered, brilliance dissipates."*

Those who wander through the *Mystic Feminine*’s gate,
And seek the *Red Water*’s pearl,
Must first release the boundless gaze of Heaven,
Confine a thousand evils,
Sever all discordance—
Then return to embracing simplicity and guarding stillness,
Stillness within stillness,
Until reaching the utmost unity.

Unity is the Dao’s function,
The Dao is unity’s essence.
Unity and the Dao,
Are naturally so—
Thus the utmost spirit has no form,
The utmost Dao has no substance,
Without action yet achieving all things,
This aligns with principle.

Therefore, those who attain its Dao,
Witness the marvels of creation,
And the mysteries of spirits and gods—
And nothing escapes their transformation.

The dung beetle transforms into a cicada,
Rotten grass into fireflies,
Sparrows diving into water become clams,
Partridges diving into water become *shen* (illusions),
Field mice transform into horses,
Fish into dragons—
These are its lesser wonders.

The greater marvels,
Are that humans may become Immortals.»

「I have often observed the transformations of Heaven and Earth,
The luxuriant growth of grasses and trees,
The winds and clouds gathering and dispersing,
The sun and moon revolving in their courses,
The interplay of water and fire,
The friction of yin and yang—
Gazing upward and downward in contemplation.

From distant sources and nearby forms,
I gathered the *Huan Yuan* [還元] *Shi* [詩] *Bai Pian* [百篇], extracting its twelve essential verses.

The first verse reads:
*"At the beginning, the hidden Dragon faces a single yang,
Its clear transformations lie within the Central Yellow."*

When the Great *Lü* [吕] begins to blow the Heavenly Fire,
How dare I witness the *Luó* [萝] *Bīn* [宾] walking upon the Earth’s Frost?
The *Kūn* [坤] Mother, if she comes to subdue,
The *Zhèn* [震] Son dares not let his wildness run amok.

The Secret Master of the Dao once spoke,
Recognizing the Golden Elixir hidden within the waters of the Way.

The second verse reads:
*"One cycle returns to search the Jade above Kunlun,
Treading the Mysterious Pass through the Gates of Marvels."*

The Hundred Valleys bow to the Sovereign of the Azure Sea,
The Nine Heavens’ stars reverence the Purple Emperor.
The Wheel of Time and Moon, the Struggle of Yin and Yang,
The Movement of the Celestial Globe—roots of Creation.
Day and night revolve in their endless return,
Thus the infant’s life is everlasting.

The third verse reads:
*"Yesterday’s maiden opened the Spirit Gate,
And indeed saw the Celestial Assembly at the Purple Emperor’s Hall.*
The entire court of stars encircled her,
The twin wheels of sun and moon flew to and fro.
The resonant drums of Heaven echoed through the void,
The radiant golden blossoms lit the earth with brilliance.
After meeting the True Masters of the Three Caverns,
The Jade Emperor granted robes of six *zhū* [铢] weight.*

The fourth verse reads:
*"The Old Master opened the Gates of Marvels with clarity,
His opening and closing respond to Heaven and Earth.*
Where the *wàngxiàng* [罔象] has no form,
There lies the root of eternal life and deathlessness.
Diligently practicing in secret, the spirits rejoice,
Continuously refining, life is everlasting.
Thus, one attains the realm of carefree liberation,
And secures blessings for oneself and descendants.*

The fifth verse reads:
*"The Primordial Sovereign sits enthroned in the Mysterious Capital,
The Threefold Embryonic Dao dances at the Eight Corners.*
The treasure hall is entirely paved with jade,
The pearl chambers are half-draped with true pearls.
Mountains and rivers remain motionless, concealing the Mysterious Cauldron,
The sun and moon shift, entering the Small Flask.
When the One Yang transforms, Heaven and Earth move,
And thus the Great Peace arises from this wondrous technique.*

The sixth verse reads:
*"Within one pearl, the world unfolds vast,
The self-same Spirit Treasure, the self-same Vision.*
In the boundless depths, the Three Realms converge,
In the fleeting haze, ten thousand transformations rest.
Yin ghosts know not the Azure Sea’s depths,
The Fire Dragon departs to the upper clod of earth.
The virtuous refine this profound mystery,
The Celestial Lord grants them office in the Jade Realm.*

The seventh verse reads:
*"The self-same spirit-*qi* and the self-same body,
Why seek answers from those trifling outsiders?
This mortal form, when united, is all illusion,
Only through cultivation does it become true.*
Years pass swiftly as peaches ripen,
Calamities dissolve like sea into dust.
Seek the Path of the Elixir Field in Heaven above,
Lest you grow old and merely follow convention.*

The eighth verse reads:
*"Alone in the empty mountain, I sit at ease,
For attaining the Dao, I gladly return to seclusion.*
The yellow-haired old man opens the Earthly Gate,
The snow-clad maiden guards the Heavenly Pass.
The divine waters are brewed in three-tiered cauldrons,
The Mysterious Pearls are played with in winding channels.
Ask not of my household’s mundane affairs,
For I distill one essence to heal my withering visage.*

The ninth verse reads:
*"The West’s *Gēng* [庚] binds armor with the Tiger and Dragon,
These two never before seen in harmony.*
Heaven and Earth are paired as husband and wife,
The firm and yielding unite as the *Kǎn-Lí* [坎离] Palaces.
Clouds and thunder transform in myriad forms,
Water and fire surge in twelve layers.
This technique of non-action requires no inquiry,
A single lotus blooms white in the Jade Pool.*

The tenth verse reads:
*"Within the twelve hours, the Child stands first,
Drawing and adding in motion without pause.*
The laws of form turn from the South,
The boundless divine waters flow toward the North.
The *Chá* [诧] maiden captures the Crow in the Vermilion Chamber,
The infant drives the Hare to the Pearl Tower.
Only by guarding the One does one contain the Primordial *Qi*,
Do not ask of the *Cāng-Qí* [沧淇] how many autumns pass.*

The eleventh verse reads:
*"The Dao lies within the Elixir Field for those who reach it,
Clearly understood—what more doubt remains?
The *Qián* [乾] Son chases the Dragon into the hidden *Kǎn* [坎],
The *Kūn* [坤] Daughter follows the Tiger into the concealed *Lí* [离].
Only by guarding the Pure and the Void does one abandon desires,
Thus naturally attaining serenity and the state of *Xīqí* [希夷].
The Daoist scriptures are no idle words,
Observe the thousand-year embryo breathing like the tortoise.*

The twelfth verse reads:
*"Emerging from the red dust, hidden in the Cavern of Heaven,
The Five Clouds pile around the field where the *zhī* [芝] grows.*
The Spirit Tortoise drinks from the Flowering Pool’s waters,
The Mysterious Leopard hides within the jade valleys’ mist.
What need for buying moonlit breezes and clear winds?
The Jade Needle and Golden Hoop are used at leisure.
Time and again, I mend the coarse sack,
Collecting the *Huan Yuan* [还元] essence of the hundred verses.*

---
**呼吸篇 [Hūxī Piān] (Chapter on Breathing):**
The spleen dwells in the center; breathing is its function.
The marvel of the True Person lies in his breath with the heels.

The utmost wanderer says:
*"Day and night, a hundred moments [刻],
One moment equals one hundred thirty-five breaths,
Thus day and night total thirteen thousand five hundred breaths.
When the sun rises and the *fāng* [方] is bound,
The pulse completes one cycle and returns to its beginning,
Hence, breathing four times—from the extremities to the center—
Completes one breath."*

Students call breath *"qi"* [气], and *"qi"* is life.
The True Person’s breath is with his heels—why so?
This is because it values the profound.

*Biān* [扁] *Quē* [鹊] says:
*"Exhale from the heart and lungs,
Inhale into the kidneys and liver,
While the spleen dwells in the center.
Thus, within the breath, the Five Phases are complete."*

I have heard *Fán* [樊] *Dà* [大] *Jūn* [君] say (in the *Yuan Dao Jing* [元道经]):
*"To restore the Primordial *Qi*,
One must always reduce breathing as a sign.
The heart’s source is calm and clear,
Its breath naturally diminishes.
Thus, from reducing breath to breathlessness,
And from breathlessness to steady breath.
Steady is the unforced, unobstructed stillness of non-action.
Then, restoring the Primordial and returning to the roots,
One may dwell in the world.*

The common man regards having breath as normal,
The sage regards having no breath as normal.
Movement brings breath,
Stillness brings no breath;
Breath and no breath,
Enter and exit freely.
Thus, having breath is delusion,
Its essence lies in careful repose.

Hence, there are three responses:
The first response—
Then for a hundred days, whether in action or repose, all is well,
For the Primordial *Qi* gradually restores,
Worldly concerns daily diminish,
The void and tranquility daily increase;»

其二应，
Then for two hundred days, the *Qi* naturally ceases in a state of tranquil stillness,
This marks the *Primordial Qi* nearing stabilization,
One abstains from grains and cereals,
And from the five flavors;
Hunger and thirst do not arise.

其三应，
Then for three hundred days, one abides motionless and serene in stillness,
This is the *Primordial Qi* returning to its roots,
Hunger and thirst never come,
Cold and heat do not intrude,
One’s lifespan aligns with the heavens and the earth.

夫减息住气，
Both reducing breath and dwelling in *Qi* are successful when one attains breathlessness and stabilized *Qi*.

若独行减息，
But if one practices only reducing breath,
Then its efficacy will be slow.

则其功迟矣，
专行住气，
Yet if one practices only dwelling in *Qi*,
Then it will be difficult to reach breathlessness.

若夫开通百关，
However, if one opens and harmonizes the hundred *passages* (关),
And combines it with reducing breath,
Then the *Primordial Qi* becomes abundant and full,
And its efficacy is doubled.

或问曰：
Someone asked:
谨其休止，
How does careful repose proceed?
亦有渐乎？
Does it also advance by stages?

曰：
It does. Its stages are nineteen:
日不减息，
On days when breath is not reduced,
Reduce by twenty-five days,
This is dwelling in fifty minor breaths.

曰小乏，
When minor fatigue arises,
Reduce by three days and five major breaths.

曰大乏，
When major fatigue arises,
Eliminate for sixty days and thirty major breaths.

曰小醉，
When minor intoxication arises,
Reduce by ten days.

曰大醉，
When major intoxication arises,
Reduce by a hundred days and combine with vomiting to eliminate one week’s worth of breath.

曰欲，
When lust arises,
Daily reduce by fifty days.

曰怒，
When wrath arises,
Daily reduce by fifty days.

曰惊，
When startled,
曰忿，
When resentful,
曰欢，
When joyful,
曰及，
When greedy,
Each reduces by ten days.

曰惧，
When fearful,
Reduce by seven days.

曰劳，
When labored,
曰倦，
When weary,
曰躁，
When restless,
曰烦，
When vexed,
曰饥，
When hungry,
All reduce by five days.

曰饱，
When sated,
Dwell in three days of good fortune.

与夫饮食触犯，
As for dietary transgressions,
寒热过差，
Excessive cold or heat,
风湿所及，
Wind-dampness affecting the body,
起居失节，
Disordered daily routines,
言语散杂，
Erratic speech,
思虑烦多，
Excessive mental strain,
These all diminish the *Primordial Qi*.

夫人受天地之气，
For humans receive the *Qi* of heaven and earth,
故呼吸出入与天地相通，
Thus, inhalation and exhalation harmonize with the *Qi* of heaven and earth,
是以通彻则生，
Hence, when the *Qi* flows freely, life thrives,
壅滞则死。
When it stagnates, death ensues.

呼者出气也，
Exhalation is the release of *Qi*,
受气於五脏六腑，
The *Qi* is drawn from the five *zàng* organs and six *fǔ* entrails,
呼出其脏腑之气归於天地。
Exhalation sends forth the *Qi* of the organs and entrails back to heaven and earth.

是以一呼出气，
Thus, with one exhalation,
其脉上行三寸而出，
The pulse ascends three inches before the *Qi* is expelled,
即以口吐旧气，
And one spits out the old *Qi* through the mouth,
以受新气焉。
To receive the fresh *Qi*.

吸者入气也，
Inhalation is the intake of *Qi*,
吸敛天地之气归於脏腑。
It draws in the *Qi* of heaven and earth to nourish the organs and entrails.

是以一吸入气，
Thus, with one inhalation,
其脉下行三寸，
The pulse descends three inches,
逐其脏府之宿气焉。
Driving out the lingering *Qi* of the organs and entrails.

呼吸不等，
If inhalation and exhalation are unequal,
失天地之调气，
Then one disrupts the harmonized *Qi* of heaven and earth,
其所以生疾者乎。
This is how illnesses arise.

樊大君之论，
The discourse of Master Fan is indeed profound.

枕中篇
*Chapter on Resting in Bed:*
空窍不守，
If the empty cavities are not maintained,
邪乃为灾；
Then pernicious *Qi* will bring calamity.

精神内存，
When the spirit is preserved within,
病安从来。
How can illness arise?

孙真人名思邈曰：
Master Sun, named *Sī Mìào*,
大道有盈虚，
The Great Dao has fullness and emptiness,
人事有消长，
Human affairs have waxing and waning,
养生者宜知自谨导引行气之方焉。
Those who cultivate life should know how to carefully regulate *Dao-Yin* and *Qi*-circulation.

夫百疾之生以夭其命者，
For the hundred illnesses that shorten life arise
由饮食不节，
From disordered eating,
不能谨其微也。
And from failing to regulate the subtle.

夏至之后逼秋之分，
After the Summer Solstice, pressing toward autumn,
肥腻勿食，
Avoid fatty and greasy foods,
酒浆勿食，
Avoid alcoholic and milky drinks,
蒜勿食，
Avoid garlic,
猜肝、犬肉勿食，
Avoid *gài* liver and dog meat,
五辛勿食，
Avoid the five pungent spices,
瓜梨之实勿食。
Avoid the flesh of melons and pears.

养生者寡念也，
Those who cultivate life hold few thoughts,
丧生者多思也。
Those who destroy life have many thoughts.

其要在乎和心损虑、
The essentials lie in harmonizing the heart and reducing concerns,
去喜怒、
Eliminating joy and anger,
除驰逐、
Removing reckless pursuit,
谨施泄，
Carefully managing excretion,
秋冬尤当固藏者也。
Especially in autumn and winter, one must firmly preserve.

若或有疾，
If illness arises,
则返舌塞喉，
Then reverse the tongue and block the throat,
漱液咽津唾也，
Gargle with saliva, swallow the *essence*, and spit out the *phlegm*,
瞑目内视，
Close the eyes and gaze inward,
使心生火，
Causing the heart to generate *fire*,
想其疾之所在，
Visualize the location of the illness,
以火攻之疾则愈矣。
And attack it with *fire*—then the illness will be cured.

甲子、甲寅、庚申八节晦朔当燕居独处，
During the eight *critical days* of *jiǎzǐ, jiǎyín, gēngshēn*—the days of solstices, equinoxes, and new moons—
冥心专精，
One should seclude oneself, quiet the mind, and focus the spirit,
以去其欲。
To eliminate desire.

日在亥子，
On days corresponding to *hài* and *zǐ*,
勿弃唾，
Do not discard saliva,
勿亡精，
Do not lose *essence*,
勿失气，
Do not lose *Qi*,
入山未至百步而却行，
Before entering a mountain, retreat a hundred steps,
却行百步，
Then retreat another hundred steps,
然后登山，
Only then ascend the mountain,
众邪伏矣，
For all pernicious *Qi* will be subdued,
百毒匿矣。
And all toxins will be concealed.

导引者当以左右手摩其尺宅，
Those practicing *Dao-Yin* should rub their wrists with both hands,
使之极热则有光泽，
Until they become intensely warm and radiant,
行之五年，
Practice for five years,
色如孺子。
Then their complexion will be like that of a child.

蚤起平气正坐，
Awaken early to balance the *Qi*, sit upright,
先叉手掩颈，
First cross the hands over the neck,
仰首视天，
Raise the head and gaze at the sky,
颈与手争力为之，
Straining the neck against the hands,
可以使精和血通，
This will make the *essence* and blood circulate,
风气不入矣。
And prevent pernicious *Qi* from entering.

屈动其体，
Bend and move the body,
反张其四支，
Stretch and extend the four limbs,
宣摇其百关，
Ventilate and sway the hundred *passages*,
周匝皆热，
Until warmth pervades all,
疾永除矣。
Then illness will be permanently dispelled.

仙之道有三：
The Dao of the Immortal has three aspects:
日保精、
Daily preserving *essence*,
日行气、
Daily circulating *Qi*,
日服饵，
Daily taking elixirs,
皆由浅以至深者也，
All progress from shallow to profound,
其大要在乎胎息而已。
The greatest essential lies in *Tāixī*—breathing within the embryo.

胎息者，
*Tāixī*—breathing within the embryo—
不以口鼻呼吸者也。
Is the method of not inhaling and exhaling through the mouth and nose.

夫善用气者，
Those skilled in *Qi*-use,
其嘘也，
Their exhalations,
水为逆流焉，
Cause water to flow backward,
火为灭焉，
Extinguish fire,
猛惊为隐伏焉，
Conceal sudden fright,
疡肿为消焉。
And dissolve tumors and swellings.

或卒然有疾则吞三九之数，
If illness suddenly arises, one should swallow three times nine,
可以差矣。
This can alleviate it.

行气之法，
The method of *Qi*-circulation:
处於密室，
Is to be in a secluded chamber,
暝目闭息，
Close the eyes and stop the breath,
置鸿毛於口鼻之上，
Place a feather above the mouth and nose,
使之不动可也。
Ensuring it does not move.

於是耳无闻、
Then the ears hear nothing,
目无视、
The eyes see nothing,
心无思，
The mind thinks nothing,
以渐除之而已。
Gradually eliminating these distractions.

夜或有悸，
If at night one experiences palpitations,
则存日月入於明堂，
Then visualize the sun and moon entering the *Bright Hall* (明堂),
而百邪自去矣。
And all pernicious *Qi* will depart.

内想篇
*Chapter on Inner Visualization:*
涓子得道，
*Qiānzǐ*, having attained the Dao,
以授苏林；
Passed it on to *Sū Lín*;
存三守一，
Preserving the three and holding to the one,
自得於心。
He himself found it within his mind.

涓子曰：
*Qiānzǐ* said:
立人之道，
The Dao of establishing humanity,
其身如栓桔焉，
Is like the *Qiánjǔ*—a wooden plug in a well—
其情如赘疣焉。
And one’s emotions are like warts.

知其然也，
Knowing this to be true,
故为修养之方。
Thus, he formulated methods of cultivation and nourishment.

皆小道也，
These are all minor methods—
彼吐纳咽漱按摩采取云者，
Such as exhaling and inhaling, swallowing and gargling, pressing and massaging, and gathering *Qi*—

古先至人，
The ancient Sage-Kings,
返老还童，
Reversed aging and restored youth,
太一含真，
The *Tàiyī* embraced the *True*,
盖有至要焉。
They possessed the most profound essentials.

吾尝炼神育胎而行内想之法而已。
I have practiced refining the spirit, nurturing the embryo, and employing the method of inner visualization.

安坐於静室而冥心焉，
Sit quietly in a still chamber and quiet the mind,
以左股加右股之上，
Place the left thigh over the right,
左右手俱下，
And let both hands hang down,
虚其身如三足之鼎，
Emptying the body like a three-legged cauldron,
於是想其左肾为日，
Then visualize the left kidney as the sun,
右肾为月，
And the right kidney as the moon,
日中出白气，
From the sun, white *Qi* emerges,
入於精海之内，
Entering the *Sea of Essence* within,
变而为赤矣；
Transforming into red.

From the moon, red *Qi* emerges,
Entering the *Sea of Essence* within,
Transforming into white.

The two *Qi* intermingle,
Condensing into true *Qi*,
And form an embryo—
Luminous as jade.

Observing my form,
Only in its initial stage does it resemble me,
Like an egg in appearance.

All limbs complete,
Gradually nurtured and growing,
Kneeling within the *Sea of Essence*,
Hands crossed before it,
Entering and exiting through the crown,
Separating from the body,
Roaming freely—
Thus escaping the fate of heaven and earth.

---
**Chapter Thirteen of *Dao Gun* Complete** *(Note: Original text had "Five," corrected to "Thirteen" per reconstructed edition.)*

**Chapter Fourteen of *Heart Mirror* by Master Youzi, Compiled by Zeng Can**

The Four Yellows and Eight Stones are not the true essence of medicine;
The Five Colors and Three Flowers transcend ordinary classification.

Master *Xuánhé* said:
*"When lead is true, the elixir forms—sacred and numinous.*
Thus, the ancient Sage-Kings spoke only of lead and mercury,
Never mentioning the Four Yellows and Eight Stones."

Lead and mercury—
When applied to the Five Phases,
Manifested through the Four Symbols,
They are the natural communion of yin and yang’s primal *Qi*,
Like how humans receive red and white *Qi* to form the embryonic *Qi*—
Sufficient, and one becomes enlightened;
Insufficient, and one becomes dull and stunted.

Thus, one must not fail to understand *Long* (Dragon) and *Hǔ* (Tiger).

*Hǔ* is silver,
Contained within lead—
Thus it is water, it is metal.

*Long* is mercury,
The *Zhuó* (intriguing female), it is wood, it is fire.
Metal arises from water,
Water is born of wood,
Wood is born of fire,
Fire gives rise to earth—
The *Way* lies within this.

Lead contains the Five Colors,
Mercury emits the Three Flowers.
When these two substances unite,
Their name is called the *River Vehicle*!

The likes of *Wei Boyang* composed *The Parametric Contract*
To speak of the *Great Transformation*,
Sequentially drawing upon the Five Phases,
Unfolding the mechanisms of heaven and earth,
To illuminate the *Way* of Great Return.
Its meaning is profound and difficult to grasp,
Thus scholars cannot fully comprehend lead and mercury.

To know lead and mercury but not the fire’s timing,
To know the fire’s timing but not the crucible and tripod,
To know the crucible and tripod but not the ebb and flow of ascent and descent—
This is not speaking of the *Way*.

The heart is the source of the elixir.
If the heart does not align with the *Way*,
Even if one grasps the deepest mysteries,
I have not seen one who could succeed.

*The Parametric Contract* says:
*"Plant grain with millet,
Embrace the parrot to cover the egg—*
This speaks of how what is not of the same kind struggles to produce."

Master *Táo Zhēn* said:
*"Sand is born from mercury,
Metal from lead—*
This clearly shows that their kinds do not intermingle."

It is said:
*"Mercury gives birth to water, silver dies;
Lead, constrained, gives birth to spirit-sprouts—*
This reasoning is profound."

What is *Returning the Elixir*?
It is to contain fire without losing its original nature.

*Nine Transformations*—
Nine changes of lead’s *Qi*,
Not nine refinements.

Thus, the supreme medicine
Is formed when yin and yang transform into *Qi*,
Not by subduing *yùshí* (ore), *quèshā* (arsenic sulfide), or *liúhuáng* (sulfur) to force it.

If one forces substances of unlike kinds upon it,
Their poison is sufficient to harm life.

The foolish subdue mercury with medicine,
Forcing it to contain fire and die—
This is erroneous.

Thus it is said:
*"True lead does not change color,
True mercury possesses divine power.*
Without the refined *Qi* of true lead,
How could one ever complete the elixir?

Thus, black lead enters the fire,
And becomes only ash and dross.
Who understands the subtlety of *Returning the Elixir*?
It lies in the *Three-One*.

The unrefined *Long* and *Hǔ*,
The essence of heaven and earth—
They do not rely on medicine,
But on the Five Phases—
This is the teaching of the Sage-Kings.

Mercury is the essence of the *Tàiyáng*,
The true *Qi* of the South,
Obtaining yin and yang, water and fire to govern its transformations,
Thus it resides at the head of the *Qīngdì* (Green Emperor),
As the essence of wood,
And thus wood generates fire,
Naturally containing the most refined medicine.

Lead is the essence of the North’s black water,
Its transformation into the West’s *Gēng-Xīn* metal,
Thus metal generates water,
Water generates wood—
These two substances align to form the divine elixir.

In ancient times, *Liú Xuánmù* served *Wei Boyang*,
Doubted and withdrew in regret, dying young.
*Xú Jǐngxiū*, through unremitting effort,
Encountered a master who taught him the Golden Elixir,
And dwelled upon *Tàibái* Mountain for over a thousand years—
The difference between belief and disbelief.

In recent times, *Xiè Chōngxuán* and *Sū Dān*
Both consumed the Golden Elixir and became immortals—
This is the efficacy of the Golden Elixir.

*The Parametric Contract* says:
*"Gold takes sand as its master,
Harmonizing with mercury,
Its transformations depend on its truth—*
Truth is *Qi*.
Beginning and end mutually engender each other.

Not using medicine but the Five Phases—
Heaven’s teeth naturally form,
The body of the white horse’s teeth is true,
*Dānshā* (cinnabar) and *Mǎoyǒu* (arsenic) are the two families harmonized.

The *Huánán* School refines autumn stone,
The Yellow Emperor admires *Jīnhuá* (golden flower).
Yellow sprouts are not lead,
Lead is not true *dānshā*.

Refining with contained fire completes one cycle,
After nine transformations,
The golden flower naturally forms.

White medicine, red spirit-mercury,
Autumn stone shares their nature.

Lonely yin cannot transform alone,
Scanty yang cannot complete the work.
Originally pure and still,
It inherently possesses transformative, numinous power.

When *Long* and *Hǔ* meet,
How could they ever fail to recognize each other?
White liquid devours in unity,
Becoming both husband and wife.
Transforming into golden sprouts,
They follow the *Hòutǔ* (Later Soil) in due time.

If one understands the *Purple River Vehicle*,
One naturally ascends to the celestial realms.

Do not refine withered lead and mercury,
Wasting effort like dust in the wind.

Heaven, earth, sun, and moon—
Numinous beings are called *Jīngōng* (Metal Lord).
*Jīngōng* is not lead,
It must be concealed within lead.

White liquid in the furnace’s fire,
Golden sprouts gradually form.
Recall the day you first met—
Difficult to find mercury’s form.
At the peak of yang, yin-fire arises,
Fire wanes as yang-*Qi* merges.
It naturally transforms into the *Purple River Vehicle*—
Consuming it grants eternal life.

「Thus, in the first month, the white liquid congeals like snow;
In the second month, it solidifies into fat-like substances;
By the third month, half its form is united with the flower, like a pendant pearl;
In the fourth month, the two substances embrace, resembling a single drop of blood.

In the fifth month, it ascends and clings to its mother, its sound like a sob;
In the sixth month, it reaches the Purple Palace, its breath nearly extinguished;
In the seventh month, it rides the yin and absorbs qi, its limbs now drawn;
In the eighth month, it nearly completes its form, its organs and entrails contained within congealed blood;
In the ninth month, it leaves behind a crimson skin while growing hair;
In the tenth month, child and mother separate—
The mother is exhausted, the child is whole—
Its appearance shifts to that of white snow,
And it must then be nurtured in the furnace.

Thus it is said:
Yang arises from *Fù* (复, Recovery),
Yin arises from *Gòu* (遘, Encounter).
The furnace is entrusted to the center,
The *Hòutǔ* (Later Soil) to the *Wù* (戊, Fifth Heavenly Stem).
The *Dǐng* (鼎, Cauldron) moves above and below in mutual succession,
Guarding the substance so it does not disperse or vanish.
Do not lose sight of it,
For seasons and times are fixed—
When the Dragon and Tiger rush to meet,
Yang reaches its peak at *Qián* (乾, Heaven),
Yin reaches its peak at *Kūn* (坤, Earth),
The Four Symbols must be divided,
And the sixty-four *Guà* (卦, Hexagrams) cycle within the central reverence.

The Dragon and Tiger intermingle and devour each other,
The Five Phases (*Wǔxíng*) establish their positions within.
Water and fire serve as mediators, refining my spirit;
Yin and yang nurture my luminous dawn and dusk.
The Eight Nodes shift with cold and warmth,
And thus it gradually transforms into golden sprouts.
The sun and moon urge it forward, evoking the mother’s favor,
From which it solidifies and establishes its foundation.
Thousands of autumns, tens of millennia—
It births descendants of longevity.
This is the profound mystery of the *Cāntóng Qì* (参同契, *The Concordant of the Three*).

*Xuán Hé Zǐ* (玄和子) says:
I possess the secret of the *Dǐng Lǔ* (鼎卤, Cauldron and Brine).

Brine is the furnace.
The *Dǐng Lǔ* are the symbols of Heaven and Earth,
Their spirit resides in the Three and Five alone.
Below is the Vermilion Bird (*Zhūquè*),
Above is the Dark Tortoise (*Xuánwǔ*),
Between them lies the division of Heaven and Earth—
This is the law of yin and yang.

Yang is born from *Fù* (复, Recovery),
And completes its nine revolutions at *Qián* (乾, Heaven).
Yin emerges from *Gòu* (遘, Encounter),
For water flows from below.
Fire flourishes and invades yin,
Yang wanes and returns to soil.
If one does not understand this,
How can one subdue the Dragon and Tiger?

The two *qì* (气) are *Zǐ* (子, Child) and *Wǔ* (午, Noon).
One suppresses to control the other’s ascent,
Thus below is the Red Dragon,
And the Wooden Green Three-Flowered Mother (*Sānhuā Lǎonǚ*).
This is the Great Medicine below.

Above is the Dark Tortoise (*Xuánwǔ*),
With divine symbols: the White Tiger, the *Huápó* (华池, Glorious Pool) Mirror of Yellow Heaven,
The *Jīngōng* (Metal Lord) in its watery position.
The Red Dragon comes from lead,
The Black Tiger comes from mercury.

Following the hexagrams to harmonize with yin and yang,
By the tenth month, it will shed its shell.
Thus, one knows that to transmute gold, gold must be present,
And to transform soil, soil must be present.
The existence of the *Jīndān* (金丹, Golden Elixir) lies in the divine water of the Glorious Pool,
And the secrets of the Great Elixir are no more than those in the *Cāntóng Qì* (参同契).

The ancient song says:
White mercury generates cinnabar,
Black lead generates golden sprouts.
Within it, the number nine is repeated nine times,
Nine transformations yield the Three-Flowered Mother.
When refined to the Purple Yang Palace (*Zǐyánggōng*),
Yellow gold cannot be boasted of—
Only when the *Jīngōng* (Metal Lord) unites with true mercury,
Can one refine the golden liquid into *Zǐlíngshā* (紫灵砂, Purple Spirit Sand).

*Xuán Hé Zǐ* says:
When using lead, do not allow lead to dwell within mercury.
Strain out all its dregs,
Then one may begin refining.
Temporarily, lead serves as its vessel.

Thus, the source of the Great Elixir
Does not depart from true lead, true mercury, divine symbols, and white snow.

Before taking the divine elixir,
Choose a day of the Eight Nodes (*Bājié*) and *Jiǎzǐ* (甲子, Heavenly Stem-Child) in conjunction.
First, abandon all intentional actions,
And cultivate the form of non-action.
Further, one must abstain from grains and regulate one’s breath,
Retaining vision and returning hearing,
And thus achieve *yǔhuà* (羽化, transcendence).

The song says:
Lead is originally the *Jīngōng* (Metal Lord),
The *Jīngōng* obtains lead and flourishes.
If the scholar abandons the *Jīngōng*,
The *Jīngōng* becomes crude.
The flowing pearl is the *Zhàinǚ* (诧女, Astonished Maiden),
With fire, it naturally ascends.
Suddenness is the *Jīngōng*’s control,
Their mutual affection is their shared destiny.
Together in movement, together in rest,
The whole day hides behind double doors.
Lead is the fixed mouth of the cauldron.
Still, it is transformed by yin and yang,
By fire both above and below.
Following its changes, it finds its foundation.
The two natures both return to soil,
The Three-Flowered Mother’s qi does not shift.
When it reaches the Purple Yang Palace,
It transforms together into yellow flowers.
Throughout the year, its hue remains purple radiance.
This is the name of true mercury,
How could it ever again ascend?

*Nǚwā* (女娲) refined the *Wǔdì Qì* (五帝气, Qi of the Five Emperors),
The essence of lead.
It transforms and supplements Heaven and Earth.
Thirty-six calculations reveal the world’s patterns,
Seventy-two stones mark their positions.
Seventy-two *liǎng* (两, ounces),
Thirty-six of lead.
Heaven obtains one and becomes complete,
Earth obtains one and becomes square,
Wood becomes charcoal and is not discarded.
The *Hèchē* (河车, Purple River Vehicle) is taken from lead,
The *Zhàinǚ* (诧女) is sought within mercury.
The *Tàiyǐ* (太乙, Supreme Unity) dispenses medicine for *Pángzǔ* (彭祖, Pengzu) to taste,
Firmly aiding the refined essence to become dense and compact.
One *wén* (文, principle) and one *wǔ* (武, force) often falter.
Below, the turtle spreads the great sea basin,
Within the furnace, the *Fúsāng* (扶桑, Azure Mulberry) is used sparingly.»

The purple vapor thick with emerald mists exhales a fragrant scent,
Shrimp, clam, and fish scales gleam with sunlight’s radiance.

To grasp how **Wèibó** (魏伯) ascends to the clouds and departs,
Do not emulate **Cháng'é** (嫦娥) hiding within the moon’s embrace.

The **Xuánhé** (玄和) principle at **Zǐ** (子) time is indeed natural,
Yet one must not neglect the **guàqì** (卦气, hexagramic *qi*) and fire’s proper measure.

**November**, the **Fù** (复) hexagram.
Its first *yáo* (爻, line) is a single *yáng* (阳, yang) emerging—
The herald of spring’s first stirrings.

At the hour of **Zǐ** (子), the *yúnfújié* (运符节, cyclical correspondences) align,
The **Tiānténg** (天呈, Heaven’s Manifestation) turns,
To ignite the fire—thus refining the **jīndǐng** (金鼎, golden furnace).
Purify your heart with fasting and stillness,
As though confronting the **Yùhuáng** (玉皇, Jade Emperor).
Within the furnace, the **Bái Hǔ** (白虎) and **Qīnglóng** (青龙) both reside.
The **Bái Hǔ** (White Tiger) restrains the **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon),
And only then does the **Qīnglóng** begin its spirited ascent.

**December**, the **Lín** (临) hexagram.
Two *yáng* (yang) lines arise—
The fire’s vigor grows, manifesting the **Chìlóng** (赤龙, Vermilion Dragon).

The **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon) ascends and descends,
Like rain in flight.

The furnace now takes the form of **Péngdǎo** (蓬岛, Penglai Isle).
Here, the phases of **tuìshuǐ jìn huǒ** (退水进火, receding water, advancing fire) occur.
The furnace has doors and vents;
**Qiánjiān** (潜肩, concealing the furnace’s opening) wards off the wind.
The key lies in knowing the **huìshuò** (晦朔, dark and bright phases) and the **qiánkūn** (乾坤, Heaven and Earth) numbers,
And harmonizing **lead and mercury**—
Only then may they enter the furnace.

Adjust the fire’s measure,
And success may be achieved.

**January**, the **Tài** (泰) hexagram.
Two *qi* (气, *qi*) forces now balance—
The **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon) in the furnace is pressed by three *yáng* (yang),
Its ascent grows fierce.

Within the furnace, the **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon) and **Bái Hǔ** (White Tiger) contend,
Devouring each other.
Listen to their roars—
If their sounds are like an infant’s cry, cease the fire’s ascent.
If the fire rages, unleash thunderous **wǔhuǒ** (武火, martial fire).
Thus, the **wǔhuǒ** (martial fire) is gradually employed.

When the hexagram reaches **Tài** (泰),
Spring’s season is complete.

Close the northern door of the furnace—
The **wǔhuǒ** (martial fire) blazes fiercely.
**February**, the **Dà Zhuàng** (大壮) hexagram alone.
Its lines mark the initial fire of summer—
The **wǔhuǒ** (martial fire) is now applied.
The *yīnyáng* (阴阳, yin-yang) *qi* follows its cyclical correspondences,
And the furnace booms like wind and thunder,
As **lead and mercury** surge within.

When the sound of dripping water and crackling fire is heard,
The **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon) is gradually subdued,
And the **dān** (丹, elixir) begins to form.

**March**, the **Yǎng** (央) hexagram.
Unless prolonged transformation leads to pure *yáng* (阳),
The fire’s force is intensified—
Thus, the **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon) and **Bái Hǔ** (White Tiger) are self-restrained.
On the furnace’s top, **zǐfěn** (紫粉, purple powder) appears,
And around its sides, **hóngfúyào** (红芙药, red peony medicine) glows.

**April**, the **Qián** (乾) hexagram.
With the six positions complete and yielding to *yáng* (阳),
This is the moment of the furnace’s blazing radiance.
Thus, the **wǔhuǒ** (martial fire) burns most fiercely—
The peak of the **dān** (丹, elixir) process,
When the **Bái Hǔ** (White Tiger) is fully consumed,
And the **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon) is utterly subdued.
Thunder and lightning cease,
The furnace stands empty and silent,
Inner and outer harmony achieved,
The sea’s waters all drained.
Treat it with utmost care—
For it is about to enter the **wǔ wèi nánfāng lí zhī jiǔ guān** (午位南方离之九官, ninth office of the south at the *wǔ* (午) position).

A verse sings:
*The Sage seizes the essence of creation’s art,*
*With hands that wrestle sun and moon within the furnace’s embrace.*
*Subtle vapors swirl—Heaven and Earth’s refined essence,*
*Piercing through yin and yang, guiding spirits and ghosts.*
*If the solar soul and lunar spirit can be recognized,*
*Then the knower is a child of the Immortals.*

*Refine and ingest it for a thousand days,*
*And the body, free from yin’s grasp, shall never die.*

This refers to the above.

**May**, the **Gòu** (遘) hexagram.
A single *yīn* (阴, yin) line first emerges—
The **dān** (丹, elixir) now, in its tranquil state,
The season of great peace.

The fire of the **Lí Guān** (离宫, office of *lí*),
With two realms in resonance yet unchanged.
Within the furnace, clouds and rain have ceased,
Its fragrance red and fresh,
Like spring’s gentle harmony.

From **November**, when *yáng* (阳) returns,
To **May**, when *yīn* (阴) once more prevails—
This is the natural cycle of **jiǔhuán qīfǎn** (九还七返, nine returns and seven revolutions).

**June**, the **Zhú** (逐) hexagram.
The *yīnfù* (阴父, yin father) gradually forms,
Returning to the **Kūn** (坤, Earth) position in the southwest,
Where fire absorbs **lead**—
This marks the onset of **qiū** (秋, autumn).
On the furnace’s top, the sea’s waters gather.
When entering *yīn* (阴), increase them;
When at the height of *yáng* (阳), decrease them.
Place a **kèlòu** (刻漏, water clock) in the room,
To measure the hours.

At this time, the **dān** (丹, elixir) is full within the furnace,
Its hue like crimson clouds.
With two *yīn* (阴) lines now formed,
The **Qīnglóng** (Green Dragon) and **Bái Hǔ** (White Tiger) have no cause for concern.

**July**, the **Pǐ** (否) hexagram.
Three *yáng* (阳) lines have retreated,
Returning once more to *yīn* (阴).
Thus, the **huángyá jiéhuā** (黄芽结花, yellow sprouts forming blossoms),
And the sea’s waters are halved in measure.

Yet within this single chamber,
The **Kūn** (坤, Earth) and **Qián** (乾, Heaven) forces are applied,
And the balance of creation is held—
When the **dān** (丹, elixir) is complete,
Like Heaven and Earth giving birth to myriad things.

**August**, the **Guān** (观) hexagram.
The **Mǎo-Yǒu** (卯酉) positions—
Where Heaven and Earth divide equally.
Thus, at the hour of **Yǒu** (酉),
The critical moment for extraction arrives.

**September**, the **Bì** (剥) hexagram.
Five *yīn* (阴) lines now prevail—
Thus, yin and yang are nearly complete.
The *yánghuǒ* (阳火, yang fire) gradually recedes,
The upper waters increase once more,
Clear and motionless—
The year’s end.

Who knows the **Dà Huán Dān** (大还丹, Great Return Elixir),
Which from nothingness generates existence,
Founded on the **One** (一),
Within the One, extracting the One,
Naturally forming?

**October**, the **Kūn** (坤) hexagram.
Its positions now complete,
Its fire has waned.
This is the moment of pure *yīn* (阴) solidifying.
Thus, pray to the **Yuándǒu** (元斗, Primordial Dipper),
And invoke the **Tàiqīu** (太丘, Great Mound)—
The stars of Heaven and Earth,
To safeguard the furnace,
Fearful of malevolent *qi* (气) intruding.
Wait until the **xīnghuǒ** (星火, stellar fire) naturally extinguishes,
And the furnace and vessel grow cold—
Then open them.

On the furnace’s top, **zǐfěn** (紫粉, purple powder) gleams bright—
This is the **Zǐyóu Dān** (紫游丹, Purple Wandering Elixir).

Why is the **sānwǔyī** (三五一, Three-Five-One) principle essential?
It is said:
The **Kǎn Guān** (坎宫, office of *kǎn*) has its master—
Named **Xuán Mǔ** (玄母, Mysterious Mother).
She harbors the **Qīnglóng** (青龙, Green Dragon),
The **Nánfāng Shǐzhě** (南方使者, Southern Envoy),
Capable of transformation and adaptation.
She takes **wood’s essence** in partial sacrifice,
To return it to the **Hòutǔ** (后土, Later Soil).
At the **Hùndùn** (混沌) time,
She pairs with the **Fūfù** (夫妇, consort).
When *yīn* (阴) is exhausted and pure *yáng* (阳) emerges,
Her treasure ascends—
Then it may be extracted.

The extraction has its proper time,
The taking has its appointed day.
Ingest it for three years,
And thus, it becomes steadfast—
The master of eternal life.

---

**Chapter on Embryonic Breathing**

Soft and lingering, like a presence sustained,
It governs the **yuánqì** (元气, primordial *qi*).
Nine years observing the walls,
Only then does this matter become clear.

In the land of **Shēndú** (身毒, Sindhu),
There dwells a **Zhìrén** (至人, perfected sage) named **Bǎoguān** (宝冠, Precious Crown),
Who masters the art of **tāixī** (胎息, embryonic breathing),
Thus his form never withers.

**Pútí Dámó** (菩提达磨) heard of it and journeyed to inquire:
*"In the lands of **Zhèndàn** (震旦, China),
Men cannot endure heat and cold,
Draining their true essence and hastening their demise.
I intend to travel widely,
And wish to learn the **tāixī** (胎息) method,
To revive them."*

**Chapter on Embryonic Breathing**

Precious Crown sat in repose:
*"I speak to you now.*

The human being at birth,
Origins from embryonic breathing.
The spirit-mind (*shénshí* 神识) and essence (*jīng* 精) harmonize and congeal.
The sun and moon transform,
And thus the form emerges.
When the form first takes shape,
The spirit abides within it.

Hence, the spirit without form cannot dwell,
The form without *qi* cannot transform,
The *qi* without form cannot manifest.
Therefore, the spirit and form—
These are the roots of receiving *qi*;
The *qi* is the foundation of nourishing the form.
When the three are harmonized,
Only then does one emerge into the world.

While dwelling in the maternal womb,
It lies dormant beneath the navel,
In chaotic unity for three months,
The dark female (*xiānpín* 玄牝) is complete—
The nose.
The dark female being complete,
Like a melon with its stem,
It subtly draws maternal *qi*,
Thus when the mother inhales, he inhales,
When the mother exhales, he exhales,
Softly and unceasingly,
For ten months, *qi* is full and the form steadfast,
The spirit complete and the mind (*shí* 识) perfected,
And thus he breaks free from the womb and is born.

After ten days of birth,
Emotions manifest outwardly;
From infancy to childhood,
Fingers and gazes express joy and anger—
First true, then false,
And thus he loses the Dao.

Moreover, his thoughts wander to external greenery,
His eyes dazzle at five colors,
His ears indulge in five sounds,
His nose is bewildered by myriad fragrances,
His tongue craves excess flavors,
His body delights in softness and warmth,
His mind entangles in joy and anger,
His spirit and intelligence are strained in labor,
Questions press without respite,
Day and night he races without end—
His pure and simple nature is utterly dispersed.

Thus his form withers, his hair falls out,
His *qi* is exhausted, his spirit declines,
Heat and cold assail him, and he cannot resist—
How could he endure to live long?

The perfected sage (*shèngrén* 圣人) thus knows
The five elements' *qi* and essence form his body,
So he cultivates the five elements' *qi* and essence to replenish them,
Returning to the origin and embracing the primordial,
To grasp the mechanism of embryonic breathing.

When the heart is tranquil,
The spirit rejoices;
When the spirit rejoices,
Fortune arises.

Why so?
The spirit is the child of *qi*,
The *qi* is the mother of the spirit.
When the spirit is active,
The *qi* is nourished;
When the *qi* is severed,
The spirit perishes.

To achieve eternal life,
One must harmonize spirit and *qi*
While the heart remains undisturbed,
Guarding the inner breath,
The spirit not enslaved to the external,
Neither departing nor arriving,
Neither emerging nor entering,
Serene and ever abiding.
Thus the dark female's gateway—
The threshold of eternal life.

Moreover, he does not ponder external things,
He does not gaze at external hues,
He does not indulge in external desires,
He does not crave external tastes,
Ever observing inwardly,
His heart blazing yet unscattered,
His spirit merging with *qi*,
Returning to the source of the five *zàng* (藏, viscera) and six *fǔ* (腑, bowels).

In time, spirit and *qi* become clear,
Illuminating the five *zàng*,
Flowing through the four limbs.
Ordinary men's breathing
Issues from the throat,
But the sage's *qi* resides in the *qìhǎi* (气海, Sea of *Qi*).
The *qìhǎi* lies three inches below the navel,
Called the *Zǐgōng* (子宫, Womb),
The root of primordial *qi*.

This is my *Zhēnyī* (真一, True Unity) *qi*.
Whoever can guard it,
Softly and unceasingly,
This is called returning to simplicity and embracing the primordial,
Allowing *qi* to congeal and settle,
Neither dispersing nor transforming—
The five *zàng* and six *fǔ* remain firm and unharmed,
The body thus does not decay,
The spirit and mind (*shénshí* 神识) remain tranquil—
The essence of eternal life.

Therefore, the form is the dwelling of *qi*,
The master of the spirit.
If the master does not guard the inner,
But is enslaved to the outer,
Then the dwelling becomes empty and collapses.

O vulgar man!
Not a single breath abides in the *qìhǎi*!

The sage rules with spirit as sovereign,
And *qi* as lord.
If breathing does not align with spirit as sovereign,
