**Fire** uses its **will** (意) to **cultivate the South** (修南方丙丁), manifesting in the **heart** (心);
**Metal** uses its **wisdom** (智) to **cultivate the West** (修西方庚辛), manifesting in the **lungs** (肺);
**Water** uses its **insight** (慧) to **cultivate the North** (修北方壬癸), manifesting in the **kidneys** (肾).
The **kidneys** govern **bones** (骨) and **ears** (耳);
The **liver** governs **sinews** (筋) and **eyes** (目);
The **spleen** governs **flesh** (肉) and **lips** (唇);
The **heart** governs **blood** (血) and **tongue** (舌);
The **lungs** govern **skin and hair** (皮毛) and **nose** (鼻).
Thus, the **gallbladder** (胆) is the **liver’s chamber** (肝府);
The **small intestine** (小肠) is the **heart’s chamber** (心府);
The **large intestine** (大肠) is the **lungs’ chamber** (肺府);
The **bladder** (膀胱) is the **kidneys’ chamber** (肾府);
The **stomach** (胃) is the **spleen’s chamber** (脾府).
Each of the **Five Phases** (五行) contains **Wood’s vital breath** (木#3气), and when it reaches its **native domain** (本方), it **embodies myriad deities** (具万神), thus ensuring the **body’s completeness and fullness** (身全而体备). At **thirty days**, the **vital breath is full** (气满); at **three hundred days**, the **embodied form of creation** (造化体象) is complete. Then, **deity, *qi*, and essence** (神、气、精) are established as its **masters** (主).

The **Three Wonders** (三奇) circulate through the **mother’s nourishing and defensive channels** (荣卫经络), permeating the **body**, and descending to the **double *qi* gates beneath the Primordial Palace and breasts** (中鬲元宫双乳之下).
Thus, within **ten days**, a **membrane** (膜) forms, and upon it **Metal elixir and white grease** (金液白膏) appear;
Within **thirty days**, the **grease is full** (膏满) and the **elixir flows** (液奔奏), pouring into the **Primordial Palace** (元宫) and irrigating the **Three Wonders** (三奇);
At **forty days**, a **second membrane** (二重膜) forms;
At **sixty days**, the **grease flows into the Primordial Palace** (膏流於元宫), and the **first membrane seals** (前膜闭);
At **seventy days**, a **third membrane** (三重膜) forms;
At **ninety days**, the **grease flows into the Primordial Palace** (膏流於元宫), and the **second membrane seals** (次膜闭).
Thus, **nine membranes** (九膜) are generated.
At **three hundred days**, an **embryo** (婴儿) is born, and within **three years**, it **feeds on accumulated breast milk** (食其积乳), until **deity is complete and *qi* is abundant** (神全气足)—this is **humanity’s foundation** (人之根本).
Those who grasp this **understand the principles of self-cultivation** (修身之理得矣).
**Self-cultivation** (修身) without first **removing ailments** (除疾) will **disrupt the deity’s order** (神乱而不宁), so what need is there for **external deities** (外神)?

Now, **ailments** (疾) arise from **disharmony among the Five Zang** (五藏不和) and **obstructed nourishing-defensive circulation** (荣卫难通). When **vital breath flows smoothly** (气顺), ailments are **removed** (疾除); when it **reverses** (气逆), the **Five Zang are disharmonious** (五藏不和) and the **hundred vessels stagnate** (百脉滞). In general, when **vital breath flows smoothly** (气之顺也), the **nourishing-defensive channels circulate freely throughout the body** (荣卫周通於身), and there is **no obstruction in its passage** (往来无滞).

The **method of self-cultivation** (修身之法) is as follows: during the **hours of *qi* stagnation** (戌、亥、子之时)—when **yin-yang’s reign is gradual** (阴阳渐王) and one **rests in bed** (人寝於床)—the **vital breath stagnates in the hundred vessels and joints** (气滞於百脉关节), so **work can be activated** (故可以兴功焉). First, **extend the four limbs** (引四支), then **spread the hands and feet** (展左右手足), opening all the **hundred vessels** (百脉). **Shake and sway the body** (撼摇其身), allowing the **vital breath to circulate freely** (使气往来), reaching every part without fail. Then the **deity will naturally clarify** (神当明矣).

What does **clarified deity** (神明) mean?
The **unfathomable interplay of yin-yang** (阴阳不测) is **deity** (神);
The **radiant precision of sun and moon** (日月精朗) is **clarity** (明);
**Will’s cultivation and mechanism’s activation** (学意发机) is **deity** (神);
**Perfect application without error** (应用不差) is **clarity** (明).
Thus, one **employs the deity** (即用其神): sitting upright and **aligned in posture** (端身正坐), **abandoning all thoughts and discarding all imaginings** (绝虑忘想), awaiting the **settling of deity and *qi*** (俟神气俱定), then **inhales pure *qi* through the nose** (鼻纳清气) and **exhales turbid *qi* through the mouth** (口呵浊气).

Why?
Because **human consumption of the Five Flavors and Five Spices** (食五味五辛) all contain **restrictions and counteractions** (刑克), which can **corrupt the Five Zang** (腐五藏) and **generate disease** (生患). Thus, **pure and turbid *qi* become mingled** (清浊混), making them **difficult to discern** (难见), so one **exhales to purge the turbid** (故呵以淘其浊). Once this is done, the **vital breath is confined to nasal inhalation and exhalation** (使其气止於鼻出入).

Now, **Metal, Wood, Water, and Fire** (金木水火) are the **light and pure *qi*** (轻清之气)—the **yang** (阳);
The **heavy and turbid** (重浊) are the **yin** (阴).
The **nose** is the **Heavenly Gate** (天门);
The **mouth** is the **Earthly Portal** (地户).
Within, it **connects to the Five Zang** (内通五藏), but only through the **two paths of yin-yang and pure-turbid** (惟阴阳清浊之二路). Yet each has its **course** (各有行). The **vital breath that flows through the nose** (鼻者) must not allow the **turbid *qi* of the mouth to disrupt its purity** (不使口中之浊挠其清).

The **nose’s inhalation of *qi*** (鼻之取气) must be **continuous and gentle** (绵绵), with **no abruptness** (不可有闻).
Why?
Because **excessive breathing through the Heavenly Gate** (大纵於天门) will **disrupt the free flow** (出入自如), making it impossible to **circulate through the hundred vessels** (通百脉) or **open the four limbs’ channels** (开四支经络五藏). Once the **Earthly Portal is closed** (地户既闭), only the **Heavenly Gate’s deity and *qi*** (天门之神气) circulate, **embracing the Primordial Palace** (抱元官)—this is **guarding the One** (守一者).

When the **hundred joints are unblocked** (百节既通) and the **hundred gates are opened** (百关既开), then one **collects the salivas formed by the Five Flavors and Five Spices** (取百味所成之津液), refining them into **deity water** (神水), and **adding them into the Primordial Palace as treasure** (添入於元官以为宝)—this is **extracting and replenishing** (抽添者).

One **takes the Primordial Palace’s essence** (元宫经) from the **saliva generated in the spleen** (脾中所生百味五辛之津), allowing the **deity and *qi*** (神气) to **move along with the nourishing-defensive channels** (随其荣卫而运). From the **double gates at the spine** (夹脊双关), it **flows through the channels**, ascending to the **top of the head** (顶门), descending to the **mouth** (口), then **gargling and swallowing** (漱咽) to return to the **Twelve Palaces** (十二重楼). The **lungs** (肺) **receive it** (乃受之) and **transmit it to the kidneys** (传於肾); the **kidneys** transmit it to the **liver** (肝); the **liver** transmits it to the **heart** (心); the **heart** transmits it to the **spleen** (脾); the **spleen** transmits it back to the **Primordial Palace** (元宫)—this is the **deity water, white elixir, and cinnabar** (神水白丹砂).

Above, it **ascends to the sublingual orifice** (舌下之窍中), then **emerges onto the tongue** (走出於舌之上) for **gargling and refining** (醴漱), passing again through the **Twelve Palaces** (十二重楼), where the **lungs** (肺) **receive it once more** (复受之).

Thus three times accomplished, the **true qi** may then be cultivated. Refining it through three to five cycles, the **precious elixir** is formed.

It no longer circulates through the **Zang organs**, dwelling solely within the **heart**.
The **heart** has three **vessels** and seven **orifices**; each orifice contains three **holes**, named **Juyan** (聚涎).
What enters through the center is transmitted to the **Zang organs**; what enters from the left and right is transformed into **honorific and defensive qi**, circulating through the **Microcosmic Orbit**, returning to the **Primordial Palace**—this is the **True One**, the **true gold within water**.

Three represents the **generative and destructive cycles of the Five Phases**, hence it is called **One**.
Three is **Wood**, **Yang**, corresponding to the **emergence of life in Spring**.
Five is **Earth**, **Yin**, the foundation upon which all things grow.
Wood’s **true qi** aligns with Earth; the refined essence of Wood and Earth becomes the **supreme treasure**.
In human terms, Wood is the **father**, Earth the **mother**—this is the **Three-Five Unity**.

A child is born in **three hundred days**; how then does one nourish bones and sinews?
Only through **non-thinking, non-worrying, non-desiring, and non-craving**—when the **spirit is settled and the qi is tranquil**, the body stands firm.
Those who understand this may **harness Yin-Yang qi**, **defy Heaven-Earth’s transformations**, and thus **cultivate the body to attain sainthood**.

Someone asks: *"Why do some refine **saliva** yet fail to produce the **precious elixir**?"*
The answer: If the **Zang organs’ qi is disordered** and the **honorific-defensive circulation is already impaired**, how much more so when attempting refinement?
Such questions arise when the **Zang organs’ qi is not harmonized**. First, **regulate the Zang organs’ qi** to ensure their harmony, then refine the **saliva through three cycles**—how could it fail to become the **medicine**?

How does one harmonize the **Zang organs**?
By **investigating the foundational principles of the Five Phases** and cultivating accordingly.

**Wood** governs the **eastern direction (Geng-Xin,甲乙)**, moving purely along the **Yang path**, its birth rooted in **Bing-Yin (丙寅)**, its **trigram** **Zhen (震)**. Drawing essence from **Water**, its symbol is the **Dragon**; its number is **Nine**—Nine breaths suffice for life.
**Fire** governs **Bing-Ding (丙丁)**, its number **Three**, its **trigram** **Li (离)**—**Yin Fire**, its symbol the **Vermilion Bird**.
Two symbols, one essence: **Wood as master, Fire as auxiliary**.

**Metal** governs the **western direction (Geng-Xin,庚辛)**, moving purely in **nourishment and grandeur**, its birth in **Ren-Shen (壬申)**, its **trigram** **Dui (兑)**. Drawing essence from **Earth**, its symbol is the **Tiger**; its number is **Seven**—Seven breaths suffice for life.
**Water** governs **Ren-Gui (壬癸)**, its number **One**, its **trigram** **Kan (坎)**—**Yang Water**, its symbol the **Dark Warrior**.
Two symbols, one essence: **Metal as master, Water as auxiliary**.

**Earth** alone can **subdue the Four Symbols’ qi**, producing the **treasure**—what differs from the **parental origin**?

To **verify the Five Phases internally**, observe the **Nine Orifices**.
The **Zang organs** externally connect to the **Nine Orifices**:
- **Liver** to the **eyes**,
- **Heart** to the **tongue**,
- **Spleen** to the **mouth**,
- **Lungs** to the **nose**,
- **Kidneys** to the **ears**,
- and below to the **genitals**.
If any **orifice is obstructed**, the **Zang organs are disordered**; if the **Zang organs are balanced**, the **orifices open**.
Each **Zang organ’s pathogenic qi** manifests its **inherent color**:
- **Liver** (青), **Heart** (赤), **Lungs** (白), **Kidneys** (黑), **Spleen** (黄).
Thus, if one sees **pure green without admixture**, the **Zang organ’s qi is harmonized**.
If the **four Zang organs** do not conform to their **native colors**, their qi is **inverted**.
This is merely the **Way of Nourishing Life**—not the **Golden Elixir’s Great Medicine**.

The **Nine Circulations of the Returned Elixir** require:
- **Recognizing the Five Phases**,
- **Securing the Golden Lock**,
- **Nurturing the Mysterious Pearl**,
- **Preserving the Spirit Water**,
- **Anchoring in the Primordial Palace**, ensuring the **qi does not depart from the Kidneys**,
- **Returning the Essence to the Supreme Harmony**—this is the **Gate to Sainthood**.

Heaven and Earth use the **sun and moon** for function; humans use **honorific and defensive qi**.
If one’s **internal use aligns with the external sun and moon**, their lifespan matches **Heaven and Earth’s duration**.

The **spirit** is the **honorific-defensive qi**.
**Honorific** is the **sun**; **defensive** is the **moon**.
The **internal movement of spirit-qi** mirrors the **external cycles of sun and moon**—naturally, **internal and external unite**.

The **Greater Sun** completes a **twelve-hour cycle**, yet only **nine hours** align; the remaining **three do not**.
In **thirty days (360 hours)**, it is visible for **270 hours**, leaving **90 unseen**.
Why?
The **Greater Sun** arises at **Yin (寅)**, its qi flowing sequentially through **Xu (戌), Hai (亥), Zi (子)**, entering the **Lesser Yin’s domain**—where the two qi intersect, rendering it **unseen**.

The **Lesser Yin** in a **month** shines clearly for **twenty-four days**, then dims for **six**.
Why?
The **Lesser Yin** arises at **Shen (申)**, its qi flowing **backward** through **Xu (戌), Hai (亥), Zi (子)**, governed by **pure Yin**—thus, it is **unseen**.
It travels **twenty-seven days**, reaching the **third day of the month**—the **conjunction of sun and moon**.
Then the **Lesser Yin** dims, the **Greater Sun** vanishes.

Students must **align their honorific-defensive qi** with the **sun and moon’s conjunctions and movements**—this is the **unification of internal and external**.

The **Greater Sun** appears for **three days before and after**, reaching **Gèn (艮)** before separating from the **Lesser Yin**.
The **Lesser Yin**, rooted in its **palace**, moves from **four to eight days**, then **twenty-three to twenty-seven days**, reaching **Chǒu (丑)** before separating from the **Greater Sun**.
Thus, the **qi completes its cycle**, achieving **full brilliance**.

The **sun and moon** move in harmony with **Heaven and Earth’s qi**—this is why their duration is **eternal**.

My **honorific-defensive qi** can harmonize with theirs—then **long life** is attainable.

**Jindan** is the refining of the **Mysterious Pearl**. To return the **Mysterious Pearl** to its original position is to **restore the Primordial and reclaim the Mandate**—yet one must carefully observe the **Five Phases**. Why? The **five viscera** each manifest their own colors visibly. Thus, when practicing the **Nine Returns Method**, one must first establish the **altar symbols** and activate them.

The **altar** is the **key to Heaven and Earth**, the **root of the cosmos**, the **apex of Heaven and Earth**, and the **foundation of the Dragon and Tiger**. Without the **altar symbols**, it is like a person without a dwelling!

Within the **altar**, I sit upright and composed, observing the **four seasons’ transitions** and the **internal and external conjunctions of sun and moon**.

The **liver belongs to Wood**, so in the **three spring months**, I select a **Jiazi day and hour**, sit properly in the **altar**, and **sever all thoughts and fantasies**, always **closing the earthly gate** while **slightly opening the heavenly gate**. The **qi** circulates softly and continuously—never rushed—while I **focus solely on returning the honorific-defensive qi to the liver**. The **qi** then ascends along the spine to the brain, descends from the **crown** into the mouth, and is **gargled** before descending into the **twelve-story pavilion**, first passing through the **lungs**, then the **kidneys**, the **liver**, the **heart**, the **spleen**, and finally entering the **Primordial Palace**, where the **spirit-qi** receives it. When the count is complete, the **qi** surges and flows back into the **two orifices beneath the tongue**, its color **green**—this is the **harmonious flow of liver qi**.

The others follow similarly.

Someone asks: *How do you know this is so?*
The answer: When the **liver qi** first moves in the **spring three months**, and the practice begins on a **Jiazi day and hour**, no other viscera’s **qi** will intrude. The **position** remains stable, allowing the **honorific-defensive qi** to circulate through the **body, meridians, and five viscera**. When the count is complete, it generates **Primordial Qi**, nourishing the body. The **most refined essence** is then stored in the **Primordial Palace**, where the **Five Phases’ generation and destruction** operate. The **qi** remains in its original position without dispersing.

At the **Wood’s sovereign season**, it is again applied to the **Primordial Palace**. The **green** is the **true qi of the liver**. After passing through the **five viscera**, the **honorific-defensive qi** circulates through the body, surging and emerging—its color differs, but only **pure green** remains. The other four **qi** follow the same principle.

The **five viscera each manifest their own colors**—this is the proof.

What is the **Golden Lock Method**?
Take **White Tiger’s meridian** at **262.5 units** as **Earth**, and **351 units** as **Metal**. **Metal** is the **true qi of the West**; **lead** is the **true qi of the White Tiger**. **Lock** means **closure**—closing the **true qi within the Yang**. **Mercury** is the **true essence of the Green Dragon**. The **most refined essence** originates from the **true qi of the Four Symbols**, thus having **no fixed form**.

Lead and mercury: only **Earth** can govern them. Thus, the **qi** takes form as **two qi** only when lead and mercury meet, and only then does the **treasure** form. Therefore, use **secret techniques** to secretly extract **Tiger Lead** and return it to the **Green Dragon’s position**. Lead is originally the **dwelling substance of the Tiger Palace**; returning it to the **Green Dragon’s Primordial Palace** prevents the **killing qi** from harming the **Primordial Spirit**. The **five viscera** then follow in order, resettling in the **Green Dragon’s Primordial Palace**.

Once the **lead** is obtained, it **controls mercury**; when **mercury** encounters **lead**, it naturally responds, forming the **treasure**—this is the **Golden Lock**.

What is the **Mysterious Pearl Sand**?
Take **true gold** of the **West’s color**—**twelve to fifteen liang**—but do not use **refined gold**. **Wood and Metal** must meet with **focused intent**; do not let the **yin-yang numbers** become disordered. The **Mysterious Pearl** is formed by the **Four Symbols**, thus composed of **Metal, Wood, Fire, and Earth**.

**Wood** is the **Dragon**; the **Dragon** is **Yang**.
**Metal** is the **Tiger**; the **Tiger** is **Yin**.
**Mercury** forms the **Dragon**, the **ultimate refinement within Yang**.
**Lead** forms the **Tiger**, the **ultimate refinement within Yin**.
Since **Yang contains Yin**, **lead** can **restrain mercury**, and **mercury** can **respond to lead**. When **lead and mercury harmonize**, the **Mysterious Vermilion** is complete.

First, use **secret techniques** to extract **true lead**, returning it to the **Green Dragon’s Primordial Palace** to form **cinnabar**. Thus, **mercury** naturally adheres to the **lead**.

Lead and mercury are the **essence of Dragon and Tiger**; when the **two qi** are obtained, the **lead** naturally gathers, and its name is the **Mysterious Pearl**.

How do we know this?
Because **mercury** submits to **true lead** within the **Primordial Palace**, and **Wood and Metal** are made to interact, receiving **Metal’s subjugation**. If the **mind stirs**, the **true qi** will descend and dissipate—it must be **deeply restrained**.

Thus, it cannot depart from its original position, and if it cannot leave, it **returns to the Primordial Palace**, merging with the **lead**—this is the **true convergence**.

In **twenty days**, the **Mysterious Pearl** forms within the **twelve-story pavilion**, below the **navel**, burning with extreme heat. Yet **Wood and Metal** must interact with **careful scrutiny**, restoring their **orifices** and belonging to **Earth**, embodying the **Five Phases**.

In **thirty days**, the **internal qi** becomes full, and the **form** is complete—sufficient to **usurp the creative power of Heaven and Earth for three hundred days**. This is **Jindan**.

When **ten months** have passed, it manifests beneath the **left rib**, its form like a **cherry**, its body like **blood**—this is the **true Golden Elixir**.

It **permanently dwells in the Primordial Palace**; the **qi abides in the spirit**, and the **refined essence ascends to the brain**—this is the **Flying Immortal**.

The **upper and lower passes** are fully opened, allowing the **elixir-qi** to circulate through the **meridians**, transforming the **bones**. In **three years**, one becomes a **True Person**.

Someone asks: *You say the thirty-day great work corresponds to three years—why specify thirty days? Now you say three years make a True Person—why?*
The answer: **Three years** encompass **one intercalary month**, when **Heaven and Earth’s qi** are full, leaving **accumulated surplus qi**. Three years can thus accumulate **thirty days**, establishing the **measurements of Heaven and Earth, sun and moon**.

Thus, **three hundred days** complete the **cyclical qi**, and **three years** make both **upper and lower** fully established—just as a human receives **Heaven and Earth’s dual qi** in the womb, **thirty days** suffice for the qi to fill, **three hundred days** for **creation and transformation** to form the body, and **three years** for full maturation into a person.

Therefore, **three years** encompass within them the **thirty-day great work**. A scholar who follows **Heaven and Earth’s ways** and accumulates the **surplus qi of thirty days within three years** achieves the highest attainment. Thus, the inherent qi of three years remains unlost.

Someone asks: *In youth, one often prioritizes profit over life, causing the **Primordial Spirit** to decay, the qi to be depleted, and the essence to weaken—how then can one practice the Dao in old age?*
The answer: **Old Yang seizing Minor Yin** extends life, while **Old Yin seizing Minor Yang** prevents death’s approach. Thus, if the aged obtain **Youthful Qi** and act accordingly, they can even **defy Heaven and Earth’s natural transformations**, achieving firmness and longevity.

Therefore, those who cultivate the Dao must know their **original essence at conception**—the **precise qi of their parents**. As for **lead and mercury** merging, forming the **Four Symbols**, entering the **Central Palace**, they then embody the **Five Phases**. When the **Five Phases’ qi is complete**, the **liver’s qi** enters the **Central Palace forty-five times**, the **heart’s qi** thirty-five times, and the **kidney’s qi** twenty-five times—totaling **one hundred and fifty**, the **True Qi**, refined through the **Three Primordials’ Divine Water**.

**Divine Water** is **bodily fluids**. Refined **three cycles**, it becomes a treasure for worldly dwelling. To achieve this without awaiting **sufficient spiritual qi**, relying on the **Three Primordials’ true numbers**, is the **mysterious essence**.

The **Three Primordials** are **Heaven, Earth, and Man**. Refining **Divine Water** with the **Three Primordials’ qi** as a treasure, permanently dwelling in the **elixir field**, firmly guarding the **Primordial Spirit**, allows one to **lengthen life through the Minor Yang’s way**.

The method states:
*The White Tiger’s head brings longevity;
Meeting True Lead extends years.
Even the lowly, mastering the Three Leads,
Can endure ten thousand springs.*

Thus, **Lead** is the **mother of all things**; **Mercury**, the **father**. When **Lead and Mercury unite**, they embody the **Five Phases**, refined by their proper numbers, becoming the **True Qi of the Three Primordials**—named **Divine Water**.

**Wood three, Fire two, Metal four, Water one**, **Earth five**—these are the **Five Phases’ true numbers**.
