**Contract of the True Authentic Lord’s Words**

When voices clash in confusion,
The sacred teachings must surely falter.
How profound these mortals are—
Yet only the **True One** holds steadfast.

**Containing-Light** (子范德昭, *Zǐ Fàn Dé Zhāo*) said:
The greatest treasure of humankind is **Divine Qi** (神气, *Shénqì*).
When **Divine Qi** and **form** (形) part ways,
How can life be preserved?

If nails grow from flesh,
And nails are broken, flesh is wounded.
If **Divine Qi** does not permeate the body,
How can the **physical vessel** (形器, *xíngqì*) avoid decay and decline?

**Containing-Light** further stated:
Many seek the **Dao/Way** (道), yet few grasp its essence.
I have discerned six key points of misunderstanding:

**First is the practice of exhalation and inhalation** (吐纳, *tǔnà*).
The world declares exhalation and inhalation as supreme,
And breath as the pivotal method.
Yet they fail to recognize that within the throat itself
Lies the **Qi of natural inhalation and exhalation** (出入呼吸之气, *chūrù hūxī zhī qì*).
Why seek further aid from exhalation and inhalation?

Are exhalation and inhalation the same as natural breath?
If not, they become mere external techniques.
**Zhuangzi** said:
*"The common man breathes through the throat,
The sage breathes through the heels."*

**Dwelling-in-Truth** (栖真子, *Qī Zhēn Zǐ*) declared:
*"The **spirit** (神) lacks force yet **Qi** flows ceaselessly,
The **form** (形) is inherently still yet its function knows no bounds."*

**Laozi** said:
*"The gate of the mysterious female,
This is called the root of heaven and earth.
Endless as silk, ever present—
Using it, one need not exhaust."*

**Smoke-and-Ro** (烟萝子, *Yān Luó Zǐ*) said:
*"The foundation follows breath without hindrance,
Endless as silk, yet without strain—
Closing the throat to retain **Qi** disrupts the method."*

The *Paramitasutra* (《参同契》, *Shēn Tóng Mì*) states:
*"To ingest **Qi** and clear the intestines and stomach,
To exhale and inhale correctly—
This is the proper way, discarding the false."*

The *Primordial Dao Scripture* (《元道经》, *Yuán Dào Jīng*) teaches:
*"Drawing through the nose and exhaling through the mouth
Cannot disperse accumulated **Primordial Qi** (元气, *Yuánqì*),*
But only serves to dispel superficial cold or lingering heat.
Retaining **Qi** in the throat can alleviate hunger and weakness,
Guiding **Qi** can harmonize the skin and flesh."*

**Li Qixian** (李栖蟾, *Lǐ Qī Xiān*) said:
*"Ingesting the essence of the Seven Mansions and Two Scenes (七宿二景之精),
Retaining **Qi** like prenatal breathing—
This is not the true adept’s marvel."*

Observing the ancient masters’ discourse on the **Great Dao/Way** (大道),
I realize that those who emphasize exhalation and inhalation alone
Have missed its true nature.
Some claim their ability to not eat and remain light-bodied
Proves their intestines are free of dross,
And they can ascend to the celestial heights—
Yet they are already deceived.

The *Secrets of Ascending to Truth* (《登真隐诀》, *Dēng Zhēn Yǐn Jué*) states:
*"Prolonged life requires severing the **Qi of grains** (谷气, *gǔqì*),*
But severing grains does not guarantee longevity."*

**Ge the True Person** (葛真人, *Gě Zhēn Rén*) said:
*"Those who attain the **Dao/Way** eat nine meals a day without suffering,
Or go a year without food without harm—
Is abstaining from food truly the pinnacle of the **Dao/Way**?"*

**The Mystic Canon** (玄纲, *Xuángāng*) states:
*"Exhalation and inhalation refine the **viscera** (脏),
Guiding and drawing harmonize the **body** (体).*
Thus, the **sage’s** use of exhalation and inhalation is such."

**Second is the practice of consortial alchemy** (御女, *yùnǚ*).
In ancient times, **Yellow Emperor** wandered in **Red Water** (赤水, *Chìshuǐ*).
Shallow disciples hearing of this
Spread tales of **consortial alchemy with Golden Flower** (御女金华之道, *Yùnǚ Jīn Huá Zhī Dào*).
Those with superficial understanding eagerly believed,
Yet their **forms** withered and their **vitality** (产, *chǎn*) exhausted—
All without gain, yet they never awoke.

This **Dao/Way** has its origins.
In days past, there was **Master Pei** (裴君, *Péi Jūn*), a bold and virtuous man...

**Supporting Master Zī** desired to transform him with the **Dao/Way** of longevity, thus devising expedient and variable methods. **Master Pei**, having attained the **Dao/Way**, declared: *"I have long suffered from this, but fortunately corrected it early."*

From this, his teachings spread widely, giving rise to the **Five-Character** and **Three-Peak** doctrines, the **Yellow Scriptures** and **Red Boundaries** secrets—all to deceive the **true sages**, a most perilous matter.

**Master Táo** said: *"To seek immortality through consorts, to seek transcendence through elixirs—these dangers exceed those of water and fire, and their destruction is swifter than axes and blades."*

**The *True Edicts*** (*Zhēn Gāo*) states:
*"I have seen those who practiced consortial alchemy die; I have never seen those who practiced it live. Even if one’s **qi** and essence are unlost, this is still insufficient to attain true transformation. If injured, one risks the calamity of **tail-hearing**."*

Within our bodies lies an inherent **maiden**—those enamored with **lead and cinnabar** seek external consorts, unaware of seeking within themselves.

The **Scripture** says:
*"A maiden, graceful and radiant, veiled in celestial splendor,
Her resplendent halls gleam with eightfold majesty."*

The **Wild Man of Tàishān** declared:
*"The maiden’s attendants number in the hundreds;
Refining elixirs to return to the origin is no ordinary woman."*

Thus observed, the **kidneys** are the **ranked maidens** of the body. If one refines their **qi**, the **vitality** first flows from the waist and navel, filling the five **viscera**, ascending to connect with the **#1 crown and spine**, producing sound. Daily, one circulates **1,200 breaths**—these are the **1,200** so-called "consorts." Who among them could truly govern such **qi** as this?

**Master Yáng** said: *"The **Dao/Way** books of the world mislead many; opening diagrams and records only further confuse the **spirit**."* Truly well said!

Guāngchéngzǐ spoke:
*"Do not weary your form,
Do not agitate your essence,
Fewer thoughts, fewer desires—
This is the very essence of nurturing life.
This is indeed the key to learning the Dao/Way.*

*Thirdly, there are the杂术 (miscellaneous techniques) and傍门 (esoteric paths).*
The myriad arts of Nángōng’s minor ways number ten thousand branches—none of them the Great Dao/Way.

Some cultivate the *lingyá* (sacred sprouts) of the five viscera, merging the red, white, green, and yellow *qi* into the five viscera, then conjuring the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Tortoise, luminous essence, form and shadow, the seven *pò* (spirits), and the three *hún* (souls).
Some practice the *chénbù* (stepping on the Big Dipper) to train ascent to the heavens.
Some rely on the *liùjiǎ* (six celestial stems) and *liùchén* (six terrestrial branches) to ingest talismans and elixirs.
Some practice the *fángzhōng jiǔyī* (Nine-One Chambering Method).
Some employ *dǎoyǐn* (guided breathing) and *ànmó* (massage), bending, stretching, reclining, and rising—twisting their bodies day and night, causing their blood and *qi* to surge, boiling upward and downward, only to harm themselves in return.
Some fix their thoughts in inner contemplation, concentrating their minds to sever all thought, restraining their *pò* (spirits) and focusing their *shén* (spirit)—yet with every thought, a spirit emerges, and each day they weaken further.
Some erect altars for *jiào* (ritual exorcism), seeking blessings and protection, or refine alchemy, using mulberry bark as medicine, cinnabar and mercury as elixirs, gold cauldrons and porcelain furnaces, black lead and white tin, herbs, stones, and filth—recklessly combining the void with the nonexistent.
Some practice *tǔnà* (breath control) to draw in external pathogenic *qi*, causing their intestines to rumble and their stomachs to swell, thus injuring their true *qi*. Even tortoises, whose nature grants them longevity, do not achieve it through such *qi*-cultivation.
Some emulate the *Máo Nǚ* (Hairy Maiden) by ingesting elixirs—though the world has pine and cypress, no *Běi Nǚ* (Northern Maiden) has ever flown through the sky.
Some consume gold, stone, herbs, and wood to preserve their form, yet they do not understand the nature of gold, stone, herbs, and wood, nor the seasonal rhythms of what is auspicious or inauspicious.
Some seek purity and stillness, abandoning desire, refining their conduct, embracing emptiness and austerity, fasting and abstaining from grain—becoming like withered wood, their will like dead ashes—yet they fail to grasp the movement of Heaven and Earth.

All these are not what I call the Dao/Way.
They bear the name of *good learning* yet lack the practice of *Dao/Way*-cultivation. Seeking longevity, they rush toward the path of death—how pitiful!

The *Classic* says:
*'False Dao/Way nourishes the form,
True Dao/Way nourishes the spirit.'*
Now I shall speak of its truth.

*Fourthly, there is 神气 (spirit and qi).*
Some use this to guard the *sān guī yī* (Three Returns to One).

They know to maintain tranquility and self-cultivation, yet who knows that within tranquility lies nature?
They know to take emptiness as principle, yet who knows that within emptiness, nothing is excluded?
Merely surrendering one’s will to silence yields no benefit.
Practicing the Dao/Way means daily diminution—
Diminishing again and again,
Until one reaches *wuwei* (non-action).
*Wuwei* is not inaction;
It is establishing the method of *wuwei* and manifesting its function.

To observe this is to know the marvelous workings of spirit and *qi*.

**Qīzhēnzǐ** said:
*"Qi lies in its movement,
Spirit lies in its application.
Returning spirit to serve *qi*,
Resting without motion—
This is called stillness.
It is the same as entering *dìng* (meditative absorption)."*

The *Classic* says:
*"When *qi* enters the body, it is called life;
When spirit departs the body, it is called death.
Thus, the perfected one rests in spirit alone."*

*Tīng* (the heel) refers not to the navel below but to the *upper celestial gate*—difficult for mortals to enter. Only by emitting the luminous spirit without breathing does one attain it.

*Yuán* (the Primordial) is the *kūn* (Earth) Palace’s *qi*, ascending and congealing into form;
*Líng* (the Refined) is the complete *qiàn* (Heaven) spirit descending and merging into substance.
Thus, humans, like Heaven and Earth, receive *qi* from the *Xūhuáng* (Void Sovereign).
They ought to be able to share in Heaven and Earth’s longevity.

Therefore, the perfected one abides eternally with Heaven and Earth.
Spirit forms through *qi*,
*Qi* lingers through spirit—
When spirit and *qi* unite, the posterior heavens do not age.

**Yānlǔozǐ** said:
*"Within lies the White Primordial Sovereign,
His flesh as pure as congealed snow.*
The Primordial Sovereign is the manifestation of the refined spirit-*qi*.
Those who learn the Dao/Way and recognize him
Have already surpassed half the path.

How does one recognize him?"*

「He said: *"Cultivate and ponder the White *Qi*,*
from the navel downward to the waist, to the spine,
ascending through the *níwán* (Brain of Mud) to its summit—
this is the true method of refining the elixir,*
the true application of the Primordial *Qi*."*

*"Thus, one clears and purifies the *níwán* (Brain of Mud),
settles and dwells the *dānlíng* (Elixir Spirit),
so that the Three do not wander forth,
and the Six do not intrude.*

*The Three—what are they?*
The inner *qi* does not escape,
the outer *qi* does not enter,
yet this is not the closure of *qi*.
*The Six—what are they?*
The eyes do not gaze recklessly,
the ears do not listen wantonly,
the mouth does not speak or savor indiscriminately,
the body does not touch or receive in vain,
the nose does not inhale fragrance or foulness without measure,
the mind does not conceive or ponder in error.
Thus, external affairs do not intrude,
and the inner *qi* is not stolen by them."*

*The Eight Harmful Extremes are:*
Hunger, satiation, toil, ease,
wind, cold, heat, dampness—
these injure the True *Qi*, and then illness arises.

*The Fifth Principle states:*
*"The True One refines essence and disperses form."*

*Ancient sages of the highest attainment possessed the method of dispersing form and scattering shadow—*
how did they achieve it?
This is the method of *jīnshuǐ* (Metal-Water) dispersion of form.

*Now, the sun’s center, the water’s depths, and the mirror’s surface*
all can disperse form—
*is this not so?*
When form is dispersed by the sun,
the Primordial Spirit emerges from the Six *Jiǎ* (Heavenly Stems) in a single day,
and at that moment,
one must not be alarmed.

*He who recognizes the *Xuánzhū* (Mysterious Pearl)*
knows the *fǎ* (Law) of it.
Just as the *Law* of winter solstice’s thunder,
when the time is ripe, success is achieved—
fulfilling the practice and reaching the Upper Pure (清界).

*The Sixth Principle states:*
*"The Mysterious One refines spirit and forms the embryo."*

*Liú Gēn* (Surname Root) said:
*"Congeal into the *dāntián* (Elixir Field),
and emerge as a child—
this is the method of forming the embryo."*

*Thus, essence has its master,*
*qi* has its source,
breathing softly and softly,
harmonizing with nature—
then the embryo is formed, and the True One is complete.*

*Now, the clam absorbs the moon’s luminous *qi* yet forms a pearl within its belly—*
is this not the refinement of its spirit after death?
Hence, refining *qi* to form a body is called the *Xiānrén* (Immortal);
refining the Immortal to form a body is called the *Zhēnrén* (True Person);
refining the True One to form a body is called the *Jiùrén* (Ancient Person);
refining the Sage to form a body is called the *Shénrén* (Divine Person).

*The Classic says:*
*"Boundless, drifting in the Mysterious Ford,*
naturally refining my spirit."*

*Zhào Dàxìn* (Surname Great Faith) said:
*"A single treasure returns the Dragon Light to the *zhēngshì* (Struggle Chamber)—
this is the foundation of preserving the marvelous."*

*Now, those who refine *qi* to form a body*
are practitioners of *dǎoyǎng* (Guiding and Nourishing),
who may attain a lifespan of a thousand years or a hundred years,
yet only retain their old form—
they never truly grasp the Dao/Way.*

*Hence, the *Hàotiān Shī* (Celestial Sovereign Master) said:*
*"Longevity like that of tortoises and cranes*
is not the mark of a true Daoist Immortal."*

*In the past, the Master of Azure Essence lived three thousand years,*
and the *Cǎinǚ* (Colored Maiden) asked *Péngzǔ* (Surname Ancestor):
*"Is this man an Immortal?"*
*Péngzǔ* replied:
*"A practitioner of Guiding and Nourishing."*

*The Dragon masters the formation of pearls—*
when its pearls emerge, its body retreats,
and its name is changed to *Tiānlóng* (Celestial Dragon).
*High True Ones* (高真) cultivate likewise as Dragons.
*Tiānzhēn* (Celestial True Ones) refine their body, their spirit, and their *qi*;
though their transformations are beyond measure,
they are still bound by the *qìxiàng* (subtle material form).
*Wánghù Shān* (Surname House Mountain) has the *Tuìgǔ Dòng* (Retreating Bone Cave),
where those who attain the Dao ascend and shed their mortal frames.
*For those with form, ascending to Heaven is not possible,*
yet then the refined body is still constrained by *qìxiàng*.
*It dies, abandoning the body passed down from its parents—*
how could such a form endure long?
*Though long-lived, it has not yet escaped the realm of yin-yang,*
nor has it entered the boundless formlessness.*

*When the Dao is first attained,*
one advances to the One Heaven (一天),
and to the Nine Heavens of Nine Hundred Million Years (九百万岁一天).
*Each advance to a Heaven doubles one’s lifespan.*
*When the lifespan reaches twentyfold,*
the cultivation and refinement are complete.
*Then one ascends to the realm of the Formless,*
and upon reaching *Tiānlóng Dì* (Celestial Dragon Emperor) and *Luòjué Chángtiān* (Dragon Roar Long Heaven),
one’s lifespan spans
one thousand two hundred seventy-nine thousand seven hundred seventy-five billion five thousand two hundred years—
yet still, one remains within the transformations of yin and yang,
not yet able to enter the Formless.*

*Ānqīshēng* (Surname Peaceful Life) rode upon a swift *lín* (Unicorn)
and met the Three Sovereigns and the Divine Old Woman (神姥),
asking about the calamity of the *Yáng* (Yang) Nine Hundred and Six.
*The Divine Old Woman said:*
*"When yin and yang exhaust their cycles,*
the waters and fires will be consumed by flames,
and the Three Realms of Heaven and Earth will perish in transformation—
only the *Jiān-Yáng* (Pure Yang), *Jīnquē* (Golden Threshold), *Kūn-Gōng* (Earth Palace), and *Míngtáng* (Bright Hall) will remain.
*Thus, beyond the Ten True Ones (十真),*
one returns to the *Jīnquē* (Golden Threshold),
and the Great Force Divine King (大力神王) returns to the *Míngtáng* (Bright Hall).
*Pure Yang endures unbroken,*
*Pure Yin does not dissolve—*
this is the state of refinement."*

*How can one refine to the point of surpassing the Ten True Ones?*
*He said:*
*"Refining form does not rely on *qi*,
refining *qi* does not rely on form—
its *qi* can be seen,
yet its form cannot be glimpsed.*
*Exhaling does not rely on *qi*,
inhaling does not rely on breath—
entering the Formless without causing transformations,*
*the subtle material forms cannot constrain it.*
*This is the same as the Primordial Sovereign and the Upper True One (上真)."*

**Chapter on Cultivating the True:**

*"Guide and open the *Gǔhǎi* (Valley Sea),
adjust and harmonize the *shénshè* (Spiritual Abode);
dedicate the mind to the True One,
quietly observe the transformations."*

*Jiùyōuzǐ* (Surname Wandering Child) said:
*"Humans possess a Primordial Head with nine apertures (窍),
above mirroring the Nine Heavens,
below following the Nine Earths.*
*The body has nine apertures,*
and also the Five Cities (五城), Twelve Towers (十二楼), Golden Hall and Jade Palace (金堂琼宫),
where the spirit dwells.*

*The Nine Palaces of the Supreme One (九宫太一)—*
what does this mean?
*Dedicate the mind to the True One,*
and only preserve the One Official (一官),
then it will dissolve and manifest clearly.
*Thus, the Hundred Evils are automatically dispelled,*
and all blessings come in abundance.*

*By applying this method,*
I possess the Six *Qi* Prescriptions (六气之方) and the Essentials for Cultivating the Body (修身之旨):*

- *Swallowing (咽) governs the lungs,*
- *Hawking (呵) governs the heart,*
- *Sighing (嘘) governs the liver,*
- *Inhaling (呼) governs the spleen,*
- *Blowing (吹) governs the kidneys,*
- *Panting (嘻) governs the *Sānjiāo* (Triple Burner).

*The *Sānjiāo* (Triple Burner)*
is the *fǎxiàng* (Law-Image) of the Thirty-Six *Qi*,
distributed throughout the Five Zang (solid organs) and Six Fǔ (hollow organs),
connecting and guiding the *Shuǐgǔ* (Water-Grain) Sea,
adjusting and harmonizing the *xíngshén* (Form-Spirit) Abode.

*He who desires to nourish his spirit*
must first nourish his *qi*,
*he who desires to nourish his *qi***
must first nourish his brain,
*he who desires to nourish his brain*
must first nourish his essence,
*he who desires to nourish his essence*
must first nourish his blood,
*he who desires to nourish his blood*
must first nourish his saliva,
*he who desires to nourish his saliva*
must first nourish his fluids—
*then, and only then, can it be done."*

「The Nine Returns and Seven Reversals—what are they?

In broad terms, they span a year,
in narrow terms, a single day.
With one cycle of day and night,
the heavens descend and the earth ascends.

Thus, from *Yín* (寅) to *Shēn* (申),
these are the Seven Reversals.
From *Shēn* (申) to *Kūn* (坤),
these are the Nine Returns.

The essentials of the *Shénxiān* (Immortal Sage)
lie in *cúnxiǎng* (存想).
*Cún* (存) means preserving one’s own spirit,
*xiǎng* (想) means closing the eyes to see its form,
and gathering the mind to see its mind.
Keep the eyes from straying from the body,
and the body from straying from the spirit—
this is the gradual way of *cúnxiǎng*.

Next, one must cultivate *xìng* (性).
The way of cultivating *xìng* is to minimize labor,
yet not to extremes—
nor to force what the body cannot bear.

In eating and drinking, one should take little,
but not all at once.
Always maintain the balance of hunger within satiety,
and satiety within hunger—
this is the art of nourishing life well.

Thus, eat when first hungry,
drink when first thirsty,
and after meals, walk and massage the abdomen—
do this a hundred times.

At night, close the *Earth’s Gate* (地之户),
otherwise, true *qi* will dissipate,
and malevolent forces will enter from without.

Bend the knees and lie down,
rest the head on the right arm while sleeping—
this is called *Jíxiáng* (吉祥, Auspicious).

In spring and summer, rise early,
in autumn and winter, rise late.
When rising early, do not precede the *yīngwǔ* (鹦呜, mythical bird’s cry);
when rising late, do not delay past sunrise.

Always, upon hearing *yīngwǔ* (鹦呜),
reflect that within your body there is a man,
three inches tall, clad in black,
who stands upright.
With prolonged reflection,
you may come to see beyond ten thousand *lǐ* (里, leagues).

Who among us does not know
there are things to be avoided?

On *huìrì* (晦日, last day of the lunar month), do not sing,
on *shuòrì* (朔日, new moon), do not laugh.
Before and after *sōuchōu* (搜勿, critical times),
do not gaze upon the sun, moon, or stars,
nor look toward the northwest.
Do not drive recklessly in a carriage,
nor gallop horses wildly.
Do not leap over wells,
nor cross the paths of *áo* (鳌, mythical tortoises).
Keep your pillow low,
do not spit far,
sleep without raising the bedding,
and avoid sitting where winds and frosts strike—
these are but preliminary measures
for attaining the ultimate *xiūzhēn* (修真, cultivation of the True).

I have heard from the *Tàishàng* (太上, Supreme Sage):
*"The *qi* mirrors the cosmos,
its transformations are boundless and unfathomable.
The *yánglóng* (阳龙, Yang Dragon) and *yīnhǔ* (阴虎, Yin Tiger)
interchange, refining *shùyè* (木液, Wood Elixir) into *jīn jīng* (金精, Metal Essence).
Above, it ascends to the *Níwán* (泥丸, Mud Pill),
below, it flows into the *Dāntián* (丹田, Elixir Field).
It gathers the Five *Shí* (石, Stones) to nourish the Hundred *Shén* (神, Spirits).
When the inner elixir is complete,
the outer elixir responds;
but if the outer elixir responds
while the inner elixir is still insufficient,
then ascent is not yet possible."*

Some say that when the *jīn shēng yù zhèn* (金声玉振, Golden Voice and Jade Resonance) occur,
it is a sign that the Dao is nearing fulfillment.

The *Wù Zhēn Piān* (悟真篇, Awakening to the True Scripture)
follows the *Yellow Path* (黄道),
where *Yīn* (阴) is diminished and *Yáng* (阳) is perfected,
and the *Xuánzhū* (玄珠, Mysterious Pearl) takes form,
while *Tàiyī* (太一, Supreme Unity) returns to its origin.

*Zhāng Píngshū* (张平叔), surnamed *Bǒduān* (伯端),
a man of *Tiāntái* (天台),
said:
*"The Dao has two aspects.
Refining the Five *Yá* (芽, Sprouts) of *qi*,
ingesting the Seven *Yào* (曜, Luminaries’ lights),
directing reflection and massage,
absorbing the pure and expelling the turbid,
reciting *sūtras* and holding *dhāraṇīs*,
swallowing water and符 (*fú*, talismans),
knocking the teeth to gather the spirit,
abstaining from flesh and fasting,
preserving the spirit and closing the breath,
supplementing the brain and returning the essence—
and further, consuming herbs and minerals,
refining *jīnshí* (金石, metals and stones)—
these are the methods of *huàhuà yǒuwéi* (幻化有为, illusory transformations with deliberate action),
what is called *easy to encounter but difficult to attain*.
Even the practice of *bìxī* (闭息, breath retention)
entails entering *dìng* (定, meditation) and exiting *shén* (神, spirit),
its principle belonging to pure *Yīn* (阴).
Its dwelling is difficult to secure,
and it cannot avoid the use of artificial methods.
How could one thus attain
the fruit of *zìrán wúlòu* (自然无漏, spontaneous and leak-free)?
Could they truly reverse the *Yáng* (阳) and transform the bones,
ascending to the heavens?"*

My method of the *Nine Transformations of Golden Elixir* (九转金液还丹)
lies in penetrating *Yīn* and *Yáng*,
understanding *zàohuà* (造化, Creation and Transformation),
pursuing the Two *Qi* (二气) along the *Yellow Path*,
uniting the Three *Xìng* (三性, natures) in the *Yuángōng* (元宫, Primordial Palace),
and refining the Five *Phases* (五行),
harmonizing the Four *Xiàng* (四象, Symbols).
The *Lóng yīn Hǔ xiào* (龙吟虎啸, Dragon’s Roar and Tiger’s Howl)
rise in chorus and response,
the *Yùdǐng* (玉鼎, Jade Cauldron) steams with warmth,
and the *Jīn lú* (金炉, Metal Furnace) blazes with fire—
thus, the *Xuánzhū* (玄珠, Mysterious Pearl) takes form,
and *Tàiyī* (太一, Supreme Unity) returns to its origin.

In practice, this is done swiftly.
Yet guarding against peril and danger
lies in caution regarding *nìshùn* (逆顺, contrary and proper),
and in the careful *chōutiān* (抽添, withdrawal and addition).
Nurturing the *Zhèng* (正, True) and maintaining *Yǐng* (盈, fullness)
lies in caution regarding *shǒucí péiyī* (守雌抱一, preserving the receptive and embracing the One).
Thus, the *Yáng* (阳) *shēng* (生, life-giving) *qi* is fostered,
the *Yīn* (阴) *killing* (杀) form is diminished.
When the seasons are complete,
the body is cast off and the spirit transformed.

Yet scholars merely regard *qiān* (铅, lead) and *gǒng* (汞, mercury) as the Two *Qi*,
the Five Zang as the Five *Phases*,
the *heart* (心) and *kidneys* (肾) as *Kǎn-Lǐ* (坎离, Water and Fire),
the *liver* (肝) and *lungs* (肺) as *Lóng-Hǔ* (龙虎, Dragon and Tiger),
the *shénqi* (神气, spiritual *qi*) as *Zǐmǔ* (子母, Male and Female),
and the *jīn* (津, fluids) and *jīng* (精, essence) as *qiān-gǒng* (铅汞, lead and mercury).
They do not grasp the principles of *fúdīn* (浮沉, rising and sinking),
nor the subtleties of *bīnzhǔ* (宾主, guest and host).
How can they differ
from those who treat others as their own kin?

This is surely because they fail to perceive
the profound interplay of *Metal* (金) and *Wood* (木),
nor the essential harmony of *Yīn-Yáng* (阴阳).
Thus, they cause the *sun* (日) and *moon* (月) to stray from the Dao,
and lead *qiān-gǒng* (铅汞, lead and mercury) to wander from their proper furnaces.
To hope for the completion of the elixir,
is that not difficult?

Observe the many scriptures,
all of which state:
*"The sun is the soul, the moon the spirit,
the *Gēng-Hǔ* (庚虎, Metal Tiger) and *Jiǎ-Lóng* (甲龙, Wood Dragon),
*shuǐyín* (水银, mercury) and *zhūshā* (朱砂, cinnabar),
*báijīn* (白金, white metal) and *hēiqiān* (黑铅, black lead),
*Kǎn* (坎, Water) as male, *Lǐ* (离, Fire) as female,
congealing into *Golden Elixir*—
yet they do not explain
what the true *lead* (真铅) and true *mercury* (真汞) are."*

Now I present five verses to clarify:

1.
*"Refine the Three *Huáng* (黄, Yellows) in seclusion,*
*and tend to the Four *Shén* (神, Spirits)—*
*to seek herbs and minerals is not the true path.*
*When *Yīn-Yáng* (阴阳) align in their proper places,*
*the Eight *Bā* (八, Eights) naturally unite.*
*The *Tán* (潭, Pool) glows red as *Yīn* (阴) vanishes,*
*and the *Mountain’s* (山头) white moon reveals fresh elixir.*
*Men fail to recognize true *lead* and *mercury*—*
*not the common *shuǐyín* (水银) or *shā* (砂, sand)."*

2.
*"All men possess the elixir of longevity,*
*yet through ignorance, they discard it.*
*When *Sweet Dew* (甘露) descends,*
*the heavens and earth unite,*
*and when *Yellow Sprouts* (黄芽) emerge,*
*Water and Fire intermingle.*
*The *well frog* (井蛙) would say there is no *Dragon’s Lair* (龙窟),*
*and the *barred yīngwǔ* (篱鹦) would not know of the *Phoenix’s Nest* (凤巢).*
*When the elixir is ready,*
*gold fills the house naturally—*
*why seek herbs or burn reeds?"*

3.
*"They do not know the inverted transformations within the Mysterious,*
*nor how fire nurtures the lotus.*
*They force the *White Tiger* (白虎) to return home,*
*and produce a *Bright Pearl* (明珠) like the full moon.*
*They guard the elixir in the furnace,*
*watching the fire’s temper—*
*yet only when meditating on the spirit*
*does it naturally settle.*
*When all *Yīn* (阴) is diminished,*
*the elixir ripens,*
*and leaps free from the mundane cage—*
*this is no great difficulty."*

4.
*"To know where the elixir is born,*
*look to the southwest—*
*that is its native land.*
*When *lead* (铅) meets *Guǐ* (癸, the tenth Heavenly Stem),*
*it must be gathered swiftly;*
*when *gold* (金) encounters *wàngyuǎn* (望远, distant gazing),*
*it cannot be taken lightly.*
*Return it to the *Earth’s Cauldron* (土釜) and seal it tightly,*
*then place it in the *flowing pearl* (流珠) to combine properly."*

The elixir weighs one *cāty* (斤) yet requires two *bā* (八)—
adjust the fire’s temper by balancing *Yīn* and *Yang*.

5.
*"Three-five-one-all-three"*—three characters,
rarely understood by the wise of past and present.
Bundle three, add two from the south to make five,
one from the north, four from the west combine.
*Wù* and *Jǐ* (戊己) return to their native *shēng* numbers—five.
The Three Families meet, and a child is born.
This child holds the true *qi*—
in ten months, the embryo rounds, establishing the sacred foundation.

*Píngshū* (平叔) deemed it incomplete,
so he appended a short chapter, adding its essence.

The first:
When the sun dwells in *Lí* (离) yet turns to *Yīn*,
and *Kǎn* (坎) aligns with the *Chán gōng* (蟾宫), it becomes *Yang*.
Those who fail to grasp this inverted meaning
should not presume their narrow views as profound discourse.

The second:
The *guà* (卦) sets forth symbols like ritual forms—
when the symbol is obtained, words fade, and meaning becomes clear.
Later deluded disciples cling only to the forms,
yet chase *guàqì* (卦气) in vain, hoping for ascension.

The third:
Swallowing saliva and inhaling *qi* is the human path—
only with substance can all things be born.
If the cauldron lacks the true seed,
it is like fierce fire boiling an empty pot.

The fourth:
On *Huàyuè* (华岳) Mountain, a雄 tiger roars,
while beneath the *Fúsāng* (扶桑) sea, a *cīlóng* (牝龙) bellows.
The *Huángpó* (黄婆) herself arranges their union,
binding them as husband and wife in one mind.

The fifth:
Not knowing the *Yang* essence and its host-guest roles,
who can distinguish between distant and intimate?
Sealing the chamber yet leaving the *wèixué* (尾问穴) open—
how many have been misled by this error?

The sixth:
Do not use common *qiān* (铅)—
even true *qiān* must be discarded.
This is the profound secret of using *qiān*:
using it yet not using it—this is the genuine truth.

The seventh:
The *White Tiger* (白虎) of the West Mountain rages wildly,
while the *Qīnglóng* (青龙) of the Eastern Sea cannot be withstood.
Seize them both to fight to the death,
and they transform into a single mass of *zǐjīn shuāng* (紫金霜).

The eighth:
When bamboo breaks, patch it with bamboo—
covering the chick requires an egg.
All other efforts are in vain—
how can they compare to true *qiān* merging with the sacred mechanism?

The ninth:
The *Snow Mountain* (雪山) offers a fine brew—
pour it into the *Yīn-Yáng* furnace of transformation.
If you reach the northwest of *Kūnlún* (昆仑),
only then will you meet *Má Gū* (麻姑) as Zhang Qian did.

The tenth:
On the fifteenth of the eighth month, admire the *Chán* (蟾) glow—
this is when *Jīn* essence thrives at its peak.
When *Yī* (一, the first *Yang*) just begins to rise,
seize the fire—do not delay.

The eleventh:
The *Xuán* (玄) *Tà* (牝) Gate is known to none—
pointing to mouths and noses is mere folly.
Though *Liáo Jūn* (饶君) perfected breathing for millennia,
how could he ever attain the *Jīnwū* (金乌) and *Gāngtù* (钢兔)?

The twelfth:
Turn the *sǐhù* (死户) into *shēnghù* (生户),
do not cling to *shēngmén* (生门) as *sǐmén* (死门).
If you grasp the killing mechanism and reverse it,
only then will you know that harm harbors birth.

The thirteenth:
When the moon hangs half-bright in the sky,
the *lóng* (龙) and *hǔ* (虎) roars are heard early.
Then, fortify your resolve to refine the two *bā* (八)—
within one *shí* (时辰), the elixir will be complete.

The fourteenth:
Within the *yǎn yuè lú* (偃月炉), jade buds sprout,
while *zhūshā* (朱砂) and *shuǐyín* (水银) settle evenly.
Only after blending in the fire’s embrace
does the *huángyá* (黄芽) begin to grow.

The fifteenth:
Dreaming of visiting *Xīhuá* (西华) in the ninth heaven,
clearly instructed in the *Xuán* (玄) scriptures.
Though its essence is simple, its intent is profound—
it teaches only the refining of *gǒng* (汞) and *qiān* (铅).

The sixteenth:
After the *Huápó* (华池) banquet, the moon’s light congeals,
riding a *Jīnlóng* (金龙) to visit *Zǐwēi* (紫微).
From then on, all immortals recognize each other,
and the tides of sea and valleys shift at will.

The seventeenth:
The *Hèchì* (赫赤) *Jīndān* (金丹) completes in a day—
listen to the ancient immortals’ poetry for truth.
If they speak of nine years or three,
those are mere baseless claims of time.

The eighteenth:
*Tài Yī* (太一) says:
The woman wears green robes,
the man dons white silk.
Seeing them is forbidden,
using them renders them invisible.
If husband and wife meet,
their affection lingers naturally.

The furnace’s flames burn crimson red—
the True Person emerges on his own.

**Chapter Eighteen of *Dàoshū* concludes** #1—
*"Jíyào"* reads *"Dá"* instead of *"lián"* #2.
*"Jíyào"* reads *"zhuàng"* instead of *"běi"* #3.
*"Jíyào"* reads *"rú"* instead of *"zhī"* #4.
*"Jiānbiàn"* is *"biànjiān"* in *"Jíyào"* #5.
*"Jiān"* is *"huán"* in *"Jíyào"* #6.

**Chapter Nineteen: From *Yóuzǐ Zēngxiè’s* Collection**
**The *Tóngzhēn* (洞真) Scripture**

Five *yá* (芽) of *Tóngzhēn* remain preserved,
employing the Six *Qì* (气).
Serene and thoughtless, the spirit guards its place.

To the True Person, it says:
From the day of *Yuánmìng* (元命) and *Tàisuì* (太岁),
after the hour of *Zǐ* (子) and before *Wǔ* (午),
squat in a quiet chamber,
the mind clear as still water,
thoughtless and carefree—
then bind the teeth and strike the *Tiāngǔ* (天鼓) thirty-six times,
imagine my head,
shade it with my *huágài* (华盖),
sit firm upon *jiǎoxiàn* (狡现),
with the Azure Dragon to my left,
the White Tiger to my right,
the Vermilion Bird before me,
the Dark Turtle behind.
Bow to the four directions,
resting my hands upon my knees,
shaking my navel—
three times to the left, seven to the right—
warm my palms and wipe my face and ears,
doing this three times according to the hour.
A thousand days, and the spirit will emerge from the crown.

If fearful, imagine returning—
first, imagine myself seated within five colored divine clouds,
the clouds covering my crown.
When settled, silently pray:
*"Five *qì* blend and generate,
the supreme essence of *Xuánshàng* (玄上),
filling the Five *Zàng* (藏),
illuminating the Six *Yuàn* (院) clearly.
Internally infused, externally dispersed—
both exterior and interior purified,
impurities banished, the True welcomed.
I fly to *Tàilíng* (太灵)."*

After praying, first absorb the *Qīngyáng* (青阳) essence,
the Azure God’s clouds,
swallowing saliva nine times,
forming nine divine beings,
like the planet Jupiter,
wearing jade belts, green robes, and crowns,
placed within the liver,
facing the spirit and seated,
breathing in rhythm with the hour.

Next, absorb the *Língdān* (灵丹) essence,
the Vermilion God’s clouds,
swallowing saliva eight times,
forming eight divine beings,
like the planet Mars,
wearing jade belts, red robes, and crowns,
placed within the heart,
facing the spirit and seated,
breathing in rhythm with the hour.

Next, absorb the *Jīnpò* (金魄) essence,
the White God’s clouds,
swallowing saliva six times,
forming six divine beings,
like the planet Venus,
wearing jade belts, white robes, and crowns,
placed within the lungs,
facing the spirit and seated,
breathing in rhythm with the hour.

Next, absorb the *Xuányào* (玄曜) essence,
the Black God’s clouds,
swallowing saliva five times,
forming five divine beings,
like the planet Mercury,
wearing jade belts, black robes, and crowns,
placed within the *Jiānggōng* (绛宫),
piercing the two *pángguāng* (膀胱),
entering the *Wěiwèn* (尾问),
rising to the *jiājí* (夹脊),
spread within the two kidneys—
three to the left, two to the right—
facing the spirit and seated,
breathing in rhythm with the hour.

At *Wǔ* (午), exhale sharply; at *Mǎo* (卯), inhale gently;
at *Yǒu* (酉), swallow.

After each breath-work,
close the *qì*,
warm the palms and wipe the face until hot,
cover the ears with both hands so as not to hear sound,
and strike the *Tiāngǔ* thirty-six times.
The *Tiāngǔ* is the *yùzhěn gǔ* (玉枕骨).

After each breath-work,
tap the teeth three times,
swallow three times, exhale three times—
all in reverse sounds.

Then blow into the kidneys,
exhale sharply at the heart,
inhale gently at the liver,
swallow at the lungs,
exhale at the *Sānjiāo* (三焦),
exhale at the spleen—
swallowing twice to purge and discharge.
First, imagine the left eye emitting the sun,
the right eye emitting the moon—
each nine inches wide,
located above the ears,
named the *Liùhé Gāochuāng* (六合高窗).

When settled, silently pray:
*"Supreme *Xuányī* (玄一),
the Nine Sovereigns exhale essence,
three, five, seven transformations,
piercing the dark and obscure,
the sun and moon cast their light,
reaching the *Shéntíng* (神庭),
illuminating the *Liùhé*,
the *Tàiyī* (太一) *Huánglíng* (黄灵),
the Emperor’s decree inscribed—
golden script unshaken,
the Five Elders bearing talismans,
heaven and earth in eternal harmony.
Grant me immortality,
attaining the True Spirit,
repelling ten thousand evils,
banishing calamity and harm,
ascending to the Celestial Sovereign,
returning to youth, reborn as an infant—
the Great Emperor’s decree,
a hundred spirits in reverent obedience."*

After praying,
absorb the sun and moon,
swallowing saliva twenty-seven times per breath,
forming twenty-seven Imperial Lords:
Nine Imperial Lords descend into the *Jiānggōng*,
piercing the *Wěiwèn*,
rising to the *Níwán Guān* (泥丸关);
Nine Imperial Lords are spread within the *Zhōngguān* (中关);
Nine Imperial Lords descend through the *Jiānggōng*,
spread within the *Xiàguān* (下关)—
their spirits all wearing purple crowns and robes.

What are the Three Passes?
The brain, the heart, the navel.

Let the sun and moon permeate the body,
internally reaching the *Níwán*,
descending to the Five *Zàng*,
illuminating both interior and exterior—
as if the body merges with the light of sun and moon.

After some time,
tap the teeth nine times,
exhaling with a *"xī"* sound twenty-five times.

Each day, in sitting or lying,
keep in mind twenty-four stars,
each larger than an inch,
linked as if connected,
and within the stars, a man—
these are the twenty-four stars,
like a newborn babe without clothing.

Then the twenty-four stars exhale from the center,
circling the body once outside.

Pray:
*"Twenty-four True Ones,
returning to the *Huángtíng* (黄庭),
mouth exhaling yellow *qì*,
irrigating my *Mìngmén* (命门),
a thousand essences subdued #1,
a hundred spirits receiving spirit,
strengthening my bones,
soothing my soul and *pò*,
the Five *Zàng* receiving talismans,
heaven and earth leaning toward me."*

After praying,
absorb the twenty-four stars twice,
swallowing saliva twenty-four times per breath.

Whenever swallowing,
feel one star enter the mouth,
descending to below the navel,
then sense the star’s light transform into twenty-four True Persons,
each exhaling yellow *qì* like smoke,
spread below the navel,
dense and penetrating both interior and exterior.

After a long while, one employs the *hē* (呼) and *tǔ* (吐) techniques fifteen times.

In all cases of using *hē* (呵), *xū* (嘘), *yàn* (咽), *xī* (嘻), *hū* (呼), and *chuī* (吹), once completed, exhale the turbid *qì* ten times, imagining its form as the Five Colors, and likewise imagining one’s own body.

From the *Chóngzhēn Piān* (崇真篇):
*"Bing-Ding (丙丁) as nature, Ren-Gui (壬癸) as fate;
Study and exhaust principle, then recognize the True Way."*

The *Chóngzhēn Zǐ* (崇真子) Jin Dao Cheng (晋道成) said:
*"Nurturing the Three while holding to the One—this is the essence of Daoist practice.
What are the Three? They are *jīng* (精), *qì* (氣), and *shén* (神)—what I call the Three True Treasures.
What is the One to be held? It is the embrace and safeguarding of the Original Yang True *qì* (元阳真气).

The *shén* originates in the heart, belonging to the Southern Fire of Bing-Ding (丙丁).
Within the heart lies *xìng* (性), which belongs to Yang.
The kidneys generate the Original Yang True *qì*, which, when released, becomes *jīng* (精), and when conserved, becomes True *qì*, belonging to the Northern Water of Ren-Gui (壬癸).
Water is fate, and fate belongs to Yin.

He who understands the Way of nurturing the Three while holding to the One—
making *qì* guard *jīng*, *jīng* guard *shén*, and *shén* guard *qì*—
over time attains steadfast *shén* and harmonious *qì*, and thus the Dao of Transcendence is achieved.

For women, focus unwaveringly within the breast and beneath the floating skin,
supplementing True *qì* fully over a decade, and their practice will equal that of men.

Its marvel lies in:
the heart thinking of nothing,
the ears hearing nothing,
the eyes seeing nothing,
a single mind devoted to stillness,
diligence and perseverance in practice—
then cold and heat will not assail,
wasps and scorpions will not poison,
birds of prey will not strike,
wild beasts will not bite.
One’s complexion returns to that of a child,
one’s strength rivals that of a tiger or rhinoceros.
The seven orifices become piercingly clear,
night vision becomes as bright as day.
The heart’s insight awakens,
Dao *qì* returns on its own.
With *hē* and *chuī*, one can heal sickness;
with *yīng* (嘤) and *tǔ* (吐), one can command ghosts and spirits.

Thus, the *shén* ascends to the lofty heavens.
What distance is there to the *Qīngdū Bǎn Yuàn* (清都板苑)?"

「The *Return to the True* Chapter:
The *Xūgǔ* (虚谷, Void Valley) probes the mysteries, and measures their source;
The true nature is inwardly restored, and life’s essence returns to its root.

The *Xūgǔ* adept, Master Liuliè (烈, *Lìe*), says:
When the undifferentiated and the differentiated are already distinct,
When clarity and turbidity have been separated—
Then you are the spirit of the ten thousand things,
And I possess the singular excellence of the One Origin.
This excellence is inherently free from death and decay, is it not?
Yet its end comes from self-inflicted annihilation, is it not?

Amidst the scramble for fame and gain like ants,
Amidst the rise of quarrels like swarms of bees—
At this juncture, if one seeks to restore the true nature and return to the root,
To blunt sharpness and disperse chaos,
To dwell in peace and take joy in one’s work,
Then the singular spirit rests, and all realms are forgotten—
This is indeed the Dao!

Only with the blade of wisdom can one sever the bonds of *troubles* (烦恼, *fánnǎo*).

Thus, though sweet words and clever smiles may be employed,
The resolve of the *Lìeshì* (烈士, ardent warrior) cannot be swayed;
Though arched brows and plump cheeks may be displayed,
The gaze of the *Gāoshì* (高士, noble recluse) cannot be ensnared.

So, abandoning that and embracing this,
Understanding matter through the body’s awareness,
One must attain utter clarity and profound stillness,
To forget all attachments.

Hence, when the *shén* (神, spirit) transforms the *qì* (氣),
And the *qì* (氣) shapes the *xíng* (形, form),
This is the culmination of the *Xúnwěi* (穷委, exhausted retreat);
When the spirit illuminates itself and its light shines forth,
This is the flow of the marvelous use.

Beyond the dim and distant,
Within the hazy and indistinct—
Here lies the life’s journey of the Kunlun *Xūgǔ* (虚谷, Void Valley).

I have two paths, continuous and winding, that can lead straight to the celestial heights;
I have one field, winding and looping, that can circle back to the earthly depths.

Hidden in motion like the *Kūn Mǎ* (坤马, Earthly Steed),
Ascending in counterflow to the *Yín Hé* (银河, Silver River),
The rolling and swaying of the *Yǐngshuǐ* (游玑, Wandering Sphere) unfolds within a single body,
While mist and clouds emit and disperse through the seven orifices.
All spirits gather, and the hundred meridians flow freely,
The two *qì* (二气, *yīnyáng qì*) merge to restore the winds,
As the Three Palaces (三宫, *Sāngōng*—*Cāi*, *Rén*, and *Du**) ascend and descend without ceasing.
Thus, the enlightened lamp reflects back upon itself.

The boundless heavens are clear and empty—who can hear them?
This is what Dao is.»

The non-action is the function, the action is its application.
Then, the essence is stored within the vessel—
Motion and stillness are the daily mechanism.

First, the Jade Furnace is established,
Then the Golden Cauldron is set in place,
Above—*Xuán* (玄), below—*Zhā* (扎),
Left—*Yīn*, right—*Yáng*.
The Dragon and Tiger leap in union,
*Kǎn* and *Lí* alternate in action,
The Four Symbols are arranged,
The Five Phases are pierced and harmonized,
The Seven Luminaries are arrayed in order,
The Eight Gates open and close.
Thus, the Mother and Child guard each other,
And the matchmaker unites the couple—
Harmony between husband and wife is achieved.

Transforming earth, water, and fire,
Corresponding to day and time,
Rabbit’s lung and Crow’s liver—
Their medicines combine to the weight of one *jīn*.
Yellow buds and white snow—
Their essence is born from the two lands’ finest.

When the work is complete,
The thirty-six thousand spirits ascend to the Emperor’s court,
And thus I can transcend the world,
Seizing the nine hundred ninety million [of existence].

Moreover, the complete Dao lies in the alchemical transformation of the body—
Naturally, entering *yǒu* from *yǒu*,
Returning to *wú* from *wú*,
The interplay of *yǒu* and *wú*,
Form and spirit both refined,
Discarding the Three Corpses and surpassing the Three Realms,
Ascending to the Upper Purity and attaining the High Immortal,
Escaping the cycles of *yīn* and *yáng*,
Thus aligning with Heaven and Earth.

Wandering through the four directions,
Entering and exiting the eight extremes,
Moving when I will, going where my intent leads—
What care have I for life, death, or fortune and misfortune?

The *Hollow Valley* alchemical texts number a hundred,
Now I select fourteen to present.

**The First:**
This subtle principle is rare to grasp—
Cleaving the chaos to establish the alchemical foundation.
A mist of gold and water, torn like ice,
Three feet of frost and flames take flight.
*Kǎn* and *Lí* divide north and south,
Morning and evening—fire aligns with Heaven’s design.
A single pill transforms into pure *Yáng* essence,
Reining in the reins, whipping the steed into the Purple Micro.

**The Second:**
The tower soars above the market’s bustle,
Its gates welcoming twin paths to the misty heavens.
The Dark Furnace is swept by the Golden Boy,
The White Cauldron is poured by the Jade Girl.
Wind stirs the green pool, shaking the mushrooms,
Moonlight pierces the true hall, illuminating the banana leaves.
Within the pavilion, the carefree maiden sings—
A thousand years dissolve beneath these eyes.

**The Third:**
Drifting and floating without striking the boat,
The true spirit shifts, wandering the nine heavens.
Fire within water merges and harmonizes,
*Yīn* wraps *yáng*, yet freedom prevails.
The White-Faced Gentleman drives the Tiger’s tail,
The Red-Robed Boy grasps the Dragon’s head.
Once he enters the Jade Terrace, unbound,
He cares not for spring and autumn in the mortal world.

**The Fourth:**
Shaking off dust and purifying the heart,
Not letting worldly affairs intrude carelessly.
Sitting still, refining the true *qi*,
Silent, nurturing the sacred gold.
Two paths lead to the vast sea,
The Silver River surges, cascading from high peaks.
This is the family’s crucial secret—
The Twenty-Eight return, stepping deep in reverence.

**The Fifth:**
At the White Jade Tortoise Peak, the Mother’s home,
The red sun barely touches the three blooms.
A single drop of ghee falls like dew on the mulberry,
Nine petals of yellow drift like mist at the valley’s mouth.
The crane’s crown bears the refined elixir,
The lotus heart, uncluttered, radiates brilliance.
If one does not seek the twin paths,
Wandering endlessly along the sea’s edge is futile.

**The Sixth:**
One *qi* fills the void, pure and uncarved,
*Xuán* and *Huáng* split—*Liǎng Yī* opens.
*Kǎn* and *Lí* still govern *Qián* and *Kūn*,
The Rabbit and Crow are born from the womb of sun and moon.
Water, when exhausted, returns to the bound sea,
Stars, when absent, turn toward the North Star.
The Three Powers I hold in the center’s excellence—
Creation and transformation naturally align.

**The Seventh:**
The empty heart resonates with the ten thousand sounds,
The divine chamber condenses in the deepest night.
Waves cluster snowflakes on the cauldron’s face,
Light plays with starry hues in the furnace’s heart.
The Five Phases gather—*Gēng* returns to *Yǐ*,
The Three Dynasties unite—*Bǐng* reverts to *Rén*.
Creation’s work is worthy of admiration—
From the fire, mushrooms sprout golden treasure.

**The Eighth:**
Returning to the origin, restoring the root—homeward bound,
Gradually, withered branches sprout tender shoots.
To recognize the *Dāo Guī* seek *Wù Jǐ*,
To know water and fire is the *Hé Chē*.
Initially, the Golden Lotus seed is transmitted,
Later, the Jade Tree blooms.
Children, two by two, wrapped in crimson gates,
Nightly explorations end in drunkenness on flowing wine.

**The Ninth:**
Suddenly taking up the poetic brush, my talent soars,
Spring marrow warms the cup, brimming and full.
Who would cleave the chaos?
I alone polish the *Hóng Móng*.
The Golden Lotus is sown in the elixir pool,
The Jade Tree is transplanted to the emerald hills.
Truly, the family’s landscape is splendid—
*Kǎn*’s son and *Lí*’s daughter arrive together.

**The Tenth:**
Who would believe the alchemical work is shallow,
Seeking the One within the Three and Five?
If one knows how *Gēng Jiǎ* captures the Dragon and Tiger,
To recognize submersion and emergence—wood and metal.
*Kūn*’s six produces *Lí*’s inner fire,
*Qián*’s three births *Kǎn*’s *Rén*.
The alchemical scriptures clearly state—
Only the bewildered fail to grasp this truth.

**The Eleventh:**
Do not be deceived by superficiality,
Who would ask the already enlightened?
Three returns to the Dawn add three months,
Once the flower flies, a spring is lost.
*Yáng*’s *qi* like smoke is truly regrettable,
The wilderness, like water, should not be neglected.
Thousands of scrolls and bamboo records attest—
Observe those who have attained the Dao before.

**The Twelfth:**
All speak of great concealment in *Hún Yǐn Luó*,
Yet laugh at mountain dwellers nurturing *Tài Hé*.
When fame and gain are slight, worldly affairs are slight,
Many pursuits bring many disputes.
Green waters and blue mountains transcend the nature’s cave,
Willow eyebrows and elixir faces sink into the river.
Ask if wealth can rival a nation—
Impermanence cannot be bought.

**The Thirteenth:**
The sun and moon revolve—examine carefully,
The *Tiān Wāi* pointer aligns with the Wandering Sphere.
The great work requires three thousand days,
The marvelous application lacks not the twelve hours.
Four and eight—*yīn* dissipates, impurities vanish,
Nine and three—*yáng* grows, merging with *Xī Yí*.
Every word of the Mystic Pass is true—
All secrets leak through these verses.

**The Fourteenth:**
The *Tài Yǐ* Divine Furnace, threefold and stored,
Circulating above and below, following *Qián* and *Kūn*.
Heaven revolves, Earth submits—tortoise and serpent respond,
*Yīn* kills, *yáng* is born—at the *Mǎo* and *Yǒu* Gates.

The fire advances through *Lún-Méng*, ever warm and balmy,
The cauldron contains gold and water, ever steady and mild.
The Mystic Pearl refined, its golden radiance dazzles bright,
Offered to the Void Sovereign—most exalted of all.

The *Modifying True Essence* scriptures speak of:
Five Phases inverted in their roots,
Three Fields reversed—*Winter Zi*, *Summer Wu*—
Divine qi stored within.

Master Hua Yang, shouldered by *Shān Wú*, heard from Master Zheng Yang, *Zhōng Lí Yún Fáng*:
*"Yù Qīng, Shàng Qīng, Tài Qīng, Tài Wú, Tài Xū, Tài Kōng, Tài Zhì"*—
These are the manifestations of the Great Dao’s *wu* and *yǔ* generating,
Establishing the foundation and markers of Heaven and Earth.

Speaking of humanity:
The Three Pure Ones are the gathered *jīng*, *qì*, and *shén* of parents—
*Jīng* and *xuè* as the exterior, *jīng* and *qì* as the wrapping,
Like the clear and turbid of Heaven and Earth.

The Pure Yang Master said:
*"When the Dragon and Tiger unite to form the Inner Elixir,*
*Three hundred days pass before True Qi arises,*
*Refined into the Yang Spirit—*
*First in the Yellow Court, then the Inner Precinct,*
*Finally emerging through the Heavenly Gate.*
*These are the Three Pure Ones of humanity."*

The kidneys are water—
Within water, *yuán qì* is born, comparable to Earth;
The heart is fire—
Within fire, true soil forms, comparable to the gathering of stones.
The spleen expands with exhalation, drawing kidney-qi upward;
With inhalation, it descends, meeting heart-qi below.
Thus, between breath and breath, the movements of Heaven and Earth are mirrored—
Pure qi enters the central palace,
Nourished by food and drink, receiving all things;
The refined essence of the four limbs is drawn from the five viscera—
These are the Three Talents of humanity.

The Pure Yang Master said:
*"Parental union generates the body—humanity’s Three Talents;*
*Heart and kidney unite to form the Elixir—my Three Talents."*

Master Hua Yang said:
*"How profound these words are!*
The moon is the essence of *Tài Yīn*—
Without *yáng*, it cannot generate, thus it receives the sun’s soul to shine.
The sun is the essence of *Tài Yáng*—
Without *yīn*, it cannot form, thus it obtains the moon’s shadow to manifest.

Within the body, it is as when kidney-qi passes to liver-qi—
When liver-qi emerges, the residual *yīn* of the kidneys is exhausted,
Thus the soul is born in the liver.
When heart-fluid passes to lung-fluid,
Lung-fluid arises, and the residual *yáng* of the heart is exhausted,
Thus the spirit is born in the lungs.

Within kidney-qi, take the water of *Zhēn Yī*—
Within heart-fluid, take the *Zhēng Yáng* qi.
Let the water of *Zhēn Yī* be the embryo,
As the moon’s shadow receives the sun’s soul to illuminate—
Let the water of *Zhēn Yī*, with *Zhēng Yáng* qi as master,
As the sun’s soul receives the moon’s shadow to radiate.

A year has twenty-four *qì*, and a day also has twenty-four *shí*:
Thus, *Hài-Zǐ-Chǒu* are the positions of *Rén-Gǔi*—
Belonging to *Xiǎo Xuě, Dà Xuě, Dōng Zhì, Xiǎo Hán, Dà Hán*.
*Yín-Mǎo-Chén* are the positions of *Jiǎ-Yǐ*—
Belonging to *Lì Chūn, Yǔ Shuǐ, Jīng Dì, Chūn Fēn, Qīng Míng, Gǔ Yǔ*.
*Wèi-Wǔ-Wèi* are the positions of *Bǐng-Dīng*—
Belonging to *Lì Xià, Xiǎo Mǎn, Máng Zhǒng, Xià Zhì, Xiǎo Shǔ, Dà Shǔ*.
*Shēn-Yǒu-Xū* are the positions of *Gēng-Xīn*—
Belonging to *Lì Qiū, Chǔ Shǔ, Bái Lù, Qiū Fēn, Hán Lù, Shuāng Jiàng, Lì Dōng*.

Five days make a *hòu*, three *hòu* make a *qì*, two *qì* make a *shí*.
The twelve *shí* are *yáng* times;
The twelve *shí* are *yīn* times.
*Gèn, Xùn, Kūn, Qián*—the four *guà* times—
Together forming twenty-four *shí*, matching the twenty-four *qì* of Heaven and Earth.
A day’s twelve *shí*, each *shí* thirty degrees—
Totaling three hundred sixty, matching Heaven and Earth’s three hundred sixty degrees.

Heaven and Earth’s spring, summer, autumn, winter,
The moon’s waxing, waning, dark, and new,
Humanity’s *Zǐ-Wǔ-Mǎo-Yǒu*—
All align in fourfold harmony.

Knowing the times and applying the method,
The Elixir is complete, qi is abundant—
Long life is achieved, refining qi into spirit grants sainthood.

The Five Phases are mutually generative:
Thus lung-qi moves only with kidney-qi,
Heart-qi moves only with liver-qi,
Spleen-qi moves only with heart-qi,
Lung-qi moves only with spleen-qi.
Within the Three Fields, *jīng* generates *qì*—
Secreting *jīng* strengthens *qì* itself.
Qi generates spirit—
Nurturing *qì* clarifies the spirit.

Mutual generation of the Five Phases extends life,
Reversing the Three Fields transcends mortality.

What are the Nine Palaces of humanity?
The *Dān Yuán* Palace—*shèn* (kidneys);
The *Zhū Líng* Palace—*xiǎo cháng* (small intestine);
The *Lán Tái* Palace—*gān* (liver);
The *Tiān Lí* Palace—*dǎn* (gallbladder);
The *Huáng Tíng* Palace—*pí* (spleen);
The *Xuán Líng* Palace—*dà cháng* (large intestine);
The *Shàng Shū* Palace—*fèi* (lungs);
The *Yù Fáng* Palace—*páng guāng* (bladder);
The *Jiàng Xiāo* Palace—*xīn* (heart).

Speaking of the Nine Provinces:
*Jì Zhōu*—*shèn* (kidneys);
*Yī Duì Zhōu*—*páng guāng* (bladder);
*Qīng Zhōu*—*gān* (liver);
*Xú Zhōu*—*dǎn* (gallbladder);
*Yáng Zhōu*—*xīn* (heart);
*Jīng Zhōu*—*xiǎo cháng* (small intestine);
*Liáng Zhōu*—*fèi* (lungs);
*Yōng Zhōu*—*dà cháng* (large intestine);
*Yù Zhōu*—*pí* (spleen).

In terms of form:
The lungs are eight inches long, shaped like a *huā gài* (flowered canopy);
The heart is nine inches long, shaped like a *chuí lián* (pendant lotus);
The liver is seven inches long, shaped like a *xuán hú* (suspended gourd);
The kidneys are three inches long, shaped like *xuán shí* (suspended stone);
The spleen is seven inches and six *fēn* long, shaped like a *fù pén* (inverted basin).
Their kinds are inexhaustible.

From kidney-qi, take the water;
From the heart’s embrace, take the qi.
Qi ascends, water descends—
This is the *Wèi Jì* hexagram.

The kidney-qi ascends to the crown, and the true water descends;
The heart-qi enters the elixir field, and the true qi ascends—
This is the **Jì Jì** (Already Fulfilled) hexagram.

When the heart and kidneys unite to form the inner elixir,
The liver and lungs transmit and manifest the fire stage,
Conforming to the Dao of Heaven and Earth’s ascent and descent,
And the numbers of the sun and moon’s advance and retreat.

How do the **Dragon** and **Tiger** unite?
From *Chén* (3–5 AM) and *Sì* (5–7 AM) until *Wǔ* (11 AM–1 PM) and cease,
Their **essence** is divided into three swallowings;
Thus, in a secluded chamber, one sits quietly,
Alternating hands and clasping knees,
Forgetting thoughts and severing contemplation,
Slightly raising the waist,
Closing the eyes and quieting the mind,
Filling the mouth with saliva,
Slowly exhaling through the nose,
Drawing in deeply again,
Pressing the saliva down—
The true Dragon will not ascend,
Drawing breath upward—
The true Tiger will not descend.

At first, one feels the throat dry;
Next, one feels the heart surge;
Finally, one feels the emotions unblocked.

Once the Dragon and Tiger unite,
Then there is no substance without generating substance—
Its form resembles **millet**,
Returning to the Yellow Court—
This is the **Mysterious Pearl**.

If the fire stage of refining is not misjudged,
Then it becomes the **Golden Elixir**.

Fire is the **Threefold True Fire**.
Ascending and descending in cycles,
There is the Dao of the **Microcosmic Orbit**.
Fifteen *liǎng* (150 *fēn*) make **360 *zhū*** (the daily cycle’s measure),
There is the degree of the Microcosmic Orbit.

Heaven-qi changes in five-day stages,
Thus the practitioner also advances and retreats the fire stage every five days.

The **Three Qi** reside in the Yellow Court;
Their method employs *Xū* (7–9 PM) and *Hài* (9–11 PM) until *Zǐ* (11 PM–1 AM),
Sitting quietly in a secluded chamber,
Shielding away thoughts and contemplation,
Slightly reclining at the desk,
Gently compressing the abdomen,
Making the breath nasal and continuous,
Using it without strain,
Silently storing the elixir field’s fire—
Its transformation never wearying,
Compressing it without movement,
If exhausted, temporarily pausing before compressing again—
This is to gather the dispersed qi,
Imagining fire turning at the kidneys,
The heart-fire descending into the Yellow Court,
At first slightly painful in the abdomen,
Then gradually warming,
Practiced thus to nourish the deficient and benefit the qi,
Accumulated to prolong life.

If one combines this with the earlier **Dragon-Tiger** practice,
In **100 days**, descend fire by **five *liǎng*** (50 *fēn*), from *Xū* until *Zǐ*,
Refining essence into **mercury**—the medicinal potency is complete;
In **200 days**, descend fire by **ten *liǎng*** (100 *fēn*), from *Yǒu* (5–7 PM) until *Zǐ*,
Refining mercury into **sand**—the **fetal chamber** is now firm;
In **300 days**, descend fire by **fifteen *liǎng*** (150 *fēn*), from *Shēn* (3–5 PM) until *Zǐ*,
Refining sand into **gold**—pure **yang** qi is born.

How does one take fire?
With a **prayer bead** of **108**, concentrating breath to count—
Only when the count is complete does one obtain **one *zhū*** (unit of measure).

How does **flying gold** appear after the elbow?
At *Zǐ* (11 PM–1 AM), when **one yang** first stirs and one applies effort,
Sitting upright with clothes spread,
Clenching and storing the spirit,
Knocking teeth **24 times**,
Gathering spirit and harmonizing breath,
Forgetting thoughts and severing contemplation,
Closing the eyes and quieting the mind,
Storing the elixir field below,
Slightly arching the spine,
At first feeling slight warmth beneath the waist—
If not yet warm, arch again,
Until warmth arrives, then cease,
Thus the breath passes through the **Tailbone Pass** to the **Lower Pass**,
Then through the **Double Pass** at the **Jiaji** (paravertebral points),
Then through the **Upper Pass** at **Yùjīng** (left of the heart),
Ascending until it strikes—
One collision at the **three passes**, entering the **Muddy Pellet**,
And ceases when the sun rises.
Practiced thus in one night,
It can restore a year’s loss;
If the count is full,
It can nourish the brain and benefit the marrow,
Turning back aging and restoring youth.

Thus, *Chén* and *Sì* are called **uniting**,
*Xū* and *Hài* are called **advancing fire**,
*Zǐ* is called **retreating fire**.

How is it called the **Golden Elixir Returning Elixir**?
Its method employs *Zǐ* (11 PM–1 AM),
Sitting quietly and storing the ascending breath,
Covering the ears and closing the nostrils,
Lightly swaying and scattering,
Making kidney-qi ascend to the crown,
Assaulting the **spirit-water** to descend—
From above, it descends in a sudden rush,
Cold and sweet, not rinsed before swallowing.
With time, bones become strong,
The body light and resilient against cold and heat.

How is it called the **Jade Elixir Returning Elixir**?
Its method employs *Chén* and *Sì* (3–5 AM and 5–7 AM) for uniting,
Sitting quietly and severing all thoughts,
Using the tongue to press the tooth gaps,
Drawing in both cheeks,
Swallowing when saliva appears,
Or swallowing breath when there is none—
Filling the count of **360**,
This is the qi ascending from the lungs,
Which can restore a year’s loss alone;
If one has the **inner elixir**, this is not needed.

At *Zǐ* (11 PM–1 AM), storing the ascending breath and arching the spine,
One collision at the **three passes**—
Once entered at the crown, quickly closing the breath,
Covering the ears and swaying,
The **golden elixir** is made to descend—
Thus, not rinsed before swallowing,
At that moment, raising the body and lifting the abdomen,
The elixir field’s pure yang ascends and descends,
Meeting beneath the **Double Layered Pavilion**—
This is **Already Fulfilled**.

At first, a single **pearl** forms,
As large as **millet**, its hue bright and yellow,
Returning then to the Yellow Court—
This is the **Golden Millet**.

Thus, **golden light** emerges from the skin and hair,
Counting the effort and fixing the breath’s measure—
This is the **Already Fulfilled** stage.

A person’s **original qi** completes **one cycle daily**,
Their **original spirit** alternates every **ten days**.

On *Jiǎ-Yǐ* (Wood-Earth days), at *Mǎo* (5–7 AM), refine **liver-qi**;
On *Bǐng-Dīng* (Fire days), at *Wǔ* (11 AM–1 PM), refine **heart-qi**;
On *Gēng-Xīn* (Metal days), at *Yǒu* (5–7 PM), refine **lung-qi**;
On *Rén-Gùi* (Water days), at *Zǐ* (11 PM–1 AM), refine **kidney-qi**—
All refined into **spirit**.

Only the **Spleen** lacks inherent *qi* and thus requires no refining.
On *Wù-Jǐ* (Earth days), rest quietly in stillness—
Sit upright in a secluded chamber,
Banish all thoughts and worries,
Tap the teeth twenty-four times,
Let the mind dwell solely in the **Dao**,
Calm the spirit, harmonize the *qi*—
Silently observe the organ being refined;
When the mind arrives, the *qi* will follow of its own accord.

The **pure-yang fire** of the **Elixir Field** now gathers—
This is the **Convergence of the Three Flowers**,
Not to be compared with the fire of *samādhi*.

After ten days of refining,
Each organ refined ten times over a hundred days—
Then the *qi* ascends, the spirit manifests,
Each rising in its own hue, a kaleidoscope of colors,
Circulating and reflecting back—
One sees the five-colored clouds arise from the **Crucible**,
This is the **transformation of *qi* into spirit**,
Ascending to **Heavenly Primordium** and entering the **Divine Officials**.

Yet fear the outer demons that would disrupt the **True Nature**—
Swiftly withdraw inward observation to ignite the fire.

Thus it is said:
To seek **longevity**, refine the **Elixir** and subdue the fire;
To seek **immortality**, return the **Elixir** and refine the form;
To seek **ascension**, transform *qi* into spirit.

**Yānluózi** said:
The **Immortal** swallows *qi*,
Seals the breath so it does not enter,
Letting it circulate in the throat—
When the *qi* is full and hard to contain,
Sit upright and elevate the waist,
Thus without ceasing,
The *qi* surges, dispelling stagnation,
And breath may be prolonged for a time.
Accumulated *qi* generates essence,
Nourishing internally the five **zàng** and six **fǔ**,
Moistening externally the skin and flesh.

This is the **supreme method of ease**,
Yet it does not exhaust the **Mysterious Subtlety**.

The **Mysterious Subtlety** lies in
Sitting in seclusion, stillness, and thoughtlessness,
Swallowing *qi* and sealing the breath,
When urgent, elevate the body;
When relaxed, exchange breaths and seize the residual *qi*—
Thus the heart and abdomen grow empty,
The head and eyes sharpen,
The body feels full and joyous,
The spirit and *qi* harmonize—
This is the method of **prolonging life**.

If one overeats,
Seal the breath and empty the mind—
The excess will naturally dissipate.
If *qi* and blood stagnate,
Seal the breath and silently observe the ailment’s location—
The illness will then be cured.

To **inhale nine breaths, swallow one**,
To **retain three, exhale seven**,
To **fix the breath and observe inwardly**—
All things will be accomplished.
This is the **secret of longevity**.

What is meant by this?
Inhale pure *qi* through the nose nine times,
Then swallow once in the throat,
Preventing the inhaled *qi* from circulating.
When it feels urgent, elevate the body to gather *qi* and exhale,
Do not let it fully escape—
Always retain two or three breaths.
At the moment of sealing the breath,
Silently observe the five **zàng**—
The *qi* will naturally flow and harmonize,
And the ailments will depart.

**Zhèngyáng Zhēnrén** said:
To awaken **Yang Gong’s eldest son**,
One must **absorb much and exhale little**,
Following the **struggle of yin and yang**,
Seizing the **True One** beyond its time.

**Chúnyáng Zhēnrén** explained:
**Yang Gong** is **Heaven (乾)**.
**Heaven** seeks **Earth (坤)** and generates **Thunder (震)**,
**Thunder** is the eldest son,
In the body, it is the **Liver**,
In time, it is the **Mao hour (5–7 AM)**—
This is the **Tài (泰) hexagram**,
The season of **three yangs**.

At this time, the **Kidney’s *qi*** is like an infant,
Ascending to nourish the **Liver**,
The **Heart’s essence** is like an old woman,
Descending to the **Lungs**,
The **Lung’s *qi*** interacts—
Thus, inhalation is abundant,
Exhalation is sparse,
The *qi* is condensed and not allowed to descend—
This is the **struggle of yin and yang**.

Accumulated *qi* generates essence,
Thus the **True *qi*** grows ever more abundant—
Hence, **seizing the True One beyond its time**.

Thus, the **Mysterious Subtlety** does not depart from the **Mao hour**.

Externally, it corresponds to **Tài (泰)**,
Internally, it aligns with the **interaction of Kǎn (坎) and Lí (离)**—
Inhaling pure *qi*,
Elevating the body inwardly,
Silently counting the **Microcosmic Orbit** three hundred and sixty times,
One may **seize a year’s *qi*** to compensate for past losses—
This surpasses **Womb-Breathing** in its efficacy.
The weak may strengthen their bones,
The aged may return to youth.

**Qíbó** said:
A person’s **True *qi***
Is stored in the **Liver** in spring,
In the **Heart** in summer,
In the **Lungs** in autumn,
In the **Kidneys** in winter.
The **Liver** and **Heart** are **yang**,
The **Lungs** and **Kidneys** are **yin**—
Nurture them according to the seasons,
Without exceeding the **solstices and equinoxes**.

The method of nurturing is:
To remain **unperturbed and self-adjusting**,
Sitting in stillness and observing inwardly the organ being nourished—
The *qi* will naturally condense, taking **form and appearance**.

Thus, **yin *qi*** is the **embryo**,
**Yang *qi*** is the **breath**—
When the *qi* is still, the form is still—
This is the **key to longevity**.

The *Língshū* says:
**Heaven and Earth inverted**,
**Yin and yang generated in reverse**,
Refining **lead** and **mercury**,
The **Dao** arises naturally.

**Biānqiú** said:
Fifteen days after **Winter Solstice**,
**True Lead** accumulates one part,
Its form like **light smoke**—
If refined, one may attain **ease and longevity**.
Thirty days,
**True Lead** accumulates two parts,
Its form like **thin mist**—
If refined, one may **reverse aging and return to youth**.
Forty-five days,
**True Lead** accumulates three parts,
Its form like **hanging dew**—
If refined, one may **preserve the form and dwell in the world**.

Fifteen days after **Summer Solstice**,
**True Mercury** accumulates one part,
Its form like **playful petals**—
If refined, one may **strengthen bones and lighten the body**.
Thirty days,
**True Mercury** accumulates two parts,
Its form like **held lotus**—
If refined, one may **achieve longevity and clear vision**.
Forty-five days,
**True Mercury** accumulates three parts,
Its form like **embracing an egg**—
If refined, one may **refine the form and transform *qi***.

Thus, refining **True Lead** yields the **Yang Embryo**,
Refining **True Mercury** yields the **Yin Breath**.
Using **Yin Breath** for the **Yang Embryo**,
The **formless transforms into the formed**.
Using the **Yang Embryo** to enter the **Yin Breath**,
The **formless generates the substantial**.

Yet **Qíbó** did not know the timing,
And **Biānqiú** did not transmit the method.

If one follows only the **solstices and equinoxes**,
The timing is not yet refined.
If one observes inwardly according to the seasons,
The method is not yet complete.

Only at **Winter’s Zǐ hour** and **Summer’s Wǔ hour**
Should one **condense the breath and retain the *qi***,
Then sit in stillness,
Gather the body and focus the spirit,
Directing attention first—
Only then may it be said to be **complete and perfect**.

「Thus, the essence of **Fetal Breathing** lies in severing all movement of thought—
like pouring water on stone, where nothing can penetrate.
Only then does the spirit settle and the *qi* harmonize,
the **Original Soul** abide, and the **True Embryo** condense.

This is the **Unleaked** state:
three years for minor attainment,
six years for medium attainment,
and nine years for great attainment.

**Divine Master** spoke of **Fetal Breathing** thus:
*"Diligently guard the center,
Do not let it stray.
Externals do not intrude,
Internals do not escape.
Return to the **Original Source**,
All matters conclude.
Cultivate with care,
Without regard for time.
*

**Master Cao** elucidated it:
*"Diligently guard the center"* means to internally retain the **spiritual awareness**;
*"Do not let it stray"* means to keep the **single intention** undivided;
*"Externals do not intrude"* means to regard all objects as nonexistent;
*"Internals do not escape"* means to dwell in dust yet remain unstained;
*"Return to the Original Source"* means to concentrate *qi* and achieve **suppleness**;
*"All matters conclude"* means to cease external desires;
*"Cultivate with care"* means to diligently practice;
*"Without regard for time"* means to attain **longevity and prolonged vision**.

Therefore, the practice of **True Fetal Breathing** consists solely in the **dual dissolution of body and self**,
the **convergence of spirit and *qi***,
condensing to form the **embryo**,
abiding to become the **breath**.
When **form and spirit** are both refined, one may achieve **longevity**;
when **spirit and *qi*** merge as one, one may attain **sainthood**.

Thus, exhausting **principle**, perfecting **nature**, and reaching **fate**,
the spirit and *qi* naturally harmonize,
from **nothingness** generating **somethingness**,
clarity within and without,
taking **color as emptiness**,
the **Heavenly True Original Soul**,
serene and self-delighted.

**Jade Emperor**’s divine method for **Fetal Breathing** states:
*"Preserve the Three, Guard the One."*

**Highest Primordial Lord** explained it:
*"The Three"* are **essence**, *qi*, and **spirit**;
*"The One"* is the **kidney**.
From the kidney arises *qi*,
from the heart arises **spirit**;
when *qi* and **spirit** merge, they form **essence**,
and when **essence** and **spirit** abide, they descend below.
Thus, **store the spirit above**,
**retain the *qi* in the middle**,
**preserve the essence below**—
when the three are stored,
then **guard the One** in the **elixir field**,
ignoring all distinctions of internal/external objects
and methods of *qi* ascent/descent.
The *qi* naturally returns to its **Original Source**,
condensing to form the **embryo**,
while the **spirit** follows the *qi* undispersed,
becoming the **breath**.

When **spirit and *qi*** are unified as one,
there is no **death or life**;
when **heart and kidney** share the same *qi*,
there is no **illness or disease**.
How then do all **phenomena** enter?
How do all **thoughts** arise?

If one wearies of the **mundane world**,
then one should **elevate the *qi*** to form the **spirit embryo**,
and **converge the spirit*** to become the **master of *qi***.

Thus, the **spirit embryo** and **breath of *qi***,
divided into **three aspects**—the **manifest** and the **formless**—
transform into **ten thousand forms**,
with the **true soul** undissipated—
this is the **method of attaining #8 Sainthood**.

**Supreme Lord’s Mysterious Principle** states the natural method of **Fetal Breathing** as:
*"Longevity and prolonged vision."*

**Master Xu** elucidated it:
*"Sit in stillness, forget all thinking,
and gaze long at the **Upper Field**—
then the **spirit** attains longevity;
gaze long at the **Middle Field**—
then the **breath** attains longevity;
gaze long at the **Lower Field**—
then the **form** attains longevity.
‘Gaze’ means to fix one’s vision
without departing from its object—
the **heart-spirit** follows the gaze and ceases,
the **kidney-*qi*** responds to the spirit and transmits.
Thus, the **formed *qi*** hides within the **formless spirit**,
the **embryo** within the **form**,
the **breath** within the **embryo**;
the **breath** abides with the **spirit**,
the **spirit** exists with the **breath**—
this is the **way of prolonged vision**.

I know only the **body** between **heaven and earth**,
and within the **body**, only **spirit and *qi*** exist.

Thus, gazing upward at the **spirit palace**,
the **spirit** does not disperse—
gazing long refines the **spirit**,
the **spirit** gathers as the **embryo**,
and the transmitted *qi* enters to become the **breath**—
naturally **above**;
gazing downward at the **breath conduit**,
the **breath** does not disperse—
gazing long refines the **breath**,
the *qi* gathers as the **embryo**,
and the preserved **spirit** enters to become the **breath**—
naturally **middle**.

Refining the **breath** and merging it,
constantly guarding the **elixir field**,
condensing to form the **embryo**,
abiding to become the **breath**—
naturally **below**.

**Upper, middle, lower** refer to the **Three Fields**.

The **True Water** of the kidney is the **Tiger**;
the **Rectified Breath** of the heart is the **Dragon**.
When **Dragon and Tiger** merge, they form the **Mysterious Pearl**,
and when the **fire alchemy** is complete, it becomes **Golden Elixir**.

Take the **end of the Zǐ hour** and the **beginning of the Wǔ hour**—
this is the time of **Xùn** (the southeast wind).
In a secluded chamber, sit upright,
fill the mouth with saliva,
neither spit nor swallow,
and press it to contain the **Dragon and Tiger’s *qi***,
preventing them from fleeing.
Merge them to form the **Mysterious Pearl**,
its size like a **millet grain**,
returning it to the **Yellow Court**.
Each cycle, it can augment **True Breath** by a **ten-foot measure**.

What is **fire alchemy**?
The **Rectified Yang *qi*** of the heart is the **True Fire**;
when **True Fire** ascends, it refines the **form**,
and when it descends, it returns to the **Original Source**,
augmenting *qi* and prolonging life.

At the **end of the Xū hour** and the **beginning of the Hài hour**—
this is the time of **Gàn** (the northwest wind).
In a secluded chamber, sit upright,
do not move the **sides or abdomen**,
condense and retain the transmitted **kidney-*qi**,
preventing it from ascending.
Internally visualize the **True Fire** descending,
and practice this for one day to replenish a year’s **deficiency**.

**Pure Yang Master** said:
*"The essence of **Golden Elixir** lies in
**preserving ascent, opening closure**,
**passing through gates without haste**,
**fire alchemy without deviation**—
this is the **method of producing Golden Elixir**.

After the **Zǐ hour**, when **one Yang** first stirs,
don the **clothes of the cosmos**, sit upright,
grasp and stabilize internally,
preserve the **lower waist and body**,
so the **kidney** merges and the *qi* gathers.
When one feels the **umbilical abdomen** slightly warm,
gradually ascend the *qi* through the **body**,
slightly arch the **spine**,
and circulate the **kidney-*qi*** back to the **tailbone**,
from below to above,
passing through the **Middle Gate**,
directly entering the **Jade Axis** at the **pituitary gland**,
to replenish the **brain**—
naturally the **marrow is filled** and the **bones are fortified**.

If refining **Golden Elixir**,
then perform the **retrograde fire** method.

When **Dragon and Tiger** merge to form the **Mysterious Pearl**,
descending **heart-fire** is the method of **replenishment**,
and **flying gold crystals** from behind the elbow
is the method of **brain supplementation**—
both are used as **Golden Elixir**.

The **Mysterious Pearl** is the **substance of Golden Elixir**.

**Advancing and retrograde fire alchemy** align with the **circuit of the heavens**—
practicing **300 days without deviation** produces **Golden Elixir**.

Condensing the **breath** and retaining it,
practice the **108 cycles**,
from **Zǐ hour** in reverse to **Wǔ hour**,
descending **heart-fire** to refine the **Yellow Court**—
thus, **five days increase by six grains**,
and **twenty-five days shift by one hour**—
this is the **advancing fire** method."*
