「Lift the body and recline the spine,
practice the **108 cycles**,
from **Zǐ hour** in forward progression to **Wǔ hour**,
using **kidney-back flying** to replenish the **Mysterious Pearl**—
thus, **five days increase by six grains**,
and **twenty-five days shift by one hour**—
this is the **retrograde fire** method.

Once the **Internal Elixir** condenses and generates **pure yang qi**,
this is called **qi within qi**.

Thus, without regard for day or night,
lift the body and sit upright—
this is the **Great Sun** method.
Refine it for **100 days**, and the body becomes light;
refine it for **1,000 days**, and it ascends, entering the **Southern Palace** as an **immortal**.

With **pure yang** following the **original qi** as it circulates,
refine the **qi of the five zàng organs**,
condensing it into the **embryonic essence**—
refining **qi** can thus forge the **spirit**.

On **丙 (Bǐng) and 丁 (Dīng) days**,
the time is **Wǔ hour**;
On **庚 (Gēng) and 辛 (Xīn) days**,
the time is **Yǒu hour**;
On **壬 (Rén) and 癸 (Guǐ) days**,
the time is **Zǐ hour**;
On **甲 (Jiǎ) and 乙 (Yǐ) days**,
the time is **Mǎo hour**.

Thus, sit in stillness and forget all thought,
draw in the **double cheeks**,
and use the **empty swallow** technique at the throat—
the number of swallows should not exceed **100**,
**ten days** for a full cycle of **washing and nourishing**,
and **100 days** to complete the process.
Thus, **pure yang qi** no longer harms the **five zàng organs**,
the **original spirits** of the five zàng organs conceal within the **true qi** and do not scatter,
and the **true qi** of the five zàng organs conceal within the **original qi** and do not deplete.
Through this, follow the **original qi** as it circulates to refine its **qi**,
thus **qi refines spirit**,
and the **spirit emerges from qi**,
resting at the **original apex**,
entering the **Mysterious Pearl**.
Those without **Elixir** may practice this method,
washing and nourishing at the proper times to refine the **form**.

*Chapter 20 of the *Dao Gun* scroll, up to the section collected by Youzi Zengzhao.*

**Chapter 20 of the *Dao Gun* Scroll**
**True Unity Inner Elixir Section**

Close the breath and rinse the essence—
let *yin* and *yang* flow through.
The method’s timing spans a year’s work.

*Child* (子) is **Restoration**;
*Cow* (丑) is **Approach**;
*Tiger* (寅) is **Harmony**;
*Rabbit* (卯) is **Great Strength**;
*Dragon* (辰) is **Confinement**;
*Snake* (巳) is **Heaven**;
*Horse* (午) is **Nurturing**;
*Sheep* (未) is **Pursuit**;
*Monkey* (申) is **Decay**;
*Rooster* (酉) is **Contemplation**;
*Dog* (戌) is **Diminution**;
*Pig* (亥) is **Earth**.

A year holds twelve months,
a day holds twelve hours—
I align hours with years.

Each hour engages two *guà*,
twelve *yáo* in total—
the pattern of a year.

Thus, one hour’s practice yields a year’s effect.
Yet from *Child* to *Snake* it may be done,
but after *Horse*, it cannot be used.

At *Child*’s hour, first ignite the fire.
Breath is fire; fire is the *yang yáo*.
Close the breath thirty-six times—
one *yang yáo*—then introduce the water.
Saliva is water; water is the *yin yáo*.
Rinse the essence twenty-four times—
one *yin yáo*.

Thus, at *Child*’s hour, practice **Restoration**,
and after *Snake*, practice **Nurturing**,
always moving in opposition.

Here, one hour employs two *guà*.
At *Child*’s hour, one *yang* and five *yin*—
first close the breath thirty-six times,
then rinse the essence twenty-four times.
Afterward, perform the *Horse*’s *guà*—
one *yin* and five *yang*—
rinse the essence twenty-four times,
then close the breath thirty-six times—
five repetitions,
harmonizing with *Child* to form six *yin* and six *yang*,
thus seizing a year’s effect.

In practice, adhere to the *yáo*’s *yin-yang* count,
sitting level, gripping firmly, pressing the teeth.
At *Child*’s hour, face the *Child* position—
the rest follow suit.
After completion, employ *Tian Dao* guidance
repeatedly.

With time, the Inner Elixir forms.
After a year, bathe it in the **Great Yang**—
the **Pearl of the Jade Pool** entering the **Golden Chamber**,
round as a bullet, yellow as a tangerine.

Cultivating *qi* refines *yang* to temper *yin*.
*Yang* begins at *Child*, peaks at *Snake*;
*Yin* begins at *Horse*, peaks at *Pig*.
Thus, always practice *Child*’s hour with *Tiger*’s,
ceasing at *Horse*—avoiding *yin qi*.

**Still-Dan Supplement**
One breath of essence—
fire alone makes it flourish.
The root of **Still-Dan** lies in **Southern *Li*** (離).

Of old, **Zhū Rén** drilled wood to kindle fire,
**Nü Wa** refined stone to mend the heavens—
thus merging the **Divine Elixir’s** way.

Someone asks: What does this mean?
It is said: Wood is the nature of **mercury**;
metal is the true fire.
Thus, **Still-Dan’s** root is in **Southern *Li***.

Why?
It is born within the **Great Yang**,
transforming form only when fire is obtained.

The first transformation—it hides its form within the chaos of *Hun Dun*,
sensing the womb of the Mother, receiving the essence of *qi*—this is when the red becomes mercury.

The second transformation—when the red essence unites with the *Dan Tian*,
becoming the foundation for receiving *qi*, melting and congealing into solidified fat.
Then, the soul and spirit descend to the *He-Bao* position—this is when mercury becomes snow.

The third transformation—when the green divine liquid alone transforms at *Fu-Sang*,
this is when snow becomes sand.

The fourth transformation—when the White Tiger’s principle harmonizes its *qi* and mercury,
returning to its original nature, this is when sand becomes yellow.

The fifth transformation—when the dark-yellow transformation is profound,
arising from the *Hou Tu* breath, filling the *Upper Primordial*,
splitting form and substance—this is when yellow becomes lead-gold.

Thus it is said: One substance contains five colors—is this not what is meant?

Mercury without fire becomes empty in body,
lead with water becomes luminous in form.
Is this not the visible hare of the moon?
Is this not the invisible crow of the sun?

Thus, the Supreme Elixir is the Dao of emptiness and nothingness.
Mercury and lead—what do they transmit?
They emerge from vague confusion and transform in the depths of obscurity.
Born at the very beginning of the Great Primordial,
formed within the chaos of *Hun Dun*,
they are the essence of *Qian* and the foundation of *Kun*.

Thus, the circulation of *qi* spans three thousand six hundred years,
and the seasons of refinement are nine revolutions and eight jade elixirs.
From this, water and fire fill the *Dan Tian*,
while the sun and moon begin and end within the crucible.
Following the written and the martial,
spirit-refining the profound and mysterious,
seizing the workings of creation in the furnace,
entrusting *Qian* and *Kun* to the palm—
*qi* surges through the body, moving naturally back and forth.
A dragon is born at the Green Mercury Gate,
a tiger is subdued on the White Metal Path.
Essence sinks into the *Qi Sea*,
*qi* embraces the primordial essence.
Dark-yellow transformation occurs,
*qi* and substance mutually depend.
Returning to the red of the Southern realm—
thus is named the Way of *Huan Dan*.

The Five Phases are inverted,
the Eight Trigrams are reversed in order.
Soul and spirit descend to the *He-Bao* position—
their transformations are boundless.

Purple Palace, Immortal Metropolis,
Jade Cavern, Elixir Chamber,
Black Chariot, Golden Toad,
Hare Riding the White Steed—
thus divine efficacy is achieved.

When the moon is full, it wanes;
when the sun is at its zenith, it turns.
The radiant dark symbols interact,
soul and spirit exchange—
metal and water subdue externally without remainder.

*Lún* and *Méng*—these are the medicines;
*Pǐ* and *Tài*—these are the furnaces.
The rest each have their paired counterparts.

A year has three hundred sixty days,
corresponding to sixty-four hexagrams,
each with three hundred sixty lines.
A decade has one hundred twenty hours,
day and night moving through twelve lines and two hexagrams—
thus three decades make a year,
and nine decades make three years.

Sun and moon, like a turning wheel,
day and night in constant motion.
The sun has thirty degrees—
heaven and earth shift their gates.

The *Classic* says:
Thirty spokes converge at a single hub,
yet it is the empty space that holds the wheel’s use—
this aligns with the marvels of the law and symbol.

This is close to the Dao of the Elixir.

The *Ode* says:
*Guan guan* the mandarin duck calls,
on the isle of the river.
The female does not dwell alone,
the male does not roam solitary.
Thus, all things return to their roots,
gathering by kindred affinity.

Remove the mercury, and they separate—
as the *Plain Book* says: *"Like *qi* attracts like *qi*."*

The *Yin Symbol* says:
A yellow-bellied beast devours the tiger,
water and wood mutually assault,
the mulberry’s sweetness softens metal,
the River Chariot subdues mercury—
its secret lies in the divine water, the flowered pool.

The *Tai Yi Zhi* says:
Black is the foundation of water;
white is the body of metal.

The *Stone Cavern Record* says:
True Five Phases are one water, one stone.
The Central Palace is the master of *qi*.
Water and fire, when stirred, form substances—
this is the Golden Liquid, the Golden Elixir.

The *Parametric Concordance* says:
Sow millet with millet,
attach the parrot with seeds.
Is this what is meant?

Yin True Lord says:
Yin is true sand;
Yang is true mercury—
seek them without reckless action.

Without substance yet generating substance—
this is *Huan Dan*,
not the common mercury or sand.

Qing Xia Zi says:
I possess elixir sand,
taking the essence of gold, the life of stone,
uniting as husband and wife,
arranging as soul and spirit,
one body in chaos,
two emotions in mutual stimulation—
this is elixir sand.

The *Classic of Changes* says:
*Initial Nine*: The hidden dragon, not yet used.
*Nine Two*: The dragon appears in the field.
*Nine Three*: The superior man perseveres unremittingly all day.

What does this mean?
All things are born from One,
age at Nine—
mercury, before obtaining fire to transform,
is hidden within the sand—
this is the hidden dragon, not yet used.

When sand’s true form is flown by fire,
entering lead, it meets true fire and true mercury in mutual stimulation—
this is the dragon appearing in the field.
The field is the *Dan Tian*.
Elixir is mercury,
the field is earth—
earth nurtures all things.

Water contains earth—
this is true gold.
True gold is the *Dan Tian*—
this is persevering unremittingly all day.
When gold and mercury become true,
transformation is possible.

*Qian* is fire, is gold.
Nine is the number of lead;
three is the number of wood.
Heaven, obtaining One, reveals water;
obtaining Two, reveals fire;
obtaining Three, reveals wood;
obtaining Four, reveals metal;
obtaining Five, reveals earth—
the cultivator must not fail to know this.

White gold is mercury—
each should weigh eight *liang*,
two eights making one *jin*—
this is the number for refining sand,
refining the spirit’s form,
all gathered into One.

One is water.

Fire is within water,
wood is within fire,
metal is within wood,
earth is within metal.

When the Five Phases merge into One, the dual principles of *Yin* and *Yang* open and close,
and the sun and moon shine bright—
the Three Realms are complete.

Thus, One gives rise to Two,
Two gives rise to Three,
Three gives rise to all things.

*Qian* is Father, *Kun* is Mother,
within them are cold and heat,
*Yin* and *Yang*,
sun and moon,
stars and constellations—
their orderly progression and retreat,
their ascendance and decline,
all follow the Dao of Nature.

Sand and mercury—
with fire, they ascend and soar;
with water, they conceal their form;
with metal, they interact harmoniously;
with wood, their essence becomes manifest;
with earth, they take form and grow.

Thus, metal becomes the elixir,
the elixir becomes the White Tiger,
the White Tiger is true fire,
true fire is the sun’s spirit,
the sun’s spirit is the golden goose,
the golden goose is the Flower Pool,
the Flower Pool is yellow lead,
yellow lead is the Alchemist.

Mercury, with wood, becomes the Green Dragon,
the Green Dragon is yellow water,
yellow water is the moon’s essence,
the moon’s essence is the jade hare,
the jade hare is the yellow sprout.

The yellow sprout—
it arises from the *Dan Tian*.
The fundamental essence of the *Dan Tian*
is called the Golden Sovereign.

If I know this Dao,
I need not discard gold and water
to transform into the Green Dragon.

The Green Dragon—
it is mercury,
and must await the completion of *Xuan Huang*’s beginning and end.

Within *Xuan Huang* lies the True.

Metal must commune with the spirit of wood,
with the spirits of ghosts and gods.
Ghosts and gods—
they are formless.

The Great Emperor deems the Golden Chamber as carefree,
descending from the *Tai He* passage,
thus one may attain immortality.

To seek the Flower Pool,
one must pass through this gate—
within it lies the hidden cinnabar.

I understand the crucibles,
perceive their forms,
master the Five Phases,
exhaust the Eight Trigrams,
determine the beginning and end of ascendance and decline,
distinguish the origins of imprisonment and death,
where souls and spirits contend,
where *Yin* and *Yang* interact—
metal hides within the trigrams of autumn and winter,
mercury conceals itself in the forms of spring and summer.

The south is the divine essence of elixir and mercury;
the northwest is the way of blending water and metal.

I possess diagrams of the Ten Heavenly Stems:
The center is the root of all things,
*Wu* and *Ji* are the alchemists who refine;
the east is *Jia* and *Yi*—
*Jia* is the sinking stone,
*Yi* is the floating stone;
the south is *Bing* and *Ding*—
*Bing* is martial fire,
*Ding* is civil fire;
the west is *Geng* and *Xin*—
*Geng* is worldly gold,
*Xin* is worldly silver;
the north is *Ren* and *Gui*—
*Ren* is true lead,
*Gui* is true mercury.

Ah!
I have uncovered the secrets of Heaven!

**The Golden Mirror Chapter on Water and Fire**

The numbers of water and fire, the symbols of *Kàn* and *Lí*—
Trace their profundity, and half the Dao is attained.

*Xuānyī* says: *"Observe the boundless *Tiān* and *Kūn*—
The Way moves effortlessly within them.
Thus, *Lí* is the precision of the sun,
*Kàn* is the brilliance of the moon.*

The cauldron follows the patterns of Heaven and Earth,
The alchemical method follows the cycles of sun and moon,
And there are the symbols of male and female.
It begins with *Pǐ* and *Tài*,
Completes with *Jìjié* and *Wèijié*—
Thus the alchemical cauldron is formed,
Not the vulgar five metals and eight stones of the world.

The *Classic* says:
*"One generates Two, Two generates Three,
Three generates the myriad things.
Thus, the One is water,
The One is fire,
The Three is wood as the dragon,
Found in the east,
The Four is metal as the tiger,
The Five is earth, harmonizing with the five phases,
Manifesting the four symbols.
Within *Tiān* and *Kūn*,
Below, there are forms;
Above, there are symbols.
My method follows the transformations of *Yin* and *Yang*—
As easy as turning one’s hand.

Thus, knowing the One of water,
The Two of fire,
The dual uses of *Kàn* and *Lí*,
And the essence of sun and moon—
Already, half the path to *Huándān* is attained.

Therefore, the Dao of the Five Phases,
Once grasped in its unity, is complete!"

*Xuānyī* says: *"How many deluded alchemists I have seen in this world!
They know only to covet gold and silver,
But do not aspire to longevity.
Do they truly understand
The roots of *Yin* and *Yang*,
The vital passes of south and north?
The secret says:
Use lead, yet do not use lead—
Seek it within lead itself.
When the time comes to use lead,
Whether to use it or not is a mistake.
To recognize *Huándān*,
One must never stray from lead’s foundation—
This is the essence of the Dao,
Yet the world does not know to refine lead.
They must know of *Jīngōng* and *Héchē*—
The Five Phases are all *Jīngōng*,
The true *qi* of the north is *Héchē*.

They take lead from Yà’ān,
Lead from Jiàn,
Lead from Tǔ,
Lead from Lóngtuó,
Lead from Cǎojié,
And forge them into a cauldron,
Then cast in mercury and nurture it with fire—
This is not the Dao I speak of.

The saying goes:
*If lead is true, it is a loyal servant;
If lead is false, it is untrustworthy.*
The key lies in the harmonious union of *Yin* and *Yang*,
The completeness of the Five Phases and the Four Symbols—
Only then does one know
That true lead is the true One,
The *Tàiyī* *Dāntián* beginning with lead.
Observe the wood within fire,
The metal within water—
Then lead and mercury are revealed.

The secret says:
*The Five Phases inverted, the dragon emerges from fire.
The Five Phases disordered, the tiger is born from water.*
This speaks of true water and fire,
The essence of sun and moon.

The cauldron has no head, no substance—
Yet without substance, substance is born.
Thus, when *Yin* reaches its peak, *Yang* arises,
And when *Yang* reaches its peak, *Yin* arises.

The foolish take empty furnaces,
Pile on thousands of pounds of charcoal,
Fan the flames in the open air,
Claiming to extract the essence of sun and moon—
Without substance, substance naturally forms.
Fire’s sweat gathers as crimson-red in the furnace,
Used as elixir, taken—it brings dryness.
Or they hold a water-jewel beneath the sun
To capture fire,
Or beneath the moon to reflect water,
Then refine the water with fire,
Claiming it as true water and fire,
The essence of sun and moon, for medicine.
Or they hear the words of the perfected ones:
*Harvest before the silkworm feeds,
Complete after the fire’s transformation*—
So they take mulberry leaves untouched by the silkworm,
Burn them to ash,
And on the eighth month’s full moon,
Collect the dew with the ash.

*Xuānyī* says: *"All of this is not the Dao.*

The sun rises above *Fúshāng* in *Jiǎ-Yǐ*—
The untraded one—
Fire is born from wood.
*Gēngshēn* is the moon’s cave—
This is the hour before *Yín*, after *Wèi*.
I have heard the secret:
*The King of Huánán is called Autumn Stone,
King Yáng concealed the Yellow Sprout,
The West receives the King’s *qi*,
The Dao is found in the Central Realm.*

Its form—
White on the outside,
Yellow within,
Like a *yīngzǐ* bird.
The world does not know of the West’s *Gēng-Xīn*—
The metal of *Duì*,
The White Star’s correspondence belongs to autumn,
The maiden of *Qián* adopts this *qi* for the cauldron’s palace
And crafts the elixir.

The maiden’s *qi*—
*Xuān* and *Hòu* call it *Jīnhuá*,
Huánán’s secret is *Qiūshí*.
Metal is the child of earth—
Why? Because earth and metal mutually generate,
Nurturing the sprouts and buds.
In the eighth month, the *Tiānwāi* is in *Yǒu*,
All plants wither—
Thus, metal overcomes wood.
Only when wood sprouts does my elixir’s Dao rise,
Like buds on metal’s surface,
Yellow as the sprouts,
Stained with color,
Responding to the central realm’s yellow sprout.

Thus it is said:
*The yellow sprout is what lead and mercury create.
The *Yin* shell contains the *Yang* essence—
Without the yellow sprout, one is far from the Golden Elixir.*

The world does not know
To proceed from One to Five,
Cyclically merging the Five Phases—
Thus, the five colors align,
Rainbows arc in the heavenly mists,
Rising from the furnace.
Therefore, refining true water and earth
Is the key to the Dao.

*Liùwù* and *Liùjǐ* are earth.
Earth has no fixed form,
Dominates the seasons’ endings,
And corresponds to the five directions.
The world does not know
That water’s One and metal’s Four form *Wù*,
Fire’s Two and wood’s Three form *Jǐ*.
*Wù* and *Jǐ* truly unite at the center,
Fulfilling the numbers of *Yin* and *Yang*—
Only then is perfection achieved.

Thus, if *Yáng-Rén* does not depart from fire,
Then *Yáng-Rén* cannot form mist.
Like a *yīngzǐ* brooding over an egg,
When the days are complete, it gives birth to a child.
Like a man and woman uniting to conceive.
Thus it is said:
*Lonely *Yin* cannot form,
Lonely *Yang* cannot stand.*
Mercury and sand are both *Yin*—
Like two women sharing a room!

Humans are born from the union of two *qi*,
Taking the father’s essence as bone,
The mother’s blood as flesh,
Knitting into form,
And after ten months, life emerges.

The **Dao** I speak of is likewise this.

The **Zhōng-Rén** (central male) governs the **Zhōng-Nǚ** (central female),
Their union forming the body.

The **Nǚ**’s *qi* reaches a hundredfold measure—
Her secret lies in **huán jīng bǔ qì** (returning essence to nourish *qi*).

**Lí** (離)—within it holds **Yin**,
Mirroring the sun’s center containing a **yīngzǐ** (mercury) as the **Nǚ**’s blood.

**Kǎn** (坎)—within it holds **Yang**,
Mirroring the moon’s center containing a hare,
Where **Yin** reaches its peak and **Yang** is born as the **Rén**’s essence.

The **Sage** uses the **Nán-Běi** (south-north) **positions** as **drugs**,
Just as parents unite to conceive.

**Zhèn** (震)—the eldest son,
Inheriting the father’s body,
Then returning to **Duì** (兑) to become the **Nǚ**,
Harvesting the **Nǚ**’s hundredfold *qi* to forge the **elixir** and the **cauldron**.

The **cauldron**—originally, there was no cauldron;
The **drug**—originally, there was no drug.
They arise from human nature, never straying,
Yet all are drawn from the **Four Symbols**.

The **foolish** do not grasp this,
And instead create filth with **contamination**,
This is incorrect.

My **ultimate alchemical method** mirrors **Qián** (乾) and **Kūn** (坤) splitting one *qi* into **Yin** and **Yang**,
Like humans using the **inherited vital essence** of parents to be born.
Thus, it unites **day and moon**,
Embodies the **Three Powers**,
Forms the **Four Symbols**,
And harmonizes the **Five Phases**.

Five days mark one **candidate**—sixty **times**;
A **decade** again five days, and one *qi* reaches completion;
Three **decades** with six days, the **Crimson Phoenix** takes shape;
Four **decades** with nine days, the **five hues** are complete;
Six **decades** with four days, the **Four *qi*** are full.
When the **Five Phases’ *qi*** are exhausted,
Then the **sprout emerges**, and the **drug reveals its True One**.

Then come the **Thirty-Six Dragons**,
Placing the **Yǐng-Tài** (否泰) **cauldron**,
Establishing the **Tài-Yī** (太一) **Divine Chamber**,
**Kǎn** and **Lí** as **day and moon**,
**Zhèn** and **Duì** as **Dragon and Tiger**,
Thus the **True Water-Fire** and the **internal-external Yin-Yang**,
Are set within the **Divine Chamber** in the **fortified city**,
Following the law, they heed the **water clock**,
Waiting for the **one Yang line** to arise,
Moving the **completed and incomplete** **Yin-Yang**,
Applying the **cultural and martial** **lower fires** to make them **flame upward**,
Thus the **Yang *qi*** ascends, becoming **Heaven**;
My **upper water** nourishes below,
Thus the **Yin *qi*** descends, becoming **Earth**.

**Mercury**—the **figure of transformation**.
When **male and female unite**,
Each conceives the **True Essence**,
In an instant, **Sagehood** is boundless.

In ancient times, **Emperor Yán** wandered in **Shǔ**,
Awakening to the **Three-One Dao**,
Forging the **elixir** and the **cauldron**,
Riding the **Red Dragon** to ascend as an **Immortal**,
Using this **method**.

My **drug** responds to the **upper and lower strings**.
The **number of twenty-eight**,
Comprising **three hundred eighty-four *zhū*** (粒),
Every **two *liǎng* (两) two *zhū***—this is one **jīn** (斤).
It corresponds to the **sixty-four hexagrams’ lines**,
The **two strategies of Qián and Kūn**,
And thus achieves **nine refineries, seven returns**.

**The Great Return Elixir Chapter: The Gates of *Mao* and *You*—Labor Unapplied**

Remove the black, take the red,
Plunge into the **Flowering Pool**.

The **Golden Elixir**—its medicine is **True Lead**.
**True Lead** is the white bone within the northern lead.
Take eight *liǎng* to cultivate the **seed-sprout**—
It grows like a seedling.
Then, from the red, seek **Mercury**.
**Mercury** is the essence of the **Vermilion Bird** of the south.
Extract eight *liǎng* and use it with the lead.

The **Water-Fire Yin-Yang** method:
Water has an upper and an inner aspect,
Fire has a lower and an outer aspect.
On the third, fifth, and seventh days,
Add medicine and one *liǎng* of Mercury,
One bowl of water.
By the fifteenth day, the **Clouds Ascend**.

At thirty-six days,
The **Golden Phoenix** is formed.

Day and night, Yin and Yang—
The key lies in **harmonization**.
Then, within the **cauldron**, Mercury itself sprouts a yellow shoot.
After twenty-four days, gradually apply fire.

Fire must always be steady, never faltering.
When the cauldron is opened, the **True Dragon and Tiger** appear.
This is the **first binding** of the **structural method**.

Remove the black, take the red,
Plunge into the **Flowering Pool**.
Mix with **Divine Talismans** and **White Snow** for boiling.
Use four *liǎng* of snow—
That from **Ling Commandery**—
Always like fish eyes.
At **one nine**, **two nine**, **three nine**,
Observe its proper state, then cease.
At **five nine**, it is complete.

Wash with broth and clarify it,
Until it is flavorless,
Its hue like the **Azure Sky**.

Then, place it in the **Golden Wok** and roast it,
Dampen it with **Immortal Wine**—
A few drops—
Until its color turns red.
From the third day onward,
Return it to the fire,
Place it in the cauldron,
Face the furnace while seated,
Counting **two, three, four, five**—
The two halves become distinct.
Every five days, stir and cease,
Then resume from the **Li** position above.
The **Mao** and **You** gates—
Fire must not be applied there.
Only in the **south and north** is the work refined.

The **Yin-fire** is external,
The **Yang-fire** is upright.
When it emerges, let the **dew-wind** enter subtly,
And ensure the cauldron is **firmly sealed and unyielding**.

When the medicine is complete,
It moves like breathing.
At one hundred twenty days, open the furnace—
This is the **Lesser Return Elixir**.
Taking it removes ten thousand ailments,
And the **Gushing Spring** dries up.

The **cauldron’s secret**—
This cannot be conveyed by written words.

**The Golden Book, Jade Mirror Chapter**

The essence is complete within me—
Seek nothing from without.
The inner minister holds the cauldron,
Covered by the **flowering canopy**.

He who cultivates the Inner Elixir
Must first rectify his furnace.
The furnace is the **external Kun** of the cauldron#1,
My body is this.
Within it lies the medicine of longevity—
My **spirit-qi** and **essence-fluid** are this.

The furnace has eight gates—why so?
My eyes, my ears, my nostrils—
These are the keys to vision, hearing, inhalation, and exhalation.
Discard the false and guard the true,
Do not let flavors and evils invade within.
Thus, in the **Heaven-Earth furnace** and the **Transformative cauldron**,
Refine the **Supreme Medicine**,
Harmonize **Yin-Yang**,
And temper **qi-spirit**—only then will success be achieved.

The **flowering canopy** covers the cauldron—what does this mean?
Heaven is **Qian**, is **Metal**.
Its inner realm is the **Palace of the Lungs**.
Above, it is the flowering canopy;
Below, it covers the **upper reaches of the viscera**.
It communicates through the nose—**the Heavenly Gate**—
Ascending and descending breath,
Circulating essence through **Honor-Wei**,
Cycling through the **Five Viscera**,
Flowing and irrigating the body.
Its movements—floating, sinking, large, small—are fixed.
They follow the **celestial motion of stars and constellations**,
The **terrestrial flow of rivers and seas**.
Thus, the Heavenly Gate governs the lungs,
Drawing in **pure qi** as the cauldron’s canopy.

Earth is the **cauldron’s belly**,
Transforming all things—why so?
Earth is **Kun**.
Its inner realm is **spleen and stomach**,
Encompassing water and grain,
Communicating upward through the mouth.
The mouth is the **Throat Gate**, Earth’s door,
Receiving and storing water and grain,
Descending into the **stomach’s conduit**.
Thus, the spleen receives the **ascending and descending qi** of the Heavenly Gate,
Turning and refining, transforming water and grain,
And separating the **pure from the turbid**.
The pure grain ascends to the **upper burner**—the **Palace of Heart and Lungs**—
And becomes **spirit-qi and essence-fluid**.
The turbid grain descends to the **large and small intestines**.
Thus, the stomach is the **Transformative cauldron**,
The mouth is the **Earthly furnace**,
The nose is the **Heavenly Gate**.
The **Mysterious Female** at the center—
Her name is **Ren Zhong**.
These are the **Three Talents**: Heaven, Earth, Man.

The **Heavenly Gate’s** breath-qi
Corresponds above to the **degrees of stars and constellations**.
The **Earthly Door’s** flowing waters
Respond internally to the **blood**—
Thus, one may discuss the principles of **Sun-Moon, Yin-Yang**.

The **Sun** dwells above, is exalted—
Heaven’s **Soul**, the **Fire-Essence of the Great Yang**.
Its position resides in **Qian-Gèn**,
Reigning in summer, declining in winter,
Short nights, long days.
Within it hides **Yin-qi**,
Concealing the **Hidden Golden Parrot**—
The **Parrot** is **You**.
Externally, it corresponds to the **Metal-Stone of the West**,
Which gives birth to **Water**.
**Qian** is Heaven, is Metal.
**Gèn** is the **mountain-stone’s core**—
This is **Yin within Yang**.
Its inner realm is the **upper burner**,
The **Heavenly Heart’s sacred symbol**.
The head is **Gèn’s mountain**;
The mouth is the **valley’s cavern**—
This is where water emerges!
Thus, water is the **accumulated Yin-qi of Kun**.
It ascends to the **upper heavens**,
Overwhelms the **flowering canopy**,
And as **rain and dew**, it nourishes the heart—
This is **Yin within Yang**.

**Li** is externally Yang, internally Yin,
Externally the **Noble**, internally the **Commoner**,
Like **cinnabar** belonging to fire yet hiding **mercury** within—
This is the **Great Yin’s Elderly Maiden’s spirit**,
Her robe five-colored.
**Li** is **adornment**.
Its essence is the **Sun**, five-colored and resplendent,
With the **Vermilion Palace** above, communicating to the eyes.
The eyes are the **Palace of the Mud Ball**,
Within which lies the **Spirit**.
The **Spirit** is the **Master of Heaven-Earth**,
The **Soul of Ten Thousand Things**.
To cultivate life, first clarify the spirit—
When the spirit is pure and upright, ten thousand evils cannot intrude.
This is the **Great Elixir of Longevity**.
If one cannot subdue the heart,
Internal **false fire** arises—
Like cinnabar that does not die,
Yet flies when exposed to flame.
Thus it is said:
*The heart is the master of life.*

The **Moon** dwells below, is humble—
Earth’s **Spirit**, the **Water-Essence of the Great Yin**.
Its position resides in **Kun-Xùn**,
Reigning in winter, declining in summer,
Short days, long nights.
Within it hides **Yang-Essence**, concealing the **Jade Rabbit**—
The **Rabbit** is **Mao**.
Leaning on the **束 wood of the East**,
It gives birth to **Fire**—
This is **Yang within Yin**.
Its inner realm is the **lower burner**,
Within the viscera, the **kidneys**.
The kidneys are two:
The **Central** is the **Dan Tian**.
The **Front** is the **Xùn Sea**, the **Water Palace**.
Thus, rivers and lakes converge in **Xùn**.
The world does not know the **true positions of Yin-Yang**,
Claiming the North is **Kàn**, the South is **Li**—
This is incorrect!
**Kàn** is the position of **Kun-Xùn in the South**.
The **odd Yang within Kàn** is the **Southern fire of Sì-Wǔ**.
**Li** is the position of **Qian-Gèn in the North**.
The **even Yin within Li** is the **Northern water of Hài-Zǐ**.

The Moon is externally Yin, internally Yang,
Externally the **Commoner**, internally the **Noble**—
Like **lead and tin**!
Thus, within Yin, **white silver** is produced,
And within the **water of stones and minerals**, **red gold** is enclosed.
Gold and silver are both **Yang within Yin**—
The so-called **Infant**.
Thus, above, it unites with the **Great Yin’s Elderly Maiden** within cinnabar,
As husband and wife, their affinity intertwined—
And they congeal into **cinnabar**.

Thus, **Kàn** is the **Sea of Water**, the **Palace of the Dragon**,
Where the **Emperor resides at the Northern Gate**,
Facing south in sovereign majesty.
The Moon is Earth.
Without its Yang, ten thousand things would not flourish.
All things receive from Heaven and grow toward the Sun—
This too is their constant way.

「The one who corresponds to humanity is the **soul of all things**? One must align with **Heaven’s Dao/Way**.

**Heaven’s Dao/Way** resides within its own body—
Thus, **pure Yang, true unity**,
**pure and natural qi**,
May lead to **long life**.
How does one attain **long life**?
By **day and night refining**—
Hence, **inner cultivation for one day** equals **one year of Heaven’s movement**.

Thus, **ascending and descending Yin and Yang**,
Operate within the **four seasons and twelve times**.
By day, it responds to **spring and summer**,
By night, it follows **autumn and winter**.
From dawn to dusk, this is the **harmonious exchange of Heaven and Earth**.

Therefore, the hours of **Hài (11 PM–1 AM)**, **Zǐ (1 AM–3 AM)**, and **Chǒu (3 AM–5 AM)**—
Their response is to **Heaven’s winter**.
**Yin ascends** to the **Heavenly Heart**,
**Yang descends** to the **Water Palace**,
Nurturing the **kidneys** and refining the **bones**,
Thus forming **golden sinews and jade marrow**—
And the **True Person** is born.

It is like **mountains and stones**,
Silently receiving the **transformation of ascending and descending Yin and Yang**,
And becoming **gold, silver, pearls, jade, cinnabar, copper, iron**!

The hours of **Yín (5 AM–7 AM)**, **Mǎo (7 AM–9 AM)**, and **Chén (9 AM–11 AM)**—
Their response is to **Heaven’s spring**.
**Yin descends** beneath the **Flowery Canopy**,
**Yang ascends** above the **Steaming Cauldron**,
Nurturing the **liver** and fostering the **sinews and vessels**,
Like **plants and trees** silently receiving the **warmth of Yang**,
And becoming **blossoms, leaves, sprouts, and tendrils**!

The hours of **Wèi (11 AM–1 PM)**, **Wǔ (1 PM–3 PM)**, and **Yǒu (3 PM–5 PM)**—
Their response is to **Heaven’s summer**.
**Yang descends** to the **Water Palace**,
**Yin reaches its peak** in the **Fire Palace**,
Nurturing the **heart** and refining the **blood** into **white milk**.

The hours of **Shēn (5 PM–7 PM)**, **Yǒu (7 PM–9 PM)**, and **Xū (9 PM–11 PM)**—
Their response is to **Heaven’s autumn**.
**Yang reaches its peak and descends** to **Heaven**,
**Yin returns and ascends** to **Earth**,
Nurturing the **spleen** and refining the **skin and flesh**.

Thus, **day and night respond to the four seasons**,
And **Yin and Yang are refined within one body**—
So one ascends from the **common to the sacred**.
Yet one must not fail to know the **principles of sovereign and minister, husband and wife**.

In terms of my **inner realm**:
The **body** is the **state**;
The **head** is the **city**;
The **eyes, ears, mouth, and nose** are the **four gates**;
The **four limbs** are the **four directions’ soldiers and defenses, without neglect**.

The **heart** is the **state’s sovereign**;
**Qi** is the **minister**.
Thus, the **heart is the master of qi**, and **qi is the servant of the heart**.
When the **heart’s spirit is clear and still**,
Then the **original qi** becomes harmonious and tranquil.
When **spirit and qi unite**,
Then **long life** is achieved.
It is like a **sovereign being holy** while the **minister remains loyal**,
Or a **minister being clear** while the **land prospers in order**.

I observe the **inner realm’s sovereign**—
The **pure, original, true unity qi** of the **Vermilion Palace**.
Its **minister** is the **dark, mysterious fluid** of the **Kàn Palace**.

**Heaven descends true qi**, transforming and giving birth to all things—
Like the **sovereign’s benevolence toward its minister**.
**Yin ascends from the north**, condensing into **rain and dew**,
Moistening and nourishing all things—
Like the **minister’s aid to the sovereign**.

The **sovereign** is the **heart**.
The **heart is connected to the tongue**,
And below it lies the **Jade Pool**—
To the left, **golden essence**,
To the right, **jade fluid**—
This is the **dark, mysterious fluid**.

When it **ascends and descends above**,
It becomes **rain and dew, deep springs**,
To irrigate and submerge the **heart**—
Then the **heart is vitalized**,
This is called the **sovereign obtaining its minister**.

The **minister** is the **kidneys**.
At the **center of the two kidneys** lies the **Cinnabar Field**.
Its **front** is the **Perverse Sea**—
The **Water Palace**—
Its **qi** originally arises from **Lí (fire)**,
Descending below to nurture the **Cinnabar Field**—
This is called the **sovereign hidden at the Northern Gate**.

Thus, when the **sovereign is holy and the minister is virtuous**, the **state thrives in splendor**;
When the **heart is clear and the qi is pure**, the **body attains long life**.

To govern the **state**, one must first govern the **body**;
To cultivate the **Dao/Way**, one must first clarify the **heart’s spirit**,
Then regulate the **original qi**—
This is **one principle**.

I have often explained this to my household:
The **body** is the **home**;
The **five viscera** are the **palaces**;
**Qián (heaven)** is the **father**;
**Kūn (earth)** is the **mother**;
**Kàn (water)** is the **middle son**;
**Lí (fire)** is the **middle daughter**;
**Zhèn (thunder)** is the **eldest son**;
**Xùn (wind)** is the **eldest daughter**;
**Gèn (mountain)** is the **younger son**;
**Duì (joy)** is the **younger daughter**.

**Qián (heaven)** as father and **Kūn (earth)** as mother—
They form a **pair**.
The **three sons and three daughters**—
They are **husband and wife**.

The **liver** is the **Gathering Palace**, **wood**#2.
**Jia (甲, wood’s first branch)** is its **elder brother**;
**Yǐ (乙, wood’s second branch)** is its **younger sister**.
**Jia** takes itself as wife,
**Yǐ** takes **Gēng (庚, metal’s first branch)** as husband—
Thus the **liver obtains water and sinks**.
Why?
Because **wood carries the qi of metal**.」

The **lung** is the **Western Palace**, **metal**.
**Gēng (庚, metal’s first branch)** is its **elder brother**;
**Xīn (辛, metal’s second branch)** is its **younger sister**.
**Gēng** takes **Yǐ (乙, wood’s second branch)** as wife,
**Xīn** takes **Bǐng (丙, fire’s first branch)** as husband—
Thus the **lung obtains water and floats**.
Why?
Because **metal carries the qi of fire**.

The **heart** is the **Southern Palace**, **fire**.
**Bǐng (丙, fire’s first branch)** is its **elder brother**;
**Dīng (丁, fire’s second branch)** is its **younger sister**.
**Bǐng** takes **Xīn (辛, metal’s second branch)** as wife,
**Dīng** takes **Rén (壬, water’s first branch)** as husband—
Thus the **heart can repel fire**.
Why?
Because **fire carries the qi of water**.

The **kidney** is the **Northern Palace**, **water**.
**Rén (壬, water’s first branch)** is its **elder brother**;
**Guǐ (癸, water’s second branch)** is its **younger sister**.
**Rén** takes **Dīng (丁, fire’s second branch)** as wife,
**Guǐ** takes **Wù (戊, earth’s first branch)** as husband—
Thus the **kidney can repel water**.
Why?
Because **water carries the qi of earth**.

The **spleen** is the **Central Official**, **earth**.
**Wù (戊, earth’s first branch)** is its **elder brother**;
**Jǐ (己, earth’s second branch)** is its **younger sister**.
**Wù** takes **Guǐ (癸, water’s second branch)** as wife,
**Jǐ** takes **Jia (甲, wood’s first branch)** as husband—
Thus the **spleen can receive grains**.
Why?
Because **earth carries the qi of wood**.

This is the crucible of my **造化** [transformation-nurture]. The **sovereign and minister** in the realm, the **husband and wife** in the family, the **spirit and qi** in the body—these are the **Dao of longevity and eternal vision**, unchanging from ancient times to now. Here, I must know the **true form of the inner realm**.

What is the **inner realm**? It is the **domain of the body**. What is the **true form**? It is the **furnace of my body**, within which reside **heaven and earth, sun and moon, stars and constellations, winds and clouds, the Milky Way, mountains and rivers, grasses and trees**.

**Heaven** is **Qián** [the Creative, Heaven], **metal**, the **flowery canopy**, dwelling above all phenomena—this is the **inner realm’s lung**. The **stars, constellations, sun, and moon** that circulate are the **upper burner** of the inner realm, the **pathways of the Honorable and Defensive Qi**.

The **uppermost void of the Mysterious Realm** condenses the **pure qi of Upper Clarity**, while the **lower Mysterious Realm** gathers and scatters **impure qi**. The division of **pure and impure above and below** is the **middle burner**, the **sieve and partition**. Above the sieve, the **domain of pure contention**; below it, the **realm of filth and turbidity**.

The **Five Peaks and clustered mountains** are the **head**; the **ravines and valleys** are the **mouth and nose**; the **springs and sources** are the **saliva and fluids**, the **drink and food**; the **rivers rushing into the great sea** are the **accumulation of drink and food in the Water-Grain Storehouse**; the **clouds and rain nourishing the mountains and rivers** are the **hair and fur**.

If one seeks to know the **Dao of heaven and earth’s enduring longevity**, it is through attaining the **True One, the Authentic One**. What does this mean? It is the **fusion of yin and yang within the crucible of heaven and earth**, preserving the **original qi** without loss.

Mankind is born of **heaven and earth**, combining their **essence** to become their child. Thus, the **inner realm** also holds the **Dao of heaven and earth’s enduring longevity**. Without embracing the **Dao of heaven and earth** and mastering the **functions of yin and yang**, how could one preserve their **natural lifespan**?

To recognize within the inner realm the **fusion of heaven and earth, the nurturing of yin and yang, the spirit and qi, the fluids and essences**, and await the **fulfillment of sun and moon**—this is the path to enduring longevity. Knowing how to achieve this, how could one ignore the **transmutations of the Five Phases**?

The **Five Phases** are the **Five Viscera**. The **liver** is the **束方 [束, bind; 方, direction] Shèn Palace**, **Jia-Yi [甲乙, wood’s first and second branches]**, the **Azure Dragon**; the **lung** is the **Western Fú Palace**, **Gēng-Xīn [庚辛, metal’s first and second branches]**, the **White Tiger**; the **heart** is the **Southern Lí Palace**, **Bǐng-Dīng [丙丁, fire’s first and second branches]**, the **Vermilion Bird**; the **kidney** is the **Northern Kǎn Palace**, **Rén-Guǐ [壬癸, water’s first and second branches]**, the **Dark Tortoise**; the **spleen** is the **Central Kūn Palace**, **Wù-Jǐ [戊己, earth’s first and second branches]**.

I possess this **crucible**, with which I harmonize the **Four Symbols**, and the **Five Phases transmute into one another**. **Water** is **fluid**; within the fluid is **metal**, hence it is called **metallic fluid**. **Metal subdues wood, wood generates fire, fire refines metal**. The **Four Symbols** return in cycles, all originating from **earth**.

**Earth** governs the **spirit**; the **spirit**, when aligned with the **Dao**, becomes **immortal**; when straying from it, becomes **ghoulish**. The **cultivator of the True** should abandon **luxury, distance desires, reject pungent meats**, seek **clarity and tranquility, roam freely**, dwell in **rocky gorges**, maintain **pure abstinence**, ascend the **platform**, enter the **chamber**, choose the **auspicious day**, await the **moment**, face **south toward the sun**, close the eyes, sit level, grasp firmly, quiet the mind, and open the **furnace’s gate** to **stir the fire’s timing**. Thus, the **Five Viscera are refined**, the **hundred bones transform**, and only then does one attain **sacred efficacy and spiritual metamorphosis**. Though this requires **nine cycles** to complete the **fulfilled work** and ascend as **immortal**.

One cycle is **four months**; three cycles complete a **year**. When the **nine refineries’ work is complete**, then in **three years**, the **elixir is formed**. Its **size is one inch**, its **weight one jin**, with **yin and yang each half**.

It corresponds externally to the **Sixty-Four Hexagrams of the Great Ease**, **three hundred eighty-four lines**. Why? The **four hexagrams** are **twenty-four zhu** [a small weight unit]; one **liǎng** is **twenty-four zhu**, so four hexagrams make one **liǎng**, and **sixteen hexagrams** make one **jin**. The **nine cycles** mark the **initial stage of immortality**, at which **calamities no longer afflict**, **cold and heat do not invade**, **water and fire cause no harm**, and **malevolent essences vanish**. Those who can **alter form and transform body** to enter **sacredness** are **mid-stage immortals**.

Only when the **great work reaches its mystical transformation**, the **true qi becomes purely yang**, does one then **ascend to pay homage to the Celestial Sovereign**.

**Essentials for Cultivating the True:**

Follow the **four seasons**, gather the **Five Phases**;
Ask of **metal and wood**, and in **a thousand days**, it is complete.

**Disciple Wang Tíngyáng**, son of **Master Lǐ Hǎitán**, said:
*The Dao has no name; its origin is natural. One generates from the **One**—the **One** is the **element of the Dao**; the **One generates Two**—the **Two** are **heaven and earth**; the **Two generate Three**—the **Three** are the **Three Powers**, and from this all things are born. Thus, **heaven** is **father**; **earth** is **mother**; **man** is **male and female**. The **father’s essence is yang**; the **mother’s blood is yin**; when combined to form man, the **Three Powers** all originate from **one qi**.

Thus, the **One** is the **root of longevity**. The *Classic of Change* says:
*"Heaven and earth interact to generate **Kǎn [water] and Lí [fire]**; those who practice take their symbols."*

Though many cultivate the body and nurture life, few attain the **Dao**. Why? They fail to **fathom the Sage’s intent** and are **misled by hearsay**. Thus, theories of **abstaining from grains, gargling, swallowing mist, inhaling qi, pulling the body, drinking milk, and breath-retention** are not the **essential Dao**—they are like those who **search for pearls in the mountains**!

What I call **essential** is:
**Cultivate the True One**, gather the **Five Phases**, arrange the **Eight Hexagrams**, unite the **Four Symbols**, encompass the **Three Powers**.

**Qián [Heaven] and Kūn [Earth]** are my **crucible**; **Kǎn [water] and Lí [fire]** are my **elixir**.
**Hexagram Lún [Concealment]** and **Méng [Youth]**, arising at **dawn and dusk**;
**Hexagram Jìjí [Accomplishment]** and **Wèijí [Unaccomplished]**, never erring at **new moon or full moon**.

The **sequence of days** cycles endlessly—**a thousand days**, and success is achieved.

I have composed **a hundred verses**, distilling their **essence** into **twelve key poems**:

**The First:**
The **Black Tortoise and White Hare** mark the days and months,
Yet none **grasp the vital bond** of **life and nature**.
Seize the **union of Earth and Heaven** in **Harmony**—
Then **qi** flows naturally through **Kǎn [water]** and **Lí [fire]**.

**The Second:**
The **worldly rush** to seek the **True One** in vain,
Mixing **cinnabar** and **mercury** in folly’s chain.
They fail to **refine their own bodily elixir**—
**Mercury** lingers dead, yet **life** is lent to others.

**The Third:**
The **circulation of the Microcosmic Orbit** is **subtle and profound**,
Its **movement and pause** follow **timed precision**.
The **seventy-two seasonal shifts** must not falter—
Then **naturally**, the **Tiger and Dragon** are subdued.

**The Fourth:**
Not in **markets** nor in **mountains** is it found,
Nor bound by **fame or idleness**—**freedom** is its ground.
If mortals seek the **elixir of longevity**,
Only **heart-ash** transmuted is the **Great Return**.

**The Fifth:**
**Yin** belongs to **Earth**, **Yang** to **Heaven**,
One leads to **ghostly realms**, the other to **immortality**.
To **refine** is to **discern the hidden and manifest**—
**Life and death** are intertwined before your eyes.

**The Sixth:**
The **Golden Elixir’s secret** seizes **Heaven’s authority**,
Its **root** lies **plainly** before you.
Wipe away the **North’s Black Tortoise**—what **mystery** remains?
Why does the **Tortoise and Dragon** coil in endless chains?

**The Seventh:**
When **hair turns white and temples gray**, tell them this:
Yet they still **covet greedily**, lost in **chaos**.
They fail to **harmonize the Five Phases** with **sun and moon**—
At this **hour of suffering**, who will they blame?

**The Eighth:**
**Water and Fire** share **affinity**, yet **Wood and Metal**?
**Fire and Water** know where to **seek**—but where?
Why **strip yellow** to don **purple**?
Only the **River Vehicle’s** revolutions run deep.

**The Ninth:**
The **Five Phases** and **Four Symbols**, **Kǎn** and **Lí** combined,
The **verse’s secret** is **clearly** spoken—
Yet where **practice** begins, few **grasp**, few **know**.

**The Tenth:**
The **crucible’s fire** must be **meticulously** refined,
Until **pure qi** ascends from within.
When the **Earthly Gate** is **quiet**, the **marrow is full**—
The **Heavenly Gate** then **opens** of its own accord.

**The Eleventh:**
Once the **seeker awakens** to **cultivate the True One**,
They must **seek the method** and **guard against harm**.
Even **water** struggles to **contain fire**—
How much more when **ghostly influences** lurk beside?

**The Twelfth:**
If you have not yet **met a teacher**, study these verses,
For within them lies the **secret** for **cultivation**.
Though you may not **reach Penglai’s path**,
You will **delay death’s reckoning** by asking others.

**Volume Twenty-Two of the *Dao Gun***
*(Compiled by the wandering scholar Zeng Kuo)*

**On Alchemical Cultivation: The Nine Cauldrons and Eight Trigrams**

Cultivate within the **Nine Cauldrons**,
Walk the **Eight Trigrams**—
Nurture and rest to **manifest the Spirit**,
Merge with the **Creative Transformation**.

The **Great Elixir** depends solely on **nurturing and resting to manifest the Spirit**.

Now, **breath**—each day holds **thirty-six thousand**,
Circulating through the **Thirty-Six Passes**,
The **Black-and-White Paths** of **Four Sixes**,
Moving through the **Eight Trigrams**,
Refined in the **Nine Cauldrons**.

A single day comprises **twelve hours**,
Each hour **eight *kè* and seventeen *fēn***—
My **four breaths** make one **cycle**,
Sufficient to traverse the **Thirty-Six Passes** and **Four Orifices**.

Each **Pass or Orifice** requires **two *kè* and five *fēn*** of breath flow,
Thus, one hour holds **three thousand breaths**,
One *kè* holds **three hundred sixty breaths**.

The **twelve hours** further divide into **four seasons**,
Where **flourishing, decline, birth, and conquest** unfold.

What are the **Thirty-Six Passes**?
- The **Lower Dantian** is the **Suxiua Pass**,
- The **Huangzhong Orifice** is the **Five Paths Pass**,
- The **Weifeng Orifice** is the **Cuiwei Pass**,
- The **Tianzhu Orifice** is the **Zhanchen Pass**,
- The **Anus** is the **Yuanmen Pass**,
- The **Nurturing Sphere** is the **Taiyi Pass**,
- The **Xuanying Orifice** is the **Haiquan Pass**,
- The **Twelve Pavilions** are the **Three Elements Pass**,
- The **Lungs** are the **White Tiger Pass**,
- The **Liver** is the **Green Dragon Pass**,
- The **Heart** is the **Pengxiao Pass**,
- The **Spleen** is the **Central Yellow Pass**,
- The **Twenty-Four Hammers**—all are **Passes**.

The **first day** receives **flourishing**,
The **second** **communicates with the Primordial**,
The **third** **achieves Jade Frost**,
The **fourth** **gathers the Seven Stars**,
The **fifth** **attains the Guardian Spirit**,
The **sixth** **illuminates the Bright Hall**,
The **seventh** **draws the Auspicious Spring**,
The **eighth** **opens the Gate of Life**,
The **ninth** **advances to the City**,
The **tenth** **roots in *Kūn***,
The **eleventh** **honors the Sovereign Lord**,
The **twelfth** **holds the Jade Tablet**,
The **thirteenth** **ascends the Red Citadel**,
The **fourteenth** **glorifies the Golden**,
The **fifteenth** **pierces the Dragon**,
The **sixteenth** **refines the Jade Elixir**,
The **seventeenth** **reaches the Jade Terrace**,
The **eighteenth** **fountains the Golden Spring**,
The **nineteenth** **fortifies the Golden City**,
The **twentieth** **surging to the Heavens**,
The **twenty-first** **rides the Golden Phoenix**,
The **twenty-second** **soars the Frozen Expanse**,
The **twenty-third** **converges the Primordial**,
The **twenty-fourth** **gathers the Hundred Jewels**.

What are the **Four Orifices**?
- The **Liver** is the **Ram’s Chariot**—
  Ride it to **audience the Jade Emperor** and **convene the myriad spirits**,
  Its name: the **Pengying Orifice**.
- The **Kidneys** are the **Deer’s Chariot**—
  Ride it to **audience Kunlun**,
  Its name: the **Sanfeng Orifice**.
- The **Heart** is the **Great Ox Chariot**—
  Ride it to **tame the Fire Dragon** and **enter Penglai**,
  Its name: the **Shouzong Orifice**.
- The **Spleen** is the **Earth**—
  **Anchored in the four directions**, with **metal and water** flanking it,
  Its name: the **Baocheng Orifice**.

What are the **Black-and-White Paths**?
They are the **White Metal** and **Black Tiger**—
The **yin-yang qi** of **Nourishing and Defensive Circulations**.

The **outflow** is **Nourishing**,
The **inflow** is **Defensive**.
Each **breath**—**out and in**—lasts **ten days**,
Yet within a single breath lie **four cycles**.

In **winter**, the **yang is received internally**,
Corresponding to the **Child, Ox, Tiger hours**—
Thus, **thirteen thousand breaths** traverse the **White Nourishing Path**,
And **twenty-three thousand breaths** traverse the **Black Defensive Path**.

In **spring**, the **yang is also received internally**,
Corresponding to the **Rabbit, Dragon, Snake hours**—
Thus, **sixteen thousand breaths** traverse the **White Nourishing Path**,
And **twenty thousand breaths** traverse the **Black Defensive Path**.

In **summer**, the **yin is received internally**,
Corresponding to the **Horse, Sheep, Monkey hours**—
Thus, **eighteen thousand breaths** traverse the **White Nourishing Path**,
And **eighteen thousand breaths** traverse the **Black Defensive Path**.

In **autumn**, the **yin is also received internally**,
Corresponding to the **Rooster, Dog, Pig hours**—
Thus, **twenty thousand breaths** traverse the **White Nourishing Path**,
And **sixteen thousand breaths** traverse the **Black Defensive Path**.

What are the **Eight Trigrams and Nine Cauldrons**?
- In the **Child, Ox, Tiger hours**, **Kān** is the **Yang Cauldron**—
  The **True Yin** takes effect.
- In the **Rabbit, Dragon, Snake hours**, **Zhèn** is the **Yang Cauldron**—
  **Wood** takes effect.
- In the **Horse, Sheep, Monkey hours**, **Lí** is the **Yin Cauldron**—
  **Heaven** takes effect.
- In the **Rooster, Dog, Pig hours**, **Duì** is the **Metal Cauldron**—
  **Duì** takes effect.

The **Ox hour**: **Earth rules and takes effect**,
Converging at the **Central Palace**.
**Gèn** is the **Cauldron**, drawing **True Essence** from the **gallbladder**—
The **yang qi** is the **embryo**.

The **Dragon hour**: **Earth rules and takes effect**,
Converging at the **Central Palace**.
**Zhèn** uses **Xùn** as the **Cauldron**—
The **Green Dragon** performs its function.
Thus, the **first nine yang** generate **water**—
The **Zhèn qi** prevails,
And **Duì** stands upright as the **Cauldron**—**wind** itself.

The **Sheep hour**: **Earth rules and takes effect**,
**Gèn** governs the **bladder**, drawing **True Essence**—
**Gèn** is the **Cauldron**—
The **Gèn-generating qi** is **fire**,
Born from the **earthly mountain**.

The **Dog hour**: **Earth rules and takes effect**,
The **Metal Cauldron** stands upright,
**Xùn** as the **Furnace**—
This is the **Metal-Stone Cauldron**,
For **Kān** is the **large intestine**,
Named **Metal-Stone**—where **metal converges**.

Thus, the **twelve hours** embody the **metal, wood, and earth qi**,
Responding to the **Three Powers’ Nine Cauldron positions**,
Stealing the **Heaven-Earth Creative Transformation’s function**!

**Heaven and Earth** are the **Kān-Kūn symbols**.
The **Five Phases and Eight Trigrams**,
Mingled and returning to the **Primordial Unity**,
Form the **Great Harmony**—
The **Heaven-Earth Trigram**.

This is the **Eight Trigrams, Nine Cauldrons’ count**—
The **Heaven-Earth union**,
The **Eight Trigrams’ Five Phases’ Heavenly Circulation**.

Observe how the **Five Phases** of **birth, conquest, flourishing, and decline**
Divide into **four seasons** and take effect—
Why so?
Within **Child, Ox, Tiger**,
**Water rules and conquers Fire**,
Yet it **nourishes Wood**—
Is this not **Fire’s mother**?

Thus, the **wood qi** supplements its **fire timing**—
Only when **fire qi** is full does it take effect.
Within **Mao, Chen, Si**,
**Wood reigns** and conquers **Earth**,
Then **generates Fire**—
Is this not **Earth’s mother**?
With **Fire qi** supplementing **Earth**,
Wait until **Earth qi** is full before taking effect.

Within **Wu, Wei, Shen**,
**Fire reigns** and conquers **Metal**,
Then **generates Earth**—
Is this not **Metal’s mother**?
With **Earth qi** supplementing **Metal**,
Wait until **Metal qi** is full before taking effect.

Within **You, Xu, Hai**,
**Metal reigns** and conquers **Wood**,
Yet it **generates Water**—
Is this not **Wood’s mother**?
With **Water qi** supplementing **Wood**,
Wait until **Wood qi** is full before taking effect.

This is the **essential principle** of the **Five Phases’ mutual generation and conquest**.

One **hour** contains **three thousand breaths**—
Passing through **three passes and two marks** becomes **eight breaths and two arrivals**,
This is the **Heavenly Circulation’s fire timing**.

Its essence lies in **beginning with One Yang as sovereign**.

At the **Child hour**, One Yang first arises—
The **initial nine**—
Born in the **Substance-Bloom Palace**,
Rising as **Moon**—
This is the **Dragon hidden in Water**,
Arriving at the **Peng-Xiao, Azure Dragon Passes**.

At the **Ox hour**, its **qi** resides in the **White Tiger, Three Primordials, Sea Spring Passes**—
This is **Wood generating Fire**.

At the **Tiger hour**, its **qi** is in the **Tai-Yi, Primordial Gate, Reel-Carp Passes**.

At the **Rabbit hour**, its **qi** is in the **White Crystal, Gathering Primordials, Ice-Xiao Passes**.

At the **Dragon hour**, its **qi** is in the **Golden Phoenix, Piercing Heaven, Golden City Passes**.

At the **Snake hour**, its **qi** is in the **Golden Water, Jade Tower, Jade Bud Passes**.

At the **Horse hour**, its **qi** is in the **Piercing Dragon, Honoring Metal, Vermilion City Passes**—
Here, **True Yin** first arises.

At the **Sheep hour**, its **qi** is in the **Jade Tablet, Imperial Sovereign, Kūn Primordial Passes**.

At the **Monkey hour**, its **qi** is in the **Advancing City, Command Gate, Auspicious Spring Passes**.

At the **Rooster hour**, its **qi** is in the **Bright Hall, Guardian Spirit, Seven Stars Passes**.

At the **Dog hour**, its **qi** is in the **Jade Crystal, Communing Primordials, Receiving Abundance Passes**.

At the **Pig hour**, its **qi** is in the **Emerald Mists, Five Paths, Yellow Bell Passes**.
Then its **qi** reverses, returning to **Substance-Bloom**.
This is the **Heavenly Circulation**.

When in **Child, Ox, Tiger hours**, sit quietly, **breathing and observing**,
Close your eyes and **internally gaze** upon the **Five Viscera**,
Imagine your **liver** holding the **Azure Dragon**,
Coiling like mist and dew—
Its emergence is faint—
With intent, **guide the qi** downward to the **heart palace**,
Then imagine the **heart palace** holding the **Vermilion Bird**,
Close your mouth to **receive its qi**—
If the **Azure Dragon’s qi** is faint,
**Retain the breath thirty-six times**,
To **subdue the heart’s fire** before practicing.

When in **Rabbit, Dragon, Snake hours**, also sit quietly and **settle the breath**,
Close your eyes and **internally gaze** upon the **Five Viscera**,
Imagine your **heart** holding **crimson qi**, coiling,
Sinking to the **lungs’ upper region**,
Then imagine the **spleen’s upper region** holding **Gou-Chen**,
Close your mouth to **receive its qi**—
If the **qi** is faint, **inhale thirty times**,
To **subdue the spleen’s Earth** before practicing.

When in **Horse, Sheep, Monkey hours**, also sit quietly, **breathing and observing**,
Close your eyes and **internally gaze** upon the **Five Viscera**,
Imagine your **spleen** holding **yellow qi**, coiling,
With intent, **guide it upward to the lungs**,
Then imagine the **lungs** holding the **White Tiger**,
Open your mouth to **receive its qi**,
**Retain and exhale thirty times**,
To **subdue the lungs’ Metal** before practicing.

When in **Rooster, Dog, Pig hours**, also sit quietly, **breathing and observing**,
Close your eyes and **internally gaze** upon the **Five Viscera**,
Imagine your **lower elixir field** holding the **White Tiger**, coiling,
With intent, **guide it upward to the liver**,
Then imagine the **liver** holding the **Azure Dragon**,
Open your mouth to **receive its qi**,
**Retain and exhale thirty times**,
To **subdue the liver’s Wood** before practicing.

Once the **Five Viscera** are supplemented,
One may **practice the Sun and Moon**—
Their union lies at the **cauldron’s left and right**,
One may **circulate the Eight Trigrams**.

When practicing, first **cool the spirit**,
Then imagine your **heart** holding the **Sun**—
As large as a **coin**—
Emerging from the **heart**,
Then imagine its **light illuminating the Five Viscera and hundred bones**,
Next imagine the **Sun’s form**—
If it **floats upward**, **inhale twenty breaths** and **swallow once**,
Swiftly imagine the **qi descending** through the **twelve-layered towers**,
Enveloping the **Sun**,
Sinking to the **spleen’s upper region**, the **cauldron’s left**,
Once **breathing and observing** are settled,
Then imagine the **lower elixir field’s water sea** holding the **Moon**—
As large as a **coin**—
Then imagine its **light illuminating the body**,
With intent, **guide it upward to the lungs**,
**Inhale thirty times**, turning the **head to the left** and **swallow once**,
Swiftly imagine the **qi descending** through the **twelve towers**,
Enveloping the **spleen’s upper region**,
Entering the **heart’s right**, the **cauldron’s right**,
Once **breathing and observing** are settled, then practice.

**Essentials of the Inner Golden Elixir Scripture**
Not **mercury nor lead**—
**True Unity** is the foundation.
**Know White, Preserve Black**,
And **spiritual clarity** naturally returns.

**Li Guangxuan** in youth longed for the **Dao**,
Later encountering a **sage** who told him:
*"If **Primordial Qi** does not scatter,
One may achieve **longevity**."*

**Primordial Qi**—
The **mixed unity qi** within the body,
The **root of humanity**.
**Dwelling in thought** halts the **qi**,
**Spirit moving** scatters the **qi**—
Thus, the **sage’s breathing** does not wander outside the **nose**,
**Cultivation and reflection** always reside in the **elixir field**,
If the **three fields** are full, one may reach **thousand years**.

As for **exhaling the stale and inhaling the fresh**,
**Gargling and swallowing saliva**—
These are all **methods of prolonging life and fortifying the body**.

Guanxuan practiced them for over ten years,
Yet deemed them **not the transcendent Golden Elixir method**.

Li Guangxuan then wandered to the **Mount Xiaoshi**,
And there encountered **Master Xuan Shou** and asked him:
*"**Alchemical Elixir** is that which takes **Primordial Unity** as its foundation,
Where **lead** and **mercury** rely upon each other,
And **Yellow Sprout** is its essence.
What is **Yellow Sprout**?
It sprouts from within **lead**,
Originating from **Absolute Primordial Truth**,
As **mercury** conveys the **qi of gold**—
This is what is called **Yellow Sprout**, is it not?"

Li Guangxuan said:
*"**Lead** is highly toxic—how can it become the **Supreme Medicine**?"*

**Master Xuan Shou** replied:
*"Within **lead** lies **gold**,
And within **gold** lies **treasure**.
When one sees **treasure** and recognizes **treasure**,
A **virtuous sage** attains the **Dao**—
It is better to refine **gold** within **lead**,
Than to forge **treasure** within **lead**.
This is not the **lead** of the mundane world.
Hence it is said:
**Yellow Sprout is lead**—yet it departs from **lead** by ten thousand leagues;
**Yellow Sprout is not lead**—yet it begins from **lead**.
**Lead** is the **mother** of the **sprout**,
The **sprout** is the **child** of **lead**—
The **mother** concealed within the **child’s womb**,
The **child** hidden in the **mother’s womb**—
To **know the white** and **guard the black**,
The **spirit** and **clarity** return naturally.
Thus, **one** is the **numerical essence** of **water**,
The **beginning of the Five Phases**—
Its hue aligns with the **black**,
Yet encompasses the **Five Colors** within.
Cultivate it to attain the **Dao**,
And it harmonizes with **Nature’s Way**.
It can generate **Heaven and Earth**,
Manifest as **yin and yang**—
Then **returning the essence of the sun** to the **moon’s cave**,
And **condensing the refined essence** in the **Dragon Palace**,
As **purple qi** subtly conceals itself,
And aligns with **Primordial Truth** in perfect accord.

The saying goes:
*"To use **lead**, one must use **lead**—
**Lead** is the **old elixir field**,
Do not abandon **lead**."*

Li Guangxuan asked:
*"The world considers **cinnabar** and **mercury** as **Yellow Sprout**—how is this so?"*

**Master Xuan Shou** replied:
*"This is not the speech of one who knows the **Dao**.
**Yellow Sprout** is the **union of the Water and Fire trigrams**,
Where **metal** and **water** generate each other—
**Male** and **female** in perfect balance,
**Yin** and **yang** harmoniously united,
Emerging from **non-being** into **being**,
As **yin moves** and **yang responds**—
This is **Yellow Sprout**."*

Li Guangxuan said:
*"Some say that **gold**, **silver**, and the **five leads** are **Yellow Sprout**—how is this so?"*
**Leads**: *Maopian, Xian, Ku, Hei, and Mituoseng.*
**Master Xuan Shou** replied:
*"All incorrect.
Those who take them—with their **coarse and stubborn** nature—
Will **scorch their Five Zang organs**."*

**Li Guangxuan** said:
*"What I speak of as **Yellow Sprout** is the **union of lead and mercury**,
**Metal** and **Wood** in parallel,
**Dragon** and **Tiger** intermingling,
**Water** and **Fire** restraining each other,
**Pushing** and **pulling** in harmony,
**With the spirit (po) following the soul (hun)**,
**Fulfilling** the **cause of return and transformation**,
**Illuminating** the **principle of breath (qi)**—
**Yin** and **yang** harmoniously united,
**Mother** within, **child** preserved,
**The quintessence of heaven and earth** complete.

Thus, **mercury** does not reveal its form,
**Metal** does not show its essence,
**Cinnabar**, **Wood essence**—
**When Metal is obtained**, they **merge**;
**Entering the body**, they **gather the soul**,
**The Tiger grows hungry** and then **comes to devour** the **vital marrow and fat**—
This is what I mean.

Yet, when the **time and circumstances** are **fully ripe**, they will **naturally transform**.
Hence it is said:
*'Lead, mercury, and cinnabar sprout—three flowers,
**Collect me**.*
**Qi** condenses into **sand (cinnabar)**,
**At first**, inquire about the **ten-day cycle** and **Fire’s augmentation**,
**Revolving** the **five colors** to enter the **Divine Essence**,
**Increasing** to **make the Dao without deviation**—
When the **three** are **complete**, then **one is a Daoist adept**."*

**Li Guangxuan** said:
*"Still, you have not yet grasped it."*
**Master Xuan Shou** replied:
*"The **ultimate medicine** employs only the **Five Phases**.
The **Scriptures** say:
*'Why speak of Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth?
**Retaining the spirit** and **preserving life** are the **Dragon** and **Tiger**.
**Students** who do not recognize the **Five Phases’ essence**,
**Forcefully** take **others’ substances** as **parents**—

**Wood governs qi**, **bones** govern the **Tiger**,
**Blood** governs **Water**, **flesh** symbolizes **Earth**,
**The Way of immortality** lies in the **Li Palace**,
**Mastering** the **Five Phases** alone holds the key.

**The Five Phases** must be **mercury’s own kind**,
**Heterogeneous substances** cannot **endure** as **companions**.
**The Great Master He Lan** names it **‘Ball of Azure Dragon’**—

**Rising as the White Tiger**, **resting as the Dark Tortoise (Xuan Wu)**,
**Flying as the Vermilion Bird (Zhu Que)**, **seated as the Yellow Dragon**,
**The Central Official** naturally **bears fruit**;

**Mother** pities **child**, **child** pities **Mother**,
**A single cloud** forms within the **furnace**,
**Taking it as medicine**—**no matter the form**—**it is acceptable**;
This is the **Dao**."*

**Li Guangxuan** said:
*"When **consuming the elixir**, what **substances** should one use?"*

**Master Xuan Shou** said:
*"When refining the elixir, only **mercury** is needed—
passing through the **river furnace (he cha)** yields **purple powder**,
which is called **the Golden Liquid Elixir (Jin Ye Hui Dan)**."*

**Li Guangxuan** asked:
*"May I inquire, what is the **weight** of the **ultimate elixir**—
how many **qian (铢)** or **liang (两)**?
When will it be **complete**?"*

**Master Xuan Shou** replied:
*"The **cauldron** holds the **Heavenly (乾)** and **Earthly (坤)** phases—
from **Child (子)** to **Separation (离)**, this is when the **hexagram patterns** are **manifest**,
and from **Separation (离)** to **Ha (亥)**, this is when the **radiance** is **seen**,
just as the **fetus** lies in the womb or the **phoenix** in its egg—
when the **time arrives**, it **emerges**.*

*‘**Twenty-eight days** of **cohabitation**’ is the **weight** of **qian (铢)** and **liang (两)**,
*‘**One star** completing its **circuit**’* is the **seasonal timing**,
and then the **Dragon arises** and the **Tiger roars**.*

*‘**Twenty-eight days**’*—this is the **elder maiden (lao nv, 姥女)**;
*‘**Sixteen days**’*—this is the **refined lead (qian jing, 铅精)**.*

When **Yang (陽)** **emerges** and **fire ignites**,
when **Yin (陰)** **consumes** and **water is spent**, it **halts**.*

**Taoist recluse Tao Yuanming** said:
*"The **Child (子)** and **Midday (午)** gates open the **Mao (卯)** and **You (酉)**—
the **Four Seasons** **circulate fire**, aligning with **Heavenly (乾)** and **Earthly (坤)** phases,
and then the **Dragon and Tiger** **devour each other**."*

**Li Guangxuan** asked:
*"Among **‘Day Soul and Night Spirit (ri hun yue po, 日魂月魄)**—the **White Tiger and Azure Dragon (Bai Hu Qing Long, 白虎青龙)**,
**cinnabar and river furnace (dan sha he cha, 丹砂河车)**,
**true lead and true mercury (zhen qian zhen gong, 真铅真汞)**—
which is the **authentic**?"*

**Master Xuan Shou** replied:
*"They are all **one**—
none **transcend** the **Five Phases**."*

*"The world uses **stones** as **medicines**,
requiring **seventy-two** or even **over a hundred** refinery cycles,
which may **temporarily** **alleviate illnesses**,
but **cannot** be **discussed** in terms of **prolonging life**."*

**Mercury**, being **fire’s wood (huo de mu, 火之木)**,
**lead**, being **water’s metal (shui de jin, 水之金)**,
must be **refined** in the **Central Palace (Zhong Gong, 中官)**,
**harmonized** by **their kindred natures**!

*‘**In ancient times**, Lord Lingyang **knew this Dao**,
so he **paired the South with the North**,
**paired the West with the Bundle (束)**,
**aligning these four directions**,
**not deviating** from the **Central Dao (Zhong Dao, 中道)**.
**One year** to **circulate fire (yun huo, 运火)**,
**ten months** to **open the furnace (kai lu, 开炉)**,
**seven returns (qi fan, 七返)** **without loss**,
**nine cycles (jiu huan, 九还)** **sufficiently complete**—
this is when the **Dragon flies** and the **soul returns (hun fan, 魂返)**,
the **Tiger submits** and the **spirit returns (po gui, 魄归)**.
Its name is **‘The Miraculous Return of Purple Essence (Zi Se Zhi Miao Huan, 紫色之妙还)**’,
**‘The Divine Elixir of the Great Nectar (Tai Ye Zhi Shen Dan, 太液之神丹)**’."*

**Li Guangxuan**#5 asked:
*"Why does **‘Three Yellows binding sand (San Huang Jie Sha, 三黄结砂)**’ **yield gold (jin, 金)**?"*

**Master Xuan Shou**#6 replied:
*"This is the **work** of the **greedy (tan, 贪)**—
not the **pursuit** of the **Hermit of the Mystic Dao (Xi Yi, 希夷)**."*

**End of Volume Twenty-Two of *Dao Gun* (道枢) –** *"***Taoist Essentials (Tai Yi, 太一)***"*
