**Volume Twenty-Three of *Dao Gun* –** *"***The Daoist Master of Ultimate Wandering (Zhi You Zi, 至游子)***"*
*(Collected by **Zeng Cong (曾慥)**).*

**The Golden Elixir and Refining Gold**

When the inner *qi* does not exit and the outer *qi* does not enter,
the Yang blazes forth in its own domain, emanating from the *Li* realm.

The Dao has three aspects:
Refining the form, refining the *qi*, refining the spirit.

Its essence lies in aligning with the seasons’ opportunities,
the transformations of the Five Phases,
and the pairing of *Kan* and *Li*—
thus internally directing the Dragon and Tiger,
and filling the Three Fields with *qi*.
When mixed and perfected, a single *qi* lies dormant within the body.

Hence, when the Three Fields of Xuan Valley are filled with *qi* and enter the Mysterious,
neither bright above nor dim below,
then the refining of *qi* and merging with the spirit begins.

For *qi* is the *qi* within *qi*.
Vast and flowing, it permeates the four limbs,
soft and still, while the spirit and soul rise and soar.

When the true *qi* blends with the body and enters below the navel,
*qi* returning to the navel becomes breath,
the spirit entering the *qi* becomes the embryo,
and when breath and embryo merge,
this is called *Tai Yi* Embracing the True—
then the refining of the spirit begins.

The complete spirit has four aspects:
Mind, intention, nature, and spirit—
all rooted in the same source.

For the mind is the dwelling of the spirit.
When the spirit can embrace *qi* and return to its root,
only then can it self-preserve—
this is the beginning of entering the Sagehood.

What is the method of refining the form?
Calm the mind and regulate the breath,
let the *qi* be still and soft,
guard the spirit within its chamber—
thus the *qi* enters the *Dan Tian*—
this is refining the form.

For *qi* is the utmost essence of Yin and Yang,
the Yang soul of Heaven and Earth.
When refined into substance,
it generates spirit-*qi* and forms the symbol of *Tai Yi*.
Flowing through the hundred vessels,
it disperses throughout the body,
with the five viscera and six bowels divided into three functions—
strengthening the form, fortifying the bones,
when the *qi* settles, the spirit is born.

How else but through still-sitting can the *qi* be made to dwell?
Sit cross-legged, forget emotions and thoughts,
breathing softly and continuously,
like the breath of a tortoise.
Soon, true *qi* permeates the body,
the breath at the nostrils moves yet does not move,
dynamic yet still—
Yin embracing Yang.

Then, use the Red Dragon to strike upward seventy-two times.
When moved, Heaven’s Yang descends upon the *Li* Palace,
the *Li* Palace obtains its transformation and becomes true fire,
to refine the form—
Yin evils exit as sweat.
Thus, five times,
and it aligns with the three hundred sixty revolutions of the Heavenly Cycle.
Yang light spreads across the body,
the *qi* naturally settles,
mother and child guard internally,
bearing Yin while embracing Yang—
this is refining the *qi*—
then grasp the spirit and return to the origin.

The spirit—
when in the ears, it listens;
when in the eyes, it sees;
when in the tongue, it tastes;
when in the heart, it transforms;
when in the intention, it flashes—
the spirit wanders freely among the six senses.
If the six senses do not receive,
then the six senses naturally still,
when spirit-*qi* returns to unity,
the spirit itself becomes true—
this is the six senses entering the chamber.

Sit upright, the spirit-*qi* now settled,
no inner vision exits, no outer vision enters,
the mind holds no thought,
listening externally yet hearing nothing,
eyes closed and opened,
the spirit resides in the heart,
*qi* returns below the navel,
brain-*qi* overflows,
the tongue presses upward in surprise,
the Spirit Spring surges forth.

Hands left and right embrace the navel,
the elixir fire gently warms,
intention wanders the boundless void,
spirit-light shines of its own accord,
the six senses are tranquil,
self and objects alike forgotten—
for a long while, dim and silent,
dark and obscure,
the spirit does not regard the body,
the body does not regard the spirit—
guest and host are divided.

Within the Great Emptiness,
a light appears like an orange—
neither within nor without—
guard it and do not lose it.
Like moonlight’s glow,
like a mirror’s reflection,
store it with intention yet do not depart—
vague and internal illumination,
its light disperses naturally,
vast as a wheel.
Intention turns upward to observe,
and within, the self-form appears.
The spirit departs the body and resides in the light,
form appears in the spirit,
spirit gazes upon the body,
form and spirit regard each other,
its light disperses like moonlight on snow.

Form and spirit both wondrous,
uniting with the Dao and attaining truth—
when the spirit returns to the body, is it the True?
When it departs, is it the Numinal?

A thousand days’ work—
the body departs and ascends.
Ten thousand days’ practice—
the spirit enters.
Then, one must use the Heart Fire to nourish it.

What is Heart Fire?
Vague yet indistinct—
within it, there is substance;
dark yet profound—
within it, there is truth.

The twelve divisions of a day—
six belong to Yang, six to Yin.
When time aligns with **Zi** (子), the work of refining life begins.
**Zi** is Yang;
**Chou** (丑) is Yin.
Taking the **Dark Mother** (玄牝) for pleasure is Yang—
pleasure on the left opens the **Golden Pass** (金关),
pleasure on the right opens the **Jade Gate** (玉户).
When time aligns with **Zi**, Yin is within Yang.
The right kidney, the **Moon**—
within it lies the **qi of the Jade Rabbit** (玉兔之氣),
emerging from the right nostril,
this is the source of pleasure.

Then, first **water three** (行水三),
then **fire three** (行火三),
in accordance with **Ji Ji** (既济).
When time aligns with **Chou**, Yang is within Yin.
The left kidney, the **Sun**—
within it lies the **qi of the Golden Crow** (金乌之氣),
emerging from the left nostril,
this is the source of pleasure.

Then, first **fire three** (行火三),
then **water three** (行水三),
in accordance with **Wei Ji** (未济).
The **Classic** (經) says:
The **Great One** (太一) contains light,
right is Yin, left is Yang.
Thus, the *Yijing* (《易》) says:
One closing, one opening is called **change** (變),
endless coming and going is called **harmony** (通).
Therefore, when **qi** expands and opens—
it is Yang’s essence,
its emergence is the **Sun Soul** (日魂), the **True Fire** (真火);
when it contracts and closes—
it is Yin’s essence,
its return is the **Moon Embryo** (月魄), the **True Water** (真水).
The *Yijing* (《易》) says:
**Qian** (乾) is firm, **Kun** (坤) is yielding—
this is what is meant.

Why?
This is the **original qi** (元氣) of **Metal and Wood** (金木),
firm and yielding, divided by the **Dark Mother** (玄牝).
Sinking inward, rising outward,
ascending and descending at the breath’s turn;
**Masculine** (雄) shifts, **Feminine** (雌) follows,
uniting in the **Elixir Field** (丹田) within;
**Death’s emergence** (出死) and **Life’s return** (入生)—
all is here!

For those who wish to refine the **elixir heart** (丹心) and the **clear mirror** (明鏡),
there is a way.

When time aligns with **Zi** (子),
left ascends, right descends—
left invests, right receives.
When time aligns with **Wu** (午),
right ascends, left descends—
right invests, left receives.
One exhale from the **heart and lungs** (心与肺),
one inhale into the **kidneys and liver** (肾与肝),
one breath and one exhale connect with the **Four Viscera** (四藏),
all gathering in the **Central Palace** (中宫) at the **Steel and Earth tripod** (戊己之鼎).

I have practiced when time aligns with **Zi** (子),
sitting upright and still,
forgetting the world and observing the marvels—
sometimes facing south, sometimes facing north,
left foot raised above,
first closing my eyes,
then striking the **Heavenly Drum** (天鼓) thirty-six times,
next tapping my teeth thirty-six times,
to gather my **spirit** (神).
Then, rubbing my hands left and right seven times,
**Fire Nine Returns** (火九还),
warming my palms to smooth the **Heavenly Abode** (天宅) twenty to thirty times,
next warming the left kidney as the **Sheep Chariot** (羊车),
then warming the right kidney as the **Deer Chariot** (鹿车),
and warming below the navel as the **Great Ox Chariot** (大牛车),
each thirty-six times.
Then, guiding and drawing to move and warm my four limbs,
twisting and extending my hundred bones,
thus the **meridians and collaterals** (经络) flow freely.

Awaiting the **qi**’s harmonious flow,
then practicing **breath refinement** (吐纳),
three **swallows** (三咽) at the **Flowering Pool** (華池).
The **Dark Embryo** (玄膺) is the **shore of life and death** (生死之岸).
Entering **clarity** (清), emerging from **darkness** (玄),
the two **qi**’s exchange.
Thus, **water and fire** are the **gates of longevity** (長生之門).

The **Great Medicine** (大药) is **three hundred eighty-four catty** (三百八十四铢),
uniting the **trigrams and lines** (卦爻) in number.
At **Zi**’s moment, I gather the **Sun’s spirit** (日中之神),
its name is **Lesser Yang** (少陽).
Facing south, sitting upright,
left foot raised above,
eyes closed, forgetting the world,
both hands firmly grasp the two kidneys,
teeth clenched tight,
with tongue propped against the upper palate,
drawing **clear qi** (清气) through the nose,
inhale softly and continuously,
until the abdomen is full, then stop.
Then, close it,
so that inside does not emerge, outside does not enter,
counting the breath with my mind,
storing the **spirit** with my intention.
Next, focus on the **Elixir Field** (下丹田).
Within the two kidneys lies a **tripod** (鼎),
and within the tripod is an **infant** (婴儿),
whose name is **Heavenly Sovereign Lord of the Origin** (天皇元君).
Sitting upright, the infant emits a **five-colored light** (五色之光).
Next, focus on my heart like a **red lotus leaf** (红芙叶),
hanging yet unopened,
within it is a **maiden** (妮女),
whose name is the **Earthly Rear Spirit** (地后之神).
Standing on the **five-colored clouds** (五彩之云),
then descend to pull the **Heavenly Sovereign** inward,
uniting with it.
In an instant, **original fire** (元火) descends from above,
**Flowering Pool** (華池) ascends from below—
now is the moment of **water and fire’s completion** (水火既济).
Close the breath and wait until the fire reaches one catty,
then **rinse the mouth** (漱口) with the **Jade Dew** (玉津) twenty to thirty times,
tap the teeth three times,
and evenly divide the three **swallows** (三咽),
to correspond with the **Three Yin** (三阴).
Left opens the **Golden Pass** (金关),
right passes through the **Jade Palace** (玉宫),
entering the tripod, then stopping.
Then, slowly exhale the **turbulent qi** (浊气),
and softly release the breath,
its name is **Rain Descending** (雨降),
also called **Dragon Leads the Way, Tiger Follows** (龙先行、虎后至).

As before, first **fire three** (行火三),
then **water three** (行水三),
until the time of **Chou** (丑),
when the right nostril is refreshed.
Then, first **water three** (行水三),
then **fire three** (行火三),
opening the **Jade Gate** (玉户) on the right.

At **Wu**’s moment, I gather the **Moon’s spirit** (月中之神),
its name is **Lesser Yin** (少阴).
First, with the right foot raised above,
the method is as before.

**Spirit storage and observation** (存观) is the **Yin-stilling method** (阴定法),
to prevent the **spirit** from wandering outside the **gates** (户).
When the breath is still, the **qi**’s exchange is complete.

One breath’s stillness contains the Six Harmonies within,
thus inhaling and exhaling the Three Yins and Three Yangs,
making them ascend and descend in union—
the Three Sons and Three Daughters combine to refine the essence.

Therefore, the mind stores the **spirit**, the **spirit** unites with the **qi**,
and when the breath is still, the **qi** harmonizes.

Breath is the **Primordial Fire**.
Using **fire** in twenty-four *chǐ* measures,
straightforward as the twenty-four lines of the four *guà*,
corresponding to the twenty-four seasons of the year.

Thus, using **fire** in twenty-four *chǐ* measures:
when the breath is still nine thousand six hundred times,
a single closure of four hundred breaths yields one *chǐ* of **fire**.
Twenty-four closures of breath complete twenty-four *chǐ* of **fire**.

Hence it is said:
*"Accumulating water forms the sea; accumulating **qi** forms the **spirit**."*
This is what is meant.

Then, the daily **Fire Function** of a full celestial circuit
can reclaim the twelve years of **not-death**.

Mortal **qi** and blood traverse eight hundred ten *zhàng* by day and night.
If one can regulate the *cùn* and *liǎng* within a hundred *kè*,
then the **Dao** of observing heaven lies within the palm.

The upper three lines of a *guà* are **Yin**—
one inhalation corresponds to them,
and the **qi** enters three *cùn*.

The **Dagger** (*dāo*) is twenty-four *cùn*;
the **Jade Tablet** (*guī*) is twenty-four *chǐ*;
the **Measure** (*chǐ*) is twenty-four *chǐ*;
the **Two** (*liǎng*) is twenty-four *chǐ*.

The lesser count of one line is one *cùn*;
one breath is six *cùn*.
When stillness is held in one breath, it becomes sixteen movements,
yielding two *chǐ* and four *cùn*—
this is the **Flowing Pearl Elixir**.

The middle count of one line is one *chǐ*;
ten breaths are six *chǐ*.
When stillness is held in forty breaths, it becomes one hundred sixty movements,
yielding twenty-four *chǐ*—one **Jade Tablet**—
this is when **blood** and **qi** cease flowing and gather as the **Crucible**.

Is this not what **Pure Yang Child** called
*"self-administering the Dagger and Jade Tablet"*?

The greatest **Yielding** of one line is one *zhàng*;
one breath is six *zhàng*.
When fully held in four hundred breaths, it becomes one thousand six hundred movements,
yielding twenty-four *zhàng*—one **Measure**—
this is when **blood** and **qi** cease flowing and transform.

By day and night, the **Fire Function** should yield one *liǎng*, nine *chǐ*, seven *dāo*, and half a **Jade Tablet**,
counting its essence as eight hundred ten—
the **earthly number** where **blood** and **qi** do not flow.

From the *Jīn Xuān Bā Sù Piān*:
*"Seal the **spirit’s dwelling**,
and regulate the breath."*

When the **Nine Nines** are complete, the **Spirit** descends to dwell.

Those who refine the **Elixir** must first externally harmonize **Yin-Yang** and internally illuminate the **viscera and bowels**, only then may they proceed.

The **bones and joints** number three hundred sixty, the **hair follicles** eighty-four thousand—none lack their place within.
The **Spinal Column**, the **Heavenly Pillar**, has twenty-four nodes; three hidden **Passes** lie upon the back:
The lowest node is called **Crow’s Tail**, situated in the **Scrotal Cavity’s Heart**—this is the **Gate of the Valley Spirit**, the **Tail Hearing**, **Sea Gate**, and **Loop Pass**.

The middle node is called **Elbow’s Back**, opposite the **Heart’s Extremity**—this is the **Pass of the Nine-Heaven Fire Dragon’s Flying Crow**.

The upper node, behind the neck and shoulder, is called **Great Spine**—this is the **Fighting Bull**, the **Dragging Support**, the three **Paths to the Upper Clarity’s Flying Step**, the **Changing Scales**, and the **Gate of the Returning Path of the Regenerating Tiger, Regenerating Dragon**.

Facing forward, the **Braided Bag** triples, three **Fields** divided within its three **Cùns** of length:
From the **Mud Pellet** to the **Neck** is the **Upper Elixir Field**, named the **Brain Palace**, divided into nine **petals**—the **Sea of Marrow, Brain, and Blood**, the **Gate of the Mysterious Female**.

From the **Neck’s Severance** to the **Stomach’s Severance** is the **Middle Elixir Field**, named the **Vermilion Palace**, divided into nine **orifices**—the **Sea of Saliva and Water**, the **Gate of the Detached Heart**.

From the **Stomach’s Severance** to the **Navel’s Severance** is the **Lower Elixir Field**, named the **Mysterious Palace**, encompassing the **Four Symbols**, arraying the **Nine Officials**—the **Sea of Spirit, Qi, and Essence**, the **Gate of the Balanced End**.

The three **Fields** each have **diaphragmatic membranes**, threefold yet impenetrable to one another.
The **Upper Primordial Palace** illuminates the **Ten Thousand Phenomena** of **Forest of Forms**.
The **Middle Primordial Palace** houses the **Pure Yang** of the **Five Viscera**.
The **Lower Primordial Palace** transmits the **Filth and Turbidity** of the **Six Bowels**.

The **Six Bowels** lie before, the **Five Viscera** reside behind, their **pulse-orifices** interconnected yet each with its own **passages and unions**.

The **Heart** is the **Li** hexagram—its **Spirit** governs, its **orifice** is the **tongue**, its **union** is the **Small Intestine**; it generates **blood, vessels, sweat, pores, hair**, and its **sound** is **speech**.

The **Kidneys** are the **Kǎn** hexagram—its **Essence** governs, its **orifice** is the **ear**, its **union** is the **Bladder**; it generates **bone, fat, sac, saliva, teeth**, and its **sound** is **groaning**.

The **Lungs** are the **Duì** hexagram—its **Po** governs, its **orifice** is the **nose**, its **union** is the **Large Intestine**; it generates **qi, skin, mucus, hair**, and its **sound** is **weeping**.

The **Liver** is the **Zhèn** hexagram—its **Hun** governs, its **orifice** is the **eye**, its **union** is the **Gallbladder**; it generates **sinew, membranes, tears, nails**, and its **sound** is **shouting**.

The **Spleen** is the **Kūn** hexagram—its **Will** governs, its **orifice** is the **mouth**, its **union** is the **Stomach**; it generates **flesh, brain, marrow, saliva**, and its **sound** is **singing**.

The **tongue** is the **root of the Heart**; the **penis** is the **stalk of the Kidneys**—
all these stem from the **Primordial One Qi**, embracing **Yin** and **Yang**, harmonizing the **Five Phases**, and giving rise to the **Six-Feet Frame**.

From **one year** to **sixteen**, the **True One** is pure and complete, filling to the measure of **one jin**. Once grown, it begins to dissipate.

All **food** gathers in the **Stomach**, secretly receiving the **Primordial Fire’s** refining—
the **Pure** ascends like **cloud-rain**, nourishing the **Heavens**,
the **Impure** sinks like **dung-soil**, draining to the **Earth**.

Thus, one should daily use the **Ascending Nourishing Water** to cleanse the **chest and intestines**,
and the **Odd Yang Fire** to consume the **form and substance**.

Now, the **Ascending Nourishing** gathers at the **mouth** as **saliva**,
fills the **Lungs** as **spittle**,
fills the **Heart** as **blood**,
fills the **Kidneys** as **essence**.

**Essence** is the **True Lead** of the **Sea Palace**, uniquely complete in the **Five Phases**—
this is the **Pearl Flow of the Great Yang**.

Its nature is fierce and unyielding, most difficult to subdue.
When the **True Fire of Heaven’s Five** descends from above to conquer it,
it ascends to the **Mud Pellet**, flowing through the **hundred vessels**,
able to **solidify marrow and brain**, **strengthen bones and flesh**, **master qi and blood**, **nourish hair**, **refine sinews and intestines**—
thus it **dwells among the Ten Thousand Spirits** and **reaches the Three Palaces**.

At the **four junctures** of **day and night**—**walking, standing, sitting, lying**—
should **demons** suddenly arise,
enter the **Chamber**, cross-legged and seated,
close the **eyes**, shut the **mouth**, grasp firmly,
clear the **mind**, and internally visualize the **two Kidney Vessels** merging at the **Spinal Column**,
like a **thread**, ascending along the **Heavenly Pillar**,
piercing straight to the **Mud Pellet**.
Once established, regulate the **qi**:
first, from the **Scrotal Sac’s hole**, between the **Kidneys’ two origins**, draw in one **contraction**,
inhale as you withdraw, guiding the **One Qi** to the **Brain**.
Then close the **mouth and nose**, preventing **qi** from rushing out.
From the **Scrotal Sac’s hole**, inhale as you withdraw again, but **slowly**.

Why **ascend and descend**?
To **internally rotate the Mysterious Tortoise**, drawing the **Neck Pass**,
secretly counting to **eighty-one**.

One **rotation** is three counts—
the key is to **tightly seal the nasal gate**,
so that within **one inhalation**, the **Tortoise Pass** turns **eighty-one times**.

If the **breath surges** or the **qi rushes**, clashing at the **nose**, regulate it **softly and continuously**,
until it reaches the **hundred passes**.
Then, as soon as an inhalation begins, the **breath** stabilizes,
and the **rotation** completes **eighty-one times**—
**slow, continuous, and natural**, without strain.

Only then does one hear the **two Kidneys** **unblocked**, the **hundred passes** **unhindered**,
the **Heart** **joyful**, the **Spirit** **delighted**, the **bones light**, the **qi clear**,
as if seated in **warm bathwater**.

At first, the **qi** is untamed, the **fire’s timing** unripe—
sealing the **mouth and nose** is difficult.
Yet fear not.
When the **qi surges upward** from **Nine to Nine**, proceed **gradually**.

In **rotating the breath**, sometimes **one Nine**, sometimes **two Nines**, sometimes **three Nines**—
if the **surge** is difficult to regulate, **pause** and **slowly** adjust the **qi**,
guiding it into the **Elixir Field**.
When the **mind** is **serene and steady**, the **mouth** may **slightly open**,
but the **nose must not be carelessly released**—
this is the **Commanding of the Breath**.

The practice endured, and when harmony settled, the **saliva and fluids** steamed and flowed—do not hastily wipe your clothes.

This **Commanding of the Breath**, when mastered, reaches **four Nines**, **six Nines**, and finally **nine Nines** in full measure. Adjusting the **qi** and steadying the **mind**, fill the mouth with saliva, then send the **fire** leftward to swallow nine times, directing it inward to the **Sea Within**. Thus, all malevolent influences retreat.

This is the **Lesser Inner Elixir**.

Without encountering the **Great Work of Heaven and Earth**, merely practicing this **Way** in daily life, after a **memorial cycle (12 years)**, one may renew **bone and blood**, restore youthful complexion and blacken the hair, becoming firm and unyielding without leakage.

Within the **Wind and Thunder Gates**, in a sealed chamber, seated cross-legged in **Kan (☴) and Xun (☴)**, straighten the spine and grasp firmly. Close the eyes, quiet the **mind**, gather the **spirit** with intent, and stir the **Dragon’s Tail**. Within the **teeth**—inner, outer, left, right, up, down—and at the **root of the tongue**, stir and rinse the **Heavenly Water** as it ascends. When full, contain it. Then, with a steady **mind**, internally observe the **Qi Sea** between the **Two Kidneys**—like a **crimson cloud** enclosing a **scarlet sun**, blazing red light, resembling a **fire-pearl**, as large as a **yellow tangerine**. Focus the **mind** upon the **fire-pearl**, drawing out a thread of **fire** as thick as a **rope**, circulating it to **Dui (☰)**—this is the **Golden Pass**.

Upon reaching **Dui**, the **fire and metal** interact, producing a strange sound. Gently direct the **mind** toward the body, rubbing the hands over it as the **fire** passes **Dui**, moving through **Li (☲)** into **Zhen (☳)**. Then, divide the **Heavenly Water** from the mouth, swallowing it straight down to **Dui**, where it merges with the **fire**, returning to the **Elixir Field**—this completes **one swallow**.

If the **swallowing** feels incomplete, exhale slightly upward, inhaling a breath of **fire** to drive it leftward and downward until it descends fully. If the **drawing and swallowing** are unclear, the **descending qi** will not be complete, risking **stagnant yin** and accumulated **pathologies**, harming the **Six Palaces**.

Thus, **one fire and one water** constitute **one swallow**. Follow this method diligently, practicing **sixty times for Wind**, **sixty times for Thunder**, daily without ceasing. When the **spirit’s count** is complete, success will come within a year.

By the **tenth swallow**, gather the **mind** as if drawing **fire**, blending **water and fire** from the **Sea’s center**, circulating through **Kan, Dui, Li, Xun, Zhen** in **nine revolutions**. When the **tide** rises, moisten and guide it downward.

At the onset, the **mind** may tremble—this is the **yin evils** burning in resistance. Remain steady and unmoved. By **seventy days**, this marks the **Middle Transformation**; beyond **one hundred days**, the **Lesser Signs** appear.

At **twenty days** and **thirty days**, though the **qi-field** is clear, there may be **cold or heat**; the **Six Palaces** stir. By **seventy days**, the **water source** overflows, as if descending with pain, and **urination** becomes frequent. Though the **Three Fields** are open, the **Six Emotions** still fluctuate—once, a **minor battle** occurs, with the **tide surging like waves**, the **fire erupting like thunder**.

Thus, the **Five Viscera** become unobstructed, the **Nine Cauldrons** secretly connected, and **appetite doubles**. By **one hundred fifty days**, the **parasitic hunger** recedes. By **one hundred eighty days**, the **creatures** emerge—**inch-worms, barley-worms, millet-worms, purple silkworms**—some like **parrot droppings**, others like **gallbladder bile**. By **two hundred days**, the **True Qi** penetrates the **Five Viscera**: entering the **lungs**, all **poisons retreat**; entering the **liver, heart, spleen, kidneys**, the **Five Colors** fade, and **filth descends with hidden pain**.

By **two hundred fifty days**, the **clean viscera and turbid bowels** grow cold. Then, a **wheel of fire** appears, revolving within—**Five Internals** purified, the **alcohol support** circulating, and **one hundred vessels** lightened. The **ears** become keen, the **eyes** bright, the **marrow** plentiful, the **bones** solid, the **flesh** refined, the **sinews** strong, the **qi** complete, the **blood** unobstructed. Below the **navel**, above the **Qi Sea**, the **internal essence** rises in layers, fat as **silkworms in cocoons**; one revolution, and the **qi** may move freely.

The **Original Qi** naturally resides in the **Elixir Field**, forming **fire**, converging at the **Central Palace**, heavy as if two fists—**hidden and warm**. Below the **navel**, it constantly glows; when the **stomach is empty**, the **fire-wheel** ascends, circulating the **Eight Trigrams**, like the sound of a **thunder-chariot**. The **Heavenly Water** and **Jade Fluids** flow; when **thoughts arise**, the mouth fills. The **Original Fire** and **Spirit Pearl** traverse the **Three Palaces**, and thus the **Eight Evils** retreat.

Who knows the **Inner Elixir’s method**? Its **secret** is thus:

*"Steady the **Heavenly Heart**, purify **Wuji (戊己)**, gather at **Weishen (巳亥)**, take at **Yinshen (寅申)**.
Circulate the **Milky Way**, revolve in the **Golden Cauldron**.
First, like a **woman grinding in emptiness**, then undress and quiet the **mind**.
Fold the legs and lie supine, rub the palms until warm, then apply the **method**—wash and wipe the face.
Thus, the body becomes unobstructed. Briefly steady the **breath**, close the eyes, seal the **passes**, and begin **inner observation**.
A **jade wave** emerges, filling heaven and earth, and the **Five Spirits** naturally submerge while **ten thousand thoughts** cease.

Within the body, the **Taiji** transforms into a **Palace**—
the **Left Golden Hall**, where my **embryonic form** resides;
the **Right Jade Chamber**, where my **ancestral mother** dwells.
Secretly emerging and merging, the **Two Qis** blend and flow—
then **lead and mercury** congeal in the **Golden Cauldron**.

Quickly ignite the **Earth Fire**, leftward in **three layers**, empty and contracting—
each enters the **sac-like cavities**. Inhale and exhale, drawing the **breath** through the **major joints**, past the **elbow’s pass**, dwelling **twenty-six counts**. Pause when breathless.

**Second:** Lower the **pillow**, flip the hands left and right, hook the **face’s center**, then from below the **sac-like cavities**, rotate in **three layers**, contracting and drawing the **breath**, past the **Fighting Bull’s pass**, dwelling **twenty-six counts**. Pause when breathless.

**Third:** Rise and sit, reverse the **Phoenix Wings**, stretch the **Great Bull’s Chariot**, then from below the **sac-like cavities**, rotate in **three layers**, contracting and drawing the **breath**, ascending to the **Brain Palace**. Bow the head **three times**, each **twenty-six counts**. Pause when breathless."

---

This **threefold return**—once the **passes and locks** grow sluggish, with **fire’s Dao** and **water’s source** both sluggish and delayed, and **circulation** still coarse—one must not rigidly adhere to each original method, for forcing the **great counts** risks harm. Instead, proceed gradually by **virtue/power**:

- **Ten counts**, or **twenty**, or **fifty**, until the proper number is reached.
When **fire surges** and **water flows**, and the **functions** are unobstructed, then calculate the **days** and proceed accordingly. By the end of a year, the work is complete.

**Flying water** is easy to rinse; **primordial fire** is difficult to draw.

The **heart of the sea’s primordial fire** has **qi** but no substance. Only by **fixing the mind** within the **dim haze**, directing the **intent** to draw it, will the **spirit** resonate with the **Dao’s symbols**, and the fire within the **pearl** naturally emerge with the will. It follows the **Eight Trigrams**, blazing fiercely to scorch the **navel**, striking the **Jue Pass** to emit sound.

At first, the drawn fire is but the size of **one finger’s pulse**. Over time, it traverses the **Eight Trigrams**, and within **thirty days**, it pierces the **Jue Pass**, producing a **crow’s cry**. By **sixty days**, it sounds like a **dove’s coo**; by **ninety days**, like a **boiling cauldron**; by **one hundred days**, like **tides**; by **half a year**, like **thunder**. Thus, the **fetal qi** condenses into **true fire**.

In the first **thirty days**, the fire is weak and the water sluggish; the **passes and locks** are not yet open, and the **dim haze** resists action. Poisonous insects, corpse ghosts, and the **Eight Evils**, **Yin specters** burned by the fire, become **demons**, causing **anger, greed, and lust**—only ensure the fire does not extinguish. After completing the **threefold return**, rest briefly, then sit **serene and composed**, the mind at ease. Rinse fully with **flying water**, swallowing the fire **nine times** from left to right, until it reaches the **Elixir Field**—this is the **Great Return**, refining the **golden essence** once.

When the **circuit of stars** is complete and the work is fulfilled, then seek the **Spiritual Mountains’ finest lands**, choosing the **hour of the Pig** on a **Hai month/day**. Undress and lie down, bathe lightly, and await full relaxation. Close the eyes, secure the **passes**, and focus on the **true female’s palace**. When the **essence** fills **one jin**, and the **male and female** align at **twenty-eight**, their **emotions merge**, bodies warm and unified, husband and wife in perfect harmony—by the **hour of the Tiger**, the **sacred embryo** is firmly formed within.

From the **hour of the Rat onward**, lock the **golden pass**, sit **upright and still**, neither turning nor shaking. By the **hour of the Tiger**, release the hands and stretch the feet, letting the mind wander freely. Sit hidden behind a screen, walking **ten steps** at first—never exceeding **twenty-four**—until **one hundred steps**, then after a month, move as desired. At the **great union**, within a single moment, the **circuit of stars** is already complete.

Thus, the **three thousand six hundred measures of true qi** are perfected, the **seven hundred twenty constellations** gathered, extending to **one breath of the Two Commands**, the **Three Talents and Four Symbols**, the **Five Phases and Six Harmonies**, the **Seven Stars and Eight Trigrams**, the **Nine Palaces and Ten Stems**, the **Twelve Branches**, the **Twenty-Four Seasons**, and the **Seventy-Two Weather Divisions**—all contained within **one embryo**.

Having obtained the **true qi of the *Great Change***—**three hundred eighty-four measures**—to form the **spiritual embryo**, the **top’s aperture** gradually opens, splitting on its own. With each **rise and pause**, each **embrace and support**, the **intent** must be precise, with **no impure thought**, and only then may it proceed.

By the **tenth month**, the **spirit** longs to **ascend and shed the body**, and the **mind grows restless**. The **aperture** splits like **thunder’s strike**, the **crown** cracking as if **flames** rose twenty-four **nodes** from the **celestial pillar**, bursting from the **top**. The practitioner must **calm the mind and steady the intent**, walking **ten steps** beyond **one zhang**. After **two years**, the **spiritual powers** are complete, the **numinous awareness** boundless—near or far, penetrating **profound mysteries and hidden depths**, unobstructed in all things.

When the **virtue/power** is profound and the **virtue/power** vast, the **shell is shed**, and one ascends to **pay homage to the Jade Emperor**.

*(End of Dao Gun Volume Twenty-Three, Upper Section: The *Jiyi* Edition reads "止" instead.)*

「#2*The Jiyi Edition reads "一" instead.*  #3*The Jiyi Edition reads "不".*  **Dao Gun Volume Twenty-Four**

**The Golden and Azure Dragon Chapter: On Nurturing Life in the Great Clarity**

The four seasons shift endlessly, like a cycle without beginning or end;
The tiger lies dormant, the dragon coils—transformed into the Golden Elixir.

**Master Liu** said: Gazing upward at the celestial symbols,
One comes to know the four seasons constantly moving,
Yin and Yang alternating, to calculate the slow and swift passage of sun and moon,
Their waxing and waning, thus uncovering the **Dao** of life’s formation,
And recording it in the *Golden and Azure Dragon* scripture.

**Golden** refers to the harmonized balance of firmness and softness;
**Azure** refers to the **Daoist adept** wandering in the **Azure Realm**.

The **Sun** is the essence of the Great Yang, the **soul** of Heaven;
Its nature is fierce and unyielding, capable of generating all things,
Residing within Yin—this is the **Li** hexagram.

The **Moon** is the essence of the Great Yin, the **spirit** of Earth;
Its nature is tranquil yet prone to agitation,
Residing within Yang—this is the **Kan** hexagram.

**Kan** represents the time of two Yins,
Where the **Sun** is born from a single Yang—this is **black lead**,
Emerging from **mercury**,
As it reaches the **Gen** palace, it gradually manifests as **greenish-white**, becoming the **Lesser Youth**,
This is the birth of one Yang from two Yins.

Then, **forty-five days** from its initial position,
Yang arises from below—this is the **Zhen** hexagram.
Its name is the **soul of cinnabar**,
And thus its **mercury** gradually subdues.

By **Peri**, six Yangs are complete,
Its name is **red gold**.
**Forty-five days** from the **Southern Vermilion** (Jiu) land,
Refined by **martial fire**,
**Forty-five days** until it reaches the **Kun** palace,
Where **yellow and black** blend—its essence is called **returning elixir**.
**Forty-five days** until it reaches the **Dui** palace,
Where the **mercury**’s body grows dry,
Its decay like mud—its name is **concealed fire**.

**Mercury** is short-lived, its fire able to enter the **Great Yang**,
Reaching the **Qian** palace—**thirty-six cycles**,
Its **gold** now **true purple**,
Reentering the **Central Palace**,
Where **Great Regeneration** merges with **Wu Fire**,
And **Yellow Chief** unites with **Wu Soil**—

**Realgar** is applied in covering,
Called the **#1**—only **White Tiger** controls it,
After **sixty cycles**, its name is **Gouzi**.
**Five cycles** later, its name is **White Gold Gouzi**.
**Six cycles** later, its name is **Five Metals Divine Elixir**.
**Five cycles** later, its name is **Great One Divine Powder**.

The highest stage is called **Water Mother**;
If it does not ascend and instead spirals within, it is called **Chen#2 Sand**;
If **purple and black** permeate fully, it is called **Great Returning Elixir**;
If it is **red and luminous**, it is called the **Elixir of Purple Micro**.

With **fasting and abstinence** for **one hundred days**,
Selecting the **royal qi** to swallow three **pellets**,
Then the **Three Corpses**, **Nine Vermin**, and **Seven Toxins** are all eliminated.
Taking it for **eighteen cycles**,
One can **ascend and soar through the heavens**.

**The Nine Transformations of the Golden Elixir Chapter**

When a person attains **Oneness**, this is **Original Fire**;
Refined in the **Three Fields**, with **spiritual qi** as auxiliary.

**Kanglongzi**, the **Daoist adept** from **Western Shu** at **Qingcheng Mountain** (段昊也),
Said: **The Dao** generates **Oneness**—this is the **One Qi of the Great Void**.
All things and humans,
Their birth stems from **One Qi**, their death returns to **One Qi**.

**Yin** is **nature**—that which comes from **nothingness**;
**Yang** is **life-force**—that which arises from **somethingness**.

The **body** is the **form**, the **heart** its function;
The **heart** is the **form**, the **spirit** its function;
The **spirit** is the **form**, the **qi** its function.

**Qi**’s form is governed by **movement**, refined in the **saliva furnace** as its function.

The **divine spirits** of Heaven and Earth are born from **Yin and Yang**;
The **divine essences** of **qi** are transformed from **Yin and Yang**.

Why are there some whose **spirit** is dimmed and **nature** obscured?
Because their **qi** does not align with their **spirit**, nor their **spirit** with their **qi**.

Thus, the **heart** takes **nature** as its **spirit**,
And the **spirit** takes the **heart** as its function.
The **spirit** is the **true essence** of **nature**;
**Nature** is the **form** of the **spirit**.

Therefore, **preserving the spirit** and **nurturing the qi**,
**Penetrating nature** and **clearing the spirit**,
Always letting the **spirit** assist the **qi** and the **qi** assist the **spirit**,
Naturally leads to **longevity**.

What is it for Heaven and Earth to attain **Oneness**?
**Yin and Yang** are the answer.

What is it for humans to attain **Oneness**?
**Original Fire** is the answer.

To know **Oneness**,
Then **emptiness** is the **medicine**,
The **Elixir’s Root** the **furnace**,
**True Qi** the **fire**,
Refined in the **Three Fields**—
If **true qi** does not disperse,
Can **Yin and Yang** truly lament their **forms**?

The **mysterious applications** of the **Dao** are threefold:
The highest—**circulating the Original Qi of the Great Void**,
**Pairing with Kan and Li spirits**,
Entering the **manifest world**, its **form** naturally transforms,
**Overcoming the unmanifest**, its **form** naturally attains **truth**;

The middle—**preserving the form and securing the qi**,
**Nurturing the form**, **dwelling in the true**,
**Spiritual qi** harmonized and refined,
**Penetrating and naturally luminous**;

The lowest—**discarding turbidity and retaining purity**,
**Spirit and soul** not dispersing, their **essence** preserved.

As for **governing the void**, **guiding the Great Space**,
And **examining its beginning and end**, the **Eight Trigrams** are the key.

**One line** is **One Qi**;
**Fourteen lines** are the **Fourteen Qi**—

The **movement** of Heaven and Earth begins,
With **wind wheels** above—symbols of **Unfinished**,
The **Three Yin Qi** descending from the **Void Emperor’s** essence;
With **water wheels** below—symbols of **Finished**,
The **Three Yang Qi** descending from the **Void Emperor’s** essence.

**East** is **Zhen**—the **True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns**, the **Lesser Yang Wood**,
Born from water, corresponding to the **liver**.
The **liver** takes **Jia** as elder brother, **Yi** as younger sister,
**Ji** as the **wife of Jia**, and **Geng** as the **husband of Yi**—
This is the **True Qi of the Great Yang Wood**, becoming **Xun**,
Born from wind.

**South** is **Li**—the **True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Fire**,
Born from wind, corresponding to the **heart**.
The **heart** takes **Bing** as elder brother, **Ding** as younger sister,
**Xin** as the **wife of Bing**, and **Ren** as the **husband of Ding**—
This is the **True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Three Yin Earth**,
Born from wind, becoming **Kun**.
Its upper is black, its lower red,
Its left white, its right green,
Its center yellow,
And it **conceals within One Qi**—its hue is **mysterious**.

**West** is **Dui**—the **True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Lesser Yin Metal**,
Born from wind, corresponding to the **lung**.
The **lung** takes **Geng** as elder brother, **Xin** as younger sister,
**Yi** as the **wife of Geng**, and **Bing** as the **husband of Xin**—
This is the **True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Great Yang Metal**,
Born from water, becoming **Qian**.

**North** is **Kan**—the **True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Yangming Water**,
Born from water, corresponding to the **kidney**.
The **kidney** takes **Ren** as elder brother—**ten days**—
**Twenty-four divinations**, this is the **second**, **Gui** as younger sister,
**Ding** as the **wife of Ren**, **Wu** as the **husband of Gui**—
This is the **True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Three Yang Earth**,
Born from water, becoming **Gen**.
Its upper is red, its lower black,
Its left green, its right white,
Its center yellow,
And it **conceals within One Qi**—its hue is **crimson**.
---

The **Center** is **Kun**—corresponding to the **spleen**.
The **spleen** takes **Wu** as elder brother, **Ji** as younger sister,
**Gui** as the **wife of Wu**, and **Jia** as the **husband of Ji**.

The **Three Yang** disperses in water to become **Heaven**—this is **Qian**,
Its natural **qi** named **Taihe Jun**;
The **Three Yin** disperses in wind to become **Earth**—this is **Kun**,
Its natural **spirit** named **Taichen Jun**.

**Qian** generates **three sons**: **Zhen**, **Kan**, and **Gen**—
The **essence of the dragon**, the **public of the phoenix**.
**Kun** generates **three daughters**: **Xun**, **Li**, and **Dui**—
The **body of the tiger**, the **essence of the tortoise**.

The **Six Qi**—**Three Yang**, **Three Yin**—
Are **transmitted to the Five Zang**, **ascend and descend through the Six Fu**,
**Enmesh the Three Elements**, **bind the Eight Vessels**,
**Circulate through the Twelve Channels and Fifteen Collaterals**,
**Cycle back through the Three Hundred Sixty-Five Orifices**,
From **Heaven’s Gate** above to **Earth’s Portal** below.
**Gain one breath**, and **heat** arises;
**Lose one breath**, and **cold** arises.

**Yang qi** spirals leftward, **Yin qi** revolves rightward—
**Five thousand degrees** in its **Microcosmic Orbit**.
Thus, when **left qi** converges, **right qi** responds;
When **right qi** converges, **left qi** responds—
And each has its **pairing**.

The **essence of Lesser Yang**, the **orthodox of Great Yang**—
These are the **first and second True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Metal**.
The **essence of Great Yang**, the **orthodox of Lesser Yang**—
These are the **third and fourth True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Fire**.
The **essence of Yangming**, the **orthodox of Lesser Yang**—
These are the **fifth True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Earth**.
The **essence of Lesser Yin**, the **orthodox of Great Yin**—
These are the **sixth True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Wood**.
The **essence of Great Yin**, the **orthodox of Reclusive Yin**—
These are the **seventh True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns Water**.
The **essence of Reclusive Yin**, the **orthodox of Lesser Yin**—
These are the **eighth True Qi of the Nine Sovereigns**.

Thus, the **Central Palace** is set as the **cauldron**,
To **collect and seize the marvelous qi** of the **Eight Directions**,
**Pairing with Earth** and **harmonizing**?
**Refining without dispersion**,
Then the **Nine Cauldrons’ Divine Elixir** is formed.

Its elixir bears **nine hues**: **cyan**, **red**, **white**, **black**, **yellow**, **purple**, **green**, **azure**, and **rust-brown**—
These are the **Nine Colors**.

In ancient times, **Emperor Huang** refined his **sword** and cast his **cauldron**,
Riding the **Fire Dragon** to ascend to **Heaven**—
This is the **illustration of internal alchemy**.
How so?
The **heart** is **fire**;
The **liver** is **charcoal**;
The **kidneys** are **wheels**;
The **lungs** are **golden liquid**;
The **spleen** is the **furnace altar**.

The **Classics** state:
The **heart** is **cinnabar**,
The **lungs** are **mica**,
The **liver** is **void-blue**,
The **kidneys** are **lodestone**,
The **gallbladder** is **realgar**—
This is the **meaning of pairing and refining**.

Thus, the **Sage** uses the **body as furnace**,
The **Three Palaces as cauldrons**,
Refining the **unending qi**,
Entering the **form of Non-Action**.

**Body still**, **spirit naturally clears**;
**Spirit clear**, **qi naturally abounds**;
**Spirit and qi harmonized**, **form naturally lightens**.
When **One Qi** is settled, **a hundred vessels** are perpetually full;
When the **Nine Cauldrons** are perfused, **ten thousand spirits** are naturally numinous.

The **Nine Cauldrons** are the **functions of the Nine Palaces**.
The **Elixir Field** is the **Caulron of True Unity**—
This is the **Hall of the Nine Cauldrons’ Grand Assembly**.
**Unifying One Qi** to become **True**,
**Refining the Nine Qi** to form **Divine Elixir**.

What are the **Nine Qi**?
They are called **Nine Qi**, **Nine Regions**, **Nine Realms**, **Nine Bends**, **Nine Orifices**, **Nine Palaces**, **Nine Circulations**, **Nine Returns**, and **Nine Cauldrons**.

Within the **Nine Cauldrons**,
There are the **Seven Reversions**, the **Eightfold Four-Eight-Six Transformations**, and the **Nine Returns**’s **Way**.

**Reversion** is **covering and merging**,
To **recover the Qi and Blood** of the **Seven Exterior and Eight Enveloping Channels and Collaterals**.
**One Reversion (of the pulse)**, and the **pulse halts its movement**;
**Two Reversions (of the qi)**, and the **qi gathers and congeals**;
**Three Reversions (of the blood)**, and the **blood becomes white milk**;
**Four Reversions (of the essence)**, and the **essence condenses into jade-like pearls**;
**Five Reversions (of the bones)**, and the **bones are like red jade**;
**Six Reversion (of the marrow)**, and the **marrow transforms into mysterious frost**;
**Seven Reversion (of the form)**, and the **form clears, the body becomes marvelous**;
**Eight Reversion (of the spirit)**, and the **spirit transforms without bounds**.

**Return** is **retrieving its origin**,
To **draw the Qi of the Five Phases**,
**Stir the Essence of the Three Centers**,
**Stabilize the Primary Source of One Thing**.

**One Return** to the **kidneys**,
**Two Return** to the **heart**,
**Three Return** to the **liver**,
**Four Return** to the **lungs**,
**Five Return** to the **spleen**,
**Six Return** to the **Elixir Chamber**,
**Seven Return** to the **Qi Gate**,
**Eight Return** to the **Essence Hall**,
**Nine Return** to the **Spirit Room**.

When **Nine Transformations** are complete, **form may be preserved**.
At first, **Qian**—
The **large intestine**, **Heaven**—
Its name is **Palace of Metal’s Foundation**, **Palace of the Soul’s Insignia**, its **number is Six**;
Next, **Kan**—
The **kidneys**, **Water**—
Its name is **Palace of Water’s Orthodoxy**, **Palace of the Elixir’s Foundation**, its **number is One**;
Next, **Gen**—
The **urinary bladder**, **Moon**, **Mountain**—
Its name is **Palace of Earth’s Foundation**, **Palace of the Jade Chamber**, where the **Qi of the Spleen and Stomach** converges—
Its **number is Eight**.

Next, **Zhen**—
The **liver**, **Thunder**—
Its name is **Palace of Wood’s Orthodoxy**, **Palace of the Orchid Terrace**, its **number is Three**;

Next, **Xun**—
The **gallbladder**, **Wind**—
Its name is **Palace of Wood’s Foundation**, **Palace of Heavenly Mist**, its **number is Four**;

Next, **Li**—
The **heart**, **Fire**—
Its name is **Palace of Fire’s Orthodoxy**, **Palace of Vermilion**, its **number is Nine**;

Next, **Kun**—
The **small intestine**, **Earth**—
Where the **Crimson Bird** is concealed in the soil—
Its name is **Palace of Earth’s Foundation**, **Palace of the Vermilion Mound**, where the **Qi of the Spleen and Stomach** converges—
Its **number is Two**;

Next, **Dui**—
The **lung**, **Marsh**—
Its name is **Palace of Metal’s Orthodoxy**, **Palace of the Grand Historian**, its **number is Seven**.

The **Central Palace** is the **Yellow Court**, **Lead and Mercury**—
Though the **cauldron lacks a cauldron**, the **elixir lacks an elixir**, the **Four Symbols and Five Phases** never depart from the body—
To seek them externally is to sever oneself from the **Way**.

For those refining the **Golden Elixir**, when **nine years** are complete, its **qi** naturally overflows, its **spirit** naturally becomes luminous—
**Five-colored clouds** pierce the crown, **ten thousand forms** gather in homage.

**Kan and Li**—
**Water and Fire**—
Water flows, moistening;
Fire ascends, drying;
Clouds follow the **Dragon**,
Winds follow the **Tiger**;
Those rooted in **Heaven** gravitate upward,
Those rooted in **Earth** gravitate downward—
Each follows its kind.

Thus, when the **yin qi** moves upward, it descends below; when the **yang qi** moves downward, it ascends above—
This is the **Golden Elixir**’s rise and fall.

From the **Winter Solstice**, one refines the **yang embryo**, internally congealing in the **Dan Tian**—
This is called **Command**;
From the **Summer Solstice**, one refines the **yin breath**, internally congealing in the **Liang Guan**—
This is called **Nature**.

The **yang qi** originates from the feet and spirals leftward, its ascent forming the **Sun**;
The **yin qi** originates from the crown and spirals rightward, its descent forming the **Moon**.

Refining **pure yang** leads to lightness and ascension as a **Immortal**;
Refining **pure yin** leads to stagnation and stillness as a **Ghost**.

The **heart** is the **Liang Guan**, the palace of **Mysterious Spirit**—
Within it lies the **Leaping Serpent**, also named **Blue-Eyed Hu’er**, **Great Substance Demon King**, or **Jade Maiden True Demon**,
Breathing **true qi**, its dispersion like white light,
Causing **Heaven’s True yin qi** to descend.

The **kidneys** are the **Yuan Guan**, the palace of the **Heir Apparent**—
Within them lies the **White Primordial Tortoise**, also named **Golden Vital Demon Beast** or **Wen Ling Demon King**,
Breathing **true qi**, its dispersion like purple clouds,
Causing **Heaven’s True yang qi** to ascend.

The **upper day** is the **wind-mixing** phase, yet unaccomplished—
Its symbol is **Li**, internally corresponding to the **Liang Guan**,
Where **yin** resides within **yang**, giving rise through interaction to the **Spirit of Earthly Grandmother and Mother of the Soil**.

The **lower day** is the **water-wheeling** phase, already accomplished—
Its symbol is **Kan**, internally corresponding to the **Dan Tian**,
Where **yang** resides within **yin**, giving rise through interaction to the **Spirit of Heavenly Infant and Divine Emperor**.

The **sutra** says:
*"Men dwell in the **Kan chamber**, women in the **Li palace**,
Then open the **wind-mixing** and pair with the **Central Palace**—*
This is its meaning.

The **Liang Guan** contains **five colors**—
Its top is black, its base red,
Its left is white, its right green,
Its center is yellow, concealing **White Snow**—
With time, it births the **Earthly Grandmother**,
Whose child is **Golden Liquid**, returning to the **Dan Tian**,
Where the **Wife** returns to the **Husband’s Palace**—
This is the **three yin spirits**.

The **Dan Tian** contains **five colors**—
Its top is red, its base black,
Its left is green, its right white,
Its center is yellow, concealing **Yellow Sprout**—
Which births the **Heavenly Infant**,
Produced from **Golden Liquid**, returning to the **Liang Guan**,
Where the **Husband** returns to the **Wife’s Palace**—
This is the **two yang spirits**.

The **Yellow Sprout**—
When **fire** is refined, it becomes the **Heavenly Infant**,
Its crown emitting a red glow,
Riding the **Green Dragon** upward through the **Golden Pass**.

The **White Snow**—
When **water** is refined, it becomes the **Earthly Grandmother**,
Its crown emitting a blue glow,
Mounting the **White Tiger** downward into the **Jade Hall**.

Thus, **yang qi** refines into red glow and descends, hidden in the **Dan Tian**—
Called the **Sun**;
**Yin qi** refines into blue glow and ascends to the **Liang Guan**—
Called the **Moon**.

The **Li Palace’s yin fire** moves in obscurity, ascending and descending,
Leftward thrust, rightward received,
Spirits and **qi** intermingling,
Dwelling in the **Dan Tian**, with **inner luminous light** appearing—
Its form resembles a **fire wheel**,
**Qi** congealing at the **Dan Yuan**.

The **Kan Palace’s yang fire** moves in obscurity, descending,
Rightward thrust, leftward received,
**Inner luminous light** shining,
Its form resembling a **water wheel**,
All limbs withdrawing,
**Essence** settling at the **Dan Yuan**,
**Qi** congealing in the **kidneys**.

Thus, those refining **qi** cause the **spirit** to come and go,
Ascending and descending, intermingling—
**Five lights** merge into **Oneness**, forming the **embryo** and **breath**.

When **Kan Palace’s qi** congeals, its **navel** emits **five-colored clouds** in radiance;
When **Li Palace’s breath** dwells, its **brow** emits white light—
This is **yin and yang** attaining their proper places,
Naturally interacting.

Yet, refining the **Golden Elixir** requires division of **left and right**, **water and fire**, **great and small**,
Refining both equally.

To act contrary to the **Yijing’s** dynamic patterns is like drilling ice to seek fire!
The adept in refining must:
Open the **Heavenly Gate** above,
Close the **Earthly Door** below,
Leftward draw the **kidney essence** to restrain the **Heavenly Dragon**,
Rightward draw the **lung fluid** to drive the **Earthly Horse**—
Leftward drawing, rightward leading,
Leftward emitting, rightward receiving,
Ascending and descending,
**Two qi** circulate and converge,
Leftward thrust and rightward received,
Rightward thrust and leftward received—
Without explicit interaction, the **spirit** naturally mingles;
Without explicit reception, the **spirit** naturally connects—
Sudden in arrival, sudden in departure,
Sudden in dispersion, sudden in gathering—
All within the **Yellow Court**,
Its dispersion like **wind**, its gathering like **rain**—
This is the **natural way** of refining **qi**.

Refining **qi**—
When **yang** opposes **yin**, **yin** lacks nothing to complete;
When **yin** opposes **yang**, **yang** lacks nothing to generate—
Thus, **inner qi** does not disperse,
**Outer qi** does not enter,
Intermingling within.

Its **qi** steams through the limbs,
Soaring and undulating—
Once mingled, twice mingled,
Once received, twice received—
Causing the **spirit** to command **qi**,
**Qi** to command the **spirit**,
**Spirit** and **qi** mutually commanding—
Naturally forming the **embryo** and **breath**.

Refining the **embryo** and **breath**—
First, clarify the **heart**, settle the **spirit**, stabilize the **qi**,
Ensure **wholeness**—
Thus, a settled **heart** brings a settled **spirit**,
A settled **spirit** brings a settled **qi**,
A settled **qi** brings a settled **breath**,
A settled **breath** brings **qi** convergence—
Convergence leads to congealing without dispersion—
This is the **embryo** and **breath**.

Hence, the **spirit** intermingles within,
The **qi** is received within—
Body intermingles with **qi**,
**Qi** intermingles with the **spirit**,
**Spirit** connects with the body,
Body returns to **essence**—
Pure and subtle, entering the **Mystery**,
Embracing the **Primordial Root**,
Guarding the **True** and preserving the **form**,
**Heart qi** descending,
**Breath** settled within—
**Spirit** and **qi** converge in the **Three Palaces**,
**Embryo** and **breath** congeal in **birth and transformation**—
Thus one may rest in harmony with **Heaven** and **Earth**.

The **Great Elixir’s** use of **fire** must follow the **Yijing’s** patterns.
The **Yijing’s** sixty-four hexagrams represent the **cyclic movements of the stars**.
Three years yield one **intercalary month**,
With **384 days**—
This is the **number of Heaven and Earth’s** seasonal **qi**, storing and ascending, descending and transforming.
Using the **384 days of the Yijing’s** dynamic patterns as the **fire’s** talisman,
Then each month has **three sets of ten days**,
Each set of ten days has **360 hours**—
The **Sun** moves through **two hexagrams**.

Thus the twelve hexagram lines—
six yin, six yang—
mark the shifts of motion and stillness.
These are the **changing lines** that govern the **fire’s** progression.

Beyond the sixty hexagrams used monthly,
there are four more:
**Qian** and **Kun** as the **furnace and cauldron**,
**Li** and **Kan** as the **lead and mercury**.
These are the **pivot and axis** in operation.

The **True Person of Wei** said:
*"Sixty-four hexagrams spread daily as a carriage,
the Dragon Horse harnessed to it,
the enlightened sovereign guiding it—
is this not what is meant?"*

The twelve lines correspond to the twelve **times** of day,
with each five days marking a **phase**,
each thirty-five days marking a **node**,
yet **Mao** and **You** are excluded.
**Mao** and **You** are when **Metal** and **Wood** clash directly.
Thus, the **River Vehicle** moves only through **two victorious phases**,
awaiting the mingling of **Jin** and **Han**—
this is the **fire of burning demons and bathing in purity**.

Therefore, in daily use, ten **times** are applied,
and in yearly use, ten **months**—excluding **Mao** and **You**—
so the **returned elixir** is forged in ten months,
just as the **master** of a man’s life.

Three sets of ten days form one **cauldron**,
for the **Sun** and **Moon** meet every thirty days.
I seize the **Nine Qi** of **Creation’s** transformation,
gather and refine them,
condensing them into **divine elixir**.

My ten **cauldrons** exclude the **Fu** hexagram on days of use.
The *Yijing* says:
*"Initial Nine: The hidden Dragon—do not use it."*
Why?
Because the **elixir medicine** has not yet undergone transformation.

Thus, the **talismanic fire** truly applied is only in the ninth month.
Is this not the **Nine Cauldrons**?

Nine years—
the **nine-nine** number—
takes the **Sun’s** and **Moon’s** movements,
its **true qi** reaching **eighty-one zhang**.
This is the **elixir** itself.

If we speak of one month’s **changing lines** governing the **fire’s** internal method,
then on the first day, the morning uses **Tun**,
the evening uses **Meng**—the **Sun’s** ascent;
on the second day, the morning uses **Xu**,
the evening uses **Song**;

Fourth day: in the morning, **Xiao Xu** [小畜],
in the evening, **Li** [履];
Fifth day: in the morning, **Tai** [泰],
in the evening, **Pi** [否].
This is the **upper five-day phase** of the sixty *qi* cycles.

Sixth day: in the morning, **Tong Ren** [同人],
in the evening, **Da You** [大有];
Seventh day: in the morning, **Qian** [谦],
in the evening, **Yu** [豫];
Eighth day: in the morning, **Sui** [随],
in the evening, **Gui** [蛊]—the **ascending waxing** period;
Ninth day: in the morning, **Lin** [临],
in the evening, **Guan** [观];
Tenth day: in the morning, **Shi He** [噬嗑],
in the evening, **Bei** [贲].
This is the **middle five-day phase** of the sixty *qi* cycles.

Eleventh day: in the morning, **Bo** [剥],
in the evening, **Fu** [复];
Twelfth day: in the morning, **Wu Mang** [无妄],
in the evening, **Da Xu** [大畜];
Thirteenth day: in the morning, **Yi** [颐],
in the evening, **Da Guo** [大过];
Fourteenth day: in the morning, **Cheng** [成],
in the evening, **Chang** [常#3].
Fifteenth day: in the morning, **Guang** [逛],
in the evening, **Da Zhuang** [大壮].
This is the **lower five-day phase** of the sixty *qi* cycles.

Sixteenth day: in the morning, **Jin** [晋],
in the evening, **Ming Yi** [明夷]—the **Sun’s descent**;
Seventeenth day: in the morning, **Jia Ren** [家人],
in the evening, **Kui** [睽];
Eighteenth day: in the morning, **Sai** [赛],
in the evening, **Jie** [解];
Nineteenth day: in the morning, **Sun** [损],
in the evening, **Yi** [益];
Twentieth day: in the morning, **Fu** [夫],
in the evening, **Shen** [娠].
This is the **upper five-day phase** of the sixty *qi* cycles.

Twenty-first day: in the morning, **Cui** [萃],
in the evening, **Sheng** [升];
Twenty-second day: in the morning, **Kun** [困],
in the evening, **Jing** [井];
Twenty-third day: in the morning, **Ge** [革],
in the evening, **Ding** [鼎]—the **descending waxing** period;
Twenty-fourth day: in the morning, **Zhen** [震],
in the evening, **Gen** [艮];
Twenty-fifth day: in the morning, **Jian** [渐],
in the evening, **Gui Mei** [归妹].
This is the **middle five-day phase** of the sixty *qi* cycles.

Twenty-sixth day: in the morning, **Feng** [丰],
in the evening, **Lv** [旅];
Twenty-seventh day: in the morning, **Sun** [巽],
in the evening, **Dui** [兑];
Twenty-eighth day: in the morning, **Huan** [涣],
in the evening, **Jie** [节];
Twenty-ninth day: in the morning, **Zhong Fu** [中孚],
in the evening, **Xiao Guo** [小过];
Thirtieth day: in the morning, **Ji Ji** [既济],
in the evening, **Wei Ji** [未济].
This is the **lower five-day phase** of the sixty *qi* cycles.

「The human body embodies the combined **symbols** of Heaven and Earth. From the **Zhāng Guān** [绛官] above to the **Dān Yuán** [丹元] below, on either side of the spinal column, there are fifteen **facial orifices** [穴] at seven *fen* [分] intervals. These are the pathways where the **Five Zang** [五脏] and **Six Fu** [六腑], the **Eight Vessels** [八脉] and **Three Elements** [三元], the myriad **divine spirits** [神], and the **Original Qi** [元气] converge, serving as the **Dao/Way** of ascent and descent.

From the **Zhāng Guān** [绛宫], moving leftward to the fifteen **facial orifices**, this is where the **Qi** ascends and surges. From the **Zhāng Guān** [绛宫], moving rightward to the fifteen **facial orifices**, this is where the **Qi** of the month descends.

The **Qi** and **divine spirits** [神] divide into left and right, ascending and descending with the sun and moon. The **Yang** days ascend from the left, reaching the sixteenth day to descend from the right, thus completing the month. The **Yin** days ascend from the right, reaching the sixteenth day to descend from the left, thus filling the month.

This is what is meant by **"Thirty spokes converge at one hub, yet the void gives rise to the chariot"**—its purpose lies in the interplay of absence and presence.

At the **Winter Solstice** [冬至], when it meets **Jiǎ Zǐ** [甲子], the **Lesser Yang** [少阳] **Qi** begins its function. At the time of **Zǐ** [子], the **Lesser Yang** corresponds to **Kǎn** [坎], its **divine spirit** [神] is the **Potent Dragon** [潜龙], and its **Qi** is the **Heavenly True** [天真] **Qi** of the **Nine Sovereigns** [九皇], the **True Gold** [金真] **Qi**. The **Wood** **Qi** moves through the **Heavenly Mist** [天雾], intersecting with the **Gold Cycle** [金运] at **25 degrees** [度]. It reaches the **Liver’s Orchid Terrace** [肝之兰台], transmitting this **Qi** to the **right Kidney** [右肾], corresponding to the first *kè* [刻] of **Zǐ** [子]. Its transmission spans **32 kè**, reaching the time of **Mǎo** [卯] for **Bathing and Refining** [沐浴运炼]. In five days—one *candidate* [候]—the **Qi** is fully refined after **15 days** [十有五日]. Here, **lead** [铅] generates a portion, manifesting as **dew-like essence** [露蕊], born in the **Dan Tian** [丹田].

It can be taken and refined, with **15 days** [十有五日] constituting one **elixir furnace** [鼎]. The first **15 days** [十有五日] are for **Yang Advancing Fire** [阳进火].

When refining the **Qi** of **Lesser Yang** [少阳], the **upper five days** [上之五日], **middle five days** [中之五日], and **lower five days** [下之五日] each form one *candidate* [候], totaling **60 hours** [时]. The first **2.5 days** [二日半] of the **upper candidate** [上之一候] are **30 hours**, using **fire of 1 liǎng 22 qián** [火一两二十有二铢]; the remaining **2.5 days** add **fire of 1 liǎng** [一两]. The first **2.5 days** of the **middle candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng** [二两], and the remaining **2.5 days** add **fire of 2 liǎng 22 qián** [二两二十有二铢]. The first **2.5 days** of the **lower candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng 22 qián**, and the remaining **2.5 days** add **fire of 3 liǎng** [三两]. Thus, the **Qi** is fully refined.

**15 days** [十五日], **180 hours** [一百八十时]. After the **Winter Solstice**, from the **16th day** [十有六日] until the end of the month, the **Greater Yang** [阳明] corresponds to **Gèn** [艮], its **divine spirit** is the **Manifest Dragon** [见龙], and its **Qi** is again the **Heavenly True** [天真] **Qi** of the **Nine Sovereigns** [九皇], the **True Gold** [金真] **Qi**. The **Wood** **Qi** moves through the **Heavenly Mist** [天雾], intersecting with the **Gold Cycle** [金运] at **25 degrees** [度], while the **human Qi** [人气] also moves **25 degrees**. It transmits this **Qi** to the **right Kidney** [右肾], corresponding to the first *kè* of **Chǒu** [丑]. Over **32 kè**, the **Liver’s Orchid Terrace** [肝之兰台] begins its cycle at **Chén** [辰], completing **three to nine rounds** [遍], arising from the **Opening Origin Palace** [开元之府] to the **left flank of the waist** [腰左胁]. Refining this **Qi** for **15 days**, **lead** [铅] again generates a portion, manifesting as **lotus-like essence** [含莲], nurtured daily by **fire**. Thus, the latter **15 days** are for **Yin Retreating Fire** [阴退火].

Refining the **Qi** of **Greater Yang** [阳明]:
The **upper five days** [上之五日], **middle five days**, and **lower five days**, each form one *candidate* [候], totaling **60 hours**. The first **2.5 days** of the **upper candidate** are **30 hours**, using **fire of 3 liǎng** [三两]; the remaining **2.5 days** reduce **fire to 2 liǎng 22 qián** [二两二十有二铢]. The first **2.5 days** of the **middle candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng 22 qián**, reducing it to **2 liǎng** [二两] in the remaining **2.5 days**. The first **2.5 days** of the **lower candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng**, reducing it to **1 liǎng 22 qián** [一两二十有二铢] in the remaining **2.5 days**.

The first **15 days** are called **Hard Fire** [刚火], whose effects allow one to **see the five colors at night** [夜视五色]. The latter **15 days** are called **Soft Fire** [柔符], whose effects make the **sun radiate divine light** [日射神光].

Then the **elixir furnace** is changed again, with **fire** adjusted from **three days after the Winter Solstice** [冬至三日] to **forty-five days** [四旬有五日]. The **Major Yang** [太阳] corresponds to **Líng** [零], its **divine spirit** is the **Soaring Dragon** [亢龙], and its **Qi** is again the **Heavenly True** [天真] **Qi** of the **Nine Sovereigns** [九皇], the **True Gold** [金真] **Qi**. The **Major Yang** **Qi** moves through the **Heavenly Rain** [天霖], intersecting with the **Gold Cycle** [金运] at **25 degrees** [度], corresponding to the first *kè* of **Yín** [寅]. Its transmission spans **32 kè**, reaching the **Liver’s Orchid Terrace** [肝之兰台] and transmitting this **Qi** to the **left Kidney** [差肾]. Here, **lead** [铅] again generates a portion, manifesting as **embracing an egg-like essence** [抱卵], marking the **changing of the elixir furnace** [换鼎].

The first **15 days** are for **Yang**, advancing **fire** to refine the **Qi** of **Major Yang**. The **upper five days**, **middle five days**, and **lower five days** each form one *candidate*, totaling **60 hours**. The first **2.5 days** of the **upper candidate** are **30 hours**, using **fire of 1 liǎng 22 qián**; the remaining **2.5 days** add **fire of 2 liǎng**. The first **2.5 days** of the **middle candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng**, adding **fire of 2 liǎng 22 qián** in the remaining **2.5 days**. The first **2.5 days** of the **lower candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng 22 qián**, adding **fire of 3 liǎng** in the remaining **2.5 days**. Thus, the **three Qi cycles** refine over **45 days**, constituting **one and a half elixir furnaces** [一鼎半], completing one **section** [节].

Refining reaches this stage, and the **three Yin** [三阴] are exhausted. The **Major Yang** **Qi** enters the **Hùe** [户], gathering at the **ancestral temple** [宗庙], where the remaining **Qi** disperses as **cinnabar** [丹砂]. The latter **15 days** are for **Yin Retreating Fire**, beginning with the **Established Spring Hexagram** [立春卦] at **Gèn** [艮].

The **upper five days**, **middle five days**, and **lower five days** each form one *candidate*, totaling **60 hours**. The first **2.5 days** of the **upper candidate** are **30 hours**, using **fire of 3 liǎng**; the remaining **2.5 days** reduce **fire to 2 liǎng 22 qián**. The first **2.5 days** of the **middle candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng 22 qián**, reducing it to **2 liǎng** in the remaining **2.5 days**. The first **2.5 days** of the **lower candidate** use **fire of 2 liǎng**, reducing it to **1 liǎng 22 qián** in the remaining **2.5 days**.」

The **lower candidate**’s first **2.5 days** use **fire of 2 liǎng**, and the remaining **2.5 days** reduce it to **1 liǎng 22 qián**. Thus, **60 days** complete the **second furnace’s** fire regimen. From this point onward, all fire usage follows this pattern.

Nurturing proceeds until the **Summer Solstice**, when fire is increased while the furnace remains unchanged. Hence, from **Winter Solstice**, fire advances progressively until the **sixth month**, forming the **Yang embryo**—a single **qi** undispersed, congealing at the **Dan Tian**, its hue **red**, known as **Red Lead**, the **Yang Mercury**.

At the **Summer Solstice**, fire is again ignited as at **Winter Solstice**. **Five days** form a *candidate*, **15 days** a *phase*, **one month** a *furnace*, and **45 days** a *node*—all following this principle. Thus, from the **Summer Solstice**, at the **midday hour**, one moment into **Lesser Yin**, the process begins, corresponding to **Lǐ** [离], its spirit the **Hidden Dragon**, its **qi** the **Nine Sovereigns of Heavenly Purity**—the **Three True Qi of Wood**.

Gold circulates through the **Soul Symbol**, intersecting with **Fire** at **25 degrees** of its course. The **Liver’s Chancellery** transmits **qi** to the **Heart’s Palace of Lǐ**, where **mercury** generates **one part**, resembling **dew medicine**, forming in the **Vermilion Palace**. When refined, blood transforms into **white milk**, the skin radiates luster, and further refinement proceeds as before—following the **Winter Solstice’s** fire regimen.

By **Winter Solstice**, fire increases to **five furnaces**, yet water does not—**Yin qi** remains undispersed, congealing in the **Vermilion Palace**. Thus, from **Summer Solstice**, fire advances until the **sixth month**, completing **Yin’s repose**, its hue **black**, known as **Black Lead**, the **Yin Mercury**.

One **red** is **Yang qi**; one **black** is **Yin qi**. When **red and black** coalesce externally, they are called **Red Lead** and **Black Lead**—the foundation of the **Great Elixir**. Cultivating this for a **year** ensures **life and essence** are mastered.

The **3×5=15 Dao**—when the body unites yet **qi** does not—**Celestial Dragon** and **Earth Horse**, **Heaven’s Inquiry** and **Earth’s Mother**. Heaven is the **solar essence**; Earth is the **lunar essence**. When **Yin and Yang** unite in harmony, they reclaim their roots—this is the **Return to Origin, Reversion to the Embryo, and Embryonic Breathing**.

Laozi said: *"The spirit of the valley does not die—this is called the Mysterious Female."* Why? For **one exhalation**, **qi** rises from **three cun**, governing the **left kidney**—this is the **Three Yang**, corresponding to the **Sun**. **One inhalation**, **qi** descends into **three cun**, governing the **right kidney**—this is the **Three Yin**, corresponding to the **Moon**. **Six breaths**—day and night, following the **Sun and Moon’s** movements—comprise **13,500 breaths**, **54,000 movements**, and **810 zhang** of **qi** and blood circulation. Thus, **blood and qi** flow like pearls day and night throughout the body.

**Nourishing Vessel** circulates **Yang** on the left, its **morning course** spanning **25 degrees**; **Defensive Vessel** circulates **Yin** on the right, its **morning course** also **25 degrees**. **Blood** is **Nourishing**; **qi** is **Defensive**. Each **inhalation and exhalation** moves **qi** and blood through **six cun**. In **270 breaths**, they traverse **16.2 zhang**—one full cycle of the body. Thus, **life and essence** depend solely on **breathing**.

**Qi’s** outward flow is the **Sun Soul**; its inward flow is the **Moon Specter**. The **Classic** says: *"Exhale with the Sun, inhale with the Moon—preserve the true breaths. The Sun Soul and Moon Specter are the two true **qi**; the enlightened become true immortals. Refining and ingesting for a thousand days, the body—lacking **Yin**—how could it die?"*

This is the **Jade Capital’s** domain, where **Sun and Moon** divide day and night—the **breath of Heaven and Earth**. **Breathing** is the **breath of humanity**. The **Sun** is **Yang**; the **Moon** is **Yin**. Their interplay generates **life and death**. If **Yin and Yang** do not unite, **Sun and Moon** do not align, and the **four seasons** lack measure, how could there be **life and death**?

What is **steady breathing**? When **breathing aligns with circulation**, the **Primordial Fire** internally consumes the **Four Great Elements**. In **1,000 days**, it may cease—awaiting the **five viscera’s** non-communication, the **six bowels’** non-transmission, the **hundred vessels’** stillness, the **hundred passes’** self-resonance, **spirit and qi’s** self-mastery, and **ten thousand transformations’** self-regulation. This is **Embryonic Breathing’s return to the Origin**.

I possess the **Great Elixir’s Divine Embryo’s Golden Furnace**, its **three-tiered crucible**. The **upper tier** is the **Yellow Elixir Court**; beneath it is **water**; beneath **water** is **earth**; beneath **earth** is **wood**. To its left is **Fixed Salvation**; to its right, **Peng Hu**. Externally, it is marked: *"Scene of Death, Sudden Opening, Rest, Birth, Injury, and Blockage"*—thus safeguarding the **furnace**.

The **Great Medicine**, **one jin**, corresponds to **384 hexagrams**; within, only **15 liǎng** are used, totaling **360 hexagrams**. The remaining **one liǎng** governs **four hexagrams and 24 lines**—the **pivotal use of Qián, Kūn, Kǎn, and Lǐ**—this is the **Heavenly Purity’s Fire Transformation**.

A **hexagram of six lines** represents the **six qi**, **one part**; a **single line** is **one qián**. The **Tài hexagram’s** upper three lines correspond to **one exhalation**, rising **three cun**—the **Three Yang**; its lower three lines correspond to **one inhalation**, descending **three cun**—the **Three Yin**.

What is the **internal use of hexagrams**? **Sixteen breaths** equal **64 movements**, totaling **96 cun**. In **four cycles**, **16 breaths** become **64 breaths**; **96 cun** become **384 cun**. Thus, the *Yì* is **cun**, **qián**, **liǎng**, and **days**—all **384**.

The **six Yang lines**—each **36 strategies**—total **216 strategies** for **Qián**; the **six Yin lines**—each **24 strategies**—total **144 strategies** for **Kūn**.

The **384 lines**—half Yang, half Yin—**combine into 11,520 strategies**.

At the **Winter Solstice**, **one Yang arises**: at the **first moment of the Child hour**, the **Lesser Yang qi** begins, traversing **36 degrees**, aligning with the **Jia-Yi qi**, moving through the **Earthly Gate**. Each degree advances **six moments**, totaling **216 moments** of motion. Then, **Lesser Yang** and **Greater Yang** proceed as before, covering **66 degrees**, completing **180 degrees**—this is the **Qiányuán (Primordial Heaven) Water Star’s** minor response to the **Great Vehicle’s Way**, accounting for **648 moments**.

At the **Summer Solstice**, **one Yin arises**: at the **first moment of the Wu hour**, the **Lesser Yin qi** begins, traversing **36 degrees**, aligning with the **Geng-Xin qi**, moving through the **Celestial Gate**. Each degree advances **four moments**, totaling **144 moments** of motion. Then, **Lesser Yin** and **Greater Yin** proceed as before, covering **36 degrees**, completing **180 degrees**—this is the **Kūnyuán (Primordial Earth) Fire Star’s** minor response to the **Great Vehicle’s Way**, accounting for **432 moments**. Together, **Yin and Yang** traverse **1,152 moments**.

This is the **number of the Sun and Moon’s celestial revolution**, governing the motion of all things.
