**太清养生上篇**
**太清养生下篇**
*Dàochu* (道枢, *Dao* Pivot) Volume Twenty-Six

The ultimate seeker, **Zeng Kuo** (曾慥), compiled the *Rìyuè Xuánshū* (日月玄枢, *Mystic Pivot of Sun and Moon*), stating:

*"Heaven and Earth as the Cauldron;
Yin still, Yang in motion;
Following **Bo Yang** (伯阳), to illuminate lead and mercury."*

**Master Liu Zi** (刘子唐), a contemporary of Emperor Xuanzong (明皇时人), **Liu Zhigū** (刘知古), who served as Magistrate of **Changming County, Mianzhou** (绵州昌明县令), said:

*"The most concealed aspect of the Dao is the **Returning Elixir** (还丹);
The most verifiable aspect of the Returning Elixir is **Dragon-Tiger** (龙虎).
The origin of Dragon-Tiger is none other than the *Cāntóng Qì* (参同契).
**Bàopǔzi** (抱朴子) said:
*Wei Boyang* (魏伯阳) composed the *Cāntóng Qì* and *Wǔ Xiānglèi* (五相类), totaling two treatises, employing the *Yì* (大易, *Great Change*) hexagrams to expound the principles of elixir cultivation.*

**Master Xuánguāng** (玄光先生) said:
*The official Xu (徐从事) modeled the *Dragon-Tiger Celestial Diagram* (龙虎天文) and composed the *Cāntóng Qì* upper chapter, transmitting it to **Wei Jun** (魏君);
**Wei Jun** composed the middle chapter, transmitting it to **Chunyu Shutong** (淳于叔通);
**Chunyu Shutong** composed the lower chapter, thus manifesting the **Three Talents** (三才) Dao.

The *Cāntóng Qì* refers to **harmonizing the Three Talents** (参考三才), taking their **correspondences** (符契) as its essence.
I shall outline its key principles.

Its core states: *"The foundation lies in **Heaven and Earth** (乾坤为..."*

The tripod is established, and thus the **Dao of Heaven and Earth** is complete;
The **Kàn-Lí** (坎离) form the elixir, and the **southern and northern positions** are divided;
The **Dragon-Tiger** are their names, and the **western boundaries** are set.

When discussing **fire control** and determining **birth and transformation**, all follow the **hexagram cycles** as measured by the **lunar phases and musical pitches**.

Thus, when the **Huángzhōng (黄钟)** qi arrives, **yang** is born at **Fù (复)**, progressing through **Pǐ (否)** and **Tài (泰)**—when it reaches **Wèi (巳)**, the count of **yang** lines concludes.
When the **Gēngbīn (羹宾)** qi arrives, **yin** is born at **Shēn (娠)**, progressing through **Dùn (遁)** and **Bō (剥)**—when it reaches **Hài (亥)**, the count of **yin** lines concludes.
Thus, **termination and renewal**—this is the principle of the **Six Extremes (六合)**, **Three Talents (三才)**, **Four Seasons (四时)**, and **Five Phases (五行)**. The **tripod and elixir** are one in essence.

Some say:
The **liver’s green** is the father—**once-fired verdigris (曾青)** is this;
The **lung’s white** is the mother—**lead and silver (铅银)** are this;
The **kidney’s black** is the child—**black magnetite (玄磁)** is this;
The **spleen’s yellow** is the ancestor—**male and female (雄雌)** are this.
When **returned cinnabar** turns white and red into **purple-red**, it is the **once-fired male (曾雄)** qi staining it.

Those who do not know of **returned cinnabar**—the transformations of **yin-yang qi** follow **Heaven and Earth’s** birth and transformation, uniting the **metals and water’s** natural essence.
Does not the *Classic* say:
*"Uproot and discard the five stones of Wǔdū (武都), where is the alchemy of metals and stones?"*
My discussion of **elixir** is of the **Dragon-Tiger**—**flowing pearls** are the **Green Dragon**.
The **Green Dragon** is the **sun**; **yellow sprouts** are the **White Tiger**.
The **White Tiger** is the **moon**.
Thus, the **refined essences of sun and moon** contain principles of transformation—those who ingest them may also transform.
What is meant by **transformation**?
**Cinnabar (丹砂)** transforms into **mercury (水银)**, returning from **yang to yin**;
**Mercury** reverts to **cinnabar**, returning from **yin to yang**.
Thus, the **flowing pearl** is the **Great Green Elixir**.
**Black lead (黑铅)** transforms into **yellow elixir (黄丹)**, returning from **yin to yang**;
**Yellow elixir** reverts to **black lead**, returning from **yang to yin**.
These two substances—if called **yin**, they suddenly become **yang**;
If called **yang**, they suddenly become **yin**.

「They become husband and wife to each other, then interchange as parents—
this is the spontaneous interplay of **yin** and **yang** that even sages cannot fully fathom.

The **Wei** Lady said:
*"The **ling** of **Lingya** (灵芽), when the **Dragon** descends from the **Fangquan** (方泉),
the **Jingyun** (景云) and **Xiaojiang** (霄降) follow in kind;
when the **Tiger** roars into the **void (虚无)**,
the **Chongfeng** (冲风) shakes the four quarters in response.
The **yang mirror (阳燧)** reflects brilliance, yet **crimson flames (朱火)** smolder within;
when **Fangzhu** (方诸) encounters **yin**, the **dark currents (玄流)** overflow—
all these are the natural workings of their own kind.

In the ancient times, there was **mercury (水银)** yet it could not alone form the **Great Elixir (大丹)**—why?
Because there was **Dragon** without **Tiger**.

If one does not grasp this,
what need is there for the **Four Symbols (四象)** or **Five Phases (五行)**,
what use are the **yin-yang male-female (阴阳男女)** correspondences?
This is the **Way (道)** that moves without reliance on external substances,
nor upon human intervention—it simply follows the **Great Dao (大道)** and transforms of its own accord.

As for the **Eight Precious Stones (纪纲八石)**,
they originate from these two substances;
the **unity of Dragon and Tiger (龙虎一体)** opens into the **Three Refined Paths (三条)**.

Yet those who attempt this often fail—why?
Because they do not comprehend the **principle of Three and Five as One (三五一者)**.

Zhuangzi said:
*"To know the One (一), all matters are complete—
is this not what he meant?*

As for **Returning to the Cinnabar (还丹)**,
how does it transcend the world?
It feeds upon the **refined essences of sun and moon (日月之精华)**.

What are the **sun and moon (日月)**?
The **Heaven-born Dark Lady (玄女)** and the **Earth-born Yellow Male (黄男)**, are they not?

The **Dragon** and **Tiger (龙虎)** are **gold (金)** and **mercury (汞)**.
When **gold** and **mercury (汞)** mutually envelop each other,
they attain the **nature of spontaneity (自然之性)**—
is this not their **divine essence (神)**?

The *Huangting Jing* (《黄庭经》) states:
*"The **refined essences of sun and moon (日月之精)** preserve the aged and restore the decrepit—
it refers to the **Two Jingyuns (二景)** and **Two Yues (二月)**."*

Master Liu (刘子) said:
*"To bow to the **Two Jingyuns’ (二景) radiance** and ingest the **Five Xias’ (五晨) mists**,
many followers there are, yet few attain transcendence and longevity—why?
The key to **longevity (长生)** lies in **nurturing and refining (保养服食)**,
drawing from both **internal and external (内外)** sources—
not by relying solely on one aspect alone,
can one then hope to succeed?"*

Some say: *"Use **black lead (铅)**,"* others say: *"Do not use **black lead (铅)**—*
which is correct?"

Master Liu (刘子) replied:
*"From the **Upper Scripture (上经)**, it is said:
*'The **True Person (真人)** is most subtle,
as if present yet absent;
like the **Great Elixir (大泉)**, sometimes deep, sometimes floating.*
From the **Middle Scripture (中经)**, it is said:
*'The **True Person (真人)** dwells in the hidden depths,
guarding the **middle rule (中规)** with sinking and rising.*
What is meant by this?"*

The **lead** is transmuted into **mercury (quicksilver)**, and the mercury is warmed before being introduced—
at first, its entry is silent, without sound.

When the fire grows fierce, the **flower** floats, standing apart and distinct—
is this not the **lead** dwelling in the depths of the **Great Elixir’s** abyss?

If one says this **lead** is not **lead**, who can truly know?

Some claim that the **crucible** contains **earth**—this is mere delusion.
The true **lead** is the **Great Lead**.

**Water** occupies the **North**, its **hexagram** belonging to **Kàn (坎)**, and **Kàn** generates the **Six Wu (六戊)**.
The **Six Wu** are **earth**.

**Fire** occupies the **South**, its **hexagram** belonging to **Lí (离)**, and **Lí** generates the **Six Ji (六己)**.
The **Six Ji** are also **earth**.

Thus, **earth** is the **qi** of **Wu and Ji**, not the **earth** of the physical world.
This is the meaning of the **Kàn-Wu month’s essence** and the **Lí-Ji day’s light**.

Hence, one **yin** and one **yang** form **water and fire**.
**Fire** takes **water** as its **husband**; **water** takes **fire** as its **wife**.
The **Way of husband and wife** is that of **Wu and Ji**.

Therefore, all things begin and end in **earth**, and none escape the **virtue/power** of **water and fire**.

**Metal** generates **water**, **water** generates **metal**—
this is the **yellow sprout** born within the **lead**.

The **secret formula** states:
*"**Lead** can subdue **mercury**, **mercury** can suppress **metal**,
**metal and mercury** take form—this is the principle of **silver’s** concealment."*

**Wood** generates **fire**, **fire** generates **wood**—
this is the **cinnabar** emerging from within the **mercury**.

How does **mercury** become **wood**?
It receives the **qi of the Great Yang (太阳)**, transforming into flowing **pearls**.

The **Great Yang** is the **sun**, rising in the **束 (shù) direction**.
The **束 direction** is the **position of wood**.

As for **lead**, it becomes **metal**—why?
Because the **moon** is born in the **West**, and the **West** is the **position of metal**.

Thus, the **Returned Elixir** aligns with the **mysterious symbols**—
the **symbols of the sun and moon** must be at **new and full moon**,
gathering the **virtue/power and penalizing qi** in harmony with **Mao and You (卯酉)**,
entering and exiting **Heaven and Earth**, lingering between **Zǐ and Wǔ (子午)**,
taking **Heaven and Earth** as **male and female**, **yin and yang** as **parent and child**,
the **left as the Azure Dragon**, the **right as the White Tiger**.

As the **Scripture** says:
*"The sun’s essence flows as pearls, accompanied by the Azure Dragon—*
this is what is meant."

The shallow-minded of this world mix **mercury and mineral ores** in a vessel,
forging what they call **"nurturing the child."**
At first, the two substances intermingle,
but later, **lead and mercury** separate—
sometimes after a year, sometimes after three,
the **silver mother** yields to **red powder**.

Those who deeply conceal the **fire** retain four or five out of ten;
the shallow retain only two or three.

「Ingesting it only brings harm to life. They claim that **silver (yin)** is born from **lead (yang)**, that by refining **lead essence (精)** with **mercury (汞)**, it will naturally become the **Azure Dragon and White Tiger (龙虎)**—yet they fail to recognize that **yellow sprout (黄芽)** emerges from **lead (铅)**, though it is not **lead** itself. The **Scripture** states:
*"**Yellow sprout (黄芽)** is not **lead (铅)**,
yet it does not depart from within **lead** to form.
This is what is meant."*

Thus, the **Azure Dragon and White Tiger (龙虎)** must be refined with **yellow sprout (黄芽)** as their **true foundation (正)**.
Hence, the ancients said:
*"The ultimate and the beginning mutually employ one another,"*
meaning that **mercury (汞)** is cast into **lead (铅)**,
and like is united with like—
as a **father refines his son (父制子)**,
and a **son refines his grandson (子制孙)****.

The nature of **fire (火)** is to consume **metal (金)**,
while **metal (金)** subdues **wood (木)** in its three phases—
this is the completion of **elixir (还丹)**.

Some have heard the **Azure Dragon and White Tiger (龙虎)** hymns say:
*"**Yin (阴)** resides above,
**Yang (阳)** races below,
**Head and tail (首尾)** are martial,
**Central interplay (中问)** is cultural."*

Why is a cup of water often placed above the furnace?
For **elixir (还丹)** arises from **yang’s birth (阳生)**,
and is perfected when **yin reaches its peak (阴极)**.
**Yang (阳)** is concealed beneath,
**Yin (阴)** is concealed above—
when water is present,
it must await the **growth of metal (金)**,
the **time of the Water King (水王)**.

What does this mean?
From **self-complexion (自复)** to **observation (观)**,
passing through ten months,
when **lead and yellow sprout (铅黄)** are refined,
the **Dao of elixir (丹道)** nears completion—
the **child (子)** emerges from the **mother’s womb (母之胞)**,
no longer mingling within her.
**Yang (阳)** is consumed, **yin (阴)** subsides,
**metal (金)** flourishes while **water (水)** wanes—
**spirit and soul (魂魄)** find harmony,
**firmness and softness (刚柔)** unite as one—
then the **yin furnace (阴炉)** is set above,
and **flame (炎火)** is arrayed below,
so that *"water is raised to stir the fire,
and the radiance is extinguished in stillness."*

The **Scripture** says:
*"When water is abundant, it invades **Kàn (坎)** and suppresses **yang (阳)**;
when fire is weak, it departs and plunges into darkness.
**Yin and yang (阴阳)** nourish one another—
their interplay conforms to the **Dao (道)**, acting naturally.
Thus, they align with the seasons,
harmonizing with the **qi (气)**."*

The **True Person (真人)** then covers the **elixir (金丹)**,
allowing it to undergo **fire refinement (火化)**,
and to receive **yin moisture (阴津)** for nourishment—
this is indeed wondrous.

The shallow-minded of this world,
some mix **yellow sprout (黄芽)** and **ore flowers (黄花)** with **mercury (水银)**,
refining them into **purple powder (紫粉)**;
some combine **cinnabar (朱砂)**, **mercury (水银)**, **realgar (雄黄)**, **orpiment (雌黄)**, **malachite (曾青)**, **azurite (空青)**, **alum (矾石)**, and **mica (云母)**, then forge and subdue them;
some bind **various greens (诸青)**, **various alum (诸矾)**, **various verdants (诸绿)**, and **various ashes (诸灰)** with **mercury (水银)** to produce **red silver (红银)**, then further refine it into **powdered dross (粉屑)**;
some boil **medicinal herbs (药)** with **sulfur (硫黄)** to yield **jade powder (玉粉)**;
some refine **sulfur (硫黄)** with **copper leaves (染铜叶)** to make **crimson elixir (赤丹)**;
some transform **bismuth (毗霜)** into **copper (铜)**, using **iron (铁)** to condense **tin (锡)**—
these are not my methods.

Others say:
*"**Gold (金)**, **silver (银)**, **copper (铜)**, **iron (铁)**, **tin (锡)**—
these are the **five metals (五金)**;
**realgar (雄黄)**, **orpiment (雌黄)**, **bismuth (毗霜)**, **alum (矾)**, **gallstone (胆)**, **malachite (曾青)**, **azurite (空青)**, **barite (誉)**—
these are the **eight stones (八石)**."*

**Master Liú (刘子)** replies:
*"These are not what I refer to as **eight stones (八石)**.
**Zǐ and Wǔ (子午)** complete the **three (三)**,
**Wù and Jǐ (戊己)** establish the **five (五)**—
this is my naming of the **eight stones (八石)**."*

The **Scripture** says:
*"**Nine returns (九还)**, **seven transformations (七返)**, **eight cycles (八归)**, **six abidings (六居)**—
this is the **mysterious essence (玄旨)** of **elixir (还丹)**.
What does it mean?

**Metal’s (金)** birth number is **four (四)**,
yet its completion number is **nine (九)**;
**Wood’s (木)** birth number is **three (三)**,
yet its completion number is **eight (八)**;
**Fire’s (火)** birth number is **two (二)**,
yet its completion number is **seven (七)**.
These three refer to the **harmony of their original generating qi (本生之气)**.

It further says:
*"**Fire (火)** unites with **earth (土)**—
this is the **seven transformations (七返)**;
**Wood (木)** unites with **earth (土)**—
this is the **eight cycles (八归)**;
**Metal (金)** unites with **earth (土)**—
this is the **nine returns (九还)**.
**Water’s (水)** birth number is **one (一)**,
yet its completion number is **six (六)**.
**Metal (金)** generates **water (水)**,
yet **water (水)** cannot unite with **metal (金)**—
it remains fixed in itself,
thus called **six abidings (六居)**."*

It further says:
*"Does **water (水)** unite with **earth (土)**?
The **Heavenly Way (天道)** revolves to the left,
while the **sun and moon (日月)** move to the right—
when observed from below,
**metal (金)** generates **water (水)**,
and **wood (木)** generates **fire (火)**;
when observed from above,
**water (水)** generates **metal (金)**,
and **fire (火)** generates **wood (木)**.
The **Scripture** says:
*"The **child (子)** turns rightward,
the **White Tiger (虎)** revolves eastward,
**Zǐ and Wǔ (卯酉)** demarcate the boundary,
and determine the **two names (二名)**—
this is what is meant, is it not?"*

In the **"Nine True Jade Scriptures (九真玉书篇)"**:
*"Take the body as the **crucible (鼎)**,
and **qi (气)** as the **medicine (药)**;
pair with **yin and yang (阴阳)**,
and silently let them interact.
The **Pure Yang Son (纯阳子)** says:
*"Those refining **elixir (丹)** must first purify their **furnace (炉)**.
The **furnace (炉)** is the **outer wall of the crucible (鼎之外垣)**—
its body is this.

Within it lies the **medicine of longevity (长生之药)**—
**divine qi (神气)** and **essence-fluid (精液)** are these.
The **furnace (炉)** is divided into **eight gates (八门)**.

The **eight gates (八门)** are:
the **eyes (目)**, the **ears (耳)**, the **mouth (口)**, the **nose (鼻)**—
these are the **portals for sight (视)**, **hearing (听)**, **exhalation and inhalation (吐纳)**,
the **unopened keys (素钥)** of the **closed doors (辟阖之户)**.
Each is moved and regulated as appropriate—
constantly guarded and steadied,
so that **form and color (形色)**,
**taste and nourishment (滋味)**,
**eight perils (八邪)**,
and **six thieves (六贼)** do not harm the **inner True (内真)**.
Then, in the **Heavenly furnace (天地之炉)**,
within the **Crucible of Transformation (造化之鼎)**,
one adjusts and harmonizes the **medicinal substances (药物)**,
matches **yin and yang (阴阳)**,
and refines **divine qi (神气)**."*

**Heaven (天)** is **Kàn (乾)** and **Metal (金)**.
The **"Inner Landscape (内景)"** states:
*"The **Lung Palace (肺宫)**,
above is the **Flowery Canopy (华盖)**,
below covers all the **viscera (诸藏)**,
and connects through the **nose (鼻)**.
The **nose (鼻)** is the **Gate of Heaven (天门)**.
As **ascending and descending breaths (升降呼吸)** circulate,
**nourishment and defense (荣卫)** move and turn,
**the five viscera (五藏)** cycle and revolve,
**vital fluids (流注)** permeate the **body (一身)**,
with **movement and stillness (动变浮沉)****,
and **expansion and contraction (大小)**** having fixed measures—
like the **Heavenly motion of stars and constellations (天运星斗)**,
and the **Earthly rotation of rivers and seas (地转江河)**.
Thus, **Heaven (天)** is the **crucible (鼎)**.
The **Gate of Heaven (天门)** links with the **Lung (肺)**,
as **breaths (出入)** of **pure qi (清气)** serve as the **crucible’s cover (鼎之盖)**."*

**Earth (地)** is **Kūn (坤)** and **Soil (土)**.
The **"Inner Landscape (内景)"** states:
*"The **Spleen (脾)** encompasses **water and grain (水谷)**,
and connects with the **Heart (心)**.
The **Heart (心)** is the **Earthly Portal (地户)****,
the **Throat Gate (咽门)**.
It receives and stores **water and grain (水谷)**,
descending to rest within the **Stomach Courtyard (胃院)**.
Its circulating **fluids (流转之水)** internally resonate with the **blood vessels (血脉)**.
Thus, the **Spleen (脾)** receives the **ascending and descending breaths (天门升降之气)**,
moving and shaking in transformation,
grinding and refining **Creation (造化)**,
to separate the **pure and turbid (清浊)** of **water and grain (水谷)**.
The **pure (清)** ascends to the **upper burner (上焦)****,
the **Lung Palace (肺宫)**—
the realm of **serenity and purity (清静之界)**—
and becomes **divine qi (神气)** and **essence-fluid (精液)**."*

The **turbid (浊)** descends and drains into the **Great and Small Palaces (大小府)**.
Thus, the **Earth (地)** is the **reverberating qi (复气)** of the **cauldron (鼎)**,
the agent of **transformation (变化)** for all things.
The **Stomach (胃)** is the **cauldron (鼎)** of **Creation (造化)**.
The **Sun (日)** is the **celestial spirit (天魂)**,
the **fire-essence (火精)** of the **Great Yang (太阳)**.
Its station resides in **Heavenly Stem (乾)** and **Earthly Branch (艮)**,
where it reigns in summer and wanes in winter,
with nights short and days long.
It internally harbors **yin-qi (阴气)**,
while concealing the **Golden Crow (金鹦)**.
The **Golden Crow (金鹦)**—**You (酉)**—
corresponds externally to the **four directions (四方)**.
For it is the **metal and stone (金石)** that can generate its **water (水)**.
Thus, **Heavenly Stem (乾)** is **Celestial Metal (天金)**,
and **Earthly Branch (艮)** is **Water Stone (水石)**,
so **water (水)** is born within the **mountain stones (山石)**.
This is **yang within yin (阳中有阴)**.

The *Inner Vision (内景)* says:
The **upper burner (上焦)** is **Heaven (天)**,
the **Heart (心)** is the **Spirit Palace (灵府)**,
the **head (首)** is the **Earthly Branch Mountain (艮山)**,
and the **mouth (口)** is the **Cavernous Valley (洞谷)**—
the **source (源)** of **water (水)**.
**Water (水)** is **Earthly Branch (坤)** and **Earth (地)**.
The **accumulated yin-qi (积阴之气)**,
ascending to the **upper heavens (上天)**,
soaring above the **Celestial Canopy (华盖)**.
Its dispersion becomes **rain and dew (雨露)**,
soaking and nourishing the **Heart (心)**—
**yin within yang (阳中之阴)**.

**Li (离)** is **external yang (外阳)** and **internal yin (内阴)**,
like **cinnabar (丹砂)**.
Its root belongs to **fire (火)**,
yet within it hides **mercury (水银)**.
The **Great Yin (太阴)** is the **spirit (魂)** of **Xie (诧)**,
wearing the **five-colored robes (五彩之衣)**.
**Li (离)** is **radiance (丽)**.
Its **essence (精)** is the **Sun (日)**,
which bears **five colors (五彩)**.
Within it is the **Vermilion Palace (绛官)**,
communicating upward with the **eyes (目)**.
The **eyes (目)** are the **gate (门)** of the **Marrow Ball (泥丸)**.
Its **palace (宫)** holds a **divine entity (神)**—
the **master (主)** of **Heaven and Earth (天地)**—
whose **virtue/power (德)** aligns with **wuwei (无为)**.
Those who **cultivate life (修命)** must first **clarify their spirit (澄其神)**;
when the **spirit is clear (神清)** and the **Heart is rectified (心正)**,
then **evil does not arise (邪不性)**.
If the **Heart cannot contain itself (心不能自伏)**,
then **deceitful fire (奸火)** internally generates—
like **cinnabar (丹砂)** that does not perish,
and upon seeing **fire (火)** flies.

Thus, the **Heart (心)** is the **master of life (生命之主)**!

The **Moon (月)** is the **earthly soul (地魄)**,
the **water-essence (水精)** of the **Great Yin (太阴)**.
Its station belongs to **Earthly Branch (坤)** and **Perseverance (巽)**,
where it reigns in winter and wanes in summer,
with days short and nights long.
It internally conceals **yang-essence (阳精)**,
while harboring the **Jade Hare (玉兔)**.
The **Jade Hare (玉兔)**—**Mao (卯)**—
is the **wood (木)** of the **four directions (束方)**,
capable of generating its **fire (火)**.
This is **yang within yin (阴中有阳)**.

The *Inner Vision (内景)* says:
The **five viscera (五藏)** of the **lower burner (下焦)** are the **two kidneys (二肾)**.
The **two kidneys (二肾)** at the center are the **Elixir Field (丹田)**.
Before them lies the **Perseverance Sea (巽海)**—
the **human Water Palace (水府)**—
whose station is at **Yin (寅)**.
This is **yang concealed within yin (阴中含阳)**.

**Kan (坎)** is **abyss (陷)**,
the **palace (府)** that receives **water (水)**,
so the **rivers and lakes (江湖)** return to **Perseverance (巽)**.
The world does not know the **true positions (正位)** of **yin and yang (阴阳)**,
mistaking the **north (北)** for **Kan (坎)** and the **south (南)** for **Li (离)**—
this is incorrect.
**Kan (坎)** is the **south (南)**, the station of **Earthly Branch (坤)** and **Perseverance (巽)**.
The **odd yang (奇阳)** within **Kan (坎)** is the **fire (火)** of the **south (南)**, at **Si (巳)** and **Wu (午)**.
**Li (离)** is the **north (北)**, the station of **Heavenly Stem (乾)** and **Earthly Branch (艮)**.
The **paired yin (偶阴)** within **Li (离)** is the **water (水)** of the **north (北)**, at **Hai (亥)** and **Zi (子)**.

**Kan (坎)** is **internal yang (内阳)** and **external yin (外阴)**,
like **lead and tin (铅锡)**.
This is **yang produced within white silver (白银)**,
and **water of stones (砂石之水)** enveloping **red gold (赤金)**.
**Gold and silver (金银)** are both **yang within yin (阴中之阳)**.
This is the **baby (婴儿)**,
which, with the **Great Yin (太阴)** old woman of **Li (离)**,
unites as **husband and wife (夫妇)**—
emotions and affinities converging—
to congeal and form **sand (砂)**.

Thus, **Kan (坎)** is the **palace (宫)** of the **hidden dragon within the water sea (水海隐龙)**!
Its **venerable status (尊)** is like that of an **emperor (帝王)**
residing at the **northern gate (北阙)**,
yet facing the **south (南)**.

The **Moon (月)** is **Earth (地)**;
without **yang (阳)**, all things would not be born.
All things, **receiving (禀)** from **Heaven and Earth (天地)**,
grow toward the **yang (阳)**.
How much more so for **humans (人)**—
the **most refined (灵)** of all things—
should they not **conform to Heaven and Earth (顺天地)**?

To **conform to the Dao of Heaven (顺天道)**,
one must **preserve the primordial yang (元阳)** of their body,
the **True One (真一)** of **Great Harmony (太和)**,
the **pure and unadulterated qi (纯粹之气)**,
then **long life (长生)** is achieved through stillness.
Yet, it must be **cultivated day and night (昼夜修炼)**.
**Inner cultivation (内功)** is **one day (一日)**;
**Heavenly cycles (天运)** are **one year (一岁)**.
The **ascending and descending (升降)** of **yin and yang (阴阳)**,
the **circulation (运行)** of the **four seasons (四序)**,
completes **twelve cycles (十有二时)**.
By **day (昼)**, one follows the **laws of spring and summer (法春夏)**;
by **night (夜)**, one follows the **laws of autumn and winter (法秋冬)**.
The **cessation and renewal (终始)** of **day and night (昼夜)**,
the **interchange of Heaven and Earth (天地交泰)**.

The **times of Hai (亥), Zi (子), Chou (丑)** correspond to **Heaven’s winter (天之冬)**.
**Yin-qi (阴)** ascends to the **Heavenly Heart (天心)**,
**yang-qi (阳)** descends to the **Water Palace (水府)**,
**nourishing warmth (温养)** in the **kidneys (肾)**,
**transmutation (变炼)** in the **bones (骨)**—
also like **mountain stones (山石)** receiving the **ascending and descending breaths (升降之气)** of **Heaven and Earth (天地)**,
transforming into **gold and silver, cinnabar, and copper-iron (金银、丹砂、铜铁)**.

The **times of Yin (寅), Mao (卯), Chen (辰)** correspond to **Heaven’s spring (天之春)**.
**Yin-qi (阴)** descends to the **Celestial Canopy (华盖)**,
**yang-qi (阳)** ascends above the **cauldron (鼎)**,
**nourishing warmth (温养)** in the **Liver (肝)**,
**generating (生成)** in the **sinews and vessels (筋脉)**—
also like **Heaven and Earth’s grasses and trees (天地草木)** receiving the **harmonious yang-qi (阳和之气)**,
to produce **blossoms, leaves, and sprouts (华叶苗蔓)**.

The **times of Si (巳), Wu (午), Wei (未)** correspond to **Heaven’s summer (天之夏)**.
**Yin-qi (阴)** descends to the **Water Palace (水府)**,
**yang-qi (阳)** reaches its peak in the **Fire Palace (火宫)**,
**nourishing warmth (温养)** in the **Heart (心)**,
**transmutation (变成)** in the **blood vessels (血脉)**—
the **true yang (真阳)** refining into **white milk (白乳)**.

The **times of Shen (申), You (酉), Xu (戌)** correspond to **Heaven’s autumn (天之秋)**.
**Yang-qi (阳)** reaches its peak and descends to **Earth (地)**,
**yin-qi (阴)** returns and ascends to **Heaven (天)**,
**nourishing warmth (温养)** in the **Lungs (肺)**,
**transformation (变换)** in the **skin (皮肤)**.

Thus, **day and night (昼夜)** respond to the **four seasons (四时)**,
and **yin and yang (阴阳)** guard the **unity of the body (一体)**.
This is the **way to attain sainthood (入圣之道)**.

The *Inner Vision (内景)* says:
The **body (身)** is a **state (国)**,
the **face (面)** is a **city (城)**,
the **ears (耳), eyes (目), mouth (口), and nose (鼻)** are **gates (门)**,
the **hands and feet, four limbs (手足、四肢)** are the **four-directional generals (四方之将)**,
to **defend against unforeseen threats (防国之不虞)**.

The **sovereign (君)** of the **state (国)** is the **Heart (心)**;
the **ministers (臣)** are the **qi (气)** and the **kidneys (肾)**.
Thus, the **Heart (心)** is the **master of qi (气主)**,
and **qi (气)** is the **spirit of the Heart (心神)**.
When **clarified and tranquil (澄静)**, it becomes **harmonious and peaceful (和宁)**—
like the **symbol of great peace (太平之象)**.
When **spirit-qi (神气)** is **harmoniously unified (和合)**,
then **longevity and lasting vision (长生久视)** are achieved.

The **sovereign (君)** is the **pure primordial yang (纯元真一)** of the **Vermilion Palace (绛官)**;
the **minister (臣)** is the **Great Yin (太阴)** and **profound darkness (玄冥)** of the **Kan Palace (坎宫)**.
**Heaven (天)** descends **true qi (真气)**,
transforming and giving birth to all things—
like the **minister (臣)** receiving **favor (恩)**.
**Earth (地)** ascends **yin-qi (阴气)**,
congealing into **rain and dew (雨露)**,
to **nourish and benefit all things (滋润万物)**—
like the **minister (臣)** benefiting the **people (利民)**.

The **Heart (心)** connects beneath the **tongue (舌)**,
where there is a **Jade Pool (玉池)**.

Left is called **Jin Jing** (金精, "metallic essence"), right is called **Yu Ye** (玉液, "jade fluid"), both originating from the **Kan Palace** (坎宫).

When **qi** ascends above, it transforms into **rain, dew, springs, and ravines** (雨露泉涧), moistening the **Heart**—then the **Heart** becomes vital. This is how the **minister benefits the state**.

The **kidneys** are the **pure primordial yin, true unity, and great harmony palace** (纯阴真一太和之宫), their **qi** originally generated from the **Li position** (离位).

Descending **qi** below, it warms and nourishes the **Dan Tian** (丹田)—the central region between the two kidneys, called the **Dan Field** (丹田焉).

The **Sovereign’s** wisdom—governing the body is like governing a household!

The **body** is the **residence** (宅);
the **Five Viscera** are the **palaces** (宫).

**Qian Heaven** (乾天) is the **father**; **Kun Earth** (坤地) is the **mother**.
**Kan** is the **middle son**; **Li** is the **middle daughter**.
**Zhen** is the **eldest son**; **Xun** is the **eldest daughter**.
**Gen** is the **youngest son**; **Dui** is the **youngest daughter**.

The **three sons and three daughters** pair as **husband and wife**;
**Qian Father** and **Kun Mother** form the **matched pair**.

The **East Palace** is the **liver** (肝), **Wood** (木).
**Jia** is the elder brother, **Yi** the younger sister;
**Ji** is **Jia’s wife**, **Geng** is **Yi’s husband**—thus the **liver**, receiving **water**, sinks, and **Wood** carries **metal qi**.

The **West Palace** is the **lung** (肺), **Metal** (金).
**Geng** is the elder brother, **Xin** the younger sister;
**Yi** is **Geng’s wife**, **Bing** is **Xin’s husband**—thus the **lung**, receiving **water**, floats, and **Metal** carries **Wood qi**.

The **South Palace** is the **Heart** (心), **Fire** (火).
**Bing** is the elder brother, **Ding** the younger sister;
**Xin** is **Bing’s wife**, **Ren** is **Ding’s husband**—thus the **Heart** can **resist fire**.

The **North Palace** is the **kidneys** (肾), **Water** (水).
**Ren** is the elder brother, **Gui** the younger sister;
**Ding** is **Ren’s wife**, **Wu** is **Gui’s husband**—thus the **kidneys** are the **fire qi**.

The **Central Palace** is the **spleen** (脾), **Earth** (土).
**Wu** is the elder brother, **Ji** the younger sister;
**Gui** is **Wu’s wife**, **Jia** is **Ji’s husband**—thus the **spleen** can **receive grains**, and **Earth** carries **water qi**.

This is called the **"Cauldron of Creation"** (造化之鼎)!

The **true form** is the **furnace’s** central **Heaven and Earth**, **sun and moon**, **stars and constellations**, **Milky Way**, **mountains and seas**, **plants and clouds**—
the **furnace** is **my body**.

**Heaven** is **Qian** (乾), **Metal** (金).
The **flowery canopy** is then its **lungs**.
**Dark symbols, stars, and constellations**, the **celestial wheel**, **sun and moon**—these are the **upper burner’s** pathways of **honoring and protective qi** (荣卫血气) flowing through.

**Tai Qing’s** (太清) **play of pure and impure** above and below is the **middle burner’s** **diaphragm** (罗膈).
**Five peaks and mountains** are its **head and face**.
**Ravines and valleys** are its **mouth and nostrils**.
**Springs and sources** are its **saliva and fluids, food and drink**.
**Rivers and seas converging into the great ocean** are its **food gathering in the Water and Grain Storehouse** (水谷之府).
**Clouds and rain born in mountain valleys** are its **breathing qi**—
**exhaled as wind**, **inhaled as clouds**.

**Grasses and trees** are its **hair and fur**.
**Heaven and Earth’s longevity** comes from **upholding the true unity of primordial qi** (正一真元之道).
Within **my furnace-cauldron of Heaven and Earth**, **yin and yang** unite without losing **primordial qi**, achieving **naturalness**—thus **longevity** is attained.

How so?
Humans receive **Heaven and Earth’s essence** at birth—within them lies the **path of Heaven and Earth’s longevity**.
If one **internally perceives Heaven and Earth**, unites **yin and yang**, and **nurtures spirit-qi**,
when **essence and fluid** (精液) are **full as sun and moon**,
how could one **not** achieve **longevity**?

Its essence lies in **refining the Five Phases** (五行).
The **Five Phases** are the **Five Viscera**.
Using the **Wu-Ji cauldron** (戊己鼎鼎) as the vessel,
**harmonizing the Four Symbols** (四象) to **transform the Five Phases**:
**Water** is **fluid** (液).
Within **fluid** is **Metal**—called **Metal Fluid** (金液).
**Metal overcomes Wood**, **Wood generates Fire**, **Fire refines Metal**—
the **Four Symbols** return in cycle, all governed by **Earth**—this is **spirit** (神).
**Spirit** finds its **Way**, ascending as **Immortal**;
**losing its Way**, it sinks as **ghost**.

The practitioner of **True Reality** (修真者) should **abandon worldly excess** (去繁华), **sever attachments** (绝嗜欲), and **exclude pungent and greasy** (屏腥膻);
**clearing the present and dispelling distractions** (清今消遥), **maintaining strict purity in diet and observances** (洁严斋戒), **ascending the platform and entering the chamber** (登坛入室), **selecting auspicious days and waiting for the right moment** (择日俟时)—
**facing the sun and turning away from the shade** (背阴向阳), **closing the eyes and sitting still** (闭目而坐),
**grasping and consolidating with a tranquil mind** (握固冥心), **opening the furnace’s door** (开辟炉门),
**to regulate and refine the Five Phases** (以运火候, 修炼其五藏焉).
Its **work** (功) must **pass through the Nine Transformations** (九转).
The **fourth month** (四月) is the **third transformation** (三转);
**one cycle** (一周) is the **ninth transformation** (九转);
**three years** (三年) and the **elixir is complete** (丹成).

Its **great central measure** (大方寸) weighs **one jin** (一斤),
**half yin and half yang** (阴阳各半).
**Externally corresponding** (外应) to the **64 Hexagrams** (六十四卦) where the **lines weigh one jin** (爻一斤),
there are **384 liang** (三百八十四铢).
The **64 Hexagrams** (六十四卦) contain **384 lines** (三百八十四爻),
the **grandest numbers of yin and yang** (阴阳之大数).

**Dao/Way’s Pivot** (道枢) Volume **26** concludes: #1**Pi** (否) and **Tai** (泰) – in the **essential compilation** (辑要), it reads *"Lin* (临) and *Fu* (夫)".* #2**Yin** (银) – in the **essential compilation**, it reads *"Qian* (铅)."* #3**Mo** (磨) – originally *"Mo* (魔),"* corrected according to the **essential compilation**. #4**Jin** (浸) – in the **essential compilation**, it reads *"Qin* (侵)."* #5**Wood** (木) – originally *"Water* (水),"* corrected according to the **essential compilation**.

Volume **27** of **Dao/Way’s Pivot**: *Great Clarity Nurturing Life* (太清养生) Upper Section (上篇), Lower Section (下篇).

「Thus, the **Master of Wanderings**, **Zeng Tao** (曾慥), compiled the *Golden Elixir of the Dragon and Tiger* (金液龙虎篇), skillfully crafting **cinnabar** (丹砂) to preserve life and safeguard one’s family; nurturing the **Incredulous Maiden** (诧女) with **Yellow Sprout** (黄芽) as her consort. The **Lord of the Golden Elixir**, **Zhang Zhongfu** (张中孚, *Encountered by Master Xiang* 遇天真子), served as an official in the **Gold Department** (金部郎) until retirement. In **Regling 7** (庆历七年), I met him in **Liyang** (历阳) and obtained the **Dragon and Tiger Method** (龙虎之诀).

He said: The **seven dozen names of the Golden Elixir** (金丹七十二名) are all achieved through the **harmony of Three and Five** (三五一). Since the Five Emperors (五帝), up to the **first year of Regling** (庆历之元) in our **Song Dynasty** (宋), those who ascended to immortality numbered **over sixty thousand** (六万余人), none of whom failed to refine **Divine Water** (神水) from the **Flower Pool** (华池). This elixir originates from the **Five Phases** (五行) and returns to **emptiness** (虚无), revealing that **Divine Water** (神水) is the **original qi** (元气) of the **Three Realms** (三才: 天地人) and the **true essence** (真精) of the Five Phases. Within the **three elixir fields** (三丹田), it circulates above and below, becoming **Returning Elixir** (还丹). Its medicine consists of **five flavors** (五味): as **Zhang Zhongfu** (张中孚) said, quoting **Excorpator Bian** (扁鹊): *"Sour, salty, pungent, sweet, and bitter—these are the **River Vehicle** (河车) and others."* Refining them with **fire alchemy** (火候) yields the **Great Elixir** (大丹). **Divine Water** (神水) is both **lead** (铅) and **mercury** (汞), yet must be refined within **lead** (铅). This is the **lead-mercury** (铅汞) essence.

The **names of the Great Medicine** (大药之名) total **twenty-four** (二十有四): **Divine Water** (神水), **Yao Ming Essence** (杳冥精), **Returning Elixir** (还丹), **True Unity** (真一), **Gold within Water** (水中金), **Black Lead** (黑铅), **River Vehicle** (河车), **Five Colors** (五彩), **Five Flavors** (五味), **Kan Male** (坎男), **True Mercury** (真汞), **White Gold** (白金), **White Tiger** (白虎), **Golden Essence** (金精), **Five Constants** (五常), **Earth Medicine** (地药), **White Earth Spirit** (白地魄), **Soul** (魂), **Moon Blossom** (月花), **Lead Yellow Blossom** (铅黄花), **Jade Flower** (玉华), **Water Tiger** (水虎), **Jade Toad** (玉蟾), and **Yellow Sprout** (黄芽). These **twenty-four qi** (二十四气) are the **hidden mysteries of the Dao’s profound gate** (隐奥之玄关).

The song says:
*Who crafts the cinnabar?*
*It rescues life and secures the family,*
*Nurtures the Incredulous Maiden,*
*And betroths her to the Yellow Sprout.*
*This is the Great Medicine.*

To obtain the **essence of Heaven and Earth** (天地之精) within the **Primordial Palace** (元官) is the **natural method of creation and transformation** (造化自然之道), known as the **harmony of Three and Five** (三五一). Why? Because the **Three** (三) represent the **symbols of the Three Realms** (三才之象: 神、气、精), while the **Flower Pool** (华池) derives from the **Five Phases** (五行). Its exterior is **red**, its interior **white**—not the **cinnabar of the mundane world** (世之朱砂). Taken from **fire**, it is thus named the **Vermilion Bird** (朱雀); emerging from **emerald-white mercury** (青白之汞), it is called the **Incredulous Maiden** (诧女). The **Yellow Old Woman** (黄婆) acts as its matchmaker, uniting with the **seventh of the Northern Celestial Stems** (北方之七). This is not the cinnabar used in the world, but the **mercury extracted from water** (内出水银为汞). The teachings of the ancient **perfected ones** (至人) speak only of **lead-mercury, Divine Water, and Flower Pool** (铅汞、神水、华池) in the **harmony of Three and Five** (三五一).

The **names of the Great Medicine** (大药之名) again total **twenty-four** (二十四): **Jade Elixir and Nectar** (玉液琼浆), **Flower Pool** (华池), **Yao Ming Essence** (杳冥精), **Vague and Indistinct** (恍惚), **Five Phases Essence** (五行精), **Kan Male** (坎男), **Li Female** (离女), **Fire Dragon** (火龙), **Water Tiger** (水虎), **Wood Essence** (木精), **Azure Dragon** (青龙), **White Tiger** (白虎), **Fierce Three Flowers** (猛三花), **Soul** (魂), **Golden Crow** (金乌), **Jade Hare** (玉兔), **Earth Steed** (地马), **Li Palace** (离宫), **Couple** (夫妇), **Golden Elixir** (金液), **Red Dragon** (赤龙), **White Sprout** (白芽), **White Snow** (白雪), and **Moon Spirit** (月魄). These are the **true pairings of husband and wife** (夫妇匹配), where **red and white mutually support** (赤白相扶), and **yellow earth serves as the furnace** (黄土为坛), embodying the **authentic Dao** (真正之道).

Refining the **Flower Pool Elixir** (华池炼药) relies on **fire alchemy** (火候). When the smoke has fully dissipated, the flames rise like stars, and the **five-colored light** (五彩) shines with sound. Once refined, it resembles **frost and snow, pearls and jade** (霜雪、珠玉). Its root lies solely in the **Five Phases** (五行). The **base metals and minerals of the world** (世之金石顽物) cannot transmute into elixir.

The *Classic* (《经》) states:
*The Azure Emperor protects the soul,*
*The White Emperor attends the spirit,*
*The Vermilion Emperor nourishes the qi,*
*The Black Emperor governs the blood,*
*The Yellow Emperor oversees the true essence of the Five Phases.*
*This is the Great Medicine.*

Thus, the **names of the Great Elixir** (大丹之名) again total **twenty-four** (二十四): **Grand Returning** (大还), **Golden Elixir** (金丹), **Jade Elixir** (玉液), **Dragon and Tiger** (龙虎), **Two Qi** (二气), **Four Spirits** (四神), **Five Halos** (五霞), **Divine Cinnabar** (神砂), **Luminous** (光明), **Flowing Pearl** (流珠), **Soul Retrieval** (返魂), **Life Seizing** (夺命), **Spiritual Herb** (灵芸), **Life Nurturing** (养命), **Longevity** (延寿), **Crucible Spirit** (坩灵), **Ten Thousand Spirits** (万灵), **Crimson Snow** (绛雪), **Concealed Fire** (伏火), **Pure Flow** (素流), **Swift Vitality** (快活), **Longevity** (延龄), **Rejuvenation** (返童), and **Longevity Immortal** (寿仙). These are all **aligned with the human body** (按於人之身者).

Those who use **five metals and eight stones** (五金、八石) forged with fire (火锻) are mistaken. They fail to grasp that the **sublime essence of lead and mercury** (铅汞之灵) lies solely in the **vague and indistinct** (杳冥恍惚). **Mercury** (汞) resides within **cinnabar** (砂), while **gold** (金) dwells within **lead** (铅). **Mercury** (汞) dwells within **lead** (铅), and **water** (水) within **gold** (金). Without the **key method**, seeking it is difficult!

Some, failing to comprehend the **Golden Elixir**, resort to **visualization and breathwork** (存想吐纳), **swallowing mist and ingesting qi** (吞霞服气), **feasting on pine and swallowing cypress** (餐松饵柏绝食). This is not the **Dao I speak of** (大道).

The **Dao** has **three levels** (三道). The highest is **Embracing Unity** (抱一). **Embracing Unity** means **unifying the Five Phases into One** (聚五行为一). The **most refined essence of Heaven and Earth** (天地至精), **paired yin and yang** (阴阳匹配), and **harmonized husband and wife** (夫妇相乘) refine the **essence** (精) and **condense the qi** (采气). Their **gathering** (采) follows the **celestial stems** (日辰), their **collection** (取) aligns with the **hours** (有时候). They employ the **Eight Trigrams** (八卦) to **augment the fire alchemy** (增喊火候), using **water and fire** (水火) to **achieve mutual aid** (既济其用). With sufficient refinement, one attains the **rank of flying ascension** (飞仙之品).

Its middle level is **Enriching the Realm and Securing the People** (富国安民). This involves **capturing the Dragon in the deep pool** (擒龙於深潭) and **subduing the Tiger in the abyss** (伏虎於坎户), **aligning the Eight Trigrams’ medicines** (按八卦之药) within the **Nine Palaces** (九官), thus achieving **nine returns and seven transformations** (九还七返).

Its lowest level is **Strengthening the Army and Conquering the Enemy** (强兵战胜). This refers to **spiritual intercourse without physical union** (神交体不交), **locking the lower furnace** (关锁其下), and **permanently sealing the #2 Elixir Field** (永锁丹田).

Those who **grasp the harmony of Three and Five** (三五一) refine the **Five Phases’ essence and qi** (五行之精气), **directing them to the Primordial Palace** (送在於元宫) and **forging them with fire alchemy** (用火候以锻之). When the **ninefold transformation** (九转) is complete, one may **return to the origin and restore the primordial** (返本还元).」

**The Great Return Elixir**

What is the **Great Return Elixir**? It is the **refined essence and qi of the Five Grains**—when cultivated, it grants longevity.

What is **Three and Five in Unity**? The **Three** refers to the **Three Powers**—*shen* (spirit), *qi*, and *jing* (essence). The **Five** refers to the **Five Phases**. Within the Five Phases, *jing*, blood, and *qi* harmonize to produce the **Five Flavors**, from which the **essence of the Five Grains** is extracted. Is this not what the *Yinfu* speaks of when it says, *"The Five Flavors can prolong life"*?

The Five Grains can **steal from man to kill him**, yet man cannot **plunder the essence of the Five Grains**—how lamentable! **Unity in One** means **gathering the Five Phases in the Primordial Palace**, refining them with **fire alchemy** until they become the **True One**.

**The *Taibai* Return Elixir Chapter**

The **Datilang** (Datilang) is high, where **Primordial Qi** resides;
Its arrival is like the **Yellow River**, descending from Heaven.

**Qingxuzi Taibai Mountain Man Wang Yuan Zheng** (self-styled), a man of the **Xixu era of the Tang**, said:
*"The secret of elixir cultivation lies in **calming the mind within the chamber**, between the **second and fourth watches** (1–7 AM). First, **harmonize the breath**—this is called the **Law of the Ritual Bath**. With both hands, rub your palms until warm, then stroke your face upward and downward over your body. Then, **rise to Heaven and stand upon Earth**—
With both hands crossed, **stretch upward with all your strength to the crown**, lifting toward Heaven—this is **Rising to Heaven**; with both feet firmly planted, **lift your body upward**—this is **Standing on Earth**.

**Beware the eight forbidden days**: the **new moon, full moon, and the three days before and after each**—the **upper and lower trines of the lunar phases**.

In the **fourth and tenth lunar months**, the **three corpses**—*Pengju*, *Pengqiao*, and *Guozhi*—guard the **Spirit Treasury** (the Heart). Knowing this will **summon demons**.

First, **nourish the Liver**: visualize a **green dragon coiling** within it;
Then, imagine the dragon’s eyes emitting light from your own—**exhale and inhale nine times**.

Next, **nourish the Heart**: visualize a **crimson phoenix** within, its **red *qi* rising from its belly to your mouth**—**exhale three times**.

Then, **nourish the Spleen**: visualize **Gouchen**, the **black tortoise**, with **tiger ears and a single horn**, its **yellow *qi* rising to your mouth**—**use your tongue to block the throat**, then **inhale twelve times**.

After, **nourish the Lungs**: visualize a **white tiger** within, its **white *qi* rising to your mouth through the nose**—**inhale seven times**.

Finally, **nourish the Kidneys**: sit upright, stretch your soles, and **pull upward with your hands**. Then, **close the breath and pause**—visualize the **Kidney Palace**, where **two black *qi* streams emerge from your eyes**, flowing into your mouth as **golden jade fluid**, the **Hua Chi Divine Water**.

**Nourishing the Five Organs** takes **seventy-two days**—this is the **Lesser Return Elixir**, sufficient to **dispel illness**.

Then, **knocking the teeth to gather the spirit** thirty-six times, **open and close your eyes**, cover your ears with both palms, and **strike the crown with your fingers**—three times on the left, four on the right—this is **Striking the Heavenly Drum**.

Now, sit still: **cross your left hand’s three fingers with your right’s four**, clasping the **Kidney Cavity**—this is **visualizing the Cauldron’s Heaven and Earth**.

**Heaven and Earth within the Cauldron** never leave the body.
The **left eye** is the **Sun**; the **right eye**, the **Moon**; the **Datilang**, **Heaven**.

Why is the **Datilang called Heaven**? Because, like Heaven, it **cannot be ascended**.

The Sage’s method is to **return to the origin and restore the Primordial**—when **Primordial Qi ascends to the Datilang**, the **Heavenly Gate opens**, and the **flow of coming and going** moves like the **Yellow River descending from the Celestial River to the sea**.

The **hair** is the **stars**; the **ears**, the **hidden valleys**. The **brows** are the **ten thousand forms**.
The **nose** is the **Mysterious Female**; the **mouth**, the **Heavenly Granary**; the **tongue**, the **Red Dragon**—the Granary **receives all things**, the Dragon **plows the fields**.
The **throat** is the **twelve-tiered pavilion**.

The **Five Organs** are the **Five Sacred Peaks**; the **Six Palaces** are the **Six Ministries**—as seen in the *Baiwen* Chapter.

The **Three Burners** are the **Three High Offices**: the **Upper** as the **Grand Teacher**, the **Middle** as the **Grand Tutor**, the **Lower** as the **Grand Guardian**.

The **Four Waters** are the **Four Readings**—as seen in the *Baiwen* Chapter.
**Sweat** is **rain**; **breath** is **wind**.

Below the **navel** lies the **Sea of Essence**, encircled like a ring.
**Thirty-six revolutions** on each side—visualize within the ring a **Jade Maiden**, who **bowing enters and exits the right kidney**.

The **right kidney** is the **Jade Hall**; the **left kidney**, the **Gate of Life**.
The two kidneys are **two inches and five divisions apart**; their **original essence weighs one *jin***—corresponding to **Kan and Kun**. After **discharge**, from **sixteen years old**:
At **twenty-four**, it diminishes by **two *liang*** (corresponding to the *Lin* hexagram);
At **thirty-two**, by **four *liang*** (corresponding to the *Zhu* hexagram)—**walking causes breathlessness and foot weakness**;
At **forty**, by **six *liang*** (corresponding to the *Pi* hexagram)—**the waist and spine ache, the limbs weaken**, and the **navel stabs while the eyes dim**;
At **forty-eight**, by **eight *liang*** (corresponding to the *Guan* hexagram)—**the hair turns white and the skin wrinkles**;
At **fifty-six**, by **ten *liang*** (corresponding to the *Biao* hexagram)—**all actions become impossible**;
At **sixty-four**, by **twelve *liang*** (corresponding to the *Kun* hexagram)—**Primordial Qi decays**, relying only on **grain’s *qi***;
At **seventy-two**, only **two *liang* remain** (corresponding to the *Shi* hexagram)—**Earth transforms into Water**;
At **eighty**, the *qi* is exhausted (corresponding to the *Mingyi* hexagram)—**Water depletes, yielding to Fire**, and thus **death arrives**.

Therefore, those who **pursue the Dao** must first **subdue the *Jue* Maiden**.

Now imagine the **Jade Maiden** entering the right kidney, returning to her chamber, and gathering her essence.

Then visualize the **Xuanwu** (Dark Warrior) and the forms of **tortoise and serpent**, fearing harm to the Jade Maiden, compelling them to forcibly retreat. This is the method of **subduing the Jue Maiden**.

Then gather the **Three Souls**—**Daylight Brilliance**, **Luminous Spirit**, and **Gloomy Essence**—
and recite the invocation:
*"What is unknown, let me know it."*

Command them to dwell at the **Kan Gate**, on my left and right, calling them three times, imagining their spirits entering the **Sea of Essence**. Then, to the left, the **Three Palaces**; to the right, the **Seven Palaces**. Thus seated, practice the **Dragon-Tiger Circulation**, filling the mouth with *qi*, and swallow—this is the **Tiger**.

One **Dragon**, one **Tiger**, swallow twice, sending it from the throat, imagining it as a great river entering the **Sea of Essence**. Again swallow the Tiger as before.

Perform this **three times**, a total of **six swallows**, then send it into the **Sea of Essence**, imagining it as the **Three Rivers**.

Again, swallow **Dragon-Tiger three times**, nine times nine—**eighty-one times**—then swallow one **Dragon**, one **Tiger** as before.

Each **Dragon** and **Tiger** nine times—**eighteen directions**—imagining the **Nine Rivers** reaching the **Sea of Essence**.

Then perform **Dragon-Tiger forty-nine times**, totaling **fifty-six swallows**, imagining the **Great Sea** reaching the **Sea of Essence**.

Before and after, **Dragon-Tiger eighty swallows** total. Rise and sit again, performing **three passes of pulse-massaging**, then swallow **Dragon-Tiger** as before.

When the **eighty count is complete**, again massage the pulses and swallow **Dragon-Tiger** as before—**three passes total**.

The number of swallows is **two hundred forty**, corresponding to the **Twenty-Four Seasons**.

When the **spirit-essence is full**, imagine the waves of the sea surging below the navel. After **eighty-one days**, begin the **Dragon-Tiger Elixir**.

For a virgin boy who has not yet ejaculated, the **Dragon-Tiger Swallowing** method is unnecessary.

Now, seated and settled, first let the **Sea of Essence** boil and churn, then still and clear. Close the mouth, and with the **Red Dragon**, plow the saliva. When the mouth is full, divide into three swallows—this is the **Dragon**. When the *qi* fills the mouth, divide into three swallows—this is the **Tiger**.

Send it to the **Sea of Essence**, where it floats on the water’s surface. With intent, form it into a pill, pressing three times—this is the **Elixir**.

Imagine the **heart-fire** rising from the heart, descending to the water’s surface to forge it. Next, imagine the **spleen-earth**, covering the fire to reduce its intensity, then open the spleen-earth and forge again. Thus, **three times**, and when the Elixir is complete, it sinks into the water.

Then, as before, form it again, creating **Dragon-Tiger nine times**, making **nine Elixir pills**—this is the **Nine Transformations**.

The ancient verse says:
*"The Dragon follows, the Tiger follows the cavern;
The Dragon enters the water, and the Tiger follows too.
Thunder-fire burns the topknots and manes,
Clouds come, rain goes, mountains tremble."*

This is the analogy.

Like a husband and wife—
**Fire** is the **female**;
**Water** is the **child**;
**Earth** is the **matchmaker**,
and thus they are formed.

Each **pass** uses **three Dragons, three Tigers**—
**twelve fires** correspond to **twelve hours of the day**.

The **Nine Transformations** correspond to the **Nine Palaces**, totaling **one hundred eighty**.

Then, employ the method of the **River Chariot** to transport it—stirring the **Passage Locks**, raising the **Golden Bell**, and lifting the **Heavenly Balance**. Three times raise the **Valley Spirit** and **Valley Way**, urging the *qi* into the spine, and with the *qi* contracted upward, imagine the **Cinnabar** and **Essence** traveling the same path, ascending to the crown, where it is then **triple-pointed** to enter the **Marrow Palace**. Lift the head and turn left—this is the **Returning Essence to Nourish the Brain**.

Then, at the first light of dawn, sit facing east while seated westward, imagining the sun as a **wheel-chariot** and swallowing it. In total, **seventy-two gulps**, also using the **River Chariot** method to lift it into the crown before resting upon it. By the **thirteenth day**, at moonrise, sit with your back to the sun and face the moon, imagining as before. **Eighty-one gulps** are used, and the practice ceases on the **twenty-third day**.

Later, on the **eighth day of the month**, imagine the moon embracing it—this is the **Wearing the Sun and Clutching the Moon**.

The sun is **Yang**; seventy-two gulps are **Yin numbers**. The moon is **Yin**; eighty-one gulps are **Yang numbers**. This is the method of **inverted Yin and Yang**!

Then, settle upon the thought of the **Kidney’s Old Maiden**, naked in form yet desiring, and imagine the **Heart Fire** burning her. The ancient verse says:
*"Use lead, yet do not use lead—
One must act within the lead itself."*
This refers to this very practice.

The world does not grasp its principle, thus making it an **inner elixir of darkness**, thereby shortening one’s lifespan. The **Immortal** is only complete when the **inner elixir** becomes the **outer elixir**.

Thus, one can use the **Great Medicine** to transmute base substances into gold, yet some see this and do not recognize the **true lead** and **true mercury**—taking **mercury** as mercury and **black tin** as lead, desiring to transmute copper into silver. Is this not deception?

Then, with a single gulp of saliva, send it down into the liver, imagining the **Green Dragon** within the liver descending into the **Kidney Palace** to welcome the Old Maiden. When the Old Maiden sees the Green Dragon, she rides upon it—this is the **child-mother *qi***. The Green Dragon is **Wood**; the Old Maiden is **Water**. Welcoming her, it ascends into the **Crown Gate**, where the **three souls** and **multitudes of spirits** all enter.

The **Crown Gate** is the **Marrow Palace**. Then, imagine the **Heart Fire** descending, arising from each **spirit pass**, circulating through the body—both ascending and descending, like the **Liver Spirit’s** form—then **pointing** it. Initially, **twenty-one points**, imagining **Peng Ju**—a figure like a Daoist, discarding his cap and sandals to flee. Again, imagine the fire burning him, as in **twenty-four points**, imagining **Peng Qiao**—a bull-headed, human-legged figure, his form like a beast.

The **seven spirits** appear as:
- **Parrot-headed, dog-footed,**
- **Night-mara shapes,**
- **Female forms,**
- **Wind Lords,**
- **Hunting dogs,**
- **Bowmen,**
- **Fish-bearers.**

Thus, they all flee. After **one hundred days of burning the body**, the **corpse-poison** is exhausted.

Then, employ the **Fetal Breathing** method, quieting the mind and steadying the will, eliminating distractions, and maintaining singular focus. Thus, seated as before, practicing the **swallowing of sun and moon**, imagine above the **spleen** a land, where the land holds a **golden cauldron**. Within the cauldron is the **Infant Brother**, in your own form, kneeling inside it, with both hands resting on his shoulders. Facing upward with an open mouth, he then swallows the **sun’s essence, moon’s essence, golden liquid, and jade liquid**, as previously described.

On nights when there is no moon’s essence, use **golden and jade liquids** in **thirty-six gulps**. When both sun and moon are in season, use **fire at the proper time**.

Every **seven days**, the infant turns once. After **twenty-eight days**, this is the **fourth transformation**, and then **fire is applied**. The fire is beneath the cauldron, imagined to be covered by earth above, with the fire within the **earth stove**—the base of the cauldron. The sun moves through **one hundred eighty degrees**, and when the fire descends, it passes beside the **cauldron’s tortoise**.

Thus, with every **fourth transformation**, fire is applied—like nurturing fire. When ten cycles are complete, **fetal breathing** is achieved.

With **Great Fire** smelting, first remove the **jade lid**, and the **Infant** becomes the **Child of Longevity**, who, if exposed to fire, will naturally ascend to the crown and fly. This is the completion of the **Great Elixir**.

For women practicing this, imagine the infant in the cauldron, always covered with a **jade lid** to benefit the head, nurtured by fire, yet remaining **unfinished**.

Once the **Sacred Fetus** emerges, the sun wanders, but it cannot stray far. The **cauldron**—what is it? It does not depart from the **liver, heart, spleen, lungs, and kidneys**.

The cauldron is **metal**, four inches high, with a base of two inches—corresponding to the **lungs**. The **tripod** is **earth**, stacked in three layers, five inches high—corresponding to the **spleen**. The **charcoal** is **wood**, for after the body is burned, wood becomes charcoal—corresponding to the **liver**. The **fire** is the **heart**. The **kidneys** are the **chaste maiden**, giving birth to the infant—this is the **essence of vital *qi***.

Above, the **jade liquid** serves as the lid, so the cauldron’s lid wraps the **heart**. The heart can **gather all phenomena** to form the **Sacred Fetus**; without the heart, nothing can be achieved.

**Qian** is the **Heavenly Gate**; **Kun** is the **Earthly Door**; **Gen** is the **Ghost Gate**; **Xun** is the **Wind Gate**. The **kidneys** are **water**, ruling the **late winter**. This is the **chaste maiden**, the **playing tortoise** symbol. The method of **inverted Five Phases** makes the **heart** the **kidney’s husband**, their **essence-qi** merging to produce the **Sacred Fetus**.

The **spleen** is **earth**, ruling the **late seasons**. This is the **male symbol**, able to act as the **tripod**, harmonizing **Yin and Yang** to complete the **Way**, hence the saying **"Huang Po as the matchmaker."**

The **liver** is **wood**, ruling **late spring**. This is the **Chancellor Green Dragon** symbol. Wood originally generates fire, fire generates wood, and when reversed, it becomes charcoal—thus, it is called the **"Long-Life Charcoal."**

The **inner elixir** takes **three years** to complete.

Within three years, the months of **Ersuì** (二月, February) and **Bāyuè** (八月, August) are not used—only the **third and tenth months** are employed.

First, **fortify the five viscera** in **seventy-two days**; next, **supplement the essence** in **eighty-one days**. **Forming the Dragon and Tiger** takes **one hundred days**, and **swallowing the moon** takes **eighty-one days**—counted by days, this spans **ten months**. **Swallowing the moon** requires **fourteen days** of the month, and **eighty-one days** make **seven months**. **Burning the body** takes **one hundred days**, thus **three months**. Altogether, this sums to **twenty-one months**. Again, nurturing it for **ten months** completes the **Great Elixir** in three years.

Once the **Sacred Fetus** is formed, then comes the **treading method**. Imagine the infant has emerged—counting days as months, its steps double daily: from **ten steps, twenty steps**, up to **one hundred steps**, and by the **third day**, it can walk **a thousand *li*** (里).

At **one hundred days**, the infant resembles an **eight-year-old child**; by **one year**, it matches the practitioner’s own form.

Yet within **one *jì*** (纪, twelve years), if misfortune arises, there are **three responses**: **re-embryonation**, **relocating the dwelling**, and **repelling the killing ghost**.

**Re-embryonation**—why? It depends on recognizing external signs. Seeing:
- A **grand hall with high chambers**—**Dragon**.
- A **thatched hut**—**camel, mule, or horse**.
- A **felt carriage**—**tortoise or turtle**.
- A **boat or carriage**—**insects or serpents**.
- A **brocade canopy**—**wolf or tiger**.
- A **thatched pavilion**—**ox**.
- **Furs**—**elephant**.
- A **grain cart**—**sheep or goat**.
- **Jewel-like flowers**—**parrot**.
- **White hibiscus**—**goose**.
- **White lotus**—**duck**.
- A **black-lacquered pavilion**—**dog**.
- **Yellow robes**—**roe deer or stag**.
- **Brocade robes**—**pheasant**.
- **Hundred flowers in the forest**—**hundred crows**.
- A **felt pavilion**—**beasts**.
- **Baby armor**—**fish**.
- **Entering water**—**maggots**.
- **Marching in battle formation**—**bees**.
- **Many with the same name**—**ants**.
- **Jars and basins**—**snails**.
- **People walking in mountains**—**lice**.
- **Wielding swords and spears**—**crabs**.
- **Falling into a well**—**becoming female**.
- **Falling from a mountain**—**becoming male**.

**Relocating the dwelling**—why? If one first recognizes a familiar place, it is already **occupied by the dead**—an **empty dwelling**. Only if the practitioner has **not suffered from *fēnglíng*** (风玲, a wind-related ailment) and their **essence is firm and substantial** may they relocate. A **young boy** is superior, so I enter and **re-cultivate as before**.

**Repelling the killing ghost**—why? A practitioner, with the **fetus unformed** and the **embryo not yet distant**, suddenly faces a **critical moment**. How to subdue it?

If **any of the five hearts** (the **palms of both hands, soles of both feet, and the chest**) ache, the **critical moment** has arrived. Sit quietly in a secluded chamber and **visualize the *Cháozhēn*** (朝真, "Facing the True Self"). **Facing the True Self** means **darkening the mind**, sealing within its **ears, eyes, nose, tongue, hands, feet**, and all **superfluous *Rén-Gǔi*** (壬癸, residual *yin* energies) with **locks**.

Use the **teeth as a fortress**, the **heart as fire**, and **burn the body**. When ghosts appear, **do not fear**. The **heart** is the **Emperor**, storing the **Three Treasures** within the **nose and feet as the Three Platforms**, illuminating all **subjects**. The **liver’s spirit** governs **thirty-six thousand luminous essences**, its guardian on the **left**. The **lung’s spirit** governs **twelve thousand forms and shadows**, its guardian on the **right**. The **spleen’s spirit** governs **eighty-four thousand pores**, its guardian in **front**. The **kidney’s spirit** governs **fifty thousand refined *yuánqì*** (元气), its guardian on the **back**. The **crown’s spirit** and **head’s spirit** govern the **hair**, their guardian above in the **Upper Official**. The **gallbladder’s spirit** guards the **lower region**.

The **six bowels** are the **Six *Dīng*** (六丁, celestial warriors), battling the ghosts—**the ghosts retreat**.

After **three *wǔ*** (五, five-day periods), if they return, **abandon the fortress**, ascend directly to the **Celestial Bureau**, becoming either a **Celestial Immortal** or an **Earthly Immortal**. An **Immortal** must have a **sword**.

How is it forged? The **body as the furnace**, **essence-qi as iron**, **sunlight and moonlight as steel**, the **liver as charcoal**, the **lungs as bellows**, the **heart as fire**, the **spleen as clay**, the **kidneys as the mold**, the **gallbladder as the whetstone**, and **leftover iron as a dagger**. How is it forged? **Only through visualization**.

Then there is the **golden hammer**: each time **Dragon and Tiger** are swallowed, they do not reach the **kidneys** but are **both stored above the lungs**. The **lungs**, being **metal**, are **forged into completion** in one casting.

*(End of Volume 27 of *Dàoshū*)*
**#1 Mercury**: *Jíyào* reads **"water"**.
**#2 Lock**: *Jíyào* reads **"subdue"**.
**#3 Time**: *Jíyào* reads **"day"**.
