**Dao Gunzhu Scroll Twenty-Nine**
*From the Collection of Youzi Zeng Zuo*
*Upper Clarity Golden Azure Chapter*

The quintessence of the Five *Qi*, refining its *jing* essence into brilliance;
Firmness and softness aligned—wandering in Azure Mist.

The *Yinluo* Child said: *"Gold is the first of the Five Phases, the root of the Five Fates, the quintessence of the Five *Qi*—thus, its firmness and softness must be properly positioned!"*
He who can master it may wander through the Azure Mist’s immortal precincts—thus, I call it *Golden Azure*.

Someone asked: *"What is its essential method?"*
The reply was: *"Take five *liang* of Great Sun [mercury] and fifteen *liang* of Great Yin [sulfur]. Blend them harmoniously, grind them in a mortar until finely pulverized, then wrap in ashless paper. Place in a long iron crucible, pressing it firm. Cover the top with Tang-dynasty ash, compacting it solid. Seal the crucible’s mouth with salt clay, bake until dry, then bury its opening in a pit, leaving only the medicine exposed. Burn with five *jin* of charcoal until one *fu* [time period] has passed. When removed, the substance will no longer scatter—this is the *Wu Zhu* [black pearl]. Its hue is black yet azure, glossy and luminous—this is its first transformation.

This is the *Flying Dragon, Crouching Tiger*—surpassing three years;
Nurturing cranes, concealing tortoises—sometimes spanning decades.

Next, place the elixir in a bottle, cover with a flat lid, seal the edges with clay half an inch thick. Dry it in the sun to form an earthen city: nine inches high, three feet wide, three inches broad. Fill its interior with cow or horse dung nine inches deep, then place the elixir within. Cover entirely with ten *dan* of dung, ignite the fire below. When extinguished, break the bottle to retrieve it—now red-yellow, like dried fermented bean curd flakes. This is the *Yellow Sprout*, also called *Golden Dog Child* or *Great Sun Rolling Pearl*.

The *Classic* says: *"The Great Sun Rolling Pearl entering the Azure Pool is mercury."* Nurturing mercury to form Purple Gold—its name is *Purple River Chariot*—is this not so? This is its second transformation.

Place it in a *Gaoche* bottle without oil, cover with a flat lid, seal with *liuyi* clay (six parts salt, one part ash), four inches thick around the edges, ensuring no gaps. Dry it in the sun, then place on a flat surface. Burn with five *jin* of fierce charcoal for three *fu* periods. Wait for the fire to die, then break the bottle to retrieve it. Its hue is purple and glossy, its weight like gold—this is the *Purple Ling* Elixir. When ingested at seven times nine doses, it transforms the bones into gold. This is its third transformation.

Select a white-glazed bottle, following the prior method, and place it in an Eight Trigram Furnace—the eight-cornered type. Twelve inches wide, equal height, with a sword planted at each of the eight sides, a mirror hung at each sword’s tip, and a cup of water and incense at each fire point. Ignite the flames, then break the bottle to retrieve it. Its hue is green, with a metallic wind rustling. Its weight is double that of gold—this is the *Dragon-Tiger* Elixir, the completion of the *Dao*.

Why is it called *Dragon-Tiger*? *"The horse-tooth [mercury] paired with sulfur—heaven’s omen advances and retreats as divine. Plundered from the *Li* Palace and Moon Hall, thus arises the radiant mist-hued light."* This is its fourth transformation.

Encase it in a *Fire Jade* bottle—*Dingzhou* porcelain—and blow it with *shunyang* furnace breath five thousand times. Gradually increase the charcoal, ensuring it does not soil with ash. Keep the furnace’s base flame steady—if it flickers, yin *qi* will breach outward, shattering the bottle. Blow it again eight thousand times, then retrieve the elixir when the fire dies. Above, a purple cloud veils it; below, golden stars and jade pillars radiate five colors—this is the *Golden Tiger* Elixir. This is its fifth transformation.

First, take the *Dragon-Tiger* Elixir and mix with eight *liang* of *Laonü* [arsenic], grinding it ten thousand times to form *Golden Tiger*. Burn it with seventy-two *jin* of fire—this is the *Preserve-Life, Everlasting* medicine. This is its sixth transformation.

Take the *Preserve-Life* Elixir and mix with one *jin* twelve *liang* of mercury, grinding it tenfold. With the divine elixir’s power, it can ingest half the mercury. Place it in the *Tiandi* Furnace—a silver cauldron—and nurture it for ten days—this is the *Huanai* Elixir. *"The golden dragon rolls ten times, the purple phoenix soars in the furnace, the vermilion crane nests in the pine, the green tiger guards the right flank."* This is its seventh transformation.

Place the elixir in a porcelain bottle, using two *jin* of **Hanjiang** *yùshí* [硫化汞]—crushed with bitter wine and rice vinegar into a paste—to seal the bottle completely. Carve a hole in the northern wall for placement. Then reseal with *yùshí* paste, leaving it for a hundred days before removal—this is the *Yin Elixir*. Its name is the *Soul-Shedding, Spirit-Nurturing Elixir*; ingesting it means dying before rebirth. This is its eighth transformation.

Store it in the bottle, and on **Pure Brightness Day**, submerge it in a well. Consuming it after a hundred days grants immortality; after two hundred days, one becomes an **Earthly Immortal**; after five hundred days, one ascends in broad daylight; after a thousand days, one’s dwelling is lifted to the heavens. Thus, one attains the **White Emperor’s** *Yùshuāng* [玉霜], the **Purple Sovereign’s** *Hóngxuě* [红雪], while *Laonü* laughs in the furnace and the infant rejoices in the cauldron. This is its ninth transformation.

**Secret Key:**
*"My eyes like the sun, my ears like the moon,
My nose like a gate, my heart like the sea,
My will like the wind, my body like the earth.
The Five Directions, the Five Peaks—all submit to me;
All beings of the great earth are my children."*

**The Golden Tiger Lead-Mercury Chapter:**
*"Things flourish luxuriantly—this is the essence of Heaven and Earth;
They coalesce through Yang, are nourished by Yin.
The Primordial Lord says: The Golden Tiger, lead, and mercury—
They do not transcend the Five Phases.
All things coalesce through Yang, are born through Yin.
Yin is the foundation of the Dao;
Yang is the beginning of Oneness.

When Yin and Yang contend, the patterns are established.
Thus, *Kàn* [坎] one, *Lí* [离] two—returning from Yin to Yang;
Two fires, one water—returning from Yang to Yin;
Water two, fire one—former patterns, latter substance.

Yet the Five Phases’ patterns, humans embody them.
The heart is fire, hidden beneath the lungs—its number is one;
The kidneys are water, paired at the *Mìngmén* [命门]—its number is two.
Thus, fire one and water two—this is the Dao’s origin!

Those who internally cultivate *Oneness* attain the *Yin Elixir*;
Those who externally cultivate *Oneness* attain the *Yang Elixir*.
The interplay of *Huan* [还] and *Dan* [丹] does not depart the Five Phases—
Its essence lies in discerning the true nature of lead and mercury.

Thus, relying on the *Great Changes*’ symbols,
Establishing **384 *zhū*** [铢] with the **24 Seasons**,
Using the **lunar and solar nodes** in upper-lower correspondence—**28 and 86**—
Setting **16 *liang*** of medicine,
With *Kàn* and *Lí* as the elixir,
Heaven and Earth as the furnace,
*Qián* [乾], *Kūn* [坤], *Zhèn* [震], and *Xùn* [巽] as the operations.

The *White Horse* [白马] *yáshā* [芽砂] is Yin-qi;
The *Golden Sand* [金砂] is Yang-qi.
All things’ birth and death return to Earth.
Earth’s sovereign is Yellow;
Metal’s sovereign is White.
Observe the *Yīngzǐ* [鹦子]—
Internally yellow, externally white—
The two *qi* interact thus.

The Northern Black Water, *Zǐ* [子], is
The Metal’s borrowed position, the Five Phases’ origin, the Dao’s foundation.
*Jia-Yǐ* [甲乙] *zhūshā* [朱砂]—within it, sprouts naturally grow.
Sun and moon radiate—when sufficient, they reside in the sand,
Their nature white, concealed by fire—this is *Heaven-born Lead*.
It emerges from *Jǐnxi* [锦溪], *Chénzhou* [辰州].

The Southern Red, *Wǔ* [午], is
The Fire’s borrowed position.
*Zhūshā* is mercury’s parent.
The Eastern Blue Wood, *Mǎo* [卯], is
The origin of Wood’s Dao, the parent of Yin and Yang.
All things each receive one *qi*, all drawing from this.
Bearing Yin while embracing Yang—
*Jia*’s essence, the sun’s spirit, fire’s parent.

The Western White Metal, *Yǒu* [酉], is
The Water’s borrowed position, the moon’s shadow.
Turning north to west, *Mǎo-Yǒu* face each other,
Metal and Wood contend, Water and Fire circulate—
Thus forming the essence of the Great Return.

The Central Yellow Earth, *Wù-Jǐ* [戊己], is
The borrowed position of *Huápú* [华池].
Yellow restrains Water—unmoving, it dies.
Thus, Earth is the parent of the *Huan Dan*—
The parent subdues all things.
Hence, the Golden Cauldron is Earth—
Three fives and one, without deviation.

Sun and moon are the Yang’s essence—
Their number is nine, within which lies nine.
Its color is black—
This is the *Wén* [壬] *Guǐ* [癸] Water’s symbol of the North,
Named *Yang within Yin*—Yang containing Yin.
Thus, *Lí*’s *Bǐng-Dīng* [丙丁] Fire Palace attains the name *Nine*,
Coalescing *qi* into *Zhūyīng* [朱英], refining it to solid form—
This aligns with the *Three-Five-One*.

Ancient sages thus refined the sun’s essence,
Returning their bodies to pure Yang.

Mercury is of the Water family.
Its nature contains Yang—
Internally Yang, externally Yin,
Yang symbolized by Yellow, Yin by White.
Thus, externally red enclosing yellow—
Mercury is born from sand, mercury from lead—
This is *Yang within Yin*—
Yin does not stand alone, nor Yang lack its pair.

The moon is the accumulated essence of Yin, occupying the *Kàn* position,
Its number fixed at one.
Yin and Yang contain the Mysterious—
Spirit and shadow resonate.
The moon’s *Chán-Tù* [蟾兔] is Yin and Yang—
Its color white, bearing the *West’s Gēng-Xīn* [庚辛] Metal’s symbol,
Named *Yin within Yang*—Yin containing Yang.

Thus, *Kàn*’s *Wén-Guǐ* Water Palace attains *Oneness*!
Moon-metal’s Yang nature—
Externally Yin, internally Yang,
Yin symbolized by White, Yang by Yellow.
Thus, externally white enclosing yellow—
White metal is born from the *Héchē* [河车].
The river is Water, the chariot is Fire,
The red is sand—
Thus, sand is produced from metal—
This is *Yin within Yang* not standing alone.

When sand and lead enter the furnace,
Melting to extract their essence,
They are added to the elixir’s spirit—
This is called *Laonü*.
*Gōu* [勾] sand entering *Laonü* is lead;
Sand is White Metal.

**Secret Key:**
*"One is the Water foundation of the elixir—lead is within it;
Two is the Fire foundation of Wood—its talisman is within it;
Three is the Earth foundation of the Mother—gold is within it.
Thus, the *Huan Dan* cannot establish itself without controlling the talisman and fire’s timing—
How then can it stand?"*

「The five *fán* [矾] and eight *shí* [石] of this world are coarse substances, not fit for the Great Elixir’s use.

The Great Elixir does not employ gold, silver, copper, iron, lead, cinnabar, tin, *zēngkōng* [曾空], male and female sulfur, *pí* [毗], vermilion, quicksilver, furnace soot, dew, mulberry frost, or *rénzhōngbái* [人中白].

Though lead’s hidden *fire* can cure ailments, if taken in excess, it will instead shorten one’s lifespan.

Quicksilver is the essence of Water.
When it ascends in flight, it becomes *liúzhū* [流珠], known as *liúgōng* [流汞].
It is the *son following his father*—quicksilver itself.
Thus, it is said: *vermilion* is the father of lead, and *wùjǐ huángjīn* [戊己黄金] is the mother of the Elixir.

When it condenses into *White Metal*, this is the form born from the One—
the hidden Yang within Yin.

When Water and Metal *Dao* [道] merge,
lead becomes black—
Yin generates Yang within, reversing aging to youth.

What is meant by this?
When *Yin’s essence* reaches its limit, it transforms back.

Thus, quicksilver is born in the North,
but comes to dwell in the Fire position,
where their union forms the Great Elixir.

Those who do not understand use common lead,
black tin, and quicksilver as the *Héchē* [河车],
male sulfur as Earth,
and gold and silver as the One Mother—
these are not the true sources of medicine.

Common cinnabar contains lead,
copper also possesses it,
iron does too,
grasses bear it,
and minerals hold it as well.

The true lead—
how can the *child and mother* be born from the same womb by Heaven’s decree?

Within it, if silver is present,
lead is the root of the Elixir,
*Shénshuǐ* [神水] is the mother of gold,
and the child and mother naturally find their harmony.

Gold is the Elixir’s essence,
dwelling in the Yang position,
quicksilver absorbs the *separating qi*,
responding to the Yin line—
it contains Heaven and Earth’s spirit,
conceives the Sun and Moon’s essence,
where *negation* reaches its limit and *affirmation* follows—
when Yin is exhausted, Yang is born,
all in accordance with the *Dao’s* natural order.

The Sun, from the *new moon’s dawn*,
receives its talisman;
the *six qi* [六气] follow its nature to form its essence,
until the sixteenth day and the thirtieth day complete.
Its *qi* shapes its nature,
and the Moon’s shadow gives birth—
this is the symbol of its rise and fall.

Gold is the *female* [妇];
Wood is the *male* [夫].
*Zhèn* [震] is the eldest son;
*Duì* [兑] is the youngest daughter.
White is the name of returning to the One,
gold is the title of attaining its position.
Black is the nature aligned with Metal and Water,
lead is of the same class as gold.
Yellow is the likeness of Earth,
*ke* [芽] governs growth.
The child is the term for its revolving movement,
the river is the foundation of Water,
the chariot fulfills the talisman’s nurturing function.

The world does not know that *vermilion* is:
the mother of lead, the father of the Elixir,
born from Earth, yet dependent on Earth for death.
Yellow can restrain Water,
so Earth is the mother.

Thus, *vermilion* is the ancestor of lead,
the foundation of the *Huan Dan* [还丹].
Lead is born from vermilion,
quicksilver from lead—
yet none have truly awakened to this.

When *vermilion* absorbs the *Heavenly talisman’s qi* and the nurturing of the *Dao*,
and the Sun and Moon’s influence is complete,
it emerges as *Yánggōng* [阳汞]—
this is the *Yang as sovereign*, the *Yin as subject*.
The two cinnabars are one substance,
though not two separate things.

The Precious Elixir originates
not from two separate substances,
but like a clam absorbing the autumn moon’s glow,
a pearl forms within its belly—
how could anything be created without its kind?
The Great Elixir has three grades:
The highest is called *Water*;
the middle is called *Elixir*;
the lowest is called *Sand*.

Those who awaken to it
return to the One and transcend the One.

*Gold Tiger* [金虎] contains Yin,
its position in the West,
its *qi* hidden within—
it nurtures the *mysterious lead* of *Great Yin*,
becoming the utmost essence.

The utmost essence is the *Dragon and Tiger* [龙虎].
*Mǎo* [卯] and *yǒu* [酉] oppose each other,
*Zǐ* [子] and *wǔ* [午] face one another—
this is the *Heavenly and Earthly Yin-Yang* revolving like a wheel,
the grand transformation of the *Dao*.

Seventeen *xún* [旬] suffice for the Nine Refinements.
A single change of the *cauldron* [鼎] leads to Nine—
its subtlety lies here!

Even without changing, it is possible.
On the eighth day of receiving the talisman,
gold’s nature is subdued yet ascendant;
on the fifteenth day,
gold’s nature is fully extinguished;
by the thirtieth day,
the *Dao* is exhausted,
and it sinks into the *Kūn* [坤] element.

Thus, the three substances receiving the talisman all descend into Earth,
except the Yang talisman, which ascends without lowering.

Then *Qián* [乾] and *Kūn* [坤], *Zhèn* [震] and *Sūn* [巽],
coiling above and below—
the Five Phases are concealed,
Yin and Yang harmonize,
Yin and Yang interact—
this is the *Dao’s* operation,
cycling endlessly.

The secret for crafting the *golden cauldron* [金鼎] is:
*"Posterior Earth, Golden Cauldron,
Life and Death, length seven;
Divine Chamber, three luminaries,
Round the five Yin, one;
Chaos wanders, Heaven and Earth five *lǐ* [里],
Yin and Yang two heads like a parrot—
shape and form must not differ.
Yellow and White within the wrapping,
thickness and thinness must be even.
Six-One firmly united,
well-guarded at the *Wǔmén* [午门],
Parametric harmony naturally achieved.*

The One is the beginning of the Five Phases.
The Sun and Moon’s Yin shadows,
their position in the *Kǎn* [坎] center,
their medicine grows in the *Yīnhuì* [阴晦] lands.

What is *Jīngōng* [金公]?
Gold is called *Great White* [太白];
*Gōng* [公] is the highest rank among substances.
Thus, it is named: *lead*.

When gold enters the *Tàiyī* [太一] palace,
within the *fire’s Gēng* [庚] city,
the *Red Crow* [赤乌] guards the *Yellow Crow*,
the *Azure Dragon* [苍龙] relies on the *White Tiger*—
their kinds gather together—
this is what is called *Parametric harmony*!

Black lead enters the Moon,
paired as husband and wife,
Yang spirit and Yin shadow—
the two naturally harmonize.

The world does not know that the Five Metals and Eight Minerals
are the total count of Yin and Yang,
combining and moving to form the Elixir.
Thus, the Eight Minerals are the Eight *Guà* [卦];
the Five Metals are the Five Phases.

Wood that does not ash is the essence of *Jiǎ* [甲],
subdued by Metal.
Metal conceives Water in tranquility,
Water must preserve Metal;
Wood conceives Fire in restraint,
Fire must depend on Wood.

*Lead Water* is the liquid born naturally within sand,
governing Yang;
*Quicksilver Water* is the liquid extracted from sand,
governing Yin.

Fire is the *symbol* [符].

*Quicksilver Fire* is the union of Water and Fire in form,
the two substances held within the furnace as a *straight symbol* [直符] to subdue them,
so they do not scatter or flee.
When struck by killing *qi* [气], they are consumed and transformed—
thus it is called *Great Return* [大还].

The **Primordial Lord** [元君] says:
*"Cinnabar* [丹砂] and *Water Essence* [水精], when joined with Metal, become balanced,
and the slightest measure suffices—
most sacred and most spiritous indeed."

The *Too Xuan Yin Fu* [《太玄阴符》] states:
The Dao/Way [道] gives birth to Yin,
Yin gives birth to Yang,
Yang gives rise to the Five Phases [五行],
and the Five Phases combine to form the *Elixir of Great Return* [还丹],
thus it is called *Dragon and Tiger* [龙虎].

The Dragon [龙] is Yang *qi* [气];
The Tiger [虎] is Yin *qi* [气].

The positions of Metal and Wood:
Yang arises from the first *Guà* [卦], *Zhen* [震]—Wood [木];
Yin arises from the second *Guà* [卦], *Xun* [巽]—Wood [木].
This is the month of *One* [一].
The month of *One* [一月].

When the two Woods receive the *symbol* [符],
they gradually weaken.

Quicksilver’s refusal to be subdued
cannot yet yield the Great Elixir,
it must be nurtured and held for three years.
Three years is the month of *Three* [三月].

Nurturing Fire for one month
can seize one year’s vital *qi* [正气].
Its hue becomes pale yet luminous,
then it emits venom into the cold spring—
one month later, extract and distill it,
using *paper mulberry* [楮] juice and *paper mulberry* [楮] broth.
Refine it, observing strict purity for fourteen days,
binding oneself while closing the eyes,
striking the teeth thirty-six times before ingestion,
to dispel illness,
to restore youth.
Hold it for five years, consuming three *cù* [铢],
one can attain longevity;
Hold it for nine years, consuming two *cù* [铢],
one can ascend to the heavens.

The **Primordial Lord** [元君] says:
"I possess the Celestial *symbol* [天符],
to be used in crafting the Metal Furnace’s essence.
*Jiǎ* [甲] is the progenitor of Wood and Fire,
its number three, completing the number eight,
its true position born in the *束方* [束方],
lodged in *Bing Ding* [丙丁],
the teacher of all things,
the parent of Fire.

The vital *spirit* [精魄] of the Sun,
the beginning of Yang,
illuminates and shapes the world—
its name is the *Sun Spirit* [日魂].
The Sun [日],
in heaven, is the *straight symbol* [直符],
able to unleash and nourish all things;
on earth, it is the *straight matter* [直事],
able to cook and mature all things."

「The *yang* *qi* [陽氣] is divided and determined,
thus the **Celestial Jade** [青腰] is called the *yang* *jing* [木精] messenger of the two *natures* [二性]—
this is the **mutual verification and harmonization** [契證參同] of *yin* and *yang*.
The **Metal Sand** [金砂] and **Fire Essence** [火并] unite,
three and five returning to one,
and **spontaneous harmony** [同自靈] arises.

The **three** here refer to **Wood** [木],
whose *yang* *jing* [陽精] illuminates and shapes life—
its **formative power** [結立] is strong,
and thus it is **arbitrarily named** [強名] the **Metal Sand** [金砂],
the **refined essence of Heaven and Earth** [天地之精].

**Cinnabar** [丹] is the *yin* **mercury** [汞] of *yang*,
its *yang* **transforms as a subject** [反為臣], the **two** [二].
**Vermilion Sand** [朱砂] serves as its **Fire** [火].

**Lead** [鉛] is the **five** [五],
**Earth** [土] as its **mother** [母],
the *yang* **mercury** [汞] of *yin*,
its *yin* **transforms as a sovereign** [反為君], the **one** [一].

**Black Lead** [黑鉛] is the **foundation of Water** [水之基],
**three refinements of the *yin* *po* [魄]** yield **Yellow Silver** [黃銀],
explaining the **subtle *yang* within *yin* dwelling in the *Kan* position** [坎位，陰中之陽].
**nine refinements of the *yang* *hun* [魂]** yield **True Water** [真水],
explaining the **subtle *yin* within *yang* dwelling in the *Li* position** [離位陽中之陰].

Its name is **Mercury** [水銀],
where **Fire** [火] and **position** [位] intermingle,
**chaotic unity** [混沌] merges,
**restoring and returning to the singular** [克復歸一],
its **formed substance** [成形] has no external limit—
thus it is called **Yin-Fire** [陰火].
**Understanding its symbolic logic** [自會其符理],
it is akin to **human inhalation and exhalation** [人消息],
**aligning with the Dao’s natural flow** [即合天道].

The **Primordial Lord** [元君] says:
**"The highest-grade Gold Elixir** [上品金丹] subdues the mother to conquer the child,
and the child **self-destructs** [自滅].
*Yin* and *yang* advance and retreat—
its **cycle of seven and eight** [其數七八],
**receiving *qi* and separating** [受氣分離],
occurs between **fifteen days** [旬有五日] and **thirty days** [三旬].
When the **Dao is exhausted** [道穷], it **returns to its origin** [在復].
**Nourishment and cultivation reach spontaneous harmony** [養育通靈].

In the **ninth month** [九月],
when **both *yin* and *yang* mercuries** [九个月阴阳二汞] merge into one form,
one must **first harmonize with nature** [先須配合自然],
**aligning the *straight symbol* [直符] with cosmic motion** [交運],
**conforming to the *yarrow stalk* patterns** [依乎爻象].
Then the **Elixir’s essence transforms spontaneously** [丹斯靈化].

The **Primordial Lord** [元君] says:
**"When Heaven and Earth return and restore** [天地返還],
**three and one unite** [三一],
its **movement aligns with the Celestial *symbol* and *formative patterns* [天符法象].
There is also a **method** [決] for this.

The **method of alignment** [行符者],
when the **child’s month** [子之月] is observed,
the *yang* **stalk** [爻] has already moved—
**yet it still generates within the *Kan* position** [初九港龍勿用],
the **divided chaotic *yang* *qi*** [陽氣混沌分判].
After the **Winter Solstice** [冬至], a **single *yang* surges** [一陽衝],
and **at *Jiazi* [甲子] it begins** [為首].
The **upper element** [上元] commences from the **hour of *zi*** [子之時],
thus **two *yang* arise** [二陽生],
**the Dragon appears in the Field** [見龍在田].
When the **stalk moves** [爻動], its **shock and concealment** [驚垫] awaken,
**receiving *yang* to act** [受陽用事],
this is called **one *yang* born** [一陽生].
When it meets **Jia** [甲], it is the **parental principle** [父母].
Thus in the **eleventh month** [十一月], **receiving *yang* to act** [受陽用事],
it **begins from *zi*** [從子而起],
its **born *yang* dwells within the hidden *yin*** [其陽生於陰暗之中].
From **Renwei** [壬癸] to the **month of *Jianwu*** [建午],
**the *yin* born within *yang* aligns with the *yang* mandate** [陽中陰生符諭同陽令].

The **Sutra** [經] says:
**"When initiating the alignment method** [起計行符],
**the *zi* principle governs the weight and measure** [子諭斤兩].

When the **stalk moves at the initial *yin*** [爻動初陰],
its **Fire** [火] is the **Fire of *yang*** [陽火].
The *yin* **dwells within the *yang* *symbol*** [陰寄於陽符],
and its **four hundred and fifty *cù*** [四百五铢] **unite in pairs** [而兩合].

**Sun and Moon’s mysterious patterns** [日月玄象],
the **five phases’ rise and fall** [五行起伏],
**begin with the number of one *yang* born** [其始之數是為一陽生],
**mirroring Heaven and Earth’s unfolding** [象乎天地發揮],
**and penetrating all emotions** [旁通情者],
**shock and concealment emerge as portents** [驚垫萌兆] and proceed in parallel.

The **Sutra** [經] says:
**"Take only the **Spring division** [春之分],
**aligning day and night with the method** [昼夜均時用符],
**the *yang* stalk gradually arises** [陽爻以漸生],
until **Great Strength** [大壮],
**from the new moon to fifteen days** [盖自朔日一至旬有五日],
**mirroring the **Fire-Wood** [火木] dominance of **Spring and Summer** [春夏],
**and the transition from **cultivated** [文] to **martial** [武]."

At **sixteen days** [旬有六日],
**take the **Autumn division** [秋之分],
**aligning day and night with the method** [昼夜均時],
**the *yin* stalk gradually arises** [陰爻漸生],
until the **month of *yin* dominance** [陰盛之月],
**mirroring the **Gold-Water** [金水] dominance of **Autumn and Winter** [秋冬],
**and the transition from **martial** [武] to **cultivated** [文].
**Calculating a hundred *ke* [刻] in total** [并更百刻],
**it corresponds to Heaven’s mysterious patterns and concealment** [應乎天之玄象藏伏],
**its disappearance at the **waning moon** [晦],
**is the number for **uniting the *yin* and *yang* organs** [合眺腑].

The **method’s principle** [符從子起],
**is not the **parental principle of Fire** [火之父母].
**Zi** [子] is the **beginning of a single *yin* stalk** [陰中一爻之始],
**explaining the **weight and measure** [斤兩].
This is the **total count of **Creation’s axis** [造化轴辖],
**the **rise and fall of *yin* and *yang*** [陰陽之起伏],
**where the **alignment method** [行符] **conforms to the water clock** [刻漏],
**and **separating *qi* aligns with weight and measure** [分氣合於斤兩].

The **method’s movement** [符動] **begins at *Chenwu*** [辰巳],
**reaching two and a half cycles** [二周半] **as the **dividing *qi*** [首分氣],
**and ending at *Xuhai*** [戌亥],
**not the **proper position of *zi*** [子之正位].

At the **Winter and Summer Solstices** [冬夏二至],
*yin* and *yang* ascend and descend—
thus **above, the method guards the **Furnace’s essence** [鼎],
**strictly following the **stalk’s patterns** [爻象] for **advance and retreat** [進退],
**and **weight and measure** [斤兩].
However, **one must use *yin* to align with *zi*** [用陰合子],
**covering with charcoal** [依炭覆藉],
**facing *yin* and turning away from *yang*** [背陽向陰],
**its concealment resembling a **bee’s nest** [蜂之穴],
**preventing *qi* from dispersing** [勿使氣泄].

The **Sutra** [經] says:
**"From the Solstice to seven and a half days** [從至第七半],
**it mirrors one season** [即象一季].
**Subsequently, upon encountering *zi*** [以次遇子], **add accordingly** [即加焉].

Since **Zi generates within the *Kan* position** [子生於坎位],
**it illuminates a single *yang* within *yin*** [故明陰中一陽],
**conforming to the *Kan* pattern** [法象於坎] **and beginning from *zi*** [而從子起],
**gradually increasing the stalks** [漸加其爻],
until **Established Summer** [立夏] and **Summer Solstice** [夏至],
**mirroring the **Fire** [火] phase,
until **Martial** [武] **turns contrary** [相背],
**at fifteen days and sixteen days** [十有五日，十有六日],
**calculating the method’s alignment** [計其符],
**a total of sixty** [共當六十].

**Before the full moon** [望之前] is *yang*,
**after the full moon** [望之後] is *yin*.
The **born *yin* begins from seventeen days** [陰生從十有七日],
**uniting with twenty-four days** [合十有四日],
**gradually retreating until the **Winter Solstice** [冬至].
The **Winter Solstice** [冬至] is when
**the five phases’ numbers are exhausted** [五行數盡],
**ending at thirty** [終於三十].
**Calculating the days for alignment** [計其合符日用],
**it follows the **six stalks’ rise, fall, and completion** [六爻上下生成終始之數],
**and aligns with the **five phases** [合於五行].

**First Watch** [初候],
**two and a half days** [二日半] **comprise one *qi* [氣] of thirty *shi* [時],
**two and a half cycles** [二周半] **comprise five *qi* [氣]s,
**dividing and returning through twelve branches** [分還歷十有二支].

**Five cycles total sixty *shi*** [凡五周為六十時],
**the alignment method spans five days** [行符五日],
**each watch utilizing five stalks** [一候當用五爻].

**Second Watch** [第二候],
**two and a half days** [二日半] **comprise one *jin* [斤] of thirty *shi* [時],
**two and a half cycles** [二周半] **comprise five *qi* [氣]s,
**dividing and returning through five cycles** [分還歷於五周],
**totaling sixty *shi*** [為六十時],
**until the alignment method reaches fifteen days** [行符至十有五日].
**Three watches suffice** [三候足矣].
Its **use of fifteen stalks** [十有五爻] **comprises thirty alignments** [三十符].

The **Sutra** [經] says:
**"The first fifteen days are **Yin-Symbols** [陽符],
**mirroring the **Fire-Wood** [火木] dominance.
**The latter fifteen days are **Yin-Symbols** [陰符],
**mirroring the **Metal-Water** [金水] dominance."

At the **beginning of the stalk’s movement** [爻動之始],
**its *yang* is **odd** [奇],
**its *yin* is **even** [偶].
**Uniting at six hundred and forty *cù*** [六十四铢] **and ten *liang* [兩]s,
**two alignments are used** [用二符].
**The initial stalk is fixed** [其初爻為定],
**and upon meeting *zi*** [及乎遇子], **add accordingly** [則加焉].
**When encountering *yin*** [逢陰], **retreat accordingly** [則退焉].
**Cycling and returning to its beginning** [周而復始],
**it conforms to the **Celestial *symbol*’s patterns** [法象乎天符],
thus **commencing from *Jianzi*** [是以建子].

**Dispersal** [發泄] is the **beginning of *yang* movement** [陽動之始],
**as chaos begins to divide** [混沌欲分],
**the **Hidden Dragon** [潜龙] has yet to appear** [未見].
**One must rely on *Jia* [甲] as the **parental principle of *yang*** [陽之父母],
**dividing *qi* belongs to the **Dao of *yang*** [分氣屬陽道].」

The **Supreme Origin** begins its movement, and when the *yang* **marching *symbol*** [行符] is active, it is the **Trembling** [震] and **Returning** [复] that take effect.
Its **manifestation** [象] is the **initial nine** [初九], using **climatic *qi*** [气候] to signify **Early Spring** [孟春].
On the **first day of Early Spring**, the **child** [子] **stalk** [爻] begins at one, the second day at two, the third at three, the fourth at four, and the fifth at five.
Each **marching *symbol*** cycles through the **twelve celestial stems** [十二辰], completing **two and a half rotations** by *si* [巳], totaling **thirty *shi*** [时] **and two and a half days**, beginning from *wu* [午] **time** [时] **to divide *qi*** [分气] again for two and a half rotations, ending at *hai* [亥], totaling **sixty *shi***, thus symbolizing **Middle Spring** [仲春].
Middle Spring belongs to *yang*, and the **five stalks of the Supreme Origin** constitute **ten *symbols*** [符], so the sixth day begins at the **sixth child stalk** [子六爻], the seventh at the **seventh child stalk**, the eighth at the **eighth child stalk**, and the ninth follows the **receptive and decisive *qi*** [坤兑之气] to symbolize **Late Spring** [季春].
Late Spring reaches *si* at **thirty *shi***, marking the **ninth and third** [九三], so the ninth day begins at the **ninth child stalk**, the tenth at the **tenth child stalk**, and ends at *hai* at **sixty *shi***. This is the **seasonal influence** [候] of the Supreme Origin’s activity, and when encountering **divided *qi*** [分气], the stalks are counted from **child to *wu* and *hai*** [午亥], returning to **three seasonal phases** [三候].

**Early Summer** is the *yang* **retreat** [遁] of the **Middle Origin** [中元], with **forty stalks** constituting **two hundred *symbols*** [符] for the **third seasonal phase** [第三候]. The eleventh day begins at the **eleventh child stalk**, the twelfth at the **twelfth child stalk**, the thirteenth at the **thirteenth child stalk**, marking the **ninth and fifth** [九五].
Two and a half days reach *si* at **thirty *shi***. **Middle Summer** begins from *wu* **time** [时] **to divide *qi*** [分气] until *hai*, so the fourteenth day begins at the **fourteenth child stalk**, the fifteenth at the **fifteenth child stalk**, ending at *hai* at **sixty *shi***. Thus, **fifteen stalks** combine into **thirty *symbols***, the **Kingly and Martial** [王武] opposing each other.

**Late Summer** is the *yang* **retreat** [遁] of the **Lower Origin** [下元], where the **metal and water boundaries** [金水二界] face each other, the **sun and moon** [日月] align, and the Supreme Origin **withdraws to await the exchange** [退守交期]. Thus, *yang* reaches its peak while *yin* arises, the **heavenly and earthly pivots** [天地轴辖] align, and the *symbols* wax and wane. This is the **application of the *symbols***.
**Beginning and ending** [终始] rely on **civilized** [文] and **martial** [武], cycling and returning.
Generally, from **child** [子] to *chen* [辰] and *si* [巳], two and a half rotations divide *qi*, beginning at *wu* and ending at *hai*, so *chen* generates within *yin*, and *si* generates within *yang*.
**Trembling and Gentle** [震巽] are the **ancestors of fire** [火之祖], first attaining **harmony with the *symbols*** [符合於信].

**Early Autumn** is **Gentle** [巽], encountering the **fourth seasonal phase** [第四候].
The **upper six** [上六], the sixteenth day begins at the **fifteenth child stalk** [子十五爻], constituting **thirty *symbols***.
The seventeenth day begins at the **fourteenth child stalk**, the eighteenth at the **thirteenth child stalk**, and from the **original time** [本时] **to divide *qi*** [分气] until *hai*, marking the **sixth and fifth** [六五].
The nineteenth day begins at the **twelfth child stalk**, the twentieth at the **eleventh child stalk**, ending at *hai* at **sixty *shi***.
**Middle Autumn** is the *yin* **retreat** [遁] of the **Supreme Origin** [上元], generally using **twenty-two *symbols***, marking the **fifth seasonal phase** [第五候], the **sixth and fourth** [六四].
The twenty-first day begins at the **tenth child stalk**, the twenty-second at the **ninth child stalk**, the twenty-third at the **eighth child stalk**, and two and a half days reach *si* at **thirty *shi***.
**Late Autumn** is the **sixth and third** [六三], beginning from *wu* **time** [时] **to divide *qi*** [分气] until *hai*, so the twenty-fourth day begins at the **seventh child stalk**, the twenty-fifth at the **sixth child stalk**, ending at *hai* at **sixty *shi***.
**Early Winter** is the *yin* **retreat** [遁] of the **Middle Origin** [中元], generally using **twelve *symbols***, marking the **sixth seasonal phase** [第六候], the **sixth and second** [六二].
The twenty-sixth day begins at the **fifth child stalk**, the twenty-seventh at the **fourth child stalk**, the twenty-eighth at the **third child stalk**, and two and a half days reach *si* at **thirty *shi***.
**Middle Winter** is the **initial six** [初六].
The twenty-ninth day begins at the **second child stalk**, the thirtieth at the **first child stalk**, ending at *hai* at **sixty *shi***.
**Late Winter** is the *yin* **retreat** [遁] of the **Lower Origin** [下元], aligning with the **two initial ebb-and-flow *symbols*** [伏之二符]. Two *symbols* constitute one stalk, the **receptive body** [坤体] concealing *yang*, from the first to the fifteenth day, **virtue** [德] attains the **heavenly body** [乾体].

Spring and summer belong to **fire and wood** [火木], autumn and winter to **metal and water** [金水]. The **seventh and eighth** [七八] precede, the **ninth and sixth** [九六] follow. **Rising and falling**, **flexing and extending**, **reversing and returning**, between **eclipse and new moon** [晦朔], the **interaction of sun and moon** [日月交会], symbolizing the **four seasons** [四季], **returning soul and spirit** [归魂归魄], **medicine aligning with the whole** [药就物全], reverting to **natural harmony** [自然]. Thus, **yin-fire and yang-fire** [阴火阳火] are established, **metal and water** [金水] stand parallel, not exceeding the **balance** [斤], conforming to the **Dao of Heaven** [天道].
The **Classic** says: *Yang* is **odd**, *yin* is **even**; one **sovereign**, two **ministers**. The **initial stalk** [初爻] of *yang* movement responds to the **second and eighth** [二八], **spiraling leftward** [左旋] as the *yang* **symbol**. Gradually increasing until **Great Strength** [大壮].
When *yang* reaches its peak and *yin* arises, it responds to the **sixth and eighth** [六八], **spiraling rightward** [右旋] as the *yin* **symbol**, gradually withdrawing to **Return’s beginning** [复之初].
When *yin* reaches its peak and *yang* arises, it cycles and returns.
When the **initial nine** [初九] divides *qi* belonging to the *yin* **Dao** [阴道], the Supreme Origin begins *yin* and **withdraws the *symbol***. Gradually retreating through the **six seasonal phases** [六候], once completed, it returns to the **three decads** [三旬]. The **five phases** [五行] exhaust their numbers, relying on **adding or subtracting fire** [抽添其火], adhering to the **mysterious *symbols*** [玄象] without deficiency. Thus, the **spiritual and numinous** [神灵] naturally align, and the **Golden Elixir** [金丹] is achieved.
One *symbol* is insufficient—then it is like **clay and rubble** [瓦砾].

The **Supreme Sovereign** [元君] says: Those refining the **Great Medicine** [大药] must use **true lead and true mercury** [真铅真汞], **gold and water** [金水] completing each other, **steel and water** [戊己] merging. Like an **infant receiving *qi* from its mother** [婴儿受气於母], the mother conceals the child within the womb, the child hidden in **gold** [金], **naturally pregnant** [含孕自然], the **golden essence** [金精] and **realized liquid** [实液] opposing each other—**one ascends, one descends** [一飞一伏], *yang* **propels**, *yin* **verifies** [阳推阴证]. Like the **mandarin duck’s white exterior concealing yellow** [鹦子外白裹黄], the **Lunar Rabbit’s chariot** [河车] revolves, in an instant **shedding its shell** [脱胎], returning to **unity** [一体]. This is the **foundation of the Elixir** [丹基].
Its essence lies in using **one hexagram per day and night** [昼夜各用一卦], the **interchange of Heaven and Earth** [乾坤互用], **Gentle and Trembling** [巽震] generating creation. The **twelve hexagrams** [十二卦] shift above and below, applying *symbols* and **verification** [符信], thus establishing **five rotations** [五周] **to divide *qi*** [分气].
From **five *zhi* [首] to *hai* [亥], beginning at **child** [子], advancing and retreating stalks, **concealing and emerging** [藏伏时候], aligning with the **Dao of Heaven** [天道], relying on **water clocks** [刻漏], taking a **porcelain vessel** [瓷] of **Great Unity** [大一] size, drilling a small hole at its base, inserting a **black crow’s feather** [乌羽] three to four inches long from the household, securing it with **wax** [蜡], drawing water into the vessel, measuring with **elevated and lowered water clocks** [升斗数马漏刻].

Then **fire is used to seal the talisman**, and it shall not err.

When encountering the **child** [子] in the twelve hours, add it forthwith. After one month, the **symbols of the four seasons** shall manifest.
Guard it for either **nine months or three years**, adhering to the **Nine Periods** [九纪], thus aligning with the **Great Cycle of Nine Rotations** [大演九周], and the elixir shall spontaneously become efficacious.

The **Classical Text** states:
*"Take three-refined lead essence, subtract twice eight—its remainder is Earth. Beneath, place twice eight [of mercury], and their essences shall naturally coalesce.*
When their essences meet, the **two *qi*** [二气] stir and respond—**instantly returning to restrain each other**. Thus, **metal and water** rise and float, merging into **Unity**, and the **metal essence emerges**, named **yellow silver**.

When its essence is fully refined, follow its measure and descend again to transform.
Obtaining the **metal’s parent-child pair**, the **two strings** [二弦] cease. That which departs the parent is called **detached embryo**; that which enters the furnace is called **fire elixir**.

The **furnace vessel** has upper and lower parts—its upper section is of **metal**, its lower of **earthenware**, not the common kind.
The **earthenware vessel** is the **Earth Mother**, sourced from the **sweat pools of Luo and Fen**. Finely ground and sifted, it is mixed with thin glue to form a shape resembling a **phoenix egg**. Its length is seven inches, its diameter five inches, with a central **divine chamber** three inches wide and two and a half inches deep—its form mimicking the **primordial chaos of yin-yang**.

Lead and mercury cannot be controlled without this earthenware vessel; hence, **yellow can subdue water**.
If one uses **parent-metal and earth-mother** to forge the furnace, then **spiritual ascent** may be achieved.

When placing it in the furnace, the **day and hour** must align with **four executions** [四杀], **clashing influences** [刑克], and **yang**. The **hundred measures of day and night** correspond to the **hexagram lines**, rising from **yin at child** [子], through **full and new moons**, **axes and scales** ascending and descending in rhythm, **civil and martial** forces intersecting, cycling endlessly—all in harmony with **spring and autumn**. Thus, from **child to *hai*** [亥] is one rotation.

For **six yang and six yin** begin and end, converging into **Unity**.

**Lord Yuan** says:
*"The talisman is applied through the lines. Water and fire regulate the talisman—six yang and six yin, every twelve branches, shift from civil to martial, or yang wanes while yin dissipates.
Civil first arises from **one line**, like **one yang born in *kan*** [坎].
Martial concludes at **fifteen lines**, like **two yin generated in *li*** [离].
When yang reaches its peak, its law mirrors **Great Strength** [大壮], the talisman cycles in harmony, thus beginning from **child** and counting growth—**six talismans unite** in their application.

It mirrors **one yin line**, with **yang talismans incrementally adding a line**.
From **child to *si*** [巳], it lies dormant in **three**—thus, **chen and *si*** [辰巳] constitute **one *qi***. Hence, **fire is born in *chen* and *si***, retreating to guard **sixty hours**, concluding at **xu and *hai*** [戌亥], then restarting from **child**.

The *Hidden Armor Classic* [《隐甲经》] states:
*'Advancing and retreating meet the **King and Martial** in opposition—this is **yang-*qi** above.
Terminating with **Civil**—this is **yin-*qi** returning below.
After the **winter solstice**, encountering **jia** signifies **yang’s birth**—thus, it ascends.
After the **summer solstice**, encountering **jia** signifies **yin’s birth**—thus, it descends.
Hence, it is said: **"Direct talismans above and below—months possess this."**
Regardless of year or season.*

The **Classical Text** states:
*"From the first watch, **child** initiates the line, concluding at **repetition-child** [复子]—this is the **one line of Heaven’s talisman**, mirroring the **twenty-four *qi*** [二十四气]. Guard it for two and a half days, and **one *qi*** gradually increases.
When the line reaches five days, it is **one watch**; sixty hours later, it reaches **chen and *si***, concluding at **xu and *hai***. From **yin to *shen*** [寅至申] is **seven returns**; from **child to *shen*** [子至申] is **nine revolutions**—one rise, one retreat.
**Thunder and Wind** [震巽] are the **beginning of *jia*** [甲], the **foundation of fire**, the **interchange of the five phases**.
**Heaven and Earth, Thunder and Wind** generate above and below—**the gate of *jia*** [甲]’s prohibition.

The **Classical Text** states:
*'The line moves for two and a half days, dividing *qi* and adding lines until five days complete **one watch**—only two hexagrams are used, aligning with the **mysterious symbols of Heaven’s talisman**.
**Day** is the **Heaven talisman**; **month** is the **yin talisman**; **fire** is the **Earth talisman**.
Regulating talismans by adding or subtracting **days, months, years** depends on the **water clocks’ advance and retreat**; executing talismans by **hiding and revealing** depends on **sequential *qi*** [合气].
In accordance with the **seven luminaries and five phases**, the **celestial balance and lodges**, and the **moon’s waxing and waning**, including **intercalary months**, govern **rise and retreat**.
From **Repetition to Thunder**, then **Wind**, until **Earth** concludes—**yin and yang** must interact in their operations.

The *Yellow Emperor’s Mirror* [《黄帝手镜》] states:
*'Days are calculated like a **chariot wheel’s rotation**.
**Fire** weighs **one hundred and eighty *jin***—this is the **nine-nine number**.
What is **Three Elements** [三元]?
Five days, sixty hours—**Upper Element**; ten days, one hundred and twenty hours—**Middle Element**; fifteen days, one hundred and eighty hours—**Lower Element**.

On **jia-ji** days at midnight, **jia-*zi*** [甲子] is born; on **yi-geng** days, **bing-*zi*** [丙子] is born; on **bing-xin** days, **wu-*zi*** [戊子] is born; on **ding-ren** days, **geng-*zi*** [庚子] is born; on **wu-gui** days, **ren-*zi*** [壬子] is born.

After the **winter solstice**, the first **jia-*zi*** is the **Upper Element**, reaching **wu-chen** [戊辰]—five days, sixty hours—**Upper Element *jia-*zi*** advances as **four *zhong*** [四仲].
On **four *zhong*** days at midnight, **jia-*zi*** advances through **eight palaces**, with **Tianpeng** [天蓬] presiding—**child, *wu*, *mao*, *you*** [子午卯酉].

From **ji-*si*** [己巳] to **gui-*you*** [癸酉], five days, sixty hours—**Middle Element *jia-*zi*** advances as **four *meng*** [四孟].
On **four *meng*** months at midnight, **jia-*zi*** advances through **four, three, two palaces**, with **Tianren** [天任] presiding—**yin, *shen*, *si*, *hai*** [寅申巳亥].

From **jia-*xu*** [甲戌] to **wu-*yin*** [戊寅], five days, sixty hours—**Lower Element *jia-*zi*** advances as **four *ji*** [四季].
On **four *ji*** days at midnight, **jia-*zi*** advances through **seven, six, four palaces**, with **Tianfu** [天辅] presiding—**chou, *xu*, *wei*, *chen*** [丑戌未辰].

The summer solstice marks its reverse course through the **Nine Palaces**, completing a cycle and returning to its beginning, exhausting the **three hundred sixty hours of a month**, and concluding at the **fire’s alchemical stage** and **seasonal correspondences**—mirroring the operations of a year.

**The Method states:**
Take a small porcelain vessel, and at its base, open a hole the size of a bean. Within the cauldron, finely sift and burn the **Steward of the Five-and-Six** (戊己) to form a cover. Use bright, uniformly colored sand as a base, placing it in the vessel, then sealing it onto the cauldron with **Six-One mud** to secure it. Apply charcoal fire beneath. When the porcelain glows red-hot, first plug the hole with a paper wick, then withdraw it. If white smoke arises, this is **mercury**. Replug the hole, and when the **pure white smoke** appears, cease.

Collect **one *tài*** per day, sweeping the porcelain with a **parrot feather**, and store it. If the sand retains a red hue, repeat the process as before. When mercury is fully extracted, the sand will no longer redden.

**End of Volume Twenty-Nine of *Dao Gū* #1**
**Annotation #1:** *Jíyào* original reads **"gold"** (金).
**Annotation #2:** *Yīn* originally reads **"yang"** (阳), corrected per *Jíyào* edition.
