**Volume Thirty of *Dao Gū*:
Twenty-Eight – *Tàiqīng Yǎngshēng* (Upper Clarity Nourishment of Life), Upper Section
Twenty-Nine – *Tàiqīng Yǎngshēng* (Upper Clarity Nourishment of Life), Lower Section**

**Volume Thirty of *Dao Gū* – *Tàiqīng Yǎngshēng* (Upper Clarity Nourishment of Life), Upper Section**

The Master of Wandering, Zeng Kai, compiled the *Five Phases of Lead and Mercury*:
*"Monthly gather its bloom, daily extract its essence;
The Four Symbols stand complete, the River Chariot moves in motion."*

The Master of Exploring the Mysteries, Cao Shengtu of Yellow Crane Mountain, said:
*"I met Master Yang at Dangyang and received the true essence from him.
Thus I knew that the Great Elixir of Gold and Immortality lies in:
Refining the Five Phases to their utmost,
Then exhausting the principles of sun and moon,
With the Four Symbols fully established,
And the birth of the Five Emperors’ River Chariot.*

*The River Chariot—this is the Divine Water.
It quickens when fire is applied, thrives when water is present,
Enduring ten thousand refineries and transformations,
Unchanging in its truth.
This is the supreme treasure of Heaven and Earth."*

The Master of Exploring the Mysteries then sang:

*"Obtain it through the One Qi,
Transform through the Golden Elixir;
The Golden Elixir opens the path to Immortality,
Seeking must be in the Five Phases.

To recognize true lead and mercury,
One water meets one fire;
The Central Palace reveals the master—
Water and fire unite to form substance.

Two substances become husband and wife,
Paired in perfect match;
A hundred moments in Kan and Li,
Cinnabar emerges from here.

Its form like a true pearl’s separation—
Cinnabar is not inherently red;
Encounter water, it returns to water’s essence,
Encounter fire, it becomes Golden Elixir.

Strip the husk, remove the black shadow—
The black shadow is lead’s nature;
The Gold Elixir forbids lead—
Using lead, a thousand times you’ll fail.

When bamboo breaks, mend with bamboo;
When wood snaps, weave with wood;
Human qi supplements the exterior—
All things are but guests;
Thus lead and mercury’s root
Resides in the Five Phases alone.

Gold governs the four—
Born from fire’s receipt of its talisman,
Capable of drawing existence from nonexistence,
And returning existence to nonexistence,
Thus the Four Symbols stand complete,
And the White Gold is conceived.

This is the Qi of sun-essence and moon-bloom,
Capable of congealing into white, of becoming water—
Named *Flowing Pearl Golden Elixir Divine Dan*.
Exhausting the ninety-nine of Yang’s extreme,
This becomes the Elixir of Transcendence.

Wood governs the three—
Born from fire’s initial mingling of Qi and receipt of its talisman.
Containing the utmost essence of the Primordial,
Through Earth’s harmony it abides, becomes parent,
Mutually generating sprouts,
Aligning with Heaven and Earth’s transformations,
Establishing trust, responding to the Jia position—
This is the Green Dragon,
Which congeals summer’s snow to resemble winter’s ice—
This is the way of reversal.

Water governs the one,
Its number residing in the North.
The *Dan Jing* says:
*Heaven births the Dark Female as Yang,
Her extreme becomes Yin, descending from Heaven.*
The lead, silver, sand, and mercury of this world—
How could they align with the Five Phases,
Responding to the Qian symbol?
My mercury—
Encompassing all symbols, pouring into the boundless,
This is the River Chariot.

Fire governs the two—
Born from Wood’s receipt of its talisman.
It is Earth’s father, Gold’s husband,
Water’s wife, Wood’s child.
Thus Heaven and Earth’s immortal nature,
Which all things bear in form,
Averse to death, loving life,
Soaring above the Nine Heavens,
Capable of drawing existence from nonexistence,
And returning existence to nonexistence.
The Sage’s longevity with Heaven and Earth lies in:
Refining one Yin to return to the Yang position—
This is the body of the Returning Elixir.

Refining mercury into dust—
Its form is sand containing mercury,
Lead containing silver.
Li is the female—
Returning to its true nature.

Earth governs the five,
Its virtue reigning over the four seasons,
Nurturing all things, stabilizing the four quarters.
The *Dan Jing* says:
*The Earth produces the Yellow Male—
This is the extreme of Yin giving birth to Yang.*
Earth’s essence is true lead.
Used in harmony, it grants longevity;
Used in opposition, it harms things.

Mercury that does not scatter—
This is the mother of the Flowing Pearl.
With lead as its root,
When the root is complete, the sprout grows;
When mercury is concealed, the Elixir is formed.
Yet it is not external—
Thus my Gold, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth
Are not the common ones of the world.

**True One Chapter**
The Dao’s birth, I grasp its principle;
Embracing the True, holding the Primordial,
Observing the origin of things.

The Master of Wandering said:
*The Dao—
Capable of generating Heaven and Earth,
The divine, the imperial—
The Sage of Old Wisdom said:
I do not know whose child it is,
Prior to the Emperor’s symbol.
For lack of a better name, it is called Dao.
Yet it supports Heaven and Earth,
Directs the sun and moon,
Rotates the four seasons,
Generates all things.
Heaven’s Five Stars,
The Five Divine Emperors,
Earth’s Five Sacred Peaks,
Man’s Five Viscera,
The Five Directions,
Down to the Five Grains, Five Colors, Five Notes—
The Dao is present in all.

Thus the Sage of Old Wisdom said:
*The Dao is born from the One,
The One generates the Two,
The Two generates the Three,
The Three generates all things.
All things, myriad and varied,
Each returns to its root.
Returning to the root is called stillness,
Stillness is called returning to life—
This refers to the source of transformation,
Beginning from the One, ending in the One,
Thus enduring all changes without exhaustion.
If one can penetrate it with the One,
Then the Dao is clear.

What is the True One?
The root of Dragon and Tiger.
Dragon and Tiger’s transformations—
When these are complete, the Elixir is formed.
Uniting Dragon and Tiger,
Returning to the origin, restoring the Primordial,
Preserving both life and nature,
Roaming the cosmos—
This is to illuminate the True One of the Great Dao.

Later scholars also wish to preserve form and dwell in the world—
How can they fail to illuminate the True One of the Great Dao?

Those who do not know the root of Dragon and Tiger’s transformations
Yet are confused by their varied names—
Some say the liver is the Dragon,
The lungs the Tiger.
Those who say the liver is the Dragon
Claim its green hue corresponds to spring,
Assigned to the East’s Jia-Yi Wood.
Where Wood’s vital force generates—
This is called the Green Dragon.
Those who say the lungs are the Tiger
Claim its white hue corresponds to autumn,
Assigned to the West’s Geng-Xin Metal.
Where Metal’s vital force is severe—
This is called the White Tiger.
Thus the bodies of Dragon and Tiger are known."*

Some say the heart is the Dragon, and the kidneys the Tiger.
Those who say the heart is the Dragon—
Claim that the Jia-Yi Green Dragon *qi* can transmit and generate within the heart’s fire,
Thus fire contains Wood, and it is called the **Yang Dragon** (陽龍).

Those who say the kidneys are the Tiger—
Claim that the Geng-Xin White Tiger *qi* can transmit and generate within the kidneys’ water,
Thus water contains Metal, and it is called the **Yin Tiger** (陰虎).

This is how the functions of Dragon and Tiger are known.

To know the Dragon and Tiger’s forms and functions
Yet fail to grasp their fundamental roots—
This is not what I call the **Dao** (道).

The True One (真一), then,
Is my very *qi* and fluids, yet they cannot comprehend it. Why?
For the **Original *Qi*** (元氣) is born between the two kidneys,
Circulating in and out at the **Yao-Ming** (杳冥) threshold—
Inaudible, invisible, its name is called the **Elemental Sea** (元海) or the **Soul Root** (靈根).

Within *qi* arises fluid, within fluid arises *qi*—
*Qi* and fluid mutually generate, united yet inseparable—
This is what is meant by:
**"Heaven’s One generates water, the Great One (太一) embraces the True *Qi*"** (天一生水，太一含真氣).

Scholars, not knowing the Dragon and Tiger’s interplay,
Often invert the **Yin-Yang** (陰陽) and misname them—
They say the Dragon is but the Dragon, the Tiger but the Tiger,
Though they know that fluid transmits to **Li** (離), generating blood in the heart,
And call it the Yang Dragon,
Yet they do not inquire how blood contains fluid,
Holding within it the Yin Tiger’s *qi*.

Though they know that blood transmits to **Kan** (坎), generating essence in the kidneys,
And call it the Yin Tiger,
Yet they do not inquire how essence contains blood,
Holding within it the Yang Dragon’s *qi*.

Those who misname and separate them—
How could it end with just this?

The heart’s fire can be the **Li Girl** (離女), the **Great Sun** (太陽), the **Vermilion Bird** (朱雀), the **Astonished Girl** (詫女), the **Red Phoenix** (赤鳳), the **Golden Crow** (金烏), the **Lead** (鉛), the **Red Snow** (紅雪), the **Burning Mountain Talisman** (燒山符), or the **White Horse Sprout** (白馬芽),
Yet all are the Yang Dragon.

The kidneys’ water can also be the **Kan Boy** (坎男), the **Great Yin** (太陰), the **Dark Tortoise** (玄武), the **Infant** (嬰兒), the **Black Turtle** (烏龜), the **Jade Rabbit** (玉兔), the **Mercury** (汞), the **Black Water** (黑水), the **Drinking Sea Turtle** (飲海龜), or the **Red Dragon’s Paw** (赤龍脚),
Yet all are the Yin Tiger.

They merely muddle their theories with myriad classifications.
If they are confused by external appearances,
And fragment the true source—
Then their teachings will drift aimlessly, finding no proper foundation.

The enlightened practitioners of the **Five Phases** (五行) and **Four Symbols** (四象) can harmonize with them,
And those of the **Eight Trigrams** (八卦) and **Nine Palaces** (九宮) can discern them.

Thus, they regulate the **fire’s ascent and descent** (行火候之抽添),
Unite the **flow and counterflow of Yin and Yang** (合阴陽之順逆),
Adjust the **Cauldron of Heaven and Earth** (按乾坤之鼎器),
Refine the **essence of Sun and Moon** (煉日月之精華),
Unleash the **subtle beginnings of Transformation** (發造化之幾微),
And grasp the **core secrets of the Elixir of Great Reversion** (得還丹之要妙),
Then they may indeed tread within the realm of **eternal life and prolonged vision** (長生久視).

The **Yellow Emperor** (黃帝) said: *"The cosmos lies within my grasp, transformation within my body."*
How fitting his words were!

I have observed the **source of cultivation and refinement** (修煉之源),
It is not dependent on **five metals and eight stones** (五金八石),
Nor does it lie in **swallowing mist and absorbing *qi*** (吞霞采氣).
Its essence lies in **qi generating fluid** (氣生液),
Fluid transforming into **blood** (液化為血),
Blood transforming into **essence** (精) (blood化為精),
Essence forming into **pearl** (精化為珠),
Pearl becoming **mercury** (汞) (珠化為汞),
Mercury turning into **sand** (砂) (汞化為砂),
And sand finally yielding the **Golden Elixir** (金丹).

The **Yellow Emperor** said: *"Heaven and Earth are the thieves of the myriad things;
The myriad things are thieves of humanity;
Humanity is the thief of the myriad things.
Yet when these three thieves vie in action,
It is humanity alone that suffers their harm,
For it cannot properly nurture life."*
(天地，萬物之盜；
萬物，人之盜；
人，萬物之盜。
然三盜競起，而人獨受其弊者，
蓋不能善攝生故也。)

Those who **master the nurturing of life** (善攝生者),
Their **spirit is whole, their essence restored** (神全精復).
If one understands the **true unity of the Great Dao** (大道之真一) lies within **qi and fluid** (氣液),
Refines **qi and fluid** to generate the **Yang Dragon and Yin Tiger** (龍虎),
And unites the **Dragon and Tiger** to achieve **transmutation** (變化),
So that the **Nine Returns to Seven** (九還) and **reversion to the undifferentiated** (七返) lead to **mixed unity and true return** (混一歸真),
Then the **spirit is whole, essence restored** (神全精復),
And what difficulty remains?

I have heard from the **secrets of the Golden and Jade Elixir** (金玉還丹之訣):
*"The origin of the **Pivot of the Great Medicine** (刀圭大藥) is indeed rooted in **qi and fluid** (氣液)."*
Is this not what I speak of as **true unity** (真一)?
(此豈吾所謂真一者欤！)
**The Orthodox Unity Scripture** (正一篇)

The **Orthodox Unity Master** speaks:

*"When **qi** is drawn from the earth and congeals through water,
Each movement and stillness—**qi** surges upward.
The five directional **qi** align in matching pairs,
Their exchange returning to **Oneness**.
**Oneness** is the root of the Great Dao,
The gateway to all transformations.

When lead retreats, mercury revives;
When gold reverses, water yields its essence.
When water irrigates the yellow sprout within the earth,
It is not born in the spleen—
But **qi** sensed in the earth condenses in water,
Circulating endlessly, beyond measure.

Inner and outer elixirs share the same essence and function.
Movement is Heaven; stillness is Earth.
Each movement and stillness—**qi** is born.

This **surge-qi** is the essence of the Great Elixir.
Let it lead and follow—never delay.
Within, a maiden dwells, yet fire is not concealed;
Her fiery essence blazes thick, illuminating the void,
As Heaven and Earth’s myriad forms unite in a single realm.
Nine unions, nine revolutions—separation and reunion brief—
She ascends to the Purple Palace,
Twisting her pure intestines,
Refining her yin soul,
One elixir, one mystery—yet they do not suffice.

The **Geng-Wu** pair, their trinity converging,
Naturally abstains from grains—
Their intestines hold no dross.
So long as dross remains, **true qi** will not respond.
When it does, like a hollow valley without sound,
Yet voices heard within.
With time, like a jade bell’s resonant hum,
A maiden’s voice emerges, delicate and clear.

My body—master of ten thousand spirits,
From which all spirits arise.
If men do not leak their essence,
And women conceal their blood,
Within the twelve seasons’ span, no stagnation occurs—
At noon, something will come to meet it.

At the **Zi** hour, both reside in the yang organs;
When yin meets yang, when yang meets yin,
One inverted, one aligned—
Their arrival runs deep.
As within yin, a Tiger hides.
The Dragon’s heart is yellow, the Tiger’s hide black—
Unseen, they conceal the true jade.
At the **Mao** hour, the nine-nines stand;
At the **You** hour, they rise—
This is their essential law.

What did the Great Emperor mean by ‘flickering substance’?
A single point of essence.
I possess three treasures—
One abides, one revolves, until nine revolutions complete,
Then the child’s gate opens, flying into the brain.
Within the brain, a jade spirit platform faces the elixir field.
The elixir field does not bar the sun and moon’s path;
An original spirit enters and exits through it,
Thus called the **One-Furnace Elixir**, refined by nine fires.

**The Two Passages Scripture**
Above and below, the two passages—
Where **qi** circulates.
Within lies the jade vulva,
Its key to be mastered.

The **High Exalted Master** said:
Strip to the waist, sit upright on a thick mat,
At the **Zi** hour, regulate the breath’s inflow and outflow,
So that **qi** harmonizes and the spirit settles.
Then clasp the hands, pressing with the tips of the thumbs
At the **structural throat** (喉结),
Drawing **qi** gently through the nose and closing it.
Next, part the thumbs and press the carotid pulses beside the throat,
Moving the middle fingers to the **heavenly pillar** (天柱骨) at the nape,
Drawing strength from it.
Gradually tighten the thumb pressure on the pulses,
Until at maximum force, the breath grows stifled—
Then swiftly release the thumbs.
This is one **passage**.

Adjust the breath again, waiting for **qi** to settle,
Then repeat as before—
Nine passages daily.
After several days, during practice,
The fingers will detach themselves,
The head will sway as if dizzy or falling.
Do not support it—
Supporting it would disrupt the **qi**.
In seclusion, a golden wheel appears above the head,
The spirit brightens, old ailments vanish,
The body feels light and at ease.
This is the sign of **original qi** ascending past the brain’s gate,
All passages now open.

Its name: **Detached Fingers, Mystic Passage**.

At the **Zi** hour, loosen the garments, sit upright,
With middle fingers tracing below the lower abdomen,
Outside the yin, within the thigh—
Where the horizontal veins pulse.
Press with all strength, as a warrior would,
Drawing **qi** gently through the nose and closing it.
When the breath reaches its limit, swiftly release the fingers,
As with the upper passage.
Nine passages daily—or three.
With time, harmonious **qi** naturally descends,
Entering the two thighs like hot water,
Old ailments vanish.
These two passages regulate the spirit and command **qi**.
First master the openings—
Then effects come swiftly.
The more practiced, the better.

**The Three Elements Scripture**
To regulate the six **qi**, do not block the three elements;
Cease thought, settle the spirit—
This too is the gate of life.

The **True White Master** said:
Man has three elements—
If the three are blocked, the six **qi** will乱.
The **Upper Element** belongs to all above the head;
The **Middle Element** spans from the head to above the navel;
The **Lower Element** spans from the navel to above the waist.

To settle the harmonious **qi** of the elements,
First remove the **spirit’s fur**—
The **spirit’s fur** is the nose.
Cease all thought, settle the spirit,
Day and night, regulate the breath—
Let it be subtle, for subtlety is the gate of life,
While excess is the path of death.
Why?
Drawing through the nose while exhaling through the mouth—
This is inverted **qi**.
Regulate it subtly—
Excess becomes yin **qi**, drawing original **qi** to harm.

Beginners may indulge in wine and meat,
Their mouths filled with toxic **qi**,
Or damage their organs—
The nose inhales it, the mouth exhales it,
Thirty or twenty passages,
Exhaling gently—never forcefully.
The nose cannot be easily opened or closed.
Let the breath be subtle—
Never force exhalation.

Forced exhalation will bring illness to the five **zàng**-organs and six **fù**-organs.
If you forcibly close it and it does not exit, it will suddenly burst forth—
Then it becomes coarse and panting, great and unrestrained.
Thus, even when exhaling **qi**, one must not let it run wild.
If the mouth opens wide, **qi** will rush forth, and the original **qi** will be depleted.
Though the nose inhales **qi**, it must not be forcibly closed—
Forcing closure will make the breath urgent.

Among the Three **Yuán** (origins), the **Middle Yuan** is the most honored.
The *Bao Pu Zi* says:
*The heart is the sovereign; intention is the minister; **qi** is the people.*
When thoughts are extinguished and all notions cease,
The original **qi** rises naturally.

As for those who first practice the Way,
And immediately turn inward to seek the **Xuan Zhu** (Mysterious Pearl),
It is like seeking fish from green wood—I have never seen one who succeeds.

In my own practice of cultivation,
When my hundred joints are blocked and I fall ill,
I can focus on the **Middle Yuan**,
Ignite fire to burn it away—
In moments, it will open, and opening brings healing.

The heart is the **Jiang Gong** (Vermilion Palace).
The **Jiang Gong** is the color of fire.
I preserve the blazing fire of the heart,
Spanning my entire body—
Not only does it circulate the **qi**,
But it also consumes the yin evils within.

When eyes are closed and teeth are struck,
The spirit is stored in the Eight **Gua** (Trigrams),
Left and right hands clasped firmly to seal the **qi**,
With intention imagining the fire of the **Middle Yuan** to burn the body—
Once done, the **qi** is moved,
Guarded at the **Lower Yuan**.

In ancient times, Guang Cheng Zi used accumulated fire to burn the Five **Dú** (poisons).
The Five **Dú** are the five grains and five flavors.
If not burned, they will obstruct the **qi**-paths.
Burning them cannot be prolonged—
Prolonged, it brings weariness.
Thus, one must move the **qi**,
Its method being to extinguish all thoughts,
Letting the spirit dwell subtly in the **Ru** (abode)—
Then the original **qi** will naturally permeate the body.

The original **qi** resides in all hundred joints and orifices.
Once it permeates the body, it must stand still and settle,
Cutting off all thoughts—
If thoughts are not cut off, the spirit cannot be preserved.

The method of attaining stillness lies in the **Lower Yuan**!
In the **Lower Yuan** **Dan Tian** lies the **Xuan Zhu**.
Its form is round and luminous.
I can illuminate within,
Preserving the pearl’s shape in the **Qi Hai**,
Then make the **qi** inhale and exhale,
Circulating one by one around the pearl—
When inhalation is complete,
It moves yet remains still,
In the space between clarity and confusion,
Naturally forming and resting in the **Qi Hai**.

Thus, the **Middle Yuan** nourishes the pearl of the **Lower Yuan**,
And the original **qi** becomes settled.

The **Middle Yuan** is yang, is masculine;
The **Lower Yuan** is yin, is feminine.
The *Huang Ting Jing* says:
*Know the masculine and embrace the feminine,
Know the white and embrace the black.*
This is what is meant.

Why?

The method of guarding the **Middle Yuan** over the **Lower Yuan** lies in the **Left White** and **Right Black**—
when they merge into one,
the heart becomes clear and the mind focused,
without thought, without deliberation,
then stillness arrives naturally.

Thus, the original **qi** becomes settled.
External **qi** does not enter,
internal **qi** does not escape—
harmonizing with Heaven and Earth,
its life knows no bounds.

The Yellow Emperor instructed the **Wang Xiang** to seek the **Xuan Zhu** in the **Chì Shuǐ**.
The **Chì Shuǐ** is blood;
the **Xuan Zhu** is **qi**;
**Wang Xiang** is the state of profound stillness, without thought, without concern.

Thus, the **Xuan Zhu** cannot be attained through mere silence—
this is why the **Dao** lies within the **Xuan Jī**;
when the **Xuan Jī** departs, the body remains;
when the **Xuan Jī** abides, the body dies.
Only when there is no **Xuan Jī** does the chest become pure white,
and one may speak of transcending and ascending with ease.

In the **"Sān Zhù" Chapter**:
The essence of **transformation** relies on **qi** as its foundation;
when the **qi** does not flow, form and spirit both abide.

The **Huá Yáng Zǐ** said to **Shǒu Wú**:
"The *Great Yì* does not say that refined **qi** is matter,
and wandering spirits are change.
Thus, within all forms, what is preserved
is none other than the original **qi**.

When the original **qi** abides, the spirit abides,
when the spirit abides, the form abides—
if these three abide, life rests in me,
why should it rest in Heaven?"

Thus, one knows that humans are born from **qi**,
and **qi** is sustained by the spirit.
Human **qi** is like fish to water—
lose the water, and death follows.

Yet, the spirit is the child of **qi**,
**qi** is the mother of the spirit,
and the form is the dwelling of the spirit—
this is the great principle of **cultivating the body**,
the root of **preserving the form**.

I have observed the function of **qi**:
like mist and clouds arising from the four limbs,
like sunlight and moonlight illuminating the **chì shè** [residence of the vital essence].
Next, I observed the stillness of the spirit:
a hundred evils cannot disturb its uprightness,
all movements cannot perturb its clarity.

The *Tài Píng Jīng* says:
"The spirit is the **Dao**.
Entering, it becomes divine clarity;
exiting, it becomes poetry and art—
these are the small accomplishments of the **Dao**.

In my former days at the **Míng Chǎng** [world of fame],
my thoughts labored endlessly;
now, without thought, it arrives naturally—
is this not the power of the **Dao**?

The **Yǐn Zhēn Rén** said:
"Extend the heart to govern **qi**,
let **qi** merge with the spirit—
when the center has its master,
the body will endure forever,
like the sun and moon revolving through Heaven,
and Earth’s ceaseless motion.
Thus, life may be endless."

The **Huá Yáng Zǐ** said:
"I have inscribed this:
The original **qi** and refined essence can preserve all forms,
my **qi** sealed within,
my body in lasting peace.
In the **Sì Shén** Chapter:
The **golden gate** and **jade door** hold a **mystic seal**;
following the **shùn** [natural order] of time,
one attains **sainthood**.

The **Tài Yáng** is the **shùn** of Heaven’s symbol,
moving leftward within,
containing the **qi** of wind and thunder—
this is the **Qīng Lóng**,
this is the **Zhū Què**.

The **Qīng Lóng** is the producer of **natural daylight essence**,
which descends to the **Lí** position below.
The **Zhū Què** is fire,
consuming and refining the **gǔ shí** [grain and food];
it corresponds internally to the **spleen**,
its **qi** spreading to the four directions,
its root residing in the **Kūn** position.
The **daylight essence** is **mercury**.
**Mercury** resides in the **Lower Dan Tian**;
the **Lower Dan Tian** is the **Yuan Yáng** [original yang] **essence sea** of humanity.
Because of its **Kūn** position,
**Tài Yīn** [original yin] is thus generated.
The **Tài Yīn** is the **earthly qi** rotating rightward,
also known as **water**—
this is the **Xuán Wǔ**,
this is the **Yuè Huá**.

Why is it called the **Lower Tian Mén**?
Heaven’s **qi** descends,
penetrating the four limbs,
all converging toward the **Lí** position,
where below there lies a **hole**,
named **Gǔ Shén**—
connecting above to the **Ní Wán** [brain marrow] **official**.
This is called the **holy gate**.
Within the **golden gate** and **jade door**,
there is the **mystic seal**—
the *Scripture* says: 'The root of Heaven and Earth.'
Is this what it refers to?

The **Sūn Zhēn Rén** said:
"From **Zì** to **Gān**, the **yang** numbers conclude;
from **Chǒu** to **Kūn**, the **yin** numbers are complete.
When **yang** advances and **yin** retreats,
they regulate the four seasons,
illuminating the waxing and waning of the five phases—
the principles of **cultivating the True** are none greater than this.

Thus, the two **qi**s can internally produce **natural white mist** with you.

When **daylight essence** and **moonlight essence** are refined,
they are called **Sì Xiàng** [Four Symbols],
also known as **Sì Shén Dān** [Four Immortal Elixir].
What is their method?

To ingest the **yang** **qi**,
gradually adding **leftward rotation** to the root’s position,
merging with Heaven and Earth,
naturally breathing—
this is the lesser effort.

From the hour of **Zǐ** to **Chǒu**,
victory is achieved.

The **yin** **qi** is **jing** [essence].
It is named **Chà Nǚ** [Astonished Maiden],
using the **Sān Chē** [Three Wheels] method
to transport it to the **Ní Wán** **official**,
thus, the **south and north** [yin-yang] **intersect**,
the **Four Symbols** are complete,
the five phases harmonize in cycle,
the eight **guà** [trigrams] arise naturally,
and the nine palaces align with Heaven and Earth’s **creative transformation**.

In its initial practice,
stir the **Tian Guān** [Heavenly Gate],
producing sweet dew below,
and proceed with full intent—
awaiting the **surging liquid** to flow upward,
this is the **Huá Chí Shén Shuǐ** [Divine Water of the Flower Pool].

What are the effects of the **yang** **qi**?
The **daylight demon** is already defeated.
The **killing qi** surges toward Heaven,
and in five days, the **navel** below gradually lengthens,
the waist and spine become unobstructed,
and the **front and rear** [orifices] function smoothly.
In three months, the **navel** below expands.
All impurities within the **navel** are removed.
After six months, the expansion continues—
adding to the sixth and seventh months,
the expansion is a **drainage and transformation**.
The **root of illness** and **noxious worms** all emerge.
At nine months, the expansion continues again,
and the **blood descends**—
like the droppings of a parrot.
At eighteen months, the **old skin** peels away like bran,
the **external kidneys** are suppressed and ache,
until three years, when the abdomen feels like a **pile** [hemorrhoid].
This is the **root of the illness** seeking release.
Or, if the body becomes **withered**,
it is the **gǔ qi**, **wind qi**, and **yin qi** desiring to emerge.
From the abdomen to the waist,
and throughout the entire body,
the pain connects to the heart.
This is the **response of the medicine**.

There are no restrictions on food and drink—
after one year, the **abdominal pouch** grows long,
and the body becomes light and agile.
In the **third vertebra** on either side, if there is **coarse dissolution** and heaviness,
it is the **yin poison** of the five **zàng** [viscera].

Or a **sore** may form in the mouth,
or the body may grow coarse and rough,
or the beard and eyebrows may fall and droop.
This is the **response of the medicine**—
with practice, it heals in five days.

After two years, hair and hairline wither and fall;
with time, the body becomes smooth and luminous.

What are the effects of **yin qi**?
If the tongue is sometimes stiff,
it is the **sign** of **yang qi** in motion.
At six years, the body grows cold—
this is the **sign** of **earth qi** ascending.

Or, if after five days or six days,
the joints of the bones ache,
it is the **sign** of the **three hundred and sixty bone joints** expanding.
After a hundred days, the body becomes light,
the **body fluids** grow sweet,
the two **kidneys** quiver,
and the area below the **navel** feels like boiling water.

In two years, the **head** increases by seventy-two bones,
and the **anterior and posterior waves** emerge—
like the **jelly of a bean** or **peach**,
which, when exposed to **fire**, becomes **body fluids**,
and can be used as a **great medicine**.

By three years, the body is light and agile,
as if without form,
and **cold and heat** cannot penetrate it.

The *Classic* says:
*"Open its **fui** [mouth], close its **men** [gate],
and it will never falter all its life;
block its **fui**, and it will fail to complete its task,
and never be saved all its life."*

Thus, the adept at **closing** [men] has no need for locks,
and the **six bandits** [evil influences] cannot breach it.

This is the **holy water**—
the **gold within water**.
Refining it through **fire** repeatedly,
this is the **earth**—
without **earth**, one must not act rashly.

**Five Precepts Section**
The harm of **imperfect life** is nothing greater than **desire**;
to preserve the **true essence** [shén], one must guard the **celestial field** [tiāngǔ].

The **Pure Yang Master** Lü Dongbin says:
*"The **celestial yang** [heavenly yang],
the **terrene yin** [earthly yin],
the **qi of things**,
the **human nature**,
the **foundation of Dao/Way**,
the **source of virtue/power**,
the **ancestor of the body**,
the **root of life**,
the **form of the dragon**,
the **shape of the tiger**,
the **name of essence-blood**,
the **first of lead and mercury**—
when the **soul** appears, it becomes **three**,
when the **spirit** meets, it becomes **seven**;
this is the **true source of unity**.*

Within my body,
refine the **elixir field qi** [dāntián qì],
and generate the **natural spirit** [zìrán shén]
within the **twelve time-periods** [shí].
Guard the **true essence of unity** [tiānzhēn yīqì],
enter the **palace of the elixir field** [dāntián gōng],
where **internally there is no thought**,
and **externally there is no intention**—
neither exiting nor entering,
neither going nor coming,
the **spirit** steadies and finds peace.

This is the **method of true unity**.

The **preserver of life** is **authenticity** [zhēn];
the **entrance to emptiness** is **spirit**—
when **inner and outer** merge harmoniously,
the **embryonic spirit** [tāilíng] is nurtured.
Scholars who do not understand this
and perish in **other sects** are truly lamentable.

The **Dao of preserving life and attaining spiritual emptiness** lies in:
extinguishing **emotional attachments** [qíng’ài],
removing **hatred and aversion** [zēngwù],
guarding the **true essence** within the **celestial field**,
circulating the **three luminaries** [sānyuè] in the **Red Courtyard** [Chìtíng],
and thus regulating the **five types of qi** [wǔqì].

The **Eight Trigrams** gather their **numinous essence** [líng] at **Mao-Wei** [the hours of 5–7 AM and 5–7 PM],
and the **Nine Heavens** align their **degrees** [dù] with **day and night** [zhòuyè].
In nine years, one may attain **non-action** [wúwéi].

I have **five precepts**—
these are the **foundations of the Great Dao**:
**Cease all thought and deliberation** [juésī lǜ],
and daily preserve **inner qi**;
**Avoid all desires** [jiè wànyù],
and daily preserve **heart qi**;
**Moderate tastes** [bó zīwèi],
and daily preserve **blood qi**;
**Return the body fluids** [huán jīnyè],
and this is **nurturing the embryonic root** [yù línggēn];
**Guard the celestial field** [shǒu tiāngǔ],
and this is **settling the embryonic spirit** [ān tāishén].

**Five Phases Section**
The **trigrams of the Nine Heavens** [zhōutiān gǔ]
must be followed to **perform their functions** [xínggōng],
and the **marvels of the Five Phases** [wǔxíng]
are put to use in **accumulation and nourishment** [túnméng].

The **Master of Wandering** says:
*"There is no greater Dao than the Five Phases."*

**Water** is born in **Shēn** [the hour of 9–11 PM],
reigns in **Zǐ** [the hour of 11 PM–1 AM],
and is stored in **Chén** [the hour of 7–9 AM],
so **Shēn, Zǐ, Chén** are the **domain of water**.

**Fire** is born in **Yín** [the hour of 1–3 AM],
reigns in **Wǔ** [the hour of 11 AM–1 PM],
and is stored in **Xiū** [the hour of 9–11 PM],
so **Yín, Wǔ, Xiū** are the **domain of fire**.

**Metal** is born in **Wèi** [the hour of 3–5 PM],
reigns in **Yǒu** [the hour of 5–7 PM],
and is stored in **Chǒu** [the hour of 1–3 AM],
so **Wèi, Yǒu, Chǒu** are the **domain of metal**.

**Wood** is born in **Hài** [the hour of 11 PM–1 AM],
reigns in **Mǎo** [the hour of 5–7 AM],
and is stored in **Wèi** [the hour of 3–5 PM],
so **Hài, Mǎo, Wèi** are the **domain of wood**.

The **domain of earth** is the same as that of **water**.

At the time when **one yang first stirs** [yīyáng chūdòng]
and **kidney water begins to generate** [shǒngshuǐ shǐshēng],
one should **loosen the clothes** [pī yī], **sit upright** [duānzuò],
and **grasp and store the spirit** [wògù cúnshén].
Circulate the **metal essence** [jīng] in the **muddy pellet** [níwán],
and **brew and refine** [zào niàng] in the **marrow sea** [suǐhǎi],
performing this **elbow-post function** [zhìzhǒu gōng],
for **Zǐ** [11 PM–1 AM] is the **domain of water**.

Though **water** daily **moistens and descends** [rùn xià],
at the time of **Zǐ**, when it reaches its **peak of reign** [wángjí],
it **returns and contains the true qi** [fǎn hán zhēnqì],
and **ascends the stream** [sù liú] to become the **morning sun** [zhāoyáng].

At the time when **one yin first generates** [yīyīn chūshēng]
and **heart fire is about to blaze** [xīnhuǒ yù fén],
one should **clasp hands and circle feet** [dié shǒu pánzú],
and **settle the tranquil spirit** [ān jìng shénshí].
Transmit the **true unity** [zhēnyī] to the **elixir platform** [dāntái],
and **transform the jade nectar** [yuèyè] in the **blood sea** [xuèhǎi],
performing this **intercourse function** [jiāohé gōng],
for **Wǔ** [11 AM–1 PM] is the **domain of fire**.

Though **fire** daily **flares and ascends** [yán shàng],
at the time of **Wǔ**, when it reaches its **peak of reign** [wángjí],
it **returns and covers the true nectar** [fǎn méng zhēnyè],
and **descends the qi** to **return to its root** [guīběn].

At the time of **Chǒu** [1–3 AM],
when **spiritual water descends** [shénshuǐ xiàjiàng],
one should **stir the tongue** [lǚshé] at the **upper throat** [shàngyè],
and **beat the jade nectar** [gǔ yǎn yuèyè] in the **pharynx** [yàn],
sending it down to the **heavy palace** [zhònglóu],
passing through the **liver and gallbladder** [gān dǎn]
and arriving at the **heart** [xīn],
performing this **nourishing-water-and-refining-nectar function** [yǎngshuǐ liàn yè],
for **water is diseased at Chǒu** [shuǐbìng yú chǒu],
and **Wèi, Yǒu, Chǒu** are the **domain of metal**.

**Metal** can generate **water**,
and is stored at **Chǒu** [1–3 AM].
Since **Chǒu** is adjacent to **Zǐ** [11 PM–1 AM],
it **unites with water** [hé shuǐ],
making **Chǒu** the place where **Zǐ’s water** is hidden.

At the time of **Wèi** [3–5 PM],
when **heart fire descends** [xīnhuǒ xiàjiàng],
one should **breathe nasal qi softly and continuously** [nǎiqì miánmián],
**absorbing more and exhaling less** [duō rù shǎo chū],
and **simmer and refine the nectar and blood** [pēng liàn yèxuè],
transmitting them to the **Yellow Courtyard** [Huángtíng],
passing through the **lungs and diaphragm** [fèi fǔ]
and returning to the **kidneys** [shèn],
performing this **nourishing-fire-and-harvesting-medicine function** [yǎnghuǒ cǎiyào],
for **fire is diseased at Wèi** [huǒbìng yú wèi],
and **Hài, Mǎo, Wèi** are the **domain of wood**.

**Wood** can generate **fire**,
and is stored at **Wèi** [3–5 PM].
Since **Wèi** is adjacent to **Wǔ** [11 AM–1 PM],
it **unites with fire** [hé huǒ],
making **Wèi** the place where **Wǔ’s fire** is hidden.

At the times of **Xiū** [9–11 PM] and **Hài** [11 PM–1 AM],
when **heart blood transmits to the kidneys** [xīnxuè chuán yú shèn],
and **yin qi** is sensed to **transform into essence** [gǎn yīnqì huà jīng],
this is the **extreme of yin flourishing and yang declining** [yīn shèng yáng kuī],
the **opportune moment for gathering fire and harvesting medicine** [jùhuǒ cǎiyào].
One should **adjust the breath and store the spirit** [tiáoxī cúnshén],
**close the mouth and swallow the qi** [bìkǒu yànqì],
and **gently press the abdomen** [wēi zǐ fù].
When one feels **heat in the navel and kidneys** [rè shèng],
then **lightly raise the body** [qīngjǔ shēntǐ];
if the heat is not yet intense,
gradually increase it,
until the **essence-blood returns to its origin** [huán yuán].

This is the **function of restraining yang at its pass** [lè yáng guān],
for **Yín, Wǔ, Xiū** are the **domain of fire**.

The fire of **Yín and Wǔ** is stored at **Xiū** and gathered there.
**Xiū** is adjacent to **Hài**, and wood is born at **Hài**,
for within **Hài** lies the **qi** of wood,
which can generate fire—
thus, it can rescue fire at **Xiū and Hài**.

Some say: *"The twelve celestial stems of the Daoist cycle contain only gold, earth, and wood, with no explicit water or fire. If not through extraction and supplementation, what sustains their alchemical refinement?"*

It is replied: *"The twelve celestial stems themselves embody the extracted and supplemented forms of water and fire. The art of extraction and supplementation lies in the moments of **Lún** and **Méng**—
clarified through the **Lún** and **Méng** hexagrams.

**Kǎn** is water.
Its first transformation is the **water marsh** node, its line at **Sì**.
Its second transformation is the **water-thunder** hexagram **Lún**, its line at **Yín**.
If one employs the **Lún** hexagram for extracting water,
then **Yín** is used.

**Lí** is fire.
Its first transformation is the **fire mountain** hexagram **Lǚ**, its line at **Chén**.
Its second transformation is the **fire wind** hexagram **Dǐng**, its line at **Hài**.
Its third transformation is the **water-fire** hexagram **Wèijì**, its line at **Wǔ**.
Its fourth transformation is the **mountain-water** hexagram **Méng**, its line at **Xiū**.
If one employs the **Méng** hexagram for supplementing fire,
then **Xiū** is used.

Thus, the twelve celestial stems’ application lies in **Lún** and **Méng**—
either extracting water to supplement fire,
or extracting fire to supplement water.
Hence, the subtleties of the Five Phases and the functions of alchemical refinement
are all contained within this.

---

From the *Seven Spirits Chapter* of the *Inner Canon*:

The words of the *Inner Canon* are vast and profound;
the five viscera and seven spirits hold their mysteries within.

**Qíbó** said: *"The five viscera harbor seven spirits, each with its domain.
What is meant by ‘domain’?
It is the human **spirit-qi**—
the liver harbors the **hun**,
the lungs harbor the **pò**,
the heart harbors the **shén**,
the spleen harbors **yì** and **zhì**,
the kidneys harbor **jīng** and **zhì**.

Why does the kidney alone harbor two?
It is not all the kidney.
The left is the kidney,
the right is the **Mìngmén** [Gate of Life].
The **Mìngmén** is where all spirits reside,
where the **yuánqi** [primordial qi] is anchored.

Thus, in males, it stores **jīng**,
in females, it secures the **bāo** [uterus].
Hence, it is known that the kidney has one domain.

The lungs are the covering of the viscera.
The heart is the essence concentrated among the five viscera.
The eyes are its orifices.
The heart governs the vessels,
the vessels govern the skin,
the liver governs the sinews,
the spleen governs the flesh,
the kidneys govern the bones—
this is what is called the domains of the five viscera.

Prolonged gazing injures the blood,
prolonged standing injures the **qi**,
prolonged sitting injures the flesh,
prolonged standing injures the bones,
prolonged walking injures the sinews—
these are called the five labors that cause harm.

A hundred ailments arise from **qi**:
anger sends **qi** upward,
joy slackens **qi**,
sorrow dissipates **qi**,
fear sends **qi** downward,
cold contracts **qi**,
heat disperses **qi**,
startle scatters **qi**,
labor exhausts **qi**,
excessive thought stagnates **qi**.

When the nine **qi** are not in harmony,
what ailments can arise?

*Volume Thirty-One*
*Collected by the wandering scholar Zēng Cùo*
*The Seven Returns Chapter*

Gold is affected by fire, fire is subdued by gold;
when their proper measures are met, the Yang is preserved while the Yin is lost.

The True Person of Hengyue, Chen Shaowei, said:
When gold is affected by fire, this is called *dan* (elixir);
when fire is subdued by gold, this is called *gong* (mercury).
Thus, *dansha* (cinnabar) is the utmost essence of the Supreme Sun,
the very substance of gold and fire.
When *dan* interacts with fire’s essence and the timing is complete,
and when *gong* blends with its original nature and remains whole,
they form the primordial *xuanyuan zhengzhen qi* (the pure and true essence of the Dark Origin).

The Seven Returns and Nine Reversions—different names, yet the same principle.
*Return* means cinnabar becoming gold;
*Reversion* means cinnabar returning to *dan*.

Some say:
The Seven Returns—*dansha*, belonging to fire,
transforms into gold through change.
Fire’s complete measure is seven;
seven transformations correspond to the utmost Yang Origin.

When *dansha* is refined#1 and obtained,
and fire is subdued to produce white silver—this is the First Return.
Taking one *liang*, all ten thousand ailments are removed.

When white silver is transformed to produce *dansha*,
and fire is subdued to produce yellow flower—this is the Second Return.
Taking one *liang*, the body harmonizes, the spirit clears,
and one returns to youth from old age.

When yellow flower silver is transformed to produce *dansha*,
and fire is subdued to produce green gold—this is the Third Return.
Taking one *liang*, one becomes empty and tranquil, emotions forgotten,
and the heart aligns with the utmost essence.

When green gold is transformed to produce *dansha*,
and fire is subdued to produce yellow gold—this is the Fourth Return.
Taking one *liang*, the body shines luminously,
penetrating both exterior and interior.

When yellow gold is transformed to produce *dansha*,
and fire is subdued to produce red gold—this is the Fifth Return.
Taking one *liang*, the transformations of nature cannot alter it,
and ghosts and spirits cannot perceive it.

When red gold is transformed#2 to produce *dansha*,
and fire is subdued to produce red gold—this is the Sixth Return.
Taking one *liang*, one is not drowned by water nor scorched by fire.

When red gold is transformed to produce *dansha*,
and fire is subdued to produce purple gold—
thus, the true Yang essence and primordial *yuan qi* are complete.
Then, with purple gold transformed back into *dansha*,
and fire applied twice in refinement,
one attains penetrating brilliance—this is the elixir of Reversion, the Seventh Return.
Taking one *liang*, form and spirit unite,
ascending beyond the Nine Heavens.
Taking nine *dans*, one attains the rank of True Person.

The method requires observing the timing every five days,
three observations constitute one *qi*,
combining the eight nodes and twenty-four *qi*—
this makes one hundred twenty days,
the period of the flying and hidden fire’s timing.

In general, one observation suffices for flying and hiding.
Within five days, four use *kan* (water),
and one uses *li* (fire).
Using *kan* means boiling with water;
using *li* means employing seven *liang* of charcoal,
always beneath the tripod.

There should always be seven *liang* of ripe charcoal, neither added nor reduced.
This is the flying Yang fire,
thus five days constitute one cycle.

**The Chapter of the Eight Precious Essences:**
The *Huaguang* tripod, sealed with six;
Nine revolutions of flying essence, emerging from the Eight Trigrams.

The True Person of *Taiji* said:
The Most High possesses the Nine Revolutions of Flying Essence,
the method of the Eight Precious.
In ancient times, Ge Xiansheng, Li Baba, and the Pang Family all practiced it.

The Wandering Scholar said:
Some obtained it from the *Yuju* furnace in Chengdu’s earth.

The method states:
Two furnaces, each holding one *dou* seven *sheng* half,
made of earth.
Once formed, seal them with *liuyi* mud,
let it dry in shade for ten days.
Then use the same mud again—
thus five times seven times.
The method for *liuyi* mud:
Powdered *mǔyè* (oyster shell), white stone pitch, mica powder,
magnetite, red stone pitch, and red ash—each two *jin*—
mixed with sour wine to form mud.
Add two *jin* half of paper, knead evenly.
The initial mud layer on the furnace should be one to two *fen* thick;
after five times seven applications, it should be one *cun* three *fen* thick.

The two furnaces are joined,
with three *fen* left exposed for drying.
Then seal them again with *liuyi* mud—
this is the *Taiyi Zhonggong Huaguang* tripod.

The second use of *liuyi* mud:
Powdered *qiāndān* (lead cinnabar) and *tiānjiāngzi* (celestine),
each two *jin* half,
and one *jin* half of ash-soaked paper—
mixed with sour wine to form mud.

Then select a remote mountain peak with flowing water,
and build the *danshi* (elixir furnace) so the water encircles it.
The *danshi* chamber:
length four *zhang*, width three *zhang*,
dug four *chi* deep, with three doors facing south and west.
The furnace’s mouth and face are curved.
The furnace is nine *cun* high,
constructed on the *bìzi* day, using arms and fine soil,
ensuring no gaps—
its height is nine *cun*, its top flat.
Once the mud dries, place the divine furnace within.
The furnaces are joined—one inverted, one upright—
four sides apart by nine *cun*,
modeling Heaven and Earth,
with twelve *shi* (hours) marked.

The four-six arrangement corresponds to *xū* (the trigram for earth);
the three-seven arrangement corresponds to *hài* (the trigram for water).

「The eight-two arrangement corresponds to *zǐ* (the trigram for water);
the upright nine arrangement corresponds to *chǒu* (the trigram for earth);
the twelve arrangement corresponds to *yín* (the trigram for thunder);
the eleven arrangement corresponds to *mǎo* (the trigram for wood).

Now, what are these medicines called?
Mercury (三斤) is the **Tàiyáng Liúzhū** (太阳流珠), the head of the **Xuánwǔ** (玄武), and the essence of *kǎn* (the trigram for water);
Male yellow (雄黄, 二斤) is the powder of **Gōuchén** (勾陈), the essence of *xùn* (the trigram for wind);
Cinnabar (朱砂, 五斤) is the **Tàiyīn Shén guāng** (太阴神光), the marrow of the **Zhūquè** (朱雀), and the essence of *lí* (the trigram for fire);
Sulfur (硫黄, 六两) is the **Zhōnggōng Téngshé** (中宫腾蛇), and the essence of *kūn* (the trigram for earth);
Northern indigo (北亭, 八两) is the powder of the **Bái Hǔ Suǒlín** (白虎索林), and the essence of *qián* (the trigram for metal);
Female yellow (雌黄, 八两) is the powder of *gēngxīn* (庚辛), and the essence of *duì* (the trigram for lake);
Alum (消石, 一斤八两) is the **Qīnglóng Jiǎyǐ** (青龙甲乙), and the essence of *zhèn* (the trigram for thunder);
Male white (木律, 八两) is the powder of **Tàibái** (太白), and the essence of *gèn* (the trigram for mountain).

Once pounded, they are further ground into fine powder.
First, spread **Tàibái** (太白) powder in the elixir furnace,
then layer **Qīnglóng** (青龙), then **Gēngxīn** (庚辛),
then **Bái Hǔ** (白虎), then **Yáng Lǜ Bì Téngshé** (扬绿碧腾蛇),
then **Zhūquè** (朱雀), and finally **Gōuchén** (勾陈),
filling it until level.

Pour the mercury into the mouth of the divine furnace,
seal the furnace’s lips with lead and cinnabar mud,
then cover and tightly seal it.
Use **Liùyī** (六一) mud to seal its exterior—
one inch thick with three *fēn* (分) divisions,
dried in the shade—
and on the day of *xū* (戌), move the divine furnace into the **Chǒng** (宠).
On the **Chóngyáng** (重阳) day,
at the hour of *yǒu* (酉), as dusk falls,
ignite the fire below.

The charcoal is cut into fist-sized pieces,
burned six inches beneath the furnace.
When the fire reaches the **Jiǔfú** (九伏) stage,
add more until the flames reach the furnace’s belly,
burning again until the **Jiǔfú** (九伏) stage,
then add more until the flames reach the furnace’s top,
burning once more until the **Jiǔfú** (九伏) stage,
before finally intensifying the fire at the sealing point.
For ten days, increase the fire daily—
thirty-six days in total—
thus completing ninety days and nights of burning.

Wait until the fire extinguishes,
then on the seventh day at the hour of *mǎo* (卯),
remove the furnace.
When it has cooled,
observe the **Líng** (玲)—
then nine-colored flying crystals will appear.

Use the feathers of a male peacock (*Yīngyīng*) to sweep the furnace,
then remove and grind it into powder.
One *liǎng* (两) of this powder is one dose.

Store it in a golden bottle,
submerge it beneath cold springs to dispel the heat’s toxicity.
After thirty-seven days, retrieve it,
placing it in a silver container,
which is then wrapped in leather.

Place it within steamed rice,
boiling approximately five *dǒu* (斗) of rice.
After more than ten days, remove it,
dry it in the shade to dispel the moisture’s toxicity,
then grind it again after two or three days.

This is the **Tàiyī Bāqióng** (太一八琼).

For those who wish to take it,
on the **Shàngyuán** (上元) day, bathe and purify oneself,
then use water infused with five scents to prepare the dose.
Tie the hair forward, clench the teeth nine times,
kneel, and pray:
*"Return me to my eternal form,
Restore me to my divine nature,
And fulfill this life."*

Sit in the **Lìwáng** (立亡) position,
ascend upon the white clouds,
soaring through the eight extremes,
reaching the golden gate in the west,
and ascending to **Fúshāng** (扶桑).
I have tasted the essence of the sun and moon.

Again, it is said:
*"Swiftly, swiftly, as the laws command."*

Thus, one may mix a single *chú* (铢) of the preparation with wine—or well-bloom water will also suffice.

When the dose reaches three servings,
the aged will return to infantile complexion,
the Six Palaces (六府) will glow with clarity,
the Three Fields (三田) will remain forever pure,
and water cannot float them, nor fire consume them—
they may then ascend and fly through the void.

The *Jiǔxiān Piān* (九仙篇) states:
The noble one discerns the subtle,
the Three Worthies (三士) nourish the hidden,
the carriage-driver holds the axle,
the cloak-wearing one shakes the collar.

The **Illustrious Master of Clarity, Leaf Fashan** (光辩天师叶法善), also said:
*"Those who cultivate longevity must avoid*
*scattering their thoughts, avoid vexation,*
*avoid attachment, avoid idle fancies,*
*avoid greed, avoid licentious desires,*
*and avoid dissipation—*
*only then may they succeed."*

The **Master of Water’s True Essence, Lao Gongyuan** (水元真人罗公远), also said:
*"Students of the Dao must first*
*kneel and strike the teeth,*
*to gather their spirit (神),*
*then visualize their Three Souls (三魂),*
*and assume the form of a true immortal.*
*This is the blessing of my body’s spirit (福神).*
*If the spirit is restless, illness arises;*
*if the spirit is scattered, death follows."*

The Illustrious Master of Clarity said:
*"Water and fire are the great medicines*
*of the ancient sages.*
*They are not found externally,*
*but reside within our own bodies.*
*The heart is fire (火), corresponding to *Lǐ* (离);
*The kidneys are water (水), corresponding to *Kǎn* (坎).*
*Thus, those who forge the Golden Elixir (金丹)*
*must rely upon the Dragon and Tiger’s water and fire.*
*First, cool the Kǎn-gate (坎户),*
*like water, then descend the Dragon and Tiger.*
*Then, regulate their interplay with measured degree,*
*and apply them with precise count.*
*Extinguish the heart’s fire,*
*and burn it to cure all ailments,*
*to replenish the void and the spent."*

The **Six Passages Master, Jìxíng** (六通国师一行), said:
*"For minor afflictions, use water—*
*do not wish to offend the kidney’s store (肾藏).*
*Maintain singular focus and guard it strictly,*
*and in seven days, all maladies will vanish.*

*For grave afflictions, use fire—*
*fire emanates from the heart,*
*descends into the left and right feet,*
*ascends to the left and right arms,*
*and reaches the head and eyes.*
*When fully kindled, it circulates nine times,*
*each breath encompassing the whole.*
*This is the so-called Fire of the Circulating Heaven (周天之火).*

*Fire has four forms:*
*There is the Fire that consumes the body (焚身火),*
*visualized as rising from the heart below,*
*to the pass of *Guānsuǒ* (关锁),*
*its radiance blazing,*
*fulfilling the count of nine nines—*
*it may then expel the Three Vermin (三虫).*

*There is the Fire that vanquishes darkness (敌阴火),*
*visualized as arising from the yin below,*
*and burning through the whole body,*
*fulfilling the count of three threes.*

*There is the Fire of the Spirit Tortoise (灵龟火),*
*where three flames ascend from its lower part,*
*to the Kǎn-gate (坎户),*
*then split into two paths,*
*left and right, following the inner soles,*
*to the toes—*
*five paths emerge,*
*and merge in a leftward spiral,*
*three revolutions, gradually expanding,*
*until they reach below the waist.*
*Then the Fire that vanquishes darkness*
*draws the Spirit Tortoise’s Fire,*
*and they combine in a rightward spiral,*
*three revolutions, gradually expanding,*
*until they reach the crown.*
*Then, nine points are struck upon the head,*
*and the former method is repeated nine times.*

*There is the Fire that subdues demons (降魔火),*
*for those with great illness nearing death—*
*then, with breath steadied, one sits,*
*as in the Spirit Tortoise’s method,*
*and leftwardly spirals,*
*to burn all demons."*

The **Master of Eternal Essence, Yǒngyuán Zhēnrén**, said:
*"When using fire, it is the heart’s fire (心火).*
*It descends to the left and right feet,*
*ascends to the hands and the crown,*
*and within a single breath,*
*nine revolutions are completed.*

*When using water, one visualizes*
*the black *qi* (气) of the two kidneys,*
*like smoke ascending straight to the crown,*
*filling the *Níwán* (泥丸),*
*transforming into water to wash it,*
*descending to the kidneys,*
*entering the Five Viscera (五藏),*
*and reaching the feet.*
*Having done this,*
*one lifts the feet,*
*and with intent, visualizes it returning to the kidneys.*
*For those with paralysis or festering sores,*
*first, it enters the large intestine,*
*and naturally, the limbs will move.*

The Illustrious Master of Clarity said:
*"The original intent of the Mysterious (冥) is above the nose,*
*not a single thread clinging to the heart.*
*The Gate of the Dark Mother (玄牝之门),*
*all matters are abandoned,*
*and one departs from their base perception,*
*with breath steadied, neither exhaling nor inhaling."*

The Master of Eternal Essence said:
*"The Gate of the Dark Mother (玄牝之门)*
*is where the nose and lungs converge,*
*and the inhaling and exhaling must be firmly guarded*
*to achieve stability.*
*From the nose to the brow,*
*from the brow to the crown,*
*then from the crown to the brow,*
*from the brow to the nose,*
*from the nose to the brow,*
*from the brow to the crown—*
*each three times,*
*and each day, perform this nine times,*
*until the count of eighty-one is fulfilled.*

*Why refine seven times seven (炼七至七)?*
*After forty-nine days,*
*one must naturally stabilize.*
*One period of seclusion (伏) without exhaling or inhaling.*

The Six Passages Master said:
*"Having established the method of stability (定法),*
*then cultivate the visualization of its origin (本).*
*The Mysterious Spirit (灵冥) resides*
*within the Golden Hall and Jade Gate (金堂玉阙),*
*as my own form—*
*when thoroughly observed,*
*then visualize the crown opening,*
*and yellow clouds emerging.*
*From the spleen’s upper part, they ascend,*
*and strike open the forehead at the crown.*
*Within a single breath,*
*this is done seven times—*
*three sets in total.*
*The left side opens upward,*
*The right side opens downward,*
*thus it is said: the yellow clouds fill heaven and earth."*

The Master of Eternal Essence said:
*"When the yellow clouds rise and strike,*
*men must strike left and cover right,*
*women must strike right and cover left.*
*When visualizing the sacred body’s emergence (高想圣身之出),*
*men press with the hand upon the right,*
*forcing it downward,*
*women press upon the left."*

The Illustrious Master of Clarity said:
*"Seven times seven (一息三七撞),*
*twenty-one revolutions per day,*
*until two lunar cycles (二旬),*
*when the yellow clouds may emerge."*

The Six Passages Master said:
*"I visualize my Mysterious Spirit (灵冥),*
*ascending upon the yellow clouds,*
*opening the crown,*
*sitting within the clouds,*
*and with utmost effort, returning to the crown.*
*With the crown sealed inward,*
*I re-enter the Golden Hall and Jade Gate (金堂玉阙),*
*visualizing its emergence and descent,*
*repeating this process many times,*
*before departing the body.*
*Then, the yellow clouds remain,*
*covering the crown,*
*and I ride upon the clouds,*
*looking down upon my form,*
*cultivating without relent,*
*until forty-nine days,*
*when a shape will appear,*
*like ink on water.*
*At eighty days,*
*its coming and going will be natural and unrestrained."*

Once the crown is opened,
the top gate is unlocked,
and warmth spreads both above and below.

The Illustrious Master Guangbian said:
*"One may practice this while lying down—
this is called the Sleep Method.
Its departure is like falling asleep,
its return like waking.
Cultivating the Dao must await the rise of yang energy,
and one must not dissipate it,
allowing the yang qi to act naturally.
Thus, when the first yang arises,
one should practice in a quiet chamber,
abandoning all green thoughts,
and visualize the five viscera’s deities—
the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, and Dark Turtle—
those vague and distant figures in the void.

The True Man of Heavenly Purity spoke:
*'The crown stores the Great Sun—
why forty-five cycles?
Is this the method of swallowing the luminous essence of sun and moon?*

At dawn, when the sun first rises,
sit facing east,
visualizing the sun as a chariot wheel,
gradually approaching until it reaches the mouth—
then swallow it seventy-two times.
Let it descend to below the navel,
using the River Vehicle to reverse its ascent
until it enters the crown.
After seventy-two days,
one may then harvest the moon’s luminous essence.

Each month, after the eighth day (upper crescent),
sit facing the moon at dusk,
visualizing its luminous essence entering the mouth—
swallow it eighty-one times.
Cease after the twenty-third day (lower crescent).
Await the next month’s upper and lower crescents to repeat this.
After eighty-one days,
this is called *loading the sun and embracing the moon.*

I have another method:
At the *mao* hour (5–7 AM),
sit facing east, visualizing the sun as a bright mirror,
gradually approaching until it reaches the nostrils—
draw it in through the Mysterious Feminine,
letting it descend to the abdomen,
then reverse it with the River Vehicle.

At noon,
sit facing west, visualizing the sun as a suspended mirror,
tilting the head back to draw it in through the nostrils
into the Mysterious Feminine,
then reversing it with the River Vehicle.

As the sun sets,
sit facing west, visualizing it approaching,
drawing it in through the nostrils
into the Sea of Essence,
then reversing it with the River Vehicle
until it reaches the crown’s rear.
In the second and eighth months,
at night,
visualize the moon as a mirror,
descending into the nostrils
until it reaches the Sea of Essence.

Or, when the sun rises,
sit facing east, visualizing it,
drawing it in through the nostrils without forcing—
lest the *ling* qi enter.
Repeat this forty-nine times each month.
This is the *jiu-wu* number.
Use the River Vehicle as a pillow.
The sun is used but not the moon—
the moon is yin, and thus avoided.

The True Man of Eternal Unity said:
*The sun is the spirit—
belonging to yang—
thus true immortals have no shadow,
being purely yang.
As for drawing it in through the nostrils without forcing—
this is indeed subtle!

Or, without using the River Vehicle,
let it enter the Mysterious Feminine
until it reaches the crown,
then bow three times upward.
Do this forty-five times daily,
from the first yang’s emergence
until the Spring Equinox—
this is the yang number.

The Illustrious Master Guangbian said:
*The sun is yang,
yet it employs the yin number—
eighty-nine, seventy-two.
The moon is yin,
yet it employs the yang number—
nine-nine, eighty-one.
This method is purely yang,
thus it uses forty-five days.
Without the River Vehicle,
it follows the Heavenly Dao’s leftward rotation,
from the Mysterious Feminine’s gate to the crown’s rear.

The Six Passages Master said:
*Below the eyebrows lie the five conduits—
the eyes.
They are named:
Blood Wheel, Qi Wheel, Water Conduit,
Metal Wheel, and Pupil Conduit.
Those who awaken within stillness
refer to the breath entering stillness and acting.

The True Man of Eternal Unity said:
*Within stillness, circulate water and fire through the eyes.

The Six Passages Master said:
*The Dragon-Tiger Elixir has three forms:
The first is to swallow one drop of saliva as the Tiger,
and one breath of qi as the Dragon.
Let the qi enter the Sea of Essence,
ascend to the Mud Pill,
and draw down heart-fire to refine it,
covering it with spleen-earth—
this is the Four Deities’ Elixir,
also called the Two-Qi Dragon-Tiger Elixir,
the Minor Circulation Elixir,
or the White Gold Elixir.
It can fortify the lower elixir field
and strengthen the Sea of Qi.

The second method:
Send the swallowed essence to below the navel,
above the Sea of Essence’s water surface,
forming a pill the size of a marble—
do this three times.
Use heart-fire to refine it,
covering it with spleen-earth.
Each pill requires three Dragons,
three Tigers,
three Fires,
three Earths—
twelve cycles correspond to the twelve hours,
nine pills to the nine regions—
this is the one-hundred-eighty number.

The third method:
As before, enter stillness,
and when the eyes flash,
saliva will naturally rise like ice and snow,
entering the mouth.
If it first descends from the mouth’s corner,
visualize it as the Tiger.
Then, within stillness, let the eyes flash again—
fire sparks will descend,
visualize these as the Dragon.
Thus, the Dragon emerges from fire,
the Tiger from water.

When the five viscera interact,
first let the Tiger reside in the mouth,
then emit the fire Dragon.
Why?
The descending fire is swallowed from the left,
reaching the spleen,
transforming into the Dragon,
exiting the liver’s right,
entering the left,
then descending to the spleen,
circling three times to the right—
this is *plowing the spleen.*

The descending water is swallowed from the right,
reaching the lungs,
transforming into the Tiger,
exiting the spleen’s left,
entering the right,
descending to the spleen’s right,
circling once to seed it in spleen-earth—
this is *coming and going without leaving the earth.*

The True Man of Eternal Unity said:
*The eyes’ five wheels contain King Fire and King Water—
water is the harder to obtain.
Thus, first flash the water,
letting it descend into the mouth,
then flash the fire downward
into the liver.
The liver is wood,
its color green—
thus the Azure Dragon.
Water enters the lungs.
The lungs are metal,
their color white—
thus the White Tiger.

The Dragon descends from the left,
reaching the liver,
piercing the liver and exiting to the right,
then returning to the left.
The Tiger descends from the right,
reaching the lungs,
piercing the left lung and exiting,
then returning to the right.*

This is what is called the *interchange of the five viscera’s qi*.

Master Guangbian said:
*The Azure Dragon first descends by day;
the White Tiger acts only by night.
The Azure Dragon belongs to Yang, with twenty-four degrees in the day;
the White Tiger belongs to Yin, with thirty-six degrees in the night.
Thus, the day’s work is forty-six degrees,
and the night’s work is forty-nine degrees—
plowing and sowing above the spleen,
and nurturing the yellow sprout.
The yellow sprout is the root of life.

Master Yongyuan said:
*My body is like a cauldron.
Pressing my left foot upon my right,
and my left and right hands upon my body,
I empty myself like a tripod cauldron.
Concentrating my heart’s blood to cover it,
I then imagine and form a child.
Like my own form, at first it is like a sparrow’s egg,
with head, eyes, hands, and feet all present—
gradually growing larger,
kneeling and sitting within the sea of essence,
crossing my hands behind my shoulders,
raising my face and opening my mouth for two *shi*,
taking the yellow sprout grown above the spleen
as the food for the sacred embryo.

Master Guangbian said:
*The sacred embryo is not sought from without;
imagine the kidneys emitting essence-qi,
entering the sea of blood,
congealing and forming it.

Master Liutong Guoshi said:
*Those refining the sacred have a method.
Imagine the left kidney as the sun, emitting white *qi*;
the right kidney as the moon, emitting red *qi*.
Thus, the white *qi* enters the sea of essence,
transforming into the form of red fire;
the red *qi* enters the sea of essence,
transforming into the form of white water.
The sun and moon’s *qi* form the sacred body,
until within the sea, the red *qi* of the sun,
like fire, ascends to the spleen,
illuminating the body—
then turning over, entering the sea of essence and sitting,
once more imagining rising from the moon,
as before.
Again, rising upon the sacred body,
emitting light to illuminate it,
then turning over and entering the sea of essence—
so from *mao* to *wu*,
stepping upon the sun’s shadow a hundred times.
Each breath is one cycle—
this is the *embryonic breath*.

Master Yongyuan said:
*The left and right sun-moon *qi*,
gradually rising,
until reaching the Golden Hall and Jade Gate,
then covering the crown—
with the forty-five days’ worth of collected solar essence
to illuminate it.
The sacred embryo, illuminated by the sun,
should be immersed in water,
its light entering the five viscera—
all within a single breath,
thirty-six cycles per *shi*.

Master Liutong Guoshi said:
*Refine the spirit by day, release it by night.*

Master Yongyuan said:
*When the sacred body is complete,
by night it rises from the sea of essence,
riding purple clouds to the Golden Hall and Jade Gate,
observing each detail from crown to sole—
then imagining it exiting through the crown,
riding the purple clouds to stabilize the breath.
At the breath’s limit, it descends into the Golden Hall and Jade Gate,
then opens the breath again.
Repeating this fourty-nine times as it exits,
after ten months,
there will be two bodies—
their form identical,
able to leave the body and go where intended.

Master Guangbian said:
*When exiting,
from one step to ten steps,
then twenty, forty,
a hundred days to travel ten thousand *li*—
this is the Earthly Immortal.

Master Liutong Guoshi said:
*Stabilize the breath and refine the kidney’s *qi* for a hundred days.
From *mao* to *wu*,
as before, a hundred cycles.
By night, imagine the kidneys have two black *qi* paths,
entering the sea of essence,
transforming into black clouds—
the child rides them,
ascending to the left ear and exiting the right.
Each breath is one cycle of exit and entry—
nightly, thirty-six cycles,
a hundred days to become the Water Immortal.

Master Guangbian said:
*What is the Daoist sword of the immortals?
First, gather the essence of sun and moon,
then stir the heart-fire to forge it.
Sun and moon are the kidneys.
Thus, the lungs are the wind-horse,
the liver the furnace-coal,
the spleen the earth-mold,
the gallbladder the whetstone.
Within a single breath,
the method forms itself.

Master Liutong Guoshi said:
*Refining the five viscera’s essence begins with the kidneys.
Imagine black *qi* rising within them,
congealed and exiting through the ears—
as large as a canopy—
returning at the breath’s limit to the kidney palace.
Day and night, eleven cycles,
then after eighty-one days,
refine the liver.
The liver has green *qi*—
imagine it exiting the crown,
also like a canopy.
Its color is emerald-green;
returning at the breath’s limit to its viscera—
eighty-one cycles,
then after eighty-one days,
refine the heart.
The heart has red *qi*—
as before in number,
then refine the spleen.
The spleen has yellow *qi*—
as before in number,
then refine the lungs.
The lungs have white *qi*—
as before in number.
When the five viscera are complete,
the five *qi* rise together,
emerging from the crown in five colors,
their light illuminating a room—
thus one may ascend to heaven.

Master Yongyuan said:
*Refinement occurs in the seventh month,
when Water is born—refine the kidneys;
the tenth month, Wood is born—refine the liver;
the first month, Fire is born—refine the heart;
the fourth month, Metal is born—refine the lungs;
Earth rules the seasonal months—
according to the four seasons, refine the spleen.
Each *qi* requires eighty-one days.*

**#2 Transformation:** Originally *"Flower"* (改 from *辑要* as *"Transformation"*).
**#3 Say:** Originally *"Mouth"* (改 from *辑要* as *"Say"*).

**Dao Gun** Scroll Thirty-Two
*Arriving at the Wanderer’s Zeng Xuan’s Collection*
*Parametric Agreement’s Upper Chapter*
*Same Chapter, Different Words—some shallow, some profound;
Measure against Heaven and Earth, then one knows its intent.*

The Dao generates **One**,
**One** generates **Two**,
**Two** generates **Three**,
**Three** generates the myriad things.
*Thus, the principle of medicine is complete in this!*

Who can know the Dao’s beginning?
Only **Fuxi** can do so.

Therefore, there is the **Great Change (易)**—
the **Original Beginning’s (元始)** *qi*,
the **Transformation’s (造化)** function.

Thus, at the **Primordial Chaos (混沌)**,
the **Mysterious Essence (玄素)** nurtures within,
holding **True Essence (真精)**—
able to embrace what it embraces,
its nature unfathomable!

Water flows, moistening;
Fire adheres, drying.
If a person can penetrate the Dao,
the Dao also **penetrates the person**.

When **human** and **Dao** are harmonized,
this is called a **Sage**.

The **Mysterious (玄)** is the person’s unclouded state.
Truly, one does not know it can **nourish white gold (金)**.

When **One Yang (一阳)** dwells beneath **Five Yin (五阴)**,
it is the **Initial Nine (初九)**—the **Hidden Dragon’s (潜龙)** position.

**Mysterious Function (玄功)** returns to **One**,
and the myriad things are born from it.
Thus it is said:
*The kidneys are the **Supreme Pole (太极)**.*

Dwelling in the interplay of **Yin and Yang (阴阳)** while able to **transform and nurture (化育)**,
none surpass the **Sun and Moon (日月)**.
The **Sun and Moon** are the **Supreme Change (太易)**,
the **Ultimate Medicine (至药)**,
the **boundaries of Yin and Yang (阴阳之邪郭)**.

Thus, **Yin and Yang (阴阳)** embrace and nurture,
producing **white gold (金)**,
the **Dao of One**’s origin.

The **Mysterious** governs the **calm spirit and soul (静神魂)**;
when the spirit and soul are still,
**penetrating clarity (通灵彻视)** is achieved.

Once the **forms of things (物象)** are established,
this is called **Primordial Chaos (太初混沌)**.
When **One** *qi* is divided and unified,
this is called **True One (真一)**—
thus the **Nine and Two (九二)** manifest the **Dragon in the Field (见龙在田)** symbol.

The **Classic** says:
*Obtaining **One**, all affairs are complete.*
Thus, **True One (真一)** is the essence of the **marrow within bones (骨之髓)**,
the **virtuous maiden (淑女)** of *Guān Zhōu (关睢)*.

Therefore, those who achieve **True One** have
**jade-like substance and golden resonance**—
this is what **True One** refers to.

From **non-being (无)**, it generates **being (有)**;
from **being (有)**, it returns to **non-being (无)**—
the **root and foundation (根蒂)** of **Elixir Reversion (还丹)**.

If one seeks to forge the **Ultimate Medicine (至药)** yet does not know **True One (真一)**,
I have not seen one who succeeds.

To refine it,
one must examine the **Five Phases’ (五行)** essences.
Thus, **white gold (白金)** and **yellow sprouts (黄芽)** are the **medicine’s mother (丹之母)**.

**Mercury (汞)** compensates **gold (金)**—
not in the form of **mercury (汞)**,
but rather **golden petals (金葩)** condensed into liquid,
embracing **One** and holding **True Essence (真)** to escape the **Five Phases (五行)**.

Therefore, there is the **Great Origin (太始)**.
**One** governs **Fire (火)**,
**Two** governs **Earth (土)**.
The **South** is **Li (离)**, thus it governs **Fire (火)**.
Fire can generate **Earth (土)**—
without a fixed form,
it resides in the **positions of Bing and Ding (丙丁)**.

**Yin (阴)** is the **Dao’s foundation (本)**,
the **medicine’s base (基)**;
**Yang (阳)** is the **origin of form (始)**.
Before **mercury (汞)** transforms,
**Yang (阳)** cannot stand alone,
**Yin (阴)** cannot generate by itself.
Thus, **Yang (阳)** depends on **Yin (阴)** for its existence,
**Yin (阴)** receives **Yang (阳)** to conceive.
When the two are harmonized,
the **Great Dao (大道)** is fulfilled.

Fire generates Earth;
Earth nurtures the myriad things.
Thus, the **medicine’s use of Earth (土)** is to
enable **mercury (汞)** to grow and flourish,
as the **foundation of all things (基)**.

Earth’s count is **Five (五)**,
belonging to the **Spleen (脾)**,
encompassing the **Four Symbols (四象)** and **Four Viscera (四藏)**.
Thus, the **Five Palaces (五宫)** and **Five Emperors (五帝)**
wander through the **Nine Heavens (九天)**,
observing the Dao to generate **One**.

Therefore, **Earth (土)**,
dwelling in the **Nine-Five (九五)** position,
is the most **venerable (尊)**.

The **human’s spirit (神)** is **thirty-six thousand (三万有六千)**,
its **form and shadow (形影)** are **twenty-two thousand (万有二千)**,
its **essence-light (精光)** is **one thousand two hundred (千有二百)**,
its **soul (魂)** is **three (三)**,
its **ethereal soul (魄)** is **seven (七)**,
its **spirit (神)** is **five (五)**—
all relying on the **Five Viscera (五藏)**,
with the **Spleen (脾)** as their master.
Thus, among medicines,
the **virtue/power of Earth (土之德)** is most **venerable (尊)**.
For it can **transform the Five Phases (化五行)**,
and thus forge the **Ultimate Medicine (至药)**.

**Great Substance (太素)** is the **root (本)**—
when the root is established, the Dao is born.
The **Three Elixirs (三丹)** all draw from this!
Their **upper correspondence** is the **Three Heavenly Palaces (三天之宫)**—
this is called **Upper Clarity’s Fire (上清之火)**,
**Jade Clarity’s Gold (玉清之金)**,
**Great Clarity’s Earth (太清之土)**.

Their **west** holds **seven ethereal souls (七魄)**,
their **east** holds **three souls (三魂)**.
**Ethereal soul (魄)** is the **Yin’s essence (阴之精)**,
governing the **autumnal *qi* (秋之气)**—
the **austerity and killing (肃杀)**.
**Soul (魂)** is the **Yang’s essence (阳之精)**,
governing the **springtime *qi* (春之气)**—
the **emergence and birth (发生)**.
Thus, the **Dragon and Tiger (龙虎)** face each other,
**souls and ethereal souls (魂魄)** depend on each other.

The **Classic** says:
*Shock (震)** is the **essence of Wood (木之精)**,
the **cinnabar (丹砂)**.*

The **essence of Wood (木之精)** obtains **gold (金)**,
and thus merges to become the **Sovereign of Great Elixir (大丹之君)**.

Fire is the **father (父)**,
*qi* is the **minister (使)**!
The **determined scholar (志士)**—
only by discerning the **Five Phases’ mutual generation and succession (五行之相生更王)**,
can one achieve the **Great Elixir (大丹)**.

The **Classic** says:
**Three, Five, One (三、五、一)** are the **ultimate essences of Heaven and Earth (天地之至精)**.
Dwelling in the **Four Seasons (四时)** while able to **generate and complete (生成)**—
**Spring (春)** does this.
**Three**—how does it generate the myriad things?
This is the **transformative *qi* of Heaven and Earth (天地之化气)**,
which forms **humans, animals, and beasts (人物、禽兽)**.
My **myriad things (万物)** are **gold and silver (金银)**.
**Three** supplements *qi*,
strengthens **tendons and muscles (筋力)**,
and benefits the **spirit (精神)**.

**Kan (坎)** is **Yin (阴)**—
holding **One (一)**.
The **Yang stem’s (阳爻)** form appears **five (五)** times.
**Three** is the **Wood’s spirit (木之灵)**.
The **Great Elixir’s Dao (大丹之道)**—
this is its **mysterious gateway (玄关)**!

The **Supreme Pole (太极)** of things—
none fail to return.
Earth dwells in **Primordial Chaos (混沌)**,
like a **tortoise (鹦子)**,
divided into **Two Principles (二仪)**.
**Two Principles (二仪)** are **Heaven and Earth (天地)**,
**Qian and Kun (乾坤)**,
**Yin and Yang (阴阳)**.
Heaven is **clear (清)**,
Earth is **turbulent (浊)**—
the myriad things are nurtured within.
It is like the **medicine’s core (药之中)**,
where **mercury (汞)** transforms into myriad things.

Thus, the **Ultimate Person (至人)** first establishes the **cauldron (鼎)** to symbolize **Heaven and Earth (天地)**.
Then, the **Sun, Moon, stars, and constellations (日月星辰)**,
the **Four Symbols (四象)** and **Five Phases (五行)**,
are all established through the **cauldron (鼎)**.
When refining,
one must not lose the **stars’ points (星点)**,
embracing the **colors and symbols of the Five Phases (五行之色象)**,
and only then is it **perfected (至)**.

「Thus, when **Yin** and **Yang** do not interact,
the **Heaven** and **Earth** become sealed and stagnant.
If **Heaven descends** and **Earth ascends**,
mountains and marshes exchange their **Qi**,
their interaction is indispensable.

Hence, **Heaven and Earth** have **opening and closing (开阖)**,
the **Sun and Moon** have **mutual illumination (交映)**,
and the **Ultimate Person (至人)** follows this principle in action.
In **thirty-six decades (三十有六旬)**, one awakens and refines,
purifying and augmenting, merging and harmonizing.
This is the **Nine Transformations (九转)**!

When fully attuned to the **Four Symbols (四象)**,
one attains **spiritual transcendence (通於灵)**.
The **Four Symbols** are:
the **Azure Dragon (青龙)**,
the **White Tiger (白虎)**,
the **Vermilion Bird (朱雀)**,
and the **Dark Tortoise (玄武)**.

In the *I Ching* (**易**), they are the **Four Symbols (四象)**;
in the human body, they are the **four limbs (四支)**;
in **Heaven (天)**, they are the **four seasons (四时)**;
on **Earth (地)**, they are the **four cardinal directions (四极)**;
in **medicine (药)**, they are the **four divine essences (四神)**.

The **Azure Dragon (青龙)** is **Yang (阳)**,
the essence of **Wood (木)**, governing **generative vitality (生成)**.
The **White Tiger (白虎)** is **Yin (阴)**,
the essence of **Metal (金)**, overseeing **destruction (杀)**.
The **Vermilion Bird (朱雀)** is **Yang (阳)**, the **Sun (日)**,
with the **Fire (火)** essence,
dominating the **south**—where there is **Earth (土)**—
and in the **Jia (己)** stem, it nurtures **growth and expansion (生长)**.
The **Dark Tortoise (玕武)** is **Yin (阴)**, the **Moon (月)**,
with the **Water (水)** essence,
dominating the **north**—where there is **Earth (土)**—
and in the **Wu (戊)** stem, it subdues the **Three Excesses (三彭)**,
serving as the **foundation of the medicine (药之基)**.
