When Heaven and Earth respond in harmony,
Man prospers and attains longevity.

When Heaven tilts and Earth shifts,
All things perish.

Thus, the *Yijing* (易) says:
*Act before Heaven, and Heaven will not resist*,
*Follow Heaven after, and you will conform to Heaven’s timing*—
Even Heaven does not resist its master,
Who holds this Way.

What is called the *cauldron* (鼎) here,
Is not the ordinary cauldron—
Square outside, round within,
Its form like a chicken’s egg,
One inch in size,
From *non-being* (无) to *being* (有),
It contains the *chaotic qi* (混沌造化之气) of the *Creative Transformation*.
The *mysterious void* (幽阙) lies at its center.

The Yellow Emperor cast the cauldron on *Jīngshān* (荆山),
With precise measurements.
Its height is one foot two inches,
Its weight seventy-two pounds,
Its circumference one foot five inches,
Its base elevated two and a half inches from the ground,
The bottom’s thickness two inches,
The body’s thickness one inch and a half,
Its depth six inches,
The lid’s thickness one inch and a half,
Its handles one inch,
And its capacity three and a half *shēng* (升).

The top of the cauldron is *Heavenly Water* (天水),
Its bottom is *Earthly Fire* (地火),
And around its sides are the *Twenty-Eight Lunar Mansions* (二十八宿).

The fire of the cauldron cannot be used for refining elixirs,
For its defects are ten in number—
As *Grass Clothing Child* (草衣子) has spoken of them.

The eleventh is *The Furnace of Supreme Unity* (太一之炉).
Here, *Heaven* (乾) and *Earth* (坤) serve as the furnace,
And *yin* and *yang* as the cauldron.
Its symbols correspond to the *Five Sacred Mountains* (五岳),
With twelve branches of the moon,
And altars erected according to the *Big Dipper’s* (北斗) position.

The altar has three tiers,
The furnace has eight gates,
Its height two feet,
Its thickness six inches,
Its circumference three feet five inches,
Its gate’s height two inches,
Its width one inch and a half for twelve branches,
And its perimeter one inch.

Thus, the furnace is the *citadel* (城) of the cauldron,
And it must not be allowed for *evil qi* (邪气) to intrude.

The twelfth is *The Furnace of the Flowering Pool* (华池之炉),
With a black moon above,
White sun below,
And the *Gathering Monkey’s* (聚猴) seat.

Begin the work at *zi* hour (子时) in the month of *Jiànzǐ* (建子).
Use fire according to the *Eight Nodes* (八节).
Set up eight gates to correspond to the *Eight Winds* (八风):
*Winter Solstice* (冬至) *Beginning Wind* (朔风),
*Spring Begins* (立春) *Tender Wind* (条风),
*Spring Equinox* (春分) *Clear and Gentle Wind* (明庶风),
*Summer Begins* (立夏) *Hot Wind* (炎风),
*Summer Solstice* (夏至) *Bright Wind* (景风),
*Autumn Begins* (立秋) *Cold Wind* (冻风),
*Autumn Equinox* (秋分) *Hurricane Wind* (闯阖风),
*Winter Begins* (立冬) *Widespread Wind* (广漠风).

Thus, the Eight Trigrams are positioned outside,
With the moon on the right and the sun on the left.
My elixir weighs three hundred eighty-four *zhǔ* (铢).

A year has three hundred sixty days,
And twenty-four *seasons* (气).
Thus, the day’s portion is twenty-five *zhǔ* and a half,
With six *liǎng* (两) and six *zhǔ* (铢) and one *shǔ* (黍) as a parameter.

When *yin* and *yang* reach the *Winter Solstice* (冬至),
And the *zi* hour (子辰) follows,
The fire is ignited.
It ends at *kūn* (Earth Trigram, 坤),
And the eleventh month is the repetition.

Open the *Gate of Astonishment* (惊门),
And the *Gate of Life* (生门),
For this is the *one yang born at Winter Solstice* (冬至一阳生).
One *liǎng* (两) and one *zhǔ* (铢) and a half,
With six *liǎng* (两) and one *shǔ* (黍) as a parameter,
Until the month’s end,
When the yang grows to thirty-two *liǎng* (两),
Its *dragon* (龙) still hidden.

Use one *jīn* (斤) of *Great Fire* (大火) over three days,
Or four *liǎng* (两) of fire for lesser quantities,
And the *Three Corpses* (三尸) will vanish of their own accord.

The White Tiger cannot yet be captured or subdued,
The Azure Dragon henceforth soars and roams.
This is what is meant.

The twelfth month is *Lín* (临, "Approaching").
Open the *Gate of Injury* (伤门),
And respond to the *Gate of Closure* (塞门).
By the month’s end, the *yang* qi reaches sixty-four *shí* (时),
This is the *nine-two*—the Dragon in the Fields (乾卦九二).
Use eight *liǎng* (两) of fire,
For the greater measure, three days of *yang* growth to nine-two,
With nine-five above in correspondence—
The medicine congeals and solidifies.
Thus it is said:
Within the *Lín* hexagram, the Azure Dragon moves,
Like spring’s misty breath, rain descending.
The sea’s waves rise toward Zhòngpēng Isle,
The Jade Gate sealed tight, shielding from dust and wind,
The Four Symbols aligned with *wù-jǐ* (戊己),
Who would believe in the divine power of *yin* and *yang*?
This is what is meant.

The first month is *Tài* (泰, "Peace").
Open the *Gate of Astonishment* (惊门),
And respond to the *Gate of Life* (生门).
By the month’s end, the *yang* qi reaches ninety-six *shí*,
This is the *nine-three*—the Virtuous One advancing in virtue and deeds (乾卦九三).
The *yang* qi descends, mingling with the Rainwater,
Refining the *Tàiyáng* (太阳),
For the greater measure, use eight *liǎng* of fire over three days to manifest the realm,
For lesser quantities, four *liǎng* over nine days.
Thus it is said:
In the *Tài* hexagram, the two *qi* are balanced,
The true medicine in the cauldron, clearly revealed;
The Dragon’s roar and Tiger’s growl are truly heard,
Lightning flashes, thunder rolls—shocking and profound;
Spring’s realm awakens, true fire descends,
Seizing the sun and moon, entering the Golden City.

The second month is *Dà Zhuàng* (大壮, "Great Strength").
Positioned at *nine-four*,
By the month’s end, the *yang* qi reaches one hundred twenty-eight *liǎng*,
External fire must not be used.
Thus it is said:
Within the jar, the sun and moon nourish the vital essence,
In the cauldron, red lotuses surge with emerald waves;
Press close to hear the voice of the *Lǎonǚ* (姥女),
Infants see the medicine and scatter in awe.
This is what is meant.

The third month is *Yāng* (央, "Central").
Opening the *Jīng* Gate (驚門), responding to the *Shāng* Gate (傷門),
Positioned at *nine-five*,
By the month’s end, the *yang* qi reaches one hundred sixty *liǎng*,
This is what is meant by *"the Flying Dragon in Heaven."*

The large dose uses two *jīn* of fire for three days;
The small dose, four *liǎng*, for fifteen days.
Thus it is said:
To subdue the White Tiger is no simple task,
To tame the Green Dragon is no chance occurrence;
Within the boiling cauldron, purple powder ascends,
Witness the fire’s transformation of gold and lead.
This is what is meant.

The fourth month is *Qián* (乾, "Heavenly").
Opening the *Shāng* Gate (傷門), responding to the *Jīng* Gate (驚門),
By the month’s end, the *yang* qi reaches one hundred ninety-two *liǎng*,
Positioned at *upper-nine*,
Using fire of two *jīn* and eight *liǎng*—
When the fire is strong, three days suffice;
For the small dose, four *liǎng* over eighteen days.
Thus it is said:
Harmonizing *qi* and climate in accordance with the seasons,
Refining the Five Phases into the Primordial Official.
This is what is meant.

The fifth month is *Rèn* (娠, "Pregnant").
Opening the *Xiū* Gate (休門), responding to the *Shēng* Gate (生門),
The *yin* grows by one *liǎng*, one *shú* (铢), half a *fēn* (分), and six *yī* (黍)—
The *yang* likewise flourishes.
By the month’s end, the *yin* qi reaches thirty-two *liǎng*,
Using fire of two *jīn* for three days;
For the small dose, four *liǎng* over eighteen days.
Thus it is said:
In the *Lí* Palace (離宮), herbs are gathered for the Primordial Spirit.
This is what is meant.

The sixth month is *Dùn* (遁, "Retreat").
Opening the *Xiū* Gate (休門), responding to the *Jīng* Gate (驚門),
Positioned at *six-two*.
By the month’s end, the *yin* grows to four *jīn*,
Using fire of one *jīn* and eight *liǎng* for three days;
For the small dose, four *liǎng* over twenty-one days.
Thus it is said:
Turning the Source’s waters, listening to the water clock’s drip,
In darkness, the red lotus fills ten isles.
This is what is meant.

The seventh month is *Pǐ* (否, "Obstruction").
Positioned and responding at *yín* (寅).
By the month’s end, the *yin* grows to six *jīn*,
The large dose uses fire of one *jīn* for three days;
The small dose, four *liǎng*, for twenty-four days.
Thus it is said:
Yellow sprouts bud, golden flowers bloom,
White snow descends, the sea runs deep.
This is what is meant.

The eighth month is *Guān* (观, "Contemplation)."

The ninth month opens the *Shāng* (Injury) Gate, responding to the *Sè* (Obstruction) Gate,
Positioned at *mǎo* (Tiger).
By the month’s end, the *yin* grows to eight *jīn*,
Thus, one cultivates inner fire; the small dose takes twenty-seven days.

The tenth month is *Pò* (Decay).
It opens the *Jīng* (Startle) Gate, responding to the *Shēng* (Birth) Gate,
Positioned at *chén* (Dragon).
By the month’s end, the *yin* grows to ten *jīn*,
Using fire of eight *liǎng* for three days;
The small dose, four *liǎng*, for thirty days.

The eleventh month is *Kūn* (Earth).
It opens the *Xiū* (Rest) Gate, responding to the *Jīng* (Startle) Gate,
Positioned at *sì* (Snake), where the six dragons battle in the wild,
Their blood is dark and yellow—thus the Dao is complete.
By the month’s end, the *yin* grows to one hundred ninety-two *liǎng*,
The large dose uses fire of four *liǎng* for thirty days;
The small dose also uses four *liǎng* for thirty days.

*Qián* is the Heavenly Gate; *Kūn* is the Earthly Portal—
They are the sovereigns of *yin* and *yang*!
Arising from the month of *Jiànzǐ* (Establishing-Hai),
Each month has a hexagram, accumulating to three hundred eighty-four lines.
Thus the medicine is complete.

From *zǐ* (Hai) to *sì* (Snake), pure *yang* prevails—
This is *yang* seeking *yin*, water entering metal.
From *wǔ* (Horse) to *hài* (Boar), pure *yin* prevails—
This is *yin* seeking *yang*; water congeals, metal disperses, and enters water.
Thus, water obtains fire and ascends,
Metal obtains water and hides.
This is how they mutually restrain and condense into the Great Elixir!

Examine the years, months, days, and large/small doses—
The *yang*’s growth and the measured *qi* and *liǎng*,
Like the movement of lines, opening the gates,
Following the Dipper’s monthly stations—
Life and death have their seasons; do not transgress them.

The Primordial Lord says:
This is the Dao—first expel the realm of form,
To drive out the Nine Worms.
In three days, dreams cease;
In seven days, the child’s face is renewed.

*Dao Shū* Volume Thirty-Six concludes.
*Dao Shū* Volume Thirty-Seven.

The *Dao Shū* now turns to **Master Chui’s** *Youzi’s Collection of Alchemical Secrets*—
**Chapter One of the *Yào Jìng* (Pharmaceutical Mirror)**.

Its three chapters’ marvels all center on **nurturing the spirit** (*cún shén*);
We record its words together, yet each traces its own truth.

Master Chui says:
At the **Primordial Chaos** (*hún dùn*)’s dawn, one *qi* gives birth to the **Two Principles** (*èr yí*—Yin and Yang),
And the **Two Principles** birth the **Three Powers** (*sān cái*—Heaven, Earth, and Man).
When the **Three Powers** stand, the **Five Phases** (*wǔxíng*) are complete.

The **Eight Trigrams** (*bā guà*)’s number is shared,
And the **ancestral roots** (*zǔ zōng*) dwell within the **Three Fields** (*sān tián*—Upper, Middle, Lower *Dantian*).
This is **Nature** (*xìng*).

**Nature** (*xìng*), the **Primordial Essence** (*yuán chén*) gathered—
Rejoices in movement, so outwardly it shifts with circumstance,
One birth, one death, cycling endlessly.
What may be cultivated to give life are called:
**Essence** (*jīng*), **Qi** (*qì*), **Spirit** (*shén*)—
Known as the **Three Activities** (*sān yè*), gathered to generate life.

The **Root of the Original** (*gēn yuán*) is the **Sea of *Dantian* Qi** (*dān tián qì hǎi*).
Now, the **male and female seminal fluids** (*nán nǚ jīng xuè*), when united, become one *qi*—
This *qi* is the **Primordial Qi** (*yuán qì*).
If the **Primordial Qi** does not disperse,
Then the art of **preserving it** is supreme.

With time, **purity and emptiness** (*qīng xū*) birth **spiritual radiance** (*shén guāng*).
When **spiritual radiance** flourishes,
It is the seed of **long life** (*cháng shēng*).

Now, when a person moves **restlessly** (*chōng chōng rán dòng*),
It is all **Qi**—not **Spirit**.
But when a single **true thought** (*yī niàn zhēn dìng*) is steadfast,
This is **Spirit’s inherent nature** (*shén zhī zì xìng*).
To examine this thoroughly,
One must discern **Qi** and reveal **Spirit’s true essence** (*zhēn niàn xiǎn huà tōng shén*).

How can my body differ from Heaven and Earth?
It too receives **one *qi***—no more, no less.
When **Qi** scatters, **Spirit** departs;
When **Qi** ceases, **Spirit** is still.
I will **preserve it** within the **Five Orifices** (*wǔ shū*—eyes, ears, nose, mouth, anus),
And **obtain it** through the **Five Forces** (*wǔ lì*—of the senses and internal organs).

What are the **Five Orifices** (*wǔ shū*)?
The **eyes**: their **white** belongs to the **lungs**,
Their **black** to the **kidneys**;
The **yellow** within the **black**, and its **upper and lower** edges, belong to the **spleen**;
The **emerald** within the **yellow** belongs to the **liver and gallbladder**;
The **outer corners** belong to the **heart**.

What are the **Five Forces** (*wǔ lì*)?
The **Spirit’s function** lies in the **eyes**,
While the **Five Viscera** (*wǔ zàng*) are linked to them.
It draws upon the **Lower *Dantian*’s Sea of Qi**—
This is the **root of the Five Forces**, their outward form.
Within, there are **Five Forces** too,
Taking the **Adamantine Nature** (*jīn gāng zhī xìng*)—
Within the **body’s Five Viscera** (*shēn wǔ zàng*), the **Five Phases** (*wǔ xíng*);
Within **form** (*xìng*), the **Five Colors** (*wǔ sè*);
Within **sound** (*shēng*), the **Five Tones** (*wǔ shēng*);
Within **Heaven** (*tiān*), the **Five Stars** (*wǔ xīng*);
Within **Earth** (*dì*), the **Five Sacred Mountains** (*wǔ yuè*).

To **unify the inner** (*nèi míng yī háng*) with a single **Phase**,
And **preserve it**, is to **manifest Spirit** (*shén*).
Its function lies in the **eyes**,
Its **Qi** in the **nose**—
To **still it** is the art’s perfection.

**Fire governs the South** (*nán*), its **stem-branches** (*gān zhī*) are **Bing Ding** (Fire and Earth),
And this is my **heart**.
**Water governs the North** (*běi*), its **stem-branches** are **Ren Gui** (Water and Metal),
And this is my **kidneys**.

The **heart** is the **upper Nature** (*shàng zhī xìng*), its essence lies in **suppressing the lower Fire** (*fù xià huǒ*).
If the **upper Nature**’s Fire does not flare,
Yet the **Fire** does not rise beforehand,
Then the **Water** will surely **leak** (*xiè*).

The **kidneys** are **Water**, the **Lower *Dantian*’s function** (*xià dān tián zhī yòng*).
By **fully preserving the kidneys** (*quán shēn*) to **guard the Sea of Qi** (*qì hǎi*),
The **root-source** (*gēn yuán*) is complete.
If one does not **preserve the kidney-Water** (*shǔn shén shuǐ*),
Then the **root-source** cannot be formed.

Thus, **Water** is the **flow downward** (*xià liú*),
The **common use** (*cháng rén zhī yòng*) of ordinary folk.
But **Water** is also **Essence** (*jīng*).
If one can **raise it** for **use** (*shàng yòng*),
Then the **Sages** call it **the Dao**.

The **heart** is **Spirit** (*shén*);
The **kidneys** are **Qi** (*qì*).
When **Spirit** is still and **Qi** harmonized,
The **True Person** (*zhēn rén*—the perfected immortal) descends.

Take my **heart** as the **mirror** (*jìng*),
My **body** as its **stand** (*tái*),
And **Spirit** as the **medicine** (*yào*).
Gathered, it becomes **sufficient** (*zú*).

**束** (*shù*—the liver’s *shén*) is the **east** (*dōng*), its use in the **eyes**;
**西** (*xī*—the lungs’ *qì*) is the **west** (*xī*), its use in the **nose**.
Thus, the **east and west** (*dōng xī*) are the **harmony of Spirit and Qi**,
Uniting in **returning to the source** (*huán yuán*) and **recovering the Original** (*huán jiù pò*).

When **Spirit** is insufficient and **Qi** unharmonized,
The **True Person** does not descend.

My **Spirit** and **Qi** must **struggle for inner clarity** (*yíng zhēng nèi míng*).
What is **inner clarity** (*nèi míng*)?
The **two substances** (*èr wù*—Spirit and Qi) **contending within Spirit and Qi**.

Thus, **Spirit’s radiance** (*shén guāng*) is **ever-active** (*rì yòng*),
Yet none know my **own radiance** (*jī zhī guāng*).
Hence, my **heart** is like a **mirror** (*jìng*).
Its **light** (*guāng*) **encompasses** things,
Yet things cannot **encompass the mirror’s light**—
Like the **eyes**, like the **heart**.

The **mirror’s light** is not **moving** (*dòng*),
Yet it is my **eyes** that move with things.
To know this is to **discern the *Yào Jìng*’s principle** (*lǐ*)
And how **things mutually encompass** one another.

How does the **heart-Fire** serve as the **mirror** (*jìng*)?
**Fire** is **clarity** (*míng*);
**Clarity** is **stillness** (*dìng*) and **inner clarity** (*nèi míng*).
When **inner clarity** is achieved,
All **ten thousand things** (*wàn wù*) are illuminated.

The **heart** is the **mirror’s essence** (*tǐ*);
**Clarity** is **Spirit’s function** (*yòng*).
To **daily preserve the Original** (*shǒu jiù bù lí hu shīn dì*)
Without departing from the **heart’s ground** (*xīn dì*) is **inner clarity** (*nèi míng*).
When **clarity** is achieved,
**Obscurity** (*mèi*) is overcome.

Thus, within the **heart**, **preserving the Original** is the way.
The **Three Poisons** (*sān dú*—greed, hatred, delusion),
The **Ten Evils** (*shí è*—ten unwholesome deeds),
And the **Eight Deceits** (*bā yé*—eight wrong views)
All arise from the **heart**.

The **daily eyes** (*rì mù*), **daily ears** (*rì ěr*), **daily nose** (*rì bí*)—
Called the **Six Passages** (*liù tōng*), through which **Spirit** constantly flows.
If one can **daily preserve the Original** (*rì yòng shǒu jiù*)
And **not depart from stillness** (*bù lí dìng jì*—even day and night),
Then its name is **Still Tranquility** (*dìng jì*).

**Daily preservation** (*rì yòng*) means:
**Spirit guards Qi**, gathering it without letting it scatter.
If **Spirit** can **respond universally** (*tōng yìng*),
Then wherever the **mind** (*yì*) reaches,
It will **manifest** (*chéng*).
When **Spirit** is still,
Day and night **cycle endlessly** (*zhōu*).

Thus, **Spirit abides** (*shén zhù*), **Qi abides** (*qì zhù*),
**Qi abides**, **Spirit abides** (*shén zhù*),
**Spirit abides**, **form remains** (*xíng zài*).

The **Five Phases** (*wǔ xíng*) originally have no **birth or death** (*shēng miè*).
Their **death** comes when my **Spirit and Qi** are lost.
What are the **Five Phases**?
The **true essence** (*zhēn yì*) of the **Five Viscera** (*wǔ zàng*)—
The **heart’s Spirit** (*xīn zhī shén*),
The **liver’s Hun** (*gān zhī hún*—ethereal soul),
The **lungs’ Po** (*fèi zhī pò*—corporeal soul),
The **spleen’s Yi** (*pí zhī yì*—intellect),
The **kidneys’ Zhi** (*shèn zhī zhì*—willpower),
Gathered for the **elixir’s use** (*dān zhī yòng*).

Human **Spirit** lies in **Nature** (*xìng*).
**Nature** is **Fire** (*huǒ*), which is **dispersal** (*sàn*—as in the depletion of *qi*).
The **Original** is **one catty** (*yī jīn*—a unit of weight),
Yet in **four years**, it scatters **one dram** (*sàn yī liǎng*—a small unit),
And in **forty years**, it **loses ten drams** (*wáng shí liǎng*).
By **sixty-four years**, it is **exhausted** (*jìn*).
Who can **gather it** without letting it scatter?
This is my **true Dao** (*zhēn dào*).

「All things arise from the movement of **qi** (*qì*), yet **Spirit** (*shén*) never moves. When **qi** disperses, **Spirit** does not disperse; when **qi** departs, **Spirit** does not depart. Life and death are **qi**—**Spirit** never experiences life and death.

If one can externally perceive the world while internally the **heart’s mind** (*xīn*) remains unmoved, this is the **inner response** (*nèi yìng*) of the **Law Gate** (*fǎ mén*), the **wondrous application** (*miào yòng*) of **Spirit**.

One must know that **True Suchness** (*shí xiàng*) lies beyond the realm of use or non-use, neither coming nor going. It rests in **tranquil wisdom** (*zhàn hù dìng huì*), harmonizing with the **vast emptiness** (*tài xū*) of Heaven and Earth. When **heart and Spirit** (*xīn shén*) are settled and clear, **Original Qi** (*yuán qì*) is stable and firm, and **Essence** (*jīng*) achieves longevity.

This is the **sublime efficacy** (*yào líng*) of the **Three Fields** (*sān tián*).
What are the **Three Fields**? The upper is the **brain** (*nǎo*), the middle is the **heart** (*xīn*), and the lower is the **qi sea** (*qì hǎi*), below the navel—commonly called **Three Wonders** (*sān qí*).
The **Three Wonders** are **Essence** (*jīng*), **Qi** (*qì*), and **Spirit** (*shén*).
When these three are complete, they return to the **lower elixir field** (*xià dān tián*), filling the **bone marrow** (*gǔ suǐ*).
This is the **work of transformation** (*zào huà zhī gōng*).

When **intent** (*yì*) is resolved and the body is realized, one attains the **true Dao of Immortality** (*zhēn xiān zhī dào*).

Yet, when one sees things and takes delight in letting go, this is the **heart** (*xīn*).
**Qi** is **Original Qi** (*yuán qì*).
It is obtained through **harmony** (*hé*), yet it scatters through **pleasure** (*yuè*).
Thus, when it disperses, it exits through the **gate** (*mén*); when gathered, it enters through the **gate**.
**Spirit** resides in the **eyes** (*mù*), while **Qi** is in the **nose** (*bí*).
Hence, the **eyes** are the **vulgar gate of the Diamond** (*jīn gāng zhī mén hù*)—the **Diamond** being **True Nature** (*zhēn xìng*).
**Qi** is **form-dependent** (*yīn xíng*), yet when **Spirit** is steadfast, **Qi** abides.
When **Spirit** perceives things and moves, yet the **heart** remains unmoved within, this is **inner stillness** (*nèi dìng*).
The **Diamond** is such that no external force can harm it, and it can gather **Qi** to solidify **form** (*gù xíng*).

When I have **desire** (*xǐ*), letting go causes **Spirit** to scatter, and the **Eight Evil Spirits** (*bā xié*) enter.
Thus, when the **heart** arises with duality, I cannot allow it to arise in vain—if it arises in vain, it will not be tranquil, and I will lose it.

**Essence**, **Qi**, and **Spirit** are mutually interdependent in their **substance** (*tǐ*).
How so?
**Essence** is the **ultimate source of life** (*zhì shēng zhī wù*), yet it has no **form** (*xíng*).
It relies on **Qi** to manifest **form**, yet within the body, it is **Qi**.
Beyond the **tailbone** (*wěi*), it becomes **Essence** once more.

If **Essence** can be steadfast in its **natural state** (*zì rán*), how can **form** decay?
Thus it is said: **Essence** is the **foundation of life** (*mìng*).
Those who can **prevent leakage** (*wú lòu*) are merely extending the **natural lifespan** (*tiān nián zhī shòu*).

If one follows the **principles of transformation** (*zào huà zhī lǐ*), then **True Essence** (*zhēn jīng*) is preserved, **True Form** (*zhēn xíng*) is solidified, and **True Spirit** (*zhēn shén*) is steadfast.
This is the **Dao of Longevity** (*cháng shēng zhī dào*).

Nowadays, people can steady **Essence** with the **heart**, yet cannot steady **Spirit**—they say, *"When water is full, it overflows; when Qi is full, it moves."* (*shuǐ mǎn ér yì, qì mǎn ér dòng*)

The world also knows that when **Spirit and Qi** are steadfast, they form the **Crucible** (*dǐng*).
**Spirit** arises from **Qi**, **Qi** arises from **Spirit**—if **Spirit** can guard **Qi**, then **Qi** can generate **Spirit**.
When these two guard each other, gathering to form **substance**, this is called the **Crucible**.
Thus, those who refine the **elixir** (*dān*) take from the **Original** (*běn yuán*), merging to form **substance**, returning to the **Jade Palace** (*yuán gōng*), nurturing until the **fetus** (*tāi*) forms, transforming into **True Form** (*zhēn xíng*), known as the **Shedding Immortal** (*tuì xiān*).

**Life** (*mìng*) is tied to the **Jade Balance** (*yù héng*), residing between the **Jade Cavern** (*yù dòng*) and the **lower field**.
There is a **Jade Spring** (*yù quán*) in the **lower field**, where **True Qi** (*zhēn qì*) gathers to become **Essence**.
When **True Essence’s Qi** (*zhēn jīng zhī qì*) emerges, it becomes **human form** (*wéi rén*); if it does not emerge, the **earthly root** (*dì gēn*) does not leak.
Refining it yields the **Jade Immortal** (*yù xiān*), thus preventing **leakage from the lower field** (*xià yuán bù lòu*).

One should understand how to **circulate and apply** (*yùn yòng*) this—following the **inverted flow of the Double Pass** (*niè liú yú shuāng guān*).
The **Double Pass** refers to the **two pathways** (*èr lù*) flanking the **spine** (*jiá jǐ*).
**Qi** is circulated upward to the **Upper Palace** (*shàng gōng*), which is the **brain**.
It enters the **Flower Pool** (*huā chí*), refining until it becomes **frost** (*shuāng*), reaching the **Azure Sea** (*bì hǎi*), which is the **elixir field**.
With this, **True Fire** (*zhēn huǒ*) is aroused, and through **forging** (*duàn*), it forms the **fetus of the Mysterious Pearl** (*xuán zhū zhī tāi*).
Thus, the **Mysterious Pearl** is the **True Qi** (*zhēn qì*) of the **Jade Palace**, gathering to become **Essence**, and **Essence** again forming **substance**—when the **Mysterious Pearl** is refined for long, it returns to **youth** (*cháng tóng*).
This is the **Dao of the Yellow River’s inverted flow** (*huáng hé niè liú zhī dào*), a **transcendent Dao** (*bù cháng dào*).

When the **elixir field** possesses **treasure** (*bǎo*), external matters **respond internally** (*xìng nèi*), and future events are **known beforehand** (*xiān zhī*).
Thus, **supernal and earthly harmony** (*shàng xià tōng líng*) is achieved.

The **heart** is the **seal** (*yìn*).
When the **heart** is not harmonized, the **seal** does not move.
The **heart** and the **seal** are the **root** (*gēn*).
The **seal** is **dust** (*chén*).
If one **severes the dust** (*jué chén*), one attains the **Immortal of True Emptiness** (*zhēn kōng zhī xiān*).
If the **heart** can be **removed yet not destroyed** (*chú ér bù miè*), one attains the **Immortal of Countless Emptinesses** (*shù kōng zhī xiān*).
If the **heart** and the **seal** are **neither used nor unused** (*bù yòng*), one attains the **Immortal of Void and Stillness** (*kōng jì zhī xiān*).

When the **heart** does not use the **seal**, nor the **seal** use the **heart**, the **heart** and **seal** dissolve and are extinguished in all **dust**.
The **common and the sage** (*fán shèng*) are not two—just as the **heart’s Dao** (*xīn fǎ*) is such that the **seal** never departs from the **heart**, and the two **mutually sustain** (*xiāng chí*), applying **transformative principles** (*yòng ruò zào huà*), one attains **True Yang** (*yáng zhēn*).
This is the **refinement of the elixir while preserving form** (*liú dān liú xíng*).

What is the **seal**? It is **Essence**.
When the **seal** is steadfast, **Essence** is generated; when the **seal** is severed, **Essence** is exhausted.
Thus, the **seal** arises from the **heart**, yet the **heart** is also generated from the **seal**.

Common people **use the heart** yet **do not use the seal**; sages **use the seal** yet **do not use the heart**.
If one neither uses the **heart** nor the **seal**, the **heart** will scatter recklessly.
**Scattering** means **Qi is disordered** (*qì luàn*) and **Spirit departs** (*shén qù*), while **Essence** disperses.

When the **heart** and **seal** are steadfast, and **Essence** is generated, then **Spirit** is clear and **Qi** is refreshed,
the **flesh** (*jī shū*) is radiant and **complexion** (*huá*) is lush,
the **eyes** possess **Spirit-light** (*shén guāng*),
there are **no dreams or nightmares** (*wú mèng mèi*),
**no delusions or fantasies** (*wú sāi wàng*),
**no startling or trembling** (*wú jīng jì*),
**no bewilderment or confusion** (*wú huǎng hū*).
All these are **manifestations of steadfast Essence** (*jīng dìng ér shēng*).

This **Dao** is the **return from the heart to the seal**, forming the **image of Essence**.
If one can **solidify Essence** as the **foundation of life** (*mìng jī*), then within **Essence**, **Qi** is produced to generate **Spirit**—thus forming the **fetus** and transforming into **True Form**.

What is **Essence**? It is **Spirit**.
When **Spirit** is steadfast, it generates **Essence**; when **Essence** is extreme, it generates **Spirit**—they **mutually consume** (*hù xiāng tūn*) and become **one**.
When gathered, they **generate**; when scattered, they **die**.

What is **Spirit**? It is **Qi**—also **mutually consuming**.
When **Spirit** moves, **Qi** responds; when **Qi** moves, **Spirit** returns.
When these two **mutually augment** (*xiāng chéng*), they **transform substance into pure Yang** (*huà xíng wéi chún yáng*).

The likeness of humanity follows the transformations of **Essence**.
**Essence** guards **Qi**, **Qi** guards **Spirit**, **Spirit** guards **Essence**—this is the **Way** of longevity.
When the body and mind are not greedy, nothing in the world can ensnare one—what quarrel could there be with clay?
Its name is **Retreat of the Body**.

When nothing in the world can cling to the mind, holding this as daily practice, its name is **Hiding the Spirit**.
Thus, one takes the **Three Primordials’** elixir-spirits and directs them downward to subdue **Fire**.
How does one gather the herbs?
**Spirit**, **Qi**, and **Essence**—they guard and harmonize each other.
With a single thought obtained, where do the three substances return?
They return to the **Root of Stillness**!

Where does the **Spirit-light** return?
The **Sage** returns it to the **Cinnabar Field**, while the common person returns it to **Emptiness**.
To return to the **Cinnabar Field** is to let the mind enter the intent and attain stillness, so that the **Original Spirit** sees things without moving, relying solely on inner steadiness.
But how does one preserve the dwelling of the **Spirit** when it decays?
**Master Cui** said: Thus there is the method of the **Great Elixir**.
At the **Cinnabar Field**, gather the **Three Qi** to form substance, and **Creation** produces **Spirit**; then the heart-nature wanders freely at ease.
What **Way** is this?
It is to **ride the River Vehicle** to the **Jade Gate**, offering the **Golden Essence**—
The **River Vehicle** is the **True Qi** of the North;
The **Golden Essence** is the **Kidney Chamber**.
Food enters the stomach, its dregs pass into the large intestine, its fluids into the small intestine, its **Qi** governs the **Cinnabar Field**, penetrating the **Brain Pass**, appearing at times within the **True Middle**, faintly and indistinctly#1, to irrigate the brain.
It traverses twelve paths, returning to the **Cinnabar Field**.
This is the foundation of **Returning to the Root and Reclaiming the Primordial**—the basis of life.
Thus, one opens the **Passages of the Sun and Moon**—why?
To gather the **Four Affairs**, then shake the **Heavenly Pillar**, steadying the breath, using the **Rolling Lucioperca** technique to circulate **Qi**.
This is the **Way of Rejuvenation**.
When ascending from the **Jade Pass** to the brain, entering through the **Upper Jaw**, reaching the **Nostrils**, and descending onto the tongue, its sweetness is reciprocated.
Like a **baby brother** drinking milk, it can grow to greatness—how much more so our **milk**?
During the hours of **Hai, Zi, and Chou**, one may practice **Fire**.
**Hai** is the tenth month, the **Kun** hexagram—**Kun**, the **Nurturing Mother**.
Old **Yin** reaches **Yang**, hence it is said: *"All things bear **Yin** and embrace **Yang**."*
At **Zi**, it becomes the **Fu** hexagram—
The extreme of pure **Yin**, yet giving birth to **Yang**.
This is the month of the eleventh month, when **Yin** yields to **Yang**.
I practice **Fire** at the hour of **Zi**, calling it **"Yang Born."**
From **Yin** turning to **Yang**, this is the **Half-Qi** meeting in the **Kidney Palace**.
**Chou** is the **Lin** hexagram, from its lower trigrams—**Two Yangs Born**.
**Yin** is the **Tai** hexagram, **Three Yangs** having arisen, continuing the work—this is acceptable.
**Fire** is formless, relying on **Qi** to manifest it.
Its light has **Spirit**, **Spirit** borrows from **Nature**, and **Nature** can transform—thus, **Spirit** is **Fire**.
It cannot be seen on its own; like fire in wood, it must be kindled to burn.
What is the method of kindling?
Close the eyes, sit upright, steady the breath, and calm the mind—
Thus, when **Spirit** is steadfast and **Qi** harmonized, the heart attains it, and **Fire** arises.
**True Fire** can refine the **Cinnabar**; do not act without principle.

During the hours of **Si, Wu, and Wei**, one may practice **Water**.
**Si** is the fourth month, the **Qian** hexagram—**Yang** at its peak, **Yin** arising;
**Wu** is the fifth month, the **Yun** hexagram—**One Yin** born;
**Wei** is the sixth month, the **Tuan** hexagram—**Two Yins** born;
**Shen** is the seventh month, the **Pi** hexagram—**Three Yins** born.
These three hexagrams are when one may practice **Water**.
Acting in accordance with the season, **Water** will naturally arise from the heart—why?
The heart is the **Root**.
If one remains serene and unmoving, the breath ceases and **Spirit** steadies, then **Water** will also arise from the **Kidney Chamber**.
Ascending to the brain and **Upper Jaw**, descending into the mouth, its taste is sweet.
With the heart’s **Water** ascending to the tongue, stirring it in the **Hua Pool** left and right, eighteen times each;
Rinsing and swirling in the mouth, thirty-six times, or without counting, standing straight and upright, divided into three, using force to swallow.
Thus, drinking **Qi** and swallowing it, sending it with **Spirit** to the **Cinnabar Field**’s left and right, bathing and irrigating—
Then the **Numinous Source** sprouts, and only then can the **Great Work** be accomplished.
For those practicing **Water**, the number twelve is used—each swallow divided into thirty-six.
Six times six is thirty-six, the number of **Water**’s cycles.
During the hours of **Yin, Shen, Mao, and You**, one may **Nurture the Spirit**.
What is this **Way**?

「Ever maintain the old **Way**,
With not a single thought straying, **Nurture the Qi** and **subdue the Essence**,
**Guard the Spirit** and **stabilize the Breath**,
Act in response to things, but do not chase after external **Realms**—
This is the **Way** of the **True Person**.

I take the **symbols** of sun and moon as **models**,
Yet prefer the **model** of the moon’s course to that of the year,
The **model** of the sun’s course to that of the moon,
And the **model** of the times’ course to that of the sun.
For the **model** of the times can **overcome** the sun’s **power**,
The **model** of the sun can **overcome** the moon’s **power**,
And the **model** of the moon can **overcome** the year’s **power**.
When I follow the **model** of the times,
The **True Person** comes to assist me.

With **inner** and **outer** **powers** practiced,
Mutually aiding for a thousand days,
There will be no **deficiency** in achieving the **True Person**’s **state**.
The **True Person** is one who attains **mixed** **dharma** and **fruit** as a **minor** **immortal**—
Yet without understanding the **method** of **refining the Elixir**,
One merely **abides in stillness** and **guards the old**,
Though perhaps the **madness of Yang** may be tempered,
At death, the **Spirit** departs—
This is but a **ghost**!

The **Spirit** is the **host**,
The **guest** does not dare to be the **host**,
Only the **guest**;
It does not dare to advance,
Only seeks to retreat.
In daily life,
It does not contend with things,
As if dwelling within beloved objects,
The **Spirit** ever remains as **guest**,
Guarding its **root foundation**.

If one **sees things** and **loves them** with the **Spirit**,
Using them as the **host** and binding to them,
Then the **eyes**, **ears**, **nose**, and **tongue**,
Within them, the **Six Emotions** arise—
Thus, the **True Self** is lost.

Therefore, those who **cultivate the True**,
Ever **guard the Spirit** in the **Cinnabar Field** and the **root of life**.
This has no other **method**—
When the **Spirit** is **harmonized**, it **guards the Qi**,
The **Qi** thus **guards the Essence**,
The **Essence** thus **guards the One**,
It does not dare to be the **host**.
This is **inner** and **outer** **Spirit** **stability**,
Thus there is no **arising** or **perishing**.

The **person** relies on **Essence** to obtain **Spirit**,
The **Spirit** relies on **thought** to obtain **life**—
Thus, **life** resides in **Essence**.
**Essence** is the **supreme True**,
The **origin** of all things,
That which has **name** but no **form**.

The heavens and earth, ten thousand things,
All are born from **Essence**,
And **accumulated** as **life**—
Its source lies in the **vague** and **dim**.

Master Cui said:
*The heavens and earth give birth to the **Eight Trigrams**,
The **Eight Trigrams** give birth to the **Ten Heavenly Stems**.
Thus, **Jia** gives birth to **Qian**,
**Yi** gives birth to **Kun**,
**Bing** gives birth to **Gen**,
**Ding** gives birth to **Dui**,
**Geng** gives birth to **Zhen**,
**Xin** gives birth to **Xun**,
**Ren** gives birth to **Li**,
**Gui** gives birth to **Kan**,
And **Wu** and **Ji** serve as their **complements**,
The **Central Palace** thus formed.

The heavens have **three wonders**: the **sun**, the **moon**, and the **stars**;
The earth has **three wonders**: **Yi**, **Bing**, and **Ding**;
Humans have **three wonders**: **Essence**, **Qi**, and **Spirit**.

The heavens’ **wandering celestial sphere**,
The earth’s **Yellow River**,
And the human’s **Nourishing and Defensive Circuits**—
These are the **manifestations** of the **three wonders**.

If my **three wonders** do not depart from the **body**,
Inheriting the heavens and earth while **circulating** and **transforming**,
I shall be **equal** to the heavens and earth.

**Water**, **Fire**, **Metal**, and **Wood** are **few**,
The **Four Seasons** are **long-lasting**—
This is the **principle** of **longevity**.

If one **inherits** this **principle**,
Then **life** can be **endless**.
Why?
The **East** is **Jia** and **Yi**—
**Jia** is **Qian**, **Yi** is **Kun**,
They are **husband** and **wife**.
The **South** is **Bing** and **Ding**—
**Bing** is **Gen**, **Ding** is **Dui**,
They are **husband** and **wife**.
The **West** is **Geng** and **Xin**—
**Geng** is **Zhen**, **Xin** is **Xun**,
They are **husband** and **wife**.
The **North** is **Ren** and **Gui**—
**Ren** is **Li**, **Gui** is **Kan**,
They are **husband** and **wife**.

**Zhen** corresponds to the **liver**,
**Dui** to the **lungs**,
**Li** to the **heart**,
**Kan** to the **kidneys**,
And **Kun** to the **spleen**.
When the **Four Seasons** enter as **medicines** into the **Cinnabar Field**,
This is how one **equals** the heavens and earth in **longevity**!

The human **Spirit** is like **fire** in **kindling**?
Within it, **fire** is **hidden**—
If the **fire** does not **emerge**, the **kindling** remains **long-lasting**,
If the **Spirit** does not **emerge**, the **body** remains **long-lasting**.

Thus, when **fire** **flares** and **illuminates** externally,
The **kindling** is **exhausted**;
When the **Spirit**’s **awareness** **emerges**,
The **primordial purity** is **scattered**.
If the **Spirit’s light** does not **scatter**,
And the **Spirit** **responds** to things without **emerging**,
It is **solid** and **complete**, preserving the **True Self**.

**Essence** is the **supreme True**.
When **Essence** **interacts** with **Spirit** and **Qi**,
It can **solidify** the **form**.
Let the **Spirit** **nourish** the **inner**,
Use the **Qi** to **nourish** the **outer**,
Rely on the **refined Essence** within to **balance** and **harmonize**,
Thus one attains **longevity**.

The **Spirit’s light** is the **hidden** within the **Qi**.
**Essence** is the **light**,
**Spirit** is the **wisdom**,
**Qi** is the **cauldron**—
These are the **so-called Three Treasures**!

The **Spirit** must not **depart** from the **body**,
The **Essence** must not **depart** from the **Spirit**,
The **Qi** **envelops** the **Three Treasures**—
Thus it **unites** with the **Three Realms**.

Master Guangchengzi said:
**Essence** is born between the **Sea of Qi**,
Like **fire** within **wood**.
My **Jade Spring** is akin to the **wandering celestial sphere** and the **Yellow River**.
The **Kun** **Trigram** and the **Fight Star’s** hour—
This is **Hai**.
Does it **transform** at **Zi**?
The **Fu** **Trigram** is **upper earth, lower wood**.
**Wood** is the **binding** **direction** among the **Five Phases**.
The **Lianzhen Star** corresponds to the **Five Phases** as **fire**.

**Fire** within **water**—
**Water** is its **form**, while **fire** is **formless**.
The **flow** of **Jade Spring** ascending—
This is **fire** within **water**.

**Symbolizing** **Kun** as **Fu**,
One **Yang** is born—
Thus, the **ten months** proceed in **order**,
Until the **eleventh month**—
This is **natural**.

All hours of **Zi** are the same.
**Zi** proceeds for **nine double-hours**,
Opening the **Passage** above and letting the **flow** descend,
The **Jade Spring** comes down—
This is **refining the form** with **golden liquid**.

When the **Five Phases** enter as **medicines**,
They are **fire**, **metal**, and **wood**,
**Combining** with the **trigrams** to **operate**.

When **Spirit** and **Essence** **merge** with the **symbols**,
They never **depart** from the **Sea of Qi**,
The **Essence** follows its **Spirit**,
And is **cast** into the **Sea of Qi**—
Thus the **cauldron** is **formed**.

When **Spirit** and **Qi** are **closed** and **retained**,
The **Qi** **attains longevity**.
When the **Qi** **expands**, the **Essence** ascends—
This is **the utmost marvel**.

The **Spirit** **responds** to the **Qi** and **follows** it—
This is called **fire**;
The **Essence** **responds** to the **Qi** and **follows** it—
This is called **water**.

When I **administer medicines**,
The **Qi** of the **Heavenly Gate** does not **emerge**,
Soft and lingering, as if **retained**—
Thus the **Qi** does not **depart** the **body**,
The **Spirit** and **Essence** **circulate** naturally,
Like the **heavenly fire** and **earthly water**,
With **water** below **fire**,
And **fire** below **Qi**.»

「This is the natural progression of the Five Phases. The seven upper orifices are the **Seven Celestial Officials**; the two lower orifices are the **Ministerial Stars**. This mirrors the movements of **Heaven and Earth**.

**Kunlun** is the **crown**; **Tianzhu** are the **twenty-four vertebrae** along the spine. Turning and moving the head left and right causes the **hundred vessels** to flow freely.

Opening the two **passes** means raising both hands. Lifting and lowering the body, as if bowing repeatedly, opens the orifices and allows the flow to enter the **Upper Palace**—the **brain**. Those who practice the **Dao** must follow their nature: close when closed, sleep when asleep, move when moving, yet their nature must not be **agitated**.

Always guarding the **Spirit** at the **Elixir Field**, one must guard it as if not guarding—this is the **true造化 (zàohuà)**.

- **乾六 (Qián liù)**, the **Large Intestine**; **坎一 (Kǎn yī)**, the **Kidneys**; **艮八 (Gèn bā)**, the **Bladder**; **震三 (Zhèn sān)**, the **Liver**; **巽四 (Xùn sì)**, the **Gallbladder**; **离九 (Lí jiǔ)**, the **Heart**; **坤二 (Kūn èr)**, the **Small Intestine**; **兑七 (Duì qī)**, the **Lungs and Spleen**; **土 (Tǔ)**, the **Central Palace’s Fire** and the source where **Earthly Metal** arises from **Water**. **Wood** arises from **Metal** within **Water**, **Water** from **Fire** within **Earth**, but only **Earth** harmonizes with the four **seasons’** transitions and dwells in the **Central Palace**.

---
**Chapter on Alchemical Refining in the *People’s Pharmacy* (人药镜中篇) says:**

I have obtained two works from **Master Cui (崔公)**. Both speak of **Original Qi (元气)**, which is **lead and mercury (铅汞)**. Refining it through **nine revolutions (九转)**, one attains **transcendence (成仙)**.

The first asks: **"Refining Refining (采药者)**, what is it?"**
When the **Dragon and Tiger** surge and **soar**, the **sun and moon** take flight.
The **Nine Curves (九曲)** are the **ancestral source of True Essence**, capable of distinguishing the **Two Polarities (二仪)**.
What are the **Nine Curves**?
They are the **Small Intestine (小肠)**.
The **Two Polarities (二仪)** are the **sun and moon**, the **True Mercury and Lead (真汞铅)**.
The **root of the Great Medicine (大药)** lies within them.

The second asks: **"Wood Mercury, Metal Lead (木汞金铅)**, what is it?"**
The **Original Qi of the Two Eights (二八之元)**—the **Essence of the Sun and Moon**—arises from **One Water (一水)**.
If I **extract and supplement (抽添)** at the **Two Eights’ Gate** without error,
Then the **Medicine Sea** reveals its **True Essence**, and the **Sun’s Radiance** descends.
Thus, refining it for **a thousand days (千日)**, it attains the form of **gold and jade (金玉之形)**.

The third asks: **"Refining the Supreme Medicine (至药抽添)**, what is it?"**
I **extract and supplement (抽添)** at the **two crescents of the Sun and Moon (日月二弦)**.
Using the **Red Dragon Fire Chariot (赤龙火车)** to refine it at these **two times (二时)**,
Then the **Perverse Wind (巽风)** arises, and the **stars align (星辰列)**.
These are the **two times (二时)**.

The **Fire Chariot (火车)** is the **symbol of Yang (阳)**.

The fourth asks: **"Dragon and Tiger: Lead and Mercury (龙虎铅汞)**, what is it?"**
The **Dragon extracts its mercury (抽其汞)**, the **Tiger supplements its lead (添其铅)**,
Floating and sinking within the **cauldron (鼎)**—both substances are complete.
Then I **combine with 坎戊 (Kǎn wù)** and **unify with 离己 (Lí jǐ)**.
I have **mastered the two moments of Yin-Yang Ascension and Descension (阴阳升降之二时)** to **activate the alchemical process (兴功)**,
Without losing even a **dram of weight (铢两)**,
Only then can the **Great Medicine (大药)** be formed.

The fifth asks: **"Seeking the Yang Crow (阳乌) at the Sea’s Depth (海底)**, what is it?"**
When it **flaps its wings (振羽)** at the **Sea** and **charges forward (奔冲)**,
Do not let the **Fire Spirit (火神)** take flight.
For if **Fire** mingles with the **Elixir Field (丹阙)**, it **extinguishes the Fire**.
By the time of **#2 Bathing in the Sun’s Radiance (沐浴之日)**, one can use **Yang Fire (阳火)**.
Taking **eight *liǎng* (两) of gold sand (金砂)**, this is called **True Yang (真阳)**.
This is the **pivotal moment of Reversion Elixir (还丹)**.

Then **Emerald Waves and Golden Tides (碧浪金波)** pour into **坎男 (Kǎn nán)**,
And the sixth asks: **"The Celestial Symbol (符星) enters the Primordial Palace (元宫)**, what is it?"**
The **Celestial Symbol** revolves and enters the **Primordial Palace (元胎之宫)**,
To **control the redness of the Lead Frost (制铅霜之红)**,
This is the **Qi of the Returning Elixir (金丹返)** and the **Celestial Symbol’s True Essence (天符还真)**.
Within the **cauldron**, **silver fluid (银液)** naturally forms—
Its appearance is like **water lilies (芙蓉)**.

The seventh asks: **"Fire attains Pure Yang (纯阳)**, what is it?"**
The **Pure Intestine (纯肠)** is **乾 (Qián)**.
When the **Gold Elixir (金丹)** reaches **seven returns (七返)**,
Then **Yang Qi (阳气)** surpasses the **sixth phase (六)**,
And **Regulating Qi (庚之气)** restrains it—
Thus **Autumn Stone (秋石)** becomes **琅牙 (Láng yá)**,
And **Lead Frost (铅霜)** solidifies into **Returning Elixir (返丹)**.
If **harmonized properly (合和有道)**,
Then the **Qi of the Nine Revolutions (九转阵和)** appears.

The eighth asks: **"Yin-Yang Restraint and Control (阴阳拘制)**, what is it?"**
There is a **Mysterious Pass (玄关)** for restraint and control.
When **Fire** reaches the **Southern Realm (南方)**, it ceases refining.
In the **坤 (Kūn) cauldron**, **Yang is restrained by Yin (阳为阴所制)**—
Its **lead (铅)** becomes **white snow (白雪)**,
Its form like **peach blossoms (桃华)**.
Refining it until **ninety-nine (九九)**,
Then **lead and mercury (铅汞)** are **settled at the Elixir Field (镇於丹田)**,
And can **overcome cold and heat (胜寒暑)**.
This is the **Iron Ox’s Clockwork Gold Coin (铁牛之锺金钱)**.

The ninth asks: **"The Galloping Elixir’s Auspicious Qi (奔腾瑞气)**, what is it?"**
Its **Qi** is **settled at the 坤宫 (Kūn Palace)**,
And the **Rainbow Chariot (霓车)** follows the **wind** in **reverse revolution (逆转)**.
Thus, the **root of the Sun and Moon (日月之根)** is obtained,
And the **yellow sprout (黄芽)** matures into **jade (玉)**—
The **Gold Elixir’s Yang nature (金丹阳质)**—
This is the **transformation of the Primordial Embryo (换胎)**.
With **Great Dao’s profound foundation (大道玄基)**, through **frequent refining by Fire (火频炼)**,
One **enters transcendence (入於仙)**.

The tenth asks: **"Tiger Crouching, Dragon Sharpening (虎踞龙铨)**, what is it?"**
It is the **crocodile that chases the Dipper (逐斗之鳄)**.
When **乾 (Qián)** and **坤 (Kūn)** **settle their positions (定位)** and reach the **lower crescent (下弦)**,
Then the **Qi within the cauldron intensifies (鼎之中生气加)**.
**Maid and Infant (姥女、婴儿)**—
Their **consumption of cinnabar (服绛销)**—
This is the **Gold Elixir’s child and parent (子母相成)**,
Where **Yin and Yang** **bind and do not disperse (结而不散)**.
Taking it for **a thousand days (千日)**, one **reverts to youthful appearance (返童颜)**.

The eleventh asks: **"The Nine Qi’s Complete Surge (九气冲全)**, what is it?"**
When **Qi surges fully (冲全)**, it **multiplies a hundredfold (百倍)**.
**Haze-light (霞光)** shines upon the **Divine Furnace (神炉)**,
And the **Yellow Grandmother’s (黄婆)** heart **settles (定)**,
While **male and female bathe in the cinnabar pearl (浴於绛珠)**.
This is the **Nine Revolutions** forming the **Mysterious Pearl (玄珠)**;
Taking it **once and refining it once (服之一圆)**,
One’s **lifespan reaches ten thousand years (寿千龄)**;
Taking it **twice and refining it twice (再服再炼)**,
Then **longevity and eternal vision (长生久视)** are attained.

The twelfth asks: **"The Jade Emperor’s Newly Sealed Supreme Position (玉帝新封剧位)**, what is it?"**
Refining it to **achieve 坎离 (Kǎn lí)**,
Then **Spirit-light (神光)** naturally **enters and exits (出入)**,
Hidden and revealed **clearly (隐显分明)**,
**Yang Spirit (阳神)** grows daily,
**Yin evils (阴邪)** fade daily—
Thus **longevity (长生)** is attained.
This is the **Jade Emperor’s seal upon the Supreme Unity (太一之君)**.

The thirteenth asks: **"The Nine-Year Tortoise Elixir (九年丹鳌)**, what is it?"**
After **nine years (九年)**, one **grasps Heaven’s Mechanism (得乎天机)**,
And **gallops ten thousand *lǐ* (万里)** without **erring (迷)**.
Refining it for **a thousand days (千日)**,
Then one **ascends in spirit (羽化)**.»

「The fourteenth asks: **"Extinction and Annihilation (灭没)**," what is it?
It is when my **cultivation (兴功)** encounters the **two phases of the moon (日月二弦)**, where there is **harm without benefit (有损无益)**.
Thus, the **cultivator (修炼者)** **perishes in extinction (灭没)**.
Hence it is said: **"The Dao (道) ceases when Yin and Yang’s phases converge (阴阳停泽二弦乎矣)**.
When the **two phases of annihilation (二没)** intersect, **extinction and annihilation (灭没)** occur together.
At this point, one **gathers and refines (会聚而炼之)**, and only then does **True Essence (真)** manifest.

The fifteenth asks: **"Gathering the Medicine (采药)**," what is it?
One **collects the metals (收金)** and **harvests the jade (采玉)**, borrowing **from Heaven’s Dao (藉乎天)**.
The **Primordial Yang Fire (元阳火)** and **True Qi (真气)** are combined and refined.
When the **weight of a *qian* or *liang* (铢两)** is sufficient,
Then **the Dragon moves and rain falls (龙行雨过)**,
And one **enters the Kun Spring (昆源)**.
**Yin True Lord (阴真君)** says:
*"There are times to gather (采有日), there are seasons to take (取有时者也)."*

The sixteenth asks: **"The Dao Knife and Rectangular Tablet (刀圭)**," what is it?
It is the **essence of the sun and moon (日月之精)**, the **True Qi (真气)**.
The **two principles of Yin and Yang (阴阳之二)**, with **Earth governing the birth of myriad things (土主生万物)**,
Are called **the Dao Knife (刀圭)**, hidden within the **cauldron of the Spleen (脾之鼎)**.
When it encounters the **division of the two Qi (二气分)**, **transformation (变化)** occurs.
Later, **Pure Yang Master (纯阳子) Lü Dongbin (吕洞宾)** once heard this from **Master Cui (崔公)** and sighed:
*"I now understand that **cultivation (修行)** has its foundation,
And that **life and nature (性命)** have no disparity—
The **Dao (道)** is achieved within this.
Thus, **Pure Yang Master (纯阳子)** further expounded and elucidated it.
**Pure Yang Master (纯阳子)** said:
*"In ancient times, the **Yellow Emperor (黄帝)** traveled throughout the four directions,
And reached the **Qingcheng Mountains (青城之山)**.
There he met **Qiběi (岐伯)**, **Guǎngchéngzi (广成子)**, and **Huánggǔzi (黄谷子)**,
And thus **illuminated the Great Dao (明大道)**.
Then he **mastered the Hundred Measures Method (究百刻之法)**,
Harvesting **gold, lead, jade, and cinnabar (金铅玉汞)**—the **Three Primordials (三元)**—
And **applying fire (下火)** to **concoct them (以烹之)**.
Within the **Hundred Measures (百刻)**, he **perfected the transformations of nature (为造化)**,
And only then did the **#3 embryo of the Rabbit (胎兔)** naturally form.
Indeed, the **Hundred Measures (百刻)** **settle the breath into one measure (定其息一刻)**.
*(End of the thirty-seventh scroll of the Dao Gears [道枢] #1
#1: Original text reads "手," amended to "卷" according to the *Jíyào Běn* [辑要本].
#2: "乎" amended to "於" in the *Jíyào Běn* [辑要本].
#3: "收" amended to "牧" in the *Jíyào Běn* [辑要本].)*
*(Thirty-eighth scroll of the Dao Gears, up to the section "Zhì Yóuzǐ Cèng Zǎo Jí" [至游子曾慥集])*」

**The Treatise on the Gathering of the True:**

The *Zhanghuang Afu Jing* (Imperial Mysteries of the Hidden Sovereign) proclaims the mighty words of the Dao,
Illuminating the path from past to future—
The gateway to entering the Way.

Huayangzi, Shi Jianwu, said:
Water, fire, metal, wood, and earth—these are the Five Phases.
They generate one another as mother and child,
They restrain one another as husband and wife—
This, all the world knows.

Yet few grasp the inverted laws,
Few perceive the principles of extraction and augmentation.

The Three Fields—Upper, Middle, Lower—
Of essence, qi, and spirit—
This, all the world knows.

Yet few attain the meaning of reversal,
Few witness the power of transcendence.

Only by mastering the inversion of the Five Phases
Can one enter the Way.
Only by knowing extraction and augmentation
Does one become a true adept.

Only by attaining the reversal of the Three Fields
Can one obtain the Way.
Only by reaching the transcendence of the Dao
Does one become a perfected sage.

I have observed those who attained the Way and transcended—
No more than ten or so in the Western Mountains.

Their essentials are twenty-five in number:
**Recognizing the Dao,**
**Recognizing the Method,**
**Recognizing humanity,**
**Recognizing the times,**
**Recognizing things,**
**Nurturing life,**
**Nurturing form,**
**Nurturing qi**—
**Twice, nurturing the heart,**
**Nurturing longevity,**
**Supplementing the inner,**
**Supplementing essence,**
**Supplementing qi,**
**Supplementing and benefiting,**
**Supplementing and diminishing,**
**True Water and Fire,**
**True Dragon and Tiger,**
**True elixir medicines,**
**True lead and mercury,**
**True yin and yang,**
**Refining the Method to enter the Way,**
**Refining form to transform qi,**
**Refining qi to become spirit,**
**Refining spirit to merge with the Dao,**
**Refining the Dao to attain sainthood.**

Ge Xian Gong said:
Buddhist monks are mired in stubborn emptiness,
Scholars cling to the present moment,
Unknowing that the ancient sages’ Way resides in the single mind.

Pure Yangzi understood this truth,
Thus he favored the School of Nature,
Cultivated the celestial rank,
And abandoned human rank;
He scorned stubborn emptiness
And awakened to True Emptiness.

This is why one must **recognize the Dao.**

**The Supreme Hidden Scripture says:**

Three thousand six hundred methods exist, yet only a few dozen nourish life.
The three thousand six hundred are for a decade’s span.
The few dozen are:
**Heaven One, Earth Two, Heaven Three, Earth Four,**
**Heaven Five, Earth Six, Heaven Seven, Earth Eight,**
**Heaven Nine, Earth Ten**—
the numbers of the Five Phases and yin-yang.

In ancient times, **Hua Tuo**#1 said that prolonged inactivity causes *qi* to stagnate and blood to congeal, so he observed the playful movements of the five animals and created *dao yin* to make the *honor* and *defense* circulate freely. Later practitioners mistakenly named this *bo yun*—a misstep.

In ancient times, **Chen Yi** entrusted his daughter to the Dao, imitating the turtle’s inhaling and exhaling, enduring a year of starvation without dying. Later practitioners mistakenly called this *fu qi* and sought elixirs—a misstep.

**Zhang Shao** said the five flavors disrupt true fluids; if one organ flourishes, another decays; if one *qi* thrives, another weakens. Thus, he abandoned the five flavors. Later practitioners mistakenly called this *xiuliang*—a misstep.

**Liu Dong** understood true yang and true yin—if in excess, he drew it inward; if deficient, he expelled its specter, supplementing and draining as needed. Later practitioners mistakenly adopted *cai ri jing yue hua* and sought the pure *qi* of Heaven and Earth—a misstep.

**Rong Chengzi** taught **Huangdi** the *fangzhong* arts, fearing he might dissipate true *qi* and neglect proper cultivation. Thus, he restrained him within the realm of desire alone—unknowing that sexual vigor consumes *qi*. Later practitioners mistakenly called this *yinren bu ren*—a misstep.

**Huangdi** cultivated at **Kongtong** but achieved no success.
**Guang Chengzi** taught external alchemy to replenish the depletion of accumulated yang. Later practitioners mistakenly sought to ingest lifeless metals and stones—a misstep.

**Pian Que** expounded the *Ling Shu*, saying:
Draw clean *qi* through the nose, expel turbid *qi* through the mouth, retain it for twenty-four breaths—this is one *liang* of fire. Use it to refine true lead like a *xie rui* flower, calling it the **Yang Embryo**; refine true mercury like a lotus in bloom, calling it the **Yin Embryo**.
When the embryo dwells in the breath, the breath stills, and the spirit remains. Accumulate thus to attain sainthood.
Later practitioners mistakenly called this *duo ru shao chu* as a method of breath retention, gathering *qi* into an embryo—a misstep.

The *Nine Immortal Scripture* says:
For grave illness, use fire; for minor illness, use water.
Using fire: inhale *qi* and let it ascend the body, spreading true *qi* through the Four Great Elements to repel yin evils.
Using water: inhale *qi* and let it ascend the body, making it surge like a gushing spring. Settle the mind and will the *qi* to the site of illness, then the *qi* and blood will flow freely without obstruction.
Later practitioners mistakenly closed the breath with the tongue as a pivot, rotating left and right, collecting residual saliva, rinsing and swallowing it, then transmitting it externally through the intestines and stomach, calling it *jiao zhuo* to nurture the yellow shoot—a misstep.

The *Communion with the Mysterious Scripture* says:
Hold to the Way of *wuwei*, attaining the principle of spontaneity—clear yet not turbid, still yet not motionless.
Later practitioners mistakenly clung to extreme stillness—a misstep.

The *Soul Treasury of the Numinous Treasure Scripture* says:
Exclude external phenomena, suppress internal distractions, close the eyes and gaze inward, lower the sovereign fire to the lower field, spread the yellow clouds through the Four Great Elements, and let the *sheng huang* carriages and attendants process to and fro.
Later practitioners became like withered wood and dead ashes, lost in torpor and dimness, with yin spirits escaping through the heavenly gate, only to return to rebirth—a misstep.

Thus arose further errors:
Opening the crown to shrink the tortoise, dwelling in mountains to recognize nature, burning incense, chanting scriptures, making offerings—all futile.

Yet one must know one’s own water and fire:
Fire contains water, water contains fire;
Fire bears yin above, vague and indistinct—this is the true One Water;
Water embraces yang below, obscure and murky—this is the pure Yang *qi*.
This is why one must **recognize the Method**.

The Daoist seeker must have a teacher.
**Zhang Menggan** met **Hai Chanzi** three times and attained three stages of the Way;
**Jie Zhi** met **Xu Jingyang** once and was granted the nine transformations;
**Wang Meng** met the **Great Longevity Immortal** and recognized the Great Dao;
**Mei Fu** encountered the **Great Cavern True Immortal** and exhausted Heaven’s designs.

Yet teachers may conceal themselves in silence or appear lacking in virtue.
**Huangdi** sought **Chi Songzi** for half a year, gaining only the *Zhong Jie Scripture* to guard against external loss;
**Liu An** followed **Wang Dao Hou** for a year, obtaining only a minor method, insufficient for cultivation, so he achieved only prolonged life. **Ma Ming** did not cease his studies despite his chronic illness, while **Ge Zhi Chuan** did not teach others despite possessing **Zheng Si Yuan’s** methods.

Thus, how difficult it is to **recognize the teacher**!
Some speak eloquently yet are tongue-tied;
Some excel in rhetoric yet lack depth;
Some affect ancient mien but are insincere;
Some are pure in essence yet flawed in detail;
Some appear foolish yet become sages in the end.
This is why one must **recognize people**.

Ancient perfected ones, before refining and transforming, first cultivated and nourished.
Ordinary bathing cannot compare to true bathing—what is this?
In a secluded chamber, still room, close the eyes and quiet the mind, sit upright to let the primal *qi* ascend, filling the Four Great Elements, entering the **muddy pellet**.
This is true bathing—
far surpassing external water and fire!
It aligns with the proper ascent and descent of yin-yang, the monthly cycles of the moon.

Spring brings growth, summer lengthens—yet plum blossoms and chrysanthemums flourish;
Autumn harvests, winter stores—yet cypress bears fruit and pine thrives.
If humans cannot cultivate true nature to refine the form, they shame the grasses and trees.

The crane knows the midnight hour, transforming yin into yang.
The swallow recognizes that *wu* and *ji* belong to water, avoiding earth;
The snake avoids the *si* day’s path;
The oriole emerges from its nest in spring—

「If humans cannot nurture the primal *yang* to store the true *qi*, they shame the birds and beasts. The unknowing waste their eight hundred and ten *zhang* of primal *qi*, yet fail to recognize that its *qi* manifests in spring at the liver, in summer at the heart, in autumn at the lungs, and in winter at the kidneys.

This is the great cycle that follows the heavens. The child hour (*zi*) belongs to the kidneys, the morning hour (*coi*) to the liver, the noon hour (*wu*) to the heart, and the evening hour (*you*) to the lungs—this is the lesser cycle that follows the sun.

The spring, summer, autumn, and winter of heaven and earth, the waxing and waning of the moon’s phases, the child, noon, morning, and evening hours of humanity—these all correspond. The days and months of heaven and earth, the days of the moon, the hours of the sun, and the degrees of humanity, are named as three hundred and sixty.

The *qi* of heaven and earth, the degrees of the sun and moon, and the hours of humanity—each has twenty-four, and these too are in harmony.

From the child hour to noon, when *qi* is generated, is *yang*; from noon to the child hour, when *qi* wanes, is yin. The hours of *zi* (child), *chén* (hour of the snake), *wu* (noon), *shēn* (hour of the monkey), *yǒu* (evening), *xū* (hour of the dog), *jiǎ* (first hour of the day), *bǐng* (third hour), *wù* (fifth hour), *gēng* (seventh hour), and *rén* (ninth hour) are the hours of *yang*; the hours of *mǎo* (morning), *wèi* (hour of the rabbit), *wǔ* (noon), *yǒu* (evening), *hài* (last hour), *chǒu* (second hour), *yí* (second hour of the day), *dīng* (fourth hour), *jǐ* (sixth hour), *xīn* (eighth hour), and *guǐ* (tenth hour) are the hours of yin.

*Chén* is the Greater *yang*, *mǎo* is Bright *yang*, *yǐ* is Lesser *yang*, *chǒu* is Greater yin, *zi* is Lesser yin, and *hài* is Reversed yin. *Xū* is Greater *yang*, *yǒu* is Bright *yang*, *shēn* is Lesser *yang*, *wǔ* is Greater yin, *wu* is Lesser yin, and *wèi* is Reversed yin.

Thus, at noon (*wu*), the *qi* of the kidneys and the *qi* of the heart intersect, ascending from below to above—this is the time when the three *yang* converge. At the child hour (*zi*), the *qi* of the heart and the kidneys intersect, descending from above to below—this is the time when the three yin converge.

The *hun* (ethereal soul) is *yang* within yin, its *qi* arising at the beginning of the morning hour (*mǎo*). The *pò* (corporeal soul) is yin within *yang*, its *qi* arising at the end of the evening hour (*yǒu*).

To nurture *yang* is not merely in spring and summer; rather, one must tend to its *qi* in the heart and liver. To nurture yin is not merely in autumn and winter; rather, one must tend to its *qi* in the kidneys and lungs.

After the summer solstice, true *mercury* (spirit of the heart) accumulates in the *Jing Palace* (vermilion chamber); after the winter solstice, true *lead* (spirit of the kidneys) accumulates in the *Dan Tian* (elixir field).

The Wood cycle converges at *Tian Wu* (heavenly mist), twenty-five degrees—this is *Xun* (gentle wind). When *yang* meets *yang*, at this juncture, one should gather it to form the Great Elixir.

The Metal cycle converges at *Ling Fu* (spiritual symbol), twenty-five degrees—this is *Qian* (metal). When yin meets yin, at this juncture, one should refine it into the Returning Elixir.

Thus, igniting fire to refine the form occurs before the *qi* ascends; gathering the Fire cycle is done at the moment of yin’s descent.

If one refines the form to dwell in the mortal world, then *qi* takes precedence, using the moments when the Five Phases (elements) mutually restrain. If one refines the *qi* to transcend the mundane, then timing is paramount, relying on the return of the Three Fields (triple burner) to their proper states. Those who see no progress are either failing to gather at the right time, to supplement when deficient, to consolidate when scattered, to seize when the moment is ripe, to seek without proper occasion, or to refine when the time is not yet returned.

This is why one must not fail to recognize the proper times.

Master Zheng Yang (*Zi*) says: The heart is heaven; the kidneys are earth; the lungs are the moon; the liver is the sun.

Master Cui Xuan Zhen says: The *qi* of the kidneys is the infant; the fluid of the heart is the elderly woman; the *qi* of the liver is *yang* within yin—this is the ethereal soul of the sun; the *qi* of the lungs is yin within *yang*—this is the corporeal soul of the moon.

What are the Four Symbols? The heart is the *Zhu Que* (Vermilion Bird); the kidneys are the *Xuan Wu* (Dark Tortoise); the liver is the *Qing Long* (Azure Dragon); the lungs are the *Bai Hu* (White Tiger).

Master Ge Xian Gong says: The infant is the *qi* above the heart’s fluid, the proper *yang* essence; the elderly woman is the *qi* within the kidneys, the true One’s water. The Golden Sage is the aged *yang* of the lungs; when its *yang* is weak, it must be restored to the lower elixir field. The remaining fluid is aged yin.

The kidneys’ *qi* reaches the spleen’s fluid—this is true yin approaching Lesser yin, its yin weak and declining, and must be restored to the lower elixir field. This too is among the Four Symbols.

Master Tai Bai Zhen Ren says: The Five Phases inversion technique—why does the Dragon emerge from within fire, when the Five Phases do not proceed in their proper order? Why does the Tiger arise from within water?

Master Hua Yang Zi replies: The Dragon is the binding of the *jiǎ* and *yí* (first and second hours of the day)—how does it emerge from fire? Indeed, the fluid of the heart is the proper *yang* essence, so it is said that the *yang* Dragon emerges from the *Li Palace* (fire).

The Tiger is of the west, the *gēng* and *xīn* (seventh and eighth hours)—how does it arise from water? Indeed, the *qi* within the kidneys is the true One’s water. So it is said that the yin Tiger arises from the *Kan position* (water).

The Dragon is fundamentally a *yang* entity, yet it excels in ascent—when it is within water, it is *yang* within yin, and thus is likened to the proper *yang* essence above the heart’s fluid. The Tiger is fundamentally a yin entity, yet it excels in swiftness—when it is on land, it is yin within *yang*, and thus is likened to the true One’s water within the kidneys.

Master Yin Zhen Jun says: Why is the proper *qi* of the north called the *He Che* (River Vehicle)?

Master Hua Yang Zi replies: Within the human body, amidst all yin, there is a single point of primal *yang*. When this primal *yang* ascends, it permeates the *bāo luò* (uterine vessels and meridians), thus generating the primal *qi*, which is transmitted from the kidneys’ *qi* to the liver, from the liver’s *qi* to the heart, from the heart’s *qi* to the lungs, and from the lungs’ *qi* back to the kidneys.

This is the Lesser River Vehicle. It ascends from the *Wei Jian* (tail interval), passing through the lower *Guan* (passage), the middle *Guan*, and the upper *Guan*;」

「From the upper field to the middle field, from the middle field to the lower field—this is the Great River Vehicle. When pure yin descends, the true water arises; when pure yang ascends, the true fire awakens. As one ascends and the other descends, they meet within the twelve chambers, and the elixir manifests in its golden radiance, gathering and illuminating all paths. This is the **Zhīhé Chē** (Purple River Vehicle).

The River Vehicle’s movement through the river is akin to *qi* flowing through the blood meridians; the River Vehicle’s bearing of things is like *qi* containing the true water within it. Master Guāngchéng taught the Yellow Emperor to refine the elixir at **Kōngtóng**, where lead—among the five metals—is the black gold, and from black gold, one takes silver; where cinnabar—among the eight stones—is the red stone, and from red stone, one takes mercury. When mercury is combined with lead, this is what is called the **Treasure Elixir**—this is the external method.

Now, the true *qi* stored in the kidneys is lead. The true essence where yin and yang converge is mercury. When fire and heat are perfectly balanced, essence becomes mercury, mercury becomes cinnabar, and cinnabar becomes the elixir. Thus, it is said: *"This is the true lead."*

From the **Jǔhòu** (elbow posterior) golden radiance, it ascends into the upper palace, entering from the crown into the lower field. The true fire then arises and ascends into the **Níwán** (brain marrow), passing through the heart and descending into the **Chónglóu** (double chamber). As one yin and one yang interact—water ascending, fire descending—the **Jiéjì** (completion) method is achieved, and it races toward the **Yuán Hǎi** (primordial sea), becoming the **Zǐjīn** (purple-gold) elixir. Thus, it is said: *"This is the true mercury."*

Yin and yang have four exchanges and four unions:
- *"Yang exchanges with yin"* (陽交陰),
- *"Yin exchanges with yang"* (陰交陽),
- *"Yang exchanges with yang"* (陽交陽),
- *"Yin exchanges with yin"* (陰交陰);
- *"Yin unites with yang"* (陰合陽),
- *"Yang unites with yin"* (陽合陰),
- *"Yin unites with yin"* (陰合陰),
- *"Yang unites with yang"* (陽合陽).

These correspond to the eight celestial phases of heaven and earth and the eight seasonal junctures of the sun and moon. This is why one must not fail to recognize the nature of things.

Many have spoken of nurturing life in ancient and modern times, but those who *minimize thoughts and desires* can only nurture the heart; those who *sever attachments and forget worldly concerns* can only nurture the spirit; those who *moderate their diet* can only nurture the body; those who *practice moderation in labor and rest* can only nurture the vital *qi*; those who *enter purity and emerge from impurity* can only nurture the *qi*; those who *abstain from licentiousness and observe sexual restraint* can only nurture the essence.

Master Huáyáng says: These are not the ultimate ways of nurturing life. The adept in nurturing life, during the **reigning** (王) phases, *nurtures and draws upon* them; during the **waning** (衰) phases, *nurtures and supplements* them. In spring, one nurtures the spleen; in autumn, one nurtures the liver; in summer, one nurtures the lungs; in winter, one nurtures the heart.

Refining the body stirs the fire, while returning the elixir gathers the *qi*—this is the yearly and monthly application of the Dao.

Why nurture yang in spring and summer? Because the true *qi* follows the great celestial cycles, residing in the lungs and kidneys. The kidneys and lungs are where fluids descend. This is the method of yin-yang transmission.

The kidneys’ *qi* is generated at the hour of **Zǐ** (子, midnight), when one yang arises within two yin. At this time, one must *calm the mind and still the thoughts*, close the eyes, and elevate the body, inwardly visualizing fire ascending from the **Dāntián** (elixir field). This is the method of nurturing the generated *qi*.

The liver’s *qi* is generated at the hour of **Mǎo** (卯, dawn), when one yang arises within two yin. At this time, one must sit alone, close the eyes, *minimize outward activity and maximize inward stillness*, and inwardly store the vision of male and female uniting within the **Yellow House** (黃屋), producing a child. This is the method of nurturing the generated yang.

The heart’s *qi* is generated at the hour of **Wǔ** (午, noon), when one yin arises within two yang. At this time, one must *sever speech and forget all thoughts*, hold the saliva in the mouth to attack the heart’s *qi* without dispersing it, and inwardly store the vision of the **Dragon and Tiger** (龍虎) uniting within the **Smoky Flame** (煙焰), swirling in a **golden cauldron** (金鼎), and flowing into the lower elixir field. This is the method of nurturing the generated yin.

The lungs’ *qi* is generated at the hour of **Yǒu** (酉, dusk), when one yin arises within two yang. At this time, one must close the eyes, focus the mind, and gently press the abdomen, inwardly storing the vision of great fire searing within the cauldron. Within the cauldron, the **three mysteries** (三昧) fire blazes forth in radiant flames. This is the method of nurturing the generated yin at its proper time.

Thus, when the **three hundred-day embryo** (三百日胎) is complete and the true *qi* is generated, nurturing and refining it yields the spirit. The **three flowers gather at the crown** (三花聚頂), and the **five *qi* pay homage to the Primordial** (五氣朝元). When the **five hundred-day embryo** (五百日陽神) is complete and the yang spirit is generated, nurturing and refining it unites one with the Dao.

From the generation of form and its nurturing arises the true *qi*; from the nurturing of *qi* arises the **true body** (法身). The true body is the body beyond the body. This is the way of nurturing life.

The adept in nurturing the body must *clothe themselves first when cold*, not abruptly adding layers; and *remove clothing first when warm*, not abruptly shedding them. After prolonged exertion, one must rest to preserve their **extreme vitality** (極力); after prolonged idleness, one must practice **guided movements** (導引) to circulate their **stagnant *qi*** (滯氣).

In summer, if one sleeps in **dampness**, the *qi* scatters and blood stagnates; in winter, if one is exposed to **extreme heat**, the kidneys will be harmed by **false yang** (虛陽), and by the time of spring and summer, the liver and heart will inevitably suffer from **obstructive diseases** (壅蔽之疾); in summer, if one is exposed to **extreme cold**, the heart will embrace **floating chill**, and by the time of autumn and winter, the lungs and kidneys will inevitably suffer from **stagnant afflictions** (沉滯之患).

These are the precautions the adept in nurturing the body must observe.

One must not eat when **extremely hungry**, nor overeat when full—overindulgence harms the spirit, while excessive hunger harms the stomach. One must not drink when **extremely thirsty**, nor consume too much when sated—excessive intake weakens the *qi*, while excessive thirst harms the blood.

For **hair washing** (沐), one must use the **decade method** (旬者). The decade is when the number is complete and returns—when the true *qi* resides in the brain. Washing the hair makes the ears and eyes sharp and clear.

For **bathing** (浴), one must use the **pentad method** (五者). The pentad is when the five *qi* flow and transmit throughout the body, making the **honorific and defensive meridians** (榮衛) unobstructed. However, bathing must not be frequent—though it may make the skin and flesh luminous, it causes **blood congealing and *qi* scattering**, and over time, the *qi* is depleted, leading to **paralysis or atrophy** (癱痪之疾). This is when *qi* cannot overcome blood, and spirit cannot overcome form;」

「Hair washing must not be frequent—overuse causes *qi* to stagnate in the upper brain, congealing in the center, and over time, the **meridians and channels** (经络) cannot flow freely, leading to **heaviness of the body and weariness of the form** (体重形疲). Thus, the ancients cultivated **yang** to nourish **yang**—so that **yang** would not dissipate; they refined **yang** with **yin**—so that **yang** would not weaken.

Within a year, **spring and summer** cultivate **yang**, while **autumn and winter** cultivate **yin**—this is how one borrows **yin** to nourish **yang**, using **yang** to consume **yin**. Within a day, before noon, one refines **the Heavenly One (乾)** with *qi*—thus, one begins by refining the **form (形)**, and later cultivates **the Earthly One (金晶)**. After noon, one refines **the Earthly One (坤)** with medicine—thus, with medicine, one gathers *qi* to forge the **elixir (丹)**, or if lacking the elixir, one collects **fire (火)** to "boil the sea" (煮海). These are all ways in which **true yang** is applied to the body—my methods for nourishing the **form (形)**.

Now, the **bird’s single surge (禽之一冲)** is governed by *qi*, so it treads upon the void as if upon solid ground. The **pine and cypress’s firm *qi* (松柏之气)** is unyielding, so they remain ever verdant. The **tortoise and crane’s settled *qi* (龟鹤之气)** endures, so they never wither. Yet even if one excels in nourishing the **form (形)**, can one not also strive to cultivate *qi*?

For those who practice **silence (不语)** to preserve *qi*, it is truly **conserving *qi* (保气)**. But if they fail and become **dim-witted (昏)**, then to practice **clarity in intake, turbidity in release (入清出浊)** is to **exchange *qi* (换气)**. If they fail and become **empty (虚)**, then to **absorb much and release little (多入少出)**—even for attacking illness—is not **fetal breathing (胎息)**. To **swallow above and compress below (上咽下擂)**, gathering *qi* may be possible, but to **make it into the Returning Elixir (还丹)** is not.

To **maintain *qi* like a thread (绵绵若存)**, using it sparingly, is to **yield *qi* and harmonize the spirit (和神)**. To **settle the breath (息之要住)** and **retain what is inhaled (纳之不出)**, closing *qi* to refine the **form (形)**—this is possible.
