This is the pattern of their coming and going,
which establishes the sequence of cold and heat.

Lüzi said: *"What lies in Heaven is known to the rocks;
what lies in humans is not yet understood."*

Master Zhōnglí said: *"The mechanism of Heaven and Earth lies in the rising and falling of Yin and Yang.
If I compare myself to the sun and moon,
then the moon receives the **hún** of the sun,
transforming Yang into Yin,
until Yin is exhausted and Yang is pure—
like the sun’s radiance.
My **qi** can refine and become spirit,
returning to **pure Yang** (纯阳).

Lüzi said: *"What comes first—the principles of Yin and Yang’s rising and falling,
or the degrees of the sun and moon’s essence merging?
Master Zhōnglí said: *"To understand the rising and falling of Yin and Yang,
and to merge **True Water** (真水) and **True Fire** (真火),
thus stabilizing the **Dan Field** (丹田) and **Great Elixir** (大药),
one can harmonize with Heaven and Earth.
If one seeks to ascend lightly,
then they should follow the sun and moon’s conjunctions,
refining Yin with Yang,
so that Yin does not arise;
nourishing spirit with **qi**,
so that spirit does not scatter.
Then, the **Five Qi** (五气) return to their origin,
and the **Three Flowers** (三花) gather at the crown.
This is indeed timely.

The rising and falling of Yin and Yang,
the yearly conjunction of seasons;
the sun and moon’s revolutions,
the monthly conjunction of phases;
human **qi** and fluids,
the daily conjunction of day and night—
thus, time is divided into four grades.

A hundred years is the common human lifespan.
From one to thirty is the **youthful vigor** (少壮) period;
sixty is the **prime of life** (长大) period;
ninety is the **aged infirmity** (老耄) period;
from a hundred to a hundred and twenty is the **decline** (衰落) period—
this is called the **time within the body** (身中之时).

Twelve **Chén** (辰) make one day;
five days make one **hòu** (候);
three **hòu** make one **qi** (气);
three **qi** make one **jié** (节);
two **jié** make one **season** (时).
When the season belongs to spring,
Yin is half within Yang,
and its **qi** shifts from cold to warmth.
When the season belongs to summer,
Yang is half within Yang,
and its **qi** shifts from warmth to heat.
When the season belongs to autumn,
Yang is half within Yin,
and its **qi** shifts from heat to chill.
When the season belongs to winter,
Yin is half within Yin,
and its **qi** shifts from chill to cold—
this is called the **time within the year** (年中之时).

The moon has three **xún** (旬),
with three hundred and sixty **Chén**,
three thousand **kè** (刻),
and eighteen thousand **fēn** (分).
From the **new moon** (朔旦) to the **upper xián** (上弦),
Yin is half within Yang;
from the **upper xián** (上弦) to the **full moon** (既望),
Yang is half within Yang;
from the **full moon** (既望) to the **lower xián** (下弦),
Yang is half within Yin;
from the **lower xián** (下弦) to the **end of the month** (晦),
Yin is half within Yin—
this is called the **time within the moon** (月中之时).

Sixty parts make one **kè** (刻);
eight **kè** and twenty parts make one **shí** (时).
Half of this time is one **guà** (卦),
speaking of its **guà** to determine the eight directions,
and discussing its **zhèng** (正) to divide the four cardinal points.
From **Zǐ** (子) to **Mǎo** (卯),
Yin is half within Yang,
with **Great Yin** (太阴) giving rise to **Lesser Yang** (少阳);
from **Mǎo** (卯) to **Wǔ** (午),
Yang is half within pure Yang,
with **Lesser Yang** (少阳) giving rise to **Great Yang** (太阳);
from **Wǔ** (午) to **Yǒu** (酉),
Yang is half within Yin,
with **Great Yang** (太阳) giving rise to **Lesser Yin** (少阴);
from **Yǒu** (酉) to **Zǐ** (子),
Yin is half within pure Yin,
with **Lesser Yin** (少阴) giving rise to **Great Yin** (太阴)—
this is called the **time within the day** (日中之时).

Ah! What is hard to obtain yet easy to lose—
it is the **time within the body** (身中之时).
The **time within the year** (年中之月) arrives slowly and departs swiftly;
the **time within the day** (一日中之辰) is swift as lightning and stony fire.»

「Now, consider the vigor of my years—
when my vitality is strong, the **root essence** (根元) is firmly established and readily cultivated; with a thousand days, great achievement may be realized.
In the middle years, first **nourish the completeness** (先圆补之) before reaching their peak;
when old age arrives, **rescue and support** (救护之、辅益之) must be applied, accumulating minor success toward moderate achievement, and moderate success toward **restoring youthfulness** (还童) before ceasing.

The distance between Heaven and Earth is **eighty-four thousand li** (八万四千里).
When the sun reaches its southernmost point, the **central Yang** (地中之阳) ascends.
Every **breath of *qi*** (一气), spanning **fifteen days** (旬有五日), rises **seven thousand li** (七千里).
After **eighteen tens** (十有八), its ascent reaches Heaven, where the **Great Polarity** (太极) gives rise to **Yin** (阴).

When the sun reaches its northernmost point, the **central Yin** (天中之阴) descends.
Every **breath of *qi*** (一气), spanning **fifteen days** (旬有五日), descends **seven thousand li** (七千里).
After **eighteen tens** (十有八), its descent reaches Earth, where the **Great Polarity** (太极) gives rise to **Yang** (阳).
Thus, it follows a **cyclical pattern** (循环).

The **perimeter of the sun and moon** (日月之围) is each **eight hundred and forty li** (八百有四十里).
After dawn, **nine *qi* arises from six** (六之中起九焉).
For a single **moon’s cycle** (一之日), the **time** (时) spans **twelve tens** (十有二), and the **soul within the body** (魄中之魂) ascends **seven thousand li** (七千里).
After **fifteen days** (旬有五日), the **time** reaches **one hundred and eighty** (一百有八十), and the **soul within the body** (魄中之魂) ascends **eight hundred and forty li** (八百有四十里).
After the full moon, **six *qi* arises from nine** (九之中起六焉).
In the middle of the moon’s cycle, the **time** spans **twelve tens** (十有二), and the **body within the soul** (魂中之魄) descends **seventy li** (七十里).
After **fifteen days** (旬有五日), the **time** reaches **one hundred and eighty** (一百有八十), and the **body within the soul** (魂中之魄) descends **eight hundred and forty li** (八百有四十里).
This too follows a **cyclical pattern** (循环).

The **heart** (心) and **kidneys** (肾) of a person are **eighty-four inches apart** (相去八寸有四分), with the **ascending and descending of Yin and Yang** (阴阳升降) mirroring that of Heaven and Earth.
The **interaction of *qi* and bodily fluids** (气液相生) follows the same principle: **fluid generates *qi*** (气中生液) and **fluid contains *qi*** (液中生气), just as the sun and moon do.

Yet Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon,
have **years following years** (年之后有年) and **moons following moons** (月之后有月).
Humans, however, do not grasp the **timing of conjunction and separation** (交合之时),
do not know when to **preserve** (损) or **nourish** (补),
do not know when to **augment** (益) or **withdraw** (收).
When **Yin and Yang interact** (阴交、阳交),
they fail to **nurture Yang** (养阳) or **refine Yin** (炼阴).
Moons pass without **preservation or augmentation** (损益),
days pass without **proper cultivation** (行持),
yet my years and months are **limited** (有限).

**Master Lü** (吕子) asked earnestly:
*"I wish to hear the methods of **refinement and cultivation** (修炼之法),
and the **timing of practice** (行持之时)."*

**Master Zhōng Lí** (子钟离子) replied:
*"The *qi* of the **five viscera** (五藏) has **monthly waxing and waning** (月有盛衰),
and **daily ebb and flow** (日有进退).
There are **critical moments of conjunction** (交合之时).
When the **five phases** (五度) are fully expressed,
and the **six seasonal shifts** (六候) have passed,
**essence is refined** (精炼) and **true *qi* arises** (真气生).
When **true *qi* is refined** (气炼),
the **Yang Spirit** (阳神) coalesces.
When the **Spirit** (神) is refined,
the **Great Dao** (大道) is attained.

**Master Lü** (吕子) said:
*"The five viscera correspond to the **five phases** (五行): Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth.
Their positions align with the **four directions and center** (东西南北中).
Is there a **method of their generation and completion** (生成之道)?
Are there **timings of their conjunction** (交合有时)?
Are there **principles of their gathering** (采取有法)?"*

**Master Zhōng Lí** (子钟离子) replied:
*"Heaven and Earth divide, and the **Five Celestial Sovereigns** (五帝) are arranged:
**Qīngdì** (青帝, the Azure Sovereign) governs the **East** (束), embodying **Spring** (春令),
giving rise to **Yang** (阳) within **Yin** (阴),
and thus all things **germinate** (生).
**Chìdì** (赤帝, the Red Sovereign) governs the **South** (南), embodying **Summer** (夏令),
ascending **Yang** (阳) within **Yang** (阳),
and thus all things **flourish** (长).
**Báidì** (白帝, the White Sovereign) governs the **West** (西), embodying **Autumn** (秋令),
giving rise to **Yin** (阴) within **Yang** (阳),
and thus all things **mature** (成).
**Hēidì** (黑帝, the Black Sovereign) governs the **North** (北), embodying **Winter** (冬令),
advancing **Yin** (阴) within **Yin** (阴),
and thus all things **dormant** (陨).

Each **season** (四时) spans **eighteen tens of days** (各旬有八日).
The **central Yellow Sovereign** (中央黄帝) oversees:
**Spring** (春) to **assist their germination** (发生),
**Summer** (夏) to **support their growth** (长育),
**Autumn** (秋) to **aid their establishment** (结立),
**Winter** (冬) to **regulate their severity** (严凛).
The **Five Celestial Sovereigns** (五帝) govern in turn,
each for **seventy-two tens of days** (各七旬有二日),
thus completing the **three hundred and sixty days** (三百有六十日) of a year.

The **children of Qīngdì** (青帝之子) are **Jiǎ** (甲) and **Yǐ** (乙),
their **position** (位) in the **East** (束),
their **virtue/power** (德) in **Wood** (木).
The **children of Chìdì** (赤帝之子) are **Bǐng** (丙) and **Dīng** (丁),
their **position** (位) in the **South** (南),
their **virtue/power** (德) in **Fire** (火).
The **children of Huángdì** (黄帝之子) are **Wù** (戊) and **Jǐ** (己),
their **position** (位) in the **center** (中央),
their **virtue/power** (德) in **Earth** (土).
The **children of Báidì** (白帝之子) are **Gēng** (庚) and **Xīn** (辛),
their **position** (位) in the **West** (西),
their **virtue/power** (德) in **Metal** (金).
The **children of Hēidì** (黑帝之子) are **Rén** (壬) and **Guǐ** (癸),
their **position** (位) in the **North** (北),
their **virtue/power** (德) in **Water** (水).

At their **conjunction** (交),
they manifest in **time** (时) as **symbols** (为象):
**Wood** (木) is the **Azure Dragon** (青龙);
**Fire** (火) is the **Vermilion Bird** (朱雀);
**Earth** (土) is **Gōuchēn** (勾陈);
**Metal** (金) is the **White Tiger** (白虎);
**Water** (水) is the **Dark Tortoise** (玄武).
When they **conjunction in time** (见於时) and **generate things** (而生物):
**Yǐ** (乙) of **Wood** (木) meets **Gēng** (庚) of **Metal** (金),
and in **Spring** (春), there is **elm** (榆), whose hue is **green and white** (青而白),
never straying from the **virtue/power of Metal and Wood** (金木).
**Xīn** (辛) of **Metal** (金) meets **Bǐng** (丙) of **Fire** (火),
and in **Autumn** (秋), there is **date** (枣), whose hue is **white and red** (白而赤),
never straying from the **virtue/power of Metal and Fire** (金火).
**Jǐ** (己) of **Earth** (土) meets **Jiǎ** (甲) of **Wood** (木),
and at the **end of Summer** (夏之杪) and **beginning of Autumn** (秋之端), there is **melon** (瓜), whose hue is **green and yellow** (青而黄),
never straying from the **virtue/power of Earth and Wood** (土木).
**Dīng** (丁) of **Fire** (火) meets **Rén** (壬) of **Water** (水),
and in **Summer** (夏), there is **mulberry** (档), whose hue is **red and black** (赤而黑),
never straying from the **virtue/power of Water and Fire** (水火).
**Guǐ** (癸) of **Water** (水) meets **Wù** (戊) of **Earth** (土),
and in **Winter** (冬), there is **tangerine** (橘), whose hue is **black and yellow** (黑而黄),
never straying from the **virtue/power of Water and Earth** (水土).
By **this analogy** (以类推之), it can be **exhaustively understood** (可胜既欤).

**Master Lü** (吕子) said:
*"The principles of **time** (时) are known,
but those of **human cultivation** (人) are not."*

**Master Zhōng Lí** (子钟离子) replied:
*"Humans have a **circular head and square feet** (圆颅方趾),
embodying the **symbols of Heaven and Earth** (天地之象).
The **mechanism of Yin ascending and Yang descending** (阴升阳降) is concealed within them.
The **kidneys** (肾) are **Water** (水);
the **heart** (心) is **Fire** (火);
the **liver** (肝) is **Wood** (木);
the **lungs** (肺) are **Metal** (金);
the **spleen** (脾) is **Earth** (土).
There is a **method of their generation and completion** (生成之道).
The **generating** (生) is called **mother** (母),
the **receiving** (受生) is called **child** (子).
Thus, there is also the **principle of mutual subjugation** (刚克之道).
**Generating** (生) refers to the **five phases nurturing each other** (五行相生),
and **subjugating** (克) refers to the **five phases restraining each other** (五行相克).
The **subjugating** (克) is called **husband** (夫),
the **receiving subjugation** (受克) is called **wife** (妇).

Now, how does the **generating *qi*** (气之生) originate?
The **kidneys** (肾) generate the **liver** (肝),
the **liver** (肝) generates the **heart** (心),
the **heart** (心) generates the **spleen** (脾),
the **spleen** (脾) generates the **lungs** (肺),
and the **lungs** (肺) generate the **kidneys** (肾).

How does the **subjugating *qi*** (气之克) originate?
The **kidneys** (肾) subjugate the **heart** (心),
the **heart** (心) subjugates the **lungs** (肺),
the **lungs** (肺) subjugate the **liver** (肝),
the **liver** (肝) subjugates the **spleen** (脾),
and the **spleen** (脾) subjugates the **kidneys** (肾).」

Thus it is said:

The **kidneys** (肾) are the **husband** (夫) of the **heart** (心), the **mother** (母) of the **liver** (肝), the **wife** (妇) of the **spleen** (脾), and the **child** (子) of the **lungs** (肺);
The **liver** (肝) is the **husband** (夫) of the **spleen** (脾), the **mother** (母) of the **heart** (心), the **wife** (妇) of the **lungs** (肺), and the **child** (子) of the **kidneys** (肾);
The **heart** (心) is the **husband** (夫) of the **lungs** (肺), the **mother** (母) of the **spleen** (脾), the **wife** (妇) of the **kidneys** (肾), and the **child** (子) of the **liver** (肝);
The **lungs** (肺) are the **husband** (夫) of the **liver** (肝), the **mother** (母) of the **kidneys** (肾), the **wife** (妇) of the **heart** (心), and the **child** (子) of the **spleen** (脾);
The **spleen** (脾) is the **husband** (夫) of the **kidneys** (肾), the **mother** (母) of the **lungs** (肺), the **wife** (妇) of the **liver** (肝), and the **child** (子) of the **heart** (心).

The **heart** (心) manifests internally as **pulse** (脉), externally as **complexion** (色).
The **mouth and tongue** (口舌) are its portals! Subdued by the **kidneys** (肾), yet serving the **lungs** (肺)—thus husband and wife.
When it receives **spleen** (脾) *qi*, it flourishes; when it encounters the **liver** (肝), it wanes—thus child and mother.

The **kidneys** (肾) manifest internally as **bones** (骨), externally as **hair** (发).
The **ears** (耳) are its portals! Subdued by the **spleen** (脾), yet serving the **heart** (心)—thus husband and wife.
When it receives **lungs** (肺) *qi*, it flourishes; when it encounters the **liver** (肝), it wanes—thus child and mother.

The **liver** (肝) manifests internally as **sinews/tendons** (筋), externally as **claws** (爪).
The **eyes** (目) are its portals! Subdued by the **lungs** (肺), yet serving the **spleen** (脾)—thus husband and wife.
When it receives **kidneys** (肾) *qi*, it flourishes; when it encounters the **heart** (心), it wanes—thus child and mother.

The **lungs** (肺) manifest internally as **skin** (肤), externally as **fur/hair** (毛).
The **nose** (鼻) is its portal! Subdued by the **heart** (心), yet serving the **liver** (肝)—thus husband and wife.
When it receives **spleen** (脾) *qi*, it flourishes; when it encounters the **kidneys** (肾), it wanes—thus child and mother.

The **spleen** (脾) manifests internally as **viscera** (藏), externally as **flesh** (肉).
The **lips and teeth** (唇齿) are its portals! Breathing regulates the flow and return, subdued by the **liver** (肝), yet serving the **kidneys** (肾)—thus husband and wife.
When it receives **heart** (心) *qi*, it flourishes; when it encounters the **lungs** (肺), it wanes—thus child and mother.

Master Lü said: The **heart** (心), being **fire** (火), how does it obtain downward movement?
The **kidneys** (肾), being **water** (水), how does it obtain upward ascent?
The **spleen** (脾), being **earth** (土), earth lies in the center and receives **fire** (心) to flourish—how could it not subjugate **water** (肾)?
The **lungs** (肺), being **metal** (金), metal lies above yet connects downward with **fire** (心) to be consumed—how could it generate **water** (肾)?

The **generating** (生) is distant, the **subjugating** (克) is near—how does this work?
Master Zǐ Zhōnglí (锺离子) replied:

The **five phases** (五行) return to their **source** (源) by drawing upon **original *yang* *qi*** (元阳) to ascend and elevate, thus producing **true water** (真水).
**True water** (真水) transforms and then generates **true *qi*** (真气), **true *qi*** (真气) transforms and then generates **yang spirit** (阳神).
This begins with the **five phases** (五行) establishing their positions, each having a **husband** (夫) and a **wife** (妇).

The **kidneys** (肾), being **water** (水), contain **metal** (金)—my **medicinal actions** (起功) must recognize this.
**Metal** (金) originally generates **water** (水), hence it is called **"metal within water"** (水中金).
**Water** (水) harms **earth** (土). My **herbal prescriptions** (采药) must return **earth** to **water**.

The **dragon** (龙) is the **liver**’s (肝) **symbol** (象);
The **tiger** (虎) is the **lungs**’ (肺) **spirit** (神).
The **yang dragon** (阳龙) emerges from **Lǐ** (离), the **yin tiger** (阴虎) arises from **Kǎn** (坎).
When the **five phases** (五行) reverse their positions, **yin** and **yang** *qi* transmit between **husband** (夫) and **wife** (妇).

From **child** (子) to **wǔ** (午), **yang** generates **yang**, and the **five phases** reverse—thus **fluids** (液) flow between **husband** (夫) and **wife** (妇).
From **wǔ** (午) to **child** (子), **yin** refines **yang**, yet **yang** cannot fully merge with **yin**—it does not reach its extreme.
Without **yin**, there would be no death;
**Yin** cannot fully merge with **yang**, nor does **yang** generate its extreme—without **yin**, life would be cut short.

Master Lü said: The **five phases** (五行), how do they originate from **yin-yang *qi*** (阴阳之气)?
Master Zǐ Zhōnglí (锺离子) replied:

At the **beginning of life** (人之始), **form** (造形) is established, and thus the **kidneys** (肾) generate the **spleen** (脾),
the **spleen** (脾) generates the **liver** (肝),
the **liver** (肝) generates the **lungs** (肺),
the **lungs** (肺) generate the **heart** (心),
the **heart** (心) generates the **small intestine** (小肠),
the **small intestine** (小肠) generates the **large intestine** (大肠),
the **large intestine** (大肠) generates the **gallbladder** (胆),
the **gallbladder** (胆) generates the **stomach** (胃),
and the **stomach** (胃) generates the **bladder** (膀胱).
This is the **yin essence and blood** (阴之精血).

When **original *yang* *qi*** (元阳) first sprouts, it lies within the **two kidneys** (二肾).
The **kidneys** (肾), being **water** (水), contain **fire** (火) that ascends, thus becoming **vital *qi*** (气), which pays homage to the **heart** (心).
The **heart** (心), being **yang** (阳), unites **yang** with **yang**, thus the **Great Ultimate** (太极) generates **yin** (阴).

From this, accumulated **vital *qi*** (气) produces **fluids** (液),
and **fluids** (液) descend from the **heart** (心) to return to the **kidneys** (肾).
The **liver** (肝) is the **mother** (母) of the **heart** (心), the **child** (子) of the **kidneys** (肾),
transmitting and guiding **kidney** *qi* (气) to the **heart** (心).
The **lungs** (肺) are the **wife** (妇) of the **heart** (心), the **mother** (母) of the **kidneys** (肾),
transmitting the **heart**’s (心) **fluids** (液) to the **kidneys** (肾).
The **vital *qi*** (气) and **fluids** (液) rise and fall like the **yin-yang** of **heaven and earth** (天地阴阳).
The **liver** (肝) and **lungs** (肺) transmit and guide like the **sun and moon**’s (日月) **reciprocating movements** (往复).

The **five phases** (五行) are merely **names** (名) for **numbers** (数).
Discussing their **interactions and generation** (交合生成),
only **original *yang* *qi*** (元阳) stands as their **foundation** (本).
**Vital *qi*** (气) generates **fluids** (液), **fluids** (液) generate **vital *qi*** (气),
thus one knows the **kidneys** (肾) are the **root** (根) of **vital *qi*** (气),
and the **heart** (心) is the **source** (源) of **fluids** (液).
When the **spiritual root** (灵根) is firmly established,
within the **dim and hazy** (恍惚), its **vital *qi*** (气) generates **true water** (真水);
When the **heart’s source** (心源) is clear,
within the **obscure and distant** (杳冥), its **fluids** (液) generate **true fire** (真火).
Within **fire**, one recognizes the **dragon** (龙);
Within **water**, one recognizes the **tiger** (虎).
When these two interact, the **yellow shoots flourish** (黄芽茂矣).

**[End of Volume 39 of *Dao Gun* (道枢)]** #1 Note: Original text had "草" (grass), but corrected to "莫" (cannot) based on the *Ji Yào* (辑要) edition.

**[Volume 40 of *Dao Gun* (道枢)]** *To the Wandering Master Zēng Huì* (游子曾慥集)

「Transmission of the Dao in Its Middle Section: Lüzi Says: What is meant by **yellow shoots** (黄芽)?

Zhōnglízi Says: The **dragon** (龙) and **tiger** (虎) are what is meant.

The **dragon** (龙) is not the **liver** (肝), but the **true water** (真水) of the **separation phase** (离官);
The **tiger** (虎) is not the **lungs** (肺), but the **true fire** (真火) of the **abyss phase** (坎位).

Lüzi Says: What is meant by **fire** (火) and **water** (水)?

Zhōnglízi Says: Within my body, there are **eighteen measures of water** (水十有八): the **Four Seas** (四海), the **Five Lakes** (五湖), the **Nine Rivers** (九江), the **Three Isles** (三岛), the **Flowery Pool** (华池), the **Jade Pool** (瑶池), the **Phoenix Pool** (凤池), the **Celestial Pool** (天池), the **Jade Spring** (玉泉), the **Kun Pool** (昆池), the **Primordial Pond** (元潭), the **Mythic Enclosure** (闽苑), the **Divine Water** (神水), the **Golden Waves** (金波), the **Luminous Fluids** (琼液), the **Yang Sū** (阳酥), and the **White Snow** (白雪).

Within my body, there are **three kinds of fire** (火有三): the **Sovereign Fire** (君火), the **Ministerial Fire** (臣火), and the **Common Fire** (民火).
These three are rooted in **primordial yang** (元阳).
Thus, **true *qi*** (真气) is generated.
**True *qi*** (真气), when gathered, brings **tranquility** (安); when weak, brings **illness** (疾); when scattered, brings **death** (死).

Lüzi Says: Though **primordial yang** (元阳) is so limited, how does it give rise to the **three fires** (三火), which emerge from the realm of **abundant water and dense yin** (群水众阴)? Their dispersion is easy, yet their intensity is hard to achieve—how so?

Zhōnglízi Says: The **heart** (心) is the **sea of blood** (血之海);
The **kidneys** (肾) are the **sea of *qi*** (气之海);
The **marrow palaces** (泥丸) are the **sea of marrow** (髓之海);
The **stomach** (胃) is the **sea of water and grain** (水谷之海).
These are my **Four Seas** (四海).
The **five viscera** (五藏) each possess their own **fluids** (液), and their positions correspond to the **Five Directions** (五方): east, west, south, north, and center.
These are my **Five Lakes** (五湖).
The **small intestine** (小肠), **four zhang and two chi** (二丈有四尺) in length, winding **nine bends** (九曲).
This is my **Nine Rivers** (九江).
The **large intestine** (大肠), when descending, is my **Primordial Pond** (元潭).
The **upper island** (上岛) is the **forehead** (顶), the **middle island** (中岛) is the **heart** (心), and the **lower island** (下岛) is the **kidneys** (肾).
These **Three Isles** (三岛) are my **Mythic Enclosure** (闱苑).
Beneath the **Yellow Court** (黄庭) lies the **Flowery Pool** (华池), before the **Red Gate** (丹阙) lies the **Jade Pool** (瑶池), where the **Jade Capital** (玉京) is approached lies the **Kun Pool** (昆池), and within the **Inner Palace** (内院) lies the **Celestial Pool** (天池).
Between the **heart** (心) and **lungs** (肺) lies the **Phoenix Pool** (凤池), and within the **lips and teeth** (唇齿) lies the **Jade Spring** (玉泉).
The **Divine Spring** (神泉) arises from **vital *qi*** (气), the **Golden Waves** (金波) descend from the heavens, where the **Red Dragon** (赤龙) rests—thus, **Luminous Fluids** (琼液) and **Jade Spring** (玉泉) are formed.
Once the **embryonic transformations** (凡胎) are complete, **White Snow** (白雪) and **Yang Sū** (阳酥) emerge.
I have often irrigated and nourished them to quench their **flame** (炎), for indeed, there is a **measure** (度) to this.

The **Supreme** (太上) is called **Jade Fluid** (玉液), the next is called **Golden Fluid** (金液)—both can be used to **return the elixir** (还丹).
When **extracted** (抽) and **augmented** (增), they correspond to **ritual bathing** (沐浴)—indeed, this too has its **measure** (度).
The **Supreme** (太上) is the **Central Field** (日中田), the next is the **Lower Field** (日下田)—both can be used to **refine the form** (炼形).
**Jade Elixir** (玉药) and **Golden Petals** (金葩), when transformed, yield **white and yellow brews** (白黄酝酬), sweet as **dew** (甘露), and their **refinement emits a fragrant intensity** (芬烈).
This is the **effect of water** (水之效).

When the **Common Fire** (民火) ascends, it aids the **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气) in generating **true water** (真水);
When the **Ministerial Fire** (臣火) ascends, it mingles with the **heart’s fluids** (心之液) to generate **true *qi*** (真气).
In **small applications** (小用), demons can be **subdued** (降), and illnesses can be **cured** (已);
In **great applications** (大用), the **embodied essence** (质) can be **refined** (炼), and the **elixir** (丹) can be **perfected** (成).
To **burn through the Microcosmic Orbit** (周天) and **consummate the body** (焚其身),
To **bind the Solar Pass** (勒阳关) and **return to the source** (还其元),
To **partition the Nine Regions’ influence** (别九州之势) and **nourish the yang spirit** (养阳神),
To **scorch the Three Pèng burdens** (燎三彭之累) and **expel yin ghosts** (除阴鬼),
To **ascend and traverse the Three Passes** (上行以通三关),
To **descend and dissolve the Seven Souls** (下运以消七魄):
When **refining the form into *qi*** (炼形成气) is achieved, one becomes a **guest of Heaven** (宾天);
When **refining *qi* into spirit** (炼气成神) is achieved, one **sheds the mortal coil** (蜕).
This is the **effect of fire** (火之效).

Lüzi Says: How does the principle of **"the few overcoming the many, the weak overcoming the strong"** (少胜多、弱致强) apply here?

Zhōnglízi Says: When the **eighteen measures of yin** (二八之阴) are **consumed** (消),
And the **nine measures of yang** (九三之阳) are **restored** (还),
Then **golden elixir** (金丹) is **perfected** (成).
When **sevenfold return** (七返) and **ninefold restoration** (九还) are achieved,
Then the **embryonic transformations** (胎) and **immortal birth** (仙) are **realized** (化).

**True *qi*** (真气) resides in the **heart** (心), for the **heart** (心) is the **source of fluids** (液之源);
**Primordial yang** (元阳) resides in the **kidneys** (肾), for the **kidneys** (肾) are the **abyss of *qi*** (气之渊).
The **bladder** (膀胱) is the **Common Fire** (民火), the **repository of fluids** (津液之府).
If the **kidneys** (肾) do not **restrain the Common Fire** (止於民火),
They cannot **fulfill their function** (为用).
Why so?
The **heart** (心) and **kidneys** (肾) are **eight cun and four fen apart** (相去八寸有四分)—this is the **position of Heaven and Earth** (天地之位).
**Vital *qi*** (气) and **fluids** (液) are the **Great Ultimate’s** (太极) **mutually generating** (相生) forces—the **interaction of yin and yang** (阴阳之交).
The **twelve divisions of a day** (一日十有二时) are the **number of a year** (一岁之数).
The **heart’s fluids** (心之液) are not **self-generated** (自生也),
But descend from the **lungs’ fluids** (肺之液) into the **heart** (心), and thus **flow** (其液行).
From above to below, they return to the **Lower Field** (下田), and are called **"Wife’s Return to the Husband’s Domain"** (妇还夫官).

The **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气) is not **self-generated** (自生也),
But ascends from the **bladder’s *qi*** (膀胱之气),
And thus the **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气) **flows** (行),
From below to above, to **pay homage to the Central Sovereign** (朝中元), and is called **"Husband’s Return to the Wife’s Chamber"** (夫还妇室).

The **liver’s *qi*** (肝之气) **guides and conducts** (导行) the **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气),
From below to above, until it reaches the **heart** (心)—this is **fire** (火).
When the two **kinds of *qi*** (二气) **interact** (相交),
They **permeate the lungs** (熏蒸於肺),
And the **lungs’ fluids** (肺之液) descend,
From the **heart** (心) and onward—
Thus, it is said that **"the heart generates fluids"** (心生液),
And **"the husband is born from the heart"** (夫生於心) yet does not **scatter** (散),
This is called **true water** (真水).

The **lungs’ fluids** (肺之液) **transmit and deliver** (传送) the **heart’s fluids** (心之液),
From above to below, until they reach the **kidneys** (肾)—this is **water** (水).
When the two **waters** (二水) **interact** (相交),
They **moisten the bladder** (浸润於膀胱),
And its **vital *qi*** (气) ascends,
From the **kidneys** (肾) and onward—
Thus, it is said that **"the kidneys generate *qi*** (肾生气),
And **"the *qi* is born from the kidneys"** (气生於肾) yet does not **consumed** (消),
This is called **true fire** (真火).

**True fire** (真火) emerges from **water** (水),
**Dim and hazy** (恍恍惚惚), yet within it there is **substance** (物),
Visible yet **cannot be seen** (视之不可见),
Seizable yet **cannot be obtained** (取之不可得).
**True water** (真水) emerges from **fire** (火),
**Obscure and distant** (杳杳冥冥), yet within it there is **essence** (精),
Seen yet **cannot be retained** (见之不能留),
Retained yet **cannot be stopped** (留之不能止).

The **substance** (物) within **fire** (火) is the **dragon** (龙),
The **essence** (精) within **water** (水) is the **tiger** (虎).
Is this what is called the **Great Elixir** (大药)?

Lüzi Says: The **heart’s fire** (心之火) generates **fluids** (液),
Thus the **dragon** (龙) **hides within water** (隐於水), yet is not in the **liver** (肝),
Its emergence is from the **separation phase** (离);
The **kidneys’ water** (肾之水) generates **vital *qi*** (气),
Thus the **tiger** (虎) **conceals within fire** (藏於火), yet is not in the **lungs** (肺),
Its birth is from the **abyss phase** (坎),
How so?

Zhōnglízi Says: The **dragon** (龙) is a **yang entity** (阳物),
In **things** (物) it is **wood** (木), in **humans** (人) it is the **liver** (肝);

The **tiger** (虎) is a **yin entity** (阴物),
In **things** (物) it is **metal** (金), in **humans** (人) it is the **lungs** (肺).

The **liver** (肝), though **yang** (阳), resides in a **yin position** (阴位),
Thus the **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气) transmits the **liver’s *qi*** (肝之气),
To **nourish wood with water** (以水生木) as it does.

When the **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气) is abundant and the **liver’s *qi*** (肝之气) arises,
Its *qi* once generated, **cuts off the kidneys’ residual yin** (以绝肾之余阴),
And the **pure yang *qi*** (纯阳之气) ascends above#1.

The **lungs** (肺), though **yin** (阴), reside in a **yang position** (阳位),
Thus the **heart’s fluids** (心之液) transmit the **lungs’ fluids** (肺之液),
To **subdue metal with fire** (以火克金) as it does.

When the **heart’s fluids** (心之液) arise and the **spleen’s fluids** (脾之液) are generated,
Its fluids once formed, **cut off the heart’s residual yang** (以绝心之余阳),
And the **pure yin fluids** (纯阴之液) descend below.

Now, though the **liver** (肝) is **yang** (阳),
It can **cut off the kidneys’ residual yin** (绝肾之余阴),
Thus it is known that when *qi* **overflows in the liver** (过於肝),
It becomes **pure yang** (纯阳),
Within which the **True One’s water** (真一之水) is concealed without form,
And is named the **Yang Dragon** (阳龙).

Now, though the **lungs** (肺) are **yin** (阴),
They can **cut off the heart’s residual yang** (绝心之余阳),
Thus it is known that when fluids **reach the lungs** (至於肺),
They become **pure yin** (纯阴),
Within which they bear the **True Yang *qi*** (正阳之气) yet remain unseen,
And are named the **Yin Tiger** (阴虎).

How then do *qi* ascending and fluids descending **interact** (交)?
The **True One’s water** (真一之水), upon encountering fluids, **unites** (合);
The **True Yang *qi*** (正阳之气), upon encountering *qi*, **converges** (聚).

This is the principle of **"like with like, things in groups"** (方以类，物以群).

When the **transmission and circulation** (传行) occur,
They are **regulated by method** (以法制之),
So that the **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气) does not stray,
And within its *qi* the **True One’s water** (真一之水) is gathered;
The **heart’s fluids** (心之液) do not disperse,
And within its fluids the **True Yang *qi*** (正阳之气) is taken.

When these two meet,
They **achieve union like millet grains** (日得如黍米),
A hundred days and the **elixir’s power** (药力) is complete;
Two hundred days and the **sage embryo** (圣胎) becomes firm.
Three hundred days and the **embryonic sage** (胎仙) is perfected.

Lüzi Says: When *qi* is generated, fluids **also descend** (其液亦降).
My **True One’s water** (真一之水), can it not **follow and descend**, transmitting to the **five viscera** (五藏)?
When fluids are generated, *qi* **also ascends** (其气亦升).
My **True Yang *qi*** (正阳之气), can it not **follow and emerge**, ascending through the **nine heavens** (重楼)?

If **True Water follows fluids downward** (真水随液下行),
Then the **tiger cannot unite with the dragon** (虎不能交龙);
If **True Yang follows *qi* upward** (真阳随气上升),
Then the **dragon cannot unite with the tiger** (龙不能交虎).

How then can one **obtain the Golden Germ** (黄芽)?

Zhōnglízi Says: The **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气),
When it arises, is like the **Great Sun emerging from the sea** (太阳之出海),
Mist and dew cannot obscure its light,
And **strong *qi* naturally forms the True One’s water** (气壮则真一之水自成).

The **heart’s fluids** (心之液),
When they arise, are like the **severe winter killing things** (严天之杀物),
A sigh or a breath cannot scatter their cold,
And **fluids formed, the True Yang *qi* naturally flourishes** (液成则正阳之气自盛),
Though their **strength and weakness cannot yet be determined** (强弱未可必).

Lüzi Says: The generation of *qi* and fluids **each has its proper time** (各有时).
When it is said that **"abundant *qi* brings abundant water"** (气盛则水盛),
And **"abundant fluids bring abundant *qi*"** (液盛则气盛),
Why then is **strength and decline not guaranteed** (何盛衰未之保)?

Zhōnglízi Says: The **kidneys’ *qi*** (肾之气) is **easily dispersed** (易散),
Thus the **True Tiger is difficult to obtain** (真虎难得);
The **heart’s fluids** (心之液) are **hard to gather** (难聚),
Thus the **True Dragon is easily lost** (真龙易失).

Lüzi Says: I wish the Master would **explain it thoroughly** (究言之),
So that students may **understand the method of the Great Elixir** (知大药之方).

Zhōnglízi Says: There are three **ailments** (疾):
If one **feeds and guards improperly** (餐卫失其宜),
Or **violates the rhythms of rest and activity** (起居违其时),
Then one **hurries toward illness** (趋於患),
And this is called **time-bound ailment** (时疾);

If one **does not preserve one’s essence** (不持其精),
Does not **cherish one’s spirit** (不颐其神),
And **recklessly indulges in desires** (而冒於情欲),
Then one **ages swiftly** (速於老),
And this is called **year-bound ailment** (年疾);

If **life and death energies are exhausted** (荣泣卫除),
And one **cannot restore themself** (不能自还),
Then one **surrenders to death** (委於死),
And this is called **body-bound ailment** (身疾).

Though the **worldly ailments** (时之疾) are known to all,
None **know how to halt aging and reverse death** (止老而却死).

The **washing of the intestines and replenishing of the flesh** (洗肠补肉),
The **replacing of the skull and extending of the limbs** (换顶续支),
These were the practices of the **ancient skilled physicians** (古之善医).

Who **recognizes that there are methods** (亦有方) to **return to youth and dwell in form** (返童驻形)?

There are two: **Internal Elixir** (内丹) and **External Elixir** (外丹).
I have heard that in ancient times, the **Highest Primordial Lord** (高上元君) transmitted the **External Elixir scripture** (外丹之经),
Which spoke of the **principles of Heaven and Earth’s ascent and descent** (天地升降之理),
And the **suitability of the sun and moon’s waxing and waning** (日月往复之宜).

The **Master Guangcheng** (广成子) obtained it,
And taught it to **the Yellow Emperor** (黄帝),
Yet the Yellow Emperor, though long practicing, **could not achieve completion** (不能成).

Master Guangcheng said: Between the **heart and kidneys** (心肾),
There exists **True *qi* and True Water** (真气真水).
Within *qi* and water,
There exists **True Yin and True Yang** (真阴真阳),
When combined, they can be **compared to gold and stone** (可比金石).

Thus he **refined them in the Kunlun Mountains** (炼於崆峒之山),
Selected from **eight stones** (八石) and used **sand** (砂),
From which he **extracted mercury** (取汞);
Selected from **five metals** (五金) and used **lead** (铅),
From which he **extracted white gold** (取白金).

Mercury is the **Yang Dragon** (阳龙);
White gold is the **Yin Tiger** (阴虎).

He **used the heart’s fire** (心之火),
Which blazed like **sand** (砂);
The **kidneys’ water** (肾之水),
Which was **dark as lead** (玄如铅).

The **fire of the year** (年之火), at its proper time, **unites with Heaven and Earth’s strategy** (合乾坤之策);
The **fire of the month** (月之火), **waxes and wanes to suit the patterns of Wu and Wen** (损益以顺文武之宜).

His **furnace was threefold** (炉三成),
Its height **nine inches** (高九寸),
Square outside and round within,
To **draw the *qi* of the eight directions** (取八方之气),
Responding to the **four seasons’ signs** (应四时之候),
Thus it was the **Golden Cauldron** (金鼎).

Within it, **lead and mercury were stored like the lungs** (藏铅汞如肺),
And **sulfur was mixed like the spleen** (和硫黄如脾).

In three years, the **elixir was slightly perfected** (小成),
And could **remove ailments** (去疾);
In six years, the **elixir was fully perfected** (中成),
And could **extend life** (延年);
In nine years, the **elixir was completely perfected** (大成),
And could **transcend calamities and endure eternally** (浩劫长存).

Though few have achieved this since antiquity,
There is no other reason—
Some **fail to discern the qualities of metals and stones** (不辨金石之材),
Some **do not understand the fire’s timing** (不通火候),
Some **lack external methods** (外行不备),
Thus how can they **ever ingest it** (又安得而饵)?

Lüzi Says: The **External Elixir** (外丹) is **not sufficient to attain sainthood** (不足以入圣).
May I ask about the **Internal Elixir** (内丹)?

Zhōnglízi Says: The **External Elixir** (外丹) is **not so shallow** (岂可浅哉)?
The **kidneys** (肾) are the **root of *qi*** (气之根),
If the root is not deep, then the **branches cannot flourish** (叶不茂).
The **heart** (心) is the **source of fluids** (液之源),
If the source is not clear, then the **flow cannot be long** (流不长).

To **age and then study the Dao** (老而学道),
One must **necessarily rely on the five metals and eight stones** (资乎五金八石),
To **assist *qi* and refine the form** (助气炼形),
And only then is it possible.

To **depend on them for immortality** (恃之以宾天),
Is **indeed crude** (则亦陋矣).

Do you wish to **know the Internal Elixir** (内丹)?
Its **origin lies in the heart and kidneys** (本出乎心肾).

「The materials are but the **Dragon** (龙) and **Tiger** (虎) alone. Hence, when the Dragon and Tiger interact, they transform into the **Yellow Sprout** (黄芽);
When the Yellow Sprout matures, they then separate into **Lead** (铅) and **Quicksilver** (汞).

**Lǚzi** Says: Lead and Quicksilver are the External Elixir (外丹), yet you speak of them here—why is that?

**Zhōnglízi** Says: The treasure of **Embracing the One** (抱天一), the foremost of the five metals, is **Lead** (铅), the mother of **White Metal** (白金);
The treasure that **responds to the *Qi* of the Great Yang** (太阳), the foremost of the eight stones, is **Sand** (砂).
**Quicksilver** (汞) is its offspring (子), the White Metal within Lead that is difficult to extract (铅中之白金难取者),
And the Quicksilver within Sand that is easily lost (砂中之汞易失者).
Together, they form the **Supreme Treasure** (至宝).
This is but speaking of their outward forms (外者).

Now let us speak of their inward essence (内):
At the beginning of my formation (始胎), I reside in the **Pure Yin Palace** (纯阴之宫),
Where **Yin and Yang** (阴阳) have yet to differentiate,
And my **spirit** (神) is concealed within.
By **three hundred days** (三百日), the embryo is complete;
By **five thousand days** (五千日), the *Qi* is full.

I have observed the **Five Phases** (五行)—
At the start of my formation (始胎), it was but **essence** (精) and **blood** (血).
There was already water within me at the outset (先已有水),
And observing the **Five Viscera** (五藏),
My essence and blood form my **substance** (形).
There was already the **kidneys** (肾) within me at the outset (先已有肾).
Within the **kidney-water** (肾水), hidden from the very beginning of conception (受胎之初),
Is the **True *Qi*** (真气) of the union (交合).
This is my **Internal Lead** (内铅).

Within the **kidneys** (肾), *Qi* is generated (生气),
And within that *Qi*, there is the **True One Water** (真一之水)—
This is called the **Tiger** (虎).
The **White Metal** (白金) of my Internal Lead,
The **kidney-*Qi*** (肾之气) passes to the **liver-*Qi*** (肝之气),
The **liver-*Qi*** (肝之气) passes to the **heart-*Qi*** (心之气),
And the **heart-*Qi**, reaching the **Great Pole** (太极), generates **fluids** (液).
Within the fluids, there is the **True Yang *Qi*** (正阳之气)—
This is my **Internal Quicksilver** (内汞).
The **fluids of the heart** (心之液), this is my **Internal Sand** (内砂).
The **True One Water** (气中真液之水) within the *Qi*
And the **True Yang *Qi*** (液中正阳之气) within the fluids combine,
Accumulating to form the embryo (胎),
And passing to the **Yellow Court** (黄庭).
If the **fire is applied correctly** (进火不差),
Then the embryo will transform into the **Immortal** (仙化).

**Lǚzi** Says: Then how does one extract the **White Metal** (白金) from **Internal Lead** (内铅)?
And how does one obtain the **Quicksilver** (汞) from **Internal Sand** (内砂)?
When Quicksilver becomes Sand and White Metal becomes Treasure—
May I hear of this?

**Zhōnglízi** Says: **Internal Lead** (内铅) is the **True *Qi* of Yin and Yang** (阴阳之真气), the **pure and unadulterated** (纯粹不杂).
Once the form is established (形既成矣), the *Qi* is stored within it (其气藏乎)!
The **kidneys** (肾) on either side face each other,
Their *Qi* ascending together (同升於气),
This is the **Primordial Yang *Qi*** (元阳之气).
Within the *Qi*, there is water—
This is the **True One Water** (真一之水).
The water ascends with the *Qi*,
And when the *Qi* ceases, the water ceases;
When the *Qi* disperses, the water disperses.
The two combined (二者合焉),
This is the **Dragon and Tiger interacting to transform into the Yellow Sprout** (龙虎交而变黄芽),
And thus the **Great Medicine** (大药) is formed.

Hence, the **True One Water** (真一之水),
Storing the **True Yang *Qi*** (正阳之气) within,
Is like the embryo (犹胎哉)!
At first, it is **Yin retaining Yang** (阴留阳);
Next, it is **Yang refining Yin** (阳炼阴).
Thus, *Qi* becomes **essence** (精),
Essence becomes **Quicksilver** (汞),
Quicksilver becomes **Pearl** (珠),
Pearl becomes **Sand** (砂),
And Sand becomes **Golden Elixir** (金丹).
The **True *Qi*** (真气) spontaneously arises,
And when refined, it becomes **Spirit** (神).
The **Fire Dragon** (火龙) emerges from the **Great Darkness Crossroads** (大昏之衢),
And the **Mystic Crane** (玄鹤) ascends to the **Penglai Domain** (蓬莱之都).

**Lǚzi** Says: When form unites with form (以形交形), form combines to generate form (形合生形);
When *Qi* unites with *Qi* (以气合气), *Qi* combines to generate *Qi* (气合生气).
The number of cycles (数) does not exceed **thirty weeks** (三十旬),
This is how humans benefit (受用),
And there are distinctions between male and female (男女别焉).
What is my **Elixir** (丹) like?

**Zhōnglízi** Says: The **father’s essence** (父精) enters first,
And the **mother’s blood** (母血) follows.
The blood envelops the essence—
This is the **female** (女).
The female is **Internal Yang, External Yin** (内阳外阴),
With the blood on the outside (血在外).
The **mother’s blood** (母血) enters first,
And the **father’s essence** (父精) follows.
The essence envelops the blood—
This is the **male** (男).
The male is **Internal Yin, External Yang** (内阴外阳),
With the essence on the outside (精在外).

The so-called **blood** (血),
Generated from the **heart** (心),
Lacks the **True Yang *Qi*** (正阳之气);
The so-called **essence** (精),
Generated from the **kidneys** (肾),
Contains the **True Yang *Qi*** (正阳之气),
Which is the **root of Quicksilver** (汞之本).

Combining the **True One Water** (真一之水)
And entering it into the **Yellow Court** (黄庭),
Quicksilver is **cooked with Lead’s broth** (铅之汤),
And Lead is **refined with Quicksilver’s fire** (汞之火).
If Lead is not cooked with Quicksilver,
It cannot **release the True One Water** (发真一之水);
If Quicksilver is not refined with Lead,
It cannot **transform into Pure Yang *Qi*** (变纯阳之气).

**Lǚzi** Says: Quicksilver is **True Yang** (正阳),
And it is the **True One Water** (真一之水) that forms its embryo (胎).
When it reaches the **Yellow Court** (黄庭),
The Dragon and Tiger have already united (龙虎已交合),
And Yin and Yang have both **settled** (两止).
If you cook it with Lead (以铅烹之),
Will it not **deplete the Yin** (阴枫) and harm the **Lower Elixir Field** (下元)?
How can you say that *Qi* within generates *Qi*,
And thus forms the **Great Medicine** (大药)?

**Zhōnglízi** Says: The **kidney-*Qi*** (肾之气),
When infused into the **heart-*Qi*** (心之气),
Reaches its peak and generates **fluids** (液),
Within which the **True Yang *Qi*** (正阳之气) harmonizes with the **True One Water** (真一之水)—
This is called the **Dragon and Tiger’s union** (龙虎交合).

The **daily accumulation** (日之所得),
If placed in the Yellow Court like a **grain of millet** (黍),
Is called the **Golden Elixir, Great Medicine** (金丹大药).
What is the **Yellow Court** (黄庭)?
It lies beneath the **stomach** (胃之下),
Above the **bladder** (膀胱之上),
North of the **heart** (心之北),
South of the **kidneys** (肾之南),
West of the **liver** (肝之西),
And beside the **lungs** (肺之束).
Above, it is **clear and pure** (上清),
Below, it is **murky and turbid** (下浊).
Its outer appearance corresponds to the **four colors** (四色),
Its capacity holds **two pints** (二升),
And its pathways connect to the **eight waters** (八水).

Once the **medicine is placed** (药) within,
And the **fire is not applied** (火不进),
It will **scatter and fail to settle** (散而不能止).
If the fire is applied (火进),
But the medicine does not **harvest it** (之采),
Then the **Yang within Yin cannot settle** (阴中之阳不能止),
And it will merely **exhaust the kidney-*Qi*** (特发举肾之气),
To **inflame the Lower Elixir Field** (炎乎下元) alone.

Thus, the **harvesting of the medicine** (药之采),
Must correspond to the **advancement of the fire** (有时火之进).
There are **cycles** (数) in which one **borrows *Qi* from Lead** (先於铅中假气)
To **advance the fire** (进火),
And thus **strengthen the Great Medicine** (使大药坚固),
To **settle it in the Lower Elixir Field** (镇乎下田)—
This is called **harvesting and supplementing** (采补).

If one can **extract Lead** (抽其铅)
And **augment Quicksilver** (增其汞),
Then **flying gold crystals** (飞金晶) will appear behind the elbow (肘后).
If Lead is extracted (铅抽矣),
But Quicksilver is not augmented (汞不增),
Then it will merely **return essence to nourish the earthen pill** (还精以补泥丸) alone.
The **True *Qi*** (真气) cannot generate,
And the **Yang Spirit** (阳神) cannot manifest.

If Quicksilver is augmented (汞增矣),
But Lead is not extracted (铅不抽),
Then it will merely **refine Quicksilver** (徒以炼汞),
And **supplement the Elixir Field** (补丹田) to extend one’s life (益寿) may be possible.
Yet the **Sand cannot transform** (砂不能变),
And the **Golden Elixir cannot be formed** (金丹不能成).」

Master Lü said: *"We rely on the water within qi to harvest the medicine, and borrow the qi within Lead to advance the fire—that is all. But what is the principle behind extracting and augmenting it?"*

Master Zhōnglí Child replied: *"Metals and stones are external medicines—without inherent vitality. Qi and fluids are internal medicines—with inherent vitality. Though lacking vitality, [external medicines] can still act upon things to produce treasures, and dwell within humans to prolong life. But what of those with vitality? Over days and months, they recognize the times of union, drawing qi from the treasury to refine qi into spirit.

The grand [principles] of Heaven and Earth, the luminous [cycles] of sun and moon, the external [agents] of metals and stones, and the internal [agents] of qi and fluids—once extracted, one must know how to augment them; once augmented, one must know how to extract them. This is the root of transformation and generation.

At the Winter Solstice, Yang ascends from Earth. Earth extracts its Yin, so Great Yin is extracted to become *Jué-Yin*, and Minor Yang is augmented to become *Yáng-Míng*. *Jué-Yin* is extracted to become Minor Yin, and *Yáng-Míng* is augmented to become Great Yang. If not so, there would be no cold to transform warmth, and warmth would not transform into heat.

At the Summer Solstice, Yin descends to Heaven. Heaven extracts its Yang, so Great Yang is extracted to become *Yáng-Míng*, and Minor Yin is augmented to become *Jué-Yin*. *Yáng-Míng* is extracted to become Minor Yang, and *Jué-Yin* is augmented to become Great Yin. If not so, there would be no heat to transform frost, and frost would not transform into cold.

This is the verification of Heaven and Earth’s six *qi*—their rising, descending, extracting, and augmenting.

As for the moon transforming into the sun’s *hún* (魂), and the sun transforming into the moon’s *pò* (魄): in the first ten days, the moon extracts its *pò*, and the sun augments its *hún*, so its essence flourishes and illuminates the lower earth. If not so, the treasury would lack what generates the *upper arc* (上弦), and the *upper arc* would not transform into the *full moon* (既望).

As for the moon returning to its Yin *pò*, and the sun collecting its Yang essence: in the latter ten days, the sun extracts its *hún*, and the moon augments its *pò*, so its radiance wanes and the Yin *pò* swells. If not so, there would be no *full moon* to transform into the *lower arc* (下弦), and the *lower arc* would not transform into the *waning* (晦朔).

This is the verification of the sun and moon’s reciprocal cycles—the nine and six transformations—of extracting and augmenting.

Now, a person’s Lead is from Heaven and Earth before all else, arising from *Tàishǐ* (太始) and only then giving birth to the *Tàizhì* (太质), the mother of myriad substances. *Tàizhì* generates *Tàisù* (太素)—this is its form! Thus it becomes the gold within water—this is its function!

Therefore it is said: *‘Water within fire is the ancestor of the Five Phases, the root of the Great Dao.’*

When Quicksilver is augmented, Lead is extracted—this is not about internal and external, but about ascending from the Lower Elixir Field to the Upper Elixir Field. This is the *flying gold crystals* behind the elbow! This is the *River Chariot* rising and the *Dragon and Tiger* racing!"

「Returning the essence to nourish the *nǐwán* (泥丸)—the *mìngmén* (命门)! Lead, having been restored, is then extracted; Quicksilver, however, descends from the center. This is the transition from the Middle Elixir Field to the Lower Elixir Field.

First, the Dragon and Tiger unite, and then they merge to transform into the *Huángyá* (黄芽)—this is the reversal of the Five Phases! Next, Lead is extracted and Quicksilver is augmented to cultivate the *Tāixiān* (胎仙), enacting the cyclical return of the Three Elixir Fields. Without this process, the Dragon and Tiger would not unite, and the *Tāixiān* would not transmute.

Master Lü said: *"True Lead and true Quicksilver are the means by which one extracts and augments. I wish to hear their details."*

Master Zhōnglí (钟离) replied: *"Quicksilver must be used with Lead, yet it cannot be used by Lead—thus, Lead must be extracted and directed into the Upper Palace. If the Original *Qi* (元气) does not return, the essence will gather in the *nǐwán* (泥丸), and the sun’s acquired essence will be spent. When the yin of Quicksilver is exhausted and its yang is pure, its transformation occurs: essence becomes sand, sand becomes gold—this is called True Lead. True Lead is that which my true *Qi* (真气) unites with and obtains.

When the gold crystals descend into the *Dāntián* (丹田), they ascend to refine the form, and their bones take on a golden hue. Upon reaching True Lead, it ascends into the Inner Treasury (*Nèifǔ* 内府), and its body becomes white. Thus, it is said: ascending from below and descending from above, refining the Elixir and the form—all are the workings of the gold essence’s return! Moving from front to back, and back to front, burning the body and uniting the *Qi*—all are the functions of true *Qi* (真气) in transformation. Without extraction and augmentation, one could never reach this stage!

Master Lü asked: *"Ascending from above, descending from below, moving forward from behind and backward from front—what are the stages for this?"*

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"At times, one may ascend but never descend; at times, one may extract but never augment. The fluid movement of ascending and descending without force is the power of the River Chariot.

Master Lü asked: *"What is the River Chariot?"*

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"The human body, with its lesser yang and greater yin, is such that water resides abundantly within. Thus, my chariot moves through water. What does the chariot carry? It bears my Original Yang *Qi* (元阳之气) and turns with it. Its movement, sometimes ascending, sometimes descending, sometimes moving backward, sometimes forward, harnesses the Eight *Qióng* (琼)—the refined essences—and races across the Four Seas.

When ascending to Heaven, it rises and enters *Kūnlún* (昆仑); when crossing to the other shore (*Jìzhì* 既济), it descends and races toward the *Fèngquè* (凤阙). It circulates through the Original Yang *Qi*, entering the *Lígōng* (离宫) directly, bearing true *Qi* and returning to the *Shòufǔ* (寿府) by indirect paths. It traverses the Nine Regions, perpetually cycling through the Three Elixir Fields. When the Dragon and Tiger unite, the *Huángpó* (黄婆) guides them. Entering the *Huángtíng* (黄庭), once Lead and Quicksilver are separated, the *Jīnnán* (金男) remains.

Entering the *Jīnquè* (金阙), the *Yùquán* (玉泉) and the golden elixirs are all borne and gathered. Thus, the Five Phases rely upon it to manifest, and the Two *Qi* (二气) depend upon it to converge. Following the seasons to descend with effort, all are the applications of this chariot.

Now, to nourish yang and refine yin—undertaking matters without restraint—who can achieve this? When *Tiān* (天) and *Kūn* (坤) are not yet pure, who can cycle their yin and yang? When the cosmos is not yet complete, who can harmonize the circulation of *Qi* and blood? To draw in from the outside and rotate within, transforming the pure and refined *Qi* of Heaven and Earth to connect with my Original Yang *Qi*—who can achieve this? To ascend from the common to the sage, rotating the true and genuine yin-yang *Qi* to refine and supplement my Original Spirit (*Yuánshén* 元神)—who can achieve this? All are the chariot’s movements.

Master Lü said: *"This chariot—what is its purpose? Are there methods to its operation?"*

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"The River Chariot originates from the North, in the pure water of the *Zhēnwù* (正水). It is the spirit of the true *Qi* of the kidneys, which generates pure *Qi*. When *Tiān* (天) repeatedly seeks *Kūn* (坤), it produces *Kǎn* (坎). *Kǎn* is water, the essence of yin. Once yang seeks yin, the yang returns, bearing the yin back to its place. In its passage, it encounters *Gèn* (艮), *Zhèn* (震), and *Xùn* (巽). It seeks yin through yin, taking yin from yin. It then moves into *Lí* (离), receiving yang and generating, thus bearing yin into yang.

When *Kūn* (坤) repeatedly seeks *Tiān* (天), it produces *Lí* (离). *Lí* is fire, the essence of yang. Once yin seeks yang, the yin returns, embracing the yang back to its place. In its passage, it encounters *Kūn* (坤), *Duì* (兑), and *Tiān* (天). It seeks yang through yang, taking yang from yang. It then moves into *Kǎn* (坎), receiving yin and generating, thus bearing yang into yin.

Upon gathering the elixir from the Nine Palaces above, once obtained, it descends into the *Huángtíng* (黄庭), extracts Lead from below the *Qūjiāng* (曲江), and bears the *Bān* (般) to ascend into the Inner Treasury. The essence of gold and jade originates from the Elixir of Return. Bearing and circulating it can refine the form, causing water to ascend and move—this is the source of the fire for both lords and subjects. Bearing and circulating it can produce the Elixir, causing fire to descend and advance—thus, the Five *Qi* (五气) converge at the Original Center (*Yuán* 元), and the Three *Huā* (花) gather at the apex!

Bearing and circulating it must also follow its seasons and numbers, for when the spirit gathers, the demon arrives. Using true fire to consume the body, the Three *Péng* (彭) perish, and the elixir is ready—thus the sea dries up. Circulating the *Xiájiāng* (霞浆) for bathing, the Eight Waters ripple in response.

Master Lü said: *"I now wander its shores but have not yet fathomed its depths. I wish to further discuss this."*

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"The Five Phases reversed, the Dragon and Tiger uniting to transform into the *Huángyá* (黄芽)—this is the Small River Chariot. The Three Elixir Fields returning in cycles, the flying gold crystals behind the elbow, returning essence into the *nǐwán* (泥丸), extracting Lead and augmenting Quicksilver to produce the Great Elixir—this is the Great River Chariot.

The Dragon and Tiger unite to transform into the *Huángyá* (黄芽), and Lead and Quicksilver unite to form the Great Elixir. True *Qi* (真气) generates, and the Five *Qi* converge at the Original Center (*Yuán* 元). The Original Yang Spirit (*Yuánshén* 元神) is complete, and the Three Spirits (*Sānshén* 三神) ascend into the Inner Treasury."*

「The *Zǐjīndān* (紫金丹) is completed, like the *Xuánhè* (玄鹤) taking flight; the *Bái yù gǒng* (白玉汞) is refined, like the *Huǒlóng* (火龙) rising. Whether it moves outward or inward with ease, or travels forth and back without obstruction—this is the *Zǐhé Chē* (紫河车).

This chariot has three stages of attainment: upper, middle, and lower. After these three stages, there are three more:

1. The *Huǒjǔ* (火聚)—when the mind directs its intention, using it to cure illness; its name is *Shǐzhě Kù qí jìjì* (使者库其既济). From above to below, yin and yang align in harmony, water and fire coexist in balance. In stillness, one hears the thunderous sounds of *léitíng* (雷霆), and its name is *Léichē* (雷车);

2. When the mind is enslaved by sensory perceptions and nature is dragged by emotions, the Original Yang *Qi* (元阳之气) is dispersed by external influences from within to without, ceaselessly. Over time, it declines, and the *Bāxié Wǔyì* (八邪五疫) then circulate and enter the *Qìfǔ* (气府). The Original Yang cannot resist them, so age and illness arise, and illness leads to death. Its name is *Pòchē* (破车).

Master Lǚ asked: *"The *Zǐhé Chē* (紫河车)—what is its origin and how does it operate?"*

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"First, yin and yang are harmonized; then, water and fire are gathered and dispersed. Afterward, medicines are gathered and fire is refined, Lead is extracted and Quicksilver is augmented. Thus, the Small River Chariot must naturally proceed. When the golden crystals enter the *Dǐng* (顶), and the *Huángtíng* (黄庭) elixir is formed, the Three Passes are struck in one blow, ascending directly into the Inner Treasury. The latter rises while the former is gathered, refining from below and nourishing from above—thus, the Great River Chariot must naturally proceed. The essence of gold and jade, known as *Huándān liànxíng* (还丹炼形), is the refining of form.

Refining form comes before refining *Qi*; refining *Qi* comes before refining spirit. When spirit and Dao are united, only then does one attain completion—this is the *Zǐhé Chē* (紫河车).

Master Lǚ asked: *"Refining form into *Qi*, refining *Qi* into spirit, and refining spirit to unite with Dao—this is beyond what I dare to inquire. I venture to ask: what is meant by *Huándān* (还丹)?"*

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"The *Dān* (丹) is neither color nor flavor—it refers to the *Dāntián* (丹田)! It has three distinct aspects: the upper is called *Shénshè* (神舍), the middle is *Qìfǔ* (气府), and the lower is *Jīngxué* (精穴).

From *Jīng* (精) arises *Qi* (气), and thus *Qi* resides in the middle *Dān* (丹); from *Qi* arises spirit, and thus spirit resides in the upper *Dān*; when true water and true *Qi* merge to form essence, then essence resides in the lower *Dān*. Which of these two lacks it?

Only when the *Qi* is generated in the *shèn* (肾) but has not yet ascended to the Original Center (*Zhōngyuán* 中元); only when the spirit is stored in the heart but has not yet ascended to the Upper Treasury (*Shàngyuàn* 上院. Therefore, the essence cannot return, and the three *Dān* (丹) remain unfulfilled—what use are they?

Master Lǚ asked: *"Within the mysterious center, who does not possess life? If life lacks essence, it is not my *Qi*—is it my Original *Qi* from the time of conception? If there is no essence, there is no *Qi*; if there is no *Qi*, there is no spirit—is it my Original spirit from the time of conception?"* Thus, essence, *Qi*, and spirit are the treasures of the Three Elixir Fields (*Sāndiàn* 三田).

To remain perpetually in the Three Treasures (*Sān Guān* 三官), one must also follow the Dao. Upper, middle, and lower.

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"When *Qi* is generated in the center of the *shèn* (肾), there is true *Yī* (真一) water within it. If one returns this water to the lower *Dān* (丹), essence nurtures the *línggēn* (灵根), and *Qi* will naturally arise. When essence is generated in the center of the heart, there is Original Yang *Qi* within it. If one returns this *Qi* to the middle *Dān*, *Qi* nurtures the *língyuán* (灵源), and spirit will naturally arise. When spirit is gathered into unity, it merges with Dao, and by returning to the upper *Dān*, one attains immortality.

Master Lǚ asked: *"Returning (还)—this is to go forth and yet have a destination. Its principles are profound and subtle; I have not yet fathomed them."*

Master Zhōnglí replied: *"Do you know of the returning of the elixir? There are small returns and great returns, seven-fold returns and nine-fold transformations, golden essence and jade essence, those that return lower elixir to upper elixir, those that return upper elixir to middle elixir, those that return middle elixir to lower elixir, those that return yang to yin, and those that return yin to yang. It is not merely about naming them—their timing and effects differ.

The so-called *small* (小) refers to the Original Center (*Shàngyuán* 上元). The lower Original Center (*Xiàyuán* 下元) is the master of the Five Viscera (*Wǔzàng* 五藏) and the root of the Three Elixir Fields (*Sāndiàn* 三田). Water generates wood, wood generates fire, fire generates earth, earth generates metal, metal generates water—following its natural order, it generates and draws forth what has not yet generated, like a mother nurturing her child.

Fire overcomes metal, metal overcomes wood, wood overcomes earth, earth overcomes water, water overcomes fire—following its natural degree, it overcomes and supplements what has not yet been overcome, like husband and wife uniting in harmony. *Qi* and essence circulate in transformation, completing cycles from *zǐ* (子) to *wǔ* (午), where yin and yang are born; from *mǎo* (卯) to *yǒu* (酉), where yin and yang are at rest. In one day and one night, the lower elixir is returned. Those who cultivate the true way gather medicines and refine fire within this cycle, and thus the lower elixir is completed.

The so-called *great* (大) is when the Dragon and Tiger unite to transform into the *Huángyá* (黄芽), Lead is extracted and Quicksilver is augmented, and the Great Elixir is formed. The golden crystals arise from the *Xuánwǔ* (玄武) Palace, true *Qi* ascends beneath the *Yùjīng* (玉京), the River Chariot races across the peaks, and jade essence is poured into the crossroads. It enters the lower field and returns to the upper field, then returns again to the lower field. The latter rises while the former descends, completing its cycle. Those who cultivate the true way within this process awaken the Dragon and Tiger, make the golden crystals fly, nurture the embryo for immortality, and thus the lower elixir is completed.

The so-called *seven-fold return* (七返) is when the yang of the heart returns to the heart itself, and the yang of the lungs, generated from the heart, returns again to the heart—all without departing from the middle *Dān*.

As for the *nine-fold transformation* (九转), why is it so? The numbers of the Five Phases' generation are fifty-five: Heaven One, Earth Two; Heaven Three, Earth Four; Heaven Five, Earth Six; Heaven Seven, Earth Eight; Heaven Nine, Earth Ten. Thus, one, three, five, seven, and nine are yang numbers, totaling twenty-five;」

「Two, four, six, eight, and ten are yin numbers, totaling thirty—thus the human body is fully composed.

Beginning from the kidneys, the Five Phases’ *generative* numbers are as follows: Water One, Fire Two; Wood Three, Metal Four; Earth Five. Here, the five numbers of generation are three yang and two yin.

Again, beginning from the kidneys, the Five Phases’ *transformative* numbers are: Water Six, Fire Seven; Wood Eight, Metal Nine; Earth Ten. Here, the five numbers of transformation are three yin and two yang.

Thus, Water corresponds to the kidneys, for it holds One and Six;
Fire corresponds to the heart, for it holds Two and Seven;
Wood corresponds to the liver, for it holds Three and Eight;
Metal corresponds to the lungs, for it holds Four and Nine;
Earth corresponds to the spleen, for it holds Five and Ten—each of these thus has its own yin and yang.

The yin reaches its extreme at Eight, flourishes at Two; hence, when *qi* arrives at the liver, the residual yin of the kidneys is exhausted.
When *qi* arrives at the heart, the *Taiji* generates yin, for Two resides in the heart and Eight in the liver.

The yang is fully spent at Nine, flourishes at One; hence, when the essence arrives at the lungs, the residual yang of the heart is exhausted.
When the essence arrives at the kidneys, the *Taiji* generates yang, for One resides in the kidneys and Nine in the lungs.

I harmonize the Dragon and Tiger, blending the heart’s *orthodox yang-qi*—this is the heart’s Seven.
The Seven returns to the *middle Dān* and descends into the *lower field*, nurturing the embryo of immortality, then returns to the heart—this is its seven-fold return.

As for the Two-Eight yin, how does it dissipate?
The *true-qi* arises, and the heart has no yin, thus exhausting the Two;
The *great medicine* forms, and the liver has no yin, thus exhausting the Eight.

When the liver’s pure yang aids the heart, the *qi* of Wood Three flourishes;
Since Seven has returned to the heart, it exhausts the lungs’ *receptive yin*, and the lungs’ Nine transforms to aid the heart—thus the Nine-Three yang grows long.

This is its nine-fold transformation.

Master Lü said: When the *golden essence* and *jade essence* meet at the Three Officials, and yin and yang alternate, what is this?

Master Zizhili replied: The ancients of supreme attainment called the lungs’ essence, when it enters the *lower field*, the *golden essence*;
The heart’s essence, when it enters the *middle field*, the *jade essence*.
They were not mistaken, yet they did not fully grasp the *mysterious mechanism*.

The lungs generate the kidneys, for Metal produces Water;
The kidneys overcome the heart, for Water subdues Fire.
Metal enters Water, Water enters Fire—how then can these be called *returning to the elixir*?

The *golden essence* is the lungs’ essence.
Its role as a *fetal sac*, its union with the Dragon and Tiger, its transmission to the *Yellow Court*—as the *great medicine* nears completion, it is drawn from the elbow’s rear, ascending and flying, its essence entering the *Upper Palace*, then descending back into the *middle Dān*, and again returning from the *middle Dān* to the *lower field*.

The *jade essence* is the kidneys’ essence.
It follows the *primordial qi* as it ascends, gathering at the heart;
Accumulated, it becomes *golden water*;
Lifted, it fills the *jade pool*;
Dispersed, it forms the *radiant flower*;
Refined, it becomes *white snow*.
When taken in, it enters from the *middle field* to the *lower field*, and if there is medicine, it can bathe the embryo of immortality;
When raised, it ascends from the *middle field* into the Four Limbs, and when the form is refined, it can transmute dust and bones.

If neither ascending nor descending, it cycles endlessly.
When yin reaches its extreme, yang is born, and within yang lies the *true One’s Water*—this water ascends with the yang, thus yin returns to yang;
When yang reaches its extreme, yin is born, and within yin lies the *orthodox yang-qi*—this *qi* descends with the yin, thus yang returns to yin.

Thus, the *mending of the earthen pill* is the refining of the Nine Heavens, returning from below to above;
Having reached completion, it irrigates and nourishes, returning from above to the middle;
Refining the elixir and advancing the fire, it returns from the middle to below;
Refining the substance and consuming the form, it returns from below to the middle.

The Five Phases are inverted, and the Three Fields alternate—until the form is refined and *qi* transmuted, until *qi* is refined into spirit, ascending from the *lower field*.
Until it reaches the *middle field*, then ascending from the *middle field*.
Until it reaches the *upper field*, then ascending from the *upper field*.
Emerging through the *Heavenly Gate*, the three ascensions’ work is complete, entering the *Sacred Stream*—no further return is needed.

The forty-first chapter of *Dao Gun* concludes. #1: Original text reads 『大』, corrected according to *Ji Yao* edition.
The forty-first chapter of *Dao Gun* continues, as collected by Master Youzi Zeng.」

**Transmission of the Dao, Lower Section**

Lüzi said: *"Refining the form—what does this mean?"*
Zhōnglíqízi replied: *"The spirit is the master of the form; the form is the dwelling of the spirit. Within the form, essence generates qi, and qi generates spirit. Within the fluid, qi is born; within qi, fluid is born—this is the child-mother within the form. That which generates wood is water; that which generates fire is wood; that which generates earth is fire; that which generates metal is earth; that which generates water is metal. Thus, qi passes through child-mother, fluid flows through husband-wife—this is the yin-yang within the form.

Water transforms into fluid, fluid into blood, blood into essence—this is yin receiving yang to generate. When yin-yang lose their proper harmony, then tears, saliva, spittle, and sweat flow horizontally, and yin loses its power to generate.

Qi transforms into essence, essence into pearl, pearl into mercury, mercury into sand—this is yang receiving yin to complete. When yin-yang lose their proper harmony, then sickness, aging, death, and suffering arise, and yang cannot be perfected.

Thus, if yin is not obtained, yang does not generate; if yang is not obtained, yin does not complete. He who cultivates yang but neglects yin, refines the form but not the substance—how can he hope to endure forever?

Our initial embryo, born from yin within yin, constructs form from form. When gestation completes and the body matures—six feet in height—all belongs to yin. The primordial yang within us is but a grain of millet. When great, it can refine the form into qi, making an external body within the body.

Lüzi said: *"Then the form is yin—yin has substance. To make substance into non-substance, to transform the form into qi and enter the sacred—this is the method of refining. Retain qi within the form, and use qi to nourish the form. The highest attain the long life of eternal vision; the next extend their years. Three hundred sixty days make a year; thirty-six thousand years make an eon; thirty-six thousand eons make a great eon. Refining the form can reach the great eon."*

Yán Yuán wished to hear this. Zhōnglíqízi said: *"The human form—its length is five feet five inches. If uneven, measure by inches to define feet, the numbers of the Five Phases in generation.

Above the heart are the Nine Heavens; below the kidneys are the Nine Earths. From kidney to heart is eight inches four parts; this harmonizes with Heaven and Earth. From heart to the first tower’s first ring is also eight inches four parts; from the first ring to the crown is also eight inches four parts. From kidney to crown is two feet five inches two parts.

My primordial qi, filling and emptying in one day and night, completes three hundred twenty degrees. Each degree is two feet five inches two parts, totaling eighty-one zhang—matching the pure yang of nine nines. From kidney to crown is the five-fives of pure yang. Thus, primordial qi issues forth with the breath.

When it exhales, the *honoring* and *defensive* circulations open. The true qi of Heaven and Earth responds to the seasons, follows the nodes—sometimes converging, sometimes separating—endless in zhang and feet. When inhaled, the meridians and collaterals unfold. Thus, with each inhalation and exhalation, the true qi of the Three Realms—Heaven, Earth, and Man—travels through the Twelve Towers. One round trip is one breath; day and night, this accumulates thirteen thousand five hundred times.

Thus, my thirteen thousand five hundred exhalations send my primordial qi outward from the center; my thirteen thousand five hundred inhalations draw the true qi of Heaven and Earth inward from without. If the root is firm and primordial qi is substantial, then inhalation and exhalation can seize the true qi of Heaven and Earth. Thus, refining qi with qi, dispersing and filling the body—clear becomes the *honoring*, turbid the *defensive*, all flowing freely; vertical are the meridians, horizontal the collaterals, all relaxed and unobstructed. Cold and heat cannot harm, and longevity follows.

If the root decays and vital essence diminishes, then the inhaled qi of Heaven and Earth pours forth. My primordial qi, reduced by nine nines, is instead seized by Heaven and Earth."*

Lüzi said: *"How can primordial qi be preserved from depletion to refine the form’s substance? How can Heaven and Earth’s true qi be seized?"*

Zhōnglíqízi replied: *"To conquer in battle, one’s army must be strong; to secure the people, the nation must be rich. Primordial qi is the army. Within, it can dissolve the form’s yin substance; without, it can seize Heaven and Earth’s qi. The body is the nation—what has form is abundant; what is formless is firm. All gates open without loss; one steed’s misstep yields many gains.

Sometimes forward, sometimes backward—to refine the substance, consume the form; sometimes upward, sometimes downward—to nourish the yang, dissolve the yin. The refining of Heaven and Earth has its time; the tempering of qi and fluid has its day.

Refine the form with jade fluid, and the Tortoise of Metal ascends, filling the body with white snow; refine with gold fluid, and the Thunder Chariot descends, filling the room with golden light.

When jade fluid ascends, the River Chariot carries it through the Four Great [elements]. First, the liver receives it, and its light shines in the eyes; next, the heart receives it, and its fluid hums in the mouth; next, the spleen receives it, and the skin becomes like congealed fat; next, the lungs receive it, and the nose emits heavenly fragrance, strengthening the face; finally, the kidneys receive it, returning twice to the original source, and its sound reaches the ears, strengthening the hair—gold fluid cannot advance further."*

If the alchemical elixir (*huandan*) has yet to return, its manifestation in the **Lord Fire** (*junhuo*) is called **Completion** (*jiji*). Once the elixir returns and again arises, it opposes the **True Yin** (*zhenyin*), and this is called **Refining the Essence** (*lianzhi*), for the Earth element subdues the Water.

If the **gold fluid** (*jinye*) resides in the Earth, it causes the **Yellow Emperor** (*Huangdi*) to **revert his light** (*huiguang*), thus aligning with the **Great Yin** (*Taiyin*), for Fire subdues Metal.

If the **gold fluid** (*jinye*) resides in the Fire, it makes the **Red Boy** (*Chizi*) share the furnace, and thus **purple vapor** (*zixi*) is born. When Fire flourishes in Water, is this not the **consumption of Yin within Yang** (*yangzhongxiaoyin*)?

Transforming the **gold elixir** (*jindan*) within the **Yellow Court** (*Huangting*), refining the **Yang Spirit** (*yangshen*) amidst the **Five Qi** (*wuqing*), then the **liver’s verdant qi** (*qingqi*) surges forth, the **lungs’ white hue** (*baise*) emerges, the **heart’s crimson light** (*chiguang*) appears, the **kidneys’ dark essence** (*heixiang*) ascends, and the **spleen’s yellow luster** (*huangcai*) responds in kind!

Then, it **faces the Central Source** (*zhongyuan*), follows the **Lord Fire** (*junhuo*), and **transcends the Inner Palace** (*neiyuan*). The **Lower Source** (*xiayuan*) is the **Yang within Yin** (*yinzhongyang*), its Yang having no counterpart in Yin; the **Central Source** (*zhongyuan*) is the **Yang within Yang** (*yangzhongyang*), its Yang having no origin in life; the **Great Elixir of the Yellow Court** (*Huangting Dayao*) is the **Yin exhausted, Yang in purity** (*yinjin yangchun*). The three ascend and converge at the **Spirit Official** (*shenguan*), so the **Lower Source** (*xiayuan*) is what the **Five Fluids** (*wuyi*) face; the **Central Source** (*zhongyuan*) is what the **Five Qi** (*wuqing*) face; the **Upper Source** (*shangyuan*) is what the **Three Yangs** (*sanyang*) face.

Master Lü asked: *"What is meant by ‘facing the Source’* (*chaoyuan*)?" The **Master Zhongli** (*Zhongli Zizi*) replied:

*"When chaos was divided into Heaven and Earth, Heaven and Earth were positioned and the Five Directions established. Each direction had its own sovereign (*di*), and each sovereign had two children (*zi*), one Yang, one Yin—these were called the **Two Sovereigns** (*er di*). They generated and nurtured each other, thus forming the **Five Phases** (*wuxing*), and the **Five Phases** then defined the **Six Qi** (*liuqing*)—the Three Yangs and Three Yins.

It is like the beginning of a human fetus: the **Essential Qi** (*jingqi*) is singular, then it divides and gives rise to the **Two Kidneys** (*er shen*). The left is **Primordial** (*xuan*), the right is **Receptive** (*pin*). The **Primordial** (*xuan*) ascends the **Qi** (*qi*) and transmits it upward to the liver; the **Receptive** (*pin*) gathers the **Fluids** (*ye*) and transmits them downward to the bladder. **Primordial** and **Receptive**—these emerge from **the Non-existent** (*wu*), and through **the Non-existent** (*wu*) become **the Existent** (*you*)!

Thus it is said: *"The Grain Spirit does not die"* (*gushenbudu*), this is called **Primordial-Receptive** (*xuanpin*), the **Gate of Primordial-Receptive** (*xuanpinmen*) being the **Root of Heaven and Earth** (*tian di gen*). From the kidneys arise the **Five Zang Organs** (*wuzang*) and **Six Fu Organs** (*liufu*).

The liver is **Wood** (*mu*), associated with **Geng-Xi** (*jia-yi*), positioned under the **Green Sovereign** (*Qingdi*) of the East; the heart is **Fire** (*huo*), associated with **Bing-Ding** (*bing-ding*), positioned under the **Red Sovereign** (*Chidi*) of the South; the lungs are **Metal** (*jin*), associated with **Geng-Xin** (*geng-xin*), positioned under the **White Sovereign** (*Baidi*) of the West; the spleen is **Earth** (*tu*), associated with **Wu-Ji** (*wu-ji*), positioned under the **Yellow Sovereign** (*Huangdi*) of the Center; the kidneys are **Water** (*shui*), associated with **Ren-Gui** (*ren-gui*), positioned under the **Black Sovereign** (*Heidi*) of the North.
