Thus, **One Qi** (*yige*) moves the **Five Phases** (*wuxing*), and the **Five Phases** (*wuxing*) move the **Six Qi** (*liuqing*). The first among them are **Yin and Yang** (*yinyang*); the Yang has the **Yang within Yin** (*yinzhongyang*), and the Yin has the **Yin within Yang** (*yangzhongyin*).

The second are the **Five Phases** (*wuxing*), which include **Fire within Water** (*shui zhonghuo*), **Water within Fire** (*huo zhongshui*), **Metal within Water** (*shui zhongjin*), **Wood within Metal** (*jin zhongmu*), **Fire within Wood** (*mu zhonghuo*), and **Earth within Fire** (*huo zhongtu*).

In the human body, these **intermingle** (*jiahe*)?

Thus the **Two Qi** (*erqi*) divide into the **Six Qi** (*liuqing*), and the **Great Dao** (*Da Dao*) disperses into the **Five Phases** (*wuxing*).

When the sun reaches its southernmost point, **One Yang** (*yiyang*) arises and **faces the Qi** (*chaoqi*) to Heaven, and the **Five Directions’ Earthly Yangs** (*wufang diyang*) all flourish. One sovereign (*di*) presides over its command, while the other four assist. If the **Spring Command** (*chunling*) is active, and the **Black Sovereign** (*Heidi*) does not **retrieve its command** (*shouling*), then **cold cannot transform into warmth** (*han bunengbian wen*); if the **Red Sovereign** (*Chidi*) does not **fulfill its command** (*beiling*), then **warmth cannot transform into heat** (*wen bunengbian re*).

When the sun reaches its northernmost point, **One Yin** (*yiyin*) arises and **faces the Qi** (*chaoqi*) to Earth, and the **Five Directions’ Heavenly Yins** (*wufang tianyin*) all descend. One sovereign (*di*) presides over its command, while the other four assist. If the **Autumn Command** (*qiuling*) is active, and the **Red Sovereign** (*Chidi*) does not **retrieve its command** (*shouling*), then **heat cannot transform into frost** (*re bunengbian shuang*); if the **Black Sovereign** (*Heidi*) does not **fulfill its command** (*beiling*), then **frost cannot transform into cold** (*shuang bunengbian han*).

Thus, broadly speaking, between the sun and moon: when **One Yang** (*yiyang*) first arises, the **Five Zang Organs’ Qi** (*wuzangqi*) face the **Central Source** (*zhongyuan*); when **One Yin** (*yiyin*) first arises, the **Five Zang Organs’ Fluids** (*wuzangye*) face the **Lower Source** (*xiayuan*).

Then, the **Three Yangs** (*sanyang*)—the **Yang within Yin** (*yinzhongyang*), the **Yang within Yang** (*yangzhongyang*), and the **Yang within Yin-Yang** (*yinyangzhongyang*)—face the **Inner Palace** (*neiyuan*). The **Heart Spirit** (*xin shen*) returns to the **Heavenly Palace** (*tian gong*), all of which are called **facing the Source** (*chaoyuan*).

Although the **Dragon and Tiger** (*longhu*) unite to form the **Great Elixir** (*dayao*), and the **Great Elixir** (*dayao*) forms the **True Qi** (*zhengqi*), once the **True Qi** (*zhengqi*) arises, it is used within the year by the month, the month’s upper portion determining the **rise and decline** (*xingshuai*) of things; the day’s middle portion is used to **reckon affairs** (*shizhi*), the upper portion of the day to **count the rectified matters** (*shizhi*); the hour’s middle portion is used to **define the breath’s number** (*xisu*), the upper portion of the hour to **determine the resting count** (*xisu*).

In the **liver’s Qi** (*ganqi*), it **buds in Hai** (*hai*), **arises in Yin** (*yin*), **flourishes in Si** (*si*), and **wanes in Shen** (*shen*). In the **heart’s Qi** (*xinqi*), it buds in **Shen** (*shen*), arises in **Hai** (*hai*), flourishes in **Yin** (*yin*), and wanes in **Si** (*si*). In the **lungs’ Qi** (*feiqi*), it buds in **Si** (*si*), arises in **Shen** (*shen*), flourishes in **Hai** (*hai*), and wanes in **Yin** (*yin*). In the **kidneys’ Qi** (*shenqi*), spring follows the liver, summer follows the heart, autumn follows the lungs, and winter follows the kidneys.

The **Spleen’s Qi**—he who does not grasp this is why he falls ill so often!

The **day**, the **moon**, and the **hour**—when the **Three Yang** converge, they refine Yang with Yang, so that Yin does not arise within. When the **Three Yin** converge, they refine Yin with Yin, so that Yang does not disperse.

Once the **True Qi** is born, it refines the **Five Viscera** with pure Yang without ceasing. Each emits its proper color, and in one movement, it ascends to the **Celestial Pool**.

First, with the **kidneys’ lack of Yin**, the **Nine Rivers** have no waves. Next, with the **liver’s lack of Yin**, the **Eight Gates** are forever sealed. Next, with the **lungs’ lack of Yin**, **Metal and Fire** are forged in one furnace. Next, with the **spleen’s lack of Yin**, the **Jade Gate** remains unopened. Then, as the **True Qi** ascends, the **Four Qi** merge into one, and the **Golden Elixir** descends.

Can a single cup of water overcome the fire of a cartload of firewood? Indeed, when **water and fire** unite, they enter the **Divine Palace**, stabilizing the **inner contemplation**. With **one intent undivided**, the **spirit and cognition** become wondrous.

In stillness, one hears the **Supreme Music of the Dao**, as if asleep yet not asleep, wandering in the realm of **emptiness**—this is called **transcending the Inner Precinct**.

Thus, as the **Yang Spirit** gathers and returns upward to refine the **Dan**, refining the spirit to unite with the **Great Dao**, ascending through the **Heavenly Gate** and returning to the body, then **form aligns with Heaven and Earth**.

If one **sheds** it, they ascend to the **Purple Palace** to pay homage to the **Great Constellation**.

**Master Lü** said: Only then did I realize that refining the **form** can prolong life—must one who seeks **immortality** necessarily refine the **Qi**?

Those **eccentric adepts** practice **embryonic breathing** without elixirs. If they forcefully retain it, accumulating **extreme cold**, they may summon **void Yang** and incur **harsh illnesses**. They do not know that when the **embryonic immortal** is complete, **True Qi** is born, and **embryonic breathing** follows.

**Embryonic breathing** refines the **Qi**; refining the **Qi** cultivates the **spirit**.

**Master Lü** said: Those who refine the **Qi** must carefully select the **month within the year**, the **day within the month**, and the **hour within the day**. Seated in stillness, forgetting worldly concerns and nearness, at such times—when the mind and spirit are not yet free of delusion, when wisdom and cognition are flawed—if one fixates on **immortality**, the **heart** and **spirit** remain unsettled. Then what should be done?

**Master Zhōnglí** replied: You have not yet attained **inner contemplation**. Through **inner contemplation**, the **spirit and cognition** naturally cease.

**Master Lü** asked: What is **inner contemplation**?

**Master Zhōnglí** replied: It is what is called **"sitting and forgetting."**

Yet those **eccentric adepts**, in their copulation without knowing the proper time, in their practices without knowing the method, still hope to succeed through **inner contemplation**.

Thus, they forge **inner elixirs** with intent, gather **medicinal essences** in imagination, grind at the nose and swallow through the mouth, hoping to draw the **day, moon, and Earth** into the **Qi repositories**—like dreaming of receiving bribes.

Yet **Heaven and Earth** remain obstructed, and though time passes, they do not unite. Their failure lies in **scattered intent**.

A skilled observer, when focused on **vermilion and indigo**, sees not the **Great Peak**; a skilled listener, when focused on **reeds and strings**, hears not the **thunder**. The uses of **ears and eyes** are shallow indeed. How much more so the **heart**, which encompasses the **Six Directions** yet claims to achieve **inner contemplation and sitting-forgetting**?

At the onset of **inner contemplation**, it is like the **Yang ascending**. The visions are of:
- **Male**, **Dragon**, **Fire**, **Heaven**, **Clouds**, **Crane**, **Sun**, **Horse**, **Smoke**, **Mist**, **Chariot**, **Reins**, **Blossoms**, **Qi**—like **Yin descending**.

The visions are of:
- **Female**, **Tiger**, **Water**, **Earth**, **Rain**, **Tortoise**, **Moon**, **Ox**, **Metal**, **Mud**, **Boat**, **Leaves**.

Yet my **inner contemplation** extends beyond these!

The **Azure Dragon**, the **White Tiger**, the **Vermilion Bird**, the **Dark Warrior**, the **Five Sacred Peaks**, the **Nine Regions**, the **Four Seas**, the **Three Isles**, the **Golden Male**, the **Jade Female**, the **River Vehicle**, the **Double Tower**—all are **symbols established in the Void** to stabilize **spirit and cognition**.

Thus, before the **fish is caught**, the **net must not be lost**; before the **hare is taken**, the **track must not be abandoned**. Yet one must not cling to permanence, for it ends in an instant.

He who reaches **cessation of thought and extinction of imagination** attains **True Emptiness**, only then may he **converse with the True**.

For **inner contemplation** is the **foundation’s beginning**; one must daily diminish it, entering **mystery and subtlety**—this too comes from **inner contemplation**.

**Master Lü** asked: When **Dragon and Tiger unite** and **Yin and Yang pair**, how does their **inner contemplation** proceed?

**Master Zhōnglí** replied: In their visions, the **Nine Sovereign True Person** draws the **child in crimson robes** upward, while the **Nine Sovereign True Mother** draws the **maiden in dark robes** downward.

They meet in the **Yellow-Housed Courtyard**, where the **aged woman in yellow robes** mediates their union. Afterward, the **maiden descends**, the **child ascends**, and they part as if estranged.

Then the **aged woman** holds an object, like a **vermilion tangerine**, and casts it into the **Yellow House**, storing it in a **vessel of refined gold**.

What is the **child**? **Heaven’s Yang** seeks **Earth’s Yin**, returning to its root, bearing **Yang** upon **Yin** to meet its place.

What is the **maiden**? **Earth’s Yin** seeks **Heaven’s Yang**, returning to its root, embracing **Yin** around **Yang** to meet its place.

This is the **union of Kan and Li**, the **pairing of Yin and Yang**!

Like **flames blazing**, within them a **Dark Tiger** ascends; like **waters surging**, within them a **Red Dragon** descends.

The two contend before the **Pavilion**, the **wooden doors** gaping open, their **flames and waves** rising—there is a **Sovereign** who gazes upon them.

The **conflagration** scorches the heavens, and above, a **ten-thousand-zhang tide** swells. The **fire** rises and then falls, its **flames filling Heaven and Earth**, while the **Dragon and Tiger** coil and twist, entering the **vessel of refined gold**, descending into the **Yellow House**, as if placed in a **cage**.

This is the **vision of the Dragon and Tiger’s union**.

Luzi said: *"How is the vision of the Fire’s Advancement?"*

Zhongli Master replied: *"In this vision, there is a vessel. It is like a cauldron or a tripod, its distinctions between **Dark Tiger** and **Yellow Dragon**—its form like a chariot wheel—with the **Azure Dragon** on the left, the **White Tiger** on the right, the **Vermilion Bird** in front, and the **Dark Turtle** behind. Beside them stand two ministers in **purple robes**, holding **jewel-axes**, while below, attendants bearing **firewood** fan the **blaze** within the vessel.

Then comes a **Sovereign** in **scarlet robes**, riding a **red steed**, driving a **red cloud**, descending from the void to issue commands. His radiance ascends, piercing the heavens as if to emerge, but the **Celestial Gate** remains closed, and it descends again. The **blaze** spreads in all directions, and the ministers—those holding the **jewel-axes** and those riding the **steed**—vie to advance the **Fire**.

Thus, the water within the vessel loses its **qi** and congeals; the **pearls** in the water lose their luster and glow. This is the vision of the Fire’s Advancement.

Luzi said: *"Does it stop here?"*

Zhongli Master replied: *"Then **clouds and thunder** descend, while **flickering flames** ascend. Sometimes **precious flowers** rain down, and **auspicious winds** arise from the **Pure Capital**, bearing **celestial maidens**, **jade women**, **four-horse phoenixes**, and **feathered cranes** from the **layered clouds**. They present **golden platters** to offer **jade dew** and **misty nectar**, presenting them below to the **Sovereign**.

This is the vision of the **Golden Elixir’s return** and the **completion of the Refined Cinnabar**.*

The **Dragon and Tiger** pull the **chariot** through their **Fire**, surging upward past the **Three Gates**, each gate guarded by its own **sentries**. First, they **charge** with the **Dragon and Tiger’s assault**; then, they **assault** with the **Great Fire’s onslaught**..."

「When it is fully revealed, it reaches the base of Kunlun and stops at the Celestial Pool.

Sometimes, three cranes surge through the Three Heavens,
sometimes, two butterflies enter the Three Palaces,
sometimes, beyond the Five Clouds,
they bear the **Sacred Child** (承绛服之子) of the **Crimson Robe** (绛服) across the Celestial Gate,
or a **Golden Carriage** (金舆) with **Jade Axles** (玉辖) conveys the **Sovereign** (王者) and transcends the Three Realms.

This is the vision of the **Elbow-Later Flying Golden Crystal** and the **Great River Chariot** (大河车).

The **Red-Garbed Messengers** (朱衣使者), riding swift conveyances, traverse the wilds of the Nine Provinces.
They begin from Ji (冀) and enter Yi (一充),
from Yi (一兑) they enter Qing (青),
from Qing (青) they enter Xu (徐),
from Xu (徐) they enter Yang (扬),
from Yang (扬) they enter Jing (荆),
from Jing (刑) they enter Liang (梁),
from Liang (梁) they enter Yong (雍),
and from Yong (雍) they return again to Ji (冀).
Having encompassed the western, southern, and northern regions, they then stop at Yu (豫) before continuing their journey.

Those they summon are **gold and jade** (金玉);
those they traverse are **blocked and stagnant** (壅滞).
With one messenger bearing the command,
the Nine Provinces harmonize and communicate,
cycling endlessly without ceasing.

Sometimes they wander the Five Sacred Mountains, beginning at Changshan (常山);
sometimes they sail the Five Lakes, beginning at the Northern Marsh (北沼).
Sometimes the **Celestial Talismans** (天符) burst forth to summon the Five Emperors,
or the Five Decrees (五命) call the Five Marshals (五侯).

This is the vision of **Returning the Refined Cinnabar** (还丹).

When pearls and jade are cast to the earth,
sometimes they rain dew upon all things,
sometimes they cause tides in the rivers of the world,
sometimes the **Yang Vitality** (阳) arises and spreads across all beings,
sometimes **Fire** (火) blazes, scorching the heavens and earth,
sometimes **mist and clouds** surge through the cosmos.

This is the vision of **Refining the Form** (炼形).

Cranes depart their nests, dragons leave their coils,
the Five Emperors pay homage to the Celestial Sovereign.
The Five Clouds rise, the **four-horse phoenixes** soar through the boundless void,
they rest and wander the Celestial Highways.
Celestial flowers fall, celestial music plays,
golden radiance blazes in the **palaces of the immortals** (官).

This is the vision of **Homage to the Primordial** (朝元).
After Homage to the Primordial, then comes **Inner Contemplation** (内观).

Lüzi said: *"What is Inner Contemplation like?"*

Zhōnglízi replied: *"Inner Contemplation is the method of the transformations of yin and yang. It knows no time or day, no fixed rules. One sits upright in a quiet chamber, day and night, discerning the **Yang Spirit** (阳神) and banishing the **Yin Ghosts** (阴鬼). This is the Dao of the Nine Years of Bodhidharma and the Six Years of Zhùqián. How difficult it is not!"*

At first, the **Purple River Chariot** (紫河之车) moves downward from above and enters the Celestial Palace. The Celestial Palace is a realm of dazzling splendor. When the cultivator of the True Way grows accustomed to austerity and finds contentment in simplicity and detachment, then they take delight in it—yet they do not realize it originates from within themselves.

Thus, their form lingers and cannot be shed. How much more so the **Three Corpses** (三尸), **Seven Spirits** (七魄), **Nine Worms** (九虫), and **Six Bandits** (六贼)? If the eight deaths are not averted, then where can they find peace? If the practitioner finds peace, they will not be restrained.

Thus, from intention arises the image, from the image arises the realm, and the cultivator of the True Way is swept into error—this is indeed something to greatly fear.

Lüzi said: *"Inner Contemplation gathers the Yang Spirit, refining the spirit to transcend the Inner Precincts (内院), leaping upward and passing through the Celestial Gate (天门), directly ascending to the ranks of the Saints. Their departures and arrivals are not misaligned with the Way, their comings and goings do not rise to the level of artificial welcome. Prolonged contemplation merges spirit with form, and ascension becomes boundless wandering. The **Eight Immortals’ Vessels** (方壶) truly attest to the power of Inner Contemplation.*

*Yet how can one avoid being swept into error?"*

Zhōnglízi replied: *"There is no other way—if one hears the Dao yet lacks resolute aspiration, they will be lost to worldly things. Yet its demons are tenfold, its difficulties ninefold. Before the Great Elixir is complete, there are cold and heat; before True Qi arises, there is hunger and thirst. Thus, the pressure of clothing and food is the first difficulty.

Within one’s family, there must be elders—father or elder brother—who restrain one’s desire to leave and seek the Dao, the second difficulty.

Humans generate love through love, and only then do bonds form. Parents demand filial duty, wives demand affection, and these become shackles, the third difficulty.

Wealth and honor are what people desire, yet to abandon them and turn to the silent, empty Way is the fourth difficulty.

In youth, one may hear the Dao, but indulgence in excess and laziness in leisure leads to early death, the fifth difficulty.

Eager to seek a teacher, yet true masters are hard to find. Some are taken in by words, others by appearance, the sixth difficulty.

A false teacher presents deviant teachings, flashing the light of **burning fire** (燸火) while unaware of the brightness of the sun and moon, deaf to the thunder of heaven while mistaking the croaking of frogs for its voice, the seventh difficulty.

Morning intentions shift by evening, sitting and rising forget their purpose, delighting in fleeting moments yet weary of endurance, ultimately succumbing to slackness, the eighth difficulty.

In youth, one pursues fame and profit; in old age, one clings to private desires. The body loses years, the year loses months, the month loses days—this is the ninth difficulty.

The eyes delight in myriad colors, the ears indulge in the Six Harmonies (六乐), tastes grow ever more refined, and emotions surge while qi becomes dissipated—these are the **Six Bandit Demons** (六贼魔).

Carved walls and towering halls, gold and jade displayed in rows—this is the **Wealth Demon** (富魔).

The splendor of carriages and attendants, the beauty of plumes and silks, hoarding silver and gold, trailing sashes and ribbons—this is the **Nobility Demon** (贵魔).

The gentle warmth of spring, the lengthening days of summer, sudden fierce winds and torrential rain, great thunder and hail—sometimes one rejoices and delights, sometimes one grieves and weeps—this is the **Emotional Demon** (一情魔).

The household suffers loss, the home is plagued by illness, the funeral is yesterday’s affair—this is the **Filial Affection Demon** (恩爱魔).

Falling into boiling cauldrons, tumbling into perilous precipices, seized by raptors, bitten by venomous creatures, robbed by bandits—this is the **Calamity Demon** (患难魔).

The Ten Directions under the sun, the Three Pure Ones and Jade Emperor, the Five Peaks and Eight Kings, the Four Celestial Animals and Seven Stars—this is the **Saintly Demon** (圣贤魔).

The **Dryad’s Spear** (干将) and **Board Halberd** (板戟) arrayed in battle—this is the **War Demon** (兵魔).

The **Immortal Chang’e** and **Jade Maiden** each leading their retinues—this is the **Female Music Demon** (女乐魔).

A beautiful woman adorned in fine silks, her gaze beckoning as if divinely granted—this is the **Female Beauty Demon** (女色魔).*

*The demons that obstruct us are threefold: first, they appear in the realm; second, they appear in dreams; third, they appear in Inner Contemplation. If one recognizes them in the realm, their resolve will be steadfast. If one recognizes them in dreams, their spirit will not be confused, their intentions will not scatter. If one recognizes them in Inner Contemplation, using the fire of **Samādhi** (三昧) to burn away the form, the demons will be annihilated.*

*Thus, one employs the Purple River Chariot to transport the Yang Spirit, transcending the Inner Precincts and returning to the Celestial Palace.*

Lüzi said: *"Are there fixed methods? Are there fixed times?"*

Zhōnglí Master said to Lüzi: *"The Dao has twelve methods: first, harmonizing yin and yang; second, gathering and dispersing water and fire; third, merging the Dragon and Tiger; fourth, refining the supreme elixir; fifth, the *Elbow Posture* (肘后) of flying gold crystals; sixth, the *Celestial Essence Return* (玉液还丹); seventh, the *Celestial Essence Refining the Form* (玉液炼形); eighth, the *Golden Elixir Return* (金液还丹); ninth, the *Golden Elixir Refining the Form* (金液炼形); tenth, the *Morning of the Primordial Refining the Qi* (朝元炼气); eleventh, the *Inner Contemplation Exchange* (内观交换); and twelfth, the *Transcendence and Dissolution of the Form* (超脱分形).*

*There are three fixed times: yearly, monthly, and daily. Yearly, one follows the Dao of Heaven and Earth’s yin and yang rising and descending; monthly, one follows the Dao of the sun and moon’s vital *qi* coming and going; daily, one follows the eight *guà* (卦) and eight cardinal directions (八正), with ten thousand ten having twelve branches and one hundred *kè* (刻) making up six thousand divisions.*

*When one practices these methods, the first cycle begins: licentious and evil *qi* departs, and external conduct is refined. Next, the gold crystals are abundant, and the mind’s distractions are purged. Next, the *Heart Sutra* (心经) surges forth, and sweet nectar flows from the mouth. Next, yin and yang clash within the abdomen, their impact resounding like thunder. Next, the soul and spirit are restless, and sleep is filled with frequent awakenings. Next, the six *fǔ* (府) and four limbs may suffer slight ailments, yet they heal without medicine or herbs. Next, the *Dantian* (丹田) warms at night, the body becomes refined and clear, the eyes radiant with divine light, and sleep is undisturbed by external intrusions—like embracing an infant to return. Next, the *Golden Lock* (金关) and *Jade Bolt* (玉锁) solidify, their defense unyielding, and sleep remains unbroken. Next, thunderous *qi* courses through the joints, and a spontaneous perspiration arises. Next, the *Celestial Essence* (玉液) is simmered and rinsed, forming a congealed cream. Next, the *Numinous Elixir* (灵液) thickens into a salve, and the stench of decay is banished. Next, the bones grow light, and the *Divine Chamber* (神室) transforms—movement becomes swift and graceful like a *jīng* (鴂) bird. Next, external circumstances cannot sway one, and cravings are extinguished. Next, the *True Qi* (真气) enters into things, and one can cure illnesses. Next, *Inner Contemplation* (内观) becomes lucid. Next, the pupils glow brightly, the hair renews like a child’s, and one regains the vigor of youth. Next, the *qi* is full yet does not diminish, and longevity is boundless. Next, the skin and flesh radiate with luster, the spirit refined and resplendent, the *Sacred Elixir* (圣丹) forms, and the *Numinous Elixir* (灵液) exudes its fragrance. Next, one perceives the subtlest details with clarity. Next, the phlegm, saliva, spittle, and sweat are eliminated, and black moles and scars vanish. Next, the *Embryonic Body* (胎全) is complete, the *qi* abundant, and one abstains from grains. Next, the inner will aligns with the *Great Void* (太虚), the seven emotions are exhausted, and the nine *chóng* (虫), three *shī* (尸) are annihilated. Next, the soul and spirit no longer wander, and dreams cease. Next, the *Yang Essence* (阳精) is perfected, and the *Divine Storehouse* (神府) is fortified—cold and heat cannot harm one. Next, one transcends life and death, sitting in *forgetfulness* (坐忘) and *Inner Contemplation*, wandering in the realm of *Huàxiū* (华胥). Next, the practice is complete, and one is granted the *Register of Merit* (授录); the Three *Qīng* (三清) can foresee the future. Next, the *Embryonic Immortal* (胎仙) appears. Next, the *Pure Yang* (纯阳) can dry the external *Mercury* (汞). Next, the *Embryonic Immortal* ascends, and auspicious light emerges. Next, stillness brings forth celestial music. Next, the body is filled with vitality, and the senses are keen—wealth and nobility are no longer distractions. Next, the *Divine Form* (仪观) transforms, and the *Divine Spirits* (神祇) are enslaved. Next, the external vision is filled with purple mist, and golden light surrounds one. Next, the *Fire Dragon* (火龙) ascends, the *Dark Crane* (玄鹤) rises, and the bones are purified. Finally, colorful clouds gather, and a *Jade Maiden* (玉女) descends, bestowing the *Purple Edict* (紫诏).*

*This is the fulfillment of the Dao.*

*Lüzi then, with heartfelt delight and sincere submission, advanced and said: "I now understand the profound principles!" But since I have not yet attained the practice, the methods of maintaining it will ultimately be in vain—no different from one who does not know. How then can I teach it?*

*Zhōnglí Master thus selected an auspicious day and imparted to him the *Complete Methods of the Numinous Treasure* (灵宝毕法).*

*End of Volume 41 of the *Dao Gun* (道枢).*
*Beginning of Volume 42 of the *Dao Gun* (道枢).*

**Volume 42 of the *Dao Gun* (道枢) – *Lingbao Pian* (灵宝篇)**

Master Zhōnglí, having already transmitted the Dao to Lüzi, further declared:

*"I once ascended the Zhōngnán Mountains (终南) and obtained the Golden Edict (金诰), the Jade Records (玉录), and the essence of the True Source (真源)—these are the essentials of the Supreme Dao. Now, I shall expound them to you."*

Lüzi replied, *"I await your instruction."*

Master Zhōnglí then spoke:

*"The Heaven attains the Way of *Kàn* (乾), and accumulates *qi* to cover below;
The Earth attains the Way of *Kūn* (坤), bearing substance to support above.
Between them lies eighty-four thousand *lǐ* (里), yet *qi* and substance cannot intermingle.

Thus, Heaven draws upon *Kūn* with three *suǒ* (索) withdrawals—when complete, it returns to the Earth’s core, its *yang* bearing *yin* upward;
The Earth draws upon *Kàn* with three *suǒ* withdrawals—when complete, it returns to Heaven’s expanse, its *yin* embracing *yang* downward.
This ascent and descent in motion through the Dao is how Heaven and Earth endure eternally.

Between Heaven and Earth, what is closest to above is *yang*, descending forty-two thousand *lǐ*—this is the *yang* domain;
What is closest to below is *yin*, ascending forty-two thousand *lǐ*—this is the *yin* domain.

At the start of the year, on the Winter Solstice, *yang* rises from the Earth’s core.
Every fifteen days, it ascends seven thousand *lǐ*—three such phases mark one *jié* (节).
Forty-five days later, *yang* ascends twenty-one thousand *lǐ*—two *jié* complete one *shí* (时).
Ninety days later, *yang* ascends forty-two thousand *lǐ*, reaching the midpoint of Heaven and Earth, where *yang* merges with the *yin* domain.
At this juncture, *yin* is half within *yang*, and its *qi* shifts from cold to warmth—the division of Spring.
Beyond this, *yang* ascends into the *yang* domain, beginning to draw Earth’s *qi* upward—forty-five days later, this is the Establishment of Summer.
After another forty-five days, this is the Summer Solstice, where *yang*’s ascent completes eighty-four thousand *lǐ*, reaching Heaven.
Here, *yang* contains *yang*, and its *qi* shifts from warmth to heat.
As *yang* accumulates, *yin* emerges—one *yin* arises within two *yang*—this begins at the Summer Solstice.
Then, *yin* from Heaven’s core descends:
Fifteen days later, it descends seven thousand *lǐ*;
Forty-five days later, it descends twenty-one thousand *lǐ*;
Ninety days later, it descends forty-two thousand *lǐ*, reaching the midpoint, where *yin* merges with the *yang* domain.
Now, *yang* is half within *yin*, and its *qi* shifts from heat to chill—the division of Autumn.
Beyond this, *yin* descends into the *yin* domain, beginning to draw Heaven’s *qi* downward—forty-five days later, this is the Establishment of Winter.
After another forty-five days, this is the Winter Solstice, where *yin*’s descent completes eighty-four thousand *lǐ*, reaching Earth.
Here, *yin* contains *yin*, and its *qi* shifts from cool to cold.
As *yin* accumulates, *yang* emerges—one *yang* arises within two *yin*.
From the Winter Solstice onward, one *yang* again ascends, cycling eternally.
Thus, the Winter Solstice is when *yang* is born and ascends back to Heaven, while *yin* descends to Earth—this is the arrival of one *yang*.
The Summer Solstice is when *yin* is born and descends back to Earth, while *yang* ascends to Heaven—this is the arrival of one *yin*.

From the Summer Solstice, *yang* ascends upward, passing the Spring division and entering *yin*, departing the *yang* domain—these are the two *fèn* (分).
From the Winter Solstice, *yang* ascends downward—though *yin* descends, what descends is merely residual *yin* within *yang*, dissipating in the *yang* domain.
Though it descends and finds its place, when *yang* ascends, its *qi* is severed.

Similarly, from the Summer Solstice, *yin* descends upward—though *yang* ascends, what ascends is merely residual *yang* within *yin*, dissipating in the *yin* domain.
Though it ascends and finds its place, when *yin* descends, its *qi* is severed.

Thus, *yin* and *yang*—their ascent, descent, and motion—never exceed eighty-four thousand *lǐ*, yet the days number three hundred and sixty.
He who aligns with the four *qì* (气) of warmth, chill, cold, and heat has grasped *yin* and *yang*.
He who follows the eight *jié* of *yang*’s ascent and *yin*’s descent has comprehended Heaven and Earth.

Heaven and Earth are the greatest among all things;
Man is the most refined among all things—thus, man may align with Heaven and Earth.

The *heart* is Heaven;
The *kidneys* are Earth.
The *liver* is the *yang* domain;
The *lungs* are the *yin* domain.
The heart and kidneys are separated by eight *cùn* and four *fèn*—just as Heaven and Earth are divided in their covering and bearing.
*Qi* is *yang*;
*Liquid* is *yin*.

*Zǐ* (子) and *wǔ* (午) are the two solstices;
*Mǎo* (卯) and *yǒu* (酉) are the two divisions.
One day is one year.
I use the eight *guà* (卦) in a single day, thus attaining the eight *jié*’s measure.

At the hour of *Zǐ*, the kidneys’ *qi* is born;
At the hour of *Mǎo*, its *qi* reaches the liver.
The liver is *yang*, so its *qi* flourishes—thus *yang* ascends into the *yang* domain, mirroring the Spring Equinox.
At the hour of *Wǔ*, the *qi* reaches the heart, where accumulated *qi* generates *liquid*—this is the Summer Solstice, where *yang* ascends to Heaven and *yin* is born.
When the heart’s *liquid* is generated, by the hour of *Yǒu*, it reaches the lungs.
The lungs are *yin*, so its *liquid* flourishes—thus *yin* descends into the *yin* domain, mirroring the Autumn Equinox.
At the hour of *Zǐ*, the *liquid* reaches the kidneys, where accumulated *liquid* generates *qi*—this is the Winter Solstice, where *yin* descends to Earth and *yang* is born."*

The daily practice follows the cycle thus, its efficacy never failing, and can thus prolong life.

Heaven and Earth are one in the Dao/Way; he who attains its unity—is it not only humanity?

Yet after the embryo is complete and the *qi* is full, the Six Desires and Seven Emotions deplete the Primordial *Yang* and lose the True *Qi*. Even though there remains a natural interplay of *qi* and *liquid*, it cannot harmonize with Heaven and Earth’s ascent and descent.

I have often used methods to compel and forcibly reclaim them—only then can it be achieved.

With each exhalation, the Primordial *Qi* departs; with each inhalation, it returns. If it cannot be retained but instead follows the exhalation back out, then my Primordial *Qi* is in turn stolen by Heaven and Earth. Thus, when *Qi* scatters, it cannot generate *liquid*; when *liquid* is scarce, it cannot generate *Qi*.

At the time when *Qi* is flourishing, daily practice aligns with the *Zhèn* hexagram, focusing on *Qi*: retain more, exhale less, and forcibly hold it in the abdomen. At this moment, the ascent from below does not escape, and the descent from without is temporarily suspended.

When the two *Qi*s merge, accumulated *Qi* generates the Five *Zàng*’s *liquid*, and accumulated *liquid* returns to its source—thus the *Qi*’s generation and nourishment increase.

This is the attainment of the *Dà* (Great) *Mó* (Embryo) *Tāi* (Breath) *Xiǎo* (Small) *Chéng* (Completion).

The essence of the Dao/Way lies in seeking the *Yáng* *Gōng* (Lord) *Zhǎngzǐ* (Eldest Son) and attaining the True One—this is also the practice of retaining more and exhaling less.

What is the *Yáng* *Gōng* *Zhǎngzǐ*? It is the *Kàn* (Heavenly Stem) *Qián* (Trigram) interacting with *Kūn* (Earthly Stem), where the Primordial *Qi* ascends upward.

*Zhèn* is the Eldest Son. Thus, at the hour of *Mǎo*, the *Qi* is born from the kidneys, and the *liquid* descends from the heart, contending in ascent and descent. Therefore, when *Qi* is closed, the *liquid* is divided, and with both suspended beyond their proper time, the True One is attained.

The True One is True Water.

What is this Dao/Way? It is the interplay where accumulated *Qi* generates *liquid*, and accumulated *liquid* generates *Qi*—where *Qi* within *liquid* descends with the *liquid*, and *Qi* within *liquid* ascends with the *Qi*, a mutual generation of *Qi* and *liquid*.

Practice this for a year to see its effects; take a cycle of three hundred days as the term, and its benefits appear in ten days.

If one eats well and remains free of illness, the head is clear and the eyes bright, the heart is full while the abdomen is hollow—within, the sounds of wind and thunder resound. Is this not its effect?

If one sits still in quietude, ceasing all thought, and remains in *Dìng* (Stillness) throughout the day, emitting the *Yīn* *Shén* (Spirit), this is not the Dao/Way of the Immortal.

Lǚzǐ said: This is the *Yáng* *Tāi* (Embryo) and *Yīn* *Xī* (Breath) harmonizing with *Yīn* and *Yáng*—is this not so?

How does Water and Fire gather and disperse?

Zǐzhōnglízǐ said: Within the Great Dao/Way, Heaven and Earth are born; within Heaven and Earth, *Yīn* and *Yáng* are born.

Thus, Heaven and Earth have their high and low, and *Yīn* and *Yáng* have their beginning and end.

I observe their inclinations and count their measures—thus the Great Dao/Way can be known.

Therefore, by aligning with Heaven and Earth’s high and low, one knows the Dao/Way’s elevation and abasement; by aligning with *Yīn* and *Yáng*’s beginning and end, one knows the Dao/Way’s precedence and sequence.

Heaven and Earth do not depart from their measures, and their cycle is completed in one year; *Yīn* and *Yáng* do not lose their propriety, and their division is marked by the eight *jié*’s (solar nodes).

At the Winter Solstice, *Yīn* reaches its zenith, and the Primordial *Qi* generates one *Yáng*; by the Spring Equinox, *Yīn* contains half of *Yáng*—beyond this, it is pure *Yáng*.

At the Summer Solstice, *Yáng* reaches its zenith, and the Primordial *Qi* generates one *Yīn*; by the Autumn Equinox, *Yáng* contains half of *Yīn*—beyond this, it is pure *Yīn*.

To recognize the Great Dao/Way’s essence, one must follow Heaven and Earth’s laws and study *Yīn* and *Yáng*!

At the Winter Solstice, *Yáng* is born and ascends; by the time of *Lìchūn* (Beginning of Spring), it ascends into the *Yīn* domain—21,000 *lǐ* (miles), where *Yáng* cannot overcome *Yīn*.

At the Summer Solstice, *Yīn* is born and descends; by the time of *Lìdōng* (Beginning of Winter), *Yīn* descends below, its distance from Heaven being 63,000 *lǐ*, and from Earth being 21,000 *lǐ*—thus *Yīn* attains its domain, and *Yáng* nears exhaustion.

Hence, within a year, *Lìchūn* (Beginning of Spring) corresponds to the end of *Chǒu* (Ox) and the start of *Yín* (Tiger), the *Gèn* (Mountain) hexagram.

At this time, the kidneys’ *Qi* is born but has not yet reached the liver, dwelling within the *Yīn* domain.

This *Qi* is weak and struggles to ascend, residing within the *liquid*.

Within a year, *Lìdōng* (Beginning of Winter) corresponds to the end of *Xū* (Dog) and the start of *Hài* (Pig), the *Qián* (Heaven) hexagram.

At this time, the heart’s *liquid* descends inward, about to return to its source and reunite in the kidneys—a moment when *Yīn* is strong and *Yáng* is exhausted.

Here, *Qi* is scarce, and *liquid* is abundant. This is why people often suffer from illness and die young: *Yīn* and *Yáng* are disordered and do not ascend and descend, and *Qi* and *liquid* wither without mutual generation.

Alas! When *Qi* is exhausted and the *Shén* (Spirit) scatters, death ensues.

At *Lìchūn* (Beginning of Spring), *Yáng* ascends from below and can rise upward—thus within days, *Yīn* contains half of *Yáng*.

At *Lìdōng* (Beginning of Winter), *Yīn* descends from above and can sink downward—thus within days, *Yáng* contains half of *Yīn*.

Only humanity, at the time of *Gèn* (Mountain), has feeble *Qi* and does not know how to nourish it; at the time of *Qián* (Heaven), its *Qi* scatters and does not know how to gather it.

Moreover, with the Six Desires and Seven Emotions depleting the Primordial *Yáng*, the True *Qi* is not strengthened, and the True *liquid* is not generated—is this not lamentable?

At the time of *Gèn* (Mountain), I cultivate the Primordial *Qi*: stretching and contracting the hands and feet, so that the *Qi* of the Four Limbs is generated. Thus internally, it preserves the Primordial *Qi*, and upwardly, it nourishes the heart’s chambers. Then, swallowing the saliva once or twice, and massaging the face thirty or twenty times, prolonged practice yields luminous and supple skin.

This is the minor practice of *Sànhuǒ Liànxíng* (Dispersing Fire, Refining Form).

At the time of *Qián* (Heaven), I gather the Primordial *Qi*: sitting quietly, swallowing the *Qi*, and kneading the external kidneys.

What is swallowing the *Qi*? It is directing the heart’s fire downward.

What is kneading the external kidneys? It is collecting the *Pángguāng* (Bladder) *Qi* inward.

When the kidneys’ *Qi* is gathered, the three fires converge into one, supplementing the Lower Field.

When there is no fluid, *qi* gathers—thus fluid is generated;
When there is fluid, it is refined—thus *qi* is generated.
This is called the **Gathering Fire, Taiyi Embracing True *Qi***.

What is this *Dao*?
It is the *qi* of the heart that should be directed inward,
And the *qi* of the *Pángguāng* (Bladder) that should be gathered inward.
If it is not allowed to disperse but instead meets the *Kàn* (Water),
Then it is the center of the *Qi* Sea—the original *qi* of birth.

Autumn and winter are the beginning;
When its effects are seen, one must cease.
Practiced for one year, its efficacy is lost;
Take one day as equivalent to three hundred days—
In ten days, its effects will manifest:
The flesh and skin become plump and lustrous,
The Lower Field is harmonized and filled,
The spirit is clear and bright—
Is this not its effect?

**Lǚzǐ** asked: *"Is there a method to the union of the Dragon and Tiger?"*

**Zǐ Zhōnglí Zǐ** replied:
*"The *Dao* originates from the Primordial Division and has the Great Beginning (*Tàishǐ*);
The Great Beginning has the Great Non-being (*Tàiwú*);
The Great Non-being has the Great Emptiness (*Tàixū*);
The Great Emptiness has the Great Void (*Tàikōng*);
The Great Void has the Great Substance (*Tàizhì*).
The Great Substance is Heaven and Earth.
Its *qi* is clear and turbid,
Its form is like an egg,
Its hue is dark and yellow—
This is but one thing within the Great Void.

At the Winter Solstice, the earth’s *yang* ascends from below;
At the Summer Solstice, it reaches Heaven.
When *yang* is at its peak, *yin* arises.
The arising of *yin* is when *yang* emerges from within *yin*,
Rising from the earth—
Vague and indistinct,
With water within *qi* yet no form—
Thus, at the Summer Solstice, accumulated *qi* generates water.

At the Summer Solstice, Heaven’s *yin* descends;
At the Winter Solstice, it reaches the earth.
When *yin* is at its peak, *yang* arises.
The arising of *yang* is when *yin* emerges from within *yang*,
Issuing from Heaven—
Dark and obscure,
With *qi* within water yet no form—
Thus, at the Winter Solstice, accumulated water generates *qi*.

At the time of *Zǐ* (Water), the *Kàn* hexagram is active,
And the *qi* of the kidneys is born.
At the time of *Wǔ* (Fire), the *Lí* hexagram is active,
And the heart’s fluid is generated.

When the kidneys’ *qi* arises from *Kàn*,
It reaches the heart at *Lí*,
Meeting the heart’s *qi* and merging with the heart’s fire—
Thus, the Great Polarity generates fluid.
This is so because the *qi* from the kidneys carries true water within it, yet is formless—
Just as accumulated *yang* generates *yin*.

When the heart’s fluid arises from *Lí*,
It reaches the kidneys at *Kàn*,
Meeting the kidneys’ water and merging with it—
Thus, the Great Polarity reaches its peak and generates *qi*.
This is so because the fluid from the heart carries true *qi* within it, yet is formless—
Is this not akin to accumulated *yin* generating *yang*?

Thus, I know that the *yang* that is generated contains water within it,
And the *yin* that is generated contains *qi* within it—
I am in harmony with Heaven and Earth’s *yin* and *yang*.
Hence, the kidneys generate *qi*, within which lies true water—this is the **Tiger**;
The heart generates fluid, within which lies true *qi*—this is the **Dragon**.

Heaven is like an overturned basin—*yang* ascends within it;
Earth is like a flat stone—*yin* enters within it.
Yet humans cannot do this,
For they deplete their Primordial *Yang* and lose their True *Qi*.

The *Lí* hexagram—
In the body, it is the heart;
Externally, it is the time of *Wǔ*.
True *Yang*—
In the body, it is the Primordial *Yang*;
Externally, it is the Greater *Yang*.

Thus, at the time of *Lí*,
When the kidneys’ *qi* has reached the heart,
And the heart and kidneys interact,
One should enter a quiet space,
Alternate palms and knees,
Elevate the body and sit upright,
Stabilize the spirit within the inner chamber,
Make the nasal breath slow in inhalation and slow in exhalation—
Soft and lingering, as if suspended,
Filling the mouth with saliva without swallowing or spitting—
Naturally, the kidneys’ *qi* and the heart’s *qi* will merge,
And the Great Polarity will generate fluid.

Thus, when True Fluid and True Water merge,
True *Qi* clings to the fluid,
True Water clings to the *qi*.
*Qi* and fluid are not originally meant to merge—
Only because the fluid contains True *Qi*,
And the *qi* contains True Water,
Do they unite in exchange.
Thus, they descend in mutual attraction—
This is called the **Union of Dragon and Tiger**.

If the fire’s timing is precise
And one knows how to supplement the earth,
Then in three hundred days, the True Embryo will form,
And the Great Elixir will be complete—
This is the foundation of transcendence.

What is this *Dao*?
Primordial *Qi* is True Water—
It must not be dissipated or lost externally.
If *qi* scatters, it cannot generate fluid;
If fluid is scarce, there will be no True *Qi*;
If *qi* and water do not unite, the Great Elixir cannot form.
Thus, the True One’s water within the kidneys
And the heart’s rectified *yang* fluid—
When these two merge,
In the body, they generate the body;
In the spirit, they generate the spirit—
This is called **Internal Elixir**.

When the count reaches thirty cycles (of ten days),
One may achieve longevity.

In the year, the months are used—
Their beginning is at the Winter Solstice!
In the day, the times are used—
Their reference is the *Lí* hexagram!

If the Winter Solstice is the beginning,
In three hundred days, the Embryo of Immortality is complete.
Its form is like a pill,
Its color is vermilion and orange—
It eternally resides in the Lower Field and does not die.

If one studies the *Dao* in old age,
With roots and sources not yet firm,
Yet with ten years of loss,
One year of补 can restore it—
This is called **Harvesting and Returning the Elixir**.

This *Dao*—
If the补 is sufficient,
Sweet saliva will arise in the mouth,
The mind will naturally clear,
Emotions and desires will stilled,
The hundred limbs will rest in ease,
The eyes will gleam like lightning,
Spirit-light will manifest in darkness—
Is this not its effect?

**Lǚzǐ** asked: *"How are the fire’s phases of the Microcosmic Orbit?"*

**Zǐ Zhōnglí Zǐ** replied:
*"Cold, heat, warmth, and chill—
These are forms of *qi* within the body;
Clouds, mist, rain, and dew—
These are manifestations within *qi*.

When the earth’s *qi* ascends,
It rises as clouds and scatters as rain;
When Heaven’s *qi* descends,
It disperses as mist and condenses as dew.

If *yin* accumulates excessively,
Its dew becomes frost,
Its rain becomes snow;
If *yang* accumulates excessively,
Its mist becomes smoke,
Its clouds become mist-haze."

When *yin* harbors *yang* within,
*Yang* cannot ascend,
Thus it strikes and clashes, giving birth to thunder and lightning;

When *yang* harbors *yin* within,
*Yin* cannot disperse,
Thus it solidifies, producing hail and sleet.

Therefore, *yang*-light scatters as thunder,
*Yin*-*qi* surges as wind,
When *yin* and *yang* fail to unite,
Citron trees face each other and lightning manifests;
When *yin* and *yang* are unbalanced,
Chaotic mingling forms the rainbow’s arc.

Only the **True *Yang*** accumulates to become **Spirit**—
Its splendor in Heaven is the great Sun and Moon;
The **True *Yin*** accumulates to become **Form**—
Its grandeur on Earth is the precious metals and jade.

The Sun and Moon,
True *Yang* receiving True *Yin*,
Thus mutually completing;
The metals and jade,
True *Yin* receiving True *Yang*,
Thus mutually generating.

Hence, the **true *qi*** within my heart’s fluid
Is like the True *Yang*;
The **true water** within my kidney’s *qi*
Is like the True *Yin*.

Without True Water, True *Qi* cannot arise;
Without True *Qi*, True Water cannot form.
When these two separate,
They harmonize above the heart, below the lungs,
Like child and mother embracing,
Like husband and wife in love.

From **Li** to **Dui**—
**Dui** is the time when *yin* is strong and *yang* is weak,
Like the Moon’s waning phase,
Like metals and jade still in their rough state.

When the Sun and Moon retreat from brilliance to darkness,
Their cycles complete, and light is reborn;
When metals and jade emerge from *yin* to *yang*,
Their *qi* is full, and treasures manifest.
Thus, treasures arise when *qi* is full and *yang* is added;
Light manifests when their cycles complete and are received by the **Soul**,
Just as in my **Li** phase,
*Qi* accumulates to generate fluid,
And fluid returns to the **Lower Dan*tiel** (元).

If not added to with *qi*,
Then it is like the Moon’s waning phase failing to receive the **Soul**,
Like metals and jade in their rough state not emitting *yang*.
Therefore, at the **Qian** phase,
Advancing fire must be measured,
Refining *yang* without decline,
And increasing fire’s measure
Will make *yang* eternally thrive.

At the **Li** phase,
When the **Dragon** and **Tiger** unite,
This is the time of **elixir** collection.

Until **Qian**, when *qi* and fluid are about to return to the **Lower Dan*tiel**,
They arise in the **Bladder**’s upper region,
Below the **Spleen** and **Stomach**,
Before the **Kidney** and behind the **Navel**,
To the right of the **Small Intestine** and left of the **Large Intestine**.
At this time,
The **Spleen**’s *qi* is strong and the **Lungs**’s *qi* flourishes,
The **Kidney**’s *qi* is exhausted and the **Liver**’s *qi* is weak.

True *Qi* originally comes from the convergence of *qi*,
But now, with *yang* weak, True *Qi* has nothing to cling to,
And only at the **Li** phase is it collected and united.
Yet, when True *Qi* has nothing to cling to, it is about to disperse.

At the moment when True *Qi* is near exhaustion,
In the **Kun** phase’s foundation,
One must enter the **Quiet Chamber** and sit upright,
Stabilizing the **Spirit** within the **Mind**,
Refining the **Mind**’s inner realm,
Breathing softly through the nose,
And gently pressing the abdomen—
Thus, the **Navel** and **Kidney** grow hot or intensely so,
Then one must **release** lightly or **restrain** gradually;
If not yet hot, **restrain** and then **release** gradually;
When it is hot, **release** or **restrain** at will,
To fulfill the **Qian** phase,
Called **Restraint of the *Yang* Pass**.

Thus, refining the **Inner Elixir**,
One prevents True *Qi* from ascending to merge with True Water,
And the **Spleen**’s fluid is harmonized.
Following the breath,
One circulates and transports within the **Palace of Life** (黄庭),
Thus *qi* and fluid transform into **Essence**,
**Essence** into **Pearl**,
**Pearl** into **Mercury**,
**Mercury** into **Sand**,
**Sand** into **Gold**.
This is the completion of the **Inner Elixir**.

My saying—
*"Age and study the Dao, ten losses and one gain"*—
How can this be neglected now!

Collecting elixir at the **Li** phase,
Refining it at the **Qian** phase,
In spring and winter, collect much and refine little—
**Qian** once, **Li** twice, with doubled effort;
In autumn and summer, collect little and refine much—
**Li** once, **Qian** twice, with doubled effort.

After **one hundred days**, the elixir’s power is complete;
After **two hundred days**, the **Sacred Embryo** is firm;
After **three hundred days**, True *Qi* is full and the **Embryo of Immortality** is complete.

Once the elixir’s power is complete,
Then fire is advanced with increased measure—
This is the **fire’s phase**,
Thus the **Sacred Embryo** is firm,
And fire’s measure is increased
To reach the **Small Microcosmic Orbit**;

When the **Embryo** is complete and *qi* arises,
Then fire’s measure is increased
To reach the **Microcosmic Orbit**.

Yet, when at the **edge of exhaustion** and in seclusion,
The **Mind** dwells in inner observation,
Preventing inner disturbances from emerging,
And outer disturbances from entering,
Like the **Dragon** nurturing its **Pearl**.

Even between waking and sleep,
Between meals and speech,
Silent as an infant,
Moving like a maiden,
Still fearing loss or damage,
One must not for an instant depart from the Dao.

**Zǐ Zhōnglí Zǐ** said:
*"This is not the ultimate attainment—
It is merely a lesser success.
I possess methods for **Golden Essence**, **Jade Fluid**, and **Golden Fluid**."*

A year, spoken in months,
Is **six *Lǜ* and six *Lǘ***,
Counted from **six *Qi***—
The numbers complete the **six positions**,
**six times six** is **thirty-six days**,
The *yin*’s full cycle.

Spoken in days,
**five days** is one **phase**,
**seventy-two phases**,
The **eight *Jǐu*** and **nine *Yīn*** numbers—
Counted from **nine *Yīn***,
The numbers complete the **six positions**,
**six times nine** is **fifty-four days**,
The *yang*’s full cycle.

**One *Lǜ* and one *Lǘ*** together with **four *Qi*** make **fifteen**—
**Fifteen** is the *qi*’s cycle of **twenty-four**,
This is the **eight nodes**,
And thus one sees the principles of *yin* and *yang*’s ascent and descent.

**One *Lǜ* and one *Lǘ*** with **four *Qi*** as their use,
Thus *yang*’s numbers total **two hundred sixteen**,
*Yin*’s numbers total **one hundred forty-four**,
Altogether **three hundred sixty**,
This is the **Microcosmic Orbit**.

*Yin* and *yang*’s ascent and descent occur within Heaven and Earth,
Like my heart and kidney’s *qi* and fluid merging;
The Sun and Moon’s revolutions occur beyond Heaven and Earth,
This is my **elixir** circulating behind the elbow—**Flying Golden Essence**.

Thus, the **Lungs** and **Liver**’s *yin* and *yang*
Are like the Sun and Moon’s coming and going;
Advancing fire and refining losses
Are like the Sun and Moon’s union;
*Yin* and *yang*’s ascent and descent
Are like the Sun and Moon’s revolutions.

The **solstice** of the year,
The **sixteenth day** of the month,
In the human body,
Is like the time of **noon**.

「The **winter solstice** of the year,
The **first day** of the month,
In the human body,
Is like the time of **child**—**midnight**.

I observe that in Heaven and Earth’s *yin* and *yang*,
And the Sun and Moon’s *arcan soul* (魂) and *subtle spirit* (魄),
There is still the order of union and revolution,
Then my heart and kidney’s *qi* and fluid,
Liver and lungs’ *arcan soul* and *subtle spirit*,
Though daily functions have their rhythms,
Do they not lack the annual **refinement** and **consummation**?

At the **time of *Kan* (坎)**,
*Yang* is born in *Gen* (艮),
And the kidney’s *qi* unites at the liver’s front;
When they have not yet united,
I loosen my clothes and sit upright,
Focusing on my lower abdomen,
Swiftly raising my body,
Then thrusting forward from my chest,
Slightly reclining my head backward,
Closing the **double gates** (双关) behind my spine,
With my elbows gently fanning front and back once or twice,
Then straightening my waist,
From the **tail vein** (尾闻), its heat like fire,
Rising from beneath my waist to gather at the **double gates** below my spine,
The double gates must not open,
As the heat intensifies and the *qi* grows strong, gradually opening the double gates,
Allowing the *qi* to pass through,
Then reclining my face upward, tightly pressing my head backward,
To close the **upper gate** (上关),
When the heat is extreme and the *qi* is powerful,
Gradually guiding it into the **forehead** (顶),
To nourish the **muddy pellet** (泥丸).

This is the foundation of **longevity**!
Then, employing the **elixir of return** (还丹) method,
I thrust from the chest and straighten the waist to close the double gates,
Focusing on and raising it,
If fire does not arise from the waist,
I sit quietly and observe internally,
Using the method again to ignite the fire.

From **chou (丑)** onward,
Until **yin (寅)** ends,
Its name is **Flying Golden Essence** (飞金晶).
Indeed, it is to make the liver’s *qi* arise from the kidney’s *qi*.

The **spine’s vertebrae** (夹脊之骨),
Number **twenty-four**,
From the lower three vertebrae,
Facing the kidney internally,
This is called the **Heavenly Pillar** (天柱).
Above the Heavenly Pillar,
This is the **Jade Capital** (玉京).
Below the Jade Capital,
Facing the kidney internally,
The **tail vein** (尾闻) above, **eighteen** vertebrae,
Among them is the **double gates** (双关),
Upper nine, lower nine,
In **one hundred days**, one can pass through and enter the muddy pellet.

The essentials of its practice:
Beginning at *Gen* (艮),
And flying the Golden Essence to *Xun* (巽) to complete,
This is the **hexagram *Li* (离)**, the **alchemical refining** method;
The **hexagram *Qian* (乾)**, the **advancing fire and restraining the *Yang* gates** method.

Beginning at the winter solstice,
Practicing for one hundred days,
And the Golden Essence enters the brain,
The **three gates and one impact** (三关一撞),
Directly entering the **upper palace** (上宫) muddy pellet.
Beginning at *Gen* (艮),
Ending at *Zhen* (震),
The alchemical refining is done in *Li* (离).

With no further union of kidney’s *qi*,
Only the liver’s *qi* generates the heart’s *qi*,
All being **pure *yang*** (纯阳).
Then the **two *bā* (八) of *yin*** (二八之阴) is consumed,
Its *qi* perfumes the **lungs** (肺),
And attains the size of **millet grains** (黍米之大),
Entering the **Yellow Court** (黄庭),
This is the **material for the inner elixir** (内丹之材)!
One hundred days without deviation,
The elixir’s power is complete.

Thus, alchemical refining in *Li* (离),
Employing methods according to the season,
Internal observation is refined further in *Qian* (乾),
Advancing fire to restrain the *Yang* gates.

Beginning at *Dui* (兑),
Ending at *Qian* (乾),
In one hundred days, the Golden Essence flies.

Beginning at *Gen* (艮) and sitting,
Ending at *Xun* (巽),
The *Li* (离) alchemical refining method remains unchanged,
Three hundred days without deviation,
The **holy embryo** (圣胎) is firm.

Restraining the *Yang* gates:
Beginning at *Kun* (坤) and sitting,
Ending at *Qian* (乾),
In one hundred days, the muddy pellet is filled,
And **rejuvenation** (还童) is achieved.

This method encompasses the **reversal of the five phases** (五行颠倒),
And the **reciprocating cycles of the three fields** (三田反覆).

First, harmonizing *yin* and *yang*,
To make the *qi* **nurture and generate**;
Next, gathering and dispersing **water and fire** (水火),
To solidify the **roots and sources** (根源),
And make the *qi* flow while **nurturing ceases**;
Then, uniting **Dragon and Tiger** (龙虎),
To refine and supplement the elixir of return,
Which is what I call **minor accomplishment** (小成).

In the middle of the year, selecting a month,
The month of the winter solstice, choosing the day at **shen (申)**,
The day of **jiazi (甲子)**, choosing the time at **midnight** (子),
*Gen* (艮), *Li* (离), and *Qian* (乾) mark its beginning.

From *Gen* (艮) to *Xun* (巽),
From *Qian* (乾) to *Kun* (坤),
Three hundred days’ practice is sufficient,
This is **medium accomplishment** (中成).

To practice this **Dao/Way** (斯道),
One must be in a **pure and tranquil place** (清静之区),
Eyes not seeing what is desirable,
Ears not hearing clamor,
Nose not inhaling foul odors,
Mouth not indulging in the **five flavors** (五味),
The **six desires and seven emotions** (六欲七情) undisturbed in the heart,
Dreading lest one lose it,
Awake or asleep, one must be **vigilant and cautious** (惴惴焉).
If the practice is not diligent,
One will not attain **immortality** (仙),
Only **delayed death** (赊死) will be the result.

What is this Dao/Way?
It is the **three primal cycles** (三元) in operation.»

「The **Flying Gold Crystal** (飞金晶) practitioner returns from the **Lower Field** (下田) to the **Upper Field** (上田)! The **Herb Gatherer** (采药者) returns from the **Lower Field** (下田) to the **Middle Field** (中田)! The **Concentrator at the Yang Pass** (勒阳关进火) returns from the **Middle Field** (中田) to the **Lower Field** (下田).

At the outset of its effects,
One experiences frequent palpitations while asleep,
Slight ailments in the **four limbs and six palaces** (四支六府),
Which heal without medicine.

With eyes closed and entering obscurity,
A luminous glow appears,
Like a **golden lock and jade key** (金关玉钥),
Their seal intact and firm,
To prevent the leakage of **Jade Essence** (精),
A single thunderous beat,
And the **joints and channels** (关节气) harmonize,
With **spiritual radiance** (神彩) clear and the **Elixir Field** (丹田) in accord,
The mind’s disturbances naturally dissipate.

In sleep,
One feels as though embracing an infant to return,
Or soaring in flight to wander,
Thus the **Eight Evils** (八邪) cannot interfere.

After **three hundred days** (三#2百日), the **Embryonic Immortal** (胎仙) is complete,
And the **Jade Nectar** (玉液) can refine the body—
This practice may then be undertaken.

When **Yang ascends** (阳之升),
How does it generate **Yin** (阴) from the **Supreme Ultimate** (太极)?
If **Yin is insufficient** (阴不足) yet **Yang has excess** (肠有余),
Then **accumulated Yang** (积阳) produces **spiritual essence** (神).
When **Yin descends** (阴之降),
How does it generate **Yang** (阳) from the **Supreme Ultimate** (太极)?
If **Yang is insufficient** (阳不足) yet **Yin has excess** (阴有余),
Then **accumulated Yin** (积阴) produces **form** (形).

**Spirit** (神) is what I call the **Sun and Moon** (日月);
**Form** (形) is what I call **Gold and Jade** (金玉).
The essence of **Gold and Jade** (金玉之质),
Arises from **accumulated Yin** (积阴),
While internally storing **true Yang Qi** (真阳之气),
Further nurtured by the **Sun and Moon** (日月),
Causing **true Yin and true Yang** (真阴真阳) to descend and form this precious treasure,
Which should indeed be cherished!

Those who accumulate **Yin to form** (积阴成形) and then embrace **Yang** (抱阳),
Are like our own accumulation of **herbs into true Embryonic Immortal Qi** (真胞真气),
To cultivate the **Embryonic Immortal** (胎仙).

Their **Qi** (气) surges toward the heavens,
Rising with **Yang** (阳) and ascending,
Descending into the earth,
Falling with **Yin** (阴) and returning,
As it follows **Yin and Yang** (阴阳) in their ascent and descent,
There are naturally the **four seasons** (东西四时) to distinguish.

This is like our **returning the Gold Nectar** (金掖) to the **Elixir Field** (丹田),
And using **Jade Nectar** (玉液) to refine the **form and essence** (形质),
Adjusting with the **four seasons** (四时) in their waxing and waning,
And daily shifting in **one cycle** (一日改移).

After **three hundred days** (三百日),
When the **true Qi** (真气) is complete,
One can then **return the Elixir and refine the form** (还丹炼形).

Thus, the **Gen** (艮) hexagram is employed,
To **Fly the Gold Crystal** (飞金晶) until it reaches **Xun** (巽) and stops.
The **Li** (离) **Herb Gathering** (采药),
And the **Kun** (坤) **Yang Pass** (阳关),
All cease at this point and are not practiced further.

Only the **Dui** (兑) hexagram is used,
To **Concentrate at the Yang Pass** (勒阳关),
Until it reaches **Qian** (乾) and stops.

Since one does not practice **Li’s Herb Gathering** (离之采药),
But instead **returns the Elixir** (还丹),
This is the **Swallowing Method** (咽法).
Its technique involves
Stirring the **upper and lower teeth** (上下愕) with the tongue between the **two cheeks** (二颊之间),
First swallowing the **impure saliva** (恶浊之津),
Then retracting the tongue’s tip to separate from the **Jade Pool** (玉池).
When the **saliva is generated** (津生),
One should not rinse but swallow it directly.

In the **Spring months** (春之月),
When the **Liver’s Qi** (肝之气) is strong,
And the **Spleen’s Qi** (脾之气) is weak,
One should daily employ the **Li** (离) hexagram.

In the **Summer months** (夏之月),
When the **Heart’s Qi** (心之气) is strong,
And the **Lung’s Qi** (肺之气) is weak,
One should daily employ the **Xun** (巽) hexagram.

In the **Autumn months** (秋之月),
When the **Lung’s Qi** (肺之气) is strong,
And the **Liver’s Qi** (肝之气) is weak,
One should daily employ the **Gen** (艮) hexagram,
To **Fly the Gold Crystal** (飞金晶);
The **Swallowing Method** (咽) may also be used.

In the **Winter months** (冬之月),
When the **Kidney’s Qi** (肾之气) is strong,
And the **Heart’s Qi** (心之气) is weak,
One should daily employ the **Zhen** (震) hexagram.

In the **transition seasons** (四时之季),
When the **Spleen’s Qi** (脾之气) is strong,
And the **Kidney’s Qi** (肾之气) is weak,
After the **eight days of the decan** (旬有八日),
One should employ the **Dui** (兑) hexagram.
For **Spring’s Li** (春之离), **Summer’s Xun** (夏之巽), and **Winter’s Zhen** (冬之震),
They should be practiced concurrently during their respective times.
Only in **Autumn** (秋) does one exclusively employ **Dui** (兑).

What is this Dao/Way?
It is the understanding of the **roots and branches of the Five Phases** (五行之根蒂),
And how they generate and restrain one another!」

The method of **Swallowing** (咽) is thus: if no saliva (津) arises between the teeth and the **Jade Pool** (玉池), what then?

Daily, I stir the **upper and lower teeth** (上下齿) with my tongue, then draw in the **Jade Pool’s double collection** (玉池双收) to the two cheeks, and **swallow the qi** (虚咽气). Within the qi, water emerges.

The number of swallows begins at **thirty-six**, then **forty-nine**, then **eighty-one**, then **one hundred eighty-one**—awaiting efficacy as the measure.

This is called the **Jade Nectar** (玉液). Practiced for a year, it irrigates the **Elixir Field** (丹田), bathes the **Embryonic Immortal** (胎仙), and the **True Qi** (真气) thrives abundantly.

If this is not done, within **three hundred days** the **Inner Elixir** (内丹) will already be formed, and the **True Qi** will arise on its own. Then, one employs **Gen** (艮) to **Fly the Golden Essence** (飞金晶), striking the **three passes** (三关) and entering the **Mud Pillow** (泥丸) directly.

When the qi first arises, why does one **plug the ears** (塞耳) with the hands? Because the ears are the **Kidney’s Gate** (肾之门)—fearing the **Kidney’s Qi** (肾之气) will leak outward.

When practicing this method, from the **forehead’s center**, **Golden Water** (金水) descends forward like a **rising anvil** (建锟), pouring into the **Yellow Court** (黄庭), transforming into **Golden Elixir** (金丹).

Thus, the method of **Golden Nectar** (金液) must be practiced in a **quiet chamber** (静宇), with **palms pressed together** (迭掌) and **legs crossed** (蟠膝), sitting upright, severing thought, forgetting emotion, and **inner observation** (内观). When the **Golden Essence** (金晶) of **Gen** (艮) flies into the **crown**, slightly raise the head, letting the **flame behind the brain** (脑之后) blaze like fire. Then, **tilt the head back** (频府仰首), lower the head toward the **throat**, retract the tongue toward the back, and **prop the upper palate** (拄上愕).

Thus, the **Upper Clarity’s Sacred Mushroom Water** (上清灵芝之水), sweet in taste, fragrant in qi, is either **gargled** (漱) or **swallowed** (咽), descending back to the **Yellow Court**. This is called the **Golden Nectar**.

Throughout the year, it is practiced without pause. Only when the **Golden Essence flies**, one swallow per flight, until **Zhen** (震) is reached, and once it has entered the **brain**, follow the **nodes in sequence**: begin with **Gen**, end with **Xun** (巽).

As the day wanes and the **Yang Pass** (阳关) is **locked**, begin with **Dui** (兑) and end with **Qian** (乾).

In practicing this, one must **sever distractions** (绝边) and **cleanse the heart** (清心) to achieve success.

This Dao/Way requires the **Golden Essence to fly**, the **medicine to be gathered**, the **Yang Pass to be locked**, and the **Inner Elixir to be complete**—only then, after **three hundred days**, may one proceed.

Otherwise, if one merely **refines the Elixir** (还丹) to **purify the Flower Pool** (华池), the **Great Medicine** will scatter and yield no benefit.

Its effects: the **body glows**, the **spirit is refined**, the **pupils darken**, the **hair turns black**, the **complexion remains youthful**, the **qi is internally sufficient** and does not falter, the **bones are transformed**, the **spirit chamber** (神室) is renewed, one’s **stride surpasses galloping steeds**, the **saliva congeals like butter**, and **cold and heat cannot harm**.

If one guards against the **Yang’s Supreme Ultimate** (阳之太极), then with **Jade Nectar** to irrigate and bathe, the **Inner Elixir is moistened**.

After **three hundred days**, practicing the **Golden Nectar** is the method of **Completed Crossing** (既济). **Ignite fire to welcome True Water** (起火以迎真水), **upper water and lower fire**, rising and sinking alternately, **refining Yin with Yang**, aiming to transform into **Pure Yang** (纯阳). When the work is complete, one may **soar beyond the world’s bounds**.

Its efficacy: **a hundred days** show results, **a year** brings completion.

What is meant by **Golden-Jade Nectar** (金玉之液)?

**Accumulated Yang becomes Spirit** (积阳成神), within which there is form—**one born of the Sun**, **two born of the Moon**.

**Accumulated Yin becomes Form** (积阴成形), within which there is Spirit—**one born of Metal**, **two born of Jade**.

The **Sun travels nine**, the **Moon six**, rising and setting with **Yin and Yang**; **Gold and Jade** also follow **Yin and Yang**. They **ascend in Spring and Summer**, **descend in Autumn and Winter**.

The **Kidney’s Qi** is the **Moon**; its **obscure nectar** (冥液) is **Gold**. The **Heart’s Qi** is the **Sun**; its **nectar** is **Jade**.

**Jade Nectar** originates from the **Kidney’s Qi**, ascending to the **Heart** to merge with the **Heart’s Qi**. When the two qi intersect and pass through the **Double Tower** (重楼), sealing the mouth and not exhaling, saliva fills the **Jade Pool**, and swallowing it yields **Jade Nectar**.

With my tongue, I stir the **upper and lower palate** (上下之愕), close the **Jade Pool**, and draw in the two cheeks, swallowing the qi in emptiness.

This is the method of **Returning Elixir** (还丹). Within the qi lies **True Water**; when qi gathers, water gathers—**the Mother moves, the Child follows**.

Since **Jade Nectar** is already the **Returning Elixir**, how does it refine the **Form** (炼形)? The **nectar** arises from the **Kidney**, generated in the **Heart**, just as **earth produces stone**, and **stone produces jade**.

**Golden Nectar** is the **Kidney’s Qi** and **Heart’s Qi** merging and ascending, **blackening** (蒸) in the **Lungs**. The **Lungs** are the **Canopy** (华盖), enveloping the two qi below, then drawing their nectar by day.

This nectar lies in the **Lower Field** (下田), ascending from the **tail** (尾闲), known as **Flying the Golden Essence** to **supplement the Mud Pillow**.

Once the **Mud Pillow** is sufficiently supplemented, it descends from above back to the **Lower Elixir Field**, becoming **Golden Nectar Returning Elixir**.

When it returns to the **Lower Field** and ascends again, circulating through the **four limbs**, this is **Golden Nectar refining the Form**—also like **Gold arising from Earth**.

How can the **Golden Essence’s flight** traverse the **three passes** and enter the **Nine Heavens** (九天)?

The **tail** is the **lower pass** (下关);
The **spine’s junction** (夹脊) is the **middle pass** (中关);
The **brain’s rear** (脑后) is the **upper pass** (上关).
The **crown** is the **Third Heaven** (九天#3).

After the **Jade Nectar returns to the Elixir**, dwelling in a **secluded quiet chamber**, untouched by wind, unexposed to sun, **secretly invoking the Three Pure Ones**:

*"To practice the Dao and manifest transformation, first refine the Form beyond Yin and Yang. Then, burning incense and swallowing, at the time of **Zhen** (震), close the eyes, still the heart, sit upright, and let the **nasal breath** be **soft and slow in inhalation, sparse and delayed in exhalation**. Deepen **inner observation**, letting no outer scene enter, no inner thought exit. Fill the mouth with saliva, neither spitting nor swallowing. Let the qi fill the four limbs, governing it carefully, lest it scatter or falter from weariness. Gradually cease and rise again, until the time of **Li** (离), when the qi has merged. Then, the qi becomes ineffable and beautiful."*

This is the practice of **refining the Form with Jade Elixir**—a means only to preserve the Form and dwell in the world. If one can abandon all external affairs and set their mind on the **Daoist Immortal**, they should, after the **Elbow-Posture Flying Gold Crystal** and **Kidney Complementation**, follow the previous method: let the **Jade Elixir return to the Dan Field** from the crown down to the kidneys. Begin with **Zhen** (震) and proceed until **Li** (离), when it ceases.

The methods of **Jade Elixir** and **Gold Elixir** are alike, yet their distinctions lie in **inner observation**. This is not merely so! When **returning the Elixir** and **refining the Form**, they are practiced in parallel—how could Jade Elixir compare?

The essence lies in **pure Yang and exhausted Yin**. In spring and winter, one should **swallow twice per rise**—how can this be called a rise? It is the **upright posture** mentioned earlier. In autumn and winter, one should **swallow five times per rise**. When swallowing in autumn and summer, the number is fifty; in spring and winter, over a hundred. This is done to **strengthen the Yang Pass** (#4) diligently, until the **completion of Qian** (乾), following the same method as before.

As for **refining the Form with Gold Elixir**, after **recovery** (#5), one **uprightly raises** and then **reclines forward**, flying the **Gold Crystal**. **Reclining forward** is the **returning of the Gold Elixir**. When the **Gold Crystal passes the crown**, it descends to the **Dan Field**, meeting the **refined Form’s qi**—do not swallow hastily! Wait until the **qi fills the four limbs**, the **mind relaxes**, and the **spirit flows freely**, until **saliva dries** and the **heart is cleansed**. Then, **swallow gently**, opposing the **qi’s movement**—this is the **achieved completion** (既济). Practicing this from **Gen** (艮) to **Li** (离), raising and swallowing, is also acceptable.

Then, how does **refining the Form** truly work? The **Gold Crystal ascends**, igniting the **inner fire** and entering the **crown**. **Raising uprightly** and **lifting forward**, its name is **consuming the Form**. Within the **fire**, one again **returns the Elixir**, adjusting the **four seasons’ intensity**. Only then can one be bound by the **years and months**!

Within my daily cycle, there are **Qian and Kun** (乾坤). Before noon, I **consumingly ignite** in **Qian**; after noon, I **consumingly ignite** in **Kun**. Speaking of the human body, the **front** is **Kun**, the **back** is **Qian**—this is the **Elbow-Posture Flying Gold Crystal**.

When **consuming in Kun**, one begins with **Dui** (兑), **restraining the Yang Pass**, and ceases at **Qian**. This must not be neglected for even a moment. In winter and spring, practice the **achieved completion** method for **three to five days**, to **prevent the swallowing of the Elixir** when the **inner fire** is ignited. Thus, the **Gold Elixir** will not be refined.

My **consuming the Form** does not merely refine the Form into **qi**—it suffices to **expel the Yin spirits** and **nourish the spirit**, killing the **Nine Vermin** and **Three Pests** below.

Now, can one discuss the **method of refining qi into spirit to attain the Primordial Origin**? What are the effects of refining the Form?

It is said: **The mind is pure and lofty**, harmonizing with the **Primordial Void** (太虚). The **soul and spirit** do not wander, and **dreams vanish**. Once the **Yang essence** is formed, the **spirit treasury** is secured. **Fire cannot scorch**, **water cannot moisten**, and the **true qi** emerges from the **spirit gate** (神门) in black.

Thus, the **eyebrows bear white hairs**—its **qi is purely Yang**, capable of **drying mercury**. Breathing can **cure illness**, and **calamities and blessings** can be foreknown. Is this not its effect? Though inferior to the **Primordial Origin’s** marvel!

The **one, three, five, seven, nine** are the **Dao’s divisions** into numbers. The **Gold, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth** are the **Dao’s transformations** into symbols. Without division, there is no number; without number, the **Dao’s origin**. Without transformation, there is no symbol; without symbol, the **Dao’s root**.

I know the **symbols of Heaven and Earth** to be their **qi and Water**. I know the **numbers of Heaven and Earth** to be their **distant and near**. Yet, is the **Dao** truly distant?

Heaven and Earth have **Five Emperors**, just as my **Five Viscera** do. The **Green Emperor’s virtue** is **Wood**, his **stem-branches** (干支) **Jia and Yi**—**Jia** is Yang, **Yi** is Yin, just as the **qi and fluids** of my **liver**. The **Red Emperor’s virtue** is **Fire**, his **stem-branches** **Bing and Ding**—**Bing** is Yang, **Ding** is Yin, just as the **qi and fluids** of my **heart**. The **White Emperor’s virtue** is **Metal**, his **stem-branches** **Geng and Xin**—**Geng** is Yang, **Xin** is Yin, just as the **qi and fluids** of my **lungs**. The **Black Emperor’s virtue** is **Water**, his **stem-branches** **Ren and Gui**—**Ren** is Yang, **Gui** is Yin, just as the **qi and fluids** of my **kidneys**. The **Yellow Emperor’s virtue** is **Earth**, his **stem-branches** **Wu and Ji**—**Wu** is Yang, **Ji** is Yin, just as the **qi and fluids** of my **spleen**.

In spring months, the **liver’s qi** is abundant—**the true qi of the parents** follows the **Heaven’s seasonal movement**, residing in the **liver**. On **Wood days** (甲乙), **save Earth** during **Chen, Xu, Chou, Wei** hours, and **ignite the fire** to refine the **spleen’s qi**. On other days, **restrain Metal** at **Dui** hours, **exhausting the lung’s qi**. At this time, **do not exert effort**.

During **Kan** (坎) hours, **ignite the fire** to refine the **kidney’s qi**. At **Zhen** (震) hours, **enter the chamber**, inhaling deeply and exhaling sparsely—**cessation of breath** is supreme, **prolonged closure** is secondary—using **a thousand breaths** as the measure. **Inner observation** focuses entirely on the **liver**; **still the mind**, close the eyes, and the **green hue** will appear. **Gradually raise the Form**, entering the **Muddy Pellet** (泥丸), from **Yin** to **Chen**, completing at **Zhen**. The **nasal breath’s exhalation** becomes **habitually faint**—then the breath ceases. Do not **force hasty completion**.

In summer months, the **heart’s qi** is abundant—**the true qi of the parents** follows the **Heaven’s seasonal movement**, residing in the **heart**. On **Fire days** (丙丁), **save Metal** during **Dui** hours, and **ignite the fire** to refine the **lung’s qi**. On other days, **restrain Water** at **Kan** hours, **exhausting the kidney’s qi**. At this time, **do not exert effort**.

During **Zhen** (震) hours, **ignite the fire** to refine the **liver’s qi**. At **Li** (离) hours, **enter the chamber**, **halt the breath**, and **steady the breath** as before. The **red qi** appears. **Gradually raise the Form**, entering the **Muddy Pellet**, from **Si** to **Wei**, completing at **Li**.

In autumn months, the **lung’s qi** is abundant—**the true qi of the parents** follows the **Heaven’s seasonal movement**, residing in the **liver**.

If it is **Metal’s day** (庚辛), **save Wood** during **Zhen** (震) hours, and **ignite the fire** to refine the **liver’s qi**. On other days, **restrain Fire** at **Li** (离) hours, **exhausting the heart’s qi**; at this time, **do not exert effort**.

During **Xun** (巽) hours, **ignite the fire** to refine the **spleen’s qi**. At **Dui** (兑) hours, **enter the chamber**, **halt the breath**, and **steady the breath** as before. **White qi** appears. **Gradually raise the Form**, entering the **Muddy Pellet**, from **Shen** (申) to **Xu** (戌), completing at **Dui**.

In winter months, the **kidney’s qi** is abundant—**the true qi of the parents** follows the **Heaven’s seasonal movement**, residing in the **kidney**.

If it is **Water’s day** (壬癸), **save Fire** during **Li** (离) hours, and **ignite the fire** to refine the **heart’s qi**#6. On other days, **restrain Earth** at **Chen** (辰), **Xu** (戌), **Chou** (丑), or **Wei** (未) hours, **exhausting the spleen’s qi**; at this time, **do not exert effort**.

During **Dui** (兑) hours, **ignite the fire** to refine the **lung’s qi**. At **Kan** (坎) hours, **enter the chamber**, **halt the breath**, and **steady the breath** as before. **Black qi** appears. **Gradually raise the Form**, entering the **Muddy Pellet**, from **Hai** (亥) to **Chou** (丑), completing at **Kan**.

In spring, **refine the liver with a thousand breaths**#7; **blue-green qi** emerges. Within its **final decan**#1, there are **eight days** dedicated solely to **steadying the breath**, sitting silently throughout the day to nurture the **unconcentrated spirit** and refine the **true qi**.

During **Kan** (坎) hours, **ignite the fire** to refine the **kidney’s qi**, lest it exhaust the **true qi**.
